text: Jaiswal camps back to this short ball that holds its line outside off and punches to short cover
143.1ks, much fuller and snaking in to hit the pad from round the stumps, the sharp angle and movement was dragging it down the leg side. The result is a leg-bye for RR
140.8ks, nice and full, seaming in to attack the stumps, whisked away to the right of mid-on
good length and slanting in from round the stumps, but does not threaten off stump. So, Jaiswal ignores it in the channel
chipped away in the air...but lands in front of square leg or rather short midwicket where Rashid collects it on the bounce
dug in short an slanting back in to cramp the batter for room, Jaiswal somehow keeps it out
full and pushed across off, left alone by Buttler
back of a length and skids back into middle and leg, jammed to the leg side off the inner half
short and wide of off, Buttler latches onto the width and scythes a cut between point and cover for four. Fetch that!
better from Dayal. Good length and much closer to off stump, draws Buttler into a front-foot defence to short cover
shorter and into the ribs, Buttler drags a hook behind square on the leg side for one
short and veering down the leg side, Jaiswal misses out on the pull and wears it on his thigh pad
Buttler gets on top of a short ball outside off and punches it just wide of Pandya for an urgent single
Shami hits a hard length and gets the ball to bounce over the stumps. Seams in to sail over middle. Jaiswal swings and misses once again
Jaiswal gets off the mark after eight balls. He clears his front leg and pumps it straight of mid-off for his first runs this evening
Shami drags his length back further, the line is outside off. Jaiswal eyes up another big slog, no contact yet again
smeared over extra-cover for six. Jaiswal backs away outside leg, manufactures swinging room, gets his length - full. Pumped over the off side for a flat six
lifter from Shami, 147.8ks, rushes Jaiswal into a hook. He can flap it over the infield - good enough for three runs
Jaiswal advances at Dayal and dinks to short third man. There's a little hesitation between the wickets, but Buttler dishes out a full-stretch dive. A direct hit could've been tight
just short of a good length on middle, Buttler clears his front leg and heaves it away between midwicket and mid-on
Jaiswal backs away even before Dayal delivers this lifter. He swishes and is beaten once again. Good take from Saha
pitched-up delivery: this is the length Jaiswal is looking for, but Jaiswal doesn't time it well enough. Sliced up and over extra-cover. He's trying to over-hit the ball in the powerplay
hooked over fine leg for six. Jaiswal stands back and still for this bouncer on the body. Dragged away over the boundary, despite the presence of deep square leg and fine leg

Another short ball, dragged away to Sai Kishore at deep square leg. Another short ball at the body, Jaiswal goes back and ends up splicing it to the outfielder. Dayal provides GT with the breakthrough. Jaiswal never really got going tonight
full and wide of off, Buttler reaches out and flays it away to backward point
good length and just a shade outside off, pressed into the covers for a single
First-ball four for Samson. Clears mid-on. Fullish on middle an leg, heaves it over mid-on
short and ducks back into Samson from over the wicket, Samson rides the bounce and secures a single to deep third man
wide yorker from Ferguson, Buttler can't touch it. It's out of his reach
just short of a yorker length outside off, Buttler throws his bat at a cover-drive, but is beaten once again
back of a length and breaks away outside off, slapped away, Sai Kishore at extra-cover fumbles and gives up four. He fails to get his body behind ball
whipped away down to long-on
possibly a wrong'un, sliding into middle, on a length, tucked away into the vacant spaces at midwicket
flat legbreak, defended back to the left of Rashid
another googly from Rashid, fuller in length, patted away to the right of Rashid to long-on
glanced off the pads to short fine leg
wide of the crease, overpitched and outside off, belted straight to mid-off
low full-toss wide of off, Samson opens the face of the bat and carves it away to sweeper cover
Ferguson pounds it on a hard length and outside off, the ball almost scratches the outside edge near the shoulder of the bat
spanked over mid-off. Slower ball from Ferguson but the length is wrong. Pitched-up delivery outside off, Buttler goes over the top
Ferguson shortens his length outside off, Buttler camps back and slashes it away between sweeper cover and deep third man
full and outside off, driven hard to mid-off. Buttler sets off and dives across at the other end for the single
tossed up and turns away outside off, Buttler is on the front foot to guide it away to sweeper cover
flighted and outside off, smashed away to the right of long-off
shorter legbreak, quicker and breaks away outside off, Buttler slashes and misses
shortish once again and turns away outside off, Buttler goes back and punches a single to Ferguson at sweeper cover
wrong'un on a length, worked away towards midwicket
another quick wrong'un, tapped into the leg side
short and outside off, Buttler leaps and flashes it to sweeper cover

Pandya strikes second ball to dismiss his opposite number. Pandya hits an in-between length outside off. Samson shapes up for the pull but can only sky it to Sai Kishore who runs forward and then across to his right to short third man to snag another catch
nice and full, starts on middle and zips away outside off, nearly clicked the outside edge
short and on the hips, worked to midwicket
back of a length and veers away outside off, beaten on the outside edge once again is Padikkal
fullish and just a shade outside off, Padikkal checks his drive and chips it to mid-off
full and on the stumps, pushed back to Shami. Buttler needs to find a higher gear
Buttler shuffles across off, gets closer to this shortish ball outside off and forces it to the right of sweeper cover. Good tumbling save from Ferguson in the outfield
Buttler finds another gear. Banged in short and outside off, Buttler rolls his wrists and pulls it behind square for four
back of a length and outside off. Buttler jumps on top of the bounce and flays it past Pandya at mid-off
fullish and outside off, patted to cover
leg-stump yorker, dug out to the leg side for one
short and outside off, Buttler rides the bounce and punches it away to the left of sweeper cover
shortish and outside off, defensively played up to cover
full on middle, the ball isn't coming on, chipped down to long-on
Paddikal makes room and flat-bats this back-of-a-length delivery back to Pandya
Paddikal backs away once again, Pandya chases him wiith an on-pace bouncer at 143ks. Beaten on the hook
shortish on the pads, deflected away through square leg
wrong'un leaves Padikkal outside off, hauled to long-on. Padikkal finally gets off the mark
fuller and sliding into middle and leg, clipped away through square leg
slapped off the back foot to sweeper cover
low full-toss on middle and leg, bunted down to long-on
Rashid puts Padikkal out of his misery. Gone for 2 off 10 balls. Shorter and outside off, Padikkal cuts in the air, slashing it to Shami at short third man
ripping wrong'un from Rashid, starts outside off and storms past the outside edge of Hetmyer

Pandya takes out Buttler. Pandya has the massive crowd behind him. Pandya hits that back of a length once again. This straightens away as opposed to angling into Buttler. The batter aims to dink it down to third man. Instead, he can only guide the ball right into the gloves of Saha. Terrific bowling from Pandya
fullish and outside off, blocked to cover off the front foot
shortish and angling into middle, worked wide of mid-on
lifter angling across off, Hetmyer yanks his head out of the way. Excellent spell from Hardik, this
head-high short ball on middle, flaps a weak pull to midwicket
just short of a good length and holds its line outside off, run away behind point
legbreak outside off, drags Ashwin forward and beats the outside edge. They check for a stumping and Ashwin is fine
full on the stumps, patted down to long-on
played back to the bowler
starts on middle and rips away past the outside edge. Hetmyer didn't pick the googly
guided away past slip off the back foot
clipped away past the midwicket region
hard-length delivery outside off. Hetmyer drags it down to long-on
short and sliding into the hips. Ashwin helps it to Shami at fine leg
back of a length on middle, Hetmyer knows mid-off is inside the circle. So he backs away and pumps it straight of that infielder for a much-needed boundary
Hetmyer backs away once again. Bumper from Pandya, Hetmyer can't ramp it away
rare full delivery from Pandya. Pushed across Hetmyer, opens the bat-face and steers it away between keeper and short third man

Pandya pockets a return catch and wheels away. Catch him if you can! He has taken out Samson, Buttler and Hetmyer. Suspect it was the back-of-a-length cutter from Pandya. Hetmyer eyes up the midwicket region and ends up plopping a return catch via a leading edge. Pandya ends with a potentially title-winning 4-0-17-3
worked down to long-on
back of a length and outside off, bunted down to long-off
shortish and darted into middle, tapped down to long-on once again
short and sliding into middle and leg, tucked away through midwicket

Sai Kishore has his TN senior and hero Ashwin holing out to long-on. Ashwin advances at Sai who held this back and shortened his length. Ashwin aims for the loft, despite not getting closer to the pitch, and picks out Ferguson in the deep. Ashwin is gone for 6 off 9 balls
looped up just a shade outside off, played back to the bowler
very full on middle and leg, Parag whips it away to deep midwicket
back of a length on middle, flamingo push past the right of the bowler
on a length and slanting into middle, clipped away to deep midwicket
wide of the crease, short and outside off. Boult stays leg-side of the ball and slaps it to sweeper cover
back of a length and slanting into middle, flicked away to deep midwicket
dug into the middle of the pitch, flapped away to the left of Rashid at short midwicket
floated up outside off, Boult jumps out of the crease and carves it over extra-cover

Miller takes the catch, but the momentum pushes him beyond the long-on boundary. So, the result is a six for Boult. He'll take that. Flat and quick outside off, Boult swings for the hills and gets a fortunate six down the ground

Sai slows this up on middle, finds some grip and turn, Boult can't quite get underneath the length. So, he ends up slicing the ball to wide long-off. Good comeback from Sai after conceding a six although that was a mis-hit as well
short and sliding across off, forced through the covers
back of a length on off, punched down the ground to long-off

swiped over midwicket for six. Sai is trying to protect the over. Darts it flat and well wide of off. McCoy still connects with a slog-sweep. Hit flat and hard over the leg side. Royals need more of these
wide yorker, squirted out to cover by Parag
bouncer on middle, gets big on Hetmyer
back of a length and outside off, McCoy goes for a slog, gets an outside edge to third man
wide yorker that Parag tries to work past point, but gets an inside edge to long leg
charges down the track to spear a full and outside off delivery through cover
swivels on the back foot and pulls to long leg
low full-toss on middle, dragged down to long-on
leg-stump half-volley, as Shami doesn't nail his length, Parag can only shovel it away with the bottom wrist to deep square leg
Shami veers away from the plan to bowl yorkers. Dug in short and outside off, Parag, having manufactured additional swinging room, scythes it over point for four

Shami searches for another yorker, marginally misses his length once again. Drilled back to Shami, the ball strikes Shami's leg and rolls down to long-off. Parag has to go for the second in order to keep strike, but McCoy is caught short at the other end. That he slipped on the first didn't help McCoy either. Kind of sums up this RR innings
Parag backs away in search for a big hit, Shami chases him with a yorker, beaten in the end
Shami yorks Parag to cap the innings. 145.1ks yorker, squeezes underneath Parag's swinging bat and clatters into off stump. Fine finish from Shami. Titans need 131 to win the IPL title
a length ball around off, Saha dabs it down towards square leg
length outside off, gets on his toes and cuts it towards point

superb fielding from Jaiswal at covers. Dives full-length to his left to intercept the back-foot punch off a short of a length ball. But Saha gets off the mark as the ball is deflected past the point fielder

dropped! A length ball on the leg stump. Gill goes for the flick but gets an inside edge onto the thigh and the ball lobs towards the catching forward square leg. Chahal dives forward, don't think there was a real need for that, and spills it
length ball on the stumps, gets behind it and blocks solidly
straying down the leg side, Gill flicks it uppishly towards the vacant fine-leg region and picks up four
length ball outside off, moving away just a little. Saha looks to work it square of the wicket and gets beaten
that made some sound off the bat. Short of length around off, Saha goes back, swivels and pulls it through midwicket
short of length outside off, hops this time and cuts it down towards point

the middle stump has been pegged back. A length ball, starting just outside off and seaming in. Saha goes for the drive but his feet are nowhere near the ball. The ball goes through the gap between bat and pad to clatter into the stumps
length ball around off, punched behind point for a couple
short of length angling across. Wade goes for the punch again but this time finds the point fielder
short of length around off, punched towards cover off the back foot
length outside off, punches it towards point. Dot again
fuller around off and shaping in. Gill looks to drive but the ball hits the inner half of the bat, goes into the ground before ricocheting off the boot and over the bowler's head
fuller length on the stumps, defended solidly
extra bounce there! A length ball, angling across this time. Gill goes for the cut but is beaten by the bounce
a maiden! Fuller length around off, punched back towards the bowler, who gets a hand to it and that's enough to stop the single
short but angling down the leg side. Wade goes for the pull but cannot connect. Samson dives to his right but only manages fingertips on it. Five freebies
that's the line and length to bowl. Short of length, just outside off and jagging in to the batter. Cramps him fo the room and hits him near the handle
a little bit room outside off this time. Goes for the cut but ends up chopping it back towards the bowler
short of length angling towards the batter, stays back and defends it in front of square leg
into the crowd. A length ball on the body, Wade moves towards the off side and picks it up over backward square leg
too full outside off, punches it towards covers, straight to Hetmyer
a full toss on the pads but he gets away with it. Flicked away firmly but straight towards square leg
length outside off, cuts it towards deep point
length outside off and moving away. Wade goes for the cut and misses. Samson collects it in front of his face

taken at short midwicket. Fuller length on the pads, shaping away a bit. Wade goes for the flick but looks like the ball got stuck just a little in the pitch. That means he ends up hitting it in the air. Parag leaps and takes it with both hands, just over his head
fuller in the channel, left alone
length ball on the pads, Pandya is careful and defends it towards short midwicket, making sure he kept it down
short of length around off, gets on the top of the bounce and defends it down
length but way down the leg side, Hardik cannot connect the flick. The second wide of the over
short of length, a bit of width as well. Hardik smashes it towards extra cover but cannot find the gap
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards square leg. An early and loud call of no
length ball on the stumps, looks to defend it on the leg side. An inside edge onto the pads. Samson is quick to the ball to prevent the single
length on the stumps once more, worked towards midwicket for a single
length ball on middle and leg. Tossed up. Hardik stays leg side of the ball and defends
length ball on the stumps, turned towards square leg
too full on the stumps, Gill brings out the sweep, hits it hard and beats the square leg fielder
short of length at the batter. Hardik looks to ramp it over the keeper but gets beaten
short and wide. Hardik cuts it down, rolling is wrists over it. But there is a sweeper cover in place
length ball on the stumps, defended to the right of the bowler
short of length angling across, a forehand to send it towards deep midwicket
fuller around off, stays leg side of the ball and drives it towards mid-off. A quick single
fuller on the pads, chipped away towards deep square leg
comes down the track but Chahal pulls his length back. Had to defend
tossed up outside off, a whipped drive but straight towards extra cover
fuller length on the stumps, pushed to the left of short midwicket, who dives across but ends up deflecting it towards long-on
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards short extra cover, Hetmyer dives to his left and gets a hand on it and that means the mid-off who was covering the original line gets beaten

just evades Hetmyer who was running back from extra cover. Tossed up outside off. Gill comes down the ground and looks to go aerial but the ball hits the outer half of the bat. Hetmyer ran hard but the ball just beat him
quicker on the stumps, pushed towards covers
length ball on the stumps, punched towards long-on
short of length outside off, goes for the cut but gets beaten. Too close to him
that would release some pressure. Prasidh errs on the fuller side this time and Hardik smashes it over mid-off
length outside off, beaten on the cut once again
short of length outside off, Hardik moves across a touch and works it towards wide long-on
streaky! A length ball outside off, Gill goes for the cut but gets an inside edge past the stump and to the left of Samson
length ball on the pads, pushed towards midwicket
length ball on middle and leg. Slow turn. Gill goes back and turns it in front of square leg
fuller on the stumps, worked inside-out towards extra cover
tossed up on a length outside leg. Some turn there. Nudged towards midwicket
fuller outside off, moves across and laps it fine for a couple
flatter and quicker around off, looked like a slider. Punched down the ground for one
short of length on the stumps, pulled in the air towards deep midwicket but it falls short and to the right of Hetmyer, who pushes it inside
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards midwicket
length outside off, stands tall and smashes it through covers for four
length ball around off, punched towards cover
short of length in the line of the stumps, Hardik was looking to dab it towards third man but it's too close to him. Gets beaten
fuller on the stumps, punched back towards the bowler. McCoy gets a hand to it and the ball rolls towards long-on
starts with a carrom ball, punched towards long-off
length ball on the stumps, worked towards midwicket. The initial call was for two but Hardik is happy with one
length outside off, goes for the cut but gets a thick outside edge that runs away towards the third man boundary, just missing Samson's right pad
whipped over deep midwicket! Backs away towards the leg side, Ashwin follows him but Hardik has given himself just enough room to launch it for a six
slower outside off, spins in. Hardik waits for it to arrive before cutting it towards sweeper cover
length, room outside off. Gill cuts it towards sweeper cover for two. Fifteen off the over
short of length outside off, cuts it past the diving point fielder but the sweeper cuts it off
short of length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover once again. This time straight towards the fielder
fuller outside off, punched through extra-cover for a couple. Long-off comes across to cut it off
an appeal for lbw but only from Boult. Was a length ball coming in but think it hit him too high. They collect a leg-bye
looked like a slower bouncer outside off. Hardik moves across and slaps it towards long-on. One bounce to the fielder
length ball angling in, flicked away but cannot beat short fine leg
fuller down the leg side, paddles it gently towards fine leg for a couple

Chahal strikes! A classic legspinner's dismissal. Pitching on middle and leg and spinning away. Hardik was anyway staying leg side of the ball. Gets an outside edge and straight into the hands of slip. Chahal wins the purple cap
defended on towards covers
length ball on the stumps, goes back and flicks it towards midwicket. They come back for the second
fuller around off, hits it back towards the bowler
length ball outside off, punched towards sweeper cover
length ball around off, pushed towards long-on
fuller length angling across, a casual-looking shot by Gill. Was trying to work it on the leg side but the ball hits the outer half and goes behind point. Was in the air
length outside off, punched towards cover
length ball outside off, Miller comes forward and hits it between mid-off and extra cover. Was in the air but he placed it well, didn't try to go hard
length outside off, opens the face of the bat to guide it towards short third man. A quick single. Gill was quick and would have been well in had Boult nailed the direct hit
fuller on the stumps, Gill pushes it towards long-off
length ball on the stumps, nudged towards midwicket. The fielder is at the boundary, which allows Gill to come back for the second
length ball around off, Gill once again places it towards midwicket but this time long-on comes across to field it. 100 comes up for Titans
tossed up on middle and leg. Miller clears his front leg and lofts it over deep midwicket. Into the stands
length ball on the stumps, works it behind square leg
length ball outside off, spinning in big. Gill waits and drops it towards covers. Was hesitant to take off but Miller calls him and it's an easy single in the end
length ball on the stumps, turned towards square leg
short of length around off and middle. Defended
short of length outside off, cuts it behind point. McCoy sprints to his left and puts in a sliding stop
length ball angling across. Fails to connect the cut
short this time, in the line of the stumps. Miller swivels to pull, gets a top edge and it goes fine for four
another short one from Prasidh but too high this time. Miller lets it go for a wide
short of length outside off, goes for the cut, gets a thick edge to the right of third man. McCoy puts in a desperate dive but in vain
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards deep square leg for a couple
a length ball around off, Gill goes revere and hits it towards cover
length outside off and spinning in. Goes back and works it towards midwicket
looked like a carrom ball. Goes back and punches it towards sweeper cover
length ball around off and middle, flicked towards square leg
slower and wider. A length ball outside off. Gills cuts it towards deep point
Miller looks to finish it with a six. Aims to hit this length ball over deep midwicket but gets an inside edge past the stumps
sealed with a six! Short down the leg side and Gill pulls into the stands over deep square leg
length ball in the channel, left alone

length ball on the stumps, Kohli plays it down to the right of Buttler at square leg, who dives across to make the stop. He has a shy at the non-striker's end but Kohli was in. The ball hits Kohli and deflects towards long-off but Kohli decides not to run for overthrows
length ball down the leg side, tucked away towards fine leg
length ball around fifth stump, a bit of shape in. Left alone by Kohli
length ball angling across this time. Kohli dabs it towards cover-point and looks to sneak in a single but the fielder was quick to the ball

first six of the night! Kohli takes a couple of steps down the ground and picks up this length ball over square leg, all the way for a six. Maybe not the pristine timing but he got more than enough on it for a 72-metre hit
fuller on the stumps, du Plessis goes for the flick but misses and gets hit in the front pad and then on the back pad. But it was clearly going down
length ball on the stumps, tucked away behind square leg
146.5kph. A length ball, or maybe just short of length, but well outside off, left alone
length ball around off, defended on the front foot

Kohli walks back! Short of length outside off, just holding its line after pitching. Kohli follows it with his hands, looking to work it behind point but gets an outside edge. Samson grabs it with reverse mitts
Prasidh strays on the pads. A length ball angling down the leg side. Patidar fails to connect the flick but the ball brushes the pads and races away towards the fine-leg boundary
length ball around off and moving in a touch. du Plessis stays in his crease and blocks it

length ball around off, once again shaping back. du Plessis looks to defend, but gets it from the inner half of the bat. The ball hits the pads and rolls towards extra cover. Patidar wanted a single but du Plessis sends him back. He had to dive but luckily there was no direct hit
length ball around off, du Plessis is happy to defend
width outside off and du Plessis doesn't miss out. He had to reach out for it, frees his arms and hits it over cover
slightly fuller, still outside off. Driven on the up towards mid-off
an inswinging yorker at 140.1kph. du Plessis, though, does well to get his bat down in time. Digs it out towards square leg. Boult has a big grin on his face
short of length outside off. Patidar throws his bat at it, gets an outside edge and it sails over the slip fielder
length ball outside off, defended towards cover-point

a jaffa! 148kph. But Royal Challengers picks up four byes. A length ball outside off but it seams back in big. Goes through the gap between bat and pad but it keeps seaming even after passing the stumps and beats a diving Samson
short of length outside off, left alone
length ball around off, defended on the leg side
slightly fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards mid-off
fuller around off, driven towards sweeper cover
length ball outside off, steered towards third man
fuller on the stumps, a bit of shape into the pads. du Plessis flicks it towards deep square leg and picks up two
short down the leg side. Goes for the pull but gets a glove on it. Samson dives to his left but gets only fingertips to it
length ball around off, chopped back towards the bowler
short of length outside off, du Plessis stands tall and slaps it to the left of mid-off. Buttler dived across but couldn't get there. Twelve from that over
short of length outside off, Patidar attempts the upper cut but fails to connect
length ball on the stumps, 140.9kph. Flicked towards square leg
smashed! Short of length but this time there was some width as well. That allowed Patidar to cut it through point for four
majestic! Prasidh pulls his length back a touch but Patidar responds with an even better shot. Gets on his toes and punches it through covers for back-to-back fours

dropped by Parag! Prasidh sticks to short of good length. Just outside off. Patidar punches it off the back foot once again but fails to keep it down this time. And it goes towards backward point, head-high to Riyan Parag who gets both hands to it but the ball bursts out
length ball outside off, flays it towards cover
length outside off, Patidar cuts it through point but Chahal makes a diving stop to his left at sweeper cover to save two for his team
length outside off, looks to punch through extra cover but fails to middle it. The ball dribbles towards extra cover
length ball on the pads, glanced towards fine leg
length ball on the stumps, 127kph. du Plessis adjusts and plays it towards covers for a quick single
length ball around off, punched towards mid-off. Buttler moves to his right from extra cover to cut it off
fuller length on the stumps, flicked towards midwicket. The initial call was for two but they will have to settle for one
length ball on the stumps, worked towards midwicket
length outside off, forces it towards extra cover off the back foot. Hetmyer dives to his right but can make only a partial stop and the ball rolls towards long-off
length ball around off, worked towards wide long-on
length but down the leg side. Patidar lets it go
length ball on the stumps, punched towards long-on
101kph. A carrom ball, fuller outside off. du Plessis looks to hit it through the off side but gets beaten
slower through the air this time. In the line of the stumps. Worked towards long-on
tossed up around off, du Plessis comes forward and drives it towards extra cover
tossed up around off once again. Just dips at the batter. du Plessis goes with his shot and whips it towards long-off
Patidar tees off! Flighted again from Chahal. Too full around off, and even though it was spinning away, Patidar goes with his shot and clears long-on easily
flatter and quicker on the stumps, punched towards long-on
pushed towards covers for a single
fuller length outside off, 83kph. Patidar ignores it and collects a wide
91.5kph. Flatter and shorter around off, Patidar doesn't get the timing right on the pull. A single to wide long-on
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards midwicket. The fielder is right at the boundary line, which allows the batters to collect two
length outside off, goes for the cut but there is a fumble there. Luckily it doesn't cost Royals as short third man tidies it up

a loud appeal for lbw, mainly from Ashwin. A length ball pitching around leg but did it straighten enough? Patidar went for a slog across the line but missed. The impact though was outside the leg stump, so Royals lose a review
a length ball on the stumps, Patidar goes for the pull but doesn't get the timing right. A single to deep midwicket
92.7kph. A length ball on the stumps, turned towards midwicket
length ball on the stumps, goes for the slog but he hasn't timed it well. Lands well short of deep midwicket
More luck for Patidar. A length ball angling across, Patidar gives himself some room and throws his bat at it. Gets an outside edge that flies to the left of Ashwin at short third man
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards deep midwicket
length ball angling across, a little bit of extra bounce. du Plessis clears his front leg and swings his bat. No connection

this time it goes towards Ashwin who takes a good, overhead catch. A length ball angling across. du Plessis looks to smash it through covers but gets an outside edge that flies towards short third man. Ashwin leaps and takes it with both hands. du Plessis walks back for 25 off 27
short of length at the batter, Maxwell almost takes evasive action but manages to dab it down behind square leg
a full toss on the pads, flicked towards midwicket
length ball on the stumps, worked towards midwicket
done nonchalantly! Fuller ball outside off, was a carrom ball from Ashwin. A big stride forward from Maxwell as he lofts it over long-off
backs away this time but Ashwin follows him, not allowing any room. In the end, he works it towards long-on
length ball on the stumps, worked towards square leg
fuller length on the stumps, pushed gently towards long-on but only a single
another carrom ball, 93.7kph. Punched towards sweeper cover
length ball on the stumps, punched towards long-off

short of length on the stumps, Maxwell goes back and pulls but he got it high on the bat. Hetmyer has positioned himself at deep midwicket. He leaps in the air, I think he even got his hand on the ball but couldn't hold onto it
punched towards long-on for one
length but way outside off, ignored
length outside off, slogged flat towards deep midwicket from there
bring out the reverse sweep! A length ball outside off and Maxwell goes fine, over and between the keeper and short third man
flatter on the stumps, goes back and drags it towards deep midwicket
length outside off, cuts it through point but Hetmyer makes a good stop, sprinting to his left from sweeper cover and diving to flick it back with his left hand
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards deep midwicket
fuller outside off, Maxwell was standing deep in his crease and hits it towards covers
slower short ball, Maxwell looks to reverse-pull it fine but fails to connect
this time on-pace and targeted at the batter, Maxwell moves towards leg side but fails to connect
caught at fine leg! Short down the leg side, Maxwell goes for the pull but he hasn't middled it. McCoy dives forward and takes it low. That's a big, big wicket
fuller around off, digs it back towards the bowler
short and wide outside off, around 78kph. Reaches out and hits it towards long-off
length ball around off, pushed towards long-on to get off the mark
length but way outside off. Another wide
on the other side this time. Too full and down the leg side. Samson does well to get his body behind that
fuller around off, looks to slog but doesn't get the elevation. A single towards logn-on
fuller on the stumps, swept behind square leg
length ball around off, 74.3 kph. Patidar aims to hit down the ground and smashes it over long-off. Brings up his fifty as well, off 40 balls
length ball on the stumps, goes back and works it in front of square leg
launched over deep midwicket! Fuller but down the leg side. Patidar clears his front leg, giving himself the room to swing the arms

taken right at the edge of the long-off boundary. A length ball around off, Patidar looks to go down the ground this time but doesn't the required power behind it. Buttler takes it overhead and for a moment, he lost his balance and and looked like he would step outside the boundary. So he lobs the ball up, regains his balance and pouches it again. They are checking upstairs but Buttler never stepped outside
length ball outside off, spinning in. Pushed towards covers
length outside off, a carrom ball it seems. Pushed towards sweeper cover
length ball around off, works it towards cover for one
a full toss down the leg side, swept towards short fine leg
fuller around off, Karthik goes for the slog sweep but fails to middle it. It lands between deep midwicket and deep square leg. Boult makes the stop
fuller on the stumps, whipped towards midwicket
moves towards the leg side before returning to his original position. Fuller on the stumps, digs it out towards long-on
length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards deep extra cover
length ball outside off, once again shuffles around, before cutting it towards deep cover
short of length outside off, dabs it towards sweeper cover
a slower full toss on the leg stump, Karthik pulls it towards deep-backward square leg
fuller length in the line of the stumps, Lomror moves outside off and looks to scoop it but misses
123.8kph. Short of length outside off, goes for the cut but ends up slicing it towards backward point where Ashwin moves to his left and takes it
fuller but way too outside off, left alone
length outside off, gets on the top of the bounce unlike Lomror and smashes it over extra cover for four
slips in a slower length ball outside off. Shahbaz swings across but was too early into the shot and fails to connect
a big moment in the game! A length ball outside off. Karthik looks to go down the ground but gets it right from the toe end of the bat. A straightforward catch for Parag at long-on
middle and leg stumps have been flattened. A 147kph yorker from Prasidh, right in the blockhole, and Hasaranga had no answer to it. Fails to get his bat down in time. Prasidh on a hat-trick
goes for the yorker again but misses his length this time. A full toss around off, pushed towards covers for one
a bouncer from around the wicket, Shahbaz takes evasive action but it's too high. Samson does well to collect it
a slower one, pushed back towards the bowler who has a shy at the stumps as the batter had taken a step down. Misses the stumps
Prasidh goes slower again, 103.1kph but Shahbaz picks it up this time and hits it over long-on for a six
Prasidh goes back to the yorker, Shahbaz moves towards the leg side but fails to connect as the ball goes between the batter and stumps
fuller on the stumps, Harshal moves across and looks to help it over short fine leg but misses and the ball hits the off stump
fuller outside off, pushes at it and gets beaten. Was looking to sneak in a bye but sent back
fuller around off, Hazlewood pushes it towards backward point for one
short of length outside off, Shahbaz goes for the pull but fails to connect
square-drive first up, on the up, straight to cover-point. Nowhere close to driving length
short of a length now, punched into the ground and to backward point
Siraj tries the bouncer, but slides down the leg side, and Jaiswal helps it along with his pull over long leg. Short boundary if you can hook behind square
short of a length, on the pads, punched away past square leg, timed very well, all the way along the ground
driven on the up, not clean, straight to short cover
Jaiswal is like a runaway train here. Pulls this short one in the air, and dead square, where the boundaries are the longest. Goes all the way
on a length, headed for top of off, defended back to him
lovely shot. Pushed on the up, with an open face, and he places it perfectly between cover-point and cover. Along the carpet
straightens his line, Buttler works to leg, but straight to midwicket
on a length, outside off, left alone
full, nearly a half-volley, slight seam movement back in, runs off the inner half of the bat, goes between mid-on and midwicket
perfect line and length, headed towards the off bail, Buttler has to defend it back
and it nearly pays off. That perfect Siraj delivery, angling away from a left-hand batter, and then leaving him a little after pitching too. Beats him
fuller now, and Jaiswal feels comfortable to drive it. Gets a single wide of mid-off
short of a length, just outside off, defended to cover
too full. Not the cleanest connection but Buttler has gone up and over, and has got enough on this to clear extra cover

and now some fortune goes their way. Buttler sets up early for the big hit, clearing the front leg, Siraj goes cross-seam, the ball comes off a little slow, and it takes the inside edge on the swipe. Fine of fine leg

oh that is massive. It is apparent Buttler is fancying himself against Siraj. Clearing the front leg early. Siraj looks to counter it by following him, but Buttler gets inside the line and lofts this over square leg for a humongous six
short, cut away, straight to point. He'll feel he has missed out
down the wicket, Maxwell pulls the length back, and he pushes it down to long-off for one
oh this stands up on him. Maxwell looking to pull it because it is short ends up hitting it in the air and down the ground. He does manage to clear mid-off, though
short of a length, into the pads, worked wide of deep midwicket for two
quicker length ball, manages to hit the inside edge of the bat, but the ball goes along the ground to midwicket
no turn on this one as Maxwell fires it in. Buttler goes back to defend
and Jaiswal welcomes him with a big slog, which he ends up hitting higher than longer, but it falls perfectly between long-on and deep midwicket
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
Buttler is in the mood folks. We could be in for an early night if he is not taken out soon. Just extends his arms through a length ball, and sends it over long-on
shimmies away but Shahbaz doesn't give up the length. Pushed to cover
he is just having his way here. Shahbaz goes wide with long-off back, but Buttler nonchalantly drags this over long-on for a flat six. Easy as
and now he is anticipating the flatter delivery, which he punches in the air and straight of deep midwicket for four more

and he gets a wicket immediately but not in the manner we were imagining it to be. He is extremely lucky here. Bowls a wide half-volley, which Jaiswal usually puts over the infield but this time he finds Kohli at point
on a length, angling in towards top of off, defended back to him
driven on the up but straight to mid-off where du Plessis misfields to allow them a single
even Buttler's mis-hits are going for runs. He is looking to go over mid-on but the length is not quite there and it runs off the inner half of the bat for a four wide of mid-on
moves across early Hazlewood bowls a wide length ball, drawing a defensive shot, but one that gets them a single
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
full slower ball as opposed to the in-the-pitch ones he bowls. Beats Buttler's drive
another full dipping slower ball. I have seen Buttler cleaned up by a few of these in the past across formats. He is cautious here and works it into the leg side for one
on pace, full, pushed with soft hands to mid-on for one
again the full slower ball to Buttler but now he is expecting them. And it is a wide half-volley to boot. Driven, through extra cover to bring up a fifty at a strike rate of over 200
full slower ball, hit straight to short extra cover

another slower full ball. He has bowled the same ball five times with just the length varying a little bit. Buttler is sitting back for these. He glances this full toss wide of short fine leg for four more
wrong'un, Samson picks it and defends outside off
too full, driven to wide long-off for one
shapes up for the paddle sweep early, Hasaranga shortens the length, but he still gets a single to fine leg
goes back to this wrong'un for a single to long-off
down the wicket, beaten in the air, but recovers well to defend this to leg
full, clipped off the toes for a single to long leg
on a length, into the pads, worked to deep midwicket for one

Samson has been quiet so far, especially against nemesis Hasaranga, but he jumps out of the crease the first ball he gets from Shahbaz. And even though he is not to the pitch of the ball he has hit it clean over long-on
wide length ball, punched to deep cover for one
Shahbaz is firing it in every time he goes to Buttler. And Buttler gets a fine outside edge for four. Fine of short third
throws this up for a change, and Buttler is going for them. Gets a thick outside edge that flies past point and goes for four
finally a dot but it is already under a run a ball now
and now Samson is correcting his stats against Hasaranga now. Short of a length, wide, not quite the cutting length, but Samson goes with an open face deliberately to go fine of short third man
picks the wrong'un and defends it right back. That is a statement too
goes really low in the release and bowls a wrong'un, Samson plays the late-cut but can't beat short third man
low release again, cut away to deep point for one
picks the googly, goes back, works it to leg for one
goes back to look for a single to long-on, but can't beat short straight midwicket

okay now it has all officially changed. Dinesh Karthik has dropped a simple chance. Looks like a late wobble to me. A change-up for Harshal. On-pace length ball, takes the outside edge, but Karthik has got outside the line of it, hits the back of the left glove
on a length, outside off, defended
slower ball, beats his cut
two dots too many for Samson. So he makes up by making room and lofting this short-of-a-length ball over wide long-on
short ball, on-pace, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
slower ball, short of a length, pushed towards deep midwicket for one
down the wicket, doesn't get the elevation on this, takes a single to  long-on
looks for the late-cut, but can't beat short third man
wrong'un, defended back to him
Hasaranga has got Samson again. He tries a really ambitious charge vat Hasaranga, who goes wider with the wrong'un, beats him, and gets the stumping
wronmg'un, starts around leg, played off the back for a single around the corer
Hasaranga dives to his left to save a single as Buttler pushes this towards long-off
short of a length, angling across him, beats his attempt to run it down for one
steers this one down for a single successfully
extra bouncer from short of a length, beats his attempt to punch this into the covers
short of a length, into the body, worked away for a single into the leg side
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
moves across to get close to the line of this ball but can't beat backward point with his steer
full, middle and leg, defended back
on a length, no turn, pushed past cover for one
short of a length, worked into the leg side for one
goes back to work this length ball past point for one
short of a length, wide, punched this in front of deep cover for two
wide length ball, goes back to cut it in front of square, but straight to extra cover
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man
short of a length, just outside off, punched to point
short of a length, slower ball, punched to deep cover for a single
wide half-volley, driven to deep cover for another single
on-pace short ball, no room, beats him on the cut with extra bounce
another single to deep cover
legbreak, on the pads, worked away into the leg side for one
short of a length, legbreak, punched down to long-on for another single
another dot. The crowd is getting into it. Hasaranga dives to his left to field this punch

that will deflate RCB. Hasaranga flights this, trying to check if there is indecision and pressure after a period without boundaries. But he has bowled it too full, and Buttler lofts him over long-off clean for a six. Goes past 800 for the season
legbreak, quick, on a length, runs off the thick outside edge to point

that should be the game. This is a comprehensive statement. Sees Hasaranga off with a six. And not just any six, but one where he has picked the wrong'un, and dropped it over wide long-on. Just 18 needed now. Buttler needs 12 for a century
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to deep point for one
Buttler is teeing off now. Goes across early trying to access his wide lines, but Hazlewood goes short. Still the top edge flies over backward point for two. Into the 90s
a Buttler masterclass is never complete without the ramp. Shuffles across early again, gets a length ball, and then scoops it over short fine
oh he is seeing if he can do it in one shot. Right across to try to slog it over wide long-on. Gets a thick inside edge for a single
Padikkal is gone, looking for a ramp. Hazlewood has dug this in short, Padikkal arches back to try to run it over the keeper's head, but the line cramps him up and goes off the glove to the keeper
short of a length, defended solidly to hand it over to Buttler
offbreak into the pads, soft hands looking for two, but he has played this straight to deep midwicket
full, on the pads, clipped away for a single
flat, into the pads, another single around the corner
pushes this offbreak down to long-on for another single
Buttler tries to get there in one shot, hits this wide of long-on, and it looks like it is going for four, but the ball plugs in the surface. So they get just the two

Hundred No. 4. He has his helmet off, and is leaping for joy. The dugout stands as one to celebrate. This is a wide half-volley, and he has pushed this past point for an easy single. What a season Buttler is having. He has a chance to go past Kohli's record of four hundreds
and Buttler rocks into the final. RR too. Their first final since the first IPL, which they won. Buttler backs away and pulls this quick short ball over wide long-on for another six
on a length, middle and leg, defended back to him
seam movement. Slightly short of a length, seams away from middle and leg and nearly takes the edge
short of a length, at his hip, tucked to square leg
misses the line, bowls a wide down the leg side

aggression from Kohli early. Not the cleanest connection but clears point with ease. Looking to go over mid-off, and gets a thick edge. Rahul tracks it down but he relays it wide of the fielder following him, allowing them a third

what a superb delivery. Lovely bowling. It shapes in a little, setting du Plessis up to play for the inswinger, and then pitches on a length and leaves him ever so slightly to take the edge. Golden duck for du Plessis. Mohsin has been the find of this IPL, and here he is on the big occasion sending back someone reputed to be the big-match man
this one moves away too, beats him but bounces well short of the keeper
looking for the inswinger, but overpitches, and Kohli clips it wide of mid-on for four. Just lets the ball come on, and then uses the wrists at the last moment
goes short of a length now, and Kohli leaves him alone
hard length now, just outside off, and defended to point
on a length, wicket to wicket, soft hands, steals a single to the tall man Avesh Khan at mid-on
short of a length, opens the face, looks for a single, but backward point is sharp on this
punched into the side pitch and it is played so hard it bounces over backward point. Just slightly short of length, and Patidar comes down hard on this
nearly caught. Kohli pushes at a length ball away from his body, gets a thick edge that flies to the right of cover-point. Vohra can't get to it
superb bounce. Digs this in, catches Kohli on the front foot and gets it higher than his chest. Kohli fends at it. Lucky not to edge it
another thick edge, this time to the left of point, gets him two runs
short of a length, at him, tucked to midwicket
slower ball, short of a length, soft hands to get a single to cover
short of a length, no room, defended back to him
angling in, on a length, pushed to deep midwicket for one
stays on a length, slight straightening of the line, defended back to him
this one angles in, worked away to deep midwicket for one
full, middle and leg, flicked hard, but straight to the midwicket inside the circle
shortens the length, worked around the corner for one
short of a length, punched away to deep midwicket for one
legcutter, into the surface, but not really slow. Patidar is hit in the rib as he pulls
looks for hard length again but provides him width, and Patidar plays a superb shot. Punches it up and over point. Nearly carries all the way
this short ball sits up. Slow off the surface. And Patidar pulls it up and over midwicket from wide outside off. Once again a legcutter short ball. Patidar is waiting
this is better from Avesh. He is short still but just a touch fuller than the last ball. Also closer to off. Beats him on the punch
short of a length, at him, punched back to him
and a good comeback from Avesh. Stays short without letting him pull or cut. Just short of a length, no room, pushed to mid-off
full, middle and leg, slow in the air, worked away for a single to leg
Patidar seems to be the man given the job of attacking. He has played this on the up, and has gone over mid-on. Expertly avoids both long-off and deep midwicket
this is too full, and it is easier for Patidar this time to clear mid-on. One bounce into the fence
and how does Patidar react? He toys with the field. Makes room, stays leg-side of the ball, and goes over mid-off. This is dismissive batting
and now through the ground. Patidar playing a gem here. Pandya shortens the length, and he punches this between backward point and cover-point
punched down to long-on for a single
fullish, swinging in, punched between long-on and deep midwicket for two
quick. Short of a length, into the body, hits the thigh pad. Late into the swivel-pull
looks for the big shot down the ground but Chameera is too short and too quick for that shot. Beats him
shimmies away and comes back before the ball is released. Chameera stays short of a length. Pushed to long-on for one
short of a length, no room, runs it down to third man for one
Patidar keeps attacking. Chameera again tries to threaten him with bounce, and Patidar short-arm pulls it between long-on and deep midwicket for four more
legbreak, middle and leg, pushed down to long-on for one
a drag down, but it doesn't come on and he cue-ends it to deep midwicket for one
tries to stay tight on the leg stump and slides down for a wide
lovely wrists. Seems to have picked a wrong'un, and flicked the wrists at the last moment to place it past short fine leg
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
wrong'un. Slower in the air, wider outside off, draws an inside edge onto the pad
wrong'un again, worked expertly between deep square and deep midwicket for a couple
yorker, outside off, dug out to deep cover for one
good bounce. There is an element of stickiness to this surface still. This one comes off spongily off the surface and beats his attempt to punch it into the off side

this would probably have been wide for height had Kohli not caught up with it. Kohli backs away early, Avesh bounces him, Ko0hli looks for the upper-cut, but gets only the toe end and is caught at third man. It has to be a big mis-hit at Eden for it to be caught because it is such a small ground. So this has missed the good part of the bat by a long way
tight, wicket to wicket, just short of driving length. Played back to Avesh
short of a length wide, punched to deep cover for one
see this is what I mean by a short boundary. Patidar gets slightly inside the line of this shortish delivery and pulls it over long leg. Not the cleanest hit but clears the field easily
on a length, just outside off, looks for a single down the ground, can't get it past Bishnoi
looks for the switch hit, Bishnoi goes really full, beats him. But this has hit the pad outside the line of off
legbreak, quick, short of a length, beats his cut. Three dots
beaten again. Bishnoi beating him on the outside edge two balls in a row. Proper legbreak, making him push away from the body

oh the error in length. This is what happens with high-intent batters. You can string together four dots but the moment you err, they go big. Just too full, and Maxwell lofts him back over his head for a six
back to good length, punched down to long-off for one
short of a length, around off, punched to deep midwicket for one
easy single to bring up a special fifty off just 28 balls. Just casually works this to deep midwkce t

Pandya with the huge wicket. Maxwell plays a shot that is not on. He has looked to hit a big shot every ball, and this one is not on. He is looking to go back to use Pandya's pace and go finer of deep square leg. However, Pandya is not that short here, and he gets no power into the shot. Caught at deep square
nice timing first up, punched it wide of deep cover for two
on a length, middle and leg, worked into the leg side for one
on a length, middle and leg, worked to leg for a single
high full toss. Called no-ball by square leg umpire immediately. Pushed past point for one
lovely comeback. Wide yorker. Dot ball
short of a length, outside off, steered to third man for one

sensational shot. Patidar gives up his stumps early, Chameera goes for the yorker, and he doesn't miss by much. Patidar has gone really deep to get under this and slices it away with bottom hand off for nearly a six over cover
better yorker now, and he has been dug out for one to long-on
gets the line wrong on this short ball. Just too much outside leg, and Lomror helps it along with a pull fine of long leg for four
lovely steer. Nothing wrong with the ball. Short of a length, quick, not much width, but he opens the face on it, and beats third man to his left
on a length, middle and leg, worked into the leg side for one
short of a length, middle and leg, punched to deep midwicket for one
tries the big hit down the ground, gets a thick inside edge onto the pad for a single. He is gone if de Kock hits but he misses slightly. Quick work from de Kock
pushed down to long-on for another single
angled in, straightens outside leg, and Patidar moves inside the line to earn a wide
that's very lucky. A big mis-hit. Patidar is looking for a loft down the ground, but the thick outside edge beats short third man. Only just. And he gets four for it
how has that missed? Big swing and miss as he looks to go over midwicket. Pandya's angle just takes it past the leg stump

and a wicket immediately after the break. Bishnoi goes wide and full, Lomror reaches out, drives it hard, but doesn't bother keeping it down or try to go over the extra cover. Low catch for Rahul there
beaten on the outside edge. Legbreak, just short of a length, past his edge as he defends

wrong'un doing too much? That's what the umpire thinks when he turns down the lbw appeal. But they have reviewed this. Oh it is one of those ones. Clipping leg. Had he given this on the field, he would have stayed out. But Karthik bats on
tries the big sweep, gets an inside edge to short fine leg
swept away again, finally gets off the mark. Karthik against spin is a good match-up for the bowler
on a length, middle and leg, worked away for one to leg
short of a length, outside off, punched down to long-off for one
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for a single to long leg
punched down to long-off for one
slower offcutter, Karthik opens the face, and backward point is in tight on the single

dropped by Rahul at mid-off. Not an easy chance. Rahul actually does really well to get there running back. Leading edge for Karthik, Rahul tracks it down, dives to his left, but the sits only in the finger tips and not in the palm as he hits the ground. And it wobbles out
short of a length, pulled hard, but for just a single to deep square leg
backs away to drive this to deep cover for a single
too short and sits up. Patidar goes back to pull this over deep midwicket for another six

another drop. It is Hooda this time, and it is a much easier chance. Both these batters have been dropped now. Wrong'un, pulled towards midwicket but doesn't get all of it. Hooda comes in, is under it, but it slips through. Goes for four too
that's salt in wounds. Bishnoi overpitches, and he goes straight back over his head. Lovely hit
oh this is unending for Bishnoi and LSG. Short of a length, wide, and he punches this wide of long-off. This is just cruel on Bishnoi

make that 27 off the over. Patidar is playing a blinder here. Too full again from Bishnoi, and he lofts him clean over long-on for a flat six. Into the 90s he goes. He could have been out for 20 runs fewer
Karthik shuffles across, Avesh goes wide, Karthik tries to ramp this towards third man. Beaten
and now Karthik rubs it in. Avesh misses the yorker by a little, and he goes over extra cover. Clears him easily
lovely batting. Avesh goes length now, but he gives him the width and Karthik drives this hard and along the ground past extra cover for four more
shuffles wide, Avesh goes wide, and this time he has been called
when it rains, it pours. Avesh has done Karthik in with this short ball outside off, but the top edge flies over de Kock for four more
yorker, outside off, steered to backward point for one
slower ball, full toss on the pads, pushed to deep midwicket for one
short ball, slower one, beats him on the punch
slower short ball again, Patidar well early into the pull. Beaten again

luck is smiling on Patidar. Wide and bright. Hard length again, Patidar looks to slog it into the leg side, gets a leading edge over point. Vohra runs back, gets to it, but it is one of the toughest catches to hold on to. Drops it

sensational hundred comes up for Patidar. What a story. He was not even picked at the auction originally. First on-pace short ball of the over, and he has pulled it over midwicket for six. Big standing ovation from the dugout
back to taking pace off, beats him on the pull
another slower offcutter to draw another dot as Patidar swings and misses

given out lbw but Karthik has reviewed this. Karthik is shuffling across anticipating a wide yorker but Chameera has surprised him b y going straight and has hit the boot on the full. However, there is a mild scratch on Ultra Edge as the ball goes past the bat. Decision reversed. The slightest of the edges
one bluff nearly worked. The second one flies deep into the stands. Chameera again tries a straight yorker, and Karthik gets under the low full toss and clears long-on with ease
now he goes for the wide yorker, but Karthik goes deep in the crease to steer it in the air and over short third man for four more
straight yorker again, gets an inside edge for a single to short fine leg
Patidar keeps going. Slower ball, right in the slot, and he clears the front leg and slogs it way over deep midwicket
oh this is carnage. Patidar's blinder carries on. He anticipates the wider ball, shuffles across, and then ramps it clean over short fine leg for four more. Chameera provides another slot ball here
placed wide of long-on for two
pumped right back over his head. Avesh bowls the length ball, Karthik stays deep and across to crash this straight of a very straight long-off. That brings up the 200
slower short ball, beats the upper-cut outside off
Karthik is filthy with himself. Shuffles across early, Avesh goes wide, Karthik tries to ramp it over third man but misses
overcooks this bouncer. Goes for five wides. Gambhir watches on helplessly. This is a massive wide
yorker, Karthik can't get under it despite going deep in the crease. Just the single to long-on
Swinging in to the pads, but all the stumps are visible as de Kock misses the flick and is struck on the pads. The 50K odd join Siraj in appeal.
Fuller around off and middle, gets it off the inner half down the track.
Dropped? Leg byes signaled though. Bowled it on a length on the pads, de Kock gets it off the thigh pads as he misses the flick. Karthik puts a dive but only gets a glove.
Back of a length ball angling in, Rahul hops and tucks it to long leg to get going.
Right! Quinton de Kock marks his attendance! A harmless ball on a length,. he clears his front leg and lifts it over deep backward square leg for half a dozen. Off the mark in style.

It's celebration time for the RCB and the Eden Gardens makes its loyalties known with the huge cheer as de Kock falls cheaply. Not the start Super Giants would have wanted. He looks to lift this over mid-on but the bat turns his hands. Easy catch for du Plessis running to his left.
What a ball! Just further than good length around fifth stump line. Rahul gets back to block but it passes under the bat.

Full on off and middle, flicked away through front of square on the leg side. Lomror chases it down and stops it on the third attempt. He crashed into Harshal coming to his left from deep square leg. Three runs result.
On a length outside off, steered to third man to get going.
Length ball outside off, punched towards point for none.
Length ball, seams in a touch. Turned around the corner for a run.
Full and outside off, times it straight to covers for none.
Outside off on a length, punches it through covers and calls for two straightaway.
A touch short outside off, cut away through point for one.
A touch shorter around off, wristed back towards the bowler.
A bit fuller this time outside off, pushed back to the bowler. Huge cheer.
A bumper gone way above. Wided. Karthik did well to get a decent amount of glove to prevent that from flying away.
Full length ball on the pads, flicked through square leg to the fielder in the deep.
Very full on middle, pushed to mid-on for a quick run.
Vohra misses, Karthik misses and its four byes! Vohra came down to hit it across but missed it completely. The keeper couldn't get around in time as well.
And that's rubbing salt on his wounds. Similar ball on a length around middle and leg, this time Vohra makes contact with the hit across the line. Over deep midwicket.
A touch shorter around off and middle, Vohra chips it almost straight to long-off. Lands well short of Faf running in.
Fired in on a length around middle and leg, goes back and punches it to midwicket.
Slower and fuller outside off, pushed to covers.
Shorter this time, outside off, punched to the man at cover.
And there goes Vohra! Gets a length ball on the pads, he flicks it over square leg for four.
Oh, my word! That was as classy as it could be. Full and outside off, he checks his chip shot and it has enough in it to go the distance. Holds the pose!

Catching practice to midwicket as Hazlewood strikes back! Back of a length around off, it climbs on Vohra who looks to heave it over midwicket. Shahbaz runs to his right and takes a good diving catch.
Full and outside off, drives it straight towards wide mid-off.
The flying Hasa! Flings himself to his right at covers to save a certain boundary. Was driven nicely by Hooda.
This time nothing's stopping it. Hooda has been timing the ball really well. Finally manages to split the gap at extra cover to get going.
Rahul opens up now. Heaves this length ball, that is angled into him, over midwicket to collect four.
Going, going, gone! Rahul sure knows this is the final over of the powerplay. Stays deep in the crease expecting another short ball. Pick-pulls it over long leg to bring up the fifty for LSG.
Just short of short third! Good comeback from Siraj. Bowls it on a hard length around off, climbs a touch more than Rahul expects. Gets a thick outside edge that lands just short of Hazlewood.
No half measures this time! This has travelled 20 rows back over cow corner. Another bumper that Rahul quite expected.

Brilliant fielding again by Hasaranga. Is that a catch though? Most RCB fielders think so. And the TV umpire will have a look. It was full and outside off, Rahul made room and ended up squeezing it out. It went off the face but well just short of the diving backward point.
Rahul pushes this full toss towards mid-off and sets off for one. Gets it comfortably.
Tossed up low full toss on the stumps, pushed down to long-on for one.
Hooda plays the slog sweep aerially towards deep midwicket, lands well short of Kohli running in.
Slower through the air around off, defended back towards the bowler.
Flighted legspinner, full outside off, pushed through cover-point for one.
Drives the very full ball to long-off for another run.
A touch flatter outside off, slapped to sweeper for one.
Fuller on middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on as Shahbaz fields after running to his right.
A touch short and outside off, cut to deep point for one.
Hooda comes down the track early, seeing which, Shahbaz fires it on the pads. Gets it off the inner half to deep square leg for one.
Fuller on the pads, turned to deep square leg for a single.
Hooda connects, and connects big! Shahbaz fires it full outside off seeing Hooda make room. But he is well in control and connects inside out over extra cover.
Fired down leg, Hooda misses the tuck.
Length on the pads, turned through midwicket for a brace.
A touch short and slow outside off, Rahul goes back and wrists it through midwicket for just one.
Flighted on a length around middle, Hooda slinks down and turns it through midwicket for one.
Fuller around off, Rahul stays on the front foot and works it through midwicket for a single.
Charges down and gets it off the inner half again to deep square leg for one.
Tossed up outside off, Rahul misses the sweep.
Gets away with the bad ball. Short around middle, pulled to deep midwicket for one.
Back of a length ball outside off to start with, pushed towards covers.
Length ball outside off again, Rahul hits it on the bounce to short third man. A better throw would have caught Hooda short.

Almost caught it, did Hasaranga but has he given away six? Kudos to the effort first up - covered good ground to his right from deep point towards sweeper. And he has done extremely brilliantly to not make contact with the ad cushions while he is in possession of the ball. Excellent job. It was a short ball and there was enough width, Hooda stood tall and slapped it towards sweeper. Almost a catch, as I said.
Very full on the pads, worked through midwicket for one.
Harshal's managed to deceive Hooda with the short, offcutter. He is early into the pull and ends up top-edging it. Lands in a no man's land on the leg for one.
Length ball on the pads, punched through midwicket for one. Just five of Harshal's first.
Cute! Tossed up outside off, Rahul changes the grip at the last moment and just steers it past the keeper via a reverse sweep and earns four.
Flatter on the middle, turned through midwicket for one.
Floated up on leg, comes down and powers it to long-on for one.
Floated outside off, Rahul gets a thick outside edge towards short third for one.
Where's the bat? It's not just the balls flying but also that wooden block! Slips out of his hands as he looks to cut the flatter one outside off.
Quicker and flatter outside off, Hooda lets it be. Not a good call, in my view. Was inside the guideline.
Slower on off and middle, hit to deep square leg for another one.
The back of a length offcutter, Hooda is early into the pull and wears it on the side of his stomach.
Another back of a length slower ball, outside off. Rahul goes for the pull, gets an under edge that goes on the bounce to Karthik.
This time manages to connect the pull off the slower length ball, straight to deep square leg for one.
Back of a length outside off, another slower one, punched towards mid-off for one more.
Another back of a length slower one, Rahul ducks. One for the over called.
Short and wide again, fetches the pull to get it through mid-on for one.
Fired flat outside off, mistimes the slaps towards covers for one.
In line of the stumps this time, goes inside out through covers for one.
Slower outside off, Rahul comes down and pushes it with soft hands to the off side for one.
Well done Faf! And a tag-team effort along with Lomror keeps it down to two. It was a tad short outside off, Hooda punched it towards wide long-off.
Fuller on the stumps, Hooda looks to power it over the boundary, loses his shape and gets it off the inner half to deep square leg for one.
A bit of confusion but they complete the run. Rahul cuts it and Hasaranga stops it with a dive at backward point. A bit of hesitation but the run is completed.
Fifty for KL Rahul in some style. Took 43 balls. Is it good enough though? Or is too late? Stands back and thumps the back of a length ball over deep midwicket.
On a length around leg, punched towards long-on. They run well to take two.
Rahul has decided to go berserk, seemingly. But he only makes contact with thin air this time, against Hazlewood's back of length ball outside off.
Another short ball, off-pace this time. Rahul pulls but has no timing. Gets one as the ball rolls towards deep square leg.
This is all timing and power from Hooda. Another back of a length ball from Hazlewood at 111.6 kph. Hooda goes back and slaps it over where straight long-on would have been.
Goes for the yorker but bowls a low full toss on off, sliced to sweeper for one.
Hooda has hit this a longggg way and it's a pity he can only get six off it! Was bowled off the side arm and it was the legspinner outside off. Hooda got under it and hit it over deep midwicket.
Quicker and flatter outside off, Hooda looks to repeat the shot, misses.
Deepak Hooda shows why he is rated highly and why he is in at four. Charges down to the leggie and deposits it over long-on for another half a dozen.

Is there life in this or what? This game is going one way and then the other, see-sawing like only T20 can. Hasaranga gets his man after being hit for a couple of maximums and lets everybody at the Eden Gardens know who the boss is. Bowls the wrong-un with a flatter trajectory, Hooda looks to go over cow corner. Misses it completely and sees the stumps shattered.
There you go. The googly to start off, Stoinis goes back but inside edges it onto his pads.
Uh, oh! Stoinis proves me wrong, for now. Gets down on his knee and picks the googly early. Wallops it over deep midwicket to get going with a sixer.
Back of a length slower one outside off, Rahul flatbats it down to long-on for one.
Yorker outside off, dug out to the off side for one.
Excellent slower ball. Outside off on a shorter length, Rahul let it pass thinking it would be a wide.
Up, up and away! 12th six of the innings to go with just the four fours. Another back of length offcutter from Siraj, Rahul is too smart for that. Plays the horizontal bat shot over long-on.
Outside off on a length, pushed through covers for one.
Sprays it wide outside off, Stoin lets it be.
Good way to end the spell. Full and wide outside off, passes under Stoinis' driving bat.
Floated outside off, Rahul comes down and works it through midwicket for one.
Looks to do that, gets it off the inner half through midwicket. It was bowled side of the arm, which meant the trajectory was quite low.
Smart batting by Rahul. Gets inside the line early as Hasaranga bowls the googly on length. Sweeps it powerfully after getting under it and gets it over fine leg for a 69-metre hit.
Once again moves to the off side, does Rahul. Gets enough bat on the sweep past short fine leg.
Flatter on middle, punched through midwicket for one.
Flatbats it down to long-off on the bounce. Hasaranga finishes off with 1 for 42.
Fires it well outside the tramline, wide given. They are checking if it landed outside the pitch before the stumps, but it didn't.
That is a very poor ball and even Karthik couldn't do much. Sprayed well outside the batter's reach outside out. It was the offcutter and Karthik got a bad bounce as well.
And what a comeback that is. Fast short ball, at 130 clicks. Stoinis pulls but misses.
Back of a length offcutter, Stoinis lets it pass thinking it to be a wide, but it wasn't.

Fielder, fielder, takes it! Rajat Patidar is the man at deep extra cover and he couldn't have been found any more perfectly. They check for the height - if it is below the shoulder - and it well is. It was another back of length offcutter outside off. Stoinis hopped and slapped it straight to the fielder, who didn't have to move an inch.
Bowls this full outside off from wide of the crease, driven nicely through cover for one.
Good use of the wrists from Rahul but gets just one. It was the offcutter on the hips. Seemed to have gotten enough for it to go to the fence through backward square leg but it didn't.
Lewis swings for the masses but misses it completely. What an over. The first two balls and the rest of the over were two different overs there.
Smart bowling. Rahul was all set to belt another length ball over the on side. But Hazlewood spears one full and wide outside off and Rahul can only watch it pass.
And now that is a wide. Not sure if Hazlewood is happy. It was just outside the tramline and Rahul moved to play the reverse sweep. But the decision stands.
A low full toss outside off, hit down to long-on for one. Good bowling so far.
Unlucky. It was full and just past Lewis' pads down leg. Misses the flick, wide given.
Another one down leg, this time Lewis lets it be.
Gets his line right. Offcutter outside off, Lewis misses the hit. But the batters steal a bye. Lewis was late to respond but the bowler couldn't effect the run-out.

Is this the telling blow? Eden Garden erupts. Hazlewood is down on his knee with his fist up in celebration. Shahbaz Ahmed has run half a lap after timing his jump to catch that. And Rahul has all sorts of emotions on display as he walks back after making a half-century that could well be not enough for his side. He gets across to play the scoop to a low full toss outside off. But does not get it over the short fine leg fielder, who times his jump perfectly.

Two in two and is that it for Super Giants? You need to look at Kohli to know in whose favour this game is. It was a full toss at a slower pace. All Krunal could do was to spoon a catch back to the bowler. Walks back for a golden duck.

That is an anti-climatic end to the over. Speared full outside off, Chameera belts it down past the bowler. Halfway through he realises they shouldn't take the single. But such is the timing that Maxwell's dive running to his left from long-on cannot prevent the boundary.
Full and outside off, driven towards covers, where Hasaranga yet again dives to his left to stop that.
Slower short ball, well outside off, leaves it alone.
full and swinging back into middle and leg, Jaiswal is struck on the pad as he looks to work this through midwicket.
off the mark with a neat tuck off his hip to deep square
wow, did I really see that? Good length, in the off-stump channel, Buttler lets this go
off the mark with a lovely cover drive! Just a gentle push through the covers. Didn't try to hit it hard. Pure timing on the up
the nipbacker from fifth stump, left alone. Good comeback
he's found the gap again! Beats a diving Wade at mid-off as the ball screams past him on this carpet of an outfield. It was just another gentle push off the front foot.
a touch wayward as this moves away from outside off, there for the cut, but Jaiswal misses out as it goes low to the 'keeper
firm push off the front foot to mid-off
looks to force this on the up through cover but ends up chopping back down the pitch. Skidded through a lot faster than Jaiswal anticipated
full and snakes back into middle and leg, Jaiswal covers the late inward movement as he squeezes it back to the bowler.
no timing on the pull, just eludes midwicket. Dayal hit a hard length with that one

has him nicking and Jaiswal walks! This is a lovely delivery. Not there for the drive, and Jaiswal ends up wafting at that with no feet. The thin nick is snaffled by Saha. They all went up in an appeal, but Jaiswal didn't wait for the umpire to lift his finger.
length ball on off, defended back
sliding into middle and leg, neatly turned to deep square for a couple
peach! Buttler looks to punch that on the up but is beaten by the late inward movement that sneaks past the inside edge.
that's superb hand-eye coordination as Buttler laces that on the up to beat cover
looks for the big inswinger but errs by slipping it down, through to Saha
beaten on the inside edge again as this one jags back in sharply off the seam
shuffles across to be on off as Shami delivers, but ends up playing outside the line to get a thin inside edge onto the body
nonchalance! On the up for six over long-on. What a way to get off the mark. All wrists and forearms with that as he punches a length ball on middle and leg over the infield, carries all the way.
slants one full and across Samson, left alone in anticipation of a wide call but umpire Oxenford reckons it was just in
walloped! No one moved. Length and slanted across, Samson stands and delivers. Slapped on the up between cover and mid-off.
punched straight to mid-off this time
sways out of the way of this short ball angling away. Samson was looking to pull but bailed out in the end
excellent from Dayal. Bangs one in and it climbs on Samson who is rushed for pace, somehow manages to defend back
wayward, so wayward that even a diving Saha can't get to the ball. Big inswing after it passed Buttler.
length on off, defended.
pushed to cover, wants a run but is sent back and rightly so
right into the blockhole, squeezed out
slower length ball on middle and leg, Buttler helps the pull along to long leg
bludgeoned! Wade moved to his right and put in a dive to try and catch that but it was just wide. Shami hit hard length and Samson just muscled that
goes full on the pads and Samson picks him over midwicket. Too easy. He's in some form today
raw pace, thuds into Buttler's thigh pad at 147kph as he tries to get onto his toes and work it to the leg side
he's hit that verty, very far. Alzarri bowls length, gets it to lift off the deck, but it doesn't matter. Samson wallops the pull off the front foot and clears deepmidwicket.
