follows him as Samson tries to make room, he was looking to whip it away but the ball lobs behind off the thigh pad
short and sliding down leg, Samson picks his spot and helps him along to clear deep fine leg.
goes full and wide outside off, Samson is beaten as he tries to reach that to drive
right behind the line as he defends back
skiddy one on middle, worked to deep midwicket
steps out, Rashid sees that and bowls flatter, Samson defends past the bowler for a single
breaks away from length on middle, Buttler gives him the respect as he defends back
wrong'un that he tucks to midwicket and jogs a single
cuts well and finds thre gap in the deep, but this is excellent work from Wade who covers nearly 20 yards around the ropes and then dfives full length to save a couple at deep point
flat-bats one down to long-on for a single
shortish and drifting into middle from around the wicket, worked to deep midwicket
gives it air on middle, worked into the leg side as they pick up a single
finds the gap behind point! Sai Kishore bowls short and gives him width, Samson had already backed away to free his arms and just thrashed that as it arrived.
shortish on middle, worked to deep midwicket
worked to deep square
glorious from Samson! Sees width outside off and he slaps this between cover and point this time to pick the gap once again.
beaten by sharp turn as he looks to take him on with a big drive
clueless! Plays back to a full ball that spins away. Played for a googly, only to be done in nearly by a leg break
wrong'un this time, tucked to midwicket
attacks the stumps on a length, defended back
gets well forward and covers the line of the wrong'un as he defends
worked down to long-on. Two of the over.
steps out and hits it flat and inside-out to long-off
steps out to mow this into the leg side, gets it off a thickish inside edge to deep midwicket
drifts in and stops on Samson as he punches wide of the bowler to long-off
worked to deep midwicket

dragged to long-on! Sai Kishore has his man. Clever piece of bowling. Gave it air - quite brave of him to do so - got the ball to dip on Samson as he made room to go inside-out over long-off but ended up dragging it to the leg side and an easy catch to Alzarri.
beaten by the skid off the delivery as he shapes to cut
paddles the full ball outside off to fine leg after going down on his back knee
back of a length ball on middle. He opens the bat face to dab to point
this one spins away! Fuller in length on middle and off, and turns away as Padikkal tries to block from deep in the crease but is beaten on the outside edge
good length ball on middle, and again turning away. Clipped to deep midwicket off his back foot
the googly now! Shortish in length on middle and off, and turning in. Clipped to fine leg with the closed face of the bat
back of a length again on middle. He goes deep in the crease to whip it to deep midwicket
swept over deep square leg! Gets down on his back knee to sweep that full ball outside off, which is going on with the angle. Drilled for the maximum
shorter in length, and just outside off. Tries to slash, but is beaten
another shortish ball on middle which goes with the arm. Punched to the man at cover from deep in the crease
this is pretty full, and tossed up on middle and off. Driven to wide long-off with a flat bat
slower, and floated full on middle and off. He tries to push forward, but gets an inside edge to deep square leg
misfield by Pandya at cover, and that is a single to deep extra cover. Shortish in length on middle, and he slashes at that with his front leg out of the way
starts with a back of a length ball on middle at 135kph. That keeps a little low, as Padikkal has to adjust for the low bounce, before dabbing it down
wide ball. A touch fuller than the previous ball, but pitching outside leg. He clips, but misses, and it is called wide
on a good length on middle and leg, and he taps that to cover before setting for a rapid run
clears his front leg, and lands a pull just short of Shami running to his right from fine leg! Pandya bangs it in short on middle, as Buttler is into his shot early, top-edging a pull safely enough
and again gets his front leg out of the way to hoick that back of a length ball on off to wide long-on. He is sensing the need to go big now
on a hard length just outside off. He opens the bat face, and taps that to the man at point
continues with that back of a length ball. This bounced more, and ended just outside off. Clipped to deep square leg from deep in the crease
on the fuller side of a good length on middle. Clipped to deep square leg from deep in the crease
very full and wide of off. That was tossed up too. But wide anyway, as Buttler lets it go
full and on middle and leg. He clears his front leg before pushing it to long-on

that is pumped over deep midwicket! Gets down to sweep, and unleashes another six. The left-hander hitting the left-arm spinner from around the wicket. Full ball on off, and Padikkal gets the right length to smash that milesss away

skips down the pitch, and the bowler follows him to go full and wide of off. Padikkal gets an outside edge that runs away for four, even as Shami gives the chase but gives up in the end. Kishore not happy with that
four to deep point now! Short of a length just outside off, as he went back in the crease before slashing that to beat the man in the deep to his left
fuller, and on middle and off. This keeps a little low, as he whips that to deep square leg

drags it on! The middle-and-leg bail is disturbed, and Padikkal is bowled. Gets a bottom edge while trying to pull that offcutter, which is on a shortish length and rising outside off. Padikkal plays the pull away from his body, and perhaps even swings his bat early with the ball coming on slowly off the surface, and has to depart after an entertaining innings
pulls to wide long-on! Gets a short ball outside off which again takes off from the surface, and pulls off his front foot
Clips for four to deep square leg! That somehow squeezes between the men at deep square leg and deep midwicket. Fullish ball on middle and leg, and angling into his pads
back of a length ball outside off, and punched to the man at cover
good fielding by Jayant Yadav, the sub fielder for Wade, at deep point. He runs and dives to his right to save a few, after Buttler pushes at a full ball on off
this is again full and outside off. Buttler nudges at that late, and plays to deep point again
pretty full ball on middle, and he gets a leading edge to cover as he tries to clip that
shorter in length on off, and the googly turning towards middle. Pushed to long-on
pretty full ball on middle and leg, as Hetmyer now gets a leading edge to point while trying to turn that around to the leg side
short of a length on middle and off, and whipped to deep midwicket
fuller in length, and just outside off after turning away from middle and off. Tapped down
fuller and just outside off. Again Hetmyer is happy to block it back to the bowler

has that been dragged back last moment by Rashid running to his right from deep square leg? Nope, the ball has touched the rope before his hand gets there. In fact, Rashid had himself signalled four after that attempted save. Buttler pulls with his bottom hand off, as Dayal bowls a slower ball on short of a length on middle and off. No control there, but four still

Pandya at long-off slips, and the ball sails over him for a one-bounce four! A short of a length ball outside off, and another change of pace delivery. Buttler hammers that away from his body, and gets what he wanted in the end
pretty full on off, and dragged to the man at extra cover

misfield by Joseph at short third, and that is four more! Exactly the momentum Buttler wanted. That's his fifty too, off 42 balls. A low full toss just outside off, as he has a heave but gets an outside off
now that is called nerves. Full and very wide of off, as the slower ball goes awry. Buttler leaves it alone
four more! Buttler on song now! Pierces the gap between point and short third man, as he slices at this full ball outside off with an open face of the bat
change of pace again. On a short of a length outside off, as he swats that to long-off after playing late
pumped over the bowler's head! An offcutter on a hard length outside off, as Buttler steps back in his crease before thumping that for a once-bounce four
good ball now. A yorker delivery on middle and leg at 145kph, as Buttler manages to jam that to the man at extra cover
whips this fullish ball on leg, as he clears the front leg for a single to deep backward square leg
heaved away wide of long-on! Right in the slot for Buttler to have a smash, as it is a length ball on middle, and Buttler gets his front leg out of the way before hammering that

you know it now, don't you? It is a low full toss on middle, and Buttler - like he does at his best - stands deep in the crease after clearing his front leg before crushing that towards deep midwicket
bouncer at 143kph! Bangs it in short on middle, and gets that to angle in, as Buttler ducks underneath.
Looks to pull that shortish ball on middle and off, which angles into him. Gets an inside edge on to his body, as the ball rolls over to the off side

dropped by Rashid running forward from deep midwicket! Buttler suddenly has everything in favour after a dry first half of the day. Short ball from Shami on middle and off, as he pulled but got a top edge

taken at long-on! Hetmyer gets one in the slot - the ball was full on middle, and shaping to angle in - as Hetmyer went for the slog over the on side but failed to connect. Crucial wicket for Titans, even if Hetmyer wasn't entirely going on very rapidly
on a hard length on off, and angling in. Clipped to deep midwicket to get Buttler back on strike
it is Buttler's day, period! The ball somehow manages to travel over short third man, as Buttler tries to pull that slower ball on a hard length

the shot of the day! The first six by Buttler this innings comes off the last ball of the 19th. A slower ball again, and this is a length ball just outside off. Buttler clears his front leg, and sends that sailing over long-off

his bat flies somewhere towards square leg, as the ball ends at third man! Goes hoicking at that slower ball, which is full and a little wide of off. Parag loses his grip, and manages what he wanted - perhaps! Now there is a check for a short run, as his left boot just kisses the crease. That is fine though
a low full on off, and that is drilled to long-on

launched over long-on! That has gone somewhere near the Ganges. Again gets a gift - right in the slot, where one loves it in the death overs - as it pitches on middle, and Buttler rams that wayyyy over long-on
goes for the heave to this full toss outside off, as he finds the man at extra cover. The bowler loses balance and falls, but all is good in the end, especially since he gets a dot ball
they rush for two, as the throw arrives at the keeper's end only to find Buttler in quickly. Full ball on middle and off, and jammed to long-off

Buttler is run-out off the last ball, as he falls short of an obvious attempted second! He is way short of the crease even as he tries to dive. But, but, but... as cruel as it gets for Buttler and Royals, it is a no-ball. Tries to swipe that length ball to long-on, as he clears his front leg. They run for the second - as they always would have considering this was ideally the final ball - and Buttler is short
slants a back of a length delivery across Saha, punched to cover point
got him! What a cracker from Boult. Gets this to nip away ever-so-slightly from back of a length  on middle, and Saha nicks one trying to work it to the leg side. Straightforward catch for Samson.
full and moving away from outside off, defended with soft hands
width and Wade slaps this behind point, beats square third man to the boundary.
full and moving away from outside off, left alone. Hardly any carry that time
stands tall and bunts it into the off side with soft hands
back of a length outside off, left alone
slapped away disdainfully! Just a hint of width, Gill picked the length early and put that away between cover and mid-off.
leading edge but just eludes Jaiswal at cover! Extra bounce of Prasidh nearly does the trick.
bottom-edges a push to the slip fielder
thuds one into Wade's elbow as he attempts a shot-arm jab. Yanks his gloves off in pain.
poor ball and the Titans will take the freebies. Full and way down leg, Wade missed, Sanju missed.
pulled and pulled well. It appears as if Wade was rushed into the stroke but he just about managed to hit it well to beat wide mid-on.
full and swinging back into middle and leg, worked to deep square
covers the line of this full delivery as he defends.
tucks this off his pads to deep fine leg
full outside off, driven firmly to mid-off where Buttler puts out a diving stop
edged and this flies between second slip and gully. Right into the gap. Wade was squared up by the length
delightfully done! Angling into the pads and Wade flicks this into the gap at midwicket. Races away on this carpet-like outfield.
skiddy length ball on middle from wide of the crease, worked to the leg side
punched straight to cover.
tucks this incoming delivery to square leg
steps out and drills this full ball to mid-off
flicks to deep square leg
driven firmly and for a while it seemed as if it was destined to the fence until Buttler put out a sensational full-length dive to save a certain boundary
short and angling in, Wade swivels back and helps it on its way to the deep square leg fence
a misfield at mid-on allows them to take a couple of runs
short of length on middle and leg, tucked wide of midwicket
gets an inside edge, a healthy one at that, and it flies off a thick inside edge past a diving Samson to the boundary
too much width and Gill has clobbered that through cover. Too full outside off from around the wicket, Gill reached out and picked the bones out of it.
fuller on off, pushed to mid-off for a single
fires one down leg, Gill sweeps and misses.
inside-out for six! Stunning from Gill as he steps out, gets besides the line and goes boom. What a shot.
back cut for four! Too much width outside off and Gill slaps this to beat a diving point fielder.
full ball drifting into the pads and Gill flicks this imperiously through square leg. It was the carom ball gone wrong
shortens his length a touch, pushed to midwicket
bowls one on a length, it hurries onto Wade as he pushes to cover
squeezed to mid-off for a quick single
drifts one away from the left-hander as Wade drives to sweeper cover
lovely from Chahal. Loopy and he finds some turn from leg-stump as Gill lunges forward and defends
fired full and down leg, tucked to short fine
shortish on middle, worked to deep midwicket
worked against the turn to deep midwicket as they jog the single
tossed up and away from Wade's arc, he's briefly lulled into a big shot but doesn't bite the bait and lets it go
lands the carom on middle, Gill bunts it down to long-on
cuts well but this is a superb stop at backward point. Jaiswal threw himself to his left full length to save four
drifts this down leg, Wade misses the tickle. Wide called.
punched to deep midwicket

hara-kiri with the running and that's a massive wicket! Gill works this full delivery to the man coming in from deep midwicket and turns for the second, only to see Wade take a couple of steps for the second and then freeze. It gave Padikkal the extra second to send in a superb throw on the bounce to Hetmyer who did the rest at the bowler's end. Unfortunate end to an innings that promised the moon
defends as Ashwin skids one in from around the stumps
lunges forward and pats it to cover
pushed through flatter outside off, eased to sweeper cover
nicely tossed up outside off, Wade slices the drive to point
wrong'un on off, punched to deep cover
punches this shortish delivery down to long-on
slow turn but sharp turn from middle, Wade is looking to cut but ends up chopping it into the off side as he's cramped for room.
reverse swept superbly to bisect short third and backward point.
starts off with a short ball but way down leg, wide called.
width and cracked behind point. That's superb from Hardik. How quickly did he pick the length!
slower length ball on middle, worked towards deep midwicket

Wade has fallen in trying to pull one to the longer boundary. He hit it well alright but found the lone man at deep midwicket. Buttler leapt high and kept his balance as he took the catch comfortably a yard or two inside the rope. The double-strike could hurt the Titans.
dug in short and it turns out to be a second short ball in the over. Miller let this slower bouncer go and sees the umpire signal a free-hit. This should get him going.
toe-ends a slap to long-on. Got it off the inner part of the bat
slips this short ball down leg, another wide called as Hardik tries to tickle this fine
whipped to the long leg boundary! Wayward from McCoy, got the direction wrong totally.
full and down leg again, another wide. McCoy is struggling and Samson runs up to him to have a word.
threads the gap for four! He overcompensates outside off with a juicy half-volley and Hardik paces it to beat mid-off. Momentum changing over?
beats him on the outside edge! On a hard length outside off, and sharply angling in at 139kph. Miller has a poke at that away from his body, but doesn't connect
good length ball on middle and off, and angling in again. Clipped to fine leg
a hard length ball again outside off, which shapes in. Pandya punches it to the man at cover
outside edge, and the shorter boundary gets him a quick four! Short and wide of off, as Pandya has a a slash at that away from his body. Still gets four to third man
good bounce for Krishna here. Bangs it in short outside off, and gets it to angle in. Pushed by Pandya towards cover point
goes for the pull to this short of a length ball on off, which ends near leg stump. Gets a pad towards where a short fine leg would have been, as Samson gives the chase
this comes into him, as it is a carrom ball. Good length ball on middle and off, as it is whipped off the inside edge towards square leg
much fuller on his pads, and clipped to deep midwicket
drills this pretty full ball on the stumps. A single to long-on
slower, and full on middle and leg. Pushed to long-on, as it invites calls of "ball, Ash bhai" from Samson
this is full and angling into his pads. Nudged to deep midwicket
on a shortish length, and just outside off. Cut away to deep point really late, leaving Ashwin with his hands on his head
bowls on a short of a length outside off, as the slower ball bounces well and comes into Miller. Tucked to point while swaying away
change of pace again, as he goes fuller and a touch wide of off. Miller slashes at that away from his body, and manages to get that between extra cover running back and deep point running forward
slower-ball bouncer this time. Bangs it in short just outside off, as Miller waits for the ball to come before pulling to deep square leg
full ball outside off. Pushed to long-off
gets an inside edge, as he looks to clips this fullish ball angling into his pads. The ball rolls over to the off side
a dipping slower ball, that ends up being a wide-ish full toss. There is speculation of it being an above-waist no-ball, but it stays a legal ball. Single to deep cover
full and on the stumps. He gets his front leg out of the way, and makes room, before pushing it to long-on
keeps a touch low after being sent in shortish on middle, as it turns in. Pulled to deep midwicket
good fielding by Parag diving to his right at long-on! A good length ball on middle that is whipped by Pandya across the line, as it seemed to have come from the inside half of his bat
this is whacked well wide of long-on! A full toss outside leg, as Pandya makes room early and decides to clatter that in the gap between long-on and deep midwicket
and he bowls a wide. Full and very wide of off, and left alone
full and straighter on middle. Driven to long-on all along the ground

jams that down the ground for four! Long-on was standing on the fence, but had no chance. It was a pretty full ball on middle and leg, and he drilled that between the non-striker and the stumps for four. Ashwin finishes with conceding a four
this one turns away after pitching on a shortish length on middle and off. Pushed to deep extra cover with the turn
good turn into the batter. Flicks this shortish ball on middle to deep midwicket
this is fullish on middle, as Pandya nudges at it for a single to long-off. His bottom hand was nearly off there
crashed down the ground! That raises the fifty stand too. Miller sees one tossed up full and slow on middle and off, as Chahal attempts the googly. Miller doesn't let it turn, and launches into it
fullish length outside off, and cut away to deep point
short of a length this time. Pitches on middle, as Pandya tucks it to the man at cover
starts with a hard length ball on off, which is bowled with scrambled seam too. Punched to the man at cover for a quick single
chips this slower ball to deep midwicket. On the fuller side of a good length on his pads, and he plays aerially
foxes him by the slower ball! This is bowled at 118kph - and is a knuckle ball - on a good length outside off, and shapes away, as Miller tries to jab at that
whipped to long-on, and Parag again dives and saves a few! He dives to his left, and keeps it to two. Fullish ball angling into Miller, as he clips that off the insode half of the bat
and this time it is Hetmyer saving a few! Short and wide of off from Boult, as Miller cracks a cut with Hetmyer at deep point running and diving to his left
slower ball again. This is on a short of a length outside off, as Miller pulls to deep midwicket after letting the ball come to him

bowls a dipping slower-ball full toss, and the ball ends up between point and short third man! Miller misread that back of the hand ball, as he went to push but got an outside edge. Never mind, he still got what he wanted
this is a good ball. A yorker on middle that is whipped away to deep midwicket with his front leg out of the way
good length ball on middle, and change of pace again. Clipped to deep midwicket

just short of extra cover diving across to his right! Slower ball and fullish and outside off. Miller has a tentative push, and ends up spooning it. Jaiswal there was really deep, and so that saved Miller
short of a length ball on middle and leg, as Pandya pulls to deep square leg
plays the pull, and gets that off the higher side of the bat. Short of a length ball on middle that is climbing on to him, as he is not in control of that pull
gets across off early, as Chahal follows to bowl short and wide of off. Cut away to deep extra-cover
shortish ball on middle, as Pandya punches it to long-off with a slightly open face of the bat
and again. Chahal follows Miller, who is pretty across off very early. Bowls short and wide of off, and swats to long-off
whips this fuller ball on leg to deep midwicket from deep in the crease

hammered into the crowd! What a sound that made! Miller swings that far and wide over long-on. The ball is again wide of off, but this time full and tossed up. Miller notices that early, and crunches that for six
short and wide of off again to Miller - like he has bowled earlier this over - and it is cut away to deep point
bangs it in short and just outside off. It is a slower ball, and Miller swats to long-off
goes for the pull to this short of a length ball on middle and leg, but is cramped for room. A single to deep square leg despite shaping up to crash that away
drilled wide of long-off! Miller maintaining a calm head here. He first tries to back away, but then stands in the crease to this very full ball on off, and sends that racing
slower ball on a short of a length on leg. Miller swivels to pull, but gets a glove as the ball rolls over to the keeper. Luck not to have hit the stumps
fifty for Miller! Fullish ball on middle and off, as he heaves at that off the inside half of the bat to deep square leg
Pandya is beaten all around, and Titans now need 16 off 6 balls! Back of the hand slower ball on a full length, and wide of off. Pandya has a swing at that, but the ball is far from his body

banged over long-on! Just the start Titans wanted. Miller moves across off stump early, and gets a ball right in the slot outside off from Krishna, whose angle from over the wicket helps the batter. Miller tears into that, and wallops that for the maximum

this time over deep square leg! Miller at his best. This is on a good length on middle and off, as this time Miller stands deep in the crease with his front leg out of the way. That allows him to swing that pull comfortably, and he sends that easily over the ropes

Carlos Brathwaite hit four in a row in 2016, and Miller hits three to win it in 2022! Titans make the final in their debut season. But Royals have another chance to make it there. Miller completely dominating the match here. Absolutely slogged over deep midwicket after opening himself up, as he was served a fullish ball on middle
Tossed up ball full on middle and leg, Garg reaches for it and pushes it to long-on to get going.
Flatter and fuller outside off, Abhishek leaves it alone.
A tad shorter and closer to off, cut away to backward point.
Slower and wider, mistimed towards covers.
Now Abhishek gets going. A bit more short this time and just enough width for him to free his arms. Hits it over cover to get the first four of the game.
Good comeback. Fired in an arm ball around off and middle, Abhishek gets his bat down in him to keep it away to the off side.
Starts off very full outside off, Garg reaches out for it. Misses edging it by a whisker.
Fuller and around the sixth stump line, gets it off the inner half towards the bowler.
Quick single! Garg drives this towards mid-off and sets off straightaway. The throw goes to the keeper's end but Abhishek was well in.
Full and outside off, seams away after landing. Abhishek lets it pass.
Outside off on a length, cut away through point for a single. Bowling to his fields is Arshdeep.
Slower one, picked early. Garg just turns it away towards where fine leg would have been and collects two. Quiet start thus far.
And he's welcomed with a boundary! The warm-up ball is a gentle half-volley on the pads, that Abhishek flicks through midwicket to the fence.
Full and just outside off, pushed towards mid-off for a quick one.
Very full on off, Garg hits it quickly to mid-on, no chance of a run.

Got him! Soft dismissal for Garg Speared on a length on off and middle, he looks to play across. All he manages is a leading edge. Agarwal runs to his left from mid-off and gobbles it up. It was the cross-seam ball and that did Garg in. Wicket No. 99 for Rabada in IPL.
Bowled on a length around middle and leg, defended solidly from the crease to the off side.
Nicely timed. Tripathi is in some touch. A tad fuller than good length, angling in on middle and leg. He glances it past mid-on and gets going with a four.
Full and swinging away outside off, left alone.
Back of a length this time, around the fourth stump channel. Abhishek adjusts and steers it to short third man.

Has he made it in? Abhishek went back to the length ball on off and steered it past short third man running to his left. Before the sweeper could return the throw, the batters run two and he is well in before the stumps are disturbed. The TV ump also checks for a short run at the bowler's end but Abhishek has done well.
Swivels the pull in some style! Banged in short and angled in to him, he adjusts and pulls it through fine leg for four.
On a length outside off, chops it to the off side.
Again on a length around off and middle, defended from the crease.
Back of a length ball outside off, shaping away a touch. Tripathi feels for it and misses.
Sprayed down leg, Tripathi misses the flick.
Length ball around off, climbs a bit more after landing. Tripathi taps it to the off side and gets to the other end.
Slower ball on a length, Abhishek mistimes it towards covers.
Aha! As good as it gets. Looked quite effortless. Short ball on the hips, he climbs up and tucks it past short fine leg for four.
Length ball slanting away, steered to deep backward point for one.
Another length ball outside off, cut away deep to point for one.

A dropped chance on the very first ball! Very tough to take it in the followthrough. Tripathi looks to bish the length ball over the bowler's head but gets it off the high part back to the bowler. Ellis has a couple of goes but fails to hold on.
And now seeing Tripathi charge down making room, Ellis spears it outside off on a length. A swish and a miss.
Length around off, gets it off the inner half towards mid-on.
That's nonchalantly flicked away over square leg for half a dozen. That travelled 69 metres. It was bowled on a length on the pads and was a gift.
Short and wide and cut to deep backward point for one.
PIcks the slower ball early and thumps it! A good end to the powerplay for SRH. It is on a length and he has rolled his fingers. Abhishek pulls it through midwicket to end the over on a high.
Starts of a with a slower one on a length around middle and leg, Tripathi goes back and punches it down to long-on.
Heave-ho over deep midwicket for half a dozen! Abhishek is making the right noises this season. It was a half-tracker and he went back and pulled it high and long.
Flatter outside off, Abhishek goes across and defends.
Hurled fuller on the pads, turned through square leg for one.
On a length on middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one.
Flatter and fuller outside off, Abhishek misses out on the cut.
Begins with a short one, pulled all along the ground to long-on for one.
Very full on middle, gets it off the inner half to long-on for a single.
The quicker legspinner on middle and leg, Tripathi gets it through square leg for one.
The offspinner on a shorter length outside off, slapped through covers for a brace.
Fired on off, pushed towards cover for one more.
Full and outside off, belted down to long-off for one.
Shot but will get just two. Full and driven nicely through covers, Livingstone does well running to his left from long-off.
On a length outside off, cuts it to backward point.

Tripathi is furious at that. And he makes it known by swinging his bat in the air as he walks off. It was fired down leg, he got inside the line and looked to sweep it over short fine. But fails to get the elevation and finds Shikhar Dhawan there. Tripathi falls after a start and he is visibly unhappy as he crosses the ropes.
Fuller and quicker on the stumps, punched back to the bowler.
A tad shorter around off, punched through point for one.
Slower outside off, mistimed towards covers. A successful over for Brar ends.
Legspinner bowled full, driven down to long-off for one.
Tonked away in some style! A touch shorter, allows Abhishek to go back and pull it over wide long-on for a 84-metre hit.
Quicker and a tad short outside off, cut straight to backward point.
Now he works the legspinner with the angle through square leg to go to the other end.
Fuller outside off, pushed through covers for one.
\Fuller outside off, gets an inside edge onto his front leg as he goes for the drive.
Brar tosses it up full on off, and Markram slices it over extra cover for four!Opens the bat face a touch to send that over the fielder inside the circle, and beats deep point to hois right
good length ball on off, and that is slashed to point for a quick single

very well taken by a leaping Livi at long-on! He had to time his jump well there, and he did that. Livi leaps, and grabs that with both hands firmly while finishing just inside the rope. Full delivery just outside off with a hint of flight, as Abhishek tries to slog that over the fence in an attempt for another maximum. Sunrisers losing momentum in search of quick runs
drags that full and wide ball outside off to wide of long-off. Off the mark, as he plays with a flat bat there
a touch shorter in length, and  on fifth stump. Markram again opens the bat face, and sends that slicing to deep point
good length ball a touch wide of off, and with a hint of turn into the batter. Cut away to deep point
pretty full ball on middle, and pushed to long-off with half a step forward
bowls full on off, and with the action of a legspinner. Tucked to the left of the man at extra cover, who dives to get a hand
full again, but straighter on middle. Tapped down to the right of the bowler
tossed up, and it turns out to be a full toss on his pads while dipping on to the batter. Clipped to deep square leg with the closed face of the bat
full again on leg stump. Nudged to deep midwicket, as long-on rushes across to field the ball
fuller on off, and closer to the batter. Almost cramps him for room as Pooran blocks it down
full ball on off, with a hint of shape away. Markram pushes it to mid-off, and they rush for a single. The throw arrives at the keeper's end, but is wide of the stumps
on a hard length on middle stump. Pooran is deep in the crease with his front leg a little out of the way, and defends that with his head down and with the bat face slightly open
much fuller and just outside off. Driven to long-off with the full face of the bat
on a back of a length on middle, as Markram tucks that back to the bowler with his front leg out of the way. Ellis misfields, and lets that slip for a single to long-on after getting a hand
wide delivery. On a shortish length outside leg, as Pooran thinks about pulling but misses
slower ball at 116kph. On a much fuller length around fourth stump, as Pooran drags that to point along the ground

edged, and taken by the keeper! This was angling away after pitching full and on fifth stump. It was more of a Test-match line and length, almost tempting the batter to drive and play away from his body. Pooran is attracted by that full length, as he goes fishing outside off while trying to drive, but gets an outside edge right into the keeper's gloves. Kings taking out one after another here
good length ball on middle and off, almost going on with the angle. Pushed to long-on for a single after clearing his front leg
yorker to welcome the new batter. Lands that bang on off stump, as Sundar goes low to jam that to point
good length ball on middle, and angling away. He closes the bat face, and tucks that to the man at midwicket
he tries the ramp, but is beaten! Rabada pitches it short on middle, and gets it to angle away late, as Sundar tries to upper cut but doesn't get bat on ball
bangs it in short and just outside off. This time Sundar runs that down third man after playing late
hard length ball on middle and leg, and angling in. Clipped to fine leg with the closed face of the bat
pretty full on middle, and pushed to long-on, as they run pretty quickly and manage two there. Very good running
deep point runs and dives to his left, but can't stop that! Short and just outside off from Brar, as Markram cuts that away fine for four. That was played late, and almost off the keeper's gloves
good length ball on off, and an arm ball there! Goes on with the angle, as Markram tucks it back

appeal for stumping! I think Markram is short of his crease since he lost balance there. Yup, his back foot is short of the crease. Sharp turn and bounce beats the batter there. Brar tossed it up on a good length on leg stump, as the ball turned away to end up outside off while also almost shooting off the surface to surprise Markram. The third umpire also check for an edge there, as he takes the help of UltraEdge. Markram lost balance because of the dual problems, as the keeper collected it close to his chest there
pretty full ball on off, and pushed to cover
shorter and quicker outside off. He tries to slash, but is beaten
driven straight, as the stumps at the bowler's end are shattered! Full length ball angling into off, as the bat turns in his hands while playing forward
chips this slower ball on a full length on middle. A single to deep midwicket
yorker on off. He jams his bat down to that 138kph ball, and gets that to the leg side
slower-ball bounce, and foxed completely. He bangs it in short outside off, as Shepherd pulls but is beaten entirely
good diving stop by Agarwal at mid-off, as he rushes and dives to his right. Much fuller on off, as he pushes forward, and the ball takes off from the pitch after being pushed forward
sharp yorker at 136kph. Brilliant ball there. Fires that on middle while getting it to angle in, as Sundar gets an inside edge while trying to jam that out
good length ball just outside off, as he tries to slash away from his body after getting his front leg out of the way. Beaten there

extra cover dives to his right, and deep point runs and dives to his left, but that is still four! A change of pace on a back of a length outside off, as Sundar rides the bounce to send that slashing to wide of deep point
a touch fuller and angling into his pads. He tries to clip, but gets that off his front pad to the on side. A leg bye there

Ellis is not happy, as the ball sneaks in between fine leg and deep midwicket! On a short of a length on middle and off, as he pulls from the higher side of the bat, and somehow manages to send that for four

six over fine leg! It is a back of a hand slower ball from Ellis, and one which is angling into his pads. Shepherd has to adjust to go low, and has a swing over fine leg for the maximum. He plays late, and sends that flying
this time Arshdeep does the cleaning up running to his right from deep midwicket. It is a full toss from Ellis, and is turned away to deep square leg
excellent loft over long-off! Brilliant shot. On a hard length outside off and with a scrambled seam, as Sundar sends that flying over the fielder from deep in his crease
good length ball on middle, and angling down leg. Wide called, as Sundar misses attempted clip
good length ball and angling into middle. Pitches on middle and off, as Sundar pushes that to cover from deep in his crease
a bye stolen there. Slower ball from Rabada on a shortish length outside off, as Shepherd swings and goes for the pull, but is beaten. The keeper can't collect it either, and they manage a bye

if you will be missing Pant this tournament, Sundar says he can do it too! Plays that scoop perfectly Pant-like. Full ball and wide of off, as he gets into position and goes across off while losing his balance and sending that over short fine leg
five wides now! Rabada not having a good over. Jitesh dives to his right but doesn't get a hand to that good length ball angling into leg
much fuller on middle, as he clears his front leg and drags that back to the bowler
has a swing to that good length ball on off. A single to deep midwicket
full toss on middle and off, and that is sent flying to long-off
fires in a yorker on middle and off at 138kph, as Shepherd gets his front leg out of the way to drag that to deep midwicket
a dipping full toss on middle, as Sundar has a heave to deep midwicket for another single

four in between the bowler and the umpire! That was full on off, and right in the slot for him to have a swing. He got his front leg out of the way, and sent that crashing down the ground for four. Neither of long-off and long-on stood a chance

takes half a step down the pitch and also stands a little across, and sends that swinging to mid-off. A full toss just outside off, as the ball lands just short of Shahrukh inside the circle. The ball hits his left leg and he grins, but looks good to continue

sliced over extra cover! Sundar doing it with the bat. Perhaps an attempted yorker gone wrong there, as the ball is another full toss just outside off. Sundar clears his front leg, and stands deep in the crease, waiting for the ball to come before opening the bat face to send that over the fielder inside the circle

just beats long-on for six! It didn't look all that convincing when it was hit, but that was hit flat and furiously. Full toss outside off, as he hangs deep in his crease to send that pumping from the higher side of the bat
fuller length on middle and off, and that is heaved to deep midwicket. Shepherd wanted a second, but was sent back

dolly for short third man! Sundar is foxed by that slower-ball bouncer. Ellis lands that short on middle, as Sundar has to leap while trying to get on top of the bounce there. He waits and waits for the ball to come - perhaps not expecting to rise that much, considering the lack of pace - and ends up spooning it to the fielder

chipped to long-off! Ellis is on a hat-trick! A full length ball on off, which goes on with the angle from over the wicket, as Suchith clears his front leg to try and heave that over the off side. But the length seemed too full for that loft there, as he ended up lifting to long-off
good ball there. An attempted, dipping yorker which ends up being a low full toss on middle and off. Bhuvi pokes that to long-on

Bhuvneshwar is run-out at the keeper's end! And it's a no-ball even as the players rush back to the dressing room. That looks like a tight call for no-ball though. A yorker sent firing just outside off, as Shepherd has a swing but is beaten but the length. The batters try to steal a bye, as Bhuvi is way of the crease while Jitesh destroys the stumps after running forward

He is bowled, but he cannot be out since it's a free hit. And there is a run-out chance at the bowler's end which also ends up being not out, as confirmed by the third umpire. Too much happening off the last two balls. A pretty full length ball on off - nearly a yorker - as Malik swings for the on side but misses. The off stump is shattered, and realising that he cannot be out, the batters immediately take a bye. Good awareness there, even as the throw from covers came at the bowler's end, where Ellis broke the stumps, although Malik was in by that time
Starts off with a length ball outside off, Bairstow defends it towards covers for none.
Bairstow and Kings are away! Intensions pretty clear. Looks to hit this out of Wankhede and into the Arabian Sea. Gets a thick outside edge over short third man for four.
Takes the shine off the ball there! Length ball swinging in, Bairstow stands legside and belts it through midwicket for another four.
Slower one on a length, gets an inside edge as he looks to force it through off.
Another slower one, swinging away. It was the knuckle ball. Bairstow is done in by the change of pace and makes contact with thin air.
This is a gift for Bairstow. Full and in the slot on middle and leg. He gets his front foot out of the way and hits it over the non-striker for his third four in the over. Kings are flying.

Dhawan was a goner had that hit. Dhawan was squared up by that delivery on a length and got it off the outer edge to short third. He then had to gather himself and run to the other end but the throw missed the stumps.

Oh wow! Sometimes you know it when it is your day. And perhaps Bairstow might know now. Looks to heave this flighted ball over midwicket but ends up getting a thick inside edge. It runs through the gap between square leg and short fine and has enough legs to cross the rope.
A tad shorter, Bairstow misses the pull.
And Bairstow connects this. Lands it on a length, slight turn in. Pulls it with the turn and deep midwicket had no chance.

That's straight up but Umran Malik drops it. Catches don't come easier than that at this level. Bairstow looks to swipe a flighted ball outside off across the line and ends up skying it up. Malik calls it early at short third and settles under and feels he has taken it before closing his palms and grassing that.
Floated full around off, JB walks down and turns it down to long-on for one.
Angling across on a length, JB has a swish and a miss.
Full and wide outside off, it was bowled slow. Bairstow is early into his shot and gets it towards midwicket for one.
Length ball outside off, Dhawan chops it towards backward point and gets to the other end.
Fuller around middle and leg, JB makes room and steers it to the off side for one.

Lovely timing. Dhawan charges down and pushes the slower ball through covers, bisecting the gap. Markram chases it down and fires a flat throw to the bowler, who is not near enough to the stumps. Could have been a goner again.

End of the Bairstow show! And there are some words exchanged as well. Full and straight, Bairstow looks to thump it but misses and sees his stumps disturbed. Farooqi leaps to let his glee known. Malik would be heaving a sigh of relief that the drop hasn't cost them much.
Full and outside off, hit through point for one.
On a length outside off, gets an inside edge through square leg to get going.
Length ball on the body, pushed to the on side.

Is it pad first or just bat? Kumar checks with the keeper but then lets it be. Dhawan seemed to have pushed the length ball to the off side for one, despite the appeal from the bowler. Replay shows that it pitched outside leg anyway.

Shahrukh Khan is here in Mumbai, ladies and gents! He is batting at three for the first time in T20s and is making an impact straightaway. Gets back quickly to the back of a length ball and hits it over deep midwicket for half a dozen.
Short and outside off, Shahrukh ramps it to third man for one to retain strike.
Length ball on the pads, whjipped away over midwicket for another four. Shahrukh sure having some fun.
On a length this time, angling away. Pushes it towards mid-off and gets to the other end quickly.
Full and angling in, turned to midwicket.

Another run-out chance goes abegging! Dhawan charged down and got it off the inside edge towards midwicket as Farooqi changed his pace. Shahrukh was down in search of a quick one and was sent back. Direct hit would have been curtains.
Ouch, that must have hurt. Misses the pull and wears it on the hip bone.
After a working over, Dhawan gets a streaky boundary. Was cramped for room as he looked to push the length ball through off. Ended up getting it off the inner half past the diving short fine leg.
Fires one full on the pads, worked away towards square leg for one.
Full ball outside off, swept to deep square leg for a single.
Fired in a tad short, heaved away on the bounce to deep midwicket for one.
Dhawan has picked that up alright. Dances down the track and picks up the length ball for a six over deep square leg.
Two in a row! Similar to the previous one, the only difference being the target area. This one turned to be a full one as he danced down and flicked it over cow corner.
Flatter outside off, chops it to cover-point.
And Shahrukh welcomes him with a four. It was speared full around the fourth-stump line. Shahrukh is already on middle stump, he belts it straight down the ground past the non-striker.
Banged in short, SRK misses the pull.

And Malik gets on the board early! Ambitious from Shahrukh, who looks to tonk the length ball - a bit on the shorter side - over long-on. It was hurled at 144 clicks and he ended up getting it high on the bat. It went a long way up and Washington, running back from mid-on, ensures he has his eyes on it and takes it safely. End of Shahrukh's cameo.
Back of a length ball on the hips, Agarwal hops and misses the tuck. But gets to the other end and is now on the floor. That's hurt.
Full and outside off, Dhawan gets an inside edge on the bounce to the keeper.
Banged short again, Dhawan taps it next to him and hares to the other end. Mayank runs, too, with a hand on the left side of the stomach.
Flatter outside off, Dhawan goes back and punches it through covers for one.
Tossed up full outside off, Mayank pushes it back towards the bowler.
Similar ball, just a bit short. Mayank goes back and pulls it through square leg and gets to the other end with a hand on his ribs.
Very full on the pads, glided to short fine leg for a quick one.

Mayank's painful, literally, stay in the middle comes to an end. He was rattled early on and didn't look his self at all. Goes back to this short ball but pulls it straight down deep midwicket's throat. Didn't get enough power due to the pain. Washington strikes.
That's how it is done, sir! Livingstone does what Mayank failed to on the previous ball. Half-tracker spinning in, he goes back and dumps the ball 20 rows back over deep midwicket. Up and running.
Very full outside off, squeezes it over backward point for one.

Excellent effort from Washington but I think it landed just short. Livingstone survives. Looked to heave the short ball over midwicket but got it off the toe-end. Long-on came running in and put in the dive and only managed to get his fingertips to that. Technically a drop. And a bat (animal) flying also put him off perhaps.
Fuller and outside off, steered to third man for one.
Short and well wide, swish and a miss.

Fetch that! Length ball outside off, Livingstone hits the leather off it over extra cover. It was bowled at 153 clicks and such was the power that the ball came back towards mid-off after hitting the LED ad boards.

The Livingstone show has started at the Wankhede! He's flown to 19 off just five balls. Another high-paced length ball around off and middle and he just thumps it over deep midwicket. Umran's bowling fast and it is flying off the bat faster.
Dhawan charges down early but fails to get bat to it. Off the pad towards covers.
Fuller around off, turned to midwicket.
Fuller on middle, worked through square leg for one.
Fired in a tad shorter, goes back and punches it through covers for one.
Fires it down leg and Dhawan misses the sweep.
Fuller and slower outside off, he goes back and taps it to the off side for one.
Just a single, which means Suchith has done well. Another full ball driven to sweeper for one.
starts with a slower ball on a yorker length on off. Pushed to point with his bottom hand almost off
slower-ball bouncer this time. On a shortish length outside off and angling into Dhawan. He is cramped for room, as he sways out a little before ramping it late towards third man
pretty full ball a little wide of off. Livingstone has a slash at that, but gets an inside edge to the on side with his bottom hand off
another yorker. This one lands on middle and at 136kph. Dragged to deep point after going low
change of pace again. On a fullish length on middle and off, and shaping away. Tapped in between point and short third man
he swivels while pulling this short of a length ball which ends on off stump. Another slower ball from Farooqi, with the ball angling in. Dhawan turns around while pulling to fine leg
skips down to this good length outside off, and ends up pushing it back to the bowler
clipped for four to wide long-on! Great use of the bottom hand there. Full and tossed up on middle and off, as Dhawan sent that racing over midwicket
again skips down, but this time the ball turns into him off a shortish length on off. Takes his front pad to the off side as he is beaten by the turn while trying to clip, and they get a leg bye
short of a length, and a little wide of off. Left alone, and is not called wide
and again, but this is called wide. Short and wide of off, and Livingstone leaves it alone
has a poke at that fuller ball outside off, but finds point. Sends back Dhawan who wanted a run
has a slash at that fuller ball outside off. Gets that off the bottom edge back to the bowler
a yorker angling into off. Dhawan has a jam at that, and drags that to cover
slower ball this time. Good length ball angling into off, as Livingstone has a tap at that towards cover
Wide called, but looks like a harsh call. That was a yorker pitching on leg, and angling into the batter, who had no clue with the slower ball dipping on to him

cleans him up! Cross-seam ball from Farooqi at 137kph, and on a good length on off. Dhawan looks to run that down third man with an open face of the bat, but is cramped for room since the ball was too close to his body for that shot. He gets a faint bottom edge, as the off stump is uprooted out of the ground

outside edge, but four to get off the mark! Full and outside off, with the ball ending at fifth stump. Jitesh drives away from his body, and gets an outside edge to beat the keeper comfortably to his right. Four to third man
shortish in length at 139kph, and on a middle and off length. Has a swat at that, but is beaten
crisp drive for four! Places that between mid-off and extra cover. Pretty full ball on off, and he leans forward to drive it in Pujara-like fashion with a lot of bottom hand
short and outside off. Livingstone cuts that late to deep point
four more, and Jitesh keeps timing those very well! Full and flighted just outside off, with a hint of turn away. Jitesh pushes at that just enough to beat long-off diving to his left
six over long-off! Effortless from Jitesh. Skips down the pitch to this fullish ball on middle and off, and sends that racing away with pure timing
this is fuller and on middle and off. He gets his front leg out of the way, and heaves that to long-on off the inside half of the bat

dropped by Sundar at point! Livingstone was perhaps looking for the 1000th six of the season, as he came down to that flighted ball full outside off. Got a leading edge that flew to the fielder, who had to take a few steps back only to drop an easy catch

taken on the edge of the rope at long-on! Jitesh's fun ends. Garg takes a well-judged catch, with the rope barely a step away from his boot. A short of a length ball on middle and off, as Jitesh's eyes light up on seeing a possible six opportunity. But he ends up sending that right where the man was placed
on the fuller side of a good length, and pitching on a possible tenth stump. Left alone, and wide called

Farooqi loses sight of the ball, it drops wide of him to his right, and then rolls over for four! The ball spins away for four, as Farooqi at short third man has to run back and keep an eye on the ball, with Livingstone heaving a full ball on off
beaten by a slower ball. On a good length outside off, as he has a jab but doesn't get bat on ball
has a slash at that back of a length ball outside off, and finds the gap between deep point and long-off

No better man to get that 1000th six of the season, and no better way either! Full and wide of off, as Livingstone connects with that slog over wide long-off, sending that 97 meters and into the top tier

misfield by Malik at fine leg, and four more! Not great ground work by Sunrisers today. Malik tumbles to his left, and is beaten by the ball spinning away from him, as Livingstone flicks that full ball outside leg
six more, and Kings are one hit away! Full and a touch wide of off again, as Livingstone gets one in the slot, and absolutely crashes that over long-off
Kings win with a boundary! A fullish ball outside off at 145kph, as Mankad opens the bat face a little, and sends that trickling to deep point. The man there gives up, as the ball rolls over for four
Back of length outside off, punched to extra cover
Length outside off, slashes and misses
Length on the stumps, pushed to the right of the bowler after shuffling across
Ducks down a bouncer aimed at him to let it go
Back of length just outside off, pulled to the left of midwicket for four
Pulls a similar ball squarer this time, it was slightly straighter and deep square leg dove to his right and stopped it
Low full toss on middle, driven to long-off
Shuffles across and goes back to flick a good length ball outside off to the right of the bowler
Full on middle and leg, flicked to deep-midwicket. The revs are high and there's some dip too
Full on leg stump, worked to mid-on
Full on off, it's overpitched and DW whips it aerially over mid-on for four
Nurdles a length ball outside off back to the bowler
Good length on off, pushed to the bowler
Prithvi makes room and goes inside out over long-off, it was full and he took a stride and went through to lift it over the infield
Length on the pads, tucked to deep-midwicket
Tries to sweep a full ball, it hits the pad and goes to short fine leg. Given leg bye. Rohit cheekily was shaping to signal for the review
Clips a full ball on the stumps to deep-midwicket

Cuts and finds short third man! On a back of length outside off, Warner tried to slash it and it went off the top-edge. Bumrah took it to his right and that's a massive wicket for MI. DC's inability to get big starts from their batters continues
Good length on middle, driven straight. Mid-on runs across and stops it

Test match bowling, finds the outside edge and it's taken at slip! Marsh played at it with an angled bat facing mid-off, it took the edge a bit like it did with Joe Root at Lord's and Rohit took it low. He played it with hard hands and the catch was taken low to the right
Full on middle, clipped to the right of deep fine leg
Full on off, driven to mid-off
Bouncer angling in is high, Prithvi tried to ramp it behind the keeper while arching back and missed
Clips a full ball to midwicket. Mid-on came in and threw it. It looked okay but Prithvi did not slide the bat in, so it would have been out
Full on off, kneels and brings out the broom. Finds the gap just in front of square. Deep-midwicket comes across and stops it
Shuffles across and punches a length ball to the left of the bowler
Clips a length ball to deep-midwicket with a roll of the wrists
Full on the stumps, lunges forward and defends to the bowler
Good length and flat on off, the 96 kmph ball is nudged on one leg to the left of the bowler

Pant misses the sweep to a full ball and is hit on the pad, given not out as it looked to have gone down leg! Hawk-Eye shows it's going down leg. On first viewing, it looked close but the off-stump was showing and Venkat got it right, I thought that was plumb!
Good length outside off, opens the bat face and pushes it to point
Length outside off, Prithvi uses the room and slaps it wide of mid-off for two
Short of good length into the body, turned to the leg side

Searing bumper gets Prithvi! Back of length ball angled in sharply from the 11 o clock action, Prithvi was indecisive as the ball came in quick. He may have thought of the upper cut initially but the ball bounced steeply. He was falling behind and the ball took the gloves and ballooned behind. Kishan ran front, diagonally to his left, and went low down with a dive to take an excellent catch
Short over middle, defended to point
Short ball comes in on the chest, pulled on one knee over deep fine leg over the first tier
Yorker on middle, driven to the bowler
Good length ball comes in to middle and off, pushed to cover
Turns a length ball on the stumps to deep square leg
Gets on a knee and sweeps the length ball on middle on the up to deep square leg.
Good length outside off, opens the bat face and drives it to deep-backward point. Fielder ran to his right to stop it, Bumrah chased it from the ring
Slight mix up but all safe. It came after flicking a length ball to midwicket's left. Pant took off but came back in time
Flicks a length ball on the pads to fine-leg
Good length outside off, driven with an open bat face to deep cover
Back of length outside off, steered to third man. Looked like a wristy drive almost
Full on the stumps, Pant moved across and drove it to mid-on right off the middle
Full on the pads, tries the flick. Beats and goes on the pads, lobs towards midwicket
Cuts it hard with a full dial of the bat swing in follow-through. It went off the edge, into the ground, fine of third man for four. It was on a back of length outside off
Full outside off, drags it with a whippy sweep into the outfield. Stopped by long-on to his right
Good length outside off, it spins far and Pant clips it against the turn to midwicket
Fullish ball pitches around leg and the googly turns away, worked with the spin this time, to push it to point

Big appeal for a caught behind, it's given! Sarfaraz has a chat with Rishabh and leaves! It came off a good length ball outside off, the legbreak spun away and Sarfaraz went for the late cut. The ball took the edge and Kishan took it and went up straight away
Comes forward and defends the full ball to the left of the bowler
Defends a good length ball outside off with an angled bat and soft hands, it goes off the outside edge past slip towards third man. Stopped with a chase to the deep
Comes down and clips the full to wide long on
Big bounce and turn from a good length ball outside off, comes in and it goes big on Powell who was thinking of turning it to leg. He retracted and the hands separated after he nurdled it below
Review for LBW by MI after the ball beat the sweep! Nothing on Ultra-Edge. It pitched around a length outside off, came in. The impact was umpire's call as was the case with hitting the stumps
Full on leg, clipped to midwicket
Cuts a length ball outside off to deep point
Goes back to a good length ball coming in to off and works it to midwicket
Good length ball spins away outside off after pitching in line with the stumps, the googly is cut to deep cover
Good length outside off, spins away and finds the outside edge. Rovman played it with soft hands so it fell in front of slip
Clips a length ball to deep-midwicket

Slapped through cover, goes to the deep where it's stopped by Sams with a run to his left. But was that a drop at cover or did it fall short? Looked like the latter. It was very low in front to his right.
Drags a length ball outside off to wide long on with a pull. Tilak at long-on ran towards it and fumbled it
Length outside off, cut to long-on
Cuts a length ball outside off to deep point
Full outside the tramline, came in but was well wide. Left alone
Powell clears midwicket with a slog sweep! It was full on middle, it came in a bit but with a stride in front and being on a knee allowed Powell access it with the middle
Goes back and clips a length ball on the stumps to midwicket
Comes down the track and swipes at it, clears the midwicket fence again! It was full, pitching outside off and coming back in, Powell reached out and swung it on the move. It went flat and far

Another misfield, this time at short third man by Bumrah. Goes for four. It came off a full ball outside off. Powell lunged across and tried to drive it through cover. It went to the right of Bumrah who could not stop it
Full and across the right hander, but it's too wide outside off. Left alone
The eight-ball over goes for 20 as Powell clips a length ball on the stumps to deep-midwicket
Clears long-off for six more! The full ball on off spun away and Powell went through with the extended aerial off-drive. It came off the bottom of the bat and went over the leaping fielder's right
Full ball spins away, beats the hard sweep, the keeper, and slip. Runs away fine for four
Flicks a back of length ball on the stumps to long-on
Googly on a back of length spins away sharply. It was slow and Pant dragged it gently with a push to deep-midwicket
Full just outside off, lunges across and defends it towards mid-off
Good length outside off, pushed to long-off
Length down leg, left alone
Tries to pull a back of length ball at waist-height, misses. Hits him and falls in front. He was on one leg as he played it
Deft from Rovman. Steers a back of length ball outside off but finds short third man. Went straight to him
Length on off, gets in line and jams it to the left of cover
Length just outside off, driven over the right shoulder of the bowler
Full ball outside off, driven whippily but off the bottom of the bat to mid-off. That was the first full ball in the over
Goes short, angles it in over the stumps. Pant ducks to let it go
Gently tries to steer a length ball outside off to third man. Goes off the bottom and falls onto the ground just behind
Back of length down leg, goes for the pull and is beaten
Bullet at the bowler takes the fingers and pops out! behind him It came off a length ball outside off that was slapped hard but off the bottom.
Low full toss on leg goes off the edge as the bat was turning. It was at the bottom of the leading edge, so didn't go up. Went to cover
Gets on a knee and pulls a back of length slower one coming into him to deep backward square
Length outside off, Pushed to point. Powell was looking at the fielder and the throw came to the non-striker's end where he was heading. Luckily for him, there was no direct hit
Clips a full ball to long-on's left, they look for two but the fielder is agile and so is the throw
Pulls it well, Sams moves swiftly to his right. Had to take a step or two across to stop the ball that was traveling quick and stopped it. It was a back of length ball outside off
Around a length over the stumps, front leg goes out the way and pulls it to long-on. Pitched around mid-on after going in the air
FInds the gap behind point by reaching out on a knee to slice the full, wide ball over the fielder and well into the gap. Deep cover had no chance
Back of length outside off, it was going away with the angle. Pant's front foot was down and across, he thought of playing it and later let it go
Low full toss is outside the off side tramline. Left alone

Edge flies over short third man for four! It was a good length ball outside off, turned full by a dance down the track. Pant flayed at it with the bottom hand coming off. It went wide of the fielder as well
Another wide, this time with a bouncer down leg. Pant was well out of his crease and tried to hook it but it was to his right
Slower bouncer down leg and Pant punishes it deservedly with a fine, aerial pull on one knee again. Goes well over the fine-leg fence

9-ball over ends with wicket with what should have been another wide! It was on a length outside the off side tramine, Pant reached out a bit too far and tried to drive it square with a horizontal bat. It took the edge, off the toe-end, and went to the keeper.
Hard length over middle, Powell has to go back and defend it in front
Bumper at head-height comes in over off and Powell sways away
Yorker on leg, Powell was backing away and tried to flick it. It went behind, between the legs to fine-leg
Length on middle and off, pushed to mid-off. This is test match bowling, the balls are zipping through
Back of length outside off, caressed to deep point

Connects with the pull and it sails over deep square leg! It was a short ball coming in, the direction was good but Powell was in position, swivelled and went through with the shot with good hand speed
Low full toss on middle, Axar gives back the strike to Powell with a flick to deep-midwicket

Length ball down leg, beaten on the flick. It hit the back pad and went towards the keeper's right, big appeal from the bowler but it looked to go down leg. Rohit showed no interest. Pitched well outside leg
Full on the stumps, flicked to long-on
Overpitched and Axar whacks it straight. He swung across the line, it was a full ball on fourth stump and the connection was sweet. Long-off saw it fly over to his left
Gets on a knee and sweeps a length ball outside off to long-on

Length ball pitches down leg and comes towards the arc of Powell, he tried to swing it over midwicket. Missed, it hit the body and squirted to the off side. Powell jumps in frustration and goes back to his crease
Yorker on the toes at middle, dug out to square leg while backing away

Yorker on off, beats the sweep, takes out the stump! It pitched just in the crease, Powell stayed leg side of the ball and tried to swing through but missed it. Palms up from Bumrah in celebration. Nonetheless, Powell has played an excellent innings

Leading edge off the nurdle goes over short third man's right. Backward point ran back to his left, Brevis tried to parry it to his partner. But went down off the palms. It came off a length ball on the stumps
Yorker on the stumps, pushed to long-on
Yorker on the stumps, dug out from the bottom of the bat in front of square
Low full toss outside off, driven to the right of long-off for two
In the slot on leg, slogged off the bottom of the bat. Went along the ground a few metres to the right of deep-midwicket. Tilak there did well to run and stop it. 150 up.
In the slot again but the angle was big. Thakur heaved and missed.
Wide of the crease again. Goes for the full, wide ball. It's a bit too much of both. Left alone

Whacked, got a good piece of it but not enough to clear Tim David at long-on. It was a slot ball but around eighth stump. The ball was travelling in the air. Tim waited as the ball took a while to come back down, settled, and took it at head-height with fingers pointing up
good length on middle at 138 kph, defended to mid-on.
full on fifth stump, goes to drive and flubs this toward mid-off.
vicious inswinger! This one swoops in sharply at 136 kph from fifth stump on a good length and nails Kishan right in the box playing around it.
another inswinger, this time not as damaging to Kishan as he gets bat on the 140 kph delivery coming in to his legs to flick through midwicket for one.
fullish delivery swinging away from Rohit late on fifth stump, strides forward to defend.
fullish length ball swings away very sharply again on fifth stump, too hot for Rohit to handle and the same goes for Rishabh, who fumbles the take though there was no edge.
full on fifth stump at 145 kph, just a firm forward press to drive through cover and it goes crisply in front of point to the rope.
fullish length on sixth stump at 145 kph, driven powerfully but straight to mid-off on the ring.
fullish length on sixth stump, width is there to attack this 147 kph delivery and flays this on the up over mid-off to the rope.
good length slower ball on fifth stump at 130 kph, Kishan prods at this trying to run this past the keeper to third man but miscues it into the ground and it's fielded by Pant.
Nortje tries to bounce him but Kishan is not cowed one bit! Short on middle, turtles his head into his neck while connecting on a pull that sails over square leg.
full on off at 136 kph, flicked straight to midwicket.
full inswinger on fourth stump, Rohit drives and misses, beaten on the inside edge through the gate, and somehow this doesn't come back enough to clip the stumps at 143 kph.
Khaleel moves this one the other way now swinging away at 142 kph on sixth stump, Rohit pokes this to point.
gem! Another high class delivery shapes away full from fourth stump at 140 kph, Rohit pokes at this with his feet stuck in the mud and beats him again.
back of a length now swinging away at 141 kph, Rohit can't touch this (queue up the MC Hammer music!) poking at this moving away from sixth stump on the back foot.
full and very wide outside off at 143 kph, left alone and called a wide. It was marginal crossing the guideline outside off. Umpire sides in favor of Rohit.
fullish length again moving away from fifth stump at 137 kph, MC Hammer is reincarnated as a left-arm bowler for Delhi. Rohit again can't touch this.
shapes this one back in now swinging past Rohit's inside edge once more full on fifth stump at 142 kph. Baggy parachute pants anyone?! Hammer time, hammer time! Ohhhh ohhhhh, ohhhh ohhhhh!
full on fourth stump, defended on the front foot to extra cover.
full on off, defended again to extra cover.
short on the body, goes to pull this and a top edge swirls over the fine leg rope thudding into a giant LCD ad board positioned above the boundary.
good length ball on the legs, flicked through backward square for one.
back of a length on off, defended to cover.
fullish length on fifth stump, uppish loose drive to this 135 kph delivery, diving stop at point but they scamper a single anyway.
fullish length on fifth stump at 124 kph, prods this past the non-striker to mid-on for a tight single.
good length ball angled into fifth stump, prods and beaten.
gem! Marsh bowls this on a good length on fourth stump and it hits the seam and jags back straightening past a hard-handed prod, somehow misses off stump.
charges Marsh trying to disrupt his length and miscues a good length ball from fifth stump into midwicket.
fullish length outside off, prods this into the off side.
back of a length on the body, goes back to flick but beaten for pace and hit on the body.
length ball on fifth stump, goes for a booming drive and misses.

Rohit is mercifully put out of his misery. This innings sums up his season. Half-volley on fourth stump, should've disappeared straight back down the ground to the rope but he scuffs a tame chip that floats in slow motion to mid-on. Basica catch at thigh height by Shardul on the ring.
fullish length on off, defended.
back of a length on off at 150 kph, defended again.
plenty of mustard again from Nortje back of a length on off, Brevis goes back to defend and a thick edge squirts wide of slip to deep third man for one.
good length ball on off, prods to cover and they set off on contact for a suicide single. Sloppy fumble by the fielder to nix what would have been a certain runout chance at either end.
back of a length on sixth stump, cross bat swat back to Marsh on one bounce and fielded sharply in his follow-through reaching left.
back of a length into the body at 129 kph, tries to flick this off his hips but can't time it and it dribbles off the body back to Marsh.
overpitched on fifth stump, driven hard down the ground but straight to long-on Warner for one.
back of a length on off, defended to midwicket.
fullish length on fifth stump at 130 kph, wild heave comes off an inside edge skittling along the turf to deep midwicket for one.
full and wide on the guideline outside off at 130 kph, Kishan reaches out to bash this just wide of extra cover on the ring and goes to the rope.
good length on sixth stump, defended on the back foot to cover.
good length ball on middle, defended behind square and Pant rushes out from behind the stumps to field.
good length ball on off, goes back to flick to midwicket. Kishan set off for a single from the non-striker's end but is sent back by Brevis.
googly lands short and wide on sixth stump and spins past an attempted pull.

full on middle, Brevis unleashes the pressure with a slog sweep and rockets this flat toward deep midwicket. The fielder on the rope leaps up to get a hand to it, Shardul Thakur, but only winds up pushing this over the rope. Not really accurate to call it a drop. He was purely looking to slap this back into play but it goes off his hand and over the rope.
back of a length on the legs, goes back to flick through square leg for one.
good length ball on middle, defended to midwicket.
too straight on the legs at 97 kph on a good length, goes back to flick to deep fine leg for one.
good length ball on fifth stump, flicked to deep midwicket for one.
back of a length on off, defended.
fullish length on off, goes to flick to midwicket, leading edge goes wide of cover for one.
good length ball on the stumps, punched to long-on for one.
full on middle, driven powerfully but straight to Warner at long-on fielded on one bounce.
flighted too full on middle, Brevis launches this drive high and deep over the sightscreen.

very very clumsy on the rope by Shardul at deep midwicket. Full on the stumps, big heave for the boundary. Should've been one, two at worst. But Shardul plays this horribly. Can't even call this a matador red cape effort as the ball goes well wide of him grasping at straws. Was more like the Three Stooges. Take your pick on whether Shardul was Moe, Larry or Curly.
very full zipped in at 115 kph on middle, jammed out well past Kuldeep to long-off for one.
good length on middle, goes back to flick through midwicket and flubs this into the ground, fielded by Pant coming out from behind the stumps.
floated full on off, slog sweep clears wide long-on landing just beyond the LCD ad boards. In fact it goes just below the car sponsor's vehicle positioned on a platform.
good length on off, prods this into the covers for one.
full on off, another slog sweep clears wide long-on by plenty this time around. Replacement ball needed as the ball is lodged in some tarp.
short on fourth stump, pulled through midwicket for one.
good length ball on middle, goes to flick into the leg side and it comes off the pads for one.
fullish length on middle, flicked wide of Warner at long-on for two.
short on fifth stump, pulled flat to long-on for one.
low full toss on the legs, pulled along the turf to deep midwicket for one.
full and wide, slices a drive in the air over point for one.

flighted full on the legs, goes to slog sweep this over the leg side but skies this to wide long-on where Warner takes a simple catch 10 yards inside the rope with hands moving to the side of his face at head height.
full on middle, jammed out to long-on for one.

Dropped! Pant spills a sitter off a skier! Flighted full on middle, goes for the slog sweep and it goes straight up over the pitch. Pant calls off Kuldeep and comes forward but the ball is tailing away from him mid-pitch, he reaches out late and fumbles it off his fingertips.
good length ball on middle, goes back to flick into the leg side.
full on the stumps, charges this and heaves a drive over wide long-on sailing onto the covered tarp seats at field level.
good length ball on off, defended to cover.
good length ball on off, goes back to flick to midwicket for one.
good length on the legs, goes back to flick through midwicket for one.
good length on the legs, flicked through midwicket for one.
fullish length on the stumps, flicked straight to short fine leg and they bolt for a quick single.
full on the legs, flicked to long-on for one.
floated full on seventh stump, goes to reverse/switch hit this behind point but misses.
short on middle, goes back to pull this to deep midwicket for one.
full on middle, driven to long-off for one.
short on sixth stump, punched to extra cover.
floated full on fourth stump, driven to long-off for one.
cutter zags off a good length well down leg side for a wide.
low full toss on middle, punched to long-on for one.
full and wide, driven flat to the point sweeper for one.

fullish length and wide near the guideline outside off at 129 kph, goes to drive this through cover but drags a bottom edge into the stumps. The drop by Pant only costs 12 runs in the end. Shardul with a peculiar non-celebration. Did he want Brevis to stay there and soak up singles and dots so that Tim David spends more time in the dugout? Hmmm....
fullish length on sixth stump, goes to drive and is beaten. Big appeal for caught behind denied. Pant has a long chat with his bowler about DRS but decides against it despite having two reviews left.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended to cover.
low full toss on the knees, flicked high and deep over backward square into the second deck 10 rows back.
back of a length on fifth stump, guides this with an open face behind point for one.
good length on sixth stump, punched behind point for one.
good length ball on off, defended.
length ball on fifth stump at 129 kph, smashes this on the up over long-off sailing into the stands.

length ball into his pads, goes for a big heave but misses. LBW shout denied with this pitching miles outside leg. Pant has now bizarrely called for DRS on a delivery which is nowhere near pitching in line with the stumps as a leg bye is taken. Pant is having an embarrassingly poor time strategically here with his use of DRS in the waning moments of a must-win match. The ball pitched a foot outside leg stump.

141 kph delivery lands on a length on off, pulls this in front of square, fielder from backward square circles around trying to keep this to two but slaps this off his body and it caroms off his body to the rope.
spectacular risk assessment from Tilak! Length ball on sixth stump, shuffles across to scoop this over the keeper and fine leg is up in the ring, automatic boundary.
slower ball on a good length on off, holds his hands back to flick over mid-on for one.
