Hooda balances himself a foot in front of the rope at long-off and reaches up above his head to take this safely without needing a self-relay flick.
slower length ball on off stump, goes for a big heave and it comes off the toe dribbling back toward Mohsin.

Mohsin trundles in with minimal effort protecting that right leg and a slower ball at 120 kph is picked easily on a good length by Narine who clobbers this over the midwicket rope barely clearing the man.
low full toss on off stump at 131 kph, flicked away through midwicket for two.
length ball on the body, goes to pull and clears deep backward square at 123 kph down the tunnel between sections of the field level stands.
wide yorker lands well outside the off stump guidelines at 134 kph, left alone and wide called.
yorker on sixth stump at 137 kph, Narine shuffles across and whips this off his toes through midwicket for one.
knee high full toss on sixth stump at 137 kph, Avesh misses the yorker badly and Narine flays this over extra cover thudding into the LCD ad boards over the foam triangle.
yorker on fifth stump at 135 kph, jammed out to the cover sweeper Evin Lewis for one.
wide yorker at 133 kph, shuffles across to sweep this and picks out short fine leg.
superb wrist strength! Full on middle at 129 kph, flicks a drive that just clears long-on.
bouncer on the body at 126 kph, pulls this awkwardly along the turf to deep square leg for one.
length ball on fourth stump, Rinku shuffles forward to swat this 113 kph delivery with plenty of Popeye forearm muscle over wide long-on beyond the rope.
follows Rinku backing away from leg with a 127 kph low full toss into the shins, miscues a heave along the turf through midwicket for one.
fullish length ball on leg stump at 129 kph, Narine heaves this along the turf through midwicket for one.
yorker sprayed down leg at 129 kph, lucky it didn't go for five. Holder was expecting Rinku to back away from leg but he stayed put.
full and speared into the legs at 128 kph, Rinku misses a flick and it comes off the pads into the leg side for one.
in the slot on sixth stump at 119 kph, Rinku sautes this drive over extra cover, no chance for long-off to cut it off.
bang bang! Length ball at 127 kph on middle stump, Rinku steps forward and creams a front foot pull shot that disappears beyond the post-match presentation setup beyond the rope.

Stoinis misses his yorker badly again and Rinku gets out the paddle to spank him like a headmaster to a naughty schoolboy over long-off! Full in the slot on sixth stump, punishes a drive into the sightscreen over long-off.

full on fifth stump at 129 kph, heaves this flat toward deep square leg, Rinku charges back for two and he's zipping so fast he looks like he had enough energy to turn back for three. His bat flew out of his hand turning back for the second but he got his foot across the line and motored home to the striker's end and then some.
Good length on middle, comes in with the angle and is blocked safely in front
Jaffa beats the outside edge! An outswinger on a good length left the bat on fourth stump. Abhishek tentatively opened the bat face and got squared up and beaten
Length on the stumps, blocked to the bowler
Length on fourth stump, steered to third man
Full ball misses the line, beats the flick and goes fine off the pad. Sams appealed but it looked to be going down leg. Rohit got a shake of the head from Sams on the review call
Garg was walking down and Sams responded with a well-directed bouncer, Garg ducked on the move with discounted grace at the last moment
Cover drive off the middle meets a full ball outside off. He went with a full follow-through and intended to drive it along the ground which he did
Clips a fullish ball on the stumps to the gap at midwicket for two
Good length on fifth stump, opens the bat face and guides it to backward point

Tight run but the throw went well over the stumps. Bouncer just under the armpit has the pull come off the top and the hand coming off. It went to square leg, Stubbs came in and threw it quick but it slipped and went over the stumps
Beaut beats the outside edge on the straight drive. It was on a good length on fourth stump, swung away and Garg looked to push at it. He seemed to be stuck on the crease and missed
Almost an action replay! A very similar ball, the shot shifted from a flick to a straight drive and he was beaten comprehensively
Misfield at point by Tilak allows one. It came after a length ball was nudged to his left
Swivels with the pull to a back of length ball coming to him and middles it. Goes behind square, well to the left of deep fine-leg for four
Length on the hips, turned to deep fine-leg

Skied and taken at mid-off! Full ball around fourth stump, Abhishek looked to loft it over mid-off but it went off the bottom and he looked despondent immediately. Markande waited and settled under the ball before taking it well

Chipped uppishly behind square but it's safe. It was a full ball on middle and leg, looked like it got extra bounce and hit the sticker of the bat as its face was turning. The fielder in front of square could no make it as it was too far away

Aiming London, going Tokyo but the trip is safe for Garg as he tried to flick a length ball on the stumps after taking a step down the track. It took the leading edge and went at the gap to the right of cover and into the fence
Yorker length ball on fifth stump, squeezed to the off side
Full outside off, whipped to mid-on
Tripathi shuffles across and gets on a knee for a slog sweep behind square. He found the short boundary from a ball on middle and leg effectively
Tries the same shot but it's outside off this time. The full ball takes the pad and goes to the off side. The impact was outside off, so he was safe
Tripathi's getting going, this time with an inside-out lofted drive over cover to send the full ball outside off to the fence
Good length on fourth stump, opens the bat face and guides it to point
Flicks uppishly, checks the shot at the end. So it falls well in front of mid-on's right. It was a good length ball on the stumps
Yorker takes out a puff of dust on off. Tripathi went back and jammed the bat to block it in front
Fullish ball just outside off, pushed with an open bat face to point

Bumrah goes shorter and Tripathi nails the pull over midwicket! He swivelled fully to rotate about 180 degrees, like an extension of a Steve Smith movement in the follow-through to get the 83 metre six
Glides a good length ball with finesse and pierces the gap between short third man and backward point
Creams a cover drive wide of mid-off this time. It was close to a yorker but he stayed in front and accessed the ball. 15 off the over after it was one in three balls.
Length ball goes away as the cutter beats the push aimed at cover and goes to the keeper on the bounce

Miscommunication leads to a dropped catch at fine-leg! It came off a mistimed pull shot off a short ball on the hips. The top edge shot the ball in the sky and Bumrah and Sanjay came in. Looked like they didn't call for it. Bumrah came in Sanjay's eyeline as he was about to take it and the ball went through the hands.
Length on the pads, clipped to deep-backward square
50 up for SRH with a guide to point from a length ball just outside off
Hot sauce on a fresh wound for MI as the short ball on the waist is helped with an aerial pull over fine-leg for a six. It ricocheted on the car from the second-tier.
Good length on fourth stump, angles the bat to push it to deep cover
Length outside off, driven to deep point off the backfoot
Length on middle, it spins away and is clipped against the turn into the acreage at midwicket
Length on fourth stump, punched to wide long-on for one. They thought of two but the fielder was quick and stopped it
Quick run to point. It came from a good length ball outside off. Tripathi reached out and opened the face late
Pulls a length ball outside off to deep-midwicket along the ground

Stumping appeal, sent upstairs. The good length ball pitched outside off and beat the bottom edge of the hard sweep. Nothing on Ultra-Edge. The foot came on the line but rotated clockwise to go back in
Good length outside off, beaten! Garg looked to guide it to point with a fully open bat face
Gets on one knee and toe-ends a slog sweep behind square for a 64 metre six. The fielder rain to his right and leapt as it was coming down but could not reach it
Full outside off, lunges forward and drives to deep cover
Opens up deep extra cover by coming down the track and lofting a full ball on off inside out. He got to the pitch of it and made contact before it spun away
Wide down leg
Gets down on the sweep to a full ball down leg, hit to deep-backward square
Darts a yorker but it's just down leg. The sweep was attempted and beaten. The keeper stopped it with good anticipation
Punches a length ball outside off to point
Full down leg, sweeps it fine. Went off the glove or the top of the bat
Reverses and Bumrah misfields to his right at backward point! It came off a low full toss and Garg had shaped for the shot early
Good length ball comes in to off, angles the bat and deftly channels it to short third man
Full outside off, pushed into the gap in front of square on the offside
Inside out sweep connects, it almost went for six. Yorked the cushion in fact. It came off a full ball on the legs
Flights a full ball on off, pushed to cover
Just over the right of the leaping point fielder and it goes to the fence! It came off a length ball outside off that was flashed at. Markande there flew but it was a bit too far
Good length on the stumps, goes for the flick. Gets it to deep-midwicket off the inside edge
Steers to the left of backward point, stopped well. It came off the length ball outside off and was traveling, the fielder did well to stop it
Off-cutter at 99 kph comes in to off stump from a good length, opens the bat-face to direct it behind square on the offside. It stopped a bit though.

The ball stops again and Garg spoons a push to the bowler! Fullish ball around fourth stump had Garg reach out and try to hit it straight. But it stuck into the pitch and meant he was on the shot too early. Taken brilliantly in the follow-through to his left
Short length ball comes on the hips over fourth stump, pulled to deep fine leg
Length ball pitches down leg and comes in to go on leg stump, clipped to the left of long-leg who had to run a few metres. But Sanjay there, who got to it, parried it and the ball hit the cushion
Good length on off, defended to the right of the bowler
Length ball comes in on the stumps, clipped to midwicket

Slower one finds the outside edge but it falls short of the keeper! The cutter hit a length and went away on fourth stump. The ball gripped and Pooran, who looked to play it with the bat-face looking at mid-off, saw the ball take the edge. But the pace was too low for it to carry
Length around off, blocked to the left of the bowler
Good length on off, angled bat defence goes towards cover point. The fielders swarmed to cut out the single
Slower one into the pitch on off, Pooran waits for it and punches carefully to long-on
Slogs a length ball on fourth stump with a cross bat. It goes off the bottom inside out on the bounce to deep-midwicket
Slower one on a good length on off, pushed to long-on
Yorker outside the off side tramline. Left alone
Yorker length ball on seventh stump, turned into a low full toss by Tripathi who went on a knee. But it was wide and meant he had to drag it to deep-midwicket along the ground
Whips a length ball just outside off to deep-midwicket. Not off the middle and Pooran, who went hard at it, is disappointed
Low full toss just outside off, Tripathi shuffles across and gets down. He goes through with a dig-out swipe to the gap on the right of long-on
Guides a length ball outside off to third man
Yorker on middle, clipped past the diving midwicket fielder. Deep square leg runs to his left and stops it as they take two
Hard length on fourth stump, opens the face and guides it to the right of third man
Thrashes a full ball on off over long-off for six! The bat turned in his hand but the boundary was short and the connection - good enough. Mid-off was in.
Slow length ball on leg stump, Pooran gets on a knee and lofts a sweep over deep-backward square for six
Low full toss on the pads, clipped to deep-backward square
Goes back to a full ball on middle and off and clips it to wide long on
Full outside off, reaches out and drives it to long-off with the spin
Slices it with limited control but safely. It was off a full ball outside off that he slashed at, the ball went in the air to the right of long-off who ran in but could not reach it
Full on off, Pooran sweeps with all his might and it sails over deep-midwicket for a second-tier six
Good length ball pitches outside leg and spins to leg. Clipped to deep-midwicket
Reaches out and drags a full ball almost on the tramline to deep-midwicket. That brings up Tripathi's fifty!
Back of length on fourth stump, slouches and guides it to third man
Low full toss on middle and leg, Pooran gets under it and flicks it to deep-backward square
Length on off, pulled along the ground a few metres left of deep-square leg who runs in and stops it. Brings up the 50 partnership
Hits a back of length over off stump, angles the bat face and guides it to point who was proactive to come in and stop the single
Yorker on leg, clipped to square leg
Length into the pitch on midde, defended to the right of the bowler
Length outside off, steered to deep-backward point
Slower short ball over off, pulls it down to deep-square leg
Smoked over wide long on! Length ball, on the back of the slot area, outside off. Tripathi swung freely and hit the MCA Pavilion for a 104 metre six which gives an indication of the timing.
Comes across and Sams goes with a length ball on middle and leg. Tripathi on one knee reaches for it and gets the fine slog  sweep over short fine leg for four
Wide yorker left alone in hopes of getting an extra. It was marginal and went in the bowler's favour
Back of length outside off, Tripathi creams a slicy drive to deep-backward point. Markane ran to his right and was about to get it but gave up on the dive as it raced to the fence
Good length outside off, flourishing cover drive goes off the middle but finds deep cover
Swipes across the line and clears deep-midwicket by a mile! It was a full ball on middle, Tripathi stayed legside of the ball and hit it with a fully close-faced bat
Low full toss down leg, Tripathi went to help it along the way and got it to deep-backward square instead of letting it go for a wide
Slower bouncer angling away has Pooran, who was shuffling across, jump in reflex but he let it go. It looked like he was shaping to drag it to the legside

Taken by Markande low down at deep-backward square. The third umpire will check this though It looks like the ball hit the palm and went towards the ground as Markande tumbled forward. The fingers were underneath the ball and it's given out. It came off a full ball on the stumps and Pooran flicked it aerially. Markande went diagonally to his left and looked to be slow on it but managed to reach it with a lunge on the move
Full on the stumps, flicked to long-on
Good length outside off, backs away and punches to long-off

Tripathi holes out to long-on! Fullish ball just outside off, Tripathi whipped it with a cross-bat and it came off the top-edge. The skier was taken well by the fielder. He leaves with a bump on his helmet but he's done his job
Full outside off, driven to short cover
Fourth stump yorker is slow. Kane jams it and it dribbles along the crease on the off side
Yorker outside off, jammed diagonally to the left of the bowler. Kane ran in and backed away
Taken at long-off! Full ball was going away with the angle and Markram slashed at it. It ballooned off the edge and long-off took it to hand Ramandeep his third wicket
Whips a back of length ball over middle palpably wristily to the acreage at midwicket. They thought of two but it looked like Kane slipped
Good length and wide outside the tramline
Excellent fielding and running! Length outside off, Sundar opened up and slapped it to deep extra cover. Long-off cut it off after a good run and the batters did well to complete three
Inch-perfect yorker on off, jammed behind the stumps towards point for one
Third man sprints, dives, and stops the traveling ball with a left hand that stuck out! It came off a full ball that was sliced fine. Stopped by Sanjay Yadav, the Gorakhpur guy, says
Bouncer outside off goes over the head marginally at least. Sundar looked to ramp it late after thinking of letting it go. Leg-umpire gives it wide
Yorker length ball outside off is driven to the right of deep cover
Slow outside off, Sundar tries to slog it to the legside. The full ball took the inside edge and Sundar had swung himself out of shape. It went on his pad as the front leg went straight with a slip
Full toss outside off dips like a nacho aiming for guac to beat Kane's swinging bat
Kane drives inside out over cover to full ball outside off. It was a cutter. Deep cover ran a few metres to his left and dove but could not make it
Full toss outside off, went for the drive again. This went to backward point's left, who stopped it
Slow full toss on middle, it was seam up but looked slow on first viewing. Sundar made room and whipped it off the bottom of the bat to the bowler
Very low full toss on the stumps dips again. Sundar brooms it to deep-midwicket for two scampered runs
Full toss on middle and off knocks over off! Sundar slouched and looked to go over midwicket but missed. 250 wickets for Bumrah in T20s!
full and wide, too wide outside off, wide called.
full and wide again, this time poked off the toe into cover.
fullish length on leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket.
fullish length on eighth stump at 133 kph, Rohit again pokes well away from his body and is beaten as the ball curls with late insuring to keep it inside the wide guideline.
good length ball on off at 139 kph, defended to the off side.
good length ball on middle and leg at 140 kph, flicked through square leg for one.
good length ball at 133 kph hugs the wide guideline outside off and is deemed legal as Kishan leaves it be.
fullish length on the legs, flicked to deep fine leg for one.
full on middle, tapped into midwicket for one.
full on off, defended to mid-on.
full on fifth stump, defended to midwicket.

in the slot on fourth stump, Rohit pumps the shotgun and blasts this over the long-on rope into the Mumbai Indians dugout as Daniel Sams and Robin Singh go scrambling for cover. The shot puts a charge into the crowd.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended to mid-off.
poor from Sundar. Too full and drifts this too straight down the leg side, swept easily along the turf to the fine leg rope.
full on middle and leg, flicked wide of mid-on for one.
full on middle, uses his feet and checks it back to Sundar.
good length ball on fifth stump, punched wide of cover for one.
overpitched on off, Kishan smokes a drive back over Sundar's head skidding over the mid-off rope on one bounce.
good length ball on off, defended.
scorching pull from Rohit! Length ball on fifth stump, sits up for a front foot pull that Rohit laces flat over the wide long-on rope.
goes for yorker and sends down a knee high full toss on middle at 140 kph that is flicked through square leg for one.
good length ball on middle, defended back to Kumar.
slower ball foxes Kishan who charged early and then swung clumsily through the short ball that skids underneath the cross bat heave.
full on fourth stump at 138 kph, flicked through midwicket for one.
yorker follows Rohit at 136 kph backing away from leg, jammed out into cover for a tight single.
good length ball on off, defended to the off side.
fullish length on fifth stump, goes to heave this through mid-on but scuffs it along the turf, diving stop on the ring keeps it to one.
nearly a wicket at short third man on the ring! Short on sixth stump, Kishan guides this with an open face just out of the reach of the fielder diving left and it goes to the rope.
overpitched on fifth stump, slaughters a drive past Natarajan and through mid-off to the rope again.
back of a length on off, flicked through midwicket for one.
shot of the day! Fullish length ball on fourth stump, Rohit gets on one knee to flick this over fine leg thudding into the LCD ad boards past the foam triangle.
slower ball angled well down leg, wide called.
slower ball full on the legs, flicked to deep backward square for one.
fullish length on sixth stump at 138 kph, flashes at this and a loose drive bounces short of backward point.
slower ball lands full on sixth stump at 127 kph, driven wide of the cover sweeper for two.
slower ball at 110 kph lands full and wide and negates Rohit's premeditated charge as he checks into a defensive poke to extra cover.
goes for wide yorker, sends down a low full toss at 137 kph on sixth stump punched wide of mid-off for one.
slower bouncer on off stump at 106 kph, drags a pull into the ground to short fine leg for a tight single.
full on middle, defended to Sundar.
uses his feet to a full ball on off, chips it well short of long-on for one.
good length ball on middle, punched to long-on for one.
back of a length on off stump, backs away to create room slicing a cut to the point sweeper for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, goes back to punch to long-on for one.
full on sixth stump, driven to long-off for one.
good length ball on the stumps, flicked straight to short fine leg and they can't pinch a single.
good length ball sliced wide enough of backward point to allow a single.
length ball on fifth stump, punched through cover for one.
goes for yorker on off at 137 kph and sends down a low full toss at ankle height shoveled wide of extra cover for one.
full on the stumps at 135 kph, flicked to midwicket for one.
full on the stumps at 137 kph, flicked to long-on for one.
rib high full toss on seventh stump, Kishan fans on this and it's fumbled behind the stumps to get Rohit on strike. No ball called on height. Free hit coming.
bouncer wide outside off, umpire spoiled for choice on the wide options. Free hit still in play.
bouncer on middle, clangs Rohit on the helmet from the sounds of it and it caroms off the lid to the fine leg rope. No ball called on height for another bouncer in the over. Free hit stays in play.
length ball into the legs at 154 kph, misses a flick and comes off the pads to fine leg for one.
another bouncer at 146 kph tailing into the legs, Kishan goes to pull and a top edge swirls off the back of the bat over the third man rope.
short ball again tailing away from sixth stump, goes to cut this 142 kph delivery and misses.
extra mustard on this short ball again outside off on fifth stump at... 142 kph? Someone check the radar gun to make sure it's working properly. Kishan beaten badly for pace going to pull.
full on fifth stump at 150 kph, scuffs a drive along the turf to long-on for one.
length ball into the pads at 141 kph, late on a flick and it goes to deep fine leg for one.
full and tailing down leg, misses a flick and it beats Pooran for a leg bye.
full on middle, jammed out to long-on for one.
charges down the track to a generously flighted delivery full on middle at 80 kph, drives this crisply over long-on.
short on fourth stump, pulls this flat along the turf to deep midwicket for one.
charges and heaves a drive along the turf to deep midwicket for one.
beaten in flight as Sharma drags the length back seeing Rohit charging a good length ball on middle, punched to long-on for one.
backs away from a good length ball darted in quickly at 92 kph onto off stump, goes to cut and a thick edge goes past Pooran to the third man rope.
short on middle at 91 kph, pulls this flat to deep midwicket for one.
full on middle, steps out to punch to long-off for one.

charges again and telegraphs it too early allowing Sundar to adjust dragging the length back on off stump, Rohit continues with the heave for midwicket anyway and splices it to the sub fielder Suchith, who takes a neck high catch while crouching ten yards inside the rope.
back of a length on fourth stump at 93 kph, shoveled off the back foot high but well short of long-off for one.
full on fifth stump, whipped across the line to long-on for one.
bouncer on middle stump at 138 kph, Kishan is cramped for room but still finds a way to uppercut this over the keeper to the rope.
length ball on off stump, Kishan is backing away nervously before poking at this into cover.

superb effort running back from the ring at mid-on! Umran bowls this full on the stumps, Kishan goes to chip this over the ring but doesn't middle it and Priyam judges this well going 20 yards backward from the ring and takes a sharp over the shoulder catch on the run.
bouncer on middle, ducks under this and wide is called on height.
length ball on middle, defended to the leg side.
short and wide, slaps this straight to backward point.
bouncer on off at 143 kph, goes to uppercut this over third man but miscues it and it falls just short of backward point charging in.
back of a length on off, goes back to punch to long-on for one.
fullish length on middle, goes back to flick to midwicket and a leading edge goes behind point for one.
yikes! Off the facade of the upper deck over square leg! Sundar drags this horribly short on the legs, Sams makes sure he doesn't forget it with a scorching pull.
short on fifth stump, pulls this flat along the turf wide of midwicket, sliding stop on the rope keeps it to two.
flighted full on middle, flicks this wide enough of long-on to pinch a second beating Markram's relay.
short again on the legs, pulls this a bit more gently this time fielded on a bounce at deep backward square leg for one.
good length ball on off, flicked behind square for one.
short on the body, pulls this behind square, one bounce over the rope for four.

slower ball lands back of a length on fifth stump, guides this behind point. The throw for the non-striker's end is wild and they pinch a very sharp second run on the overthrow thanks to Sams being extremely alert.
yorker at 139 kph goes wide down leg. Missed everything. Someone deemed a legal delivery by the umpire. Hmmm...
slower length ball on middle, punched to long-on for one.
slower ball angled outside off on a good length just inside the wide guideline at 111 kph beats Sams swinging wildly.
bouncer on off stump, Tilak is hustled sharply for pace going to pull and a top edge swirls over cover for a basic catch just inside the ring by Williamson.
back of a length on fifth stump at 148 kph, prodded to the cover sweeper for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, shuffles well across his stumps to flick to midwicket.

nearly another wicket! Sams looks very uncomfortable getting on his toes to deal with a 144 kph delivery bowled back of a length on fourth stump, the ball clips the shoulder of the bat and lands just short of backward point as he scampers desperately for a single to get off strike.
back of a length on fourth stump, punched confidently to the cover sweeper for one.
bouncer over middle, Sams doesn't even duck and it clears him easily. Wide called from square leg.

another bouncer, another wicket! Sams looked like he was firmly in the crosshairs throughout the over. Hustled for pace trying to pull this off middle stump at... 135 kph? Seemed sharper than that. Miscued shot flutters to midwicket on the ring, Priyam, who does a bunny hop to take this reaching high above his head before tumbling backwards to the turf.
full on the legs, flicked through midwicket and the boundary rider makes a clumsy effort trying to dive to keep it in play and it goes off his hands and over the rope.
length ball outside off now, punched past Williamson in the covers and goes to the off side rope.
yorker on the legs at 134 kph, flicked behind square and a tumbling stop on the rope keeps this to two.
goes for wide yorker on sixth stump at 133 kph, scuffs a drive to long-off for one.
yorker on middle, jammed out into the leg side for one.
goes for wide yorker again, misses badly at shin height on the wide guideline with a full toss, but there's an extra cover sweeper in place who intercepts this for one.
yorker lands full on the legs at 137 kph, flicked straight to short fine leg and they scamper a tight run taking on Natarajan's arm.
yorker lands full on off at 135 kph, jammed out to extra cover.

full on the legs, flicked to long-on for an easy one, they turn back for the second as Markram's throw comes to Pooran. David was hot-dogging it on the second not expecting the throw to come to his end but Pooran takes a split-second too long getting the bails off being pulled away from the stumps ever so slightly. David's bat is fractionally across the line.

yorker on middle, David jams this out back to Bhuvi who deflects this back onto the non-striker's stumps. Stubbs is cheating several yards out of the crease even before the ball is delivered, so he's a no-hoper when it comes to the deflection produced by Bhuvi. He appeals and the umpire stands there motionless so he picks up the ball and presses it to the stumps ripping out one chunk of wood for insurance.
goes for yorker again on middle, David steps forward though to change the length into a shin high full toss and flicks this over wide long-on for a boundary.
yorker lands this time on fourth stump at 139 kph, punched to long-off for one.
wide yorker lands well outside the off stump guidelines. Will have to rebowl it.
misfired yorker again at 133 kph arrives at shin height on fifth stump, David gets under this and smashes it down the ground over the long-off rope.
yorker sprayed down the leg side now. Another wide called.

yorker punched back into the non-striker's stumps once again by David. Another flick on but this time Ramandeep had his bat back inside the crease safely. David turns down an easy single on offer as the ball dribbled toward mid-off. He wants to keep the strike to take on Natarajan.
misfired yorker results in a full toss again on the legs, annihilated by David into the third row of the second deck over square leg!

goodness what an awful over from Natarajan! Misfiring his yorkers almost every time. Comes to David at thigh height on off stump, and he spits it back out over square leg again, this time landing on the covered tarp of the field level seats.

hat-trick! And this one is into the upper deck over long-on! Full toss again at knee height, middles this and then some and it disappears into the night wide of the upper deck into a gap in the stands.

Natarajan gets his redemption! Length ball angled across eighth stump, David slaps this off the toe to Natarajan's right and he gets a hand on it to knock it down trickling toward the non-striker's stumps. Ramandeep turns down the run initially wanting to let David fight another battle in the next over at some point but David is determined to keep the strike and pays for it. The ball stopped inches from the stumps. It was a footrace between Natarajan and David to pick it up and get the bails off and Natarajan wins it by a yard.
length ball angled across sixth stump, swing and a miss.
slower bouncer on the wide guideline, goes to slash this over point but gets too much of the ball and picks out Suchith on the point sweeper rope. Catch taken five yards in at chest height.
fullish length on sixth stump, goes to open the face to run this to deep third man and chops it just wide of the stumps to Pooran.
yorker beats Bumrah backing away from leg at 139 kph.
yorker again beats Bumrah again backing away from leg.
yorker on middle at 135 kph, jammed out to midwicket.
wide yorker is way outside the guidelines, too wide and left alone.
yorker lands outside the wide guidelines again but Ramandeep shuffled well past his stumps to play this and the umpire deems the ball legal.

oh David Warner. Takes first strike at the last moment because Livingstone is bowling. Drives hard at a wide length ball, and it runs a little, bounces a little, and takes a thick edge to backward point. What a moment. Will Warner be wishing he had not changed the plan at the last minute?
offbreak, Marsh stays back to work it around the corner for one
another offbreak. Not bowling wristspin with the new ball. Worked past midwicket for one
offbreak that doesn't turn. Marsh defends from the back foot
tosses this one up, and it turns from outside off. Marsh opens the face past short third man
quicker offbreak looking to protect the over, swept past short fine leg for two
on a length, into the pads, tucked away past square leg
Marsh has had enough time in the middle. Sees an on-pace half-volley, and just lofts it down the ground. Just a clean swing of the bat
and he drop-kicks this one over midwicket. Rabada pulls the length back a little but still in his swinging arc, and he picks it up over midwicket now
short of a length now, just outside off, defended
wide length ball, opens the face for a single past point
first ball of pace for Sarfaraz, and he is looking to ramp it, and not even into the leg side but off side of the keeper. Beaten by the extra bounce
on a length, straight, Marsh goes back and gets a single to leg
no turn for Brar still, pushed to the short straight extra cover
goes back to punch this length ball, but can't beat cover-point
slog sweep into the short boundary. Sarfaraz shimmies away a touch before the release, then gets back to his original stance, and sends this length ball over square midwicket
and now he sitting back and anticipating a flatter quicker delivery. Cuts this in front of square for four
quicker full toss, down the leg side, and Sarfaraz gets enough bat on the paddle sweep to send this past short fine leg for four
on a length, slight shape in, defended back to him
short of a length, wide, punched in the air, but there is a deep point in place to keep them to one
slow swinging ball, just short of a length and outside off, Sarfaraz late-cuts it in the air but between point and short third. This is a knuckle ball

oh he has nailed that ramp this time. A lot like Dilshan here. Down on a knee early, lines up this ball, and then drops his head out of the way and scoops this on the third man side of the keeper. Five straight boundaries for Sarf
nearly a sixth as he gets an edge on a cut and it squeezes underneath Arshdeep's hand at short third man. However, the ball hits his boot. Three runs saved
on a length, around off, defended back to him
and he has been welcomed with a sweep. Sees a full toss outside off, and goes down on a knee to flat-bat it over midwicket
slower ball, short and wide, Sarfaraz goes hard at it, gets an edge, but it falls fell short of the keeper
nearly gets him. excellent short ball, angling in, cramping him up, getting it shoulder high, and the pull just clears the diving mid-on
big swing and miss. Wide length ball, and Sarf holds nothing back in his attempted loft down the ground. Looks like a slower ball because he is early into it and beaten

Arshdeep stands in the middle of the pitch and applauds like a man who knows his job. He has messed around with Sarfaraz's bat swing with his changes of pace and that bouncer. Now he bowls another slower ball but on a straighter line. Sarfaraz wants a six down the ground but ends up lobbing it over mid-on. Chahar takes a good catch running back

Lalit, please send Rishabh in when you go. Oh hang on, wait. lalit, please come back. Arshdeep has overstepped. This is another lovely bouncer, Lalit is late into the hook, gets a top edge, Bairstow runs to his right from long leg to take a superb catch, but the celebrations have to be cut short
yorker, on leg stump, whipped to midwicket for one
on a length, straying down, lucky that Lalit has glanced this straight to short fine leg
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
bouncer, well outside off, slow off the surface, Marsh pulls out of it after shaping up to pull
on a length, around off, opens the face, gets a single
another top edge from Lalit on a sharp short ball. Keeps rising on him, and he is clearly late into the hook. Gloves it over the keeper's head
another short ball he is late on, and is hit on the helmet grille. He is a little shook. Doesn't respond to Marsh's call for a run
low full toss, driven down to long-off for one
full legbreak, pushed down the ground, the short straight extra cover can't deny them the single
gets a bit of an inside edge on this full ball, which rolls back to Marsh
just a bit short of a length, and too slow. Marsh has enough time to go back and cut this legbreak in front of deep cover for four
gets the line closer to off but stays short of a length. Defended this time
a bit of a nothing shot as this legbreak dips on him and he still plays it in the air without much power behind it. He is lucky it has taken the outer edge for a couple wide of long-off
appeal for pad first as this shapes back in, but he has got bat first on it. Turned down both by the umpire and the captain
on a length, into the pads, nudged away for one
slower ball, short of a length, punched wide of long-on for two
full now, off and middle, driven to long-on for one
slower ball, on a length, middle and leg, worked to deep midwicket for one
another slower ball, another single to long-on
full, on off, driven hard but straight to extra cover
Lalit opens up now. Just a touch too full, and he slog-sweeps it over the short boundary. Clean swing, high grip, good reach
wrong'un, picked off the surface, pulled in the air but short of deep midwicket
stays back to work this length ball into the leg side
spot on with the length this time, also getting it to dip. Driven with an open face but straight to point
goes back but Chahar stays full enough to not let him play a back-foot shot. Pushed back to him
stays back to a length ball but has not room. Defended back
goes back to cut this away for a single to deep point
down the wicket, Brar bowls this wide, Lalit pushes it to deep cover for a single
nice drift in, draws an inside edge onto the pad, but they still get a single
stays back, hits this length ball hard, nut straight to deep cover
full, outside off, pushed straight to extra cover. Good comeback for Brar
on a length, straight, tucked into the leg side
full, outside off, pushed past extra cover, comes back for two before deep cover can get the ball back
slower ball, on a length, middle and leg, Marsh doesn't get all of it but gets enough of it to send it for a six off the inner half of the bat. Sails comfortably over long-on
full toss, on off, hit down to long-off for one
hurries him up as Lalit looks to pick this up mover square leg. The shank still clears square leg and gets them two

massive slower bouncer. Lalit has shaped up for the hook, aborted the shot, and the ball is still there in front of his face. So he tries to ramp it, but there is no pace in it to clear the infield. Caught at backward point
full legbreak, worked into the leg side for one
offbreak, wide, driven to deep cover for one
nearly a return catch. Slow loopy legbreak outside leg, Marsh turns the face early, and gets a leading edge that falls just short of LL
some turn on this one as LL pitches short of a length. Marsh opens the face, gets a single
Pant with his trademark one-handed six. Actually this is not quite one-handed at the point of contact. He just swings the bat so hard it comes out of his top hand. Down the wicket, and over long-on
LL with another big wicket. Pant leaves the crease early, Livingstone slips this wide, Pant swings hard but goes wide of the ball and is beaten on the inside edge. Stumped. Pant's innings: 1, 6, out
full toss, driven down to long-on for one
sharp turn. Off a length, just outside off. Powell stays back to defend
another legbreak that turns. Poweel stays back to defend
yes it is the wrong'un, but seems like he has picked it and defended to cover
another wrong'un, tucked away to leg for one
sharp turn again from middle and off. Beats him on a back-foot defence
legbreak, some turn, stays back to punch this down the ground
tries the big legbreak, starts too far outside leg. Wide
goes back to outside off, punched to deep point for one

not the pitch to be trying this shot. It has been turning big, and they have been bowling good lengths. Powell has blocked five, thinks the sixth one is full enough, but it isn't. He is looking to go over long-on, but the ball turns enough to take the thick outer edge to long-off where Dhawan takes a good catch running in
offbreak, full, middle and leg, driven down to long-on for one
goes back to punch this legbreak to deep cover for one
slows this offbreak down, driven to long-off for one
legbreak that starts on leg, turns down, Jitesh appeals for the catch, not given, but not called wide either
turn from middle and leg, hits the pad, but is missing leg
quicker, flatter, pulled away, but straight to midwicket
stays back to a length-ball legbreak. Opens the face. Another dot
another spot-on legbreak, defended from the crease
breaks the maiden but still a superb over. Just one run, clipped to deep midwicket
flat offbreak, cut to point
lovely drive. LL gets too full with this offbreak, and Axar drives him with an open face, getting it sufficiently wide of long-off
tries the slog, but mis-hits it for a single to deep midwicket
legbreak, opens the face, gets it past cover-point for one
slow off the surface. Axar picks the length early, winds up for the big pull, but is early into the shot and misses completely
goes full and wide, goes too wide
quick offbreak, punched square but can't beat point
on a length, outside off, crunched straight to extra cover
seems him back away, slips one in wide, concedes just the single to deep point
fired into the pads, beats the sweep, concedes just the leg-bye
big boundary on the off side, but that also means bigger pockets. Marsh drills this length ball hard and square of deep cover. Gets four. Gets to a responsible fifty
big wind-up, but Brar is not giving him the line to go leg side. Punched to deep cover for one
watches him step down, slows it down, but Axar gets enough on the swipe to bisect long-on and deep midwicket. Along the ground but hit hard enough
slower short ball, angling in, and Marsh pulls this behind square for four. He has the pace of the pitch down
back to his yorker, single down to long-on
another dipping yorker, dug out to long-on for another single
lucky to start off with still unlucky in the end. Misses the yorker, bowls a length ball down the leg side, lucky to beat Marsh's bat, but then deflection of the pad goes past short fine leg for four

Shikhar Dhawan takes the aggressive option in the field, but it doesn't come off. Arshdeep misses the yorker, sends down a high full toss, about thigh high, gets the thick outside edge of Marsh, Dhawan runs in and to his left from long-off, puts in a dive, but just can't catch up with it. Could have kept them to one had he been defensive, but he reckoned Marsh was a big wicket
slower ball, nearly a yorker, single into the off side
slower ball, Marsh takes a big swipe, gets a bottom edge through to the keeper

into the short leg boundary, but also a mis-hit. Rishi Dhawan runs in from deep midwicket and takes the low catch. Marsh looks to play the pick-up shot over midwicket, but this full ball is just a touch slow off the surface and he gets too far under it and doesn't get the distance
wide length ball, toe-ended to long-off for one
Appeal for a catch down the leg side, not given, and they review it. Short of a length, tucks him up, takes the thigh pad on the way. The on-field call stays
short of a length again, into the pads, nudged to leg
another toe-end from Thakur. Single to long-off as he looks to pull this from outside off
yorker, on the toes, just the single off the toe of the bat
tries the yorker, but bowls the low full toss. Still just the single to deep midwicket
sometimes missed yorkers work too. A low full toss, but the line takes away him arms. No room at all, and Thakur doesn't get power into his hit down the ground. Caught at long-on
Arsh misses the yorker, Kuldeep lofts the half-volley over extra cover. Kuldeep wonders if he should take just the one and bring Axar back on strike. Axar says no. Lets Kuldeep face the next ball too
slower ball, big dip in pace, beats his slog, but they take a single off the body. Inside edge onto the body actually
pinpoint yorker, dug out into the leg side, and a wide throw lets them take the second
good length ball angled across the fourth stump channel at 137 kph, defended to mid-off.
back of a length on sixth stump at 140 kph, rocks back to cut and smashes this in the gap through point for a boundary to kick off the scoring in the chase.
full and angled down leg at 142 kph, flicks the pads past a late flick, no appeal for caught behind from Pant and a mild shout from Khaleel is denied.
full and angled across Bairstow on seventh stump at 139 kph, goes for a flat-footed drive and is beaten.
full on middle at 143 kph, big heave goes flat along the turf through midwicket for one to the boundary rider.
full on fifth stump at 137 kph, blocked to extra cover.
back of a length on middle, gets on his toes to tap and run in front of point for one.
length ball on middle at 144 kph, Bairstow goes for a front foot pull and mashes this behind square to the rope.
back of a length follows Bairstow backing away from leg stump, slices this to deep third man for one.
back of a length on fourth stump at 142 kph, punched off the back foot to cover.
slightly slower angled on fifth stump on a good length at 128 kph, Dhawan through his cut shot a touch early and nearly drags a bottom edge onto his stumps but it goes past to short fine leg for one.
goes for yorker but instead sends down a knee high full toss on middle stump at 145 kph that is whipped along the turf through midwicket for one.
massive strike! Length ball on off stump at 140 kph, Bairstow latches onto it and lifts it high and deep over the midwicket rope onto the tarp-covered lower tier.
slower length ball on off stump, through the shot a touch early but keeps his hands back long enough to drag this along the turf through midwicket for one.
back of a length on the stumps, tap and run into the off side for one.
wide yorker on fifth stump at 143 kph, jammed out into the ground into his feet. Dhawan calls him through for a tight run and collides a touch with Khaleel on the way to the striker's end.
length ball on off stump, takes a step down the track to this 143 kph delivery and miscues a pull tamely to mid-on.
fullish length on fifth stump, goes to drive and muscles this past mid-on to the rope for a boundary.
carbon copy of his first boundary against Nortje. Length ball on middle stump, sits up at 147 kph for him to smoke a front foot pull behind square to the rope.
full on the stumps, flicked out to deep backward square for one.
back of a length pitching well outside leg stump following Dhawan backing away from leg, Dhawan fishes at this and is beaten by some sharp and late away swing.
back of a length on off, guides this to deep third man for one. Police siren goes off to collar the bowling criminal for an overstep. Free hit coming up.
goes for yorker on fifth stump, but Bairstow cleverly backs away to create room to smoke a drive flat along the turf through the off side through cover to the rope.

bounced out! Nortje persisted with the short ball plan to Bairstow and after leaking a few boundaries it finally comes off. Back of a length at 152 kph on fourth stump, the times he was hit for four he was bowling low to mid 140s but gets some extra mustard behind this to hustle Bairstow and produce a top edge that goes to deep square leg. Simple catch for Axar five yards inside the rope at chest height.
knee high full toss on middle stump at 145 kph, Rajapaksa doesn't have his eye in on arrival and just pats this back gently.

good length ball skids on toward middle middle stump beating a back foot prod. Massive lbw shout given not out after a very very very veryyyyyyyyyy long thought by the umpire. Pant goes for DRS. He was hit mighty deep in the crease, but also very high. 50/50 call watching it live, and it might be that way on ball-tracking too. Indeed, the ball-tracking shows a projection of umpire's call clipping the bails. Delhi very unlucky this was given not out on field.
half-tracker on fourth stump, rocks back to smash a pull through midwicket to the rope.
fullish length on the stumps, defended to midwicket.

chaotic sequence and a simple runout chance blown! Full on the stumps, flicked toward midwicket, but Lalit makes an athletic diving stop moving left as Dhawan took off on contact while Rajapaksa stayed put. Both batters were at the same end but Lalit rushed a panicky throw while lying on his back that sailed wide of Pant, wide of the square leg umpire in fact it was so horrendous, to allow a run in the end.
spears in a quicker ball that is blocked out.
wide darted in down the leg side very full.
full on middle, defended to midwicket.
back of a length on fifth stump at 134 kph, Dhawan slices this intentionally over the cordon to the third man rope.
back of a length on off, tap and run in front of point for one.
short ball on off, goes to pull and top edges this over the keeper to the rope for another boundary.

similar ball at 135 kph, but a much different result! Shardul goes length on middle, Rajapaksa tries to heave this over midwicket but splices this to send it swirling toward backward point. Simple catch on the ring at chest height.
back of a length on fourth stump, Livingstone comes forward and across his stumps, flicks this into square leg for one.

gem! Ball of the chase! Back of a length on fourth stump at 139 kph, cramps Dhawan for room trying to repeat the shot he played at the start of the over intentionally trying to carve this over short third man. Instead it climbs on him with a touch of extra pace and bounce and produces a healthy edge to Pant.
full on off, driven to long-off for one.
full on middle, arm ball skids on and a prod forward produces an inside edge into the pads.

another arm ball! The previous one was too full and Mayank got away with it thanks to his footwork coming forward. This time it's on a good length on fourth stump and Mayank goes back to cut but it skids on sharply through a massive gap between bat and pad to crash into middle stump.
fullish length on middle, defended to midwicket.
back of a length on middle, goes back to defend to Axar.
half-tracker, Jitesh moves back to pummel a pull over midwicket to the rope. There were cries of catch it, but the fielder in the ring would've needed a fire engine ladder to get his hands to it.
length ball spinning in from off, defended.
Full on middle and off, turns away and takes the outside edge
Full on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
Good length just outside off. Defended towards cover's right
Goes back and punches a length ball over off to long-off

Livingstone comes down the track and has a waft aimed over long on, misses and is stumped! It was slow and on a good length, it went away and Livingstone was not to the pitch of the ball. He swung off balance and looked behind. By then, the wily Pant took a moment and dislodged the bails
dropped! Nearly another wicket! Full and wide outside off, driven loosely toward Warner at extra cover, he gets his left paw to it but it slips through toward the sweeper for two.
full on the stumps, driven down the ground for one.
good length on off, flicked loosely to deep midwicket for one.
full on fifth stump, defended to extra cover.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended to cover.
back of a length on middle, goes back to flick through midwicket for one.
good length ball on middle, goes back to punch back to Kuldeep.
full on off, driven firmly to long-on for one.

wrong-un beats him through the gate! Lands this on a good length on fourth stump, Brar plays for orthodox turn away prodding forward to defend and leaves a big gap between bat and pad. Faint inside edge before continuing on to the stumps.

dropped! Warner again at extra cover, this time going with a dive one-handed to his right! It was full on fourth stump, loose punch in the air at waist height, Warner flies out for it and gets his right paw on it but once again it doesn't stick.
full outside off, defended to cover.
back of a length on fourth stump, goes back and across to flick through midwicket for one.
full on fifth stumps driven to wide long-off for one.
full on off, driven toward Warner again at extra cover, who is suddenly a magnet for the ball in the last 20 minutes, and another diving effort goes off his hands to long-off for one.
full on fourth stump, driven straight to Warner at extra cover for none.
good length ball on off, straightens and defended to Warner at extra cover.
flighted more and fuller on middle, blocked back to Axar.
back of a length on the legs, flicked straight to short fine leg.
full on middle, flicked through wide long-on for two. Kuldeep is shouting at Rovman for overrunning the ball to create the second run.
full outside leg, flicked through the ring softly enough to create two before the boundary rider can charge in.
full on middle, chips this over Kuldeep leaping in front of the umpire and the ball skids along the nailed in advertising mat to speed to the long-on rope.
good length ball on middle, goes back to flick through midwicket for one.
full on fifth stump, defended in front of point where Marsh charges in to deny a run.
full and wide on seventh stump, smashes a drive to the cover sweeper for one.
short on fifth stump, cuts this straight to backward point.
good length ball on sixth stump, guides this with soft hands past the keeper for one before a diving stop is made by Marsh at short third man.
full on off, punched to long-off for one.
another arm ball wicket! Fullish length on fifth stump, Rishi reaches forward to sweep and misses, the ball skids on and crashes into off stump.
good length ball on middle, defended.
full on fifth stump, prods at this and it spins past the edge.
back of a length on fifths tump, smashes a cut straight to backward point.

missed runout! Slower ball on a good length on fourth stump, prods this to Lalit Yadav at backward point. Jitesh set off and is rightly sent back. The throw from 15 yards with one stump to aim it is wide with Jitesh a yard short if it hit.
bouncer on middle at 142 kph, sways under this to leave.
back of a length on middle at 143 kph, defended back to Nortje.
bouncer again on off stump this time, too high at 137 kph and called a wide on height.
bouncer again on off stump at 142 kph, goes for the pull and a top edge goes over the keeper to the rope.
slower ball on off stump, guides this wide of backward point for two to deep third man.
starts with a slower ball on a good length on fourth stump at 125 kph, Chahar pokes at this and a thick edge goes just wide of Marsh at slip for two.
back of a length slower ball again on off stump, taps this to point where the fielder charges in to deny a run.
slower ball at 125 kph lands back of a length on fifth stump, goes for an awkward cross bat flick and a top edge swirls just behind Marsh at slip for a run.
full pace for the first time this over at 142 kph with short ball on off, goes for a pull and cranks this high over deep backward square leg onto the covered tarp stands at field level.
back of a length on fourth stump, punches this wide of backward point for two.
short and wide, slices this behind point to the sweeper for one.

length ball on middle at 146 kph, his fastest ball of the day and it flies even faster off the bat out of the ground! Jitesh charges him and slams this on the up and it carries over the long-on rope before clanging off the facade of the second tier stands.
bouncer over leg stump, goes to hook and misses.
slower ball at 122 kph lands short outside off, slapped to wide long-off for one.
length ball on sixth stump at 136 kph, goes to pull and a cue shot off the toe goes to mid-off for none.
back of a length on the hips at 138 kph, flicked gently toward Lalit in the ring at midwicket and they take one.
yorker tailing down leg at 138 kph, Jitesh is late on a flick and is nailed on the toes, big appeal but it was missing quite clearly.
good length ball angled across fifth stump, goes for a big heave and misses.
another length ball on fifth stump, another wild heave catching nothing but air.
bouncer on fifth stump now, goes for another wild cross bat heave and misses.
length ball on sixth stump, another cross-bat swipe to a slower ball at 127 kph but this time he connects and just barely clears mid-off before it backspins away to the rope.
length ball on middle at 126 kph, Khaleel is being too predictable now with this slower balls and Chahar is lining him up now, clatters another pull this time sailing it over square leg.
short and wide, carves this cut high over point and the sweeper slides to keep this to two.

in the slot on off stump, driven powerfully but flat toward Rovman at long-on. He charges 15 yards left and leaps up to latch on but his body momentum is taking him over the rope so he has to let go to allow a run rather than it being a wicket. He's saved five runs though. Terrible running by both batters to only wind up with a single on that instead of coming back for what should have been a simple two for all the time it took Rovman to release the ball, land over the rope and come back into play to pick it up before relaying back in.
and here's the result of the failure to get two off that previous ball. Length delivery on sixth stump, Chahar fans on yet another big heave.
short on sixth stump, slaps a cut to the point sweeper for one.

sensational from Warner, who finally holds on to one charging in at long-off! Knuckle ball from Shardul lands full on fourth stump. Jitesh slams a drive very flat in the air, doesn't get more than 15 feet above the ground but Warner never hesitated charging forward 15 yards off the rope and lunging forward to take this at shin height. There's an awful lot of fielders in Warner's situation who would have gladly let the ball bounce in front to keep it to a single but he went for glory and got a gold medal catch.
slower bouncer on fifth stump, too high and left alone for a wide on height.

length ball well down the leg side at 135 kph, Pant flies to his right with his right hand with no glove on his right hand! He's taken it off before delivery to be able to throw at the stumps to deny a bye or tight single and he saves it from being five wides. Incredible.
slower ball sits up on fourth stump on a length, Rabada creams a pull over wide long-on that sails over the LCD ad boards and down a tunnel.

Rabada can't repeat it to another slower ball at 118 kph! This is quietly a brilliant spell from Shardul. Slower ball on sixth stump back of a length, Rabada with another big cross-bat heave but it flutters gently to Rovman who takes a head high catch 10 yards in from the rope at long-off.

dropped! Full toss at knee height on sixth stump, slices a cut straight to Shardul at head height at backward point, he reaches up and parries this over his head for one. It came sharply pace wise but was right to him and should have ended the match.
full on middle, punched straight to extra cover.
goes for yorker and misfires again with another knee high full toss on middle, Arshdeep pokes this tentatively to point, bad misfield allows a single.
wide yorker just inside the guideline at 140 kph, jammed out off the toe to the keeper.
yorker full on middle, jammed out back to Nortje.
wide yorker again on seventh stump at 136 kph, scuffs out a drive to long-off for one.
length ball on sixth stump at 122 kph, cracks a cross bat shot through wide long-off, diving effort by Warner charging left but it goes just off his left hand to the rope.

slower bouncer on sixth stump, Chahar backs away from leg stump expecting something else and takes himself out of reach. He looks desperately to the leg side umpire for a wide on height. It cleared his head while leaping off his toes and should have been a wide on height. Lucky break goes Delhi's way.
low full toss miscued toward extra cover for one.

dropped! After the sensational catch earlier, Warner has now dropped a sitter! Low full toss at shin height on middle, miscues this toward long-on. Warner covers 20 yards jogging in and settles himself going onto his knees with arms reaching forward but it clangs out.
length ball slanted across the right-hander, too wide to play at and an extra is added.
length ball again slanted across Chahar, this time on sixth stump, big swing aiming for midwicket and misses.
length ball nipping in from well outside off, he cuts it square to point
similar ball, a touch fuller, and Jaiswal cuts to point again
away swing for Mohsin, swing and a miss for Jaiswal! He pitches it up this time wide outside off, Jaiswal swings big over mid-off but doesn't get anything on it as the ball swings away
sprints back to the crease as backward point stops the ball. Punches it nicely off the back foot but there are two points there, and one of them stops this time
a punchy cover drive to get off the mark after four dot balls. He waits for the ball that nips in and punches that off the back foot through the gap in the covers

on the other side this time and Mohsin won't be happy with his end to the over. Pitches this one much shorter and towards the stumps, Jaiswal waits before whipping that away behind square on the leg side for a one-bounce four
watches carefully and steers the ball square for a single
inside edges onto his pads as the ball angles away slightly outside off. He wants to tap it to off, but gets an edge
slightly wider outside off with the angle, and he runs it down to third man for one
beats the inside edge, just misses the off stump! Buttler doesn't move his feet at all for this inswinger that nips in from length, he punches down the ground and nearly gets the inside edge
targets the stumps with the length ball and Buttler pushes it to cover
punches this length ball through the covers for one, there's a fielder in the deep
starts with a length ball on off, Buttler pushes it back to mid-off

knocks the off stump! Buttler has been on 2 off 5, he wants to up the scoring and goes across a long way to scoop it fine leg, but misses it completely. Avesh is pumped, he kind of gives Buttler a send-off while thumping his heart with his right fist. It was a perfect length ball that went on to hit top of off stump, which has gone to Marine Drive for a walk. Avesh had Buttler bowled the last time too
first ball four for Samson! Too full, too much on the pads and Samson flicks it away with perfect timing to send that racing to the midwicket boundary
beats him outside off this time. Some away swing for the length ball outside off, Samson chases and misses
shorter and wider outside off, Samson lets it go this time
length ball on off, punches it square for one
just wide of slip for four! Short and angling away, Samson has to play at it and cuts it late, and it flies wide of first slip for four
on the pads this time and Samson helps it to midwicket
140.4kmh, a bouncer down the leg side for a wide. Excellent take from de Kock down the leg side, with his right hand
126.kmh, just short of length on leg and Samson hangs back to nudge it to midwicket
stays back and punches the back of length ball to cover
shuffles across a little for the quicker ball at 140kmh, and gets into a bit of tangle while pushing it down to mid-on

gets width to free his arms and he does so with a big flourish for a cracking four! Slightly full and wide, big back lift from Samson and he crashes it through the covers along the ground with a booming cover drive
140.4kmh, hard length around off stumps, he punches it to cover off the back foot

super length, stifling line and Jaiswal is beaten completely! A ripper which could have been a wicket taking ball any other day. Pitches on length around middle, nips away just a bit to beat the poking bat and rushes through to de Kock who is beaten as well

doesn't get in a good position at all and he dangerously chips it over the bowler past mid-off for four. He moved a long, long way to leg, Avesh cleverly chased him with the ball and gave it some bounce, and Jaiswal made a last adjustment to chip it over Avesh's right shoulder

dropped by Mohsin at short fine leg! It was a straightforward chance, Avesh is not happy but turns quickly for his run up. Short on leg, Jaiswal pivots on the back foot to whip it away and it goes straight to Mohsin's right side for which he gets both hands to it but just can't hold on
wants to cut the ball away from outside off but gets an inside edge
length ball outside off to end the over, Samson swings and misses
some width, it's full too outside off and Jaiswal swings wildly to slice it over and wide of short third man for four

he has skied it a long, long way towards wide long-on, Holder gives it a chase from mid-on and the ball lands well behind him. Back of length towards middle and leg, Jaiswal lofts it very high on leg and gets two
low full toss and Jaiswal creams that drive along the ground and beats deep point as well, four more. It's a no-ball for overstepping
really good ball for free hit, angles it in sharply towards the pads and Jaiswal makes room but drills it down to mid-off
short ball, another pivot on the back foot for Jaiswal and another boundary, this time a pull that's gone fine enough and well over short fine leg

smoked for six over midwicket! Cracking shot, that was six the moment he hit it. Chameera bangs it in again, Jaiswal is waiting for the short ball and he pulls that handsomely over the midwicket region into second tier
good ball to end the over, on length on the pads and Jaiswal nudges it down to mid-on
127.9kmh, a gentle square drive for the length ball for one
takes the pace off at 118.3kmh and bowls on off, he runs it down to third man for one
turns his wrists to nudge the length ball from off to leg for a quick single
back of length on the stumps and he works it square on leg for one

middles the pul for a one-bounce four! Holder had been bowling on length or short of length until now, he bangs in a short one, reduces the pace, but Samson pounces on it like a cat and dispatches it to the midwicket boundary
back to good length on middle and leg, and he pushes it down to long-on for one
welcomes him with a first ball four, crashed through the covers. Some room outside off, Samson makes the rest by opening up and hammers that with a big flourish through the covers

lands just short of long-off, excellent fielding effort in the deep by Stoinis. Pitched up on off, Samson smashes it back and straight, it nearly carries to long-off where Stoinis dives forward despite the ball not carrying and puts his body behind it to save two
better length and tighter line, Samson pushes it to cover
poor short ball down the leg side and Bishnoi is lucky that Samson has pulled it straight to deep fine leg
flights it up and full on leg, Jaiswal waits and gently pushes to the leg side

ends the over almost the way he started it, crashes the ball to the cover boundary for a four. Width again, it's full as well, there's flight too, and Samson loves all of it. He uses his high back lift and demolishes the ball over the covers
almost a bouncer and Jaiswal pulls it to deep square leg
slower full ball at 106.7kmh on the pads, Samson waits and works it down to long-on
back of length outside off, slow again at 110kmh, and Jaiswal cuts it away for one
short and wide, Samson cuts but straight to point

nearly checks his lofted drive, finds deep cover, and Holder brings out his three-finger celebration. It was slow and full outside off, Samson slices that square instead of muscling it over the covers, which he had been doing earlier, and it goes high before landing in the hands of Hooda in the deep

nearly run-out at the bowler's end! Doesn't get the direct hit, or it was close. Padikkal guides the ball to point and doesn't leave his crease, but Jaiswal covers half the pitch in a flash, turns around and somehow gets back
beats the edge first ball! 123.9kmh, scrambled seam around off and the ball nips away, Jaiswal pokes and misses
pushes the length ball on the stumps down to long-on for one
goes through mid-off for four! Padikkal chips the ball gently towards mid-off, where Holder completely misjudges his effort while going for the ball only with his left hand and leaks four
high and handsome over long-on! There comes the elegance from a left-hand batter. This one is fuller on the stumps, right on the slot for Padikkal and he hits it straight back over the bowler's head
squares him up a little with some movement off the pitch, Padikkal defends it to off
another boundary, this is a different Padikkal on show today. Punches the shorter ball square off the back foot and beats deep point too
Fullish ball on off, tucked to square leg for one
Late cut gets a bottom edge and falls in front of the keeper. Length ball just outside off has DDP try and glide it but the bat face was open and the edge was found. It half-volleyed the keeper
Short of good length outside off, pushed to point
DDP makes room and swings out of shape and manages to get four! The bowler followed him with a short ball and he swung through, the ball went over wide-mid off and managed to beat the fielder
Pulls a short ball fine and gets two, stopped at long-leg
Length down leg, the cutter is tickled gently and fine for a boundary to long-leg
Yorker on fourth stump, cracks a drive to cover after making room
Skied and it's taken! It was on a length just outside off, Jaiswal tried to drag it through aerially and it took the top edge. Mid-on moved to his left, settled under it and took the catch
Full on the pads, beats the clip, hits the pad and ricochets to the gap in front of square
Length on middle, goes back and pushes it to long-on
Swings a full ball on leg aerially into the acreage to the left of deep-midwicket. The large outfield allows two
Fullish ball outside off, chopped to the left of deep-cover who runs and stops it
Length on middle, flicked to deep-midwicket
Full and slow just outside off, defended to point with a horizontal bat
Goes back and clips a good length ball on middle and off to deep-midwicket
Short and slow ball on middle sits up and DDP clears his front leg, it was low but slow enough for the batter to clobber a pull over the deep-midwicket fence
Slightly shorter and flatter on a similar line, flicked to deep-midwicket
Full on the legs, beats the flick. Hits the pad and goes to the fielder in front of square
Yorker on middle, makes room and jams it out to mid-off
Drags the sweep from a full ball outside off and manages to pierce the gap between long-on and deep-midwicket, it was inside out and there were no fielders in the ring there
Makes room and cuts a good length ball just outside off to deep-point
Holes out to deep-midwicket with a slog-sweep! It was a googly that pitched on off and the full ball was swept hard and in the air. It took the edge and went flat to Krunal, who took it well
Full and flat on off, clipped back to the bowler
Slower on a similar length just outside off, front leg shuffles across and allows the off-drive to long-off
Full on off, defended to the diagonal left of cover for one
Full on middle and leg, pushed to long-off
Reverses a full ball on off and it went to the left of short-third, Mohsin went down but the ball slipped through and went to the fence
Checks the flick from a length ball on the stumps, goes to the offside off the edge. It was played with soft hands
Falls after slipping from the sweep, but the ball pitched outside leg. It missed the bat, hit the pad, and went to the short-leg region
Punches a good length ball just outside off to long-off
Whips it and beats deep-midwicket to his right. It was full on the stumps and Neesham got good contact, it went flat and raced through, Krunal put a dive in the deep but could not get there
Tries the sweep on a full ball outside off and is beaten
Pulls a length ball from outside off to long-on along the ground
Wrong 'un entices a caught-behind appeal after beating a prod away from the body with a horizontal bat and is rejected

Smart stumping attempt from QDK, it's referred upstairs. The length ball down leg clips the pad on the way after beating the flick, QDK takes it and waits for Parag to go off balance as he tries to swivel with the momentum of the shot. But the feet were grounded when the bails were dislodged
Gets on a knee and sweeps a full ball around off to wide long-off for two
Slower one into the pitch on fifth stump is glided to third man
Good length angling out to fourth stump by the left-armer, defended to the bowler
Slogs it and connects over cow corner for six! It was a slot ball just outside off. Parag swung through and it went for a 95 metre six
Pulls, does not get all of it, and the aerial pull falls safely between deep-midwicket and cow corner running towards each other. The latter ran to his right and flicked it back to his partner.

Excellent running allows two. It was close to a yorker and beat the flick. It hit the bat, looked like it was going down leg, and hit the pad. There was no one in the ring square and the ball squirted to midwicket around the edge of the circle. The wily batters realized the bowler was appealing and not backing up. It allowed them to push and get two
Backfoot drive off a length ball outside off goes to deep cover

Pulled in the air and it is taken by Stoinis at deep-midwicket! It was on the shorter side and on the stumps, Parag swiveled but the connection was not good enough. It went flat and Stoinis went to his right and took it low to his right
Around a good length down leg, beats the flick. But it's a wide
Pushes a length ball outside off to deep cover
Full on off, opens the bat-face and angles it gently to point

Run-out at the non-striker's end after a mix-up! It came after Ashwin drove a full ball on middle to cover. Neesham took off for the run and Ashwin was ball-watching, the question is did they cross? It looked like Ashwin was walking but they were told to wait. Neesham had completed around three-fourth of the run and they have not crossed even though they tried to albeit in the last moment. The ball went to the right of the fielder, who got the ball on a good bounce
Clips a length ball on the stumps to deep-midwicket
Moves across and drives a full ball on sixth stump to long-off
Makes room and swipes a length ball over the stumps through long-off, it was a hard slap off the middle of the bat and it raced to the fence
Boult is building the run-reserve with the bat. It was a slot ball just outside off and Boult sliced it over cover. It went in the gap, allowing four more.
Swipes at a full ball around off, thrashed along the ground to long-off
Back of a length on the stumps, it is angled behind square for one

Badoni at point parries it and stops a rising ball couple after almost taking a blinder! It was a low, wide full toss and Boult opened the bat-face and sliced it in the air, Badoni took off in the air with a leap and pulled out a hand and it went off the swinging palms to deep cover
Makes room, slouches and carves a back of length ball outside off over cover, it goes inside out and falls in the gap. Stopped in the deep but they take two
Low full toss on middle, tries the lofted on-drive and gets it to long-on with half-decent contact
Larger wide boundaries is exploited by Boult as he makes room and clips a low full toss from the inside half of the bat. It went towards deep-midwicket and the batters pushed for two and made it
Makes room and swings at a length ball over leg with a horizontal bat, beaten
Full on legstump, Boult gets it long-off

Beats deep-backward square and gets four does Ashwin's slog that went off the bottom with the bat turning, it went along the ground and travelled away from the fielder running to his left and beat his dive
Slogs, gets the full ball on leg, off the bottom after making room to long-on's right and they scamper two
nice shape for the back of length ball, de Kock taps it towards off and takes off, Rahul responds well and they complete the single
he presses forward and takes off to get off the mark with a push to cover
some swing for the length ball on the pads, de Kock flicks it to midwicket
even more on the leg side, it deflects fine off the pads for a leg bye
short of length around off, Rahul patiently defends to off
hint of inswing on off stump for the length ball, Rahul defends with a straight bat

straight as an arrow from de Kock, cracking boundary! Length ball on off, a tad too full without much bounce and de Kock presents the straight bat beautifully with perfect timing and it might have taken Pradish's finger tips on the way but raced to the boundary
shorter and angling away outside off, de Kock steers towards point now
pushes the length ball into the covers and they take another quick single

doesn't carry to third man. For a second Prasidh would have thought he had Rahul after the batter cut it high and straight towards third man, where McCoy chooses to hang back near the rope to take it on the bounce instead of going forward
too short and wide outside off, swinging away further and it goes off the keeper's right glove for five wides
short of length ball angling into de Kock, he works it to leg for one
late swing but after it leaves the batter from well outside off, Rahul lets it go

taken at point, Neesham takes a sharp one! They're going to check for the catch though. de Kock slashed the short ball square, Neesham at point went low in front to get his fingers under it and the third umpire is convinced that he got his fingers under it cleanly

first ball duck for Badoni, Boult traps him lbw! Badoni reviews it after consulting his captain, but he might have wasted a review there because he wouldn't have asked Rahul if there was an edge. Pitched on middle, swinging in, hitting middle of middle. Boult knew it was out and appealed loudly with his team-mates as soon as it hit the pad after going past the bat as Badoni failed to connect with his flick

edged to slip but it reaches him after a bounce and what's more, Rahul could have been run-out too! Hooda under-edged to slip, it deflected off his left hand and Rahul sprinted across but he was sent back by Hooda, and the wayward throw helped him
good comeback from Hooda to cream that through the covers as he gets a fuller delivery and collects four
shorter length and wider too, Hooda slices it between point and third man for two
nearly in the block hole on leg, Hooda digs it out to midwicket
141.2kmh, length ball on target on off, Rahul defends with his bat close to body
good bounce for the length ball outside off, Rahul doesn't bother this time
142.3kmh, uses the angle and bounce sharply this time as Rahul defends in front of his chest
144.4kmh, another one left by Rahul as Prasidh pitches it short again outside off and swings it away
not much movement outside off and Rahul steers it to point
not a maiden because Rahul runs the slightly wide ball down to third man for one
nearly kisses the outside edge! Lovely seam position on off, Rahul goes on his toes to punch it to off but the ball angles away and nearly takes the edge
uses the angle again outside off and this time Rahul taps it to point
138.2kmh, takes it wider outside off with the angle and Rahul leaves
swings it in on the pads, Rahul watches it carefully and nudges to leg
