short of length on the hips and Rahul goes on his toes to tuck it square
slightly full and very wide, Hooda swings for a drive but finds cover

cover driven for six! That is just stunning and elegant from Rahul. Breathtaking shot. After all those dot balls and leaves outside off, Rahul takes out a cover drive for a ball that's not even that full, but he gets into great position to absolutely middle that over the covers
touch shorter outside off and he steers it to point

Prasidh counters and Rahul is taken at point! He bangs it in short and nips it in from outside off, Rahul wants to slice it over point but Jaiswal is stationed absolutely square at the edge of the circle, and he times his jump nicely to get both hands to it
on the leg side, not short at all, and Krunal helps it down to mid-on
144.2kmh, just short of length on off, and Krunal uses the angle so well to scythe that with perfect timing to beat a diving backward point for four
angles it into the pads and they get a leg bye to fine leg off the pads
81.2kmh, slow and gentle legbreak on off, Krunal leans forward and blocks
nicel tossed up on leg, and Krunal is waiting and waiting before he nearly chips it back, but it goes wide of Chahal. That was bowled at 72kmh
on length on off and Hooda flicks it to leg for one
lofted over long-on for a clean six! That's always on the cards when a legspinner is bowling to a left-hand batter. Slightly full on off, Krunal uses the turn and swings it over long-on
bowls it shorter and slower on off, it turns to leg and Krunal works it square for one
84.8kmh, leans forward to help the length ball down to long-on
nearly taken at cover! Hooda gets a leading edge off the carrom ball around off, it goes in the air to the left of cover where Neesham dives but it falls wide of him
he goes back to let the ball turn and works it to leg for two
94.4kmh, on length on the stumps and Hooda makes room to drive it through the covers for one
fuller on middle and leg, and he helps it square for one more
flat and straight around fifth stump, Hooda punches it down to long-on
98kmh, quicker on the stumps and Krunal drives to long-off for one
starts with a short ball outside off which Krunal steers to short third man where Chahal dives to stop it

139.7kmh, bangs it into the pitch outside off, Krunal punches it square with good timing and Boult puts in a slide at deep point just in time to save one. He tumbles after pulling the ball in but is applauded for his effort even as he lands awkwardly on his neck and right shoulder
excellent slower ball wide outside off, Hooda knows it's way out of his reach and nearly gives up in his shot
too short, down the leg side and Hooda middles that pull to smash a six fine on the leg side
clever change of pace on the pads at 109.2kmh, Hooda watches the slower one and defends to leg for one
low and dipping slower ball nearly in the block hole outside off, 105kmh, and he works it square for one
flat and short on off, he punches to cover
fuller on off and this time Krunal drives to deep cover for one
errs down the leg side for a wide left easily
backs away and then comes down the track to flick that away to wide long-on for two
floats it straight on the stumps, he pushes it back
loud, loud appeal for lbw, Ashwin wants it given out but he doesn't review it. Struck on the back foot as he was beaten by the quicker one, and it probably hit him too high or was going down leg
turning in and Hooda works it square for one

Comes down the ground and launches a full ball on off over long-off. He got to the pitch of the ball, the backfoot went up like that of a ballet dancer and the hands went through the ball. It salied over.
Full on off, gets a good stride and flogs it. The hard sweep went along the ground through deep square leg for one
Turns a length ball on the stumps behind square for one
Comes down the ground and Chahal tries to hide it down leg. Krunal jammed the flick and got a low, leading edge. Chahal went forward but could not reach
Clips a length ball to deep-midwicket
Comes down the ground and pushes a wide, full ball to cover point's right. Prasidh, there, could not pick it up and the tight single is completed
Comes down the ground and pushes a length ball to the right of cover. Direct hit comes in at the non-striker's end but the batter is well in which made the TV umpire's job easy
Drives a full ball outside off to deep cover
Comes down the ground and drives a full ball to long-off

Length ball over off, Hooda makes room and tries to cut it. It takes the edge and goes off the gloves and deflects through the vacant slip region. Short third man dove to his left but could not stop it
Full on the stumps, pushed to long-on
Full outside off, dug out to the bowler
McCoy falls after delivering the low, slow full toss on middle in the follow-through. It's tapped to cover gently for one
Short length ball comes on the hip and is turned to deep-midwicket
Waits for the slower short ball into the pitch outside off, it's slapped hard but the timing is 50-50. It dribbles to long-off along the ground.

Excellent fielding by Neesham to his right at cover. It was a full ball outside off, the hard cover drive came off the bat well and was racing to Neesham's right but he dove and got his hands flapping sideways
Chops a back of length ball outside off to point off the bottom of the bat
Length outside off, used the room and slapped it straight inside out. It went to the left of long-off, who stopped it

Excellent assisted catch between Jos at long-on and Riyan at long-off! It's referred upstairs but it looked fine. It came after Krunal came down the ground and went through with the lofted straight swipe, it went flat but a few metres to the right of Jos, he managed to reach out, take it on the move, and lob it to his partner while going diagonally over the fence. Parag stretched up and back, he maintained balance and took it well. Ashwin celebrates as the crowd breaks into cheers.
Sweeps in the air from a full ball on off over square leg, falls safely and is stopped in the deep.
Length ball comes in on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
Cuts a length ball outside off to deep point
Makes room and opens the face to push a length ball on the stumps to cover
Good length outside off with a straight run-up, driven to cover
Full and wide, Hooda slashes and misses as it angles away.
Reaches out and sweeps the bat along the ground with one hand coming off, the ball takes the edge and dribbles to the right of the keeper and the left of the diving short third man for four
Goes across and swipes across a full ball outside off to long-on along the ground
Finds the inside edge, it goes down from the horizontal bat and goes to the left of the keeper. It's half-stopped and a single is taken. It was a full ball outside off
Hooda brings up his 50 by cover driving a full ball outside off to deep extra cover, two taken
Shuffles to off from outside leg and squeezes a full ball just outside off to long-off
Length outside off, pushes off the inside-half half of the bat to the right of the bowler
Reaches out and slaps a length ball outside off and manages to pierce the gap between point and short third man
Slow down leg, shapes for the sweep but let it go as it was going away
Fullish ball on leg, clipped to the gap at midwicket. Goes to the edge of the circle, they take two
Goes across, comes back to make room and sweeps a good length ball following him. Goes along the ground to deep-midwicket
Good length outside off, whacked against the turn to long-on. It went off the bottom of the bat and along the ground

Samson uproots the stumps after fumbling the ball and somehow dismisses Hooda! The third umpire is checking, it came after Hooda came down the ground and tried to whack the full ball, following him, straight. It took the inside edge, then the pad, and dribbled to Samson. The keeper fumbled multiple times and managed to push the ball, sans control, on the stumps. Hooda, for whatever reason, did not try to come back. The third umpire decides on a few replays that the bails came off because of the ball, gives it out.
Full outside off, pushed to long-off
Wide yorker is left alone as it was outside the tramline
Full outside off, driven to cover
Length outside off, drags the pull along the ground to deep-midwicket

Edged and taken! Cross-seamer at yorker length on fourth stump has Holder, who had the front leg out the way, manufacture an open-faced drive towards cover point but it takes the outside edge. Taken by Samson to his right followed by celebrations
Full outside off, tries the drive. Goes off the inside edge to the bowler

Bowls him with a yorker on middle! Chameera had his front leg out the way, as is often the case at the death, and tried to whack it over midwicket. The ball went past the swing and disturbed the furniture to McCoy's delight
Good length down leg, pulled to long-on. Single rejected
Full on leg stump, swept to deep-midwicket. Single rejected again
Wide, good length ball sits up and is slapped over cover to the deep. Boult bolts to his left and stops it
Full on middle, makes room and swipes it to the right of long-on. He called for two, Samson yelled 'one'. That was the case in the end
Gets on a knee and drags a full ball on the tramline to long-on along the ground off the bottom of the bat
Six? Yes! Stoinis' free swing came off a full ball on leg. He made further room and whacked it over long-on
Full on leg, the slower yorker length ball is worked to long-on
Slow yorker well outside the off side tramline, left alone
Slower one on a length sits up outside off and Stoinis clobbers it to the right of deep-midwicket. Neesham runs across swiftly and tries to parry it in but it's going away.

Parag takes an excellent catch diving diagonally to his right at long-on! It's sent upstairs but it looked good on first viewing. Nope, third umpire, Bruce Oxenford, observes it hit the ground, gives it not-out. It came off a full ball outside off and Stoinis swung it across. Parag ran through and took the catch on the move but the ball looks to have reached him on the half volley
Length down leg, beats the fine pull but it's a wide
Full down leg, beats the whip aimed to send it fine. Wide. McCoy isn't fully fit but is continuing to try his best to complete his spell
Low full toss outside off is driven along the ground to sweeper cover
Length outside off, Mohsin swings out of shape trying to go over deep-midwicket and misses. It goes over the bat on its way to the keeper
Similar line and length, the front leg comes out the way and the lofted square drive connects. It goes over point and rolls to the fence
Yorker length ball on off, Stoinis lunges forward, makes it a low full toss, and swings through the line. It sails over long-off

Parag takes it easily at long-on this time! Length ball outside off, Stoinis slapped across the line, it goes up and Parag comes in and takes it. He slowly took the ball down and cheekily lifted it just before it hit the ground
Swings at a length ball outside off and misses
Makes room and swings through a slower length ball on leg, gets it to wide long-off
on a length, top of off, defended to off
stays on the same line and length, Gaikwad this time defends it to mid-off
slightly fuller, but still on off and middle. Defended to cover this time
short of a length now, tucked away off the hip for one
phew unplayable. On a length, angling in towards top of off, and then seaming just a touch and moving against the angle to beat him
this one comes in with the angle, and he clipped it past square leg for three runs
and he starts off with a no-ball. Left alone outside off
strange shot on a free hit. Hit along the ground to mid-on. It was a full ball and not a yorker. Could have tried to get under it
on a length, into the pads, worked around the corner
short of a length, around off, pushed back to him
short of a length, tucks him up with the line, worked to leg but can't find a gap
driven on the up, but straight to mid-off
short of a length, just outside off, opens the face to take a single to short third man

this is just too good. Test-match stuff. Round the wicket, angling in, making him play the angle, and then leaving him just a touch to take the edge. Conway tried to walk down at him but it didn't help him
on a length, angling in, defended back to him
angling in, tucked away off the hip for a single to fine leg
short of a length, outside off, steered away to third man for one
on a length, angling in, slight seam movement in too, played uppishly to midwicket
short of a length, outside off, Moeen plays away from the body, gets an outside edge, which goes past the slip
on a length, around off, punched to extra cover
on a length, just outside off, defended back to him
short of a length, just outside off, opens the face on it for a single
on a length, on off, defended to short cover
fuller, on the pads, clipped away for a single
short of a length, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
Dayal is celebrating even before he appeals because he has hit Gaikwad right in front, but this ball is pitched clearly outside leg. No support for him from the umpire, keeper or captain
first boundary attempt. And he gets a boundary too. Charges at him, and flat-bats this short-of-a-length ball past mid-on
anticipates the short ball, stays back, and pulls it over the short boundary for six. Just uses his pace and goes over short fine leg with the pull
walks at him again, Dayal shortens the length but his line is poor. All Gaikwad has to do is get a touch on it and beat short fine leg. He does so
on a length, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
gets a bottom edge as Moeen looks to crash this length ball through the covers
draws a thick inside edge immediately as Gaikwad gives him the charge and looks to go down the ground. No turn on the ball, and the inside edge flies over square leg
stays back to work this length ball to deep midwicket
on a length, on off, just holds its line. Played back to Rashid

just clears the deep midwicket to his left. Moeen gets under a short-of-a-length ball and pulls it high towards square leg, the shorter boundary. Deep midwicket runs to his left, but can't catch up with this. It has gone at a catchable height, though
oh nobody is catching this. Rashid goes on a length, and Moeen slog-sweeps him for a huge six over forward square leg
quicker, flatter, punched past extra cover for two
short of a length, just outside off, opens the face, can't beat point
right forward to defend this length ball
short of a length, opens the face, takes a quick single
short of a length, outside leg, gets big on him, Moeen plays it down with the bottom hand off the handle
pulled away flat for a four into the short leg-side boundary. This has absolutely raced away to the fence
steered down to third man for one
too short, and is cut away square of deep cover for two
stays back to open the face on this length ball for a single
punches this to the right of the sweeper-cover but gets just the single
flighted, full, driven down to long-off for one
wrong'un, Moeen looks to hit this in the air and down the ground off the back foot. A bit of a mis-hit for a single to long-off
this legbreak turns, Gaikwad still manages to pull it to leg for one
full, on the pads, gets a single to leg
full, looks to slog it, doesn't get all of it. A single to deep midwicket
sweeps this length ball to deep square leg for one. Tewatia slides to his right to keep them down to one
angles this one across Moeen. Concedes a wide
smart bowling. Slow in the air, outside off, making him drag it to his favourite slog into the leg side even though it is the bigger boundary. Caught at deep midwicket
oh too full and down the leg side. Jagadeesan glances it past short fine leg for four. That's a nice little gift first ball
gets the line closer to middle this time, but it is still drifting in and a half-volley. Jagadeesan misses it, and is hit on the pad
on a length, top off, pushed to the left of cover for one. That's a quick single so well done Jagadeesan on responding immediately
full, outside off, and a leave from Jagadeesan
down the wicket, Dayal drags the length back, Jagadeesan flat-bats it to mid-off for one
slower ball, full, outside off, defended back to him
is this dropped or does it not carry?. Doesn't carry. Pulled down and hard to the right of short midwicket, and Wade dives to gets a touch on it on the half-volley
down the wicket, Dayal shortens the length again, and he works this into the leg side and takes on the arm of Sai Kishore. Kishore loses his shoe and the throw is not accurate either
Jagadeesan gives him the charge, is beaten in the flight, but gets the inside half of the bat on the ball for a single to long-on
on a length, Gaikwad stays back to push this to deep cover for one
hit uppishly towards long-off for one
full, almost a yorker, dug out back to him
tosses this up wide, and Gaikwad leaves it alone. A misjudgement there because this is not even close to being a wide
sees him give the charge and goes wide outside off again. This time Gaikwad has to get his bat on ball to avoid a stumping. He does so but doesn't get even a single
yorker, swinging in, dug out to point
on a length but shaping in to beat his attempt to run it down to third man
makes room, Jospeh follows him, he hits this to mid-off for one
whipped in the air and into the longer side of the ground, his leg side. A bit of a helicopter shot from deep inside the crease to drag this from outside off. Places this in front of deep square leg
hit too hard to mid-off to be trying a single
looks to get inside the line of the ball to capitalise on the short fine leg but finds the man. Sudharsan gets his body behind it even though he doesn't field it cleanly
on a length, on off, pushed past cover for one
tries the big cut, gets a think edge that goes straight of short third man for four. Dayal, the fielder, dives over the ball
on a length, makes room to punch this to deep point for one
Kishore's towel comes as he releases the ball but that has no impact on Gaikwad's mis-hit into the leg side after giving him the charge. off the cue end for a single to deep midwicket
fires in a yorker, and draws a dot
slower in the air now, a bit of a shank to long-on for one
makes room and gives him the charge, but manages only the toe-end of the bat for a single to mid-off
looks like a slower ball from Gaikwad's reaction to this pull shot, which he sends straight to deep midwicket for one. Just looks early into the shot
nearly a yorker, dug out for one
yorker, just a single towards long-on
gives himself some room, looks like a slower ball, crunched straight to deep cover for one
down the wicket to flick this to long-on for one
low full toss, driven to deep cover a single that brings up yet another fifty for Gaikwad
down the wicket, gets close enough to it to be able to drill it back over Kishore's head for four
looks for the reverse-hit, changes his stance too early, and Kishore slows it down appreciably to beat him
fired in full, hit hard but can't get under it. Just the single to long-off
goes back to late-cut this length ball for one. Gill makes a diving save at point
quicker short ball, looking to protect the over, but he has pulled it for a flat six over the short leg side. A bit of a blot on an impressive spell otherwise
wrong'un, starts straight too, pulled to deep square leg for one
down the wicket but yorks himself. Gets just the single to long-on
gives him the charge, Rashid beats him in the air, and draws an inside edge back to himself
wrong'un, pulled to deep square leg for just the single
wrong'un, picks it, pulls it in the air, for a single to deep midwicket

Gaikwad falls for 53 off 49. We will know in a bit if this is the correct representation of this pitch. The crowd is not debating that. they are chanting Dhoni Dhoni. And then a bit of a boo as they see Shivam Dube walk out. Gaikwad skips down the wicket, Rashid drags the length back, and he ends up dragging this to deep midwicket. No timing either. Signs that it is a slow pitch
cramps him up mas he looks to go down the ground. Just too short for a hit down the ground. Just the single to long-on
hit straight to mid-off but along the ground

sharp bouncer. Joseph has been really quick this IPL. And Dube looks to pull out of this late, and gets a top edge into the shoulder and then through to Saha. The crowd, though, is delirious with joy. And they are all CSK fans, mind you
forward defensive to start off with. Inside edge into the pad
short of a length, around off, defended back again
wide length ball, driven on the up and to the left of deep cover. Gets a couple
swept in the air, on the bounce to deep midwicket
legbreak, on a length, middle and leg, defended back to him
down the wicket, Rashid stays slow in the air, Dhoni gets too close to it and actually gets it on the full, but gets just the single to long-on
wrong'un, comepltely does him in, gets an inside edge onto the pad
gives him the charge but ends up yorking himself for a single to long--on
stays back to cautiously defend this. Doesn't want to give Rashid a wicket with his last ball
starts off with a pin-point yorker, just outside off. Squeezes under his bat
sees him shuffle across, bowls wide of him and a slower ball. Still called a wide
this time the batter doesn't move and Dayal goes really wide. This one nobody will question
wide on the crease, slower ball, draws a big mis-hit that doesn't carry to long-on. Dhoni chants go up again as he comes back on strike
nails the yorker, just the single for Dhoni to deep cover
slower ball, on a length, hit hard but straight to long-off for one
another perfect yorker to Dhoni. Again just the single to extra cover
wide yorker, beats him as he has shuffled across. belated call of a wide
full and wide again, just the single to deep cover. Excellent over from Dayal despite three wides. Jagadeesan on strike for the start of the final over
low full toss, hit to long-off for a single
goes for the yorker, misses it by inches, but still hits his inside edge. A couple to fine leg
and Dhoni is out for 7 off 10. Shami digs this in, Dhoni looks to pull over midwicket, but perhaps the ball has come slower than he expects and he can't clear midwicket
yorker, dug out for one to deep point where Kishore loses his shoe for the second time today
shuffles across looking to ramp it, Shami slips this past his pads, and it is not called a wide even though it misses the leg stump. Good umpiring. Would have hit the pads had he stayed in his stance
no boundary in the death overs. The best they can manage is a second after hitting this yorker to long-on
Full ball outside off to start, Saha reaches out and drives it to backward point.
Streaky, lucky four to get going! Very full outside off, swinging in just a touch. Saha goes for the drive and gets an inside edge past off stump.
Peach! Choudhary has been very impressive this season. Lands this on a length and takes it away from the batter. Saha is squared up and misses the ball by a whisker.
And more luck goes Saha's way. Looks to whack the length ball across the line and gets a top edge. No chance for the wicketkeeper running back as well as third man running to his right.
This time deliberate. Smartly played. Length ball again, slanting well away. Saha just watches it closely and steers it past the wide slip. No chance for third man.
Better. Length ball around off, Saha defends it from the crease and wrings his right hand as soon as he does that.
Starts with a back of a length ball around the fourth stump line, pulled straight to midwicket.
Fuller and on the pads, tucked away through backward square leg for one.
Saha is playing this smartly. Yet again stands tall besides the length ball outside off, rides the bounce and steers it past short third man for his fourth four.
Length ball on off, defended from the crease.
Banged short outside off, Saha watches it through. Wide signaled for height.
Another back of a length ball around off, Saha hopes and pushes it to backward point.
First non-boundary run for Saha, as he flicks this one to fine leg for a single to retain strike.
The Saha teams love to have in their side. The attacker who did very well for Kings XI Punjab around 2014. Gets it full and hits it way over mid-on for four more.
Pulls his length back a bit and bowls it around off, defended back from the crease.
Back of a length ball around middle and off, Saha is on the front foot and has to adjust to go back for the pull. Misses and gets it off his body towards slip.

A dolly goes down! Gaikwad had backward point shells an easy catch and he indicates that the sun disturbed his vision, all while having his goggles resting on the cap. Saha saw a full ball and looked to go over the ring on the off side. Sliced it but survives.
Fuller outside off, pushed to mid-off for one.
You drop a catch, you pay! That's what Saha says with this shot. Gets a half-volley outside off, belts it over mid-off for his sixth four.
Flatter on middle and leg, Gill misses the flick.
Slower through the air around leg, swept to short fine leg.

Valiant effort from Conway but to no avail. Half-tracker from Santner, Gill goes back and pulls it along the ground through midwicket. Conway hares to his left, slides with his foot first but can't stop that.
Saha seems to be in but the TV ump is called in for a check. One replay is enough to confirm that. Gill pushed this in front of square on the leg and hared across for a quick run.
Slower one on a length, Saha goes back but doesn't manage to put it away.
Fuller and outside off, driven through wide mid-off for one.

It has hit Saha in line but has it done a bit too much? The umpire feels so and Dhoni doesn't contest. Length ball swinging in, Saha misses the flick and is hit on the front leg in front of middle and leg. Would have been umpire's call at best.
Fuller and outside off, driven to cover.
WriddhiBoundaryman Saha! Gets a short one and pulls it with a swivel for a maximum over deep midwicket.
Full and outside off, pushed to cover, where the fielder stops with a dive.
Length ball slanting in, Saha looks to pull but misses.
Take that! Saha's in the mood. Thumps the length ball with disdain right over the bowler's head. Simarjeet can't do much apart from kicking the turf in disgust.
Short and quick on middle, swiped to square leg.
Similar ball a touch slower, whipped to midwicket.
Fired it on the pads, Gill blocks.
Shot! Gill anticipated the line quite nicely there. Gets across and under the sweep and plays it over short fine leg for four.
This is a waste. Santner fires it short and down leg, easy pickings for Gill, who pulls it past short fine to bring up the 50.
A touch slower, punched back to the bowler.
Tosses it up full outside off, driven to long-off for a single.
Similar ball around off, driven to long-off to rotate strike.
A touch short, Saha goes back and punches it to deep backward point for one.
Generously flighted, full on middle, whipped to deep midwicket for one.
Loopy ball around middle, nearly does Saha in in flight. Bahut badhiya (very nice) shouts Dhoni as the batters take a run, courtesy the inner half of Saha's blade.
Shorter and quicker, punched down to long-on for a single.

No. 99 at the back, Malinga's bowling action, slinger Pathirana strikes first ball in the IPL! Gill clearly is done in by the pace and is late in bringing his bat down for the flick. It was speared full on middle. Gill asked for the review. Pad first, confirms the Snicko, Hawk-Eye returns three reds. First-ball strike for Pathirana, remember the name! What a mode of dismissal to kickstart your IPL career.
That's fast but down leg, Wade misses the flick.
What's the fuss, asks Wade! Very full on off, he just times the push down the ground to get going with a four.
Length ball on middle, whipped through midwicket and called for two, makes it in as well.
Misdirects it and pays the price. Full and down leg, Wade times his flick perfectly through backward square leg. Ten off three!
Outside off on a length, slices it to third man for one.
On a length outside off, Saha stands tall and blocks.
Flatter and on a length slanting away from around the stumps, Wade slaps it through point for one.
Quicker on a length, Saha goes back and punches it to long-off.
Bull's eye! Has Wade made it though? Yes he has. Turns a ball on middle through square leg and calls for two. The dive in the end saves him.
Floated up, full outside off, taps it to the off side and gets to the other end.
Tossed up outside off, Saha lets it be.
Fired quicker and full outside off, hit to cover.
Starts with a low full toss, driven down to long-off for a single.
Generously flighted, bowled fuller outside off, driven to cover.
Again, full and loopy outside off, driven through covers for one.
Looks to bowl a loopy full ball again, dishes out a low full toss. Belted down to long-off for one.
Lands it on a fuller length, Saha goes back and punches it to long-off.
Fuller on off, reverse-swept through covers for one.
Hurled on the pads, worked away fine down leg for one.
Fuller on off, punches it through point to get to the other end.
Deceived everybody! Results in four byes though. Flighted around leg, turns down further. Beats Wade as well as Dhoni. Lucky to not be called wide.
Pushed towards midwicket for a quick run.
Sees Saha charging down and throws it full and wide. But Saha reaches out and hits it over covers for a brace.
Fired down leg, Saha perhaps got a glove to it as he swept. No way Dhoni could have taken it though. 0/24 for Santner.
Well done, Santner! He is at slip and dives to prevent any runs. Wade was done in by the flight and got a thick outside edge. Didn't carry to slip, though.

Wade loses two things on a single ball - his wicket as well as his bat! Yet again looks to attack Moeen but fails to pick the flight early. Almost yorks himself as he holes out to long-on. Loses his bat, that flew to almost hit Dhoni.
Attacker Pandya gets going with a four. Loads up big time and slog-sweeps the flighted ball over midwicket to split the gap in the deep.
Flatter and quicker, driven to long-on for one.
Fuller on off, turns it through square leg for one.
Tossed up outside off, Hardik comes down and pushes it back.
Ripper! Saha goes back to defend but gets it off the outside edge to point.
Super fielding from Santner at covers. Saha pushes the full ball to the right of cover, but he stops and throws it in a single motion.
Quicker on middle and leg, turned through midwicket for one.
Quicker one on a shorter length. goes back and punches it to long-off for one.
Loopy ball, full on off. Pushed down to long-off.
Hardik loses shape as he aims to deposit this one way beyond the ropes. Full ball outside off, gets it off the inner half to deep midwicket for one.

Another wicket off the first ball of his over, Pathirana is on a roll! It was the offcutter that did Pandya in. It was full, Pandya was early into the flick and ended up getting a leading edge. Dube at mid-off kept his eyes on the ball and took it after taking a couple of steps back. Is there life in the game?
Spears it full on the pads, Miller misses the flick and gets it off his pads, Dhoni does well to keep it to one with his dive.

Back of a length outside off, Saha hops and pats it to the off side and hares to the other end to bring up his 11th IPL fifty. Had to dive but the throw was well wide. Saha's played a good knock thus far.
Full outside off, squeezed to cover.
Wide and full outside off, left alone.
Slower one again, full outside off, pushed towards covers.
Length ball slanting away, punches it to sweeper for one.
Tossed up full on middle and leg, hit down to long-on for one.
Slower and fuller outside off, Saha hits it past cover for one.
Sees Miller making room and bowls a slow googly. Miller pushes it back.
Flatter legspinner, turned to midwicket.
Fuller and outside off this time, pushed to long-off.
Very full on middle, swept to deep square leg for another single. Just three from the over.
Full and on the pads, turned through square leg for a single.
Length ball slanting away at 141.4 kph. Gets a thick outside edge to the attempted punch to third man for one.
Banged in short, Saha misses the pull.
On a length on off, this was the slower one. Saha works it through square leg. The less pace allows him to get back for two.
Very full on middle, hit back down past the stumps at the other end for one.
Poor ball to end the over. Seems to be the slower ball gone wrong. A juicy full toss outside off, thrashed through covers for four. Simarjeet was seen gesturing that he was trying the offcutter.
Full and wide, Saha reaches out and hits it to long-off for one.
Floated on a length, Miller lets it turn before pushing it to cover.
Flatter on leg, worked away through square leg for one.
A bit short, Saha mistimes the pull through midwicket and gets just one.
Floated full on middle, hit on the bounce to long-on for one.
Beauty! Tossed up around off, on a length. Turns well past Saha's defensive blade. Dhoni uproots the stumps but Saha is well in. End of Solanki's impressive debut.
Fires it on the pads, Miller misses the flick and gets it off his pads. A leg bye taken even as Pathirana appeals.
Short in length, Saha swivels the pull all along the ground to fine leg. Was bowled at 114.4 kph.
Very full outside off, pushed in front of point for a quick one.
Full and outside off, Saha misses the drive.
Well bowled. Steams in and bowls a fast yorker on middle. Saha digs it out towards midwicket for a single.
Very full outside off, hit to cover.
A full toss to end the over, put Miller finds deep point for one.
Very full on off, driven down to long-off for one run.
Length ball slanting away, Saha glides it to short third for one.
Bowls it full just outside off, Miller pushes it down to long-off.
Speared full, Saha looks to walk across and scoop it over short fine. Gets the inner edge past the stumps for one.
Very full on leg, driven to long-on for one.
Back of a length ball, hurried Saha, who goes for the pull. Gets a top edge that lands in no man's land around where backward point would have been.
Saha starts the chase with a four, ends it with another! Length ball well outside off, guides it past short third man to move to 67 not out and seal the seven-wicket win.
shortish and sliding into the hips, deflected away fine on the leg side
much fuller, starts outside off and swings away further in the channel. Rahane wafts and misses
even fuller and wider of off, so much that it ends up as an off-side wide. Rahane throws his hands at ball, but can't reach it
inswinger from Bhuvneshwar, angling in and moving in towards middle, Rahane presses forward and keeps it out
another inswinger from Bhuvneshwar, hits the pad and trickles away square through the leg side. This was surely missing leg stump. Okay, the tracker returns umpire's call on leg stump
driven straight past Bhuvneshwar for four. Pitched-up delivery on the stumps, no swing, Venkatesh presses forward and strokes it away straight of mid-off
Bhuvneshwar darts another wide, this is a leg-side wide
back of a length and angling across off, Venkatesh stabs at it and watches the inside edge roll quickly to Malik at fine leg
back of a length and largely holds its line just a shade outside off, punched up to mid-off
similar length and slanting into middle, whisked wide of mid-on for a single
pulled over fine leg for six. Short and sliding down the leg side, Rahane picks it up off his hips and uses the pace and bounce of Jansen to his advantage
fuller and angling across off, defensively guided into the covers
back of a length and veering away outside off with the angle, tip and run to the right of Pooran behind the stumps

Venkatesh chops on and knocks out his own off stump. Shorter outside off, from wide of the crease, Venkatesh throws his bat at ball and drags it back onto his own stumps. Gone for 7 off 6 balls. Welcome back, Marco
full and slanting into middle, Rahane presses forward and plays it back to Bhuvneshwar
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, Rahane gets on top of the bounce and punches to covers
full and angling into off and middle, Rahane clips it more or less straight to midwicket
Rahane punchily drives it wide of mid-off and sets off for a single
nice and full, angling across off, Rana watches it through to Pooran
nice and full once again, nipping away in the channel, nothing doing from Rana
full and on the stumps, Rahane gets forward and drives a single to the right of mid-on
on a length and outside off, Rana taps it away but can't get it past backward point
Jansen hits that in-between length, the line is outside off, jabbed into the covers
back of a length and slanting in at off, run away to backward point once again
full and veering into the pads, Rana does not make contact with bat, kisses the pad and rolls away for a leg bye
good length and leaves Rahane in the channel outside off, almost scratches the outside edge
pitched-up delivery outside off, the length is right there for the drive. Drilled away straight of mid-off as Natarajan concedes a first-ball four
four followed by six. Back of a length and outside off, Rana goes so very deep in the crease and hauls a pull over mid-on for six
better ball from Natarajan. Full and hung up outside off, Rana drives and is beaten on the outside edge

short and angling into the hips, with fine leg inside the circle. Natarajan is looking rusty. Poor ball. Picked up over short fine leg for another boundary. Not short enough or quick enough from Natarajan
low full-toss on middle, flicked away to deep square leg
chipped away to the right of the leg umpire
pumped over mid-on. On a length and angling across off stump, stand and deliver from Rahane. He clears the infield
shuffles across and clips it off the pads to deep square leg
Rahane rides the bounce of this short ball angling across him and picks up a single to deep third man
ramped over short third man for another six. Banged in short and outside off, Rana uses the pace and bounce of Jansen to his advantage
short and wide of off, scythed away to sweeper cover off the back foot

worked off the hips through backward square leg. Rahane is in some discomfort. He hobbles across and seems to be clutching his right hamstring at the non-striker's end at the end of the over. The physio is out to tend to Rahane
sliding into middle, played back to Washington
pushed through and angling into middle, slog-sweeps and inside-edges it onto his pad
deliberately chipped over extra-cover for one. Rahane hobbles across once again
low full-toss on the pads, from round the stumps, whipped away through midwicket for a single
hauled over long-on for six. 101.5ks dart from Washington, on a length and outside off, Rahane clears his front leg and swings it away over the outfielder. Even Jansen can't pluck it
darted into the pitch, on a fourth-stump line, Rahane drags a reverse-sweep to point
Rana immediately backs away outside leg and guides a single to deep third man
pretty full on the stumps, whipped away to deep midwicket. Rahane hobbles across for another single. He bats on despite the injury

Malik gets rid of Rana. This was on the cards, wasn't it? Flapped away to deep square leg. On a back of a length and just outside off, this isn't quite a full-blooded pull from Rana. Shashank runs in rather belatedly from the boundary but dives forward to pouch the catch. Rana helps it to Shashank
147.1ks full delivery wide of off, Shreyas sat back for the bounce. He still throws his bat at ball and slices it away over backward point
full again, on the stumps, chipped in the air, but between midwicket and mid-on. Bhuvneshwar chases hard and hauls the ball in

Malik takes out Rana and Rahane in the same over. Shashank runs across to his right from sweeper cover and pouches it once again. He got into a side-on position, but managed to hold onto the ball at the boundary after a tumble. Banged in short and outside off, Rahane upper-cuts in the air, but can't clear the boundary
worked off the pads through the square-leg region
low full-toss on off stump, which is bunted down to Jansen at long-on
pushed through outside off, driven away to the left of wide long-off
forced down to long-on off the back foot
Billings dares to reverse-sweep from the stumps and finds short third man
back of a length and outside off, punched past the right of short cover, down to long-off
hard-length delivery skidding into middle, fended back to Malik
dug in short and outside off, heaved away behind square leg off the inner half
dug in short and outside off, Shreyas arches back, but can't ramp it away. Beaten
Shreyas gets a pitched-up delivery and the result is four. He hangs back and punchily drives it straight past Malik
shortish and on off, possibly a slower one, fended back to the bowler

147.8ks, full and angling into the pads from wide of the crease. Shreyas goes deep in the crease, searching for the short ball. This is nowhere near that length. He still flicks it in the air. Holes out to Tripathi at deep midwicket. Dives forward to complete the catch
on a length and turning into middle, blocked to the leg side off the back foot
pushed through just a shade outside off, Billings senses an opportunity to reverse-sweep and places it to the left of sweeper cover
down the track and driven down to long-on
sliding into off stump, blocked off the front foot
short and turning away outside off, Rinku slices an outside edge that does not carry to short third man
Washington bowls into the pitch and keeps Rinku to a single down to long-on
Rinku pulls this short ball from outside off. Jansen slides at the boundary and cuts it off to two
back of a length and wide of off, forced away to the left of sweeper cover
lifter from Natarajan, Rinku ducks under it

Natarajan spins around and belts out an appeal for lbw. Given out rather belatedly on the field. Rinku and Billings get together and Rinku belatedly asks for a review of Ananthapadmanabhan's on-field out decision. Rinku has been timed out on the review. He hangs around for a bit before dragging himself off the field. Umpire Anil Chaudhary sends him on his way even as he remonstrates with him. Looks like Billings had initially signalled for a review, but that doesn't count. Baz McCullum has a word with the fourth umpire at the boundary. This was a Natarajan special: inswinging yorker from over the wicket, dips and crashes into the toe. Looks pretty adjacent. Steyn is pumped in the dug-out. Strange play
Natarajan welcomes Russell with a yorker, jammed out
just short of a yorker length on off, squirted out for a single
glanced away through backward square leg
just short of a good length and angling across off, glided down to deep third man
very full and Jansen hides it away from the swinging arc of Russell, left alone
yorker from Jansen, dug out
follows the yorker with a bouncer, Russell ducks under it
full and on the pads, tucked away to deep midwicket
short and wide of off, slapped away to the right of sweeper cover off the back foot
Russell stays leg-side of this short ball outside off and fiercely flat-bats it away straight of Williamson at wide mid-off
short and wide of off, Russell stays leg-side of the ball once again, swishes and misses this time
on a length on middle, Russell winds up and hacks it away to deep midwicket
short and outside off, helped away to deep third man
shortish and on middle, hoicked away to deep midwicket
banged in short and outside off, Billings shelves the hook and lets it sail through to Pooran
full and sprayed down the leg side, wide
full and speared outside off, Billings, having jumped across off, can't connect with the scoop

Natarajan goes for a yorker on middle, comes out as a full-toss, which is hauled away to wide long-on. They check for a run-out. Russell dives and is in at the non-striker's end. Don't think there was a double there
yorker from Natarajan this time, Billings shuffles across for a scoop/sweep, but can only deflect it away fine on the leg side
leg-stump yorker, squeezed away through midwicket
Natarajan keeps nailing his yorkers, dips under the bat or rather hits the cue end and goes through to Pooran
down the track, manufactures a full-toss and heaves it away to deep midwicket
There is no margin for error against Russell. Natarajan misses the yorker, comes out as a full-toss. Russell opens up his hips and smokes it over midwicket for six
Billings backs away outside leg, fired full and outside off, Billings swings and misses
Malik tries the slower ball, 134.6ks, short and outside off, scythed over the covers. A much-needed boundary for Billings
on-pace full ball outside off, Billings stays leg-side of the ball and sends it clattering past the left of Malik for back-to-back fours. Mid-off is up
Billings makes room, just short of a yorker length on middle, stabbed back to the bowler who makes a half-save
back of a length and sails over the leg stump, from round the wicket, as Russell swings to the leg side and does not make contact
banged in short and angling across off, scythed away to sweeper cover
full-toss on leg stump, it's still a hard-to-hit low full-toss, but Russell makes it look easy by hoicking it away between wide long-on and deep midwicket
slower cutter, floated wide of off, Russell can't reach it
off-stump yorker, jammed out to long-on
Billings jumps out of the crease, Bhuvneshwar drags his length back and pushes it so very wide of off. He has to re-bowl this
back of a length and wide of off, Billings opens the bat-face and carves it away wide of sweeper cover
back of a length and outside off, flat-batted, past Bhuvneshwar, down to long-off
whacked away between deep midwicket and wide long-on for another boundary. Bhuvneshwar misses the yorker but not by much. Comes out a full-toss and Russell hits it flat and hard over the leg side

another lbw appeal from Natarajan, not given out lbw this time. SRH ask for a review. Just short of a yorker length from Natarajan, Billings goes for a little sweep and actually hits it. Ultra Edge confirms the involvement of bat. The on-field not-out decision has been vindicated
Natarajan tries the slower ball, banged in at the body, hooked away to deep midwicket
Billings shuffles outside leg, Natarajan nails the yorker, Billings can't touch it
fractionally overpitched on off stump, Billings clears his front leg and gets underneath the length. Pumped straight of mid-off
lifter on middle, dragged away to deep midwicket
Russell makes room outside leg, Natarajan chases him with a yorker and beats him. The six aside, good last over from Natarajan
full and sliding in, Billings swishes and misses, but this is heading down the leg side. They cross over for a leg bye
full and wide of off, thrashed away to the right of sweeper cover. Fine one-handed stop from Tripathi in the outfield
slower bouncer floated past the tramline. Off-side wide
Bhuvneshwar nails the yorker and floors Russell. Cannons into the back pad, but this is missing the stumps once again
Bhuvneshwar attempts another slower ball from round the stumps, pushes it past the tramline once again
yorker on middle from over the wicket, stabbed away to deep midwicket
Chipped to Williamson at extra-cover. 118.3ks slower one wide of off. Seems like the legcutter from Bhuvneshwar, hides it away from the swinging arc. Loopy catch for Williamson
wide yorker from Bhuvneshwar, squeezes underneath Narine's hard-handed jab
fired full and outside off, 98ks, slammed to straightish long-on. Russell turns over the strike to Narine
Narine backs away, Washington chases him with a dart from wide of the crease. Slapped down to long-off
full-toss from Washington and there's only one result possible: that's Russell whacking it over six. He clears his front leg and sends it over the midwicket fence
starts with a length ball outside off which Abhishek pushes gingerly to cover
bangs it in shorter at 138.5kmh, Abhishek hangs back and steers it on the rise towards point
a bit of shape into the batter from short of length and Abhishek is off the mark by helping it down to third man
right on target on the stumps at 142.7kmh, Williamson defends with a straight bat
short of length at 142.3kmh on fifth stump and Williamson pushes it to cover
errs on the pads but gets away with it, Williamson flicks it straight to midwicket
129.7kmh, not much pace, some width with the angle outside off and Abhishek punches that nicely through the covers with wonderful timing for four
stays back and punches the length ball down to mid-off

falls just short of Russell at mid-on! Angling in with a scrambled seam from around the wicket, Abhishek mistimes it down to mid-on where Russell goes forward and might have got his fingertips under the ball but I have a feeling he didn't move forward early enough
outside off and he pushes towards cover point for one
slashes it past point for four more! Backs away marginally, gets a short ball with some room and he cuts it well
134.6km, extra bounce, appeal for caught behind only from Southee but turned down. Short of length, decent pace, Abhishek just poked and missed as the ball rose outside off
beaten outside off! Really good short of length ball just outside off, Williamson tries his staple dab to third man but misses
similar ball, not as steep with the bounce and this time Williamson successfully runs it down to third man
140.2kmh, short on the hips, he tucks it square for one

dropped by Umesh in the follow through! A tough chance, no doubt about that. Full toss which Williamson slams back, Umesh gets both hands to it around his chest but just can't hold on. He barely had time to react
too short this time to follow the full toss, and Williamson gets going with a short-arm pull to the vacant midwicket boundary
he makes room on the last ball to slash it away but finds point
lofted over his head first ball! Just a little short, the field is in, obviously, and Abhishek stays back to slam it to the long-on boundary
stays in the crease and pushes the ball to mid-on
goes back patiently and works the ball to leg for one
angling in, maybe some drift as well, and Abhishek lofts that inside out to long-off for one

nearly a run-out chance at the bowler's end! Abhishek defended to off and sent his partner back but Williamson was nearly halfway down the pitch before he turned back. Shreyas had a shy at the stumps but just missed
goes back and works the incoming ball to deep midwicket for two
short ball, Williamson pulls with a pivot and it falls just short of Shreyas at midwicket
138.6kmh, just outside off now and he tickles it to third man
bangs it around back of length on off and Abhishek taps it close to himself for a quick single
wide half-volley and Williamson goes down on a knee but drives it straight to cover
a bouncer with some away swing, Williamson is air borne to try and sort of ramp it to third man but he's beaten!
drills the full ball back but Umesh gets a hand on the way and keeps it to one as the ball deflects towards mid-off
a cutter around off, stifling line, and Williamson nudges it too fine and finds the keeper

another scratchy Williamson innings ends! Russell sticks to the basics by targeting top of off, Williamson tries something fancy by going across and scooping it fine, but he misses it competely and loses his stumps. Gone for 9 off 17, Lara is shaking his head with his face buried in his hands in the dugout
welcomes him with a bouncer and it's too short, goes over his head for a wide
opens up to attack and drives on the up on off, but finds mid-off with hardly any room to swing his arms

another near run-out! Tripathi is halfway down the pitch now after flicking the cutter to midwicket, where the fielder dives to his left to stop the ball and quickly tries to throw the stumps down at the keeper's end but he misses and Tripathi returns by then
third dot in a row as Tripathi swings down the ground and finds mid-on this time
an excellent powerplay over from Russell. Stifling line and length around off, Tripathi is desperate for some runs and steers it square but to point
on the pads and Abhishek goes back to defend
fuller and straighter on off, Abhishek drives for a single to cover
the one-sided match-up continues! Gets a low full toss on the stumps and he whacks it straight back, past the bowler, and to just beat the diving long-on fielder
presses forward and opens the face of the bat to help it to point
95.6kmh, quicker on the pads and he helps it behind square on leg for one
105kmh, short, flat and quick around off with the angle. Abhishek is beaten by pace as he tries to cut and gets a bottom edge towards point
88.9kmh, short and turning in, Tripathi waits and pulls it away to deep midwicket for two
turning away from well outside off, still quite short, and Tripathi slaps it down to long-on
to the moon and back! A bit too full, Abhishek uses his reach to lunge forward and smoke it with a big slog-sweep over wide long-on
much straighter, six more! Around the wicket, offbreak around off on length, and Abhishek swings down the ground, over and wide of the sight screen. They're going to look for the ball
99.3kmh, stays back this time for the shorter ball and helps it fine to short fine leg for one
taps the length ball towards short cover and takes off immediately for a quick single, and makes it in time at the other end
right on target on off, he defends it to cover

Southee takes a stunner! That was rocketed back, much quicker than the return catch Umesh got a few overs back and Southee has hung on to it. Length ball, Tripathi absolutely slams it back and Southee, somehow, brings both his hands up to his left shoulder and grabs with both hands
Markram gets a stifling length ball around off and defends it back with respect
more towards middle and leg, and Markram is off the mark by driving it down to long-on
plenty of width outside off and he scythes it away to deep point
stays back and punches down to mid-off for one
short of length outside off and Markram punches it off the back foot to deep cover for two
pushes this back of length ball to mid-off for one more
towards the hips from back of length, and Abhishek helps it back
good placement and he just about beats Venkatesh at deep square for four! Slaps the bouncer into the ground to deep square leg where Venkatesh dives to his left but can't keep it in
full and wide outside off to follow the bouncer and he drives it away to deep cover
anoffcutter on off stump, Markram drives down with hard hands and gets the inside half of the bat to wide long-on
beats him outside off by turning it away, Markram tries to steer square and misses
offbreak now towards the stumps, he goes back and punches to cover
some more sharp turn towards the stumps, Markram wants to cut and sends it back
thick outside edge towards short third man as Markram wants to flick the fuller ball to leg but it turns away and takes the edge
length ball turning in with the angle, he nudges it to deep midwicket for one
hint of width and Markram rocks back for the cut, he middles it too, but can't get more than one to deep point
turning in from length, gets the inside half of the bat to long-on
shorter on the leg side to Abhishek, he slaps it down to long-on
100.2kmh, short of length on fifth stump, punches it to cover
falls short of Russell at long-off! Pitched up, Markram swings down the ground with hard hands and Russell comes forward but it bounces before him
Varun gets the big wicket! Reduces the speed, Abhishek goes for the slog sweep and miscues it completely, it goes high towards square leg where Billings gets under the ball after calling for it
there's a slip in place but Varun sends this one down leg for a wide
96.5kmh, on length on off and he taps it to short cover for one
short of length around off, he goes back to turn it to leg for one
on length around off, he works it down to long-on for one more

straight back to Narine this time for a return catch! Narine is turning it around for himself as the asking rate rises. Short and angling in, Pooran pounces on the short ball and slaps it back, Narine misjudges the trajectory and jumps a bit as the ball crashes towards his groin but he does well to get both hands to it
punches this one to cover for a quick single
93.2kmh, turning into the pads and he works it square for one
floats it outside off at 90.5kmh, Washington scythes and misses
Markram finally gets one in the slot, swings big and wide of long-on, and hits it over long-on, in fact, for six
fuller and wider now, he steers it to a diving point fielder
shorter and straighter, Markram lofts it straight down while he's stifled for room but he has somehow sent that straight down for six!
101.3kmh, turns it away marginally from middle stump, he pushes it straight back
98.8kmh, better ball from Varun to pitch it on length on middle, no room or length to work with and he defends it back
some width now and he cuts it square for one
too short, Markram gets into really good position to get on top of that and whip it over long-on
bangs it in short with three fielders in the deep, and Markram pulls it to deep midwicket for one
short and quick on middle stump, Washington helps it to point for a quick single
chops on! It's an attempted yorker outside off, just short of the yorker length, and Markram opens up to swing wildly to only get an inside edge onto his off stump
short of length on the stumps and he nudges it to leg for one
late away swing for the bouncer which Washington tries to ramp and misses

Varun appeals all alone as Shashank tries to paddle the ball fine from around off, the umpire turns it down and KKR go for the review. Goes down on a knee to paddle, struck right in front of off on the front thigh pad, and ball-tracking says umpire's call for clipping the bails
presses forward and defends the length ball
turning in, he works to leg with a forward press and wants one, but he's sent back
goes back to cover the stumps, helps it to leg and they scamper across for a single this time, Billings appeals for a run-put after deflecting the ball to the stumps but Washington was easily inside
99.5kmh, slightly slower and on the pads, looks to nudge it to leg but misses
turns it the other way this time, this mystery spinner, and it beats Washington's outside edge
pulls the short ball to deep midwicket and Shashank gets two
131.7kmh, makes room and Southee follows him with the angle, he works it down to long-on
angles the short of length ball in, and he turns it to deep midwicket for one

really close shout, Southee is confident as Shashank is struck in front of off, the question is the height. He's been given out but Shashank reviews it. He went across to work the short of length ball to leg, missed, and took it high on the thigh pad, and ball-tracking shows it's going over off stump
stays back for the short ball this time, and he pulls to deep square leg for one
angling in towards the stumps, swings it down to long-on for one

he strikes again, it's Russell's night. Bangs in the slower ball, Washington is through with his pull well before the ball reaches him, one hand comes off the bat when he makes the connection and the ball goes high to the long leg boundary where Venkatesh waits patiently to catch it just before the rope
136.2kmh, nearly in the block hole and Jansen gets one to deep midwicket

Rinku Singh over-runs the ball at deep square and Russel doesn't mind it all, he has a big smile on his face. Shashank pulls the short ball, Rinku sprints to his left from behind square and the ball turns behind him after pitching. Russell is having a laugh!
fuller ball this time and he drives it down to long-on

one more for Russell, a faint outside edge off Jansen's bat! Slower ball cutting away from length, Jansen swings into the leg side and makes a connection he didn't want to, low catch to the right for Billings
low and inswinging full toss, nearly in the block hole, and Bhuvneshwar steers it to point

the two Iyers are coming under the ball, Shreyas takes it easily! Scrambled seam outside off, Shashank swings big, doesn't middle it at all, and it's skied towards mid-off where Shreyas gets under the ball nicely
some width for Umran and he runs it down to third man for one
if Billings had hit, Umran was gone! Bhuvneshwar tapped the ball towards short third man but Billings sprinted to his right and cut it off, had a shy at the stumps but missed
on length outside off, Umran swings big and finds midwicket

Mavi puts down a sitter at the edge of the circle around midwicket as he runs in, he's frustrated as he picks the ball up and fires a throw in at the bowler's end but nobody is backing up. There is a fielder but it beats his dive, goes for overthrows, and then Rinku fumbles in the deep too. It's all happening from KKR
short of length towards the stumps and he defends it back this time
length ball on off, Bhuvneshwar makes room and drills a drive through the covers for four!
backs away again, this time Russell follows him, and the batter defends to leg
133.7kmh, really good ball to stifle him for room. Short of length over off stump, the batter tries to ramp it fine but misses
right in the block hole on the stumps, Bhuvneshwar digs it out to point
bowls a short ball down the leg side for a wide
112.3kmh, slower one towards the stumps and he swings it down to long-on
ends with a dot ball, all of those matter in the end. Umran Malik swings and misses the length ball outside off
outside off, and punched into the covers
a skip to the pitch, nurdled out to the leg side, and Bairstow is off the mark
round the wicket, tapped off the back foot into the off side
on the legs, nudged to the on-side, another single to keep the pot boiling
pinged over long-off! That's some stunning timing, no back-lift, no followthrough, just lofted through the line, high and handsome!
skiddier outside off, a bit of extra kick as Bairstow lines up the cut and avoids a top-edge
tight line to the top of off, Dhawan slides into line to tap to short cover and gets the single despite close attentions from the incoming fielder
a fraction too short, and blatted across the line! Bairstow hangs back in the crease, launches into an urgent pull, and that's hit so hard past the square leg sweeper
attempted pull again, this time the skips through, smacking the thigh and deflecting to gully
vast! Jonny's in the mood tonight! A step down the track, a hard swing around the front pad, nailing the slower ball from outside off, high over cow corner!
fired past the legs, Hazlewood's line errs in response
humungous! A murderous flog across the line once more, picking Hazlewood's length with venom, hard and high over square leg!
fuller length, a touch of outswing, but when you're hot, you're hot! A fat outside edge, fizzes past gully, and that's 22 off the over!
leans back and joins the party! Width outside off, slap-cut through backward point!
up on the toes, tapped down through third man
swivels into another flat pull over square leg! Jonny's gone ballistic! Not desperately short, but uses the pace so well as the ball comes onto bat... and straight off it again!
fuller length, punched through the line, and accepts the single to long-on
back of a length, up on the toes, opens the face, guided down through third man
over-pitched, the surprise full toss earns a rare dot as YJB pats the ball back down the pitch
coshed into the covers, taking the pace off the ball
a round-house slap to the on-side, loses his shape on the pull and scuffs the ball to mid-on
flogged back through the bowler! Hazlewood sticks out a futile left hand but that's travelling hard! Tonked with impunity through the line, trusting the pace onto the bat
short, a sharp bouncer, and Dhawan is not remotely in position for the pull, but just about gets enough bat through the ball to beat square leg
on the back foot, bashed to deep backward square, up comes a very brisk fifty stand, the second fastest this year
big inswinger, that's a good delivery and Bairstow inside-edges onto his boot
launched over long-on! Round the wicket, Dhawan skips to the pitch, gets right underneath the ball with his unfurled levers, and lifts it over the rope!
drags the length back, blocked to cover and a loud "no run!"
skids into the front pad, deflects to the off side

nudged off the legs to deep midwicket, Bairstow steams back for the second, and there's the chance for overthrows as the ball ricochets off the stumps... but I think JYB has run too far past the stumps and they can't add the third. Nearly goes all the way to the rope anyway, but it looks like it's been dragged back well enough
nudged to the on-side, another single

splat! A slow-motion slog-sweep from Dhawan, but the ball never arrives as he topples backwards with the momentum of his bat-swing, and instead nestles juicily between the middle and off stumps. The end of a feisty opening stand

outstanding delivery, full and fast, spears in the yorker as the ball deflects to the boundary... not out is the on-field call, but RCB review. Looked leg-sided, but not necessarily missing leg.... and it's touch and go whether there's a feather of inside edge from the toe of the bat... the umpire is satisfied that the spike aligns, and on we go
wide full toss, pumped to wide long-on with an unleashing of the forearms
back of a length, and panned over long-on! It looked for a moment like he hadn't connected properly, but that's sailed high and long, clearing the rope by plenty!
beamer, and Bairstow wrings his glove! Turns down the single as he wants the free hit. Climbed into a pull but couldn't connect
free hit but it's a well-targeted full length, into the pads, and he can't work the gap
flicked effortlessly off the toes, for a 21-ball fifty! Jonny is seeing it like a comet tonight! And it's his ninth IPL fifty. And it's giving his team a fighting chance!
Mashed over midwicket! Fast, flat, dispatched! This is some preposterous hitting from Bairstow tonight!
back of a length, tapped back down the pitch
pulled out to the leg side to get off the mark
skips to the pitch, doesn't quite get hold of a clip along the ground to mid-on
inside-out drive, but scuffed to backward point! Rajapaksa makes his match-up work this time, not quite to the pitch of the googly, as Harshal swoops round to dent Punjab's momentum
driven into the covers
back and across, into line to feel bat on ball early doors
round the wicket, inside-out drive into the covers
cuffed down the ground to long-on, not quite timed
fired it out wide as Livingstone advanced... and under-edged past the keeper, over the stumps! Lucky!
no messing about this time! Belted hard back down the track, through the line, clean lines
round the wicket, dipping on a full length, eased to long-on
short and wide, but Jonny gets greedy on the cut, and under-edges down into the pitch
full length, onto the front foot, eased out to cover
on the back foot this time, tapped to the on-side as Hasaranga floats up the fuller length
eased back past the bowler
drawn down the track, but can't connect this time, thuds the pad
huge swing across the line, and an unkind dent in Hasaranga's outstanding over! Beaten by the turn back into the bat, a thin inside-edge eludes the leg stump!
flicked to the leg side, just the six off the over. This has put a handbrake on their efforts and no mistake.
big wicket for Shahbaz. Smart bowling. Keeps it wide outside off even as Bairstow leaves the crease. Bairstow looks to go down the ground, but gets a thick edge for a catch at backward point
full, middle and leg, driven down to long-on for one
driven to long-off for one
Agarwal looks for a big shot second ball, but he is not close to the pitch of the ball, Gets an inside edge into the pad
full, middle and off, driven to long-off for another single
short of a length, wide, punched to deep cover for one
on a length, punched down the ground, can't beat the short straight midwicket
a length ball into the pads, worked around the corner for one
turned around the corner but can't go past square leg
another inside edge on another big shot from Agarwal. This one doesn't turn
wrong'un, looks like he has picked it from the surface as he aborts the big swing and opens the face on it for a single
into the pads, tight single to short fine, but a fumble from Harshal makes it easier than it should be
flat six. Down the wicket, not quite to its pitch, but still gets enough on it to clear long-off with ease
short of a length, wide, hit hard and wide of deep cover for two
on a length, outside off, pushed to deep cover for one

Hazlewood misfields at the fine leg boundary. This is a length ball, fired in, Agarwal glances it fine, but the fine leg is square. Hazlewood makes it easily but slides past the ball. Has cost them at least one, likely two
on a length, into the pads, worked away for one
driven to long-off for another single
starts off with a slower ball, chipped to long-on for one
on-pace, short of a length, beats him as he looks to run it down to third man
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep point for one
half-volley, on-pace, outside off, and Livingstone drives it through extra cover into the shorter side. Easy four
slower ball, hits it back at Harshal, who gets a hand on it to deny them a run
slower ball, into the pitch, pushed to long-on for one
Shahbaz gets away with one. Big wide down leg, Livingstone thinks he can get a boundary but ends up toe-ending it to square leg
short of a length, wide, squeezes under his cut and just inside that blue guide line
finally gets his boundary. Reverse-sweeps a wide length ball past short third man into the big boundary
and after that touch shot, he goes down the ground and goes big. Skips down the track and goes well over long-on. Out of the building
goes wide seeing him skip down, but Livingstone catches up with it and punches it to deep cover for one
Agarwal skips down the wicket, Shahbaz pulls the length back and also slows it down, and Agarwal aborts the big shot and takes a single to leg
slower ball, into the pitch, defeats Agarwal's pull
Agarwal's first boundary. Harshal bowls on-pace, short, wide, and Agarwal upper-cuts it into the smaller boundary
and now he beats short third man. Not entirely intended. Slower ball this time, Agarwal does delay his down swing, but also gets a bit of an edge, fine of short third
yorker from wide on the crease, pushed to long-off for one
slower bouncer, Livingstone well into the pull before it arrives, Agarwal calls him through for a leg-bye off the shoulder

Agarwal in two minds. Ends up getting dismissed. Again slower ball, into the pitch, about shoulder high or just under, Agarwal aborts his cut and decides to play a sort of ramp, but the ball hardly arrives, which means it goes straight to point as opposed to third man. Caught
yorker, on off, dug out to long-off for one
on a length, on off, pushed towards deep point for one
sees him shuffle for a ramp, goes with the wide yorker, and Livingstone can get just the single through square leg
short of a length, slight nip in, hits the inner half of the bat as he looks for a single down the ground
over midwicket and into the boundary. On a length, on-pace, straight. Jitesh picks on the smaller side
full and wide, and even though he has the big boundary on the off side, Jitesh has hit this straight of deep cover. Great timing too. Gets four for it
on a length, on off, takes a single to long-off

doesn't pick the wtong'un. Jitesh does the right thing in theory, taking on the threatening bowler, but he has come down the track and has been beaten in the air and then off the pitch too. Bowled middle stump
wrong'un, on leg, worked into the leg side for one
short of a length, punched down the ground for one
beats him with the wrong'un. Brar lucky to not edge it
ends with a wrong'un, which is patted back to him. Mark of the man. Batters playing him out in the 17th over
wide full toss, angles across him, hit down to long-off for one
well that is not very clever. On-pace, in the slot, angling in, and Brar helps himself to a six over long-on

six and out. Stays on pace, but bowls short of a length and wide, Brar looks to go into the off side, but manages only an edge through to the keeper. Everybody knows he is out but Brar waits for the umpire to raise the finger, which he eventually does
on a length, middle and leg, pushed down the ground for one
full and wide, allows him only the single to long-off

costly drop. Costs them six immediately. Just a check drive from Rishi and looks like going straight to long-on where Maxwell ends up parrying it over the bar. He is disgusted with himself. Easy catch by his standards
it doesn't matter if you slide down the leg side with a slower ball. Short of a length, down the leg side, Livingstone helps it along with the pull. Fifty for him
he used the power now after using the pace last ball. Big slog to a length ball, over wide long-on, off the toe end and still goes for a six
slower wide ball, beats him, but called wide
goes wide outside off, slower length ball, and Livingstone crashes it over extra cover for a flat four into the shorter boundary

the mis-hit lets him come back for two. Livingstone is looking to play the pick-up into the leg side, the bottom hand comes off, he ends up shanking it to deep square leg, but that allows him to come back for two
into the 60s goes Hazlewood. Digs this in short, looks like a knuckle ball, and Livingstone pulls it behind square and into the third tier. It is flying all over
most expensive figures this IPL. Short of a length, slower ball, and he runs it down for a single. Hazlewood has gone for 64
starts off with a big wide
another wide? No, it is not called. He has squeezed this just under the bat and just on the blue line. Interesting that Livingstone is not moving across to access that ball

oh he has ramped it straight up. Livingstone moves across looking to ramp him with the angle and over short third but Harshal bowls this closer to him. Livingstone also slightly early into the shot. Ends up going over the keepr but it goes high rather than long
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one
Maxwell missed him last time but catches it clean now. Slower offcutter, on a length, wide, Rishi goes down the ground but has to drag it and gets too far under it. Easy catch for Maxwell at long-on
digs this in short, Rabada early into it, gets a leg-bye
low full toss, hit to long-on, good to see them trying the second that is not on. The throw from long-on goes to the striker's, and catches Chahar short
good length ball on off, shuffles across to flick through midwicket for one.
darted full into the legs at 81 kph, misses the flick and dribbles off the pads to the keeper.
short on sixth stump, goes back to power a back foot punch through cover to the rope.
back of a length outside off, slapped away again for one.
Kohli uses his feet, Harpreet drags the length back on fifth stump and Kohli checks defensively to mid-on.
flighted full down the leg side, late on a sweep and wide called.
arm ball darted in full on fifth stump, defended to the off side.
good length inswinger at 125 kph on off stump, goes back to punch and inside edge into the pads before dribbling into cover for one.
back of a length outside leg stump at 134 kph, Kohli premeditated a charge backing away from leg and misses a wild heave.
Is Kohli showing signs of getting back into form?! Arshdeep darts this on a length moving away from sixth stump at 129 kph, Kohli punches this on the up through extra cover to the rope.
full on middle at 138 kph, defended to midwicket.
full inswinger on off stump at 140 kph, Kohli powers this with a wristy flick through midwicket to the rope again.
full and swinging down leg side, Kohli late on a flick and wide called.
fullish length on the legs, flicked behind square where the boundary rider Nathan Ellis on as a sub fielder for Liam Livingstone slides to his right to keep it to two.
short angled into leg stump, Faf backs away and powers a pull past mid-on to the rope.
spears in a quicker ball following Faf again backing away from leg, Faf plays over the top of this with a swipe and it skids just past leg stump, off the keeper's gloves behind square for a bye.
full on middle and leg, flicked straight to midwicket.
yummy! Vintage! Kohli uses his feet to dance down the track to meet this full ball on the legs before flicking this elegantly high and wide over the long-on rope.
full on fifth stump, pushes this into the covers but is turned back by Faf.
full on middle, flicked gently to the deep midwicket fielder for one.
full on middle at 140 kph, big heave and an inside edge goes to deep backward square for two.

back of a length ball into Kohli's hips, late on a pull and the ball balloons off the body to short fine leg. Didn't look like it hit bat at all but the ricochet was so significant to carry to fine leg. He's been given not out on field. Punjab calls for DRS immediately. Ultraedge is showing a spike as the ball passes his gloves though. The decision will be overturned and Kohli's stay at the crease flames out like a supernova.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended to cover.
back of a length ball defended.
bouncer clears off stump with Patidar ducking under.
full and wide tailing down leg.
back of a length on fifth stump at 134 kph, defended high off the shoulder of the bat into the off side.
back of a length on off, defended.

length ball on fifth stump, Faf charges with a big swish and a massive appeal for caught behind is denied. Keeper is adamant about going for DRS and the captain agrees. Ultraedge is going to be two for two helping to overturn consecutive reviews in favor of Punjab Kings.
full on off, defended back to the bowler.
fullish length on sixth stump, drives this high and deep over long-off.

Dhawan to Dhawan, tag-team for a wicket at midwicket! Length ball on leg stump, charge from Lomror who clobbers a pull straight out of the middle of the bat but picks out Shikhar on the ring at waist height. The Kabbadi thigh slap comes out in celebration.
back of a length on sixth stump, punched gently off the back foot behind point for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, tap and run into the off side.
back of a length on off stump, tap and run behind the stumps for a sharp single.
aims for yorker on off stump, sends down a low full toss that is shoveled low to extra cover and knocked down.
full on middle, jammed out to mid-on for one.
slower ball at 120 kph lands back of a length on middle, defended back to Rabada.
bouncer over middle, ducked under.
back of a length on fifth stump, punched through point for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, flicked through the leg side and cut off by the midwicket boundary rider.
overpitched on fifth stump, driven firmly to long-off for one.
fullish length on fifth stump, flicked through the leg side for one.
fullish length slower ball into the legs at 111 kph, flicked loosely over midwicket for one.

fullish length on fourth stump, thumps a drive through extra cover, Mayank at wide long-off slides along the foam triangle trying to keep this in play and does so through an acrobatic effort to save one run.
good length ball skids on to middle, Maxwell hustled playing back punching to cover.
Maxwell breaks out the reverse sweep second ball to Chahar, connects on this legbreak on a good length and hits with the spin over short third man to the rope.
full on middle and off, driven to wide long-off for one.
full on middle, too full and heaved high and deep over wide midwicket.
back of a length on middle, goes back to flick through wide midwicket for one.
