Maxwell with another reverse/switch this time creamed flat over cover turned midwicket for six! He got into position early to a full ball on off stump, smashes this much flatter thanks to the fuller length and it careens just wide of the cover sweeper.
full on middle and leg, goes for a big heave and misses off the pads.
full on fourth stump, another big heave this time connects flat to Rishi Dhawan, fielded on one bounce.
arm ball skids on flat on off stump on a good length, goes back to cut and sends this to the sweeper for one.
overpitched again, and slams this almost off the facade of the upper deck! Full on the stumps, hammered high and deep over long-on clanging off the ad boards in from of the upper deck.
back of a length on sixth stump, goes back to punch this through extra cover beating wide long-off to the rope.
full and wide outside the guideline, left alone and wide called.
good length ball outside off, goes to chop this behind point but can't pick the gap.
short and wide, slaps a cut to the sweeper for one.
back of a length on sixth stump at 126 kph, slaps a cross bat shot to long-on for one.
slower bouncer on leg stump, pulled firmly to deep square leg where Rabada tumbles to his right to stop it.
slower ball on a good length on sixth stump, Maxwell keeps the hands back waiting for this 104 kph delivery and slices a cut delicately picking the gap behind point to the rope.
slower ball on a good length on off, goes back to punch to wide long-on for one.
another slower ball full on fifth stump, tapped gently into the vacant leg side ring and they pinch a sharp two.
full and wide, Maxwell goes inside out with a drive over extra cover and beats the sweeper.
full and wide, goes to sweep orthodox and bottom edges this past the keeper to deep fine leg for two.
good length ball hugs the wide guideline, left alone and deemed a wide. Hmmm... Looked kosher to me.
full and wide, goes to reverse/switch hit with a sweep again and misses.
good length ball on fifth stump, rocks back to pull to deep midwicket for one.

full on eighth stump, goes for a slog sweep and misses, beaten by the turn, wide called. Another very very harsh call on Chahar. Looked live and on replay like it passed well within the guideline and Patidar just swung through it.
redemption! A good length ball just inside the wide guideline, left alone and deemed legal.

good length ball again hugging the wide guideline, Patidar tries to drag this over wide long-on instead of playing with the turn into the off side and winds up clipping this closer to the toe of the bat floating tamely to Shikhar Dhawan, who takes a chest height catch 10 yards inside the rope.
flighted full on the pads, Maxwell goes for a hammer sweep standing upright and misses.

full on off, backs away from leg stump trying to carve this over Arshdeep at long-off but picks him out perfectly at waist height five yards inside the rope. Arshdeep emulates Shikhar Dhawan's Kabbadi thigh slap celebration, and the domino effect extends to Harpreet, who follows in kind with it as well.
good length ball on sixth stump, goes back to defend and pushes back to Brar.
back of a length on the wide guideline, Shahbaz reaches out to cut this to the point sweeper for one. Would've been a wide had he left it alone.
good length ball on middle, taps this gently into the leg side for one.
short and wide, slices this to backward point and can't pick the gap.
full and wide, goes to sweep and misses.
back of a length on off, goes back to punch to long-on for one.
full toss at knee height on middle, thumps a straight bat drive straight to midwicket in the ring.
good length ball zipped in quicker at 90 kph on the legs, flicks straight to short fine leg.
googly flighted full on fourth stump, goes to drive through mid-off and slices this high to the cover sweeper for one.
back of a length on off, goes back to flick through midwicket for one.
slower ball at 105 kph lands short on fifth stump, pulled flat along the turf to deep midwicket for one.
full on fourth stump, driven to long-off for one.
slower ball yorker attempted landing full on middle at 98 kph, DK shuffles across to get outside the line of the stumps and sweeps this over fine leg to the rope.
slower ball lands on a good length on off, tap and run into the off side.
wide yorker on eighth stump, jammed out to backward point, diving stop by Rabada on the ring saves three runs.
back of a length on off stump, prodded in front of cover for one.
good length ball on fifth stump, prodded into the off side to the cover sweeper for one.
bouncer at 128 kph follows Shahbaz backing away from leg stump, clears his pull shot.
fullish length on off at 135 kph aiming for yorker, smashes this to long-on for one.
slower ball lands sort into the body, mistimes the pull off a bottom edge into his pads.
wide yorker at 137 kph, tries to slice this out behind point but winds up squeezing this flat to short third man on the ring. Taken crouching at thigh height falling left by Rajapaksa.
yorker on off stump at 136 kph, jammed out to extra cover.
short ball on the body, goes to pull and misses off the body before dribbling away.
slower ball lands short on seventh stump at 119 kph, goes to cut and a thick edge goes wide of the keeper cut off at deep third man for two.
slower ball lands short on middle, miscues a pull that flutters back over the bowler well short of long-on for two.

slower ball lands on a good length on fifth stump at 115 kph, goes to cut and it floats gently to the man on the ring at backward point. He waits for it to arrive and takes a simple catch at rib height.
wide yorker on fifth stump, jammed out to backward point.
slower bouncer clears Wanindu ducking it and the keeper fumbles to allow a second run after the leg side umpire calls a wide.
length delivery on fifth stump, Harshal throws that bat at this and slices a thick edge wide of the keeper to the third man rope.
short and wide, slaps this through the off side to the sweeper for one.
full and wide, slices a drive aiming for extra cover but comes off a thick outside edge and backspins behind point wide of the sweeper to the rope.
good length ball hugging the wide guideline, umpire has shown no mercy on the wide line to Chahar today.
full on fifth stump, driven to long-on for one.

full on fourth stump, goes for the big slog sweep and picks out Harpreet on the deep midwicket rope. He plucks this reaching high above his head after leaping in the air. He's falling over the rope and flicks this up before stepping over, then collects it upon reentering. Third umpire is checking if this is all kosher. It looks to be. A decade ago everyone would have lost their minds seeing this kind of effort, but this is standard fare now.
full on seventh stump, prods at this and is beaten.
back of a length on fourth stump, goes back to defend.
yorker full on off, jammed out in front of point for one.
full and wide, slices this out behind point for one.
back of a length on fifth stump at 134 kph, goes back to punch this behind point for one again.
short and wide, slices a cut behind point for one.
yorker on middle, jammed out into the off side.
short ball on middle, goes back to cut and misses.
full length ball on middle, goes to drive and skies this over the ring. Mayank tracks this swirler over extra cover, runs backward and takes a superb over the shoulder effort.
short and wide, slices this high over point for one to the sweeper.
length ball sails over the stumps beating an attempt to play this backing away.
fullish length on off stump, backs away to heave and a thick edge goes to the rope.
fullish length ball outside off, shuffles way across to scoop and misses.
slower ball on a length on sixth stump, misses flailing at this.
yorker on middle, jammed out back to long-off for one.
full on off stump, slices this inside out to the cover sweeper Brar for one.
slower ball lands full on off, goes to heave and connects over midwicket to the rope.
Full on off, clipped to the right of mid-on

Given LBW and the decision stays as there is no review! Ruturaj has a chat with the umpires but Conway has to leave. It looked to be going down leg. The full ball from Sams beat the flick and hit the pad, to Conway's surprise it was given out. It hit him just below the knee-roll, but looked to go down leg.
Good length on fourth stump, defended to point
Back of a good length ball pitches outside off and swings away outside the tramline

Soft dismissal as Moeen was in two minds on how to play the short ball! The short ball came in with the angle around throat-height and Moeen's hands went for the pull and then retracted but in the meantime, the ball took the edge and lobbed to short-midwicket. Dream start for MI!
Length ball misses the line down leg
Fuller but misses the line down leg again, it swung and Uthappa could not reach with the flick. Another wide
Good length on leg stump, Uthappa shuffles across and directs it in front from his left
Stays back to a good length ball and defends it to point with soft hands.
Length ball pitches on fourth stump and shapes away, Uthappa played inside the line and opened the bat-face to direct it to cover, beaten
Another beauty, this time on a good length and on a similar line. Uthappa tried playing straight and missed
Pitched up outside off, it looked to have left him again. Beaten on the cover drive

Given LBW, DRS is still not available, Uthappa has to go! But this looked adjacent. It was a good length ball that that pitched around middle and beat the flick across the line and hit the pad in front of off. Uthappa looked to see if he could review but that was sadly not on
Good length ball comes in with the angle on middle and leg, blocked in front
Length ball pitches outside off and shapes in sharply. Goes through the channel and is left alone
Good length on off, clipped to deep-fine leg
Lets go a short ball outside off by swaying away
Back of a good length on fourth stump, opens the bat-face and channels it to point
Clips a full ball on middle and leg to square-leg
Around a back of good length, angles away outside off and is left alone
Full on the stumps, pushed to the bowler
Good length ball on fourth stump is driven in front of the eyes through cover with minimal follow-through and perfect timing
Ducks down a short ball outside off to let it go
Rides the bounce on a back of length ball under the armpit, clipped to the gap at square-leg
Rayudu channels his inner Steve Smith and glides a length ball outside off, goes to the left of short-third on its way to the fence
Length ball beats the pull and goes to the keeper. Not given wide, may have hit the thigh-pad
Pulled fine, stopped by Meredith at long-leg with a sprint and a dive to his left, and is assisted by Tim David to keep it to two. It was a short ball around shoulder height

Strangled down leg! It was an innocuous length ball down leg, Ruturaj reached for the flick and the ball took the edge and Kishan took an easy catch. The feet stayed still and the ball took the inside edge on the bezel of the sticker
Back of length down leg, MS thinks of the flick but chooses later to let it go
Around a good length outside off, defended to cover
Length outside off, left alone
Goes for the yorker, it misses by a few inches and MS clips it from middle to midwicket, stopped in the outfield
Full ball down leg, retracts from the flick. Wide
Sams looks for swing but overpitches outside off, MS leans into the cover drive. Pushes through the line of the ball and gets it to the gap at the left of cover-point for four
Stays in his crease and pushes a full ball on off behind the bowler, stopped at mid-on
Yorker outside off, looked like there was some swing. Rayudu stayed back and waited for it to come under his eyeline and blocked it in front
Reaches out and cuts to cover-point. The fielder is in, the shot had minimal timing, the ball was on a length outside off and swung away a bit again
Creams a backfoot square drive! It was on a back of good length, Rayudu watched it come on and went through with the shot. It came off the middle

Rayudu's been given out caught-behind and he is walking! The back of length ball has cut him in half, he tried to defend it with the full face off the backfoot and it took the inside edge. Rayudu was setting up for the short ball by standing deep in his crease and was squared up.
Full on leg, swings in and Dube clips it to the gap at midwicket, stopped in the outfield
Short ball unsettles Dube but he manages to drop the ball just under the shoulder to the empty short leg area awkwardly but also safely
Goes after the full ball outside off, the aerial drive was over the left of cover, who leapt but could not stop it. Stopped by long-off with a run to his right and a good dive
Full outside off, defended towards cover-point
Full outside off, defended away from the body but off the middle towards cover
Clips a full ball outside off to long-on off the inside half of the bat
Good length on middle, it came in and MS took a big lunge forward and defended it in front
Length ball comes in to leg, it was slow and beat the attempted flick, it hit the pad and fell in front. MS raised his bat when it was close to the bat to ensure there were no deflections
Chops a shortish ball outside off to cover, Dube rode the bounce well there
Pulled hard and effectively, Dube was probably expecting the short ball. It came in on the chest and he pulled with a swivel and it went aerially and in the gap to the right of deep-square

Edged and taken! Dube stood still and tried to ramp it but all he could do is edge the short ball over middle and off. A good catch by Kishan as he leaps up to reach for it and take it. MI fielders celebrate in joy.

Ripping bouncer takes Kishan's finger and goes for four! It was a bouncer down leg, Bravo shuffled a bit and let it go. The ball swung late to Kishan's right, it took the top of his right middle finger on its way to the fence
Beaten comprehensively! Around a good length outside off, swings away. Bravo tries the defence to cover and it goes a few inches away
Bit fuller on a similar line, Bravo tries to play straight while staying within the line. Beaten again
Opens the face and manages to get bat on a length ball outside off. Goes to the gap at point
Length on the stumps, flicked to the bowler
Length outside off, pushed to deep cover
LBW appeal turned down. MS looked to play the full ball straight, it looked to have pitched on leg and beat the inside edge
Comes down and tries to nudge it, it looks to have beaten him and lobbed and fell in front of cover who was running in
Comes down the track and whacks a full ball on the stumps through wide-long on
Flatter ball just outside off is cut late and it's to the right of point and races through the gap behind him
Full on middle and leg, Bravo tried to flick it. It looked to have missed the bat, went to the pad and lobbed to the right of the bowler for one
Comes down the track and whips it over square-leg! It was on a length on the stumps, turned into a full ball. The hands were quick as ever, and the power immense. It sailed over the fence
Full on leg stump, MS clips it fine to deep-fine leg, where it is stopped
Comes down and clips a full ball on leg to square leg
MS tries to jam the full ball down leg, he tried what I can only refer to as a reverse drive like Sachin once did. Kishan covered the line well and got his pad in front of the ball
Full outside off, defended to the left of the bowler
Backfoot punch meets a length ball on off to take the ball to deep-point along the ground
Tries the hard reverse drive type shot again, it hit the pad and went to short-fine
Uppish but safe! It was on a good length outside off, the ball dipped and he had to check the off-drive. It went to the right of the bowler on its way to long-off
Dhoni tries to chop the back of good length ball outside off and is beaten
Around a length outside off, cut to deep-point
Bravo edges the full ball while trying to whack it over long off, it goes up but falls safely well in front of deep-cover
Dhoni pushes for the second and gets it, that came after he leant into a full ball outside off and square drove it to the  right of deep-point where it was stopped
Good length outside off, it was at least two inches away from the outside edge after Bravo went for the booming cover drive
Length ball on a back of length beats the flick and hits the thigh pad. Falls in front
Bravo jumps and rides the bounce on a shortish ball outside off, manages to push it to point
Short length outside off, does not bounce much. Bravo pushes it to point off the bottom of his bat
Goes back and jumps to clip a back of length ball on middle and leg to midwicket
MS ducks below a short ball over fourth stump
Clears long-on by a mile! Bravo came down the ground and got to the pitch of the full ball just outside off and went through with the lofted on-drive.

Bullet towards cover sticks to Tilak's hand! A low full toss around off had Bravo come down the ground and try and drive it with all his might. It was hard, aerial and flat, Tilak puts his hands up which was brave by itself and the ball went in the hands. Kartikeya closes his mouth as a reaction to being impressed almost in disbelief
Around a good length outside off, gets across and defends it to the offiside
Around a good length on the stumps, clipped to deep-backward square

Given LBW, CSK review. It looked to have pitched on leg and beat the full-faced defence and hit the front pad just below the knee-roll. Nothing on Ultra-Edge. It's actually pitching on middle, the impact is in line and it's hitting the top of middle. Three reds and he's a goner.
Solidly blocks a full ball on off to the left of the bowler
Around a length on fourth stump, punched to deep cover
Nasty bouncer has Maheesh with his hands coming down in reflex, it took the handle and popped up to the legside. He opened the bat-face to a back of length ball over off with his eyes off the ball
Taken at cover! Around a good length outside off, Maheesh reaches out and tries to drive it with a horizontal bat. It took the edge, a hand came off the bat, and and the ball floated to the fielder
Another short ball, this was outside off so Choudhary could let it go without much movement
Solidly blocks a full ball on leg to the bowler

Edged and it goes to the left of the diving keeper on the way to the boundary. It was a good length ball just outside off, Mukesh tried to push it to cover and got the outside edge but it ended well for him
Cuts to deep point, rejects the run. On a length at fourth stump and the ball went straight to the fielder, so two was not on
Off cutter on a back of good length outside off stays low and beats the chop
Another slower one, this on a length on fourth stump. MS went across and tried the pull but it went below and he tried to reach it by bending but got into an awkward shape and couldn't
Length, wide outside the offside tramline. Left alone
Back of length over fourth stump, the back leg comes off for the cut to cover in the deep. No run taken
Swats the back of length ball on middle to deep-backward square. The bounce is low again, Dhoni was prepared for it and used a slouch for reach
No, the full ball on the stumps is clipped to mid on.
Pulls fine and beats deep-fine leg to his left. It was on a back of length just below the waist, MS helped it on its way and the ball screeched off the turf
Back of length again, this around off. Pushed to point with a horizontal bat
Back of length on fourth, defended to the left of the bowler off the backfoot again

Heaved over square leg for six! The slower one into the pitch sat up over off and MS waited and nonchalantly pulled it in the air. Didn't look like it was off the middle but turned out to be a 77-metre six
Into the pitch outside off, cut to point

Is that a run out? This was odd, MS ducked under a short ball and scampered for the run. It looked premeditated, Choudhary ran in but was well short. Kishan's direct hit was on point and fast. He did it with the gloves on. MS shook his head, MI fielders celebrated

full on the legs, no shot played to a ball that hits the pads going down the leg side. He went to leave it wanting a wide called. They don't take a run because dead ball would have been called. Dhoni goes for DRS but there's no way this was ever hitting the stumps and may have pitched outside leg stump too. Indeed ball-tracking shows the ball pitched outside leg stump. Review burned on the first ball by Dhoni.
full on fifth stump at 130 kph, half-volley punched through extra cover past the diving ring fielder to the rope.
full and wide on sixth stump at 136 kph, driven square through point for two.
fullish length on seventh stump at 139 kph, gets Kishan chasing at this without much footwork and is beaten by the away swing.

Kishan didn't learn his lesson from the previous ball. Fullish length ball again swinging away from seventh stump, Kishan with another wild poke well away from his body and a thin edge goes through to Dhoni at waist height.

good length ball on the legs, swings into the pads and Sams is late on a flick, big appeal for lbw from the bowler given not out. Dhoni learned his lesson from the first ball. Pitched well outside leg stump so no review called for.
good length ball on off stump, defended to point.
back of a length on sixth stump, extra bounce on this 140 kph delivery takes it past a back foot prod.
full on fourth stump at 137 kph, driven firmly but straight to mid-off on the ring.
fullish length on fifth stump, this time Rohit punches this on the up over the ring to the mid-off rope.
back of a length on the stumps, goes back to flick through midwicket for one.
short ball on fifth stump climbs up to give Sams something to sniff at 138 kph before it goes through to Dhoni.

fullish length ball swings into Rohit on middle and leg, huge appeal denied. Could be worth a review but now that CSK only has one left after burning one on the first ball so they hold it in the bag. Replays show the ball was pitching just outside leg stump.
Rohit backs away from legs stump now to a full ball on middle and clatters this flat over mid-off to the rope.
full and swinging into middle, defended with a firm front foot block.
fullish length swinging in to fourth stump, just a firm punch to this 139 kph delivery, no follow-through at all but timed swiftly to go to the mid-off rope.
good length ball on off, defended.
full and wide swinging away from the wide guideline, wide called.
back of a length on the stumps, flicked into the leg side for one.
overpitched full on off, another simple punch with no flourish that flies past the bowler to the mid-off rope.
length ball on fourth stump at 135 kph, Rohit prods at this down the wrong line and is beaten.
bouncer over fifth stump sails over Dhoni and the slips cordon to the rope for extras.

Simarjeet replicates the ball at 3.2 and this time gets Rohit nibbling an edge! Good length in the fifth stump channel, Rohit pokes defensively away from his body and a healthy deflection carries through to Dhoni tumbling to his knees moving right.
good length ball on off, tap and run to mid-off for a sharp single.
back of a length on sixth stump at 133 kph, slaps at this and connects behind point to deep third man for one.
good length ball angled across fifth stump and left alone.
back of a length outside leg tailing past the hips, wide called.
fullish length on fifth stump swings in at 128 kph, goes to heave over midwicket and is cut in half.
thigh high full toss on fifth stump, tapped defensively to mid-off. Should've gone for six but indicates quite clearly the shell Sams is currently hiding in.

that was always on the cards, especially after Sams missed the juicy full toss on the previous ball. Looked nervy throughout his innings and is beaten by a full inswinger trapped in front of middle below the knee roll. Big appeal and finger goes up immediately. Sams waits 10 seconds before going for DRS but this is a hopeless review. Ball-tracking shows three red lights ripping out middle stump three-quarters of the way up.
Choudhary goes for yorker and winds up sending down a shin high full toss on sixth stump, tries to drive through cover but the inswing produces an inside edge past the stumps to leg slip on a bounce.

almost a carbon copy sequence to how Sams fell! Stubbs misses a juicy full toss on the previous ball that should've gone to the boundary and next ball is beaten by a back of a length delivery at 135 kph that traps him playing across the line on the back foot. He's nailed on the knee roll deep in the crease in front of middle. Huge appeal upheld immediately. Unlike Sams, Stubbs storms straight off without reviewing.
Hrithik walks down the track first ball to a 139 kph inswinger on a good length and is hit on the hip, ricochet goes to the leg side for an extra.
fullish length in the fourth stump channel at 133 kph moves away a fraction to beat a front foot prod.
back of a length on sixth stump at 138 kph, left alone.

fullish length ball tailing down the pads, flicks something and a big appeal goes up for caught behind. The umpire looks confused, spread his arm initially as if to signal wide... and then raises the right arm all the way vertical to give it out! DRS called for immediately by Shokeen. Replays show a clear gap between bat and ball as it passes with the sound produced by the thigh guard. Decision overturned.
good length ball on the stumps, tapped away through the ring for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended to the off side.
back of a length on middle, flicked into midwicket for a sharp single.
back of a length swinging away from seventh stump at 132 kph, left alone.
fullish length swinging away on fourth stump, pokes at this and an inside edge goes through the legs past leg stump to the fine leg rope.
full and swinging down leg, wide called.
full on the stumps, pokes at this and it flies square off the edge for one.
full on fourth stump, Shokeen walks down the track to negate the inswing and blocks this to mid-off.
inswinging yorker on middle at 136 kph, jammed out to mid-on.
back of a length angled across fifth stump at 134 kph, left alone.
full on off, defended.
bouncer over middle at 137 kph, ducked under by Tilak.
back of a length on the hips at 134 kph, flicked to the fine leg rope.
back of a length on off at 138 kph, defended into the covers.
back of a length on off at 138 kph, goes back to defend to cover.
full on fifth stump at 136 kph, defended on the front foot to cover.
back of a length on fifth stump, prods at this and it goes off the edge to ground wide of Moeen Ali at slip to the third man rope.
short and wide outside off, taps a cut gently for placement behind point softly enough to get two before the sweeper can collect.
full on fifth stump at 128 kph, defended to cover.
full on sixth stump, driven through cover to the sweeper for one.
good length ball on fifth stump, gentle tap and run behind point for one.
full on off stump at 133 kph, shuffles across to flick this behind square for one.
good length ball on fifth stump, defended to point.
full on fourth stump, flicked to long-on for one.
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on for one.

sloppy red matador cape effort from Uthappa at cover sweeper turns a single into a boundary! full on the wide guideline, driven in the air to the cover sweeper Uthappa who does an Ole with his cape to let the ball go straight past him to the rope.
full and wide, driven through the off side for one.
edge! Full on fifth stump, goes to drive, the ball turns to produce the edge but it flies well wide of slip to the third man rope.
full and wide on seventh stump, driven square through point for two.
short ball on fifth stump at 125 kph, tapped down off his toes to backward point.
full on middle at 133 kph, flicked to deep fine leg for one.
full outside leg, flicked square for two before it is cut off at deep square leg.
full and angled down leg at 130 kph for a wide.
fullish length on middle, defended on the front foot back to Bravo.
full on off at 130 kph, driven firmly to long-on for one.
back of a length on off, defended to point.
back of a length on fifth stump, left alone.
full on fifth stump, goes for the reverse sweep and sends this sailing over slip to the third man rope.
full on fifth stump, this time prods this wide of the cover sweeper for an easy two. The relay eludes Theekshana at the bowler's end but the backup is good enough to prevent an overthrow for a third.
arm ball skids on a good length toward off stump, punched to mid-on.
full on fifth stump, smothered on the front foot.
full and speared into the pads, inside edges a flick into the legs.
good length ball on middle, goes back to flick into midwicket for one.
full on fifth stump, goes to sweep and misses but is struck outside the line of off stump so Moeen's appeal is stifled.

rash charge and big turn beats a heave to knock back the stumps! Shokeen couldn't contain his aggression any longer, tries to mash the first six of the chase and misses everything dancing down the wicket. The ball spins in sharply from a good length on seventh stump to smash into middle and leg.
fullish length on fifth stump spinning in, David with a loose flick that sails over vacant midwicket in the ring for one.
full and wide outside off, driven along the turf to long-off for one.
back of length on leg spins sharply past off, goes back and flicks through midwicket for one.
good length ball skids on straight from sixth stump, goes back to punch through cover for one.
good length ball on seventh stump turns away sharply as a tentative cut shot flies off a top edge over gully for two.
back of a length on fifth stump, punched to long-off for one.
fullish length ball on sixth stump skids on flat again, beats a back foot punch.
another quicker skiddy delivery on fifth stump on a good length, goes back to punch to the cover sweeper.
The first six of the chase! Overpitched on sixth stump, David frees the arms to wallop this high and mighty over wide long-on onto the tarp-covered lower-level stands.
back of a length on fifth stump, spins in and goes back to punch to long-on for one.
back of a length on sixth stump, defended to the off side.
uses his feet to a full ball on fifth stump, driven to long-off for one.

half-tracker laced into the front row of the second-tier! David hits two sixes in his last three balls to bring an abrupt finish to what at one time was a nervy chase. Too short on middle from Moeen, David shuffles across and whacks this over midwicket and then some.
skids down the pitch so Sakariya drags his length back. Nudged into the leg side via the glove, surprised by the extra bounce
inswinger, plenty of movement but down the leg side. 131kph
back of a length, wide outside off stump at 131kph. Punched calmly out to deep point
back of a length outside off, chopped out to deep backward point. 129kph

Sakariya is celebrating but Pant isn't sure and decides against the review. Fullish length, holding its line and angling across Buttler. Replays confirm it only brushed the back pad on the way through, rather than the edge of Buttler's bat
fullish on off stump at 129kph, pushed to mid-off
back of a length, angling across him, steered to point with an open face

low full toss outside off stump at 143kph, Buttler squeezes it away through point. Enough width for Buttler to free his arms a touch, and it skews away off the toe end, just in front of backward point
short, wide, and slapped away to deep third. 144kph
back of a length, extra bounce takes Jaiswal by surprise. 143kph, and he tries to pull out of his attempted cut shot as the ball flies over the top edge
fullish, angled across him, driven to mid-off. 147kph
back of a length, Jaiswal looks to work him through the leg side but can only steer it back to the bowler. 147kph
a fraction full of a length, pitching outside leg stump and angling across him. Squeezed out to point
back of a length, angled across him. Worked back to the bowler via the inside edge
a touch fuller, swinging in at 128kph. Buttler can't time it, punching straight to mid-off
full, angled across him. Pushed back down the pitch, towards mid-on
swinging away sharply, Buttler can only steer a length ball to point with an open face
full, fired down the leg side at 126kph as Buttler shimmies down

pressure bursts pipe! Buttler chips straight to mid-on who hardly has to move an inch. Fullish, pretty much a half-volley on leg stump. He looks to swing it over the infield but his timing is awry and he picks out Shardul. Big early wicket for Delhi!
just full of a length, swinging in. Ashwin shuffles across and nudges it into the leg side
beautiful off-drive. On a length, 148kph, and Jaiswal unfurls a gorgeous drive. High front elbow, straight enough to beat the mid-off fielder inside the ring to his left
fullish length, punched elegantly again but this time straight to mid-off
back of a length, chopped to Powell at point on the bounce
on a good length, hits Ashwin on the pad as he looks to work into the leg side
back of a length, 142kph, steered down to deep third with an open face

slashed over deep third, into the dugouts for six! This is the flipside of Nortje's pace. Extra bounce, Jaiswal rocks back and slaps him away, behind square on the off side. Deep third was interested on the rope, but it flies away for six
full, wide, swinging away. Ashwin leans into the cover drive but it's straight to extra cover

chipped over the leg side. This is why RR have sent Ashwin in at No. 3. He might not have the power to clear the ropes at the death but his boundary is the 30-yard circle at this stage. Fullish, straight, and he whips him over short midwicket for four
fullish length, Ashwin chips it aerially with no timing... but it falls short of mid-off
wide on the crease, full and swinging away, creamed through the covers by Ashwin. Top of the bounce, slashed away through the infield
on a length, swinging away, wide outside off stump. Cut straight to Powell at deep point
banged in short, pitching outside leg stump, and it loops harmlessly over Jaiswal... who is understandably confused as to why this isn't given as a wide
fired down the leg side... not given as a wide again! Looks like there was a tiny inside edge on replay, which Pant spilled... harsh to call it a drop, but explains the lack of wide
dragged down again, Ashwin can't tickle it past short fine leg
flat, fired in, but short and wide enough for Ashwin to throw his hands, cutting it through the ring for four

skips down the pitch and launches him over wide long-on! Ashwin is determined to make best use of the fielding restrictions but hits this 86 metres, which would clear any deep fielder... shimmies down, clean connection
fired in towards the hip on a length, tucked into the leg side for one
angled across the left-hander from around the wicket, and Jaiswal can't make contact on the drive
slower ball on a length, tucked out to long leg
angled across him on a length, flies down to deep third via a thick outside edge
plinks the pull into no-man's-land. Banged in back of a length by Marsh, and Ashwin looks to go big over the leg side. It hits high on the bat, and lands 15 yards short of the boundary-riders
worked down to wide long-on, Jaiswal still finding his rhythm here
tight to the stumps on release, but the delivery is a fraction wider outside off stump. Chopped out to deep point
slower ball, on a length. Jaiswal hangs back and steers a dab to short third for a scampered single
sharply-spun legbreak, away from the left-hander. Whipped out to deep midwicket
tossed up at 82kph, clipped out to midwicket
fullish, less turn this time. Jaiswal stays leg-side of it and punches down to long-off
skips down, and Kuldeep sees him coming. Fires it through, full and wide outside off stump, and he just about manages to jam his bat down to work it down to long-on
flat and wide outside off stump, slapped out to deep cover
gets down on one knee looking to slog-sweep over the leg side, but can only bottom-edge to short fine. Jaiswal sets off but is sent back and scrambles to make his ground

steps outside leg stump, looking to give himself the best chance to flay Marsh away over the shorter off-side boundary. But Marsh spots his early trigger, and digs in a short offcutter, down the leg side. Jaiswal has no room, and miscues his pull straight to Lalit Yadav at deep midwicket. Clever from Marsh, and DC have their second
full outside off, square-driven away through the off side and picks up four. Freebie from Marsh, half-volley and wide enough for him to free his arms. Hint of outside edge.
offcutter on a length, fenced out to deep cover point
back of a length, shuffles across and works down to long leg

banged in short, down the leg side, but Padikkal stays still and pulls him away very fine. Possibly via the gloves, or the bottom edge as he was cramped for room, but that meant it went fine of fine leg
tight to the stumps on release, slower ball on a length, and he can't generate any pace to get it past mid-off
googly, Ashwin shuffles back and across and whips him out to midwicket for a single
tossed up, dips and drifts in towards DDP's pads. He nudges it back to Kuldeep's left hand in his follow through
full, relatively flat and a little quicker at 92kph. No real turn. Chopped out to point
full outside off stump, yorker length. 82kph. Ashwin digs it out wristily, out to deep cover for another single
fullish, slapped out to deep point for one more

shimmies down and is struck on the pad. Strangled appeal from Kuldeep but Pant doesn't look too interested in the idea of a review. Looked to have pitched outside leg stump. EDIT: Replay confirms it pitched in-line, but umpire's call on impact and stumps.
cramps him for room on a length, can't get it through the infield
tickled down to long leg for one
wide on the crease on release, full and angling in. Punched out to deep cover and they scamper back for two
back of a length, shapes to pull but can't get any meaningful bat on it. Looks like it might have got him on the grille, in fact
on a length outside off stump, swings and misses. Looking to play him through the off side but can't lay bat on ball

thumps it back at Shardul who can't cling on. Yorker length, Ashwin shimmies down and finally gets some decent bat on it. Shardul sticks out a hopeful hand and it thumps into it, deflecting down to long-on
full toss, Ashwin skips down but cloths it down to long-on
tossed up, full outside off. Slapped hard out to wide long-off where Rovman does well to keep them to one
full and straight, Ashwin skips down and drags it out to deep midwicket. Still no boundary for him since the powerplay
fuller and flatter outside off stump, chopped out to deep cover
that's what Ashwin was after! Shimmies down as Kuldeep tosses it up, full and straight, and launches him straight back over his head for six. 87 metres
full on the pads, Ashwin leans across then tucks it off his pads for a single out towards midwicket
arm ball, on a length, steered to short third on the bounce
round-arm, full and straight, swept out to deep square
flighted on a length, DDP looks to work down to long-on but gets a leading edge back towards the bounce on the bounce
hammered over deep backward point on the reverse! Full outside off stump, DDP switches his stance around and sweeps behind square
skips down and hammers him over long-on! DDP is taking on his favourable match-up. Fullish and straight, DDP gets to the pitch and hammers it for half-a-dozen more
wide outside off, steered to short third with an open face
wide outside off stump on a length, slashed down to deep third
slower ball on a length outside off, deep in the crease to cut. Hesitation in the running but there's a misfield, which allows them to scamper back for two. Bharat the guilty party
banged in short, Ashwin upper-cuts over the keeper! Slow enough for Ashwin to lean back, ramping over Pant for four to reach his highest T20 score
back of a length, shovelled into the leg side
slower ball on a length, punched out to backward point with an open face
cutter on a length, chopped to point on the cut. Ashwin has his first-ever T20 fifty!
gives himself room, stepping outside leg stump, but no timing. Looks to go up and over the off side but skies it hiiiiiigh straight to Warner, running round from extra cover towards mid-off
tucked away off the pads to get off the mark
slower ball, back of a length, down the leg side. Tickled down towards fine leg with a roll of the wrists, and beats the man on the rope to his left
lofted over short third for four more. Leans back, opens the face, and skews it away over the infield with the man at 45 inside the inner ring. Back of a length, offcutter from Marsh
cutter on a length, no timing from Padikkal looking to work through the leg side. Marsh fields in his follow-through
cutter, very short. Pulled away but straight to short fine leg

launched over extra cover! One-bounce four, textbook Sanju. Too full from Shardul with enough width outside the off stump for him to free his arms. Flayed over the infield and over the rope on the bounce
back of a length, pulled out to deep backward square
beaten. DDP is turned into an 'S'. Extra bounce from a good length, cross-seamer which takes Padikkal by surprise, beating the splice of his bat as he pulls out of the shot
offcutter, just short of a length, angled across him. Shapes to pull but no connection

banged in short, mistimes the pull... but Kuldeep goes the wrong way at short fine leg! Beaten for pace and it looped up via the glove... but Kuldeep didn't make the ground to his left and couldn't get his left hand underneath it, diving low to his left
worked back to the bowler, looking to play through the leg side but no timing

on a length, Samson skies it into the leg side... it's gone miles up, but Shardul settles underneath it and clings on! Angling in towards the pads, mistimed into the leg side. Thakur was running in off the rope and took an excellent catch, tumbling over as he did
angling in, fullish length at 144kph. Worked down to long-on
backs away, Nortje follows him. Punched down to long-on

back of a length, pulled over deep backward square for a huuuuuuuuge six! Parag's second ball disappears into the stands. Short ball in fact, banged in towards the helmet, and Parag extends his arms, pulling it 92 metres, into the stands
a fraction short of a length, nudged into the leg side
banged in very short, down the leg side
banged in, back of a length, tickled down to fine leg for four more! DDP is flying now
dipping yorker, dug out to long-off via the toe-end
angling in on a full length, whipped out to deep midwicket with a roll of the wrists
banged in short, sails harmlessly over Parag's right shoulder
slower ball, Parag looks to muscle it over midwicket but mistimes it... and Powell settles underneath it to take a straightforward catch at long-on. Two for Sakariya, five for DC.
slower ball, wide outside off stump on a length. Tip-and-run into the off side
on a length, punched out to long-off
low full toss, angled across him. Whipped out to wide long-on for a couple

fantastic catch running in from deep point! Nortje runs his fingers down this, a quick offcutter on a fullish length outside off stump. Padikkal gives himself room and skies it away square of the wicket on the off side, but Nagarkoti, the sub fielder, races in and takes a good low catch diving forwards
back of a length outside off stump at 143kph, steered away through cover point
hard length, outside off stump, rolls his fingers down the side again. Dragged across the line, out to deep midwicket
banged in short, plinked out to deep cover while swatting at it
wide on the crease, attempted yorker which slips out as a full toss. RvdD has to reach for it, but gets enough bat on it to beat mid-on - who is up in the circle - to his right
hard length, RvdD plinks the pull and it falls short of midwicket
fullish, wide outside off stump. Inside-edged into the pad as he looks to slog-sweep across the line, and it skews away into the off side for a single
banged in short, Boult swats at it but only connects with thin air... but it's short enough to be called wide
half-volley on off stump, can't beat extra cover but they scramble through for one
slower ball outside off stump, RvdD flips his bat looking to reverse-ramp towards third, but can't get bat on ball
wide on the crease, RvdD looks to be cute again and reverse-dink past short third but again can't get bat on ball
wide on the crease, nails his yorker. RvdD gets down on one knee and thumps him over extra cover
swings at thin air again but they scamper through for a bye. Excellent last over from Shardul, closing out the innings well.
Length ball comes in over middle and leg, it comes in and Bharat defends on the backfoot in front

Edged and taken! Bharat swung himself off shape with a hard pull, it came from a back of length and was going outside off, away with the angle, Bharat was late on the pull and it nicked the bottom of the bat on its way to the keeper, who took a dolly.
Full just outside off, driven off the middle to mid-off
Length on the hips, turned to deep-square leg
Good length outside off, defended to cover with a tap on the ball's head

Extra bounce has Warner retrieve from the shot. It was on a back of length outside off, Warner shaped to play it with a horizontal bat but the ball zipped over and missed everything on its way to the keeper
Length outside off, left alone. Looked like that went lower than normal.
Defends a good length ball just outside off to cover
Inside edges after attempting a whip, aimed over short-fine, into the thigh and onto the ground in front. It was a length ball coming in to off
Big outswing! It was full, outside off and Marsh went for the flowing drive with a full follow-through and was beaten comprehensively. The pace was 143.3 kph
Back of a good length outside off, defended to the left of the bowler
Third maiden for Prasidh in this IPL! It was a length ball outside off, Marsh was caught in two minds on leaving and playing it late off the backfoot, it was a leave in the end
Length ball comes in with the angle over middle, Warner stays legside of the ball and defends it to cover
DW's foot goes across as he drags the length ball outside off with a pull to mid-on

Inside-edge looks to have saved Marsh! It was an in-swinging yorker, it moved late and went between his legs on the way to short-fine. Replays show it hit the boot before going on to the bat! RR thought of the review, it's hard to blame them for not taking it as the pace of the ball slowed down significantly. Hawk-Eye shows it's smashing the stumps.
Length over the stumps, Warner jumps and manages to roll his wrist on the cut and safely direct it to third man
Length ball angles away outside off. Marsh played within the line as the ball went past
Full outside off, pushed to point
Length ball on the hips, clipped to square-leg
Clips a length ball on the stumps to square-leg
Launched over long-off! It was full and on middle, the carrom ball was smoked after Marsh made room and swung through the line of the ball
Full on the legs, turned to deep-midwicket
Length ball on the pads beats the flick, goes to square leg after the ricochet off the pads
Flicks a back of good length ball on the stumps to midwicket

Almost a chop-on! Length ball around sixth stump had Marsh go for a backfoot punch away from the body through cover, it took the edge and went past leg-stump, the keeper's left on its way to the fence
Peach beats the outside edge. It was a short of good length ball going away with the angle outside off, Marsh prodded at it with the face looking at cover and got beaten
Goes back and clips a back of length ball on the hips to square-leg
Full on middle, it swung away a bit but Warner covered it with his hands, defended it straight.
Full ball down leg misses the line, goes well past the flick. Samson stops it with a dive to his right
Whacks a length ball on the stumps by going back and allowing it to come to him. The pull went through midwicket for four
Misses the line with a ball down leg again
Goes back and chops a back of good length ball outside off to cover for one
Squeezes out a yorker outside off with precision to find the gap to the left of point, Jos chased it swiftly to the deep from within the ring, scooped it back to the playing area to save a run
The back of good length ball coming in onto the thigh pad misses the bat as Marsh tries to hoick it, the ball ricocheted in front

Helped on its way, it looked to have gone up but had enough distance to clear the fine-leg fence! It was a short ball coming in and Marsh pulled it with all his might, the power worked for him in the end
Back of a length ball coming in to fourth stump, punched to point
Full toss outside off, pushed to cover
Around a good length on fifth stump, Marsh tries to defend it with a full-faced bat. It goes off the inside edge to square leg
Low full toss on middle, flicked to long-on, who is placed a bit wide
Hangs back and cuts a short ball over middle and off to deep-point, he stayed legside of the ball again
Clubs it and gets enough to clear wide-long on! It was on a good length outside off and Marsh swung across the line, the bat turned in his hand but the ball sailed over the fence
Full outside off, defended with an open-faced bat to cover
Stands still and swings through a full ball on fourth stump, the ball sails over the sightscreen. It was in the slot and Marsh got under it and deposited it for an 88-metre six
Opens the face to guide a back of length ball outside off a few metres to the right of third man, two taken
Good length outside off, driven towards cover
Slightly shorter on a similar line, makes room and punches to cover
Flatter length ball over off, punched to long-off
Full on middle and leg, defended to midwicket
Back of a good length outside off, chopped to deep-point
Full just outside off, driven to the right of the bowler. Ashwin stops it with a step across
Length outside off, driven to cover. Misfielded and it went to long-off
Pull just clears deep-midwicket! It was a slow, short ball that sat up and came over middle, DW pulled it and thought he was in trouble but the ball went over the fielder and he smiled in relief

Buttler cannot reach it at long-off! It was full, outside off, and tossed up, Warner went with a loft over long-on. It went off the bottom and went wide and in front of Buttler at long-off, he ran towards and leant at it, but could not get under it despite the full-reach
Good length on middle, punched to long off
Tucks a full ball on the stumps to deep-square leg

Spins in sharply and somehow missed leg-stump! It hit a good length just outside off and spun back and either went past leg-stump or it kissed the bail slow enough for it to not fall. Replay shows it hit the stumps, the light came on but the bails remained intact!
Short of good length on the pads, it beat the flick and went to short-fine leg off the pad
Another ball rises big! It was on a back of a length and went away with the angle, Warner shaped for the backfoot punch toward cover but the ball jumped up and he had to retract with a grunt
Opens the bat-face to direct a length ball outside off to cover
Slower one into the pitch outside off, he cuts it into the pitch on its way to the bowler

Boult does all the hard work with a long, quick run from deep-fine leg to his right but could not stop it. He tried to sweep the ball in with his palms but parried it away. It came off a low-ish full toss on middle and leg, Marsh whipped it behind square, it went inside out to the deep before Boult's intervention.
Back of a good length on off, pushed off the backfoot to long-on
Good length ball on off is driven to cover, while stayling legside of the ball. He did so by getting the front-foot out the way

Buttler's athleticism can't save six at the ropes, it goes for six and brings up Marsh's 50! It was full and tossed up on off, Marsh went through with the full, straight swing. It was sailing over the fence, Jos jumped to his left and tried to lob it to long-off who was also running in. But the ball went over from his palms for six
Works a full ball on the stumps towards midwicket
Length ball on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
Slow on a back of good length outside off spins away and beats the cut
Similar line and slightly fuller, it does not spin and the cut went to deep-point
Back of a good length ball on the legs beats the flick and goes to short-fine leg off the pad
Carrom ball. Length outside off, hit to deep point
Jams out a yorker on fifth stump to the right of cover-point. The throw hit the dusty part of the pitch in front and hit Samson on the grill. He looks safe.

RR review for a strangle down leg. Given not out, of course. It was a carrom ball on a full length. It pitched down leg and went away further. Marsh looked to nudge it across the line. He missed it, there's nothing on Ultra-Edge, it remains not out and wide
Back of a good length ball on middle, stays legside and cuts it to the bowler
Around a good length outside off, cut to deep cover
Makes room and drives a good length ball on middle and leg on the move to deep cover
Warner's getting a few balls that are misbehaving. This was another length ball on off stump that jumped up, Warner played it on top of it, enough to tap it from the sticker in front
Back of length over off, clipped to midwicket

Cutter on a back of a length outside off foxes Warner, he's squared up and the ball balloons off the outside edge after he's too early on turning it to the legside. It landed safely on its way to third man
Back of a good length outside off, the cutter is cut late to fine the gap to the left of deep-point for four
Short ball on the chest, just over the ribs and Marsh turns on the pull and sends it in the gap well to the right of deep-backward square
Full just outside off, driven to long-off
Slower one into the pitch coming to leg is turned to short-fine leg
Warner checks a slash to ensure that a back of length ball outside off, going away with the angle, goes to cover on the bounce
Brings up the 100 partnership with a cut off a good length ball outside off. Warner's front leg was out the way from the get go and it allowed him to cream the shot through the gap
Pulls a short ball on the chest with limited control, he turned and the ball went behind square. Deep-backward square ran diagonally to his left to stop it as it was slowing down
Length ball coming in to leg misses the heave, hits the pad and goes to the pitch on the right hander's offside
Full on fourth stump, worked to long-on
Slow good length ball pitches outside off and spins away. The legspinner takes the bottom edge of the chop and goes in front
Cuts a ball on a similar line and length to deep-point, this one did not spin as much
Warner came down the ground which Chahal  may have seen, the batter went down on a knee and sweeped it aerially in the gap at deep-square leg
Jabs a good length ball on the stumps to deep-square leg off the backfoot.
Good length ball comes in to legstump, it was flat and Marsh played it with a full-face. It took the edge and went on to the ground on its way to point which allowed the run
Full ball goes well down leg, beats the hard, fine sweep and misses. Wide nonetheless
Goes back and pulls a back of good length ball outside off to long-on
Pierces the gap between cow-corner and long-on with surgical precision! It was on a good length just outside off, DW pulled it in the air and in the gap, went inside out and in the gap for four
Length ball on the stumps, clipped to square-leg
Marsh pulls it hard and clears the fence! It was slow and short, the ball came off the bottom but had enough timing to go for a 79-metre six over deep-square leg
Works a full ball on the pad to short-fine leg
Tucks a good length ball pitching on off and spinning away to deep-square leg
Good length ball is down leg and Marsh lets it go
Full on middle, clipped to deep-square leg
Around a length ball goes away with the angle over off, Marsh swings across the line and misses
Pulls a length ball over middle with might, the bat turns and helps the ball stay on the ground. It blazed through square-leg for four
Clubbed to the second-tier! Shortish ball on the hips was pulled right off the middle overmidwicket for a 102-metre six!
Similar length but it was over middle, Marsh swung hard and a hand came off but it went into the ground and dribbled to deep-square leg
Pulled effortlessly to the gap behind square. DW swivels and pulls a back of a length ball coming towards him and hit it well to the right of deep-fine leg
Makes room and has to reach out to a good length ball on fourth stump to point off the bottom of the bat along the ground

Top-edges a sweep straight to short-fine leg! Marsh is on his haunches before leaving but he has done his job. It was a full ball on leg and was there for the slog-sweep, the option Marsh went for but it spun away a bit and took the top-edge over the sticker. Kuldeep Sen takes a comfortable catch. Marsh leaves to a standing ovation from the dugout.
Flighted on off, Pant whacks the full ball with a hard sweep. It goes off the bottom, into the ground to deep-square leg
Good length outside off, flighted at 84 kph, driven to deep-cover

Pant does Pant things and clears wide-long off! It was a good length ball outside off, it was going away from Pant's arc even as he danced across the pitch. He went through with the lofted shot and cleared wide-long off
Back of good length outside the tramline but the legbreak comes in and Pant leaves it. Smiles at Yuzi to acknowledge the big-turn
Comes down again and manages to reach out to a slow, wide, full ball and slaps it over deep-extra cover for six more!

Pulls a back of a length ball outside off through midwicket, who misfields, and allows the ball to go to the fence. It brings up Warner's 50, Parag stops it close to the ropes but they managed to run three.
peach first up, and very nearly straight to slip! Full on middle, Saha presses forward to defend, but it takes the edge. Soft hands save Wriddhi
tantalising length and line. Lands on a good length on off and angles slightly across, past Saha's bat as he pokes at it
good length, and fended. First time off the bat's middle
back of a length on leg stump. Some extra bounce onto Saha's gut region. Hits him on the body
good length, on middle and angling cross. Poked away to third man for one

Karan Sharma in action - and very nearly takes a stunner! Gill very nearly out for a first-ball duck as his cut flies to the debutant at third man, who dives forward extravagantly to take a catch, but the ball doesn't stick. Did he hesitate getting off the line? Perhaps!
fourth-stump line, length ball. Cut square, four written all over it, but Deepak Hooda is manning that region. Throws his body sideways, and stops it with his hand
good length ball, fourth-stump line again. Tap and run to mid off, with Gill running to the danger end. KL Rahul couldn't collect it cleanly, or else...
full on off and middle. Saha pushes it back
not short enough, not full enough. Fourth-stump line and Saha swings across the line, getting enough wood to smack it through midwicket
goes short, Saha wants to go hard again, but misses out
full just outside off. Saha looks aggressive trying to go up and over, but plays down the wrong line. Past the edge, past the stumps to the keeper
good length ball on off, but it jags back in. Surprises the batter, cramped for space too
good length, on off stump. Worked off his waist to midwicket

How's Mohsin's ankle? Good length on middle, maybe pace off too. Saha offers a defensive shot with hard hands, and the ball pops up off the blade. But Mohsin falls over trying to turn and take a caught and bowled

Mohsin's dream run continues as he gets Saha next ball. Quite similar to the last ball. Another cutter from Mohsin, Saha looks to go leg side, but the length ball hits the top half of his bat, loops up and over the bowler, and mid on runs in to take that
back of a length outside off stump. Rides the bounce and cuts behind square for one
cut away strongly as Gill gets his first boundary of the evening. Mohsin tried to get this length ball across him, but Gill got top connection off the back foot
punched strongly Length ball on middle and off, and Wade transfers the body weight well to smack it to cover
Chameera goes short, but it's not short enough to trouble an Australian. Pulled from his chest region
fuller, and crunched drive, but stopped at the infielder on the off side. Stoinis with the reflex effort
good length, on off. Slower ball. Smacked to mid off and they are off for one
back of a length angling into Gill. Plays a pull, but along the ground
ends with the pace-off option. Rolls his fingers over it, and he tries to drag a pull but can't.
nurdles a length all off his waist to midwicket

Wade will not want to see the replay! Avesh goes slightly wide outside off, Wade walks across to try and play a paddle over the vacant fine leg region, but ends up bunting a shot right into the hands of the keeper!
full and wide outside off. Hardik throws his bat at it first ball, and it's flown to third man. Bit of a risky slash
caresses a pull along the carpet. Avesh tries short, but Gill keeps the bat's face facing down so he can play a safe shot for four
good length, outside off. Cut square

batters have given up, but Super Giants can't capitalise! Pushed to the leg side and Gill is too slow off the blocks. Badoni collects but throws a loop that's way off from the keeper's grasp or the stumps
defended to the leg side. Length ball
checks a pull and drags this fourth-stump ball to midwicket for four! The ball races along the grass
full outside off stump. Pushed to cover
full outside off stump, bit of movement away on this occasion in the air. Driven to cover
good length ball just outside off. Whizzing past the outside edge. And it's the Titans' lowest powerplay score of the season!
around the stumps. Length ball on off and middle. Worked off his hips behind square for one
good length on middle, and he plays a paddle around his waist to short fine leg
tucked to the leg side and the bowler runs around to intercept
good length on off. Worked to midwicket for one
fullish on off and middle. Defended to the vacant midwicket region after Krunal fails to stop it with a dive
tidy first over from Krunal. Good length outside off. Cut behind square
here's Holder, starts off with a back of length fifth-stump line delivery. Cut behind square behind point for one
another back of a length ball. Gill drags it to wide long on for one
stands tall, and punches it through the covers. But not perfectly timed, so KL Rahul can run towards the boundary and stop it
good length, on middle and leg. Played off his waist with the horizontal bat to deep backward square
full on middle and off. Flicks off his pads to midwicket on the boundary line
back of a length outside off. Hardik drags a pull towards the packed leg-side boundary to collect two more
full on off stump. Gets low to sweep. Top-edge, in the air, but well short of the fielder at fine leg
full outside off. Hardik comes down the track and pushes it to cover
quicker one. Angling into his body. Punched to long on for a walking single
good length, on off stump. Punched off the back foot to mid on
good length, on off stump. Pulled to deep midwicket for a walking single again
good length, on off stump. Pushed to wide long on

short, wide, slashed hard, edged and taken! Hardik will be disappointed falling to a ball like that. Loses his wicket first ball after the time out. What helped Avesh was that he bowled full pace, and the extra bounce induced the edge to de Kock
length ball, on his waist, and worked to the leg side behind square
unconvincingly cut to third man. Back of a length this time
back of a length delivery, and he pokes at it. Runs it to point behind square
back of a length outside leg stump. Miller swivels to pull but can't connect
angling across, and helped down to third man for a single
imperious!
good length on off. Turning into him. Tucked to the leg side for a single
good length, on off. Flicked off his waist to midwicket. Played there since there's no outfielder at midwicket inside the circle, and they easily pick off two
good length, on off stump. Worked off his pads towards the square-leg umpire. They settle for one
good length, on off stump. Pulled off the back foot to deep midwicket for just one
reverse sweep - a rare one from Gill. Full on leg stump, Gill quickly changes his stance, and then gives the ball a good slap past the regulation third-man region
good length, on off and middle. Swiped to wide long on for one
short on fifth stump at 133 kph, flat-bat swat skids to long-on for one.
short and wide at 131 kph, slices a cut straight to point.
slower ball at 115 kph lands back of a length on fourth stump, guided with soft hands this time to backward point, can't pick the gap.
short and wide at 129 kph, this time picks the gap with a late cut playing this later and with softer hands to beat the sweeper too.
slower ball lands short on middle, Miller leans back to cut this to the point sweeper this time.
slower bouncer on fifth stump, pulls this tamely to deep midwicket for one.
back of a length, flicked square softly enough to come back for two.
back of a length on the body, goes back to flick but misses off the pads.
back of a length again into the legs, this time Gill is able to flick it square for one.
short on fourth stump, goes back to pull to deep midwicket for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, tap and run into the covers for one.
back of a length speared into the legs, flicked through midwicket for one.
good length ball on off, goes back to flick into midwicket for two.
slower ball at 118 kph lands on a good length ball on middle, defended back to Mohsin.
140 kph deliver lands full on off, blocked to extra cover.
back of a length slower ball on fifth stump at 122 kph, prods this wide of extra cover for one.
good length ball on the body at 121 kph, flicked into midwicket for one.
slower bouncer on off, pulled gently in front of square and fielded on one bounce at the deep square leg rope by Krunal before being relayed in to keep it to one.
short and wide, slapped through point for one.
yorker speared into middle, jammed out into midwicket for one.
length ball hugging the wide guideline outside off, Miller is late on a cut.
short and wide, slaps this into the covers for a sharp single.
slower bouncer on the wide guideline, toe-slapped through point to the sweeper for one.
goes for wide yorker and instead hurls a waist high full toss on the wide guideline, hammered straight to the point sweeper for one.
starts with a slower ball landing short outside leg, offcutter breaks across Miller before he pulls to the leg side for one.
slower bouncer on middle, pulled through midwicket for one.

super duper shot over extra cover! Full and wide, but it's in the slot at 130 kph and Miller drives this flat with back leg bent to get the elevation and it sizzles over the LCD ad boards. First six of the innings if you can believe it.

short and wide outside off, Miller tries to keep the hands back to cut this and sends it in the direction of KL Rahul at cover, who stops it to keep it to one. Hard to tell if it carried for it to be a chance. Brings up a half-century partnership off 40 balls.
slower ball again short on the stumps at 106 kph, pulled into the leg side for one.
full and wide yorker, too wide to play at, left alone and wide called.

short and wide slower ball at 116 kph, Miller slashes this straight to deep third man! Miller had one hand fly off the bat, was an uncontrolled shot to say the least and it sails gently to the man coming in five yards off the rope, catch taken at rib height.
full and wide at 140 kph, driven firmly to mid-off but they scamper a single to get Gill his half-century off 42 balls.
full on fifth stump, poked square through point to the sweeper for one.

slower length ball on sixth stump at 123 kph, Gill muscles this baseball style straight back over the bowler's head to the mid-off rope. Even better value than he'd get on the diamond where it's a single up the middle.
wide yorker on seventh stump, jams this out off the toe and squeezes it wide enough of the keeper to go to the third man rope beating the effort of the diving fielder.
wide yorker lands just outside the guideline, will have to be rebowled.
short on fifth stump, pulls this firmly but straight to Stoinis positioned at cow corner.
bouncer down the leg side, wide called on the line.
short and wide, carves a cut to the sweeper for one.
back of a length on middle, goes back to flick through square leg for one.
slower ball at 124 kph lands short on middle, drills a pull to deep midwicket for one.
slower ball back of a length on fifth stump at 125 kph, cuts this gently into the covers for one.
slower ball at 123 kph lands back of a length on fifth stump, slapped to mid-off on the ring for one.
gem! Full pace at 133 kph lands on a good length and seams in over middle stump to cut Tewatia in two.
slower bouncer on middle, pulled gently into the leg side for one.
length ball on off stump, pulls this into midwicket to the boundary rider for one.
yorker speared into middle, jammed out into the pads and they scamper one.

we have an alligator-armed fielder named Badoni at deep backward square! Short ball on the body, pulled in the air toward Badoni, he stops running in and backpedals choosing to not dive for the chance, and then to compound matters lets it go past him to the rope.
length ball on fourth stump, misses a pull off his ribs and it trickles to the keeper. They can't steal a run.

length ball on fifth stump, Tewatia shuffles across on one knee to slog sweep and a top edge is hit in the helmet. Avesh asks him if he's okay. The physio sprints out to the field for a concussion check. It's the shortest concussion test in medical history. We're back to the next ball.

dropped! LSG getting very sloppy here. Tewatia survives his second chance of the over. Length ball on fourth stump, goes for a wild heave, top edges this to short third man where Deepak Hooda looks like the most uncomfortable short third man fielder under a skier this season. Backs away practically and dives forward at the end but hardly gets fingertips to this.
length ball outside off, toe slaps this into the off side for one.
offcutter lands short and wide, slashes this off a thick edge and beats Badoni at the deep third man rope, who is having a very very rough time here in the last 10 minutes in the field.
slower bouncer outside off, bounces too high for Tewatia to reach. Wide called on height.
another slower short ball at 112 kph on sixth stump, Tewatia thumps a cross-bat swat on the up over mid-off who was up in the ring. Easy four.
slower ball lands just inside the wide guideline, left alone and Tewatia is unhappy no wide is called but it was clearly legal.
slower ball wide yorker, lands clearly outside the guideline to be called a wide.
slower ball at 106 kph short on the stumps, shuffles well across his stumps and pulls this high over fine leg to the rope.
Shami starts off, and de Kock fends this away to the leg side
back of a length outside off. Extra bounce, hits the bat near the shoulder. Ball flies away to the leg side
good length, fourth-stump line. Rahul nudges it towards point, but can't take a run
good length ball, but pace off. Rahul is surprised as the ball holds up on the deck. Rahul mistimes it leg side. A wry smile from Shami
ball nips back after landing on a good length on off. Rahul can't flick it square, and instead hits the top of his knee roll
good length, bit of width outside off. Ball seams away slightly, and Rahul pokes a shot away from his body to third man
fullish, wide outside off. Rahul cuts, but is a tad late to the shot. Flies off the edge to third man
full on leg stump, and clipped to deep backward square leg for a couple
fullish, leg stump. Clipped off his heels to square leg. Can't beat the infield
length ball hits him near his knee roll, and wants a run, but two infielders come running in to intercept.
good length, on leg stump. Worked to deep backward square for a single

full just outside off. But Rahul backs away to make some room and slashes hard at it trying to play over cover. But the edge takes it past the vacant third-man region instead, and Rahul enjoys a lucky four off his good friend
length ball just outside off. Taps it to cover and they are off for a single
good length, on middle and leg. Clipped to  midwicket
good length ball outside off. Bit of extra bounce and he mistimes the attempted punch. Hits the top half of the bat
slower ball, length ball just outside off. Rahul tries to cut, but inside edged onto his pad
good length on off stump. Tapped towards the leg side off the back foot for a single
good length outside off stump. Pushed with soft hands to cover's right for one
length ball on an off-stump line. Wants to punch, but edged to third man

three men get under it for a catch, but the ball goes for a bizarre six! Dayal went for a back of a length ball and de Kock tried to clobber a pull, but it took a top edge. Dayal's pace, though, took it for six behind the keeper
six and out! Sai at cover point takes a tricky catch low. Dayal went full, de Kock looked to clobber a drive, but it's played square to the infielder
full on off, and Hooda mistimes a drive to mid off. Wants one, but can't get it
Dayal unlucky! Great seam position in his length ball going just away from Hooda. Wants to cut, but ends up slicing it behind, very nearly to the first slip fielder!
fullish, fourth-stump line. Left alone
full and wide outside off. Ball still moving in the air, going away from Rahul. Tries to drive, but beaten by the pace
good length, just outside off. Rahul stands tall and fends it with the full face of the bat
good length outside off. Flayed off the back foot with the angle of the bat's face open. Finds cover point
good length outside off stump. Punched off the back foot, stopped behind point

into the night sky, and Wriddhiman Saha's not gonna miss that! The captain is gone, and Shami has picked off Rahul with the short ball. Off-stump line, rising delivery, Rahul pulls, but the top edge brings his demise. Shami does the season double over KL
good length, on off. Fended off the back foot
full face of the bat in hid drive down the ground
full on middle, and clipped with the bat's closed face to midwicket
good length outside off. Cuts with the ball angling across. Intercepted at point
fullish, on off stump. He punches it off the front foot, and cover is right there, but the ball bursts through Jayant Yadav's hands! Free runs help Karan Sharma get off the mark in the IPL

flies to short third man! Almost as if the fielder was right there for that kind of shot. Left-arm seamers ruling here today as Dayal's length ball outside off tempts Karan to cut, and the thick edge flies to Miller inside the circle. Dayal gets his UP team-mate!
full just outside off, and Krunal leans into a beautiful drive through the covers! #HoldThePose
Short and wide, and the loosener from Alzarri is put away. Rides the bounce, and flays a cut behind point for four!
full on off stump. Defended to mid on, and off they go for a single
good length, on middle stump. Tapped back to the bowler off the back foot
fullish on middle and off. Mistimed to the leg side. Wanted to play straighter than the ball went
good length just outside off and anglng into off stump. Fended back to Joseph off the front foot
length ball, just outside off stump. Tapped off the back foot, and they are off for a single as the ball rolls away to point.
googly on fifth stump lands short, goes back to flick square for one.
googly again lands on a good length on middle and spins across this forward prod to beat the edge.

a Rashid classic! Krunal stumbles out of his crease groping at another googly landed on a good length on middle that spins sharply past the edge. Saha whips the bails off and there's no bother checking with the third umpire on this one.
full on fourth stump, driven to long-on for one.
good length ball on off, goes back to tip and run into square leg but Saha bolts from behind the stumps to deny a single.
floated full on sixth stump, sweeps this in the air but well short of deep midwicket for one.
back of a length on fifth stump at 144 kph, guides this with an open face to deep third man for one.
short ball on sixth stump at 138 kph, loose wave at this and is beaten.
length ball on fifth stump, smashes this on the up at 146 kph through mid-on to the rope.
good length ball angled into fourth stump at 143 kph, defended to cover.
good length ball on sixth stump, prods this 140 kph delivery in front of point for one.
back of a length on sixth stump at 132 kph, guides this to deep third man for one.
full on sixth stump, sweeps this fine through fine leg for one.
full on off, chips this back low to Rashid, fielded on a bounce.
googly on a good length spins down leg, wide called.
full on fifth stump, blunted back to extra cover.

full on middle and leg, Badoni uses his feet to drive to long-on right off the middle of the bat. Rashid appeals for lbw, because hey, why not... Rashid has actually cajoled Hardik Pandya into burning a DRS review on this. Extraordinary. The replay confirms that he did indeed smash this ball straight out of the middle of the bat to long-on. Review lost.
good length ball on off, tapped away for one.
good length ball on sixth stump spins in, goes to late dab this but can't get it past slip, who fields it on a bounce.
good length ball on middle and leg, defended.
good length ball on off, punched to the off side for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, flicked through midwicket for one.
back of a length on off, punched to long-off for one.

beautiful flight from Kishore and he gets Badoni dancing to nowhere! Slows up the pace and drags the length back a touch on fifth stump with Badoni telegraphing his charge, gets nowhere close to the pitch, flails aimlessly and Saha takes the bails off with Badoni four yards out of his crease.
good length ball on off, hangs back to punch this square to the cover sweeper.
zipped in quick and full on fifth stump, sweep goes through square leg for one.

googly spins down leg, sweep missed and a wide is called in spite of an appeal for caught behind. This was actually much closer than the burned lbw. Could have come off the glove but they leave it be.

as comical a runout as you'll ever see.... Fullish length ball on the stumps that Hooda sweeps to deep square leg. Stoinis thinks there's an easy two on the cards and turns to come back but Hooda doesn't respond and Stoinis is halfway down the track when a straightforward relay is fired in by Miller to Saha at the striker's end.
full and wide, driven to long-off for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended to Rashid.
full toss at thigh height on fifth stump, swats this flat to deep midwicket for just one.

legbrkak straightens past Holder's back foot flick to pin him in front! Holder was playing for the googly and waves past this ball. It's an orthodox legbrkak though and zips past the bat to peg him on the knee in front of middle and off very deep in his crease. Rashid charges toward slip while appealing and Holder starts to walk off before the finger is up. Doesn't bother asking for DRS. Stone dead.
good length ball on middle, punched to extra cover.
