good length ball on off stump sticks in the pitch a touch and it results in a shovel just wide of Hardik at extra cover for one.
back of a length on middle, defended to midwicket.
good length ball on fifth stump, guided to backward point for one.
back of a length on middle, punched to the cover sweeper for one.

flighted full on fourth stump, wild heave by Mohsin skied over backward point. Rashid calls everyone off running forward from short third man, slides to cushion this chance and bobbles it before holding onto it on the second effort.

top-edged sweep goes to Shami charging behind the keeper from short fine leg! It was a legbreak flighted full on middle, top edge swirled behind Saha and a very alert effort from Shami allowed him to take this in stride at chest height after running 20 yards to his right along the ring.
what a shot from Avesh on the hat-trick ball! Flighted full on off, Avesh winds up and heaves this over the fielder at long-on and beyond the LCD ad boards.
short ball on the body, goes back to pull this and actually winds up double-hitting this over backward square leg over the rope.
full again on off stump, goes for another big heave and misses it spinning just past off stump.

googly spins past another wild heave. Big appeal for caught behind from Saha but nothing from Rashid. Given not out. But Saha has convinced Hardik to go for the review. Ultraedge shows a feather off a slight inside edge. Decision overturned. A fitting way to cap a brilliant display from behind the stumps by Saha throughout this chase.
Begins with a full ball on off, driven nicely but straight to mid-off.
Whipped away nicely. Sams aims for the blockhole and spears it full on middle and leg. Iyer stands tall and works it through square leg to get going with a brace.
Another full and straight one on middle and leg, flicked straight to midwicket this time.
Outside off on a length, punched straight to cover.
Excellent effort from Ashwin at short fine leg. It was a slower bouncer angling down leg, Venkatesh pulls it. Seems to be going past short fine but Ashwin dives and keeps it down to one.
Short and wide, cut straight to deep point to get off the mark.
Well-judged run. Floated outside off, Rahane lunges and pushes it towards point and immediately sees Venky rush for one.
It was the googly but well down leg. Venky has a go but misses.

Thank you very much, says Venkatesh Iyer as he thumps this one wayyy over deep midwicket. Another attempted wrong'un, perhaps expecting Venky to dance down. Delivers a long-hop which Iyer pulls powerfully.
Fuller on off, pushed to cover.
Tossed up on a length outside leg, Venky turns it to short fine leg.
Flatter outside off, pushed defensively towards point.
That's whipped away powerfully. Tossed up full on off, again the googly. Venkatesh drives it powerfully through covers and finds the gap perfectly. 12 off the over.
Very full outside off, Rahane digs it out to cover.
On a length on the pads, Rahane tucks it fine down leg for a single.
Length ball around off, Venky stands tall and drives it but straight to the man at cover.

Ho, ho, ho! It's a beauty! 800th six of this season and this is as clean as any. Venkatesh goes deep in the crease and converts the full ball into a length one. Gets under it and wallops it over deep midwicket.
Short and wide, slashes powerfully to deep backward point for one.
Full and wide down leg, Rahane misses the flick.
Full outside off, Rahane pushes it down. Didn't time it well and that allowed him a run before mid-off could get to his left and stop that.
That sounded good. Crrrruunchhh! It's all about timing. Length ball outside off, Rahane hangs back and times the guide past backward point and gets his first boundary of the match.
Fuller on off and middle, defended back towards the bowler.
Almost chopped on. Length ball angling in, Rahane goes back to defend but gets it off the inner edge towards short fine leg.
Doesn't get the pull off the middle of the bat. Back of a length ball, ends up mistiming it towards midwicket.
Venkatesh isn't sure whether to come forward of go back. Ends up being nowhere as he looks to lift this length ball over the bowler's head.
On a length around off, steered to point. Just one run of the last five balls after going for four on the first.
Length ball on the pads, misses the flick and it goes off the pad to the on side.
Audacious! Venky has come out with a clear intent to attack and it has come off thus far. Sees the length ball early and slinks down and slices it over cover and gets four.
That goes the distance! Back of a length delivery angling away, Venkatesh moves across and ramps it well over fine leg, who was in the deep.
That's a proper Gayle hoick. Back of a length slower ball, Venky pulls it along the ground to mid-on where Kartikeya does well with a dive.
Five wides! Runs are flowing thick and fast. Banged in short, it climbs well over the batter and the leaping wicketkeeper and goes to the rope behind.

Would have been curtains had Pollard hit. That was a misjudged single. Iyer hit it towards midwicket and set off. Pollard did well to quickly get to his right and get rid of the bowler but missed his aim at the bowler's end. Venky would have been a goner despite the dive.
Full on middle, worked to midwicket. End of the most expensive over thus far - 17 off it.

No half measures from Venky! No sighters needed. Venkatesh swings hard straightaway and gets a thick outside edge past the keeper for four. It was bowled with the index finger and thumb, which meant the ball swung away a touch.
A misfield by Sams at covers gives Iyer a couple more. It was full and outside off, driven straight to cover.
That's gone 20 rows back! Sees the tossed up ball, gets down on his knee and thumps it over deep midwicket.

You live by the sword and you die by it - that's the saying Venkatesh followed tonight. Once again used his long reach to try and thwack it over the on side. But yet again, the length meant that it was out of Iyer's reach and all he could manage was a top edge. It was also the wristspin that was thrown a tad wider. Gobbled safely by Sams at cover. Kartikeya gets his MP team-mate.
Flatter and a tad shorter outside off, Rana goes back and steers it to point.
Generously tossed up and ends up bowling a low full toss. Rana is too good to miss out on such an opportunity. Drives it through covers to get going with a boundary. That concludes the powerplay.
Very full on the pads, Rahane lifts it up towards the right of long-on for one.
Back of a length around the fourth stump line, Rana goes back and works it towards midwicket.
Length ball around off, Rana hops and works it through backward square leg for a couple.
Banged in short, Rana ducks.
Another back of a length ball, Rana keeps it out from the crease.
Sams sees Rana charge down and sprays it down leg.
Short ball again, Rana looks to get inside the line and pull it to fine leg. Ends up gloving it down to the wicketkeeper.
Paddles it fine and gets four. Sees the tossed up ball, and goes for the shot. Ishan moved to his left but couldn't get anything on the way. No fine leg in place and that helped Rahane.
Floated full outside off, Rahane pushes it towards covers for a quick one.
Tossed up full on middle and leg, worked it towards midwicket for none.

Have they got Rana? Ishan Kishan thinks so? Ashwin joins belatedly. A long discussion takes place but Mumbai don't opt for the review. It was a tossed up wrong'un that Rana looked to reverse sweep. Seemed to have missed it.
Another googly, this time on the pads. Worked away through square leg for one.
Loopy ball, full outside off, Rahane whips it through midwicket to retain strike.
Flatter and outside off, it was the offspinner. Rahane misses the cut.
Fuller on middle and leg, worked through midwicket for one.
Now the legspin to the left-hander. Full outside off, driven to cover.

That is a smart run. It was tossed up outside off, Rana went for the reverse sweep but didn't make proper contact. The ball  was rolling just besides Kishan even as he was searching for it towards third man. Rahane spotted that and hared across for a run.

Is Rahane stumped? Ishan Kishan thinks so. They've taken it upstairs. It was the tossed up ball outside off, inviting the drive. Rahane goes for it and is dragged out as he does so. But misses the ball completely. But before Kishan could whip the bails, he is back in.
This is a half-tracker, Rahane pulls it all along the ground to deep square leg for a single.
Rahane welcomes Pollard with a four. A gentle delivery on a length outside off, enough room for Rahane to exploit the gap between short third man and backward point.
Slower one, around off, mistimes the pull through midwicket for one.

Slower one on a length, angling away. Rana comes down and gets it off the outer half towards backward point for one. Short third did well to stop that after backward point dived in front of him but missed the ball.
Short but not much pace, Rahane pulls it to deep backward square leg for a single.
Another ball on a length, slanting away. Rana stays back and cuts it to deep backward point for only one.
Full toss, another attempted slower one, driven to long-on for one. Nine runs is a decent return considering that the first ball went for four.
Such are the dynamics of the sport that this will go down as a chance. Rahane went for the reverse-sweep early and Kartikeya threw it a bit wide. Ends up hitting it straight on to Kishan's pad.

And here's the false shot that brings Kartikeya the success. Another attempted reverse-sweep, Rahane misses it completely to lose his off stump. Kartikeya flighted this one and kept it closer to the stumps unlike the last ball. Gets rewarded for the second time this game. Smart, brave bowling.
Flatter on middle, he goes back and defends.
Wristspinner on a flatter trajectory on the pads, worked away through square leg for one.
High and long! Floated full on off, Rana clears his front leg and smashes it way over the bowler's head.

This one's even better. Another flighted one, seemed to be the offspinner this time. But it was full and in Rana's slot. He gets down on a knee and belts it over long-on for half a dozen. Excellent way to end the over and bring up the 100 for KKR.
Back of a length around off, Iyer looks to work it to the on side and gets a leading edge towards covers.
Shreyas does the moving in the crease - first towards off and then back. Meredith bangs it short and he lets it be.
Short ball outside off, Iyer moves to the off and pulls it to midwicket.
Short again down leg, pulled to fine leg for one.
Back of a length outside off, steered to third man for one.
That's thrashed with disdain! Length ball outside off, Shreyas stands deep ion the crease and smashes it through covers for four.

Wallopped! Rana perhaps knows what Pollard has to offer. Charges down early and converts the length ball into a full one. It was angling away so he got the desired room, too. Frees his arms and belts it over wide long-off.
Short one at a slower pace, Rana looks to ramp it but misses.
Another back of a length ball, Rana gets inside the line to scoop but misses.

Smart bowling. It's a cat and mouse game and Pollard is not happy at that being called wide. He saw Rana move across for yet another scoop and threw it wide. It passed ouitside the tramline and was called a wide. He shows the replay to the ump but nothing doing.
And now Rana stands still and smashes it over covers. Makes Pollard throw it wider owing to his antics on the previous ball. And gets what he wants.
Rana is now dictating moves! Slower ball on a length just outside off, Rana stands tall and thumps it over deep midwicket for half a dozen. Fourth six for Rana.
Another back of a length ball slanting away, Rana misses the ramp.

Beauts of a delivery to get rid of Shreyas Iyer, who is very good against spin. A perfect Test match dismissal. Tossed up, lands on a length around off and middle, turns, bounces, draws the batter forward. Shreyas lunges and only manages to glove it to Kishan behind. A wicket right after the break for Mumbai.
Sighter? What's that? Russell sees the tossed up ball around off and looks to go big. Slices it towards deep cover and sweeper does well to keep it down to two.
And thwacks his second ball for a maximum! Muscle Russell is in the house! Clears a leaping Tim David at long-on with a powerful hit.
Fires it quicker on the pads, Russell goes back and turns it through square leg for one.

Bumrah does a hash of the fielding chance in the deep. The deep square leg was kept finer due to the kind of sweep Rana plays. He picks the googly early and nails the sweep. Bumrah moved to his left and dived over the ball. Ashwin isn't pleased.
Tossed up full down leg, Rana sweeps it straight to short fine leg.
Perfect yorker from Bumrah! Tradmark. It was on the mark, on off and middle. Russell does well to dig it out.

Bumrah delivers with the big wicket and big man Polly seldom drops catches! Length ball this time around off, beats Russell for pace. Yet he goes with the heave and only ends up hitting it as far as Pollard at long-on.

"Keeper yaar, c'mon!" yells Kishan as the batters steal two. Rinku managed to get the length ball through covers and was the slower of the two batters because he began on the back foot. But the throw from the deep goes to the bowler, who is not pleased as well.
This one has been worked through square leg for one.

That's out! Surely? The umpire doesn't think so and Mumbai opt for the DRS. Short ball from over the stumps, Rana is caught in an awkward position - he looks to duck as well as fend - and I heard a noise as the ball passed the bat. Ishan Kishan did so, too, while Bumrah also celebrated. But the umpire stayed unmoved. Rana knows he's gloved it and is seen walking back even as the Snicko confirms it. The short ball does him in yet again.
Length ball angling in from outside off, steered to third man for one. Four runs and two wickets from the over.
Floated full on off and middle, lunges forward and blocks it back.
Beauty! Jackson charges down but then goes back, tried to play the cut but adjusts belatedly seeing that it's a googly. Ends up chopping it fine towards short third for one.
Driven towards covers for none.
Tossed up on the pads, swept to fine leg for one.
Goes back to this legspinning delivery to work it through midwicket for one.
Rinku looks to charge down but is not allowed to do so due to the googly. Manages to defend it back. 1/35 tonight for Ashwin.
Shortish ball on the hips, worked away towards midwicket for one.
Tickled away! Back of a length ball, on leg. Rinku gets inside the line and manages to get it past the diving Kishan.
Angling away on a length, Rinku cuts it past backward point and collects two.
Slower one, pushed back down thr ground for a quick one before Pollard gets to his left from mid-off.
Very full on the pads, worked away to deep midwicket for one.
Taken full toll. Offcutter on a shorter length, Rinku pulls it through long leg for four. There was a fine leg and deep square leg in place but he found the gap to perfection.

Stupendous, stunning, fantastic, fantabulous Daniel Sams! Covers a lot of ground to run in from the deep and pull off a diving catch. It is another KKR wicket off a short ball, this time Jackson the batter. Looks to pull it but only gets it towards where midwicket would be been in the circle. Sams runs in from deep square leg and puts in the dive to catch that swirling ball.
Welcomes to the crease with a bumper, he ducks.

Tilak Varma's turn to take a good running catch now! Bumrah is bringing back the smiles in the MI dugout as well as supporters' section. Banged in short, Cummins' bottom hand comes off as he pulls. Ends up skying it high. Varma calls, has his eyes on the ball as he runs towards square leg from midwicket and takes it.

Bumrah is here and how! Fast, faster and fastest have been Bumrah's speeds this over. This is the Bumrah teams fall to and he has got an amazing fifer. And mind you, he's only 16 balls into his spell. Runs in from around the stumps and bowls it back of a length. Narine is caught by surprise and looks to turn it round the corner. Gets it high on the bat and towards the bowler. Bumrah hares towards it and takes it in his followthrough, and throws it up in celebration. You have to be at DY Patil to feel it all.
The perfect ball from Bumrah - full and straight - but Southee manages to keep it out.
Triple-wicket maiden from Bumrah! What an over this has been. Back of a length outside off, Southee fishes at that but misses.
Slower offcutter outside off, cut to backward point.
Slower one again, full on off, Rinku pushes it back.
How early did he pick it! Full ball, slow offcutter on off. Rinku picked it yesterday and thumps it over deep midwicket for six.
Sprayed well outside off.
Offcutter on a shorter length, pulled to deep square leg for one.
Back of a length again, Southee looks to smash but misses/
Catching practice. Back of a length ball around middle, the offcutter yet again. Southee looks to hit it over long-on but finds the big man Pollard there. Four-ball duck for Southee.
Short ball, pulled to fine leg. But he doesn't take a run. Understandable.
Almost there! A perfect yorker on middle and leg, Rinku manages to dig it out.
Slower full toss on off, drilled to mid-off.
Once again the run denied. Rinku moves across to scoop it over fine leg but mistimed it. Thought about a run and then sent Varun back.
This is very full on off, hit to midwicket. Five dot balls,
short on sixth stump at 134 kph, mistimes a cut into the ground to backward point.
good length ball on middle at 134 kph, flicked through backward square leg for two.
good length ball on fifth stump, left alone by Rohit.
Rohit charges Southee who darts in a length ball into the hips and Rohit can't whip this away.
length ball on seventh stump at 133 kph, slapped straight to cover on the ring.

back of a length on the hips, Rohit goes back to defend and it looks like he misses a back foot prod with the ball going off his back leg to the keeper. Rohit doesn't move, the appeal for caught behind is denied. KKR goes for the review. Looked fairly straightforward. All sorts of large spikes on ultra-edge before and after the ball passes the bat as well as while the ball is passing the bat. So many wild and large deviations there on the ultra-edge that it's hard to differentiate them. It looked like there was a gap between bat and ball too. But the third umpire says he's convinced one of those outrageous spikes had to be bat on ball. Decision overturned. Rohit is steaming as he walks off.
good length ball on off, defended to cover.
back of a length on the legs, late on a flick but it goes off the thigh guard past the keeper to the fine leg rope.
fullish length on fifth stump at 139 kph, goes to punch through cover and miscues it back to the bowler.
back of a length on fifth stump at 137 kph, punched to cover.
overpitched on the stumps, just a simple firm punch back through mid-off to the rope.
good length ball on middle, flicked into midwicket for one.
length ball on fifth stump, goes to punch this and is beaten by extra bounce.
good length ball on off at 129 kph, defended into the off side.
length ball on fourth stump, goes to pull and is beaten for pace, miscues this off the toe tamely into the covers.
short and wide at 134 kph on sixth stump, goes to cut and slashes this over slip to the rope.
length ball outside off, goes to cut again and misses.
length ball on sixth stump at 125 kph, punches this behind point for one.
fullish length on fourth stump at 140 kph, smashes back past the non-striker to the mid-off rope.
length ball on fifth stump at 141 kph, leans back from leg stump to try to uppercut over point and misses.
back of a length on fourth stump at 141 kph, leans back again from leg stump and pokes this behind point for one.
back of a length on sixth stump, pokes this behind point for one.

short and wide almost on the wide guideline, toe edges a cut wide of slip and a sliding effort at the third man rope winds up being in vain because the fielder was in contact with the rope while knocking it back into play.... or not? Third umpire deemed it was a legal effort and rules it two? That's even stranger than the decision on Rohit's wicket.
short and wide again, sliced behind point and this time the third man fielding slides to his left, no doubt about the cleanliness of this effort inside the rope, and relays it back for two.
back of a length on off at 144 kph, tap and run into the covers for a quick single.
length ball on seventh stump, goes to swat this 138 kph delivery and a toe edge fails to carry to the keeper.
length ball pulled into the leg side for one.
back of a length on fifth stump at 142 kph, goes to cut, cramped for room and top edges this over the keeper and slip to the rope.
back of a length on middle at 143 kph, defended to Russell.

Russell keeps banging away on this same fifth stump back of a length ploy and it finally pays off! Tilak is cramped for room going onto his toes to cut, edge carries comfortably to Rana at chest height at slip.
full on sixth stump, slams a drive back into Narine's feet to save four.
back of a length on off, goes back to flick into midwicket for one.
back of a length on fifth stump, defended to midwicket.
good length ball slides down leg, wide called.
good length ball on off, tap and run into the covers for one.
fullish length on middle, flicked through midwicket for one.
back of a length on sixth stump, tap and run into the covers for one.
good length ball on fifth stump, pushed into the covers for one.
good length ball tapped away for one.
another fullish ball tapped away through the ring for one.
fullish length poked to point.
charges a full ball on sixth stump and smokes a drive through extra cover to the rope.
full outside leg, flicked wide of long-on for two.
back of a length on fourth stump, Ramandeep leans back and cuts behind point to the sweeper for one.
short on fifth stump, slaps this through midwicket for one.
full on off, flicked to long-on for one.
full on sixth stump, smears a drive through to wide long-on for one.
darts this in very flat and quick landing outside leg, beats a prod and thuds into the back leg in front of middle before going to third man for an extra.
good length ball defended.
fullish length on fourth stump, charge and drive toward long-off for a tumbling stop by Southee to keep it to one.
full on middle, flicked to long-on for one.
good length ball punched down the ground again for one.
full on the legs, flicked behind square for one.
full and wide, backs away from leg to slice a drive over cover and backspins away from the sweeper sliding to his left to keep this to two.
fullish length ball on sixth stump, goes to drive and misses, goes through the keeper's legs too for a bye.
length ball on sixth stump, goes to drive and misses.
slower ball full on off, shuffles across to flick through midwicket for one.
full on middle, driven to long-on for one.
short and wide, slapped to the point sweeper for one.
goes for wide yorker at 130 kph, sends down a knee high full toss on fifth stump, and Shreyas gives a red matador cape effort at extra cover with an ole as the ball passes underneath him to the rope.
full on the stumps, flicked through the ring for one.
short on sixth stump, pulled through midwicket for two.
back of a length on the legs, flicked through midwicket for one.
length ball on fourth stump, tries to heave this over midwicket and it winds up being skied tamely to short third man. Simple catch on the ring at chest height for Rana.
David starts in fourth gear! Bounced at 140 kph, he creams a pull behind square one bounce over the rope.
goes for yorker and instead it's a shin height full toss at 144 kph on off stump, just a simple firm punch back past Russell to the mid-on rope.
hat-trick of fours to start his innings! This time bouncer on fourth stump, David swats a front foot pull through midwicket to the rope.
full on middle, defended.
short on middle, goes back to pull through midwicket for one.
my goodness! A dot ball to David! Back of a length on fourth stump, punched firmly back to Narine.
two in a row! His strike rate is down to a measly 240.00 Fullish length on fourth stump, flicked to midwicket.
slants this across fourth stump on a good length, defended back to Narine.
another good length ball slanted wider this time onto sixth stump, slapped away through cover for one.
fullish length on middle, prods this back just short of Varun reaching forward in his follow-through.

David looked futile against spin and finally falls! 12 off 3 balls to start his innings against Dre Russ, 1 off his final 6 balls against a combination of Narine and Varun. He gets a length ball on middle that he tries to heave over the leg side rope but skies a top edge that swirls around before coming down into the hands of deep midwicket at chest height 15 yards inside the rope.
back of a length on the legs, Pollard shuffles forward only to kick this away.
Pollard sends this into orbit over long-on! Overpitched, at least in terms of how long Pollard's arms can reach, and he stretches forward to slaughter this high and deep down the ground.
not quite as theatrical this time to a good length ball flicked down the ground for one.
good length ball on the body, goes to initially play a shot before awkwardly leaving as the extra bounce thuds this into the shoulder.
good length ball flicked into midwicket and they scamper a tight run.
short ball on off, rocks back to muscle a pull that just clears the man at deep midwicket.
full on fifth stump, reaches forward to chip this to long-on for one. Half-century up for Ishan Kishan off 41 balls. Generous applause from around the ground. Third fifty this season.
good length ball, mistimes this off the pads behind point.

dropped at midwicket by Shreyas! Pollard charges a length ball and annihilates this with a pull to Shreyas, didn't have to move but it came at a blinding pace at shoulder height to his left side. It bursts through and goes for one. That was 9/10 on difficulty. Straight to him but the speed of the ball made it tough to hold onto, as it showed.
good length ball flicked away for one.

starts with a bouncer on middle and a top edge swirls to deep backward square leg where Rinku Singh continues to show off his catching prowess by holding onto this steepler 10 yards in from the rope, taking the catch falling forward to cushion the ball in.
back of a length on fifth stump, tap and run to get away.
length ball on fifth stump, wild heave dragged through midwicket for one.
bounces another one out in this over! Short on middle at 141 kph, goes to pull and a top edge goes off the helmet and flutters to the keeper.
short and tailing into the body, M Ashwin tries to uppercut this and misses.

a trifecta of short ball wickets in this over for Cummins! M Ashwin tried to uppercut the first ball he faced but missed. This time he middles it... but sends it straight to Varun Chakravarthy on the third man rope. Sharp catch taken reaching above his head while staying balanced a foot inside the rope.
good length ball on fourth stump, flicked through midwicket for two.
full on the legs, flicks at this and misses off the pads behind square for an extra.
full on the legs, flicked through midwicket for one.
back of a length into the pads at 130 kph, misses a flick and another leg bye goes behind square for one.
good length ball on off at 133 kph, defended back to Southee.
back of a length on leg, Kartikeya backs away from leg stump but punches straight to cover.
full on the legs, goes to flick and can't get it away.
Pollard backs away from the stumps to a 134 kph ball bowled back of a length over leg stump, Pollard can't get bat on this trying to go inside out over the off side.
short on leg stump, Pollard clears the front leg and pulls flat to deep square leg for one.
bouncer on the stumps, tries to uppercut this 139 kph delivery but it's out of reach, wide called on height.

length ball on middle and leg, chips this just short of mid-on and they set off for a dicey single. Direct hit from the mid-on fielder from 20 yards out is going to the third umpire but he's just in by a few inches.
short on the body at 138 kph, flicks a pull behind square for one.

length ball on off stump, shuffles way across for this 139 kph delivery to flick behind square. It was the final ball of the over so they wanted an even numbered outcome. Dot, two, four or six. But Pollard wanted the strike for the next over and that's the only reason Kartikeya came back for two because it was never on in a million years. The relay catches him short by six yards.
slower ball angled down leg at 113 kph, Pollard misses a one-handed flick and it comes off the lower part of the thigh guard to the keeper for a dot.

dropped! Mile high skier is fumbled by the keeper! But they will get the runout in a chaotic sequence! Length ball on the stumps, Pollard goes to heave this over midwicket and skies this behind the stumps. It swirls round and round where Jackson is twisted in knots before diving forward and can't hold on. But full credit to the awareness of both Chakravarthy and Shreyas. They never stopped playing. Chakravarthy was prepared for a possible drop and backed up Jackson to field and throw to Shreyas, who alertly covered the striker's stumps and has Pollard short by several yards.

Back to back runouts end it! Length ball into the hips, goes to tap and run into midwicket. But Rinku is on the scene to charge, field, and fire from 12 yards out, his momentum taking him toward square leg before unleashing a skiddy one-bounce direct hit with one stump to aim at and catches Bumrah a yard short.
outswinger, on a length, Gaikwad defends it to mid-off
slightly short of a length, he opens the face, and takes the single to short third man
he has a deep square leg, but Conway has flicked this full inswinger in front of that man for four. Superb placement
better line now, outside off, punched to mid-off
short of a length, just outside off, defended back to him
seam movement. This one shapes up to be an inswinger, and then pitches and leaves Conway. Beaten on the drive
good bounce, but the line is down the leg side, with fine leg up. Lucky there is no tickle
movement away from the batter, left alone outside off
short of a length, outside off, pulled to short midwicket
short of a length, at his hips, Gaikwad manages to drop it to the right of cover for a single
on a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
pulled away but there is a deep square leg in place to keep them down to one
on a length, on the pads, helped into the leg side for a single
what a player Gaikwad is. He laid into Umran Malik too. Bumrah too. The faster you bowl, the harder he comes at you. Gives him thew charge first ball and disdainfully lofts him over long-on
cut away this time, expecting a short ball, but there is deep point to keep them down to one. It is a no-ball
on a length, down the leg side, helped away, using his pace, fine of that deep square leg, for four
on a length, on off, Conway opens the face for a single
late-cut, to the left of deep point, but Powell is too quick to take him on for the second
full and wide, driven to deep point for one
looks like a slower ball, registered at 134ks, fullish, outside off, punched to cover
this one ducks in off short of a length, hits him on the thigh pad
on a length, outside off, pushed softly towards mid-on for one
short of a length, no room, steered to third man for one
pulled in the air but falls well short of deep square leg
runs this down to third man for another single
on a length, angling in, soft hands, they steal a single to mid-on
arm ball, swinging away from the left-hand batter, defended back to him
he reverse-sweeps now, but can't beat backward point. Gets a single, though
on a length, no room, looks for a single to cover but is sent back
down the wicket, not to its pitch, gets a single to deep midwicket
superb shot. Down the wicket, close enough to it to be able to go back over his head, and sends it straight for a flat six
he repeats the dose. Gives him the charge again, and lofts him over the bigger boundary on the leg side. Clears deep midwicket with ease
big wide as Thakur tries a bouncer. Pant does well to get a hand on it after leaping full length
short of a length, no room, he still manages to open the face an d get a single
opens the face, takes a single
short of a length, punched to midwicket
up and over against hard length. This man can play pace very well. He has played this on the up, but has managed to clear cover-point
full ball now, not the best of connections, but he has cleared mid-on with ease. Falls just inside the rope
slower ball, short of a length, worked into the leg side for a single
on a length, into the pads, worked away for one
slow in the air, on a length, worked to leg for one
flatter, quicker, just short of a length, cramps him up and draws a dot
on a length, middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
hard sweep to a length ball outside off, gets a single to long leg
beaten in the flight as Gaikwad skips down the wicket, but he manages to get an inside edge onto the pad
on a length, punched against the turn to long-on for one
is that dropped?. It is the slider, out of the front of the hand, Gaikwad looks to late-cut, gets a big deflection, so hardly fair to call it a drop
looks like the wrong'un, uppishly driven to long-off for one
so that is the plan. Gaikwad going after pace, Conway taking spin on. Down the wicket, gets under a length ball, and sends it over the short boundary at wide long-on
swept in the air to capitalise on the short leg boundary. Against the turn but gets enough to get a six over square leg
and now the big boundary. Kuldeep compensates by going full and wide, and he drives past it extra cover for four. Sweeper stands no chance
short of a length, punched to deep midwicket for one
driven on the up to deep cover for one
flat, quick, opens the face, takes a single to short third
driven on the up, straight to deep cover, brings up his third consecutive fifty
beaten in the air as he gives him the charge, the thick inside edge saves him from a stumping again
yorker, dug out, but not wide enough of Axar for a single
Gaikwad skips down the wicket to york himself up but gets a single to long-off
short of a length, draws a bottom edge on the cut with some turn, concedes just the single
reverse-swept but Nortje at short third man saves three runs with a full-length dive
big wide down the leg side
lovely shot. Drives deliberately in the air, over extra cover, for a four. Kuldeep has gone wide again to protect the short leg boundary, but Conway loves cover-drives
fired in, just short of a yorker, and he has drilled this straight of extra cover and wide of long-off for a four
oh he is peppering the extra-cover boundary. DC doing nothing to make him change up. Powerfully lofts this full ball over extra cover for a hat-trick of fours
and immediately Gaikwad takes pace on. This is such a dovetailing stand. Nortje starts with a slower one, and he lofts him over mid-off for four. He began Nortje's first ball of the over for a six
steers this one for a single to third man
full and straight, played back to Nortje
down the wicket, Nortje shortens the length, he runs it down to third man for one
uses all his pace for a late-cut. Short-arm jab really. Deliberately in the air and over point
finally a wicket for DC. Nortje produces the point of difference. A sharp bounder aimed at the melon. And high pace too: 152.6ks. Gaikwad is late on the pull, and midwicket takes the miscue
legcutter to start off with, but short and wide, and he cuts him away for four into the big boundary
pulled between deep midwicket and long-on, and the direct hit gives him two extra overthrows
full legcutter, driven down the ground for one
Warner misfields at extra cover to let him get off the mark
yorker, outside off, runs it to short third for one
short of a length, outside off, gets a single to backward point
nice dip and turn to beat the bat as Dube defends outside off
on a length, straight, worked to leg for one
Conway still looking for the big sweep into the big boundary, but the drift beats him
fired down the leg side, wide
short boundary doesn't matter when you go down the ground. Down the wicket early and lofts him over long-on for yet another six. He is constantly going against the turn
fired into the pads, punched down to long-on for one
nice dip and drift, no turn, through, hits his pad but headed down leg
full and wide, driven in the air to deep cover for one
looks for the big loft down the ground to a length ball. Misses completely
slower ball, full and wide, too wide
short of a length, wide, punched square of deep cover for two
short of a length, too wide again
full and wide, opens the face, gets it between deep cover and deep point. Comes back for two
short, still wide, pulled down the ground, on the bounce to long-on
close ton the umpire on the release, full, outside off, driven to long-off for one
short, shoulder high, Conway helps it along with the pull. Wide of long leg
short of a length, quick, no room, inside edge for a single
nails the yorker, on off, dug out back to him
dug in short now, 143ks, bottom edge on the pull for a single
Dube finally gets one away. Only just, mind. The short ball gets big on him, and the pull is a mis-hit, but it just clears midwicket for four
short of a length, Dube hits him down the ground for a single. Again a mis-hit
slower offcutter, wide outside off
slower offcutter again, Dube looking for a six over long-off, gets a thick edge, Axar Patel runs in from deep cover, but fails to catch it as he dives forward. Dropped
looking to pull a wide ball, gets a front edge to long-off for a single
the slower offcutter has become too predictable now. Dube is now setting himself up for it, and sends it for a humongous six back over his head. Too predictable and too full
he is bowling half-volleys to a man who loves half-volleys. And too predictable with his slower balls. Over long-off he goes this time
digs this offcutter in, draws a bottom edge to the keeper
on-pace for a change, but a length ball, and he has slogged this wide of long-on. This has been an ordinary over
yorker, right on the money, dug out, and Dube calls him through for one. Conway is gone if Khaleel hits but he misses
full, into the pads, cramping him up, whipped to leg for one

Conway has lost rhythm and now that he tries for a ramp, all he gets is a faint edge to Pant. No boundary since he was 81, I think. Khaleel has bowled the offcutter to draw the edge from him, and Pant dives to take the catch
sharp bouncer, Rayudu looks for the upper-cut but is beaten by the bounce
slower bouncer now, beats Rayudu on the pull this time. Just cuts away from him
screaming bouncer, but too high. Wide
slower offcutter, on a length, beats the slog as Rayudu is through the shot early
full and wide, away from his reach, but Dube still tries to go over long-off. Manages only the cue end. Caught at long-off
and he quietens the crowd with a dead-bat defence to a slower offcutter
and the roof comes off again. He jumps out of the crease and lofts Marsh for a flat six over long-on. Doesn't matter it is pace on, doesn't matter it is hard length
anticipates the shorter length, stays back, late-cuts him between short third and point. The crowd goes wild again
bouncer but too high and also possibly down leg
on a length, pace on, punched down to long-on for a single. The crowd goes down again
Rayudu gets bat on ball finally. Drives this full ball to deep cover for one
and Rayudu gets his first boundary now. Khaleel gives him length and width, and he crashes it through point for four. Goes deep in his crease to create the length
and to the plan he bowls. Short and wide outside off. Extra bounce too. Offcutter too. Rayudu's upper-cut into the bigger side goes to deep point
and he goes short, but slightly down leg, and Moeen gets enough of a top edge on it for four to fine leg
quick bouncer, chest high, pulled for a single into the leg side
Dhoni shuffles across to look to help him to leg but it is too wide to be able to place it. Square leg keeps them to a dot
called a wide even though Dhoni is standing on off stump. Slower ball, wide again, and beats him. Slightly harsh call, I feel

not the cleanest hit but Dhoni has found a counter to Khaleel's plan. Instead of going to the big square boundary on the off side, he flat-bats this short and wide ball down the ground. It goes straight of the diving Warner at long-off
Short of a length ball outside off has Warner waft from where he's standing. Beaten.

A bit of a mix-up but safe, Length ball outside off was pushed to cover, Warner called and sent his partner back in time. The throw came in and replays show he would have been safe. But he took time while turning.
Full outside off, driven to mid-off's left. The call of 'wait' was clear this time.
Yorker length ball just over the boots beats the clip, hits the pad and goes in front of square
Tucks a length ball around off to deep-square leg, the fielder runs to his right and stops it

Slashes, outside edge goes for six! It was a length ball outside off and DW tried to flay it over cover but it went over third man which has the short boundary. It looked to go up but ended up clearing the fence
Late swing finds the outside edge but it's safe again! It was a good length ball that went away and Bharat drove, it took the edge and went well past the slip fielder and in the gap for four
Full outside off, cracks a drive to the left of cover and it scoots for four
Length ball on leg beats the flick and hits the pad but it looked to be too high and maybe going down leg too
Length ball outside off swings away again, this time it beats the cut

Freak dismissal, pulled to slip! It was a back of a length ball coming in, Bharat rolled with the pull, it took the bat and then went on the forearm, ballooned to the right of slip who took it easily. Simarjeet celebrates
Outside edge off a length ball outside off flies to third man on a bounce or two. Marsh went with the extended backfoot punch and it looked to have bounced more than he expected.
Driven on the up, finds the cover fence. It was on a good length outside off, Marsh went through with the conventional drive, got it to the left of cover for four
Back of a good length ball goes away with the angle outside off and is left alone
Cutter outside off beats Marsh as he tries the cut.
Test match lengths, back of a good length on fifth stump. Left alone
Works a back of a length ball on off to deep-midwicket
Goes back and extends the pull and it clears the ropes! It was on a length and Warner's initial movement allowed him to get it around the waist and he swung through, went over deep-midwicket
Good length just outside off, pushed to long-off

Extra bounce beats the pull! It was off a back of a good length and shot up, Warner backed away but continued with the pull, may have been the momentum taking through. Went past him with no contact made.
Wide yorker-length ball is left alone
Length outside off, slapped to deep-backward point.
Defends a length ball just outside off to cover
Drags a length ball around fifth stump to the right of deep-midwicket, it was and in the gap enough to allow two
Warner takes on the new bowler with a slash over deep-cover. It was slow and sat up off a good length outside off, the hands went through and the ball went inside-out on its way to the fence.

LBW given, Warner reviews. This looked adjacent. It came after DW missed the reverse, the ball was on a length and the ball went past the bat before contact could be made. Umpire's call, hitting the top of off! Warner is not pleased and has a word with the umpire.
Flatter length ball beats the pull as the front leg came out of line and the bat coming through. Looked like it was pitching down leg
Pant whacks it straight and tumbles over and the ball goes over the bowler for four! It was on a length outside off, he wound up but got enough connection to clear mid-off
Comes down the track and whacks it again! It was fuller on leg and the drive went over mid-off for four more.
Carrom ball on a length just outside off tucked Rishabh as he tried to cut it, the ball went off the shoulder of the bat and went well to the right of short-third, through where the slip was
Marsh joins in with a lofted off-drive over the ropes! It was full outside off, the follow-through was full and the ball sailed over
Around a length outside off, Marsh unconvincingly prodded and retrieved the bat. Beaten
Cutter on a back of good length outside off is driven to cover-point
Length ball on the hips, turned to square-leg
Back of a length over off, pulled into the ground towards midwicket
Pulls a short ball around the ribs just in front of square. It was in the gap and raced to the fence
Beats deep-midwicket to his left and gets four! The cutter was full on the legs, Marsh flicked it in the air, the ball went some distance away from Dube there, and he was not able to make it.
Length coming in front of off, pushed to extra cover standing on the circle for one
Comes down the track and checks the flick after shaping up to follow through, the ball went slowly to deep-midwicket and the deftness along with good running allowed two
Low full toss has Pant try the flick, it went in the air and fell safely at mid-on on its way to long-on
Cuts a length ball outside off into the pitch and it races to the sweeper cover fence
Yorker outside off has Marsh jam the bat behind him but the ball goes past to the keeper
Full on the boots, swept to deep-backward square along the ground
Slow on a length outside off, the 88 kph ball comes in and is hit back to the bowler off a horizontal bat

Slog went up and stayed up, it is taken at long-on! It was full and wide outside off, the bat turned in the hand and Marsh knew he was in trouble. The ball was in the air a while, Ruturaj waited and settled under it. Took it cleanly
Good length on middle, goes back and flicks it to midwicket
Full just outside off, defended to midwicket
Bends and pulls a short ball to deep-square leg
Works a length ball on the stumps to deep-midwicket
Slow on a good length outside off, chopped off the bottom edge to short-third man
Full toss on middle, shapes for the whack and hits it into the ground on to long on with a whip
Goes back and drives a length ball outside off to cover
Back of good length outside off, defended to cover off the backfoot
Full outside off, pushed to cover
Leg-bail falls as Pant chops on! Pant looked distraught after chopping a length ball outside off, while backing away, and it went off the underedge into the pitch and then the stumps.
Goes back to a good length ball just outside off and pushes it to cover
Gets a sighter and then sends the next ball way over the midwicket fence! It was flighted and full on off, Ripal went on one knee and slogged it with all his might and it sailed over the fence

Ripal tries the big shot again and holes out to deep-midwicket! A slightly shorter ball than the previous one, on a good length, on middle and off, and Ripal swung through it again. It went straight up and Conway took it easily in the deep.
Full and flighted outside off, beats Axar on the lunging cover drive
Good length just outside off, punched to long-off

Through the gate! It was a good length ball coming in slightly and Axar went with the full-faced drive, the ball went through and took off-bail on its way. Axar walks back gesticulating there was little he could done about that jaffa. It literally hit just the bail!
Back of a good length ball outside off, pushed to deep-point
Cramped on the pull is Powell but it's safe. It was on a back of a length and the ball went off the bottom to mid-on and rolled from there to the fielder in the deep
Flashes at a full ball outside off and the edge goes to third man, stopped well by Simarjeet

Edged and taken! Powell went for the hard slash off the back of a length ball which went away with the angle. It was on the seventh stump, at least, and took the thin edge over the sticker and went to MS who pouched it easily.
Good length outside off, pushed to cover off the backfoot
Good length just outside off is pushed after going back to the right of the bowler
Full on leg-stump, nurdled to deep-square leg
Reverses a full ball on off, gets a thin edge and goes towards point
Good length on middle and leg, defended to the right of the bowler
Full on middle, pushed to the bowler
Full on leg, Moeen drifted it in and Kuldeep lunged forward and defended to the bowler
Full on leg, beats the flick and dribbles towards deep-square leg off the deflection
Bumper pitches on leg and beats the pull but it is over the head. Wide
Good length outside off, steers the cover drive to the left of the fielder in the deep
Bravo leaps to his left and latches on to the ball in the follow-through. It came after the length ball was punched into the ground to his left
Works a ball into the pitch on the stumps to deep-midwicket
Full on leg, clipped to short-midwicket
Full on off, flicks it to the left of Bravo, who went down low to his left as the ball burst through on its way to long-on
Full outside off, takes the inside half of the cover drive on its way to the bowler
Comes down and defends a full ball back to the bowler
Full on leg-stump, gets down on the sweep. Goes to deep-backward square
Goes back and tucks a length ball on off to deep-square leg
Full just outside off, defended with an open-faced bat to point
Full on middle, clipped to square-leg
Good length down leg, beats the flick and takes the pad on its way to short-fine leg
Good length on off, gets the outside edge while trying to turn it to midwicket. Goes towards cover

Run-out chance missed! It came after the length on middle and off was clipped to midwicket in the deep, the fielder came in and threw it hard. The bowler tried to take it with one hand on his right but the ball popped through.
Full outside off, pushed towards mid-off, short-cover stops it
Yorker on middle and leg, clipped to deep-square leg
Clips a full ball on the stumps to deep-square leg
Cuts a length ball outside off into the ground to cover

Sliced, goes straight up and it is taken at backward point! It was a length ball outside off, Kuldeep swung through the line and the ball took the top-edge, went up and Uthappa settled underneath and took a dolly
Ducks down to a short ball over leg. Wide.
Good length outside off, pushed with an open-faced to backward point who is well in the circle

Another run-out chance missed! UIthappa throws it from cover-point and misses the direct hit at the non-striker's end. It came off a back of a length ball outside off driven to the right of point. Nortje dropped and picked up the bat again and somehow made it.
Full on the stumps, driven to long-on
Good length on middle, stands still and punches it back to the bowler.
Full ball on the legs, clipped to deep-square leg. He refused the single.
Slaps a full ball outside off over long-on. First boundary in 40 balls It was full outside off, whipped in the air for six
Full outside off, pushed to long-off and he takes the run this time
Goes back and drives a length ball outside off to cover
Inside edges a good length ball on middle by using a full-faced bat. He was squared up and back in his crease but the bat angle helped
Defends a length ball on off to cover
Length ball outside off is creamed nonchalantly and it is in the gap and beats deep-point to his left. He went on a knee and eased it through with a horizontal bat
A harder slap this time to similar length ball, a bit slower and Thakur kept it in the air and cleared cover in the ring
Strangled down leg! It was a length ball pitching down leg, Thakur tried to nudge it fine. It took the edge and went low to MS' left and he took it. Bravo and Thakur have a friendly chat with smiles.

Slower yorker dips like a nacho and hits the stumps. Bravo runs around in celebration, it was low, Khaleel's bat went down from up, he stood still while he did it, the ball went underneath the bat and made its way to the stumps

what?! Another first-ball duck for Virat Kohli! It was gentle, innocuous delivery, fuller on the pads. Kohli chipped it on the leg side but failed to keep it down. A simple catch for Williamson at short midwicket
flatter and quicker, on a length. But down the leg side
length ball around off, goes back and works it towards deep midwicket
length ball on the stumps, defended
length around off, punched back towards the bowler
quicker and fuller on the stumps, flicked towards short midwicket
length ball on the stumps, pushed back. An excellent over from Suchith
length ball around off, defended from the crease
length ball outside off, opens the face of the bat to run it past the slip fielder
fuller outside off, drives it to the left of mid-off, Williamson makes a sliding stop to keep it to one
length ball outside off, goes back and punches it towards extra cover
fuller around off, comes forward and wrists it towards mid-on. Not much power behind it though and mid-on cuts it off easily
cuts him in half. A length ball starting from well outside off and nipping back in sharply to beat the inside edge
fuller but down the leg side. This time Pooran too fails to stop it. They run one before short fine leg could stop it
too full on the stumps, goes for the slog to midwicket but fails to middle it. The ball though runs past the square leg fielder, who puts in the chase and the slide to flick it inside
worked towards midwicket off the front foot
pushed to the right of the bowler who makes a diving stop
uses his feet to come down the ground and hit him over the non-striker, didn't really middle it but still enough on it to easily take it to the boundary
fuller around off, drives it inside out towards long-off

almost chipped back. A length ball around off. Looks like it stopped a bit at the batter who was a touch early into the push. Luckily for him it was well to the left of Suchith put in the dive but couldn't get a hand on it
down the track to this length ball and looks to whip it on the leg side. Gets an inside edge onto the body
once again charges towards the bowler and pushes this length ball towards long-off
slightly fuller length outside off, punched towards sweeper cover
fuller outside off, looks to hit it through extra cover but the bat face closes slightly on the impact and the ball rolls towards long-off
smashed! Not much wrong with the ball. A length delivery around off, was a legcutter. Patidar stood on the front foot and launched it over long-on. Way over long-on
length ball around off, pushed towards mid-on for a quick single
starts with a fuller one around off, punched back towards the bowler
length ball on the pads, Patidar tucks it behind square leg and picks up an easy boundary
fuller on the stumps, looked like a slower one. Pushed towards long-off for a single
another slower one. A length ball around off, du Plessis stays back and forces it towards extra cover
short, down the leg side but he gets away with it. du Plessis turns it towards fine leg
fuller around off, comes forward and punches it towards mid-off
short of length around off, du Plessis transfers the weight and pulls it over deep midwicket for a 75-metre six
length around off, du Plessis once again goes for the pull but cannot get his timing right. Ends up hitting it towards deep square leg
just evades Pooran. Short outside off, Patidar slashes at it, gets an outside edge but it goes over a leaping Pooran
short of length outside off, dabbed towards backward point where the fielder throws himself to his left to make the stop
length ball on the stumps, flicked uppishly towards deep square leg
short, wide and going further way. du Plessis ignore it
on the shorter side again. du Plessis swivels and pulls it down behind square leg. The fielder at deep square leg had no chance
fuller on the stumps, goes for the slog sweep but fails to middle it. A single to deep midwicket
length ball on the pads, flicked behind square leg for another single
length ball around middle and off. Looked like it stopped a touch. Defended from the back foot
down the track but Suchith shortens his length and bowls outside off. Patidar had to changes his shot and almost reaches out to dab it towards cover-point
length ball, Patidar stays back this time and launches it over long-on from the back foot
slogged towards deep midwicket this time. Calls for two and du Plessis sprints back and beats the throw
length outside off, punched square of the wicket on the off side
short and wide, and Patidar says thank you for the extra pace. Stays back and just punches it over extra cover for four
148.3kph. Short and wide outside of once again, Patidar cuts it towards sweeper cover
145kph. Slightly fuller outside off, du Plessis clears his front leg and hits it to the right of mid-off, the fielder puts in the dive but cannot stop it

dropped! And looks like it has gone for the boundary too. Injury and insult on the same ball. du Plessis once again cleared his front leg and tried to hoick it on the leg side. Didn't middle it though. Tripathi dived to his left at midwicket, got a hand on it but it didn't stick. Buvneshwar ran to his right from long-on, reached there in time but failed to flick it back. Sloppy work
du Plessis doesn't mind the extra pace. In fact, he is loving it. Once again clears the front leg and despatches it over wide long-on

another dropped catch, and some more salt to that wound. Fuller around off, Patidar looks to go aerial down the ground but gets an outside edge towards short third man. The fielder charges in, dives forward but it goes through his hands and reaches the third man boundary
fuller on the leg stump, looks to paddle sweep it but misses. An appeal for lbw but denied. They take a single as the ball goes towards short fine leg
flatter around off, finds the cover fielder with the cut
uses his feet to flick this worked towards midwicket
length ball around off, worked towards deep midwicket for another single
fuller outside off, pushes it towards deep extra cover
a full toss outside off, flays it towards deep extra cover, the fielder makes a sliding stop as the batters come back for the second
length ball angling across, cuts it towards deep point
a slower bouncer angling across the batter. Patidar leaves it alone
fuller around off, hits it towards long-off for one
fuller and wider, was another slower one. du Plessis decides not to chase it
fuller and wider and du Plessis slices it through the point region to end the over with a boundary
Full on off, driven to long-on
Slow outside leg, takes the outside leg and goes to leg
Full on off, takes the outside edge off the nurdle and falls in front
Good length on middle and off, tucked to deep-midwicket
Steps down and clips a full ball on the stumps to deep-midwidwicket
Short of a good length ball spins in to middle and is clipped to deep-midwicket again
Length outside off, beaten on the cut
Cuts him in half! Back of a length ball comes in and goes over middle. Batter tried the flick but missed
Length ball over middle has Faf swing with the pull, beaten

Slaps a wide ball to get to 50! It was a length ball but there was room and Faf reached out with his torso and let the hands take over with a free swing and the ball went inside out over cover for four
Similar line and length, Faf leans out and tries the cut but underedges it. Goes along the ground to the gap behind the left of the bowler
Short one outside off is over the head and left alone. Left alone
The short ball is better directed this time, came in with the angle on the chest. Punched to deep-cover
Slow and full down leg, Rajat went legside of the ball and tried to heave it. Beaten, falls on the leg and goes to the offside

Whacked to deep-midwicket and it is taken! Rajat stayed legside of the back of a good length ball following him, he opened his hips and took the front-leg out the way and pulled it in the air. It hit the inside-half of the bat. Suchith came and took it down in front. SRH finally hold on to a catch!
Good length middle, shuffles across and clips it to cow-corner along the ground
Length on off, clipped to long-on
Maxi's switched on! Gets into LHB position by changing his grip, he turned in time to connect with the full ball outside off and swung through with full power and timed it to perfection
Full outside off, slaps it hard but straight to cover along the ground
Shuffles and pulls on one leg, a length ball on the hips to deep-fine leg
Beaten for pace! It was a hard length ball outside off and Maxwell tried the backfoot cover drive and was comprehensively beaten
Back of a good length outside off, pushed to short-midwicket's left
Yorker at 150.8 kph at sixth stump has Maxi try and stomp it with the bat but it flies past it
Glorious flowing cover drive scorches on the turf to the fence! Full outside off, around a half-volley so Maxi goes through with the hard drive and finds the gap to the left of Kane at short cover

SRH review a for caught behind, given not-out on-field! It was a bouncer down leg and Maxwell took the front leg out the way and tried the ramp-cut. It was too close for the shot, the ball went over the sticker and then the back of the bat when it came through but there was no contact made. Not-out, remains the decision
Length ball outside off, driven to cover with a horizontal bat for one
Full outside off, swings for the cover drive and misses. It was a cross-seamer that bouncer more than Glenn expected
Tennis ball bounce goes for wide but stops it from going for four. The short ball went well over the head and looped over the keeper's head, Pooran leapt and took it
Tries the Reverse-pull to a length ball outside off and is beaten. He swung himself off balance on going so hard and the ball went quick to beat him
Slower length ball comes in on middle and Maxwell went across and scooped the pull, turned the wrist and sent it over the gap behind short-fine's left
Stays legside of the ball and slaps a length ball just outside off to cover
Pulls a length ball outside off to deep-midwicket
Yorker on leg beats the flick, hits the inner-half on the base of the pads and dribbles slowly behind square for one
Yorker on middle and leg, Faf takes his back-leg out the way with the front-foot to allow access for the flick to long-on along the ground
Slaps a good length ball, well outside off to deep-mid off. The ball is not coming on to the bat as the ball has softened
Whips a low fully on middle to the gap between long-on and deep-midwicket for two
Yorker on middle is well executed. It's flicked to deep-midwicket

In the slot outside off and Glenn latches on it, sends it over the sightscreen for six. The line was okay but the length was where Bhuvi erred, Maxwell swung through and was able to swing through freely

Fazal goes down just after the ball goes to the fence. It was a low full-toss outside off, Faf swung through with his might and the ball went behind point and went along the ground to the fence. Fazal pulled up on the second step in his follow-through, and the right-foot seems to be where the issue is. The therapist massages it and he looks to be okay to continue.

The ball smacks Fazal on the back of the left leg in his follow-through! It came off a whip from a full ball outside off from Faf and it missed the right leg and hit him behind the back-leg over the ankle area
Faf shapes for the slap and the bowler held it back with a slower bouncer. Steered to third. Had the throw hit the striker's end direct, it would have been out

Pulled to deep-square. Maxi went slowly with the first, then called Faf who responded and went back right after the fielder, Tyagi, misfielded. A bit of confusion but the throw was over the keeper which saved Faf
Bouncer on the chest hurries the pull and goes to deep-square leg.
Shapes full the reverse-fine pull and the slower length ball over off was angling away, the contact was not great. So the ball dribbled to short-third.

Misfielded at deep-fine leg by Umran, allows the boundary. It was a half-volley on leg and Maxi flicked it, the ball went to the left of the fielder and he could not bend down enough or reach far enough to get the body behind it
That's like a Nat-Meg from Maxwell, full ball on the legs was flicked to deep-square leg
Was trying to get out the way of a yorker following him, tries to work it to square-leg, gets it off the inner-half of the base of the bat. Goes past the keeper and fine for four
Similar ball after a similar set-up, this time the yorker beats the flick on its way to the keeper
Bhuvi's nailing yorkers for fun! This one on leg, inside edges a flick onto pad, dribbles to the offside for one. Brings up the 50 partnership!
Flicks a low fully on leg to deep-midwicket on one leg
Length outside off, Maxi flaps at it with all his might. The ball was too far and took the toe-edge on its way to the keeper. The siren comes on! Front foot no ball but Tyagi was unperturbed
Close to a yorker just outside off, Maxi leant to his right and drove through it. Didn't get much elevation and the ball went to the left of long-on and managed to stop it
Thrashed... and he finds long-on! It was a full ball on off and he swung across the line, diagonally almost. The ball went flat, to the right of long-on, Markram took it easily.
Good length outside off, DK tries the hard cover drive. The ball came in at 146 kph and it zipped through to beat the bat
DK tries the reverse lap, Tyagi notices the attempt so he holds the length back and hid it outside off. DK tried to pull it but got it off the edge to the keeper on the bounce
Direct hit at the striker's end from long-on! Replays show DK's in as he slid his bat. Slaps a back of a good length ball outside off to long-off and ran like a hare right after
Goes across, gets on a knee and launches a wide ball over deep-midwicket. He sat down and created a fusion between a slog-sweep and a sit-down pull.
Low full toss on off, goes across and lofts it over the left of the bowler. Goes to long-off and they get two
Drills a wide yorker-length ball to wide-long on.
Deep-square leg lets the ball through and it goes for six! DK pulled a length ball outside off and it went flat, straight to Tripathi and it burst through the hands.
Full yorker length ball outside off, DK stood back and managed to whack the ball over long-on. It went over the leaping fielder for six
Three in a row! Stays back and pulls a length ball to deep-midwicket. It goes over the rope and hits the boundary board on the bounce.

A direct hit at the keeper's end. A length outside off, some turn there. Abhishek goes back and punches it towards covers. Sets off for a quick single. Shahbaz Ahmed with the throw and It's touch and go. The third umpire reckons the bat is on the line when the bails came off. Kohli fell for a first-ball duck, Williamson walks back without facing one.
fuller length around off, pushed towards mid-on
worked towards mid-on once again and this time he will get a single
short of length outside off, cuts it towards backward point

bowled 'im! This one doesn't turn. A length ball pitching on a length around off, Abhishek goes for the pull but ends up playing above the ball. Misses completely and the off stump is out of its groove
fuller around off, punched back. Maxwell fields it and flicks it behind. Misses the stumps but I think Tripathi was in
fuller length on the pads, flicked towards square leg
length outside off, punched towards covers off the back foot
length, just outside off. Stays beside the line of the ball and defends
fuller length around off, pushed towards covers. Another dot
short of length around off, hops and punches it towards mid-on for a quick single
fuller length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards short midwicket
short of length starting from outside off and spinning in big. But the length meant Markram could go back and punch it through extra cover. du Plessis with the chase but the ball just wins
use of feet this time from Markram. Wasn't exactly to the pitch of the ball but he held his shape and went through with the shot, sending it over long-off. New balls, please
fuller, targeting the pads. Flicked towards deep midwicket
dropped short on the leg stump. Tripathi goes down on one knee and sweeps it hard towards deep square leg
length ball on the pads, flicked towards square leg
flatter and quicker. Length again on the leg stump, tucked away towards square leg once more
length ball outside off, Tripathi moves across and deep and laps it over short fine leg
length ball angling towards the pads, Tripathi looks to flick it behind square leg but misses and gets hit on the pads
slightly back of length around off and middle. Turned in front of square leg for a quick single. A fumble there makes it a comfortable one
back of length outside off, goes for the cut but ends up chopping it into the ground
length outside off, stands tall and drives it on the up towards mid-off
length ball on the stumps, punched towards mid-on
fuller around off, pushed towards long-off for one
length ball around off, stays back and turns it towards midwicket
length ball outside off, gets low on one knee and scoop-sweeps it over short fine leg
length ball on the stumps, nudges it towards covers and sets off. Kohli swoops in and underarms it to the keeper who breaks the stumps but Markram was home
fuller on the leg stumps, tucked away towards midwicket
quicker, length ball on the stumps. Pushed down the pitch off the back foot
short of length around off, hops and defends it on the off side
short of length outside off, stays leg side of the ball and punches it towards sweeper cover
length ball around off, defended on the back foot
short of length outside off, cuts it away towards sweeper cover. Only a single on this occasion
smoked! Short of length around off, goes back and pulls it over wide long-on for a six
short outside off, cuts it to the right of the point fielder but sweeper cover cuts it off
short of length, wide outside off, cuts it towards deep extra cover
length ball on the stumps, goes back and flicks it towards midwicket
length ball on the stumps, goes back and punches it towards cover
short of length on the stumps, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
short of length around off, rocks back and pulls it to the left of deep midwicket. One-bounce four. That's the longer side of the ground
flatter and quicker on the stumps, pushed back towards the bowler
length ball outside off, goes for the cut but it doesn't come on to the bat properly. Chopped into the ground
length but way outside off, goes for the cut and gets an under edge. Bounces on its way to the keeper
short of length angling towards the off stump, goes back and punches it towards sweeper cover
length ball angling in towards the pads, tucked away towards square leg
fuller around off and middle, pushes it towards long-on

dropped! Length ball around off, Tripathi looks to flick it on the leg side. Gets a leading edge that flies to the right of short third man. Hazlewood dives across, gets his right hand to it but it doesn't stick
length ball on the stumps, worked towards short fine leg
holes out to deep midwicket. Tossed up in the line of the stumps, Markram goes for the slog sweep but fails to clear Kohli who makes it look very casual
fuller length on the pads, flicked behind square leg for a quick single
fuller on the stumps, swept towards deep square leg
length ball outside off, goes back for the cut but ends up under-edging it into the ground
too full on the stumps, Pooran digs it out towards long-on. Shouts of catch it, du Plessis charges in but it lands well short and somehow de Plessis fails to get his body behind it
fuller and wider outside off, some turn as well. Tripathi leaves it and collects a wide
length outside off and turning even further. Another wide
fuller around off, goes for the slog sweep between deep square leg and deep midwicket, and picks up a boundary
length ball outside off, moves across and laps it towards short fine leg
length ball fired across. Pooran ignores it
length ball around off, a little bit of turn. Goes back and pulls it towards deep midwicket
an appeal for caught behind but mainly from the bowler. Ignored. A length ball around off and spinning away. Tripathi misses the cut
length outside off, goes back and cuts it past the diving point fielder to find the boundary
Length outside off, chops hard and is beaten

Misfielded at deep-backward point by Josh allows four! Length ball outside off had Pooran cut late and the ball went to the left of Josh. The ball went up his wrists like in pinball and looped back behind him on to the ropes.
Good length outside off, defended to cover-point
Back of a length (expect a lot more of it) outside off, flicked off the backfoot to deep-midwicket
Length outside off, beaten on the cut
Good length outside off, driven to deep-point. Siraj's towel fell while running in but Pooran was not disturbed.
Length on the hips, Pooran tries to help it fine aerially but misses. Hits the flank, goes to the legside for one
Extends the off-drive and lofts the full ball coming in and the ball goes over the left of the bowler and beats long-off to his right
Wide yorker, just close to the tramline. Left alone.

Oops, that one slipped. The full toss had the batter crouch fully. He sat down and tried to pull it down It looked high, but the batter slouching made it harder to judge. Tripathi was unimpressed but the decision stands.
Pooran takes the unofficial free-hit, sends a length ball over deep-square leg for six.
Slow and full outside off, defended to cover

Spliced and taken! It was tossed up on the stumps, Pooran tried to slog it across the line, the googly took the edge and spooned up. Shahbaz ran in a bit from short-third and leapt forward to take it.
Full on off, pushed to long-on
Length outside off, clipped to deep-midwicket
Full on middle, driven to the left of short-cover, who stops it
Full on middle and off, clipped to long-on
Good length on middle, goes back and tucks it to long-on
Tripathi brings up his 50 with a cover drive!. It was full and on fifth stump, Tripathi launched it over deep-extra cover and it sailed over for six
Full and wide outside off, left alone
Length outside off, pulled to long-on
Back of a length outside off, beaten on the backfoot cover drive. The bat-face opened and the bowler was serious about the appeal, but DK gave nothing, Faf does not review
Short ball at head-height over middle and off beats the attempted pull
Back of a length on the hips, beats the nudge and goes legside after ricocheting off the body

Dropped by Hasaranga at deep cover! It was off a full ball outside off, Rahul reached out and sliced the aerial drive, it was a simple catch. But Hasaranga's eyes were not on the ball, he tried to cup it but it hit him low on the palms and popped to the side.
Back of a length outside off, cut to deep cover
Stumped! Googly on a full length spins away from off and beats the heave. He was off balance and out of the crease, missed the bat-swing and the keeper removed the bails in a flash
Comes down the ground and tries to defend a length ball to cover, beats and hits him on the body. Then falls in front
Full on the legs, beats the nurdle and goes legside off the pads
Full outside off, whacks it straight. It goes over the sightscreen for six

LBW appeal is not given, it's led to an overthrow. RCB review. It was a full ball that beat the slightly open-faced defence and hit the pad. It was hitting the wickets but impact was umpire's call, so it remains not out. Throw went to the bowler's end and he was appealing and there was no one backing up. Since it was given not-out on field, the leg-bye stays
Cuts a length ball outside off to deep-backward point
Pulls a length ball just outside off to long-on along the ground
Goes across and pulls a length ball outside off to long-on, mostly along the ground

Holes out to deep-backward square! It was a length ball outside off and Tripathi dragged it and looked to clear the fielder but the connection was not good enough. The fielder did not have to move much and took it comfortably.
Is that another? Yes, it is! Short ball on the body has Tyagi pull but it came too quick and was a bit too short. The ball took the top-edge and ballooned to point, who took it comfortably.
Full outside off, pushed to mid-off
Full on middle, Shashank tries to slog it over long-on. Takes the inside edge onto the pad

Given LBW, SRH review. It looked plumb as the full ball, pitched around off. The googly came in, beat the inside edge and hit the top of the knee-roll and the off-stump could be seen. But Hawk-Eye shows it to be going over the stumps! Decision reversed.
Holes out at long-on! Shashank came down the track and tried to loft the full ball over long-on but did not connect with it well enough. This, like the last two balls, were googlies.

Another LBW given and reviewed by SRH! It was a full ball pitching on off, came in and hit him full. Hawk-Eye shows half the ball hitting leg-stump and let Hasaranga have his five-fer. So the decision stays.
Another googly, it was full and outside off. Slightly overpitched which allowed the defence to cover to come off the middle
Full on middle, Fazal hangs back and blocks it with the full-faced bat
Length outside off, cut to deep-point
Stays legside of the good length ball down leg-stump and defends it towards mid-on
Length just outside off, batter makes room and slaps it to mid-off
Wide yorker, opens the bat-face fully to push it to the gap between point and cover
Back of a good length ball comes in and is pushed to long-on
Close to a yorker outside off, tries to steer it with a fully open bat-face. It hits the thick inside edge and goes in front
Full and just down leg, it's clipped to mid-on
Bhuvi connects with a straight-pull and gets it inside-out over mid-on. It was a short ball just outside off, he made room and nailed it.
Full outside off, opens the bat-face and steers it to third man
Length ball jumps up and has Fazal try and fend it straight. It took the handle or the glove but fell safely at square-leg
Length on the stumps, clipped to long-on
Full outside off, tries to steer it to third man and is beaten
Full ball down leg, beats the flick but that's a wide
Good length on the stumps, defends it to square-leg
And it's all over! Faf takes a good catch tumbling over after Bhuvi tried to loft a full ball after making room. It went up off the bottom edge and was taken.
length ball angling across, a hint of shape back towards off stump, gets forward to push to short extra-cover
length ball straightening towards middle stump, clipped into the on side and midwicket sprints in to deny the single
back of a length, straightening towards off stump. Looks to work it away for a single and midwicket moves quickly again, to his left this time, to cut it off
drops a touch short on off stump, and de Kock doesn't quite time the pull but gets it over the inner ring, in the gap between midwicket and mid-on

length ball straightening towards off stump, and is KL Rahul run-out without facing??? Yes, he is! Sprints out of his crease quickly as de Kock mistimes his drive, off the inner half of the bat into the off side, and Iyer sprints forward and to his left from short extra-cover, spins around in a jiffy, and throws down the stumps at the bowler's end.
