Rahul, turning around and trying to stretch to regain his crease, is a few inches short. Massive, massive wicket, KKR get LSG's main man without having to bowl a ball to him. Replays suggest QdK called for the run initially and then decided against it
fullish, slanting away from off stump, gets on the front foot and punches to mid-off
length ball nipping in slightly towards middle and leg, hangs back and clips to midwicket
very full, almost in the blockhole, close to off stump, jabbed back defensively to the bowler
back of a length close to off stump, presses forward and looks to flat-bat through the covers, ends up hitting it towards mid-off off the inside half of the bat
shot. Offers a bit too much width there. Fullish, inviting the drive, and Hooda obliges by driving on the up into the gap to the left of cover point

and again, a wide half-volley, and you really don't want to bowl there to this man. He loves hitting over the covers, and he sinks onto his back knee and lets his bat flow through a smooth drive over extra-cover
hits the pitch harder now, on a length and angling in towards off stump. Looks to drive on the up through the covers, and gets a thickish inside edge that rolls away through the square leg region
length ball angling across the stumps, and de Kock sets himself up early, clears his front leg, shifts his weight onto his back foot, and muscles a pull over the jumping fielder at short midwicket

wow. Deep midwicket had just dropped back, but QdK doesn't care. Gets one a touch short from Southee, angling across to off stump, and he plants that front foot forward and towards the leg side, and swats away a glorious pull over the leg-side boundary and into the stands, to the left of the fielder who's just dropped back
carnage. Looks to bowl full and wide, but it's not full enough to deny QdK the drive, gets down low and drives with a full follow-through past the fielder at short extra
length ball angling into off stump, looks to make room and target the off side but gets cramped, chops into the point region
length ball angling into the stumps, clipped away towards the fielder at deep midwicket, to his left
length ball on off stump, lets it come and dabs with soft hands to the right of backward point
floated up and angled into the pads, clipped away into the square leg region
back of a length, spinningin towards off stump, cut firmly to point, who misfields, but the ball only rolls a short distance away so no single conceded
shot. Bowls a length offbreak wide of off stump, and Hooda picks the ball out of the hand (I assume), and frees his arms to hit with the turn, over mid-on, with effortless power
goes flatter and shorter, carrom ball straightening towards middle and off, and he works it away from the crease to deep midwicket
length offbreak straightening towards middle stump, stretches forward and dabs with soft hands into the point region
back of a length, a hint of width, and QdK chops it away and squeezes it into the gap between point and backward point
slow, on the fuller side of a length outside off, driven firmly but straight to extra-cover
sees him step out and fires a length ball into the pads, clipped towards deep midwicket
Poor ball with no one back on the boundary square or behind square on the leg side. Fires it in outside leg stump, and QdK sweeps in the air, over square leg
length ball on leg stump, clipped towards deep midwicket

again, Hooda targets his favourite region. Errs on the full side on off stump, and Hooda steps away from the line to loft it inside-out over extra-cover. Ends with left elbow high, holding his pose as the ball crosses the boundary on one bounce
flat length ball straightening towards middle stump. Looks to clip to mid-on, can't beat the alert fielder at short midwicket
what a shot. A half-volley on leg stump, sure, but the timing is fantastic. Just leans into the ball and clips it into the gap between mid-on and midwicket
very full, slanting into a wide line outside off stump. Looks for the cover drive, but has to reach too far and the bottom hand takes over, drags it back to the bowler with a turn of the wrists
length ball bouncing over the top of leg stump. QdK looks to shuffle across and help it over short fine, but he can't make contact
shot. Back of a length, angling across to off stump. By no means a long-hop, but QdK is ready well in advance, clears his front leg and pulls it up and over midwicket

and again. There's a fielder back at deep square leg, but QdK won't miss out on anything marginally short - which is all this is. Clears that fielder and lands the ball just beyond the advertising hoardings
back of a length, slanting away from off stump, slapped to sweeper cover
on the pads, clipped to the right of deep backward square leg, who has quite a lot of distance to cover running in from the boundary
flat, a touch shorter now, on the pads again, and QdK clips neatly into the gap between deep midwicket and deep backward square leg to pinch another two
back of a length, targeting those pads again, tucked away to deep backward square leg

dropped. Half-chance, you'd say. Steps out to try and hit over long-off, and Anukul bowls it quickly into the pitch, gets it to bite and turn. Slices it away in the air, just clears backward point, and Mavi, turning around and trying to take the catch as the ball drops down from over his shoulder, lets it slip between his hands
down the leg side, looks to sweep and doesn't get all of it, ends up rolling to the left of short fine leg, who makes a diving stop. Brings up an excellent, intent-packed half-century
down the track, looks to hoick over midwicket, gets too close to the ball and under-edges towards short fine leg
back of a length on off stump, looks to make room and cut, can only chop it towards backward point without much power. No room

gone, he's spooned it straight to long-off. Narine bowls a quick one into the pitch, just short of a length and spinning away from off stump. Stops on QdK as he tries to make room to hit over extra-cover. Goes through with the shot, but doesn't get hold of it, and ends up offering a simple catch to the man on the boundary
length ball straightening towards middle and off, defended to short extra-cover
flat, back of a length, angling into leg stump to deny Krunal room. Goes back and punches towards mid-on, who's on the edge of the circle. That positioning allows the hurried single
quick length ball on middle and leg, looks like the carrom ball, but offers no room. Presses forward to push into the covers

a touch shorter, slanting across to off stump, makes room to cut to the left of sweeper cover, and he turns back for a dangerous second run. Has he made it? Yup, just about, the dive gets him home by the time the keeper can whip off the bails
palpable effort to deny the left-hander room. Back of a length and attacking middle and leg, clipped to short midwicket

slower offcutter, turning from leg to middle. Gets forward for a push to the left of short extra-cover, and LSG pick up another tight single. Iyer's throw misses at the bowler's end, but the diving Krunal would have been safe
back of a length on off stump, punched towards cover point

back of a length, straightens towards leg stump to cramp Krunal, who was looking to make room to dab to third man. Ends up beating him and hitting the thigh pad. Pitched outside leg, though, and height may have been an issue too
back of a length on off stump, punched towards extra-cover, who's now on the edge of the circle, so the single is a straightforward affair this time
slower offcutter outside off. Looks to make room to cut but is beaten by the lack of pace

deep third was quite fine, but this is too fine even for him. Length ball angling across the left-hander, nips away slightly. Looks to drive through the covers and gets a thick edge that flies away through the vacant slip region
length ball angling into the pads, skids off the pitch to hurry Krunal for pace. Was looking to dab into the point region, ends up hit on the pad
shot. Short and wide, and Hooda makes a little bit of extra room to uppercut over backward point
now he follows Hooda's attempt to create room by angling a back-of-a-length ball in towards leg stump. Dabbed into the point region
length ball on middle stump, punched towards mid-off

back of a length, and the skiddiness of Harshit continues to bother Krunal. A little late on the pull, and the top-edge goes to Russell at deep third, was in the air but bounced some ten yards in front of him
flat, around leg stump, swept firmly but can't beat short fine leg on the dive

shot. The idea wasn't wrong, he was looking to follow Hooda as he attempted to make room, but he ended up landing the ball right in his hitting arc for a powerful drive over long-on. That's Hooda's 50th six in the IPL

flat, back of a length, holding on the surface and straightening towards leg stump. Looks to work it leg side, closes his bat face early, and lobs the ball in the air but it lands safely in no man's land in the covers
flat, back of a length, straightens towards middle and leg to cramp Krunal, who chops towards extra-cover
steps out and he fires it in at his feet. Driven to long-on
makes plenty of room again and Anukul bowls a flat one at the stumps. Jabs it quietly to sweeper cover for one
looks to make room again and Narine bowls an offbreak on leg stump. Chops it away and extra-cover dives left to stop it

looks to step out and Narine floats one wider to make Krunal reach for the ball. Looks to do that and drive over extra-cover, ends up slicing it over the gap between backward point and short third man
carrom ball sneaking in towards off stump. Not sure he picked it. Looks to push into the covers and squeezes it into the pitch off the inner half of the bat
this goes the other way. Quick offbreak pitching just outside off and straightening past the outside edge as Krunal looks to make room and dab it square
flat and quick, on the stumps, jabbed back down the pitch
back of a length on off stump, makes room and dabs into the point region
slower offcutter finishing just outside off, makes room to cut towards deep cover point
back of a length close to off stump, chopped to sweeper cover
slower short ball on off stump, pulled in the air, one bounce to deep midwicket

Russell strikes, and it's his extra bounce from that hard length that does it. Back of a length, hits the pitch hard, and Hooda, looking to pull from just outside off, ends up with his bat turning in his hands and the ball going higher than intended and not as far. Iyer runs in from the midwicket boundary and completes a straightforward catch
looks for the leg-stump yorker, ends up bowling a low full-toss angling down leg, and it's clipped away neatly but Narine has been stationed very fine at fine leg, so just the two runs
slower length ball close to off stump, shuffles across and clips to deep square leg
shortish slower ball, attacking the body, gets his feet off the ground and defends awkwardly into the leg side
back of a length outside off, dabbed to short third
shortish, skids on to finish on a middle-stumpish line and cramp Badoni on the pull. Dragged away to long leg
past the outside edge. Back of a length offcutter, turns away from a middle-and-off line. No footwork as he looks to punch into the covers
another slower offcutter, shorter this time and offers width. Krunal gets his feet off the ground to ride the bounce and carve it away to beat deep point to his left

into no-man's land. Another short ball angling across, possibly another offcutter, finishing around Krunal's back shoulder. Through his pull too early, and the top edge flies over the keeper, to his left, and he can't turn around and sprint and reach it in time
shortish on off stump, flat-batted to the left of long-on, where Mavi gets to the ball quickly to prevent a second run
low full-toss on off stump, whipped to long-on
steps out and Russell slants a full ball away from his arc. Opens his bat face and steers to the right of deep point

back of a length offcutter finishing around off stump, stays leg-side of the ball and carves it to the right of deep point. Reaches the fielder slower this time, and they have time to hurry back for a second

gone, Russell gets his second, and this time it's the short ball banged hard into the pitch. It's angling away from Krunal, but it gets up above shoulder height, and he can't control the uppercut from that height. Ends up hitting it straight to the man at deep point. He goes for 25 off 27, a genuine struggle of an innings
full on the pads, almost offers the single to deep square leg to keep him on strike for the next over
offbreak on a length outside off, stretches out and paddles to long leg
back of a length carrom ball turning away from off stump, punched to sweeper cover
that wide line again, that premeditated paddle sweep again, and he manages to play it fairly well despite this one turning away from him
length ball outside off, stretches out and opens his bat face to dab to backward point. No effort to go after Narine here
quickish on off stump, presses forward and clips to short midwicket
carrom ball, back of a length, straightens close to off stump, lets it come and dabs to backward point. Just the three runs off the over
slower yorker close to off stump, jabbed back to the bowler
wow, that's steep carry from a fairly full length. Looks to drive into the covers, and the ball straightens and kicks up to beat the outside edge
length ball on off stump, punched towards long-off
slower ball, full and quite wide, driven to deep point
nicely bowled. But ends up juuust outside the tramline. Slower offcutter, on a length and wide, and Stoinis fails to connect with the reaching-out square drive
legcutter bowled hard into the pitch outside off, and Stoinis, looking to hit over mid-off or extra-cover, ends up top-edging over short third man
well bowled. Slower bouncer, turns in like an offbreak from wide outside off, and Stoinis leaves it alone, perhaps not accounting for the turn and hoping for a wide

pffcutter finishing on middle stump, shuffles across and clips through backward square leg. They're checking to see if Badoni completed his first run properly, and it looks tight, but they decide he's okay in the end
back of a length, angling into leg stump, steps across and tucks it to long leg
slower ball, shortish and finishing around off stump, jumps across and works it into the backward square leg region
looks for the leg-stump yorker, maybe, and ends up bowling a quick full-toss down the leg side, past the attempted flick
short outside off, cuts firmly but too close to backward point, who stops it with a dive to his right
in the blockhole on off stump, clipped to long-on
short, rising ball in the corridor, can't control his pull and top-edges in the air, bounces to the right of fine leg

shot. Stoinis was standing with his back foot on off stump, waiting for anything he could swing over the shorter leg side boundary. Marginal error in line from Mavi, his length offcutter ending up on leg stump, and Stoinis whips it away over the backward square leg boundary
shot. Now the error is one of length. Looks to bowl a slower yorker outside off, and ends up offering a knee-high full-toss that Stoinis swipes away over deep midwicket

wow, this is sensational hitting from Stoinis. Short offcutter outside off, and he's almost expecting it. The ball only gets up to chest height, or even lower, and he pulls it with immense power, with the turn, over the midwicket boundary

Got him, but a few feet either side of that fielder and it may have been four sixes in a row. Looks for the cross-seam legcutter on an off-stumpish line, and it's a length ball with Stoinis deep in his crease. He whips it powerfully and flat, but he ends up picking out the fielder at deep midwicket
and there, disappearing over the backward square leg boundary, is the ball. Tries to cramp Holder for room, ends up offering a ball at his pads, and he flicks it away effortlessly

five sixes in the over, and Mavi's figures are in tatters. Wow. The last ball is a slot ball outside off, and Holder clears his front leg and drives cleanly to clear the long-off boundary. T20 hitting is at a level now where the smallest errors disappear for six, and through that over, Mavi's radar simply deserted him
slower ball, back of a length, turning in towards middle stump, swiped away towards long leg
back of a length, angling into the body as cramping Holder as he attempts to clear his front leg. Misses the front-foot hoick, and inside-edges into his body
back of a length is working for Southee through this over. Another offcutter, finishes around off stump, and the attemped pull ends up as a flat-bat hit to long-off
hard length again, angling into leg stump, and Holder, clearing his front leg, ends up forced to hit with a diagonal bat. He aims over midwicket, and ends up top-edging to the fielder at fine leg
back of a length, on pace, over off stump. Looks to flat-bat it through midwicket and misses, and they sneak a quick bye

great finish from Southee here. Goes back of a length again, but angles the ball away from the right-hander and still finishes inside the tramline. Knew Badoni would be looking to create hitting room. Looks to reach out and slap it away, but fails to connect, and this time they can't get the bye, as Indrajith rolls the ball into the stumps at his end and catches Chameera well short
Back of a good length ball zips away with the angle past the outside edge, the batter tried to defend it towards cover
Slightly shorter on a similar line, Indrajith looks to prod at it with an open-faced bat and it beaten
Full on the legs, tries the flick and inside edges it onto his front pad. Falls in front on the legside
Back to ball-2, it was a beautiful good length ball going away. Indrajith tried defending it with an open bat-face again, beaten again
Slightly wider on a fuller length, defended to point

Mohsin gets his reward! Indrajith top-edges the pull and it's taken by the square-leg fielder after a run to his right! The batter came down the track and tried the pull but he was cramped by the pace and the line, which was on the body, the bat-face looked at the sky after turning and the skier was taken well. Indrajith tried the bail-out shot after Mohsin had the ball on a string for the over
Chameera has Finch hopping with a back of a good length ball in the channel, Finch tried to defend in front and was beaten on the outside edge
Good length on off, pushed to mid-off from the middle of the bat
Tucks a length ball on the stumps to deep-backward square

Length ball on middle and leg may have bounced a little lesser than Finch expected. He tried to flick it across the line on the backfoot. The ball hit his pad and went towards the fielder behind square on the offside
Length on middle and off, pushed gently to the left of mid-on for one
Short ball just outside off at chest height is fended with limited control towards the gap at midwicket for one
Finds the outside edge with a good length ball outside off, Iyer tried the straight drive. It went to point after being in the air for a bit
Jaffa! Full just outside off beats the outside edge of the full-faced bat. Iyer was standing a back
Squared up and beaten! Back of a good length ball zips away past the outside edge, Iyer tried to play it straight but got squared up
Finds the outside edge from a full-pitched ball but it was played with soft hands. Went to the right of the slips
Cutter on a length down leg hits the thigh-pad after missing the flick and goes to the gap at short-fine leg
Full around off, driven to mid-off
Clips a length ball on the stumps to midwicket for one
Length ball outside off is punched off the backfoot through cover along the ground. There was a short-cover point, but it went to his left on its way to the fence
Makes room and swings wildly but the good length ball outside off is out of reach

Short ball gets Iyer! It was a well-directed ball in front of Iyer's face. He tried to roll his wrist on the pull but the ball ballooned straight to square-leg. Badoni celebrates as LSG are now firmly on top.
On a back of a good length on off, Rana shuffles across and defends it with a slightly closed bat-face
Length ball comes in with the angle on the stumps, defended in front
Stands back and punches a back of a length ball outside off through cover for two
Almost a stunner! Length ball outside off, Finch pulled it into the legside. Badoni ran back from midwicket to the deep and reached out and was able to get his fingers on the ball, but not catch it
Length outside off, beaten on the cut but outside the tramline
Slightly overpitched and width given, Finch flays it over wide-mid off inside out for four
Short of a length outside off, cut to sweeper cover
Back of a good length on middle and off, defended to the left of the bowler who stops it
Length outside off, gets good carry to beat the slashing cut.
Back of a good length just outside off, goes off the outside edge to the gap at point
Length over middle, shuffles across and tucks it to square-leg
Holder beats the nudge across the line with a back of a good length ball on leg. FInch stood back but could not get bat on it

One more wicket to the short ball! Finch made room and was followed, he was on the move as he tried to upper-cut it like one does with a twig while trying to pluck fruits from a tree but got the top-edge. It went straight up, QDK called for it and took it with a stroll to his left
Length on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
Good length outside off, defended in front of point with soft hands. The fielder comes in and throws it to the non-striker's end with good speed but not accuracy as the batter slid the bat through
Good length outside off, beats the outside edge yet again. The ball went away with the angle, the batter tried to defend it to cover but was beaten
Opens the bat-face to a length ball outside off to point, the bat went up-down and back like a windscreen wiper
Tucks a length ball on the stumps to the right of the bowler
Underedges a upper-cut off a short ball outside off, he tried to play it in the air. So the bat-swing went from down to up

Knocks him over with a yorker! Rana was shaping for the short one, but the full ball came in just outside off, the front leg went to the side to make room and he opened the bat-face but it took the inside edge and went onto the stumps. It was a chop-on that almost looked like it came in, in real time
Punches a length ball outside off to cover
Full on off, pushed to mid-on who was standing on the circle
Makes room and bunts a short ball over the stumps outside off to point
Slower bouncer goes away with the angle and beats the swinging bat, Russell backed away and tried to swipe at it and was beaten
Top-edge off the short ball over off goes to the third man fence. Russell made room and tried the cut but missed.
Full and just outside off, the slower one has Dre Russ swinging but he misses.
Short ball cramps Russell, it was a quicker cutter on a short length. The batter tried to fend it in front, it lobbed up a bit but fell on a length on the pitch
Opens the bat-face and allows the outside edge to steer the back of a good length ball outside off to third man
In the slot on leg, and it's 20 rows back over the midwicket fence! Russell went to the legside and the ball came in the slot for the bat-swing to give ball flight

Flat-bats it hard and the bullet could not be caught at deep-point! It was a length ball outside off and Russell slapped it with all his might, it went to Bishnoi who ran to his right and tried to take an overhead catch but the ball burst through his hands and went over the ropes
Slower one foxes Russ but he's safe! It was a slower, wide ball that had Russ slashing. It went up and went behind cover, the fielders ran back from the ring but could not reach it
Another flat-batted shot, this time a pull that goes straight. The slower back of a length ball outside off is heaved straight, 83-metres away for a six
More luck for Dre Russ! This time, it's from a full ball outside off. He went for another almighty heave over cow-corner but it took the bottom of the bat and flew over short-third
Length ball on the hips, tucked to deep-midwicket
Clubbed over cow-corner! Full ball, flighted on off went tens of rows back after being whacked by Dre Russ, it went 98-metres off the toe-end
Flatter good length ball on off is blocked in front
Military medium-paced leggie down leg has Dre Russ stay legside off the ball and block it in front
Flat on a length outside off, driven to deep-point along the ground
Length ball outside off, Rana makes room and drives it to long-off
Full on middle and off, defended in front
Good length ball on middle and off hits the upper quarter of the full-faced bat and goes to the bowler
Tries the pull on a short ball angling in and it hits the top of the bat, around the sticker and falls in front
Good length outside off, driven to the left of point for one
Deft from Russell! Wide yorker has him jam the bat, the ball went off the edge through the vacant first slip area and fine to the fence
Short ball outside off has Russell sway away from where he stands

Slog-sweep taken at cow-corner! Full ball just outside off had Rinku try the slog sweep but it found the top-edge and went straight up. There were two fielders in the deep but good, clear calling meant Pandya took it comfortably
Does not carry to slip! It was a good length ball on middle and off, Narine went for the straight drive, the ball went off the outside edge in front of Holder, who was standing a tad back
Swings at a full ball outside off and misses
Clubbed over deep-midwicket! It was full on the stumps, Sunil got on a knee and whacked it across the line for six
Opens up sweeper cover by reaching out and slapping a good length ball along the turf to the fence
Length ball outside off has Narine contemplating playing at it but he eventually lets it go

Flat six clubbed over, you guessed it, deep-midwicket! The pull came from the ball in front of his face, the bat face was looking down on its way but the elevation was good enough and it was in the gap

Taken at third man! Cross-seamed short ball had Russell swiping again, it went off the top-edge a few metres in front of third man. Holder, there, ran in, lunged and slid forward and caught it with his hands in front on the move
Back of a good length ball just outside off is pushed to the left of short-cover

Given out caught behind and Anukul reviews. It was a length ball down leg and Anukul shuffled across and tried to nudge it fine, there was a subdued appeal from the bowler. The keeper underarmed the ball to the square-leg umpire. Ultra-Edge confirms that there was some contact made with the glove on its way and the decision stands
Short ball goes over the left of the batter, it was left alone by the batter as he rotated intuitively. Wide called by the square-leg umpire.
Full outside off, driven to the left of mid-off for one
Length ball on middle has Narine try and steer it to point but it takes the underedge and goes towards third man for one
Swipes at a full ball outside off and it goes straight, inside-out on its way to the fence

Stoinis drops a skier! It came after a Narine toe-ended a full ball outside off after trying the slog-sweep again. The ball went up, three fielders converged. Stoinis called for it and came in, went down. Tumbled, but could not reach out and catch it
Length outside off, Narine tries the heave but it goes off the underedge behind the keeper for four
Swings at a length ball outside off and misses
Goes across and slaps a length ball outside off to long-on
LSG review an LBW given not-out. It hit the pad after beating the sweep, the impact is the issue. There is no edge but the impact, since the batter went across with a stride, was outside off

Krunal backtracks at cover and takes it! It was a length ball outside off, Narine tried to launch it over cover but got it off the bottom, it was going over Krunal's head but he backtracked and took the catch well

Two in two for Holder as Southee pulls it to deep-square leg! The short ball at hip-height had Southee pull it in the air, Avesh came in, took the catch, and tumbled in front and got up with a smile on his face.

All fielders in and Harshit drives a good length ball down the ground. The ball trickled away and was pulled back, the throw came in and the batters came back for three. There could have been a run-out at either end, the ball came to the bowler and took off the bails before the batter made his ground. Comedy of errors ends the game.
Back of a good length ball swings in and Jonny works with it with a controlled flick to the gap at the right of midwicket
Similar length on off, clipped to midwicket
Length on the thighs, nudged to midwicket
Wide of the crease, the length ball angles in just over the pads. Jonny tucks it to the right of short-fine for four

Back of a good length outside off, Jonny tries to chop it but gets the bottom edge. It pitches behind and beats the keeper to his right and is chased fine by Ashwin from short-third to the deep, where it's stopped
Back of a good length ball comes in just outside off, Jonny swipes at it and is beaten
Length ball just outside off is tapped to the offside gently enough in front of point for one
Length ball comes in, looked like a knuckle ball. Bairstow defended it straight, got the inside-edge onto pad and the ball landed in front
Back of a good length outside off, pushed to mid-off
Width offered, the length ball takes the outside edge off the cut and dribbles to the right of slip on its way to the fence
Length outside off, tapped to point off the backfoot
Good length on off, pushed to cover. Yashaswi dives to his left but unintentionally parries it towards mid-on, allowing the single
Dhawan charges down the track and swings but is beaten! It was a back of a good length ball outside off, Dhawan swung with a horizontal bat but could not make contact
Length outside off, Dhawan cuts but it did not bounce as much and was beaten on the underedge
Good length outside off, defended to cover
Back of a good length outside off, pushed to point with a horizontal bat
Bit of a leading edge on the square drive off the full ball outside off but it lands before point
Yes, it is! Dhawan comes down the track and tries the cut and is beaten. Excellent over from Boult.
Full outside off, pushed gently to mid-off
Good length but down leg, he's hitting the 140s pace-wise. SD let it go
Back of a good length on the pads, clips and misses. Hits the pad, the towel on his waist and falls in front. He's not connecting with any as of now.
Back of a good length just outside off, cut to the left of point for one
Length outside off at 143 kph, Jonny creams a backfoot drive into the ground and it goes over forward point on its way to the fence
Turns with the pull and puts it in the gap to the left of deep-square leg off a length ball outside off
Length outside off, cuts to backward point on the bounce
Dhawan shuffles across to access the back of a good length outside off and flicks it to deep-square leg
Swings and it goes off the underedge just past the off-stump! It was a back of a good length ball outside off and Jonny swung with a horizontal bat and the keeper could not grab it to his right
Around a good length on off, Bairstow tries to defend it to cover, gets an inside edge and goes to point slow enough for one
Length outside off, helps it on the way with a wristy pull and sends it in the gap at deep-square leg
Yorker down leg, Dhawan helps it again to deep-square leg
Good length outside off, left alone. GIven wide
Picks up a length ball outside off and pulls it over the fence at deep-midwicket. Timed to perfection to bring up Jonny's first six this IPL!
Good length down leg, misses the flick. Given wide

Buttler takes a one-handed ripper at mid-on! It was a length ball outside off and Dhawan came down the ground and tried to flick it in the air, was not down to the pitch of it but got enough to go over where Buttler was initially standing. But he tracked back, went left and adjusted to his right, put up his left mitt and it stuck! He tumbled back and somehow kept the ball in his hands. Ashwin celebrates, Dhawan leaves with a smile. One of the catches of the season.
Full on the stumps, pushed to the right of the bowler
Full on off, pushed to deep cover
Full outside off, tries to open the bat-face and send it to cover point but misses
Cuts a length ball outside off to point

LBW appeal is turned down, Ashwin manages to convince Samson to go for the DRS! The carrom ball pitched on middle and leg and looked to go down further to beat the sweep. The ball went to short-fine and they took a run. No bat involved. It was pitching in-line but the impact was outside off. "The skip was hoodwinked into a review" says Swann on air.
Full outside off, pushed to the right of the bowler
Full and tossed up outside off, comes down the track and swipes at it. Connects and sends it over deep-midwicket for an 82-metre six
Full on off, comes down to negate the spin and pushes it to the left of the bowler
Full on the boots, clipped to the gap in front of square for one
Full on off, pushed to the left of point for one
Full outside off, pushed to the offfside, to the right of the bowler
Full on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
Wide of the crease, the length ball outside off does not bounce much. Jonny closes the reverse in time and sends it to the gap at the left of point for four
Length on the stumps, clipped to deep-midwicket
Full on the stumps, clipped to deep-midwicket
Yorker on the boots from wide of the crease, clipped to deep-square leg
Fully on middle, clipped to deep-midwicket
Length ball on leg stump, beats the clip and goes towards third man
Good length, it pitched on leg and Rajapaksa came down the track and slapped it EA cricket style over long-off. It was a Ctrl+Bottom arrow+ D to a good length ball
Bowls from on the tramline, the ball lands on a good length outside off. Bhanuka comes down the track and flays at it. Beaten.
Hard length outside off, cut to deep point
Cracking Yorker just in front of the crease may have some polish off the stumps! Jonny thrashed at it but it came in and blew a kiss at the off-stump from centimetres away
Full ball down leg, wide.
Around the 7m mark outside off, Jonny waited for it and cut it behind him and it went to the gap at the right of deep-point for four

Leading edge goes over the gap between the keeper and short-fine leg for four! It was a cutter into the pitch and Bhanuka went too early and it took the glove and went behind him, fortunately in the gap
Full outside off, whips it to deep-midwicket along the ground for another four
Steers a yorker length ball outside off to point for one
Short ball outside off, pulled in air with control. It goes inside-out and bounces well before deep-square leg who stops it
Slower good length ball outside off is slashed along the ground to deep-backward point for one
Short ball comes in with the angle on the chest, it's pulled to deep-square leg
Bairstow goes for a big sweep from outside leg, doesn't connect and takes a leg bye

Rajapaksa charges down but loses his leg stump! Rajapaksa dances down the track to smoke that over long-on, Chahal doesn't give it much flight and it goes straight through after pitching on length on the leg stump, well past the big swing of the bat. Chahal is thrilled!
drifting down the leg side, might have been the wrong'un, and Agarwal gets a leg bye towards short fine leg
on length on the stumps, tucks a single to deep midwicket
touch fuller on middle and leg, and he gets off the mark with a single down to long-on
turning away and keeps a bit low, Bairstow gets a bottom edge through the keeper's legs for one
on length on the stumps and Bairstow nudges it towards square leg off the back foot
spectacular cover drive for four! Pitched up from Ashwin, Agarwal goes leg side of the ball just marginally and middles that cover drive for four

four more, this time off the back foot! Ashwin pitches it shorter and wider, Agarwal hangs back and scythes it away between short third man and backward point. They don't even move, it's so well placed
stays back again and steers it towards point for one
leans forward and lets the ball turn away before pushing to point for one
goes wide of the crease from behind the umpire for the a length ball, worked to leg for one
quick, short and into the body, Agarwal is rushed into it by pace and can't get it away
short outside off now and Agarwal pulls to midwicket gently for one
really good bouncer that rises towards Bairstow's helmet, he wants to pull but it nips in as well and sways out of the line in the end
swings it in, Bairstow gets a thin edge towards midwicket and brings up his maiden fifty of IPL 2022, eighth overall
142.2kmh, back of a length and quick on the stumps, nudged to deep midwicket for one
low full toss on the pads, deflects off the pads towards short fine leg for one
very wide of the crease and angling in, Bairstow wants to pull but can't get it away
too full outside off and Bairstow has dispatched that to the covers in a mili-second! So much width that Bairstow got enough room to free his arms for a big swing for a one-bounce four
slow bouncer towards off, he waits and slaps it down to deep midwicket for one
full slower ball at 114kmh to Agarwal, he pushes it straight past Boult towards long-off
makes room for the ball angling in and slices it towards third man for one
he waits on the back foot and runs it down to third man for one
drifts it down the leg side for a wide, good take by Samson
waits and steers it to backward point and he's sent back just in time

finds long-on, another wicket for Chahal, another catch for Buttler! Pitches it up a little bit but not much pace on leg stump, Agarwal wants to go all the way but he hands a simple catch to Buttler. Chahal takes a bow
full on the stumps and he pushes it down to long-on for one

full on leg, misses the flick, roaring appeal from Samson for lbw and the umpire gives it out. Might be going down leg, Bairstow reviews it. It was a flat legbreak from Chahal that Bairstow wanted to flick off the pads. He is struck way down the crease, no edge, pitches on leg, ball-tracking says "umpire's call" for clipping leg stump and it's the third wicket for Chahal!
too wide outside off, trying to keep it out of his reach but it's a wide
now on the other side down the leg side, and it's another wide that goes off the keeper's gloves
nice and tight on the stumps, pitched up, and he pushes it to cover
high back lift but Chahal pitches it shorter and slower on leg, and Livingstone adjusts to only push it down the ground for one
tight length ball on the stumps, he waits and defends down the ground
hint of room outside off and he steers it to deep cover for one
swings big for the ball outside off, doesn't middle it but gets enough to send it racing towards deep cover and Boult does well to slide in the deep on off and keep it to two. Quick running too
towards the stumps from wide of the crease, he defends it back
shorter on the stumps and Jitesh rocks back to pull it down to long-on

hammered down the ground! What a way to say goodbye to Ashwin. He dances down to take it on the full, doesn't quite take it full as Ashwin pulls the length back but such is Livingstone's power that he sends that high and far into the second tier at Wankhede
from wide of the crease, well outside off and angling away for a wide
wants to swing big but only gets an inside edge towards his body and they sneak in a single
low full toss wide outside off, he steers it to third man for one
low and wide again outside off, Jitesh swings big this time but finds deep cover for one
excellent bowling to his field, from Prasidh. It's full and wide again and Livingstone gets another single to deep point

he pitches it shorter outside off for the free hit, Jitesh doesn't middle the big swing after shuffing across and just manages to send that high and between mid-off and deep cover for a one-bounce four

down the ground this time, four more! Slower ball, too full, and Jitesh loses his shape completely while going after that with some power but it's the result that matters. Straight down the ground for a four
full and wide again to end the over, and it's a single to deep point
flighted way down the leg side, Jitesh leans into it outside the crease and he lofts that from the middle this time, over wide long-on for six!
flat and full on off, Jitesh charges down and drills that over Chahal's head, almost taking his hands on the way, for one to long-off
dipping full toss on leg, Livingstone flicks a single to deep midwicket
beaten with lack of pace and turn! Lovely legbreak from way outside leg, Jitesh swings big on the leg side but it turns towards the stumps and the short length means it goes just over the stumps
too, too wide outside off and turning away too, wide
he gives the charge again to take it on the full and drills it to long-off
flat around off and he pushes it down to long-off for one

a really close call for a wide, not given! Livingstone moved a long way towards off, Prasidh bowled it pretty wide outside off too. And remember, the wide line moves with the batter. He lets it go but it's a dot ball
even wider outside off, this time surely a wide
too full, right in the slot for him, and he has smoked that over long-off with a massive swing! Second six for him
really good ball from Prasidh Krishna, he pitches it fill and wide, Livingstone wants to steer it square but misses

this is spectacular cricket all around! Livingstone moves a long way across to off, fine leg is in, Prasidh bowls a good ball way outside off that's going away even further, but such is Livingstone's connection that he manages to pull it over short fine leg!
Prasidh Krishna wins the contest with a yorker! Right at the base of the stumps, Livingstone has gone across to off again, swings for the leg side and misses it completely
low full toss on the stumps, that's a poor ball to end the over and Dhawan flicks it away with some power to the leg side boundary
Length outside off, goes away with the angle. Gets a bit of swing too and is left alone
A wider ball on a length has the batter slashing and missing. KP thinks it was a wide, as did Graeme Smith on air, not given though
Jaiswal crunches a length ball outside off to the gap at the left of point for four
Picked up over deep-square with nonchalance for six! It was a back of a good length ball on off and Jaiswal swung through and got good connection and the ball sailed over the fence
Length outside off, beaten on the cut
Cuts a wide length ball outside off and places it well to the left of deep cover, who runs to cover a lot of ground but the ball was rolling further away and hit the cushion.
Uppish drive lands safely and goes to the left of mid-off. It was a good length ball and Jos, who started the shot with conviction but checked it later, ended safely for him.
Length on the top of the front pad, clipped to square leg who half-stops it. The ball goes a bit further to allow a single
Lovely off-drive goes to the bowler's left, Rabada gets his hands in the follow-through and channels it to mid-off. It was a full ball on off
Premeditates the lap and connects! The back-leg went away, then went across, the body followed and he connected with the low full-toss and paddled it in the gap to the left of short-fine leg
Full outside off, driven to mid-off
Pulls a length ball outside off to mid-on
Length outside off, cut to deep point
Shuffles across and tries to clip a length ball coming in on middle, beaten and the ball hits the pad on the way to the keeper. Went to him on the bounce
Length outside off, pushed to cover
Full-fledged cover drive from Jos, it goes in the air and in the gap over the right of mid-off. It was a back of a good length ball outside off.
Full outside off, driven to mid-off
Full on off, pushed to long-on for one
Launched! Jos got onto a solid power base and smoked a length ball on leg and it went two stands over just below the scorecard over square leg.
Slashes a full ball just outside off over cover for another four. He stayed legside of the ball and opened up the offside by thrashing it

Cata-pulls a bouncer that was going over him while on the move across the crease! Lots happening there, it was outside off and Jos accessed it and pulled it from below to above, like pulling water to splash someone behind in the pool. He connected and got four
Slices a full ball on middle and off over cover, didn't get all of it. But enough to go over cover
Drills a yorker length ball on middle through mid-off and the ball scorches the turf on its way.

Taken at short-third man in... a weird entanglement! It's a wide yorker and Jos shuffled across to meet it on the full, he tried to scoop it but the body was rotating, the ball hit the bottom and went to short-third who took it comfortably. Talk about living and dying off the same sword...
Full outside off, driven to deep-cover
Good length outside off, tries the open-faced drive aimed at mid-off but it took the edge and went to the gap between keeper and third man
Full on the stumps, punched to long-on
Guides a wide yorker to point by laying the bat down
Smacks a full ball in the slot over the bowler, it was outside off. So, the batter went across and whipped it through the line of the ball
Good length ball outside off is pushed to cover
Full outside off, driven to deep-cover
Good length on off, blocked solidly off the backfoot to the bowler
Slower back of a good length ball just outside off is pushed to cover gently to get one
Streaky but four! Samson slashed at a back of a good length ball outside off, he tried to open the face of the bat but got the edge. It went in the air between short-third and backward point for four
Steers a length ball outside with a fully open bat-face and channels the ball in the gap behind point for another four
Full outside off, driven to deep-backward point to end an enterprising powerplay.
Good length just outside off, drives it through mid-off for four
Uppish drive falls safely at mid-off, the fielder was at long-off which meant Sanju was safe. Think the good length ball outside off stuck in the pitch and had Samson early on the shot
Length just outside off, steered to short-third man
Wide, full ball had Jaiswal try and reach it with a shuffle and reverse row it (like it's done on boats) and is beaten. He did it after premeditating a move to the legside.
Low fully outside off is steered to deep-point
Slower good length ball on off is nudged to long-on
Full on off, lunges and pushes it to long-off
Goes on a knee and sweeps a ball on off at knee-roll height and sends it to the gap between deep-square leg and deep-midwicket for two
Full outside off, driven to long-off
Comes down the track and the full length ball yorks him, he jams it with the full-faced bat and it goes to short-third man from the outside half of the bottom of the bat
Googly goes away with the angle on a length outside off, beats the backfoot cover drive
Makes room and swipes at the full ball on the stumps to send it over sweeper cover for a flat six.

Skied and taken by Shikhar! Length ball just outside off had Samson come down the track and slap it but the bat turned and the ball went straight up in the air. Shikhar waited under the ball and took it comfortably after backtracking a bit from point to make it a dismissal of the Dhawans
Steers a good length ball outside off, he opened the bat-face late to send it along the ground to third man
Full outside off, driven to deep-cover point
Back of a good length outside off, gently bunted to point
Backfoot cover drive meets a back of a good length ball, goes to deep-cover
Around the half-volley length outside off, square-driven to deep-point
Full on middle, turned to wide-long on along the ground. Fielder ran in swiftly to keep it to one
Full on middle, pushed to the left of the bowler on the next pitch. Stopped by the bowler
Slow and full but down leg, DDP went for a hard, fine sweep and missed
Full outside off, driven to deep-cover
Full outside off, driven to wide-long off
Length outside off, cut to wide-long off
Full down leg, swept to short-fine leg
welcome back, Sandeep, says Jaiswal! Wide outside off, the length was decent, but enough room for Jaiswal to free his arms for a flourishing drive over the covers
fine on the off side, four more! Cheeky stuff from Jaiswal: nearly in the block hole outside off with a scrambled seam and he digs it out but very late and beats short third man easily
in the block hole and even wider, he steers it to point
goes for the attack by charging down and across to off, Sandeep pitches it wide well outside off and it's a wide past the swinging bat
width again outside off and he drives with a big flourish to deep cover
tighter line for Padikkal outside off, he waits and guides it to point
slower and shorter ball outside off, surprises the batter with the lack of pace and he pushes it to cover for one
starts with a wide down leg and it goes off the keeper's gloves for another run
on the leg side again and he sweeps it with the turn for one
goes back to cut but not much room and he doesn't middle it
goes back again for the flat delivery and cuts successfully to deep point this time
Jaiswal cleverly leans into the fuller ball on leg and tucks it square with soft hands. He did it for two quick runs, takes off immediately and Padikkal makes it in time for the sharp throw
Bairstow first and Jaiswal now, tucks a legbreak to leg and gets to his fifty off 33 balls to come back to form
flat on middle and leg, and Padikkal goes back to block it
slow and back of a length, it's really tough to hit such balls but Jaiswal goes deep in the crease and then flat-bats it straight down the ground to beat long-on for four
width outside and slightly full as well, chipped over the covers for one
outside off with the angle and he finds a single to deep cover
misses leg stump by a whisker! Scrambled seam just outside leg, Jaiswal goes across to swipe it away by going down on a knee and misses it. Nearly loses his leg stump

scoops it nearly over the keeper, Jaiswal is in top form today! Tries to confuse the bowler by making room and then going across, gets a full ball, and he scoops it right behind the keeper's left side

driven through the covers now, he has all the shots you can think of! Dhawan goes slightly wide and very full outside off, Jaiswal loves to drive and he does so by drilling it all along the ground in the gap

falls just short of fine leg! A googly outside leg, too full, and Padikkal sweeps it away behind square where it falls short of Sandeep but he does very well to cover for the turning ball after it pitches and keeps it to two
turning in sharply from off, he tucks to leg off the back foot
too full on off, it's a low full toss, and the only shot left to see from Jaiswal today is the reverse sweep, which he unleashes and that too by middling it behind square for four
leans into the ball and finds a single to long-on with the turn
Padikkal gets his first boundary! Wide outside off, and the batter grabs the chance with both hands, he hangs back and brings out the late cut to steer it to third man
goes back again and keeps strike by finding a single to short third man
mistimes the slower ball down to long-off, reaches the fielder after a bounce

Arshdeep breaks the stand and gets the big wicket! A stock, length delivery from Arshdeep just outside off, Jaiswal goes down the ground with a big drive but only gets height towards long-off, not much distance and the tall Livingstone gets under it
traps him in front, loud appeal for lbw but it does quickly, and they decide not to review. Length ball swinging in, beats the bat and strikes him in front of leg, probably going down or clipping leg
some width now outside off and he punches through the covers for one
nearly gets the off stump! A tentative Padikkal defends the length ball off the back foot and the edge nearly goes on to hit off stump
drives the length ball straight back down to long-off for one more
outside leg and he clips it behind square before three fielders converge to keep it to one
delicate and clever boundary! Length ball on the pads, fine leg is in, and Hetmyer clips it square enough to beat the fielder in the circle and gets four
similar delivery, he runs it down to deep fine leg now for one
bangs in a bouncer, called wide immediately by square leg umpire as Padikkal ducks under it
on the pads and Padikkal finds midwicket
offcutter on the stumps and Padikkal merely taps it back

run-out chance, it's gone to the third umpire! It's Hetmyer in danger. He's not, he made it. Padikkal nudged the ball behind square and they took off, Hetmyer strangely wanted a second and he was rightly sent back. Sharp and flat throw close to the stumps, Hetmyer makes it just in time with a full length dive
finally an attacking stroke from Padikkal. Nearly in the block hole and Padikkal powers it down to long-on
dipping and slow full toss, it's wide outside off and Hetmyer swings it away to the wide long-on boundary in the gap!
Hetmyer is going after the gun death bowler! Swinging in from length towards off, Hetmyer stays still and heaves it to the wide long-on boundary yet again. Two in a row
wide yorker, Hetmyer lets it go and it's called a wide. It was right on the wide line until it swung in late. Arshdeep is furious, Punjab Kings aren't happy at all and Agarwal calms his bowler down
slightly wide and in the block hole now, swings and bunts it down to long-on. Really good ball
nails the wide yorker, Padikkal chases without moving his feet but only manages an inside edge into the ground and to the keeper
yet another wide yorker, what a comeback from Arshdeep. Padikkal gets some more bat this time and gets a single to deep point. And he keeps strike too
short ball, Padikkal pulls and finds his second four! There's a deep square leg but Padikkal pulled it nicely in the gap with a pivot on the back foot
one length on the pads, tucks it off the pads comfortably for one

bangs it in short, there's a faint sound for the edge, the keeper and Rabada go up but the umpire doesn't move. Agarwal reviews it. Bouncer from Rabada despite being pulled for four earlier in the over, Hetmyer goes for a big swipe-cum-pull on leg down the leg side. There's an entire galaxy between bat and ball, not out. And not given a wide either
not a yorker but it's an inswinging full toss and Hetmyer has dispatched that to the square-leg boundary for six! Juicy full toss and punished with a powerful pull
cramps him for room by bowling into the pads, he can't get it away and they sneak in a leg bye

clips it off the pads nonchalantly, four more! Padikkal ends the over the way he started it, with a four. Stays on the back foot, clips it off the pads and just beats a diving deep backward square leg
Arshdeep continues with his wide and slow yorkers, Hetmyer bunts it just past the bowler's right foot for one
another wide yorker from the ever consistent Arshdeep, drills it down to long-off
right in the block hole outside off, bunts it down to cover for a quick single
yet another yorker just outside off, tries to put it away but finds cover

taken at cover! Such is life; you nail those yorkers outside off for some runs, and you go marginally inaccurate with the length for a full toss and get a wicket. Padikkal swung for the off side when he saw the full toss but didn't middle it at all and handed a catch straight to Agarwal around head height
right in the block hole on the stumps with the angle, what an over, what a spell in the death overs, what a bowler. Parag stays back and carefully defends it to leg
poor bowling, really poor. Slides a wide down the leg side

levels the score in style with a six over long-on! Length ball on middle and leg, Hetmyer leans into it and swings it down the ground, not with belligerent power but good timing. He's done the job for his team
tucks the legbreak to short fine leg with the turn. No time for a run
the slider just outside off, he steers it straight to cover off the back foot
the chip off the full toss falls short of long-on and it's all over, Royals win by six wickets
length ball, but sprayed it down the leg side. Wanted to cramp him for room, but just started off from leg and middle, going further down with the angle
back of a length, around off, and he slaps it away, West Indies of the 80s style, towards deep backward square leg. Reminiscent of Haynes and Greenidge in their pomp
length, and he plays it with soft hands, just off the outer part of the bat, but well down the ground, towards third
back of a length again, nips away after pitching, and he looks to push it wide of point. There's a half stop, but they are able to get a single
length, coming back in and he defends it
length, and he presses forward a touch to defend it, right off the middle of the bat
fullish, on the pads, and worked away to fine leg
length, and he has drilled this over extra cover. One bounce and into the boundary. A bit of width on offer, and Rohit just leans into it
length, and he looks to defend it, takes an outside edge, and goes low to the right of first slip, and runs away on this quick outfield
fullish length, into his pads, and he works it away on the onside, but there's a man at midwicket not far from the square leg umpire who fields this
fullish again, and another gorgeous drive. Straight to wide mid-off
length, around off, angles back in, and he defends close to his body

a bit full again, and hello, we have our first six! There's a bit of Viv Richards about this shot, where he just transfers his weight on to the back foot and drills one over midwicket. This hits the Tata Punch over midwicket, but on the rebound
angles in from around the stumps, and he works it away towards square leg. Happy to hand the strike over to his captain
back foot punch, wide of cover-point, but that has travelled quite quickly to him. No chance to get through for a single
Rohit's putting on a masterclass today! Gets down on one knee, and proposes that this ball should fly over fine leg for a six. Ramps it, taking it off off stump. Ranveer Singh in the crowd approves
fullish, and driven down the ground, right off the middle, but Ferguson gets acorss quickly to his left at mid-on to cut this off. Easy single jogged by the batters
steers a length ball outside off, towards third
length, and he looks to biff it away towards mid-wicket. Runs off the inside of the bat and goes down towards fine leg
short of a length, a bit wide, and he punches this past point. Sublime timing on this one

creamed to the right of point this time! This was a touch fuller in length, but stull had enough width to allow Rohit to trust the bounce, stay back in the crease, and punch this with an open face of the bat. Crrrrrracking timing!
length, and a good ball, that bounces well past his outside edge. Perhaps looking to run it down to third, in the absence of slip
length, around off, and he drops it towards point and takes a quick single
fullish length, and he looks to drive. Off the edge, wide of third to the left of the man there. Pradeep Sangwan rifles in a throw, but they take two comfortably before that can happen
short in length, and he looks to swat it away, line was outside off. Just doesn't time it well. Seems to have hit the toe-end of the bat. Drops harmlessly close to the wicket
fullish, googly, around off, and he just pushes it away towards a vacant midwicket area for a quick single
full in length, around leg, and he punches this through midwicket

gets down on the knee and looks to sweep this. Not quite off the middle, but done enough to clear Tewatia at square leg. Tewatia has to chase it down to the boundary, and does well to reel it back and save a run
length, and he goes deep in the crease to pull it away. Off the toe of the bat, and to the off side. Could have had him leg before otherwise
and this goes back in from around off, goes past Saha. Was there an edge there? Just a little inside edge, as he is looking to push forward, and the edge carries it just wide of Saha and behind him
goes down to sweep, gets an under edge and it goes finer than he perhaps wants, but still brings up the 50 of this partnership
full, around off, and he drives it back down the pitch
a bit short, but Rohit manufactures this swat down to midwicket. It is pitched outside off, and he fetches it from there with a dismissive short-arm jab
full toss, on the pads, and worked away towards deep midwicket. This was a change in pace, with about 20 kmh taken off what Ferguson normally bowls at
length, and he punches this through cover-point. Gorgeous from Kishan this time!
full, but on the leg stump, as it strikes him on the pad as he tries to force it away through square leg. Gets a leg bye towards short third
slower ball, around leg stump, and he works it away towards midwicket. There's a man pretty close to the wicket
length, punched away wide of the man at sweeper cover. Easy two for them

short again, and he goes back to punch this towards cover. A bit of a misfield from Rashid, after a good stop, and that allows them to scamper one. And then an overthrow. Rashid has thrown it onto his foot in fact. Lots of laughs, as a result
lucky Ishan! Fullish ball on off stump, and he looks to drive. Way away from his body, and gets an inside edge, but it goes just wide of off stump and then runs past Saha's outstretched right glove
short, into the body, and worked away towards square leg. Easy single
down the leg side. Attempted to slow it down, and even though Rohit shuffles a bit to the off side, this is called a wide
fullish, widish, and he looks to drive, but again away from his body. Bottom and outside of the bat, carries it down to third
length, nips away from just outside off, and he drives to a man at short cover
full, outside off, and driven firmly to cover
length, spins back in from outside off, and Rohit defends this from the crease

goes for the reverse sweep, and strikes him on the pads instead. Not given, but Rashid has reviewed immediately. This could save him both on impact as well on height. There was a long stretch forward, and the ball has actually evaded bat and hit him on the area meant to be treated with gentle loving care. Oh, it reveals three reds! Just hits the top of off and middle, and Rashid has the breakthrough
googly, and Suryakumar looks to guide this past the man at short third, but the fielder does well to get there
short, around off, and he slaps this past the non-striker towards long-on
on leg stump, and worked away against the turn towards midwicket
goes with the spin towards midwicket, looking to swat it away
length, angles in from wide of the crease, and he works it away towards deep square leg
down the wicket, and he has sent this halfway into Pune! Given generous flight by Tewatia, and Kishan accepts the invitation and swats this over for a 104m six over mid-wicket
a bit fuller, and he goes with the angle, from around off, towards long-on
full, and he looks to sweep it fine, gets it to the left of short fine, and picks up a quick single

one-handed cut from Kishan! Just a one for that. Tewatia spots him looking to skip down the wicket and fires it a touch wide. Has to take one hand off to get to it, and get it to the deep cover point sweeper
fullish, around off, and he drives to mid-off. They pinch a risky single, and a direct hit by Pandya there would have seen him gone

picked up, whipped away over fine leg for six. Surya is down with the shot that he plays so well, using the pace of the bowler, after a little shimmy across the stumps. Like how he started scoring in international cricket
quickly on to him from a little back of a length, and he works it to short midwicket
change of pace, and deceives him as he looks to run it away on the off side. This went at 131.9 kph, and was the leg cutter from Lockie
works a length ball into him towards square leg
slower ball, outside off, and he plays a delightful inside out scoop towards deep point, where there's a sweeper stationed
Full on the stumps, driven off the inner half of the bat as it turns in the hand to mid-on
Length outside off, tapped to deep-point

Straight up, taken at midwicket! Surya tried to lofts a length ball on off but the bat turned in his hand at the end leaving the ball ballooning in the air. He was through with the shot a bit too early. Rashid takes it comfortably, Kishan was as disappointed, if not more, than Surya who looked distraught himself.
Back of a good length outside off, inside edges a backfoot punch aimed to go to cover. Goes to the deep-square leg gap
Full outside off, Tilak drives it through mid-off, well to the left of the fielder who was in the circle. The lean allowed the reach for Tilak
Slightly fuller on a similar line, the half-volley is driven to mid-off
Driven through cover for four! It was a length ball outside off, Kishan went with the flurry off the backfoot and sent it to the fence along the ground
Full outside off, driven to mid-off
Length on off, turns the wrist and flicks it to midwicket
Length on middle, clipped to deep-square leg
Mishits a pull but it lands safely! Short ball has Tilak go too early on the pull, it hits the toe end and pops to square keg which is vacant, allowing the single

Soft dismissal as Kishan flicks one straight to midwicket! A 124 kph full ball on off has Ishan go through with the shot too early. This time, it costs him his wicket as that popped up straight to the fielder. The change-ups and disguising has come off for Joseph.
Length and wide, cut to deep point

Back of a length ball may have come in a bit, beats the attempted nudge with the bat-face looking towards mid-on. Hit him over the pads and went to third man, single taken. It's pitching just in line but going over the stumps.
Guides a back of a good length ball to third man
Pollard takes a step or two down the ground and Sangwan goes short but it is down leg, left alone
Makes room and Sangwan hits a length over middle and off, Pollard checks the defence with a push to cover
Clips a length ball on the thighs to the right of Rashid at midwicket, they take a quick single. No direct hit at the striker's end
Length outside off, beaten. Tilak tried to guide it to third man but with the wrists turning to keep it down.
Attempted yorker on middle almost hits the mark, Pollard shuffles behind and flicks it behind square in the gap and charges for two
Slower one foxes Pollard! Cutter on a back of a length comes in and looks to be over the stumps and going down leg after he missed the flick
Length on the stumps, tapped to the bowler
Short one outside off zips up, it was at head-height and Pollard retracted his bat to ensure there was no edge
Full on middle, dug out back to the bowler. It was close to the yorker length, Pollard made way and drove it with the full-face
Low fully on off, driven to the right of mid-off for one
Full outside off, Pollard searches for it with the bat going to cover. Beaten
Length ball is pushed back to the bowler on the backfoot
Full googly spins in and beats the flick, it was going down leg
Full just outside off, Pollard blocks with a lean in front

Cleaned up! Leggie hits the top of off. It pitched around middle, middle and off and turned away ever so slightly to beat the full-faced push from Pollard. It went back to hit the stumps to end Pollard's misery, Rashid goes to his signature celebration with a spinning index finger
Length on middle, it was 92 kph but looked slower. Punched to wide-long on
Length outside off, David tries the backfoot cover drive with little foot movement and misses
Covers off stump with a shuffle and powers an off-drive to send the full ball on off to the long-off fence
Short ball is on the hips and David pulls it around the corner, finds the gap at deep-backward square and it rolls to the cushion
Back of a good length ball outside off, driven to the right of deep cover for two. David, like he often does, is standing tall as he plays the shot.

Excellent fielding at long off after a gorgeous straight drive. David punched a full ball with a slightly open-faced bat and the ball scooted away. Rashid ran across to his left and managed to stop it with a dive

Leading edge falls safely past cover! David tried to clip the length ball on the stumps to midwicket but it took the edge and went over the fielder at cover. Chased at the deep by cover after a chase to keep it two
Good length ball on the stumps is pulled to long-on
Good length ball on middle is pushed to mid-on. It lobbed up after David pushed it off the backfoot with a slightly closed bat-face, went safely to the right of the bowler
Whips a full ball on the stumps to cow corner along the ground and Sangwan stops it to his left with a dive
Length ball on the stumps is pulled to deep-backward square. Slight fumble but no extra cost
Good length googly comes in to off, batter makes room and drives it off the backfoot to deep cover
Good length on the stumps, tucked gently to deep-midwicket and push the fielder who runs in, and get two
Slower length ball outside off has David try the pull too early. Beaten. Goes to the keeper on the half-volley
In the slot at 142 kmph, David takes a step acros and whacks it with an extended aerial drive, across the line, and sends it straight for a 95-metre six
Slow and full on off, the 122 kph ball is pushed to long-on
Hard length ball at 142 kph, Tilak set up with a shuffle across for a fine pull. The ball ballooned off the glove and went to the vacant square-leg region
Slower one has David adjust the shot. Ends up playing a bunt on one knee to row the full ball outside off to long-on
Makes room to go past the legside tramline and Joseph follows him with a length ball and Tilak steered it behind square on the offside
Sets for the slower ball and gets a full one outside off, he waits for it and tries the whack over midwicket, gets a thin outside edge. Goes to the keeper on the bounce
Full and fast on middle, it was close to a yorker but Tilak took the right leg out the way and went through with the off-drive. Mid-off was in, so it was four all the way

Direct hit from mid-off, run-out check. The batter is about half a metre short and will have to leave. It was a full toss, just below the waist, and surprised Tilak who tried to hit through the line with a horizontal bat. Turns out it was over the waist, given no-ball late. Think the third ump had a word. The ball went in front of mid-off, who ran in and collected it, hit the stumps direct
The free hit is in David's hitting arc and he sends it over long-on for a 93-metre six! It was full and on the stumps, David went through with the extended aerial loft and connected
Good length ball on middle and off is pushed to mid-on

GT review for an LBW. It was a good length ball pitching outside off, the leg-cutter came in but where is the impact? There is no bat, Sams attempted help over fine-leg missed, and the ball hit the pad. Impact is umpire's cann, so Sams survives
Taken at deep-midwicket! Sams goes across and heaves at a full ball outside off. It goes off the bottom of the bat and is taken by Rashid tumbling back, he's been omnipresent in the field today
Length ball outside off, reaches out and pulls it off the bottom to long-on. Refuses the single
Length ball outside off is heaved off the bottom of the bat along the ground to deep-midwicket
Connects with one over long-off! He shuffled across and lofted a full ball outside off over long-off for a six
Cutter outside off on a good length has David try and slap it hard. Goes off the bottom edge into the pitch, on its way to the bowler
Shami tries to hide one outside off but the back of a good length ball is left alone. Wide
Goes across, swings at a good length ball outside off and misses. It said 139 kph but seemed to have gone below where Tim expected
Sammack! Deposits a back of a length ball outside off by going across and pulling it over deep-midwicket for six
fullish length, swings back in from leg and middle and strikes Saha on the pad as he looks to work it off his legs
length, punched off the back foot, and M Ashwin at cover-point dives across to his right to stop that. Hi-fives all around
dug in short, and he looks to pull it away. Doesn't quite middle it, and it drops short of short midwicket
fuller, driven towards mid-off. Hit too well to consider taking any runs for this
length, angles across Saha, who plays a gorgeous drive out to the sweeper on the off side
fullish, driven to mid-on
wide outside off, and Saha just uses the pace on offer to guide it wide of point. Lovely bit of timing, and highlights again how good this pitch is
fuller, wider, and he throws the kitchen sink at this. The ball nibbles away a bit and beats the outside edge. Not a very Saha-like shot this. Perhaps the job description he has inside the powerplay
fuller, closer to the bat, and beats the outside edge. Looks for the poke-drive again, and doesn't get his front foot upto the pitch of the ball
fuller, on the pads, and he has whipped this over mid-wicket. It was angling in, and he has just used the pace on offer, and a little whip of the wrists. Saha, you little beauty!
back of a length, angles in, and he looks to drop it on the off side for a quick single. Drops behind him, and he watches it closely to ensure it doesn't roll towards the stumps. Oh, it doesn't!

fuller, and he has just drop-kicked this back over Bumrah's head. Oh, this has to be insulting and infuriating for the fast bowler. Just slapped it down the ground. Picked up a little change in pace early
on a good length, pitching around leg, and he presses forward to defend it towards short midwicket
fuller, and he drives this towards long-on
goes back to whip this away with the turn into him, but cannot beat short midwicket
fuller, and he shuffles across to work it away towards square leg
hangs back to try and cut it, then makes a decision to pull, and plays it off the inside edge, but on to his leg
presses forward and works it towards deep midwicket. Sams has to come in from deep square leg, and they can come back for the second
full, down the leg side, and will have to bowl this again
length, pushed to mid-off
length, worked away towards short fine
edged, and flies away towards third, for four! This was bowled at 142.2 kph, and he was looking to hoick this across the line. Goes off the edge, and lands just short of the ropes
cutter, at 117.5 kph, and he works it away towards short midwicket
fullish, and he has just dragged it and dropped it over mid-wicket. Effortless, and making it look simpler than it was
short, slower ball, and he looks to pull it away. Does well to delay the shot, and just run it towards deep backward square
back of a length, angles in, and he drops it away towards fine leg
short, angles in, tucks him for room, and Gill defends this
length, angles in at pace, and he drops it towards short midwicket

edged, but safe! Angles in again from wide of the crease, and hits him high on the splice as he looks to work it away on the onside. The edge goes past point and flies away on a couple of bounces to third
probably not, because then this shot would also have been disqualified for runs! Short ball, and he has just helped it along with a swivel pull. Deep into the stands behind long leg

superb yorker, inside edge, down for four to fine leg. No justice in this world for Bumrah. They have taken a review. Has it hit foot first, by any chance? This was a searing yorker, but it has hit the bat. More in hope than anything else. A touch of desperation in fact!
length, and he has slog swept this. I think this has just missed the Punch car beyond midwicket. Punches gloves wiith Saha. What a shot from Gill!
fullish, around off, and he works it towards point
down the wicket, and rifled past mid-off. Spin it to win it, but only if you are called Shubman Gill at the moment.
down the wicket, and works it away towards long-on
fuller, works it away towards square leg with a little poke
fuller, straighter, and punched towards wide mid-off
length, driven back with the angle back into him over the wicket, towards the bowler
this goes straighter on, and he punches this down to long-off
fuller, and worked away towards deep square leg off the back foot
short, into the wicket, turning back in with the wrists, and he has cut this towards deep point
fuller, driven towards deep point again
punched off the back foot towards long-on
short, around off, and he looks to pull this away. Just short of Ramandeep, the substitute, running in and diving from deep midwicket. What a chance!
slower ball, around off, and he defends this towards cover
fuller, slower again, and he has picked this. Pushes this wide of cover
short, and cut away hard. That is hit with some venom, as it beats the dive from the sweeper!

fullish, around leg, and worked away towards midwicket. A misfield from Ramandeep, as he was coming in from cow corner, and Kartikeya, who was behind him, having run in from deep square leg, and the ball goes for four
short again, and he hangs back and swats this away on the off side. Beats the sweeper yet again
short, and he can hang back and drive this beyond the sweeper on the off side
full, on the pads, and looped into him, and he drives it towards wide long-on
fuller, on leg and angles across Gill, who punches it back to him down the wicket
down the wicket, and has picked up a googly. Deposits it just wide of the sight-screen over long-off. Crunch time!
slows it up, makes it spin back in from around off, and he works it to short midwicket
around off, and he has swept this towards deep square leg. Placed to perfection, bisects the gap between deep midwicket and deep backward square leg
sweeps this behind square, fetching it from outside off
skips down the wicket, but he drags it shorter. Defended back to the bowler
short, wide, and punished! Just drives this along the carpet, and in front of cover-point
fullish, and driven towards midwicket with a little flick of the wrists. It was on a line outside off, but he uses the pace and length to play it away towards the leg side
sweeps to deep backward square leg. Picked up again from just outside off
drives this from just outside off, and cover dives across to field it. Good commitment from the captain himself
Slower good length ball on off at 114 kph is flicked to deep-square leg
Length on middle, clipped to short-midwicket
Hard length ball outside off may have stuck in the pitch. Gill played it off the backfoot with a full-faced bat, was in the air but well in front of the bowler. To his right on its way to mid-on
Length outside off, pushed to cover again off the backfoot
Cutter outside off on a length, cut to deep-point
Palpable slower one outside off on a full length is pushed to to mid-off, gets Saha to 50. He raises his bat in celebration.
Flicks a good length ball to deep-midwicket.
Slow on a back of a good length outside off, nurdled to long-on. Gets to 50, celebrates with the bat raised as well.
Full on the pads down leg, misses the flick and goes to square-leg. Pollard was the only one appealing, Swann on air says that's non out even in any league
Good length outside off, caressed to deep-cover
Full on off, Saha flicks it aerially in the gap to deep-midwicket
Length outside off, tucked on the move to deep-midwicket

Skier taken at long-on by Pollard!
