It was a legbreak on a full length on off, Gill came down the track and tried to whack it straight but he did not get to the pitch of the ball and the bat turned in the hand. The ball went straight up off the edge and Pollard had plenty of time to settle underneath and take it well over his head with his fingers pointing up. Ends Gill's excellent innings
Length ball spins from leg to off and is clipped to deep-midwicket
Length outside off, the googly comes in and is cut against the spin again, to deep point
Full on leg, pushed to long-on
Length on the stumps, slouches and helps himself with a fine pull to the right of deep-backward square. Stopped at the deep-fine leg region.

Swept in the air, taken at deep-square leg! It was a full ball on the stumps and Saha went for the hard sweep and got the elevation but not control or distance. Taken well by Sams with a slide. Pandya punches Saha's gloves to gesticulate a job well done, Ashwin thumps his chest and Ishan punches the air in celebration.
Full down legstump, misses the flick and goes off the pad to deep-fine leg
Full on off, tries the flick. Goes off the outside-half of the bat but along the ground to cover

Glorious straight drive past the bowler! It was in the front of a good length and Sai drove it with a punch, somewhat similar to K Pandya in terms of style, it goes past the bowler's right on its way to the fence
Length on the hips, pulled to the deep on the legside
Hard length outside off, pushed off the backfoot to cover's right, who parries it towards mid-off. But no extra.
Length outside off, caresses a backfoot drive plus cut fusion with a horizontal bat to the gap at deep-cover
Cuts a length ball outside off to deep cover
Full outside off, the 102 kph ball is pushed to long-off
Comes down the ground and flicks a good length ball to the bowler. He had to adjust the shot as it was flighted further.
Works a back of a good length ball on the stumps to deep-midwicket
Slow and on a length, sits up for the pull from Pandya. Goes into the acres of gap at deep-midwicket to the fence
Full outside off, driven to cover, who gets his left hand and half-stops it but it goes behind him. Mid-off had to cover it and that allowed two
Cutter on a good length outside off, Sai swings and misses. The attempted shot was a whippy drive through cover
Clears long-on with a free swing! It was a 104 kph ball, Sai came down the track and whacked it golf-style with an extended aerial whip over long-on for an 87-metre six
Underedges a length ball outside off back to the bowler. The shot attempted was a pull
Full outside off, pulls it from outside off to deep-midwicket with a sweep on one knee
Length ball on the hips is helped to deep-backward square with a pull along the ground

Hit wicket! as Sai swings himself off balance after being beaten on the pull His left hand came off the bat as the short ball at head-height was going past him, Pollard had beaten the shot with the lack of pace. Sai was probably expecting a length ball but not that short. It had him swing hard and the hand came off, the bat hit the stumps in the follow-through. Rohit celebrates. Pollard does so with his elbow whacking on his palm.
Length outside off, stands tall and drives it off the backfoot while shaping for a punch through cover. But adjusts and sends it past the bowler for four.
Low fully on the stumps, pushed to long-on
Full outside off, driven to cover. It was a cutter from Bumrah.

Inside edge goes past legstump and to the long-leg fence. Bumrah smiles in resignation after it misses. It was a good length ball outside off, Miller tried the straight drive, it took the inside edge and went to the right of leg-stump
Full outside off, driven to long-on
Clips a fullish ball just outside off to long-on
Length outside off, whacks the pull through square leg. In the gap and to the fence. Sweat and dew sprayed as Riley was releasing the ball, which was palpable in the slow-motion replays
Jams a yorker down leg-stump, beats the flick. Goes on the pad and in front of square. One taken
Low full toss on leg, clipped fine to the left of deep-backward square. The fielder chases with a good run and stops it. Two taken

Runout chance after the direct hit from the keeper, sent upstairs. It was a good length ball outside off, Miller tried to chop it and got the underedge, it went behind on the pitch into the keeper. The proactive Kishan ran in and threw the stumps at the striker's end with an underarm throw. Replays show Pandya's bat was on the line! He has to leave, the game is in GT's hands but can this wicket change the status quo match-situation wise? It was Hardik's call and he slid his bat through, no dive. He looked to have known he was short instinctively.
Back of a good length on off, driven off the backfoot to deep-cover
Slow, back of a length ball outside off. Miller slaps it to deep cover along the ground

Low full toss on the legs, the attempted yorker is flicked to long-on. Tewatia comes in for a tight two, and has replays show he has made it! He took off early which helped him cover extra ground. Good, proactive running.
Bamboozled! Miller has no clue where the cutter pitching outside off and almost clipping off went! He tried the nurdle from outside leg and missed it by a metre, it looked like.
Works a length ball around off to deep-midwicket
Guides a back of a good length ball outside off to short-third man. He was making room but the pace of the ball meant he had to adjust the shot

Is that the decisive blow? Waited for the slower length ball and pulled it 93-metres over deep-midwicket, ten rows back. Looked like that was the longer boundary but no matter, it was timed to perfection
Length ball following Miller, who was making room, was able to channel it to deep-cover
Slower length ball into the pitch is cut to deep-point
Just inside the tramline! It was full and wide, Tewatia reached out and tried to swing through it but missed. Wide not given, looked fair.

Run-out review! He's gone! Tewatia pulled a length ball to deep-midwicket and scampered for a very tight second, the fielder ran to his right. Covered decent ground and threw it on a length to the keeper, who reached to his right and whipped off the bails. Tewatia's bat was on the line. MI celebrate, this game can still go both ways!

Top-edges the pull, bowler runs back... but cannot make it! It came after a length ball, cutter, outside off had Rashid puling. It went off the edge, Sams backtracked and kept his eyes on the ball but the distance was too much. Even the dive could not allow access. Only one taken.

Swings and misses! It was full, wide, and slow. Miller stood his ground and swung through the line and missed. Could he have shuffled or tried to not force it to the legside? Whatever, dot is the result.

Miller misses, MI win! Sams punches the air, so does Sharma. Everyone gets into a huddle, they celebrate like this is another trophy-lifting moment! It was a wide full-toss that Miller swung across, it went to the keeper on the bounce after beating the bat.
Hits a length outside off and it swings away sharply, the length makes Mandeep not consider playing at it
Slightly fuller and straighter but it is still outside off and Mandeep lets it go again

Jags back in sharply and beats the flick but it looks to be going over. It hit a length outside off and came back in prodigiously, Mandeep tried the flick across the line and missed it. The appeal was turned down.
Length ball comes in and beats the flick but it was going down leg

Edged and taken! An unconvincing prod from Mandeep to try and push the good length ball well outside off came with a step towards the ball but it was because he was off-balance. The ball held its line and took the edge for the keeper to take comfortably
Length just outside off, blocks it off the backfoot cautiously to short-mid off
Slaps it on the up but checks the shot at the end, does Warner, but it goes in the gap to the left of cover. It was a good length ball that was going away with the angle and was wide outside off.
Full outside off, pushed to wide-mid off for one
Short ball does not go high, it goes just over middle and Marsh swung it off his hips behind square in the gap for four
Full ball angling in on middle and leg is pushed to mid-off for one but Marsh was cramped as he was trying to force a ball on the legs straight
Around a length on the legs, tucked to deep-backward square
Back of a good length ball misses the flick and hits the knee-roll of the front pad but it looks to have gone down leg
Good length outside off is left alone

Back of a good length ball gets good bounce and leaves Warner, who tries to push it towards cover and gets beaten. His backfoot went back and there was little gap between both feet as he tried to push it
Length ball hits the top of the pad down the legstump after beating the flick and goes to the offsite
Back of a good length outside off, Warner lets it go. He is trying to see through Bhuvi's potentially 2-over spell
Full on off, pushed to mid on
Good length just outside off, Warner opens the bat-face and pushes the ball to deep-backward point
Down leg, five wides! It was a length ball that came in with the angle and yorked the keeper to his right. The gloves could not get under the ball and it went for four
Length on the hips, pulled along the ground to deep-backward square
Toe-ends a pull and it goes to cover safely in the gap, it was a short ball and Marsh was early on the shot but it ends up safe after being in the air for a bit
Sits back and helps a length ball on the hips just behind square inside out for a four through deep-backward square. 11 off 3 so far
Just a push. Back of a good length ball is pushed off the backfoot through cover to direct it to the fence along the carpet
Hits a good length and it is coming on middle, Warner stays back and defends it cautiously to mid on
Uses the pace and swivel-pulls a length ball over fine leg for six. Umran is bowling it over 145 kmph and Warner helped it along with a pull to make it 21 off the over
Lovely cover-punch from Marsh for four. It was a length ball outside off and it came at pace and Marsh created a fusion of a cut and a punch to get four

133 kmph leg-cutter sticks in the pitch and gets extra bounce, Marsh is too early on the shot and gets a leading edge which lobs to the bowler. The catch is taken with the fingers pointing upwards and the fielders celebrate. It was around a length and did not seem to move laterally but the revs meant Marsh's bat face turned as it closed on coming in contact with the ball and ballooned up.

Miscommunication ends safe for DC. Pant pushed a full ball to mid off, cover dove to his left but could not get to it. Pant, in the meantime, called for one but later sent the non-striker back. Warner was in trouble but there was no direct hit and the throw was in the gap through midwicket which allowed the single
Length ball down leg, left after considering the flick
Full on the stumps, pushed to mid on
Back of a length on the hips, clipped to midwicket
Beaten on the nurdle, it was a length ball around off. Warner closed the bat and missed the gentle flick, it hit the thigh-pad and went towards the keeper
Beaut of a good length ball cuts Pant in half. It pitched around off and came back in at 146 kmph, Pant tried to play it with a straight bat but the ball went through the gate.
Full outside off, tries the cover drive with a reach and gets beaten
Length ball on the hip is clipped to square leg. Front foot no ball is signalled by the siren! It was a close call but there was nothing behind the line.

Tries to hide the ball wide but the low full toss is driven over point for four. DW took a step outside and went through with the shot, it went in the air but in the gap behind point on its way to the fence.
Imperious off-drive races to the fence. It was full and outside off, Warner drives it with a full and the follow-through was full. The ball went in the gap to the left of mid off
Length outside off, guided to deep-backward point
Back of a good length ball beats the flick, hits the thigh pad and falls in front

DW lets one into his pads as the ball pitches outside leg. It pitched on the back of a good length and went behind, to the right of the keeper. But no shot was offered, so the run was not on. Warner looked ginger after being hit but it only stung. No issues.
Good length on the stumps, tucked to deep-midwicket. They think of two but reject the second.
Full on the legs, swept to short-fine leg
Good length ball outside off is cut to point
Backs away and slashes a length ball outside off to cover along the ground
Back of a good length ball is pitching outside leg, it came in and beat the flick and hit the pad below the knee-roll. The appeal was stifled early.
Full on off, whacks it along the ground to long on. It goes to the fielder's right, who stops it with a little run
Full outside off, Pant dances across and clips it to deep-midwicket
Pulls a 94 kmph length ball on middle to deep-midwicket
Bad timing aids Pant as the whack after dancing down the ground lands safely at mid on. The fielder, to whom the ball went, was at long on.
Plants the front foot down the ground and launches a full ball over long on. The keeper said, 'catch' but it went well over the fielder. That is 400 sixes for Warner in all T20s!
Full on the stumps, nudged to deep-midwicket
Full ball on leg stump is clipped to wide-long on. They ran the first run quick but the fielder collected the ball, so the second was not on
Pant connects with the slog-sweep! It goes 91 metres, over square leg. The ball pitched on leg stump and was full, Pant whacked it to dismiss it from his sight.
Takes a step down and smacks a full ball straight for another six!
Three in three! The googly was full and on off, Pant stayed legside of the ball and slashed it over long off for a 93 metre six.
Back of a good length ball outside off has Pant going back and cutting. It goes behind square, no one at point. Deep point ran to his right but could not cut it off

Drags it on! A fully, a low fully outside off has Pant reaching out just a bit, he went for a hard cover drive but the ball took the inside edge, went back diagonally and pitched on its way to hit leg stump. Pant stood there, crestfallen, with his hands over the bat handle and looking down but had do go back. Gopal, who was taken down, comes back and celebrates heartily.
Length ball goes away with the angles outside off and beats the cut
Length on middle and off, pulled to midwicket
Length ball again, the 141 kmph ball on off is pulled in front of square. It was in the air but went over midwicket and went to the fence
Length on the stumps, clipped to deep-square leg
That's a surprising sight, Powell leaves. It was a good length ball outside off.
Short ball rushes Powell and has him fending! It was on the chest, Powell tried to play it straight, it took the glove and went to third man after landing safely around the
Good length ball outside off keeps low and beats the heave outside off
Full outside off, pushed to cover
Length ball on the legs is clipped to deep-midwicket
Length just outside off, pulled to cow corner along the ground
Full on middle, flicked to wide-long on along the turf
Reaches out and slashes a wide, full ball over wide-long off and the ball is nowhere in sight! It lands a few rows past and Gopal's over, good so far, ends poorly
Warner brings up his 54th IPL 50 with a pull, 89th off his career! It was a length ball on off and Warner pulled it effortlessly through midwicket,
Yorker on middle and off is jammed to mid off. Warner made room and brought the bat down in time.
Wide down leg, Warner tries to pull it and misses.
Full outside off, Umran steers it and uses the pace by not following through with the shot. He held his shape and the ball went to deep cover, where it was stopped
Length ball does not bounce as much, it is pushed to point
Length on the hips, clipped to the gap at deep-midwicket for two
Length on the hips, just over off, pulled to deep-midwicket
Good length on off, Powell crouches on the push and sends it along the ground to deep-backward point
Good short ball, it lands down leg and straightens with the angle. The ball went over middle and off to the side of Warner's face as he pulled away

Misfield allows the second run! A length ball on the stumps is turned to fine leg, the ball hit the knee of Umran as he bent down, and went to his right. The wiley Warner was ready to pounce for the second and made it.
Back of a good length outside off is driven to deep cover
Length outside off, pulled to the right of long on

Picked up and the ball launches like a rocket and lands over the long leg fence. The ball was full on the stumps and Warner helped it along the way. The bat came from bottom to top. I thought it was off a leading edge but our, scorer, Venkat, says he lifted it intentionally
Yorker on the stumps, flicked to deep-midwicket
Warner goes across and swats a wide, length ball straight down the ground along the ground. Mid off was in but long on ran across to his right and cut it off
Back of a good length outside off, stood still and tried to cut it. The ball went off the bottom edge on its way to cover

Half chance goes down! Powell mistimed the pull off a short ball on the body, Kartik was backtracking from short-fine leg but he could not judge the ball's trajectory as it came down. It was a bit too far from his reach at the end, he tried a leap in front but could not latch on
Length on the hips, turned to deep-backward leg
Full outside off, it went past the offside tramline with the angle. Warner walked towards it but the leave was always on

Warner is crunching everything in sight! Leans on a full ball outside off, Warner stands still and reaches out with his hands and connects with a cover drive, well past the right of mid-off to the fence along the ground
Sitter dropped at mid off by Kane! Powell slashes at a full ball outside off, and the ball went to Kane at knee-height. He was ready with a crouch and the ball came in and popper out of his fingers
Short ball at head-height is let go, not given wide. Warner stares the ump but to no avail
Very full outside off, thrashed along the turf to long on
Full outside off, open-faced drive goes to point
Yorker down leg takes the boot after beating the flick. It went further to Pooran's right after deflecting, he stopped it well and threw down the stumps but DW was in
Full toss on middle is pushed with a slightly open bat-face to mid off
Length ball outside off is pushed to deep cover
Blockhole ball is dug out to the right of the bowler.
Short ball around neck-height is outside off and pulled across to the gap at deep-midwicket for two
Bang and boom, goes KP on air. Powell goes after the short ball on the head, it sailed over deep-square leg for a 95-metre six
Yorker on leg, Powell had to get his front leg out the way to flick it to wide-long on for one
Low fully just outside off, driven to point
Length ball outside off has Powell heaving, tries to send it to the legside but misses.
Back of a length ball is outside the tramline outside off and was going further away with the angle as the bowler got his hands across during the delivery. Wide
Swings and connects! 104-metre six comes off a slash from a length ball outside off, it went over deep-extra cover. There was long-off but it went wide and he was only a spectator
Pulled to wide-long on for another six! It was a length ball outside off and Powell got the pull, swing, whack what have you, off the bottom but the ball sailed over the fence.
Yorker on the stumps is drilled along the ground to long on
Clobbers a good ball outside off over the right shoulder of the bowler. It went like a bullet, so there was no chance of a catch
Slower bouncer comes in with the angle, DW tries the ramp over third man but misses

Markram leaps in front at long on but the ball did not carry! It was a close to yorker length ball on the stumps, Powell whacked at it. The ball went flat towards long on, Aiden took a step in front and drove the body in front and tried to hang on to a low catch but could not.
Good length outside off, takes the front leg out the shape and swings but the reach was not enough for him to gain access
Wide full toss has DW fall down as he tried to reach it. He backed away at first, saw it wide and tried to get bat on ball in the air with a leap but missed
Wide low full toss at pace beats the drive on the move, another dot.
Low full toss just outside off is heaved along the ground to long on

Length ball has Powell swing hard through the line of the ball, it was in the air for ages. The ball made the journey to the stratosphere, deceiving the viewer to make it look like it went straight up, but then went behind the long on fielder, who was backtracking
Gets away with a short ball that was around the tramline and Powell let it go

Warner switches his stance, the bowler notices and tries the wide yorker (for the right hander), and DW gilded it with an open-faced bat (like a right hander). The ball went past short-third to the fence
Yorker on the stumps is flicked to deep-midwicket
Wide yorker at 138 kmph has Powell try the sweep. It goes to short-fine leg off the edge along the ground
Makes ample room and slaps a good length ball that was bowled around leg, it went in the air and well over mid off, who was in. Long on had no chance of cutting it off as it went too wide for him

Brings up the 100 partnership with a surgical sweep! Low full toss on middle is swept right between deep-square leg and deep-midwicket, the former made a dive to his right but could not stop it. DW now in the 90s.
Yorker down leg but DW was making room, so he got it on the full and on to, effectively, the off side. Pushed to mid off
Thrashes a full ball over long off to bring up 50! Powell took a step back, the front leg made room for the hands to come through. That was all that was needed to send it over the rope.
Short ball outside off has Powell pull it with all his might but found thin air
Edge off the slash goes over short-third for four! Length outside off, Powell swung through it, got it off the top edge but it went well over the fielder
Good length ball at 157 kmph on off is slashed with the front leg out the way, 'the ball went off the bat at 257 kmph', says Venkat from the scoring seat
good length ball on off, defended to cover.
good length ball swings down the leg side for a wide.
good length ball on fourth stump, punched wide of mid-off for one.
back of a length on the legs, flicked through square leg for one.
full on fifth stump, punched firmly but straight to mid-off.
full on sixth stump this time a touch wider, driven firmly to extra cover.
short on fifth stump at 131 kph, goes to cut and chops this into the ground bouncing to Pant.
full on sixth stump at 138 kph, miscues a drive off the inside edge that dribbles back to Khaleel.
fullish length wide outside off, slashes at this on the up and flays it high over point bouncing away to the rope.

half-volley on the pads whipped straight to short fine leg! This was a boundary ball but Khaleel might wanna go buy lottery tickets tonight with the luck it takes to be caught where Abhishek falls. Whips this ball off his pads and middles it straight to Kuldeep who can't believe he's been picked out and falls over to his left to snatch this at thigh height. Three yards either side of Kuldeep and it's a boundary through fine leg.
back of a length angled across off stump at 137 kph, pushes at this awkwardly and taps it through point.
full and wide angled across seventh stump, left alone.
carbon copy of the previous ball angled wide across Williamson at 137 kph, left alone on seventh stump.
back of a length on off at 143 kph, guided with soft hands to deep third man for one.
short and wide hovering near the off side guideline, goes to cut and misses, delivery deemed legal.
short on off stump at 150 kph, drags a pull along the turf through square leg and it skittles to the rope.
length ball outside off swinging toward the wide guideline at 146 kph, wild flail from Williamson means 7 dot balls in 8 deliveries faced.
short on the hips, flicked through fine leg for one.
back of a length on fourth stump at 144 kph, tapped through backward point for one.

short on the body at 145 kph, Tripathi is cramped for room and bottom edges a pull into the box. Must have taken the pace off the ball on the connection because he's laughing and immediately ready for the next ball.
full and angled across sixth stump at 139 kph, Tripathi backs away with a wild heave and misses taking himself out of reach of the ball.
finally a crisp connection! Length ball sits up at waist height on the body, Tripathi clatters a pull high and deep over backward square leg.
fullish length angled well across Tripathi toward the wide guideline and another drive is missed.
slower ball swings in from fifth stump on a good length at 128 kph, goes to cut and chops this tamely in front of point for one.
back of a length slower ball on middle at 128 kph, Williamson tries to tap and run behind point but picks out the fielder on the ring.
back of a length on middle, tap and run to point for one.

Williamson's miserable stay mercifully ends with a tame edge poked to Pant! Back of a length on fourth stump, backs away trying to run this off the open face to third man but gets it much too fine and edges it low to Pant. Nortje is fired up and does a slew of fist pumps to celebrate.
short and wide hugging the wide guideline, Markram is late trying to cut.
short and wide on eighth stump at 145 kph, cuts this straight to cover.
short outside off at 147 kph, another back foot punch that catches nothing but air.
back of a length on fifth stump at 134 kph, skids low underneath a back foot punch.
back of a length on fifth stump, punched to extra cover, sliding stop.
short and wide, was well outside the guideline and would've been wide if he left this 130 kph delivery alone, but instead he toe slaps it to cover for none.
short and wide, finally picks the gap with a cut to deep third man for one.
short and wide, charges Shardul and slashes this delivery high over third man in the ring, goes over the rope on one bounce.
length ball on fifth stump at 131 kph, Tripathi keeps thrashing like a barracuda and this time connects high over cover bouncing away to the rope.
short and wide again on seventh stump at 134 kph, slices a cut to deep backward point for one.
full on middle, driven to mid-off.
full on sixth stump, goes to drive through cover and miscues this down the ground through mid-on for one.
short and wide, slaps a cut straight to the cover sweeper for one.
fullish length on leg stump at 134 kph, goes to flick to midwicket, leading edge floats behind point to the fielder.
short ball on fifth stump at 133 kph, Tripathi charges and tries to shovel this on the up over mid-off but misses.

picks out deep backward square! Tripathi was trying all sorts of shots to break the shackles to no avail. This time Marsh goes a touch short at 134 kph on middle stump, Tripathi shuffled across premeditated and tried to play a short-arm jab pull in the end rather than fully unleashing his arms. He winds up hitting it very flat and the man on the rope only needs to come in five yards before lunging forward on his knees for a simple catch.
floated full on sixth stump, goes to drive this and misses.
full and wide, drives hard at this and a thick edge goes well wide of Marsh and slip and backspins to the third man rope.
good length on fifth stump, punched through cover for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, punched off the back foot to long-off for one.
good length ball on middle, goes back to swat this cross-batted to long-on for one.
short on seventh stump, goes back to cut and the ball skids quite low underneath the shot.
back of a length on fifth stump at 129 kph, punched to the cover sweeper for one.

fullish length swinging into the pads, uproarious appeal from Marsh upheld. This looked live like it was going well down leg and Pooran goes for DRS immediately. He was hit above the knee roll but the more obvious but was the ball swinging. Ball-tracking shows it was pitching in line but the impact was only marginally in line with the stumps showing umpire's call and the projection shows it was missing leg. Decision overturned and Pooran stays.
good length ball on fifth stump at 136 kph, punched to extra cover on the ring.

short on sixth stump, chops a cut into the covers. The man at extra cover charges in and underhands toward the non-striker's end but the throw is off balance and wild allowing Pooran to make his ground for one.
back of a length on middle, defended back to Marsh.
short and wide, slices a cut high over backward point and collected by the sweeper for two.
good length ball outside off, punched through the off side for one.
overpitched on middle at 83 kph, Markram tees off with a three-wood driving this high and deep over wide long-on.
full on leg stump, backs away to create room to drive to long-off for one.
short and wide, goes to cut and misses this, beaten by extra bounce.
full and wide at 90 kph, width is there to free the arms and launch this over wide long-off thudding into the LCD ad boards.
floated full again this time straighter on middle, driven firmly to long-on for one.
short on fourth stump at 132 kph, heaves a pull flat to wide long-on for one.
length ball angled well down the leg side past a pull for a wide.
length ball into the thigh at 131 kph, goes to pull and misses off the leg before popping up toward Marsh who collects in his follow-through.
full and wide on fifth stump at 134 kph, Markram opens up his wrists to go inside out with a drive high over extra cover, one bounce over the rope for four.
length ball on middle at 132 kph, heaves this across the line and connects well enough to get it along the turf forward of square leg to the rope.
length ball on sixth stump, clears the front leg before slapping straight to extra cover for no run.
length ball on sixth stump at 132 kph, Markram bashes this on the up clearing mid-off in the ring easily to the rope.
breaks out the reverse sweep to a full ball on middle but drags it along the ground straight to backward point.
darts this in mighty quick and full outside off at 114 kph, Pooran is late on a drive.

flighted full on middle, goes to slog sweep this and toe drags an edge to short fine leg, direct hit from the fielder Nortje. No translation needed on that throw but the third umpire says Markram just barely made the ground.
back of a length outside off, miscues a slap into the ground for a dot.
change of angle goes awry for Yadav. Floats this too full spinning into the body from fourth stump, Markram mashes this into the sightscreen just below the press boxes on the second level.
bang bang! Too short on middle, Markram rocks back to slaughter a pull that barely clears the man at deep midwicket for another maximum.
goes for yorker but gets it horribly wrong at shin height as a full toss on the legs, flicked easily to the fine leg rope.
another misfired yorker at knee height on middle stump, but Pooran equally misfires with his shot flubbing this along the ground to long-on for one.
length ball outside off, goes for a big heave and misses.

dropped! Length ball on off stump at 141 kph is fired back like a howitzer off Pooran's bat and nails Khaleel in the left collarbone, or perhaps nearer the upper chest, and ricochets to cover. He never got a hand to it, and in fact his follow-through has his body in a terrible position to be able to protect himself, let alone catch the ball despite it being at a very catchable height within the body frame.

one ball after nearly getting his head taken off by Pooran, Khaleel fights through the pain to snare Markram! Slower ball angled full on eighth stump at 127 kph, Markram is through the drive a touch early and skies this to Kuldeep Yadav at long-off. Simple catch taken in front of his face 10 yards in from the rope.
full and swinging in to off stump at 138 kph, flicked with the wrists and comes close to fizzing past Khaleel's left ear before going to the rope.
length ball angled across sixth stump, Pooran winds up and smokes this over wide midwicket.
goes for wide yorker but it's a shin height full toss on the guideline that Pooran shovels to the cover sweeper for one.
full on off, flicked out straight to midwicket in the ring.
131 kph slower yorker on off, jammed out into midwicket for one.
wide yorker lands well outside the guidelines, wide called.
back of a length tailing down leg, wide called and a fumble by Pant behind but he corrals it to prevent a second extra.
thigh high full toss on the wide guideline, toe-slapped to extra cover for none.
overpitched wide outside off, in the slot for Pooran to crank this over the long-off rope.
short on sixth stump, shuffles across and cramps himself for room on a slower ball at 119 kph, chops a cut into the ground behind the stumps.
fullish length slower ball at 121 kph on the body, Pooran winds up and clobbers this high over backward square leg.
slower ball at 118 kph goes well down leg, triple bounces before Pant who slides left but can't collect it and bounces through him to go for five wides.
full and wide, drives this high and wide of Powell at cover sweeper for a very long single.
yorker on middle, Shashank shuffles well across his stumps and tickles this 131 kph delivery very fine past short fine leg to the rope.

what a way to go. Almost a mirror reversed from the start of the innings of the catch at short fine leg gifted by Abhishek Sharma. Wide yorker is played with a billiards cue shot straight to short third man for a chest high catch to Nortje on the ring! It was a wide if he left it alone. Shashank tries to keep the scoring aggression going and pays the price for barely getting bat on ball.
slower length ball on seventh stump, Abbott scuffs it into the ground back to Shardul.
goes for wide slower ball yorker, sends down a knee high full toss on sixth stump at 117 kph, Pooran miscues a slap tamely to long-on for one.
back of a length on off at 141 kph, tap and run into the covers for one.

wide yorker, Pooran chases this and there's a noise as it passes the bat. Sounded like bat on ground, but there was a clear noise. Given not out and as a wide on field. Pant has a long thought before going for DRS. Big gap between bat and ball on the replay and the wide stays. Review lost.
off the facade of the roof over midwicket! Another slower ball yorker gone awry at thigh height on sixth stump, this time Pooran latches on and sends it nearly out of the stadium.

full and wide yorker lands this time, Pooran slices a thick edge to this 111 kph delivery and gets it between the keeper and short third man, Shardul is able to get a hand to take some pace off it and stop it, but his relay is very wild to allow a second. An accurate throw and Pooran may have been running to the dugout.
full length ball on fifth stump, miscues a drive that dribbles into midwicket for one.
bouncer on middle at 141 kph, Abbott leaps on his toes to knock it back to Nortje.
goes for yorker and misses on the knees at 140 kph, but Pooran flubs this and it clips the pad through to Pant so won't be called a wide. Should've gone for six.
yorker on middle, flicked to deep midwicket for one. Second straight fifty for Pooran, fourth in his IPL career.
length ball on fifth stump, sits up for Abbott to whack high over long-on.

Abbott tries to repeat this shot to a 132 kph slower delivery angled on a length across seventh stump, skies this over short third man and a simple catch is taken at chest height by Ripal backpedaling from the ring at backward point.
142 kph delivery greets Gopal on a good length on fourth stump, fishes at this trying to get a single to put Pooran back on strike and misses.
short on fifth stump at 137 kph, beaten by the extra bounce trying to cut.
Shardul goes for wide yorker, Pooran meets this as a full toss at ankle height and has enough power in his forearms to shovel this over extra cover to the rope.
yorker swings into off stump, jammed out to deep midwicket and they turn down the single. Pooran wants to face everything to give Sunrisers the best chance of an unlikely victory.

dropped at long-off! Shin height full toss on the wide guideline, Pooran spoons this high and wide of long-off, Lalit Yadav charges in and to his right 25 yards and dives forward, gets two hands around it but the ball clangs out as his elbows hit the turf.
another misfired wide yorker as a shin high full toss, this time on fifth stump, well within Pooran's arc to muscle this over the long-off rope.

worst ball of the over and it's going to be a catch for Powell at long-on! Waist high full toss on fifth stump, should've disappeared into the stands again but Pooran miscues this a mile high to Powell who takes a simple catch at chest height. Pooran met the ball around waist height but he stepped several yards outside the crease and after a third umpire review it is deemed legal.
slower bouncer at 117 kph on sixth stump, fans on a cut.

length ball on sixth stump at 131 kph, pushes at this with hard hands and checks his shot slightly, barely clears Warner on the ring at mid-off leaping one-handed. Would've been a regulation catch for Jason Holder if he was on the field of play.
pitches this much fuller this time on seventh stump, Gopal is able to shovel this much more cleanly over wide mid-off to the rope.
full and angled across fifth stump, driven into midwicket for one.
overpitched on fourth stump at 133 kph, Tyagi backs away from leg and slams a drive past the non-striker to the long-off rope.
length ball wide outside off, punched wide of the cover sweeper for two.
139 kph delivery full on fifth stump, driven along the ground to wide long-on for one.
short ball on middle, Tyagi premeditated a charge and swings through this after getting nowhere near to the pitch of the ball, middle and leg stump light up.
short and wide, misses a cut.
short on the legs, shuffles across to pull behind square.
good length ball outside off, tapped away for one.
Gopal goes for a fancy switch hit to a short ball outside off and misses badly.
Starts off with a full ball, swing in into his pads. Worked away gently through backward square leg by Kohli to get off the mark.
Attacks Faf's pads with a full inswinging delivery. Worked away yet again through backward square leg for a single to get going.
Length ball on sixth stump line, shaping in a touch. Kohli taps it to the off side and wants a run but is denied.
Length ball, shaping in a touch on fourth stump channel. Kohli defends it unsurely to the on side.
Easy pickings. Full and on the pads, sliding down. Kohli just tickles it to the vacant fine leg ropes. The man was squarer, at deep backward square leg.
Good comeback! Fuller on off stump, Kohli pushes it back as he comes down. Choudhary hurls a throw back that hits Kohli. All good, after a stare.
Starts off with a wide down leg. Very full, Faf misses the flick.
Length ball around middle and leg, climbs up a bit more. Fended through backward square leg for a single.
Length ball on off and middle, Kohli gets across and defends it to midwicket.

Edged and just past second slip! Heart-in-mouth moment for Kohli, who's not really friends with that area. Full and inviting the drive, well outside off. Kohli does that and gets a thick edge that flies over the right of a leaping second slip fielder,
Length around off, defended solidly to the off side.
On off, worked away to the on side.
A touch fuller around off, whipped away through square leg for a brace to end the over.
Slice of luck for du Plessis now! Length ball just around the off stump, Faf is unsure. Hangs his bat out and gets a thick inside edge through fine leg for four.
Well bowled. Sees Faf charging down and bowls it wider outside off. Misses.
On a length just outside off, du Plessis waits before directing it to third man for one.
Length ball angling away, patted towards covers.
Length ball around off and middle, seaming away a touch. Kohli goes back and keeps it out towards point.
Sprayed well wide, almost outside the pitch. Wide given after Kohli lets it go unhindered.
Full outside off, steered to cover-point. Kohli isn't happy and lets out a grunt.
Length ball on middle, Faf wanted to get to the other end after playing it with soft hands to the off side but the bowler got to it to prevent it.
And the ball goes exactly to where from the fielder was moved. Length ball wide outside off, Faf slashes hard and gets it over the widish second slip.
Good running but Conway did well to get in the slide and save one. It was a length ball that was wristed through square leg.
Bumper outside off, Kohli misses the pull. One for the over given.
Length ball outside off, climbed a bit more than Kohli expected. Got the chop high on the bat towards covers.
Shot! Classic Kohli stroke! Get out all the lovely adjective. Short and wide outside off, Kohli transferred the weight back beautifully and slapped it high and long over covers. Oof, what class!
RCB are accelerating now. The mid-off was a bit wide and Faf just hits the full ball on the rise down the ground for four.
Choudhary bowls it full and wide after seeing Faf shape to scoop and abort.
Another edgy four for du Plessis, this time the outer edge. Full and wide, he reaches out with his feet glued. Gets it well wide of Dhoni. 14 in the last four balls for RCB.
Back to bowling on a length, on the pads. Worked away through backward square leg for two.
Full and outside off, sliced over cover-point for a couple more.
As authoritative as it gets! Faf's back, baby! In the slot, fuller in length. du Plessis gets his front foot out and swings it over long-on for half a dozen.
Superb fielding, Conway! Dives full length to his left to keep it down to just one. Would have been a certain four. It was a shortish ball, slapped by Kohli.
A hint of turn in, Faf works it with the turn through midwicket for one.
Flatter one on a length on off, at 95 clicks. Worked away to deep midwicket for one.
Quicker again, on off and middle. Faf goes back and turns it through midwicket for another single.
Fuller on middle, pushed down to long-on for one.
Sees Faf shuffle in the crease and hurls it short. Goes back and pulls it through midwicket for one. Six singles to end the powerplay.
Tossed up full outside off, driven through covers for one.
Flatter on middle, worked away through midwicket for one.
A touch shorter, but a bit of lift. Faf adjusts and turns it to deep midwicket for a single.
Flatter and quicker outside off, at 98 clicks. Kohli finds point with the cut.
On the pads this time, worked through square leg for one.
Fuller on off, driven past the diving extra cover fielder for a single. Five singles in the over.
Slow, loopy ball outside off, with a bit of spin inwards. Faf adjusts and pushes it to covers.

Moeen is in the team and on the board! A wicket on his second ball on return. Hafl-tracker on off and middle, du Plessis goes back and pulls. But finds deep midwicket to perfection. The RCB captain's poor run continues.
Full on off, driven down the ground to long-on for one.
Shorter and spinning in, Kohli goes back and punches it to long-on for a single.
Floated full outside off, driven to long-off for one.
Quick one. Fuller and slower outside off, Kohli glides it to short third for one.
Fired in on the pads, Kohli misses the flick and it goes off his pads to the fine leg fence. Four leg byes.
Tossed up full around off, Kohli allows it to turn before tapping it to the off side for a quick single.
Fuller on middle and leg, turned away through square leg for one.
Fuller on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler.
Well played! Very well played. A touch short, not very short. Kohli goes deep and cuts it after the ball spins. Gets it well past backward point for four.

Curtains for Maxwell! Didn't let the matchup with Jadeja take place. A horrible misjudgement of the run there. Kohli comes down the pitch and plays the turning ball towards off with soft hands. Uthappa from cover pounces on the ball and returns a swift, fast throw to Dhoni, who does the rest. Maxwell is well short and Kohli cannot believe it. RCB in a spot of bother.
Floated on a length on middle, Kohli goes back and works it with the turn through backward square leg for one.

Uh, oh! An overthrow lets Lomror get off strike and that doesn't please Dhoni. Lomror pushed it towards covers and wanted a run but was sent back. Rayudu's throw misses the stumps and a run was taken.
Worked away to midwicket off the front foot.
Flatter and quicker outside off, Kohli misses the glide.
Slower one turned down leg, Kohli misses the flick.

Jaffa! A perfect off-spinner's dismissal, to use a cliche. And this is proper Test match wicket in a T20I game. Kohli has to walk back for 30 off 33 and RCB are in a hole. Tossed up outside off, inviting Kohli for the drive, just to turn past the inside edge and clatter the stumps.
Fuller and slower on off, driven back to the bowler.
good length on the pads, flicked through square leg for one.
good length straying on the pads, flicked through square leg again for one.
good length ball on fifth stump, cuts this to the point sweeper.
darted in flat and full on off, patted into cover for one.
good length on fourth stump, mistimes a back foot punch to extra cover.
short and wide, slices this to the point sweeper for one.
full on fifth stump, driven to long-off for one.
yummy! Flighted too full on middle and off, Patidar winds up with the three wood and drives this high and mighty over wide long-on.
good length ball on middle spins sharply down leg for a wide.
good length ball on fifth stump turning in, tapped gently in front of square leg for one.
full on off, defended to cover.
full on middle and off, driven to long-off for one.
good length ball on fifth stump turns in past the bat into the pads, hit outside the line of off and goes to fine leg for an extra.
full on off stump, jammed out into the covers.
back of a length on the stumps, flicked straight to square leg.
short and wide, slices this to the point sweeper for one.
full on fifth stump, tap and run into the covers.
back of a length on leg stump, goes back to flick to midwicket.
full on fourth stump, driven wide of extra cover for one.
overpitched on middle, walloped back past the non-striker and umpire to the long-on rope.
full on fourth stump, tap and run into the covers.

tries to repeat his heave off Moeen from the previous over clearing long-on, pitched full on fourth stump and miscues this high but falls safely into no man's land between deep midwicket and long-on for two.
good length ball spins down leg for a wide.
good length ball on off, goes back to flick through square leg for one.
back of a length on fifth stump, punched to the cover sweeper Jadeja for one.
back of a length on middle, flicked through square leg for one.
good length ball on off, flicked to wide long-on for one.
back of a length on the legs, flicked through square leg for one.
overpitched on middle, laces a scorching drive over the ducking non-striker to the long-on rope.
back of a length on middle, tapped wide of the non-striker and Theekshana fumbles chasing after it into midwicket to allow the single to happen.
back of a length outside leg, backs away to cut but chops this into the ground back to the bowler.
flighted full outside leg, frees the arms to slog sweep this on the line and clears the rope at deep midwicket.

stupendous effort charging from deep backward square by Mukesh Choudhary! Length ball angled across off stump, heaves this across the line but gets under it too much and skies it over square leg. Choudhary charges 30+ yards from the rope from deep backward square coming forward in front of square, puts in a full length dive and holds on while getting plenty of carpet burn with his elbows sliding across the nailed in advertising logos square of the wicket. 10/10 on the judge's scorecards from Switzerland, Peru, Zambia, Fiji, South Korea and Canada!
good length ball on fourth stump, defended.
back of a length on the hips, flicked to deep fine leg for one.
Wide yorker lands beyond the wide guideline outside off, left alone and wide called.
back of a length on seventh stump, punched to the cover sweeper for one.
back of a length on leg stump at 127 kph, flicked through square leg for one.
full on fifth stump, shuffles across to slog sweep the pace bowler along the turf through square leg to the rope.
good length ball on off, prodded into the off side.
fullish length on sixth stump, reaches out a long way to drag this slog sweep flat through the air, one bounce over the midwicket rope.
full and wide, driven tamely through cover for one.
length ball on middle, mistimes a slog that barely clears the man leaping from the ring at midwicket, Uthappa, before going to the boundary rider for two.
short and wide, slices this behind point.
darts this in very fast and full at 103 kph on fourth stump, jammed out back to Theekshana.
length ball at 132 kph on eighth stump, swats this flat over mid-off up in the ring and clears the man to go to the rope.
slower wide yorker at 113 kph is tapped through to cover sweeper for two.
length ball lands well outside the wide guideline outside off, left alone and wide called.

dropped by Jadeja charging in from cover sweeper, and he looks hurt! Slower ball lands on a fullish length on fifth stump, skies a drive that swirls over extra cover. Jadeja charges 30+ yards to get to the ball, most players would've have covered the ground to even get to the chance. He gets to the edge of the ring in plenty of time and doesn't even have to dive but the ball bursts through his hands at waist height and it looks like his knee may have jammed into his stomach inadvertently knocking the wind out of himself. He gets up after a minute or so of examination from the physio and will continue.
too full on fifth stump, another slog sweep against the pace bowler and creams this flat over the wide long-on rope.
wide yorker lands well outside the wide guideline at 124 kph, if he left it alone it was a certain wide but reaches out to flay this off the toe to the cover sweeper for one.
full outside off, tip and run in front of point and they scamper back for a sharp too.

low full toss at knee height, tries to muscle this over the midwicket rope but miscues it nearer the toe of the bat and it floats gently to the man at cow corner Gaikwad, who bobbles the chest high chance briefly before holding on five yards inside the rope.

Theekshana is on a hat-trick! Full on fifth stump, tries to muscle this drive over long-off but skews it again off the toe of the bat and it flutters to Gaikwad, who again juggles this chance 20 yards in from the rope but holds onto the second effort lunging forward at knee height.
full on fourth stump darted in quick at 101 kph, driven to long-off for one.
good length ball on sixth stump, goes to pull this and misses.
full on fifth stump at 102 kph, punched out to the off side for one.
Bullseye! Triple-wicket over for Theekshana! Carom ball lands on a good length on middle and skids on past a tame flick across the line to light up the stumps 3/4 of the way up middle and off.

yorker speared in at 125 kph near leg stump, lbw shout upheld. Karthik goes for DRS immediately, believing there's no way this could have pitched in line with the stumps from around the wicket. But live it looked like Pretorius got this very full and straight enough to get the decision legitimately. However, Karthik's instincts are correct. The ball is marginally pitching outside leg and he survives. Decision overturned.
Pretorius aims for a middle stump yorker again, this time gets the length wrong and it's a half-volley sitting up for Karthik to muller over the midwicket rope.
angled across fifth stump full and driven high over mid-off for two.
rinse and repeat from the second ball of the over! Misfired yorker winds up in the slot on middle and off, DK goes deep deep over wide midwicket.
Starts with a full ball at a quicker pace, hit back towards him.
Slower one to follow, a bit of turn there. Gaikwad was a tad early in push and gets it a bit aerially down to long-off for one.
Fuller on middle and leg, flatter as well. Pushed to midwicket.
Conway is off with a reverse-swept four! Sees the line early and gets it through short third.
Shahbaz appeals, probably missing the edge. Conway looks to sweep but gets it off the edge on to DK's pads down leg.
Well played! Now the orthodox sweep to gather another boundary. Was on a length on the pads, he got it well past short fine leg.
Starts with a length ball outside off, cut away to third man for one.
Nearly edged it to slip! Length ball slanting away, lifts after landing. Conway looked to punch it before getting his bottom hand off and gliding it to third man for one.
Length ball outside off, Gaikwad shoulders arms.
Very full outside off, a hint of shape away. RG pushes it back towards the bowler.
On a length and angling in, hops on to the back foot and punches it towards the right of mid-on for one.
Very full on middle and leg, a bit of shape inwards. Gets an inside edge onto his front pad as Conway went for the drive.
Full and outside off, Gaikwad lets it be.
Short of a length and outside off, chopped towards point.
Shot! It was short and wide, Gaikwad is camping on the back foot. Stands tall and slaps it through backward point for four
Length ball outside off, glided to third man for one.
Ahh! One of the drives that makes our sport beautiful - the on-drive from a left-hander. Full on middle and leg, Conway times it nicely past the left of Siraj and gets four more.
Full and straight, drives it down again but cannot beat mid-off. A quick run taken.
Length ball angling away, steered to third man for one.
Length ball outside off, Gaikwad defends it from the crease.
Length ball, hitting top of off, defended solidly from the crease.
Once again, Gaikwad wanted a run after patting it to the off side but Kohli was quick to get to his left from backward point and keep RG on strike.
Back of a length outside off, Gaikwad pulls it all along the ground through midwicket for a couple.
Fuller outside off, comes down the track and pushes it towards covers. Just three off the over.
Length ball, worked off the hips to fine leg for a single.
A successful hoick across the line! Just further than a good length, around off. Gaikwad whips it through midwicket for a boundary.
Audacious! Gaikwad charges down pretty early and Siraj bowls it just a bit wider. But Gaikwad was up for it and hit it right over the bowler's head for another four.
A bit fuller outside off, pushes towards mid-off for a quick run.
Short in length, nails the pull to deep square leg for a single.
Back of a length outside off, pushed through covers for one. Productive over for CSK.
Tossed up around middle and leg, Gaikwad slinks down and pushes it to mid-on for a quick one.
Floated outside off, Conway punches it to covers.
Another punch finds cover to perfection.
That's out of here! Conway picked the legspinner, it was on a perfect length too. He hoicked it over deep midwicket for half a dozen.
Floated fuller outside off, swept through backward square leg for one.
Dismissed out of his presence! Half-tracker on middle, Gaikwad goes back and heaves it over deep midwicket to bring up the 50!
Quicker and flatter on leg, pushed to long-on for one.
Floated outside off, he comes down and drives it down to long-off for one.

A bit of hesitation but they complete the run. Conway played the reverse-sweep and saw it go to short third man and just stopped a bit. But Gaikwad's intent running forced him to take off and make it.

Shahbaz gets RCB the breakthrough! Flatter ball on a shorter length, Gaikwad goes back to pull but gets more height than distance. Hasaranga runs to his right from long-on and pulls off a good, diving catch. Shahbaz strikes outside the powerplay.
Fuller outside off, driven through covers for a single to get off the mark.
How well did Conway use the crease there! A touch short and flatter outside off, spins in a bit. Conway goes on to the back foot quickly and slaps it through covers.
Flatter on off, punched back to the boiwler.

Oh, my word! Uthappa has picked backward point to perfection! A touch short outside off, it was there to be hit. And all he does is find the substitute Prabhudessai to perfection. Maxwell cannot believe his luck. CSK lose two in quick succession.
Flatter down leg, worked through square leg for one to get going.
Tossed up on a length outside off, defended from the crease.
Flatter one around off, Conway punches it down to long-on for one.
Quicker outside off, punched through covers to retain strike.
Flatter outside off, pushed to covers.
A touch short around the sixth stump line, chopped off the bottom edge towards the left of the bowler.
Looped up full outside off, driven through covers for one after the turn.

Excellent running. Rayudu is in despite the direct hit at the bowler's end. Conway turned it through square leg with soft hands and both the batters were aware and got back for a couple. It was bowled with a side-arm action.
Very full outside off, hoicked all along the ground to deep midwicket for one.
Walloped for another half a dozen! Half-tracker and Rayudu adjusts quickly and pulls it wayyyy over deep midwicket.
Flatter outside off, swept through backward square leg for one.
Maxwell gets away with another long hop. Rayudu finds deep midwicket on the bounce with the heave.
Quick running again. Flatter outside off, Conway mistimes the chop to backward point. Rayudu hares to the striker's end.

Maxwell is putting on a show in Pune! Second wicket for the Big Show and he's ecstatic and makes it known. Another shortish ball, a bit slower through the air. Rayudu was early through his punch and saw his middle stump disturbed. These are some serious blows for CSK.
Tossed up outside off, driven through covers for one.
A bit short and flatter, Conway goes back and punches it down to long-on.
good length ball on off, defended.
pitches this on fifth stump, prodded into the covers for one.
good length on middle, punched back to Hasaranga.
good length on middle spins into the legs, flicked to fine leg for one.
flighted full on middle, sweeps and drags this along the ground to short fine leg.
charges a fullish length ball on middle and leg, flicks this wristily high and deep just clearing the rope at wide midwicket.
good length ball on the stumps, flicked through midwicket for one.
full on middle, driven to long-on for one.

edge! No slip to the new batter Moeen and goes to the third man rope for four! Gets Moeen prodding to a fullish length ball on fourth stump with no footwork, would've been a regulation chance at knee height but instead becomes runs.
good length ball on off, defended back to Maxwell.
full and wide, driven to the cover sweeper for one.
full on leg stump, reverse sweeps this straight to backward point.
aims for yorker but instead sends down a knee high full toss on fourth stump that is tamely tapped into the off side.
short on the body at 129 kph, too easy for Moeen to pull this wide of short fine leg on the ring to the rope.
back of a length on middle, goes back to flick into midwicket for one.
overpitched on off, Conway punches a drive that eludes the diving effort at extra cover and goes to the rope beating the sweeper.
back of a length on off, goes back to flick into midwicket for one to bring up his second consecutive fifty, this time off 33 balls.
full on fifth stump, defended into the covers.
short on sixth stump, cut to the cover sweeper for one.
good length on the legs, flicked to deep square leg for one.

nearly a catch at deep square leg! Flighted full on fourth stump, Conwar slog sweeps this in uncontrolled fashion and it flies toward the man on the rope but it lands just wide of his diving effort by two yards before bouncing over the rope.
short on seventh stump, slapped to the cover sweeper for one.
full on fourth stump, defended to backward point.
full on middle, defended to Maxwell's left.

this time Conway does pick out deep backward square leg with the sweep! He got away with this shot in the previous over off Maxwell, but this time drags a full delivery from middle stump too fine behind square and doesn't get the distance nor the elevation, regulation catch at chest height five yards in from the rope for the fielder who barely had to move more than three yards to his right for the chance.
full on middle, flicked straight to midwicket.
full on leg stump, driven to long-on for one to bring up 2,500 runs for Jadeja in CSK colors.
full on leg stump, driven to long-on for one.
missed runout! Good length ball on middle, goes back to flick into midwicket, the fielder collects, spins and fires at the non-striker's end but the throw is wide with Jadeja two yards short.
flighted too full on off, Moeen winds up and smokes a drive over the long-on rope.
back of a length ball into the body, flicked through midwicket for one.
good length ball on off, miscues a flick back to Harshal.
back of a length on fourth stump at 129 kph, punched off the back foot straight to extra cover.
length ball at 124 kph on middle, goes to heave this over the leg side and mistimes it floating toward deep midwicket where it falls short of the diving effort of Patidar and results in two.
back of a length on fifth stump, punched to the cover sweeper for one.

length ball on fifth stump at 127 kph, skies a heave that swirls a mile high over mid-off in the ring. Kohli gets into position very early for this steepler that is by no means an easy take as gravity pulls it back to earth. Kohli goes up with his hands in front of his face, palms facing out, and takes a sharp catch while falling to the ground to cushion the take.
full on middle at 136 kph, flicked though wide long-on for two.
back of a length on middle and off at 133 kph, tapped behind square for one.
length ball on sixth stump at 137 kph, slices this to deep third man for one.
length ball on off, punched to extra cover on the ring for one.
gem! Length ball angled across off stump, beats Moeen prodding at this flat-footed.
short on the body at 132 kph, pulls this behind square for one.
length ball on the stumps, heaves this powerfully over midwicket for the maximum.

Harshal strikes back with the slower ball! Floats this up back of a length on the wide guideline, probably a wide of Moeen leaves it alone, instead he toe slaps it tamely to Siraj on the ring at extra cover.
back of a length slower ball on fifth stump, mishits a flick aiming for midwicket into his pads back to Harshal.
gem! 126 kph length ball on fourth stump, Pretorius pokes at this and is beaten.
yorker on middle and leg, flicked to short fine leg for one.
length ball on off stump, tapped in front of point for one.

the fat lady is starting with her mi-mi-mi-mi-miiiii warm-up exercises. Length ball on fourth stump, Dhoni smokes a pull but doesn't get the elevation and picks out Patidar at head height five yards in from the deep midwicket rope.
length ball on off, flicked through square leg for one.
length ball on off, swatted to long-on for one.
length ball on fifth stump, flicked into midwicket for one.
short ball on fifth stump, goes to pull and top edges this over the keeper to the rope.
length ball on off at 136 kph, slapped to mid-off for one.
one down, five to go! Length ball on off, heaves this a mile high over wide long-on.

length ball at full pace, 129 kph after the slower ball to start the over, Pretorius is hustled for pace and skies a pull back over the bowler. Kohli takes a simple catch at long-on three yards in from the rope at rib height.
length ball on sixth stump, creamed over wide long-on.

Theekshana desperately tried to get out of the way of this length ball speared into the hips. If he did, it would've gone for five wides down leg. Just flicks the pads and goes to the fine leg rope. An argument could be made it should be dead ball because he wasn't really playing a shot there but it's given as four extras.
bouncer clears Theekshana flinching on leg stump at 129 kph, one short ball signaled for the over.
length ball on off, miscues a drive that flutters short of extra cover for one.
on a length, outside off, no swing, left alone
superb shot. He saw the first ball didn't swing, and went after the second. It is wide, quite away from his body, but he drives on the up, and between extra cover and cover for four
slight extra bounce, hits the sticker on the bat as Saha defends outside off
short of a length, wide, Saha punches it in front of cover, but the dive from extra cover denies them runs
extra bounce again, kicking at him off a length well outside off. Saha has had to play this with soft hands towards point
short of a length, and this one nips in a little. Saha defends with an open face
on a length, outside off, hits him high on the bat as he defends
that is not what you want to bowl with the fine leg up and square leg back. On a length, straying into the pads, and Gill has glanced this square of short fine leg
okay these are lucky runs. He just pushes at one short of a length, and gets an inside edge fine of short fine leg for four more
beats him outside off, extra bounce again
pitched up this time, and he pushes are runs, takes mid-on on and makes it easily
uppish punch down the ground, not in control of it, but mid-on is quite wide, and the timing is good on this. The outfield is quick too. This goes straight of that wide mid-on

sensational fielding. Hits the one visible stump down. Gill is not happy. He reckons Sandeep Sharma has got in the way. Gill has pushed this to extra cover and set off. It is timed well, and Rishi Dhawan also gets a good bounce. What also happens is that Gill realises he is struggling so he wants to run in the shortest possible line, which also involves Sandeep's follow-through. So he has to run around him. Caught well short. Don't even need the third umpire. Sandeep not in the wrong at all

pocket rocket. They have just lost a wicket, but if you bowl length at this pace, Saha is going after it. Especially with no swing available. Hits this dead straight over the bowler's head and half-volleys the boundary skirting
slower ball, Saha picks it late, defends
hit straight to mid-off
on a length, into the pads, pushed to short midwicket
they take on extra cover again, but make it easily now as Rishi Dhawan doesn't get that good bounce this time, which means another split second to pick the ball up
just short of a length, Saha looks for a pick-up shot, is beaten and hit on the thigh pad
high full toss, and Rabada just gets away with it re the no-ball. It dips at the last moment, hits him high on the thigh pad and goes for four leg-byes
looks to loft this over mid-off, gets a thickish edge over extra cover for two
superb shot. He gets length just outside off, and goes after it powerfully. Drags him over wide long-on for a six

Rabada has his own back. This pitch has good bounce so Rabada doesn't really have to go short of a length to bother Saha with the bounce. Saha is looking for the hit over mid-off, but the extra bounce means he gets too much under it. Agarwal back-peddles quite some way from mid-off to take a superb catch
on a length, outside off, left alone
edge on a forward defensive outside off but falls well short of the slip
tries the straight change-up, but strays down leg
wide length ball, driven on the up, but straight to cover-point
shape back in towards top of off, defended with an open face again
wide length ball, driven on the up, to the right of the square third man
soft hands, pushed towards point, and they set off for a single
on a length, just outside off, defended
on a length, some shape away, Sudharsan runs this behind square for one
some shape for Arshdeep, but well down the leg side
on a length, around off, pushed to cover
on a length, good bounce again, Pandya punches it to cover
slightly fuller, letting him drive, but Pandya can't get it past short cover
soft hands, placed in front of point for one
short of a length, opens the face, takes the single. Just four off the last over of the powerplay
and he starts with a wide down the leg side
walks down at him, drives on the up, straight of mid-off, gets a single

what a big moment in the match. The wicket of Hardik Pandya after he has practically blocked out two overs in the powerplay. Looks to drive this length ball on the up, and the face is open because he is looking to go through the covers. The ball moves ever so slightly to take the edge through to the keeper
hit on the thigh pad as this ball holds its line and bounces a little extra
slight shimmy down the wicket to push this to cover
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for a single
full and straight, drops and runs for an easy single
flighted outside off, defended back to him
driven down to long-off for one
another offbreak, pushed to backward point
slow in the air, around off, full, defended with an open face
tossed up wide, driven wide of long-off, comes back for the second
slow in the air, just short of the driving length, placed in front of point for one

the line is expected to be straight but he bowls too full and too straight here, and has been clipped away in front of deep square leg. Rabada, though, gives a good chase and puts a dive in to save two runs
short of a length, tucked away into the leg side for one
full and straight, can't get the push past the bowler
Sudharsan walks at him, Dhawan shortens the length, concedes a single to deep square leg
full and wide, that is dangerous because there is no deep cover, but Miller manages only a single to long-off
full, just outside off, driven to long-off for one
wrong'un to start off, punched to extra cover
legbreak, worked past midwicket, and they take the second. Into the big side so gets it into a gap. Still Rahul Chahar has a chance if he gets behind the wicket, but he isn't
wrong'un, punched to extra cover again
short of a length, offbreak, cut away fine of deep point for two
legbreak now, tucked away off the hip for one
cut away off a length, Rajapaksa fumbles at point, allowing them a single
wide length ball, driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, outside off, beats his cut with extra bounce
cut away this time to deep point for one
down the wicket to drive this to long-off for one
slower ball, looks like the knuckle ball, and he has to delay his shot, which means he can't place it past point
slower ball again, punched away to deep cover for one
on a length, middle and off, offbreak, worked into the leg side for one

Livingstone ia doing a great job for Agarwal even as Chahar gets his hand looked at. Full ball, offbreak, Miller thinks this is in the wheelhouse, but I suspect it is too close to him. He doesn't get the height he needs. Also it turns to take the thick edge. Caught at long-off
on a length, middle and leg, worked into the leg side for one
legbreak, a touch short, he gets inside the line to pull this past short fine leg. Arshdeep chases to his left from fine leg but can't catch up. First boundary in 48 balls
low full toss, hit into the leg side for one
on a length, just outside off, pushed into the off side
slower bouncer, well outside leg, he looks to pull it behind the wicket but can't catch up with it
slower short ball, upper-cut away square of deep point
punched away wide of long-on. Third slower ball of the over. Short of a length. Sudharsan muscles it down the ground, wide of long-on, Shikhar Dhawan's dive is not enough to keep this in
slower legcutter, on a length, hit uppishly to long-on for one
fullish, on-pace, just outside off, pushed to extra cover
slower ball, full outside off, driven to deep point for one
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
wrong'un, punched to extra cover
another wrong'un, opens the face, gets the single. Picks it off the surface
legbreak, on a length, played to the right of extra cover for one
he has dragged this legbreak down, and Sudharsan pulls it between deep square and deep midwicket
wrong'un, on a length, punched down to long-off for one
another drag down, Tewatia pulls this in front of deep midwicket. Gets two for it
yorker, just outside off, dug out for one
slower ball, short of a length, outside off, punched to deep point for another single
yorker, swirling away from him, called wide even as it squeezes under the bat. That is a harsh call. It has gone inside the blue line
on a length, outside off, driven to long-off for one
slower ball, yorker, dug out back to him
on a length, outside off, Tewatia opens the face, Arshdeep puts in a diving save at short third man
full toss, wide outside off, sliced away to deep point for one. Rishi D 4-0-26-1
slower short ball, cue-ended to deep midwicket for one
on a length, outside off, opens the face, Rajapaksa fumbles, allowing them a single
Rabada caught in two minds. Arshdeep has drawn a mis-hit with a full ball, Rabada charges in from mid-off, but bails out in the end, and thus allowing it go wide of him for four
short, outside off, pulled to long-on for one
on a length, on off, runs off the outside edge for a single to third man
just misses the yorker by inches, clipped away off the toes for two tom deep square leg
wide length ball, called wide, is wide
another wide outside off. He is looking to bowl hard lengths wide outside his reach
goes full and straight finally, Bairstow misfields at long-on, and they come back for two

that wide length ball finally pays off. Rabada gets it spot on. Wide and slow, but not wide enough to be called. Tewatia tries to go into the short leg boundary, but gets a top edge, which is caught at short third man
he is on a hat-trick. Cross seam, on a length, just outside off, Rashid opens the face looking for a single, but it holds its line to take the edge through to the keeper
wide length ball, and he defends it solidly back to Rabada
short of a length, around off, pushed towards short midwicket
sharp bouncer, beats his hook, and is called wide for height
short of a length, outside off, takes a risky single to short midwicket. PBKS won't mind it because Sudharsan is away from strike at the start of the next over
quite an angular run, slower ball, on a length, goes for a single to third man
Sudharsan gets to his fifty with a six. Arshdeep goes short, and he pulls it over midwicket. Just sits up to be hit. Only the fifth six off Arshdeep this IPL
on a length, outside off, punched down to long-off for one
nails the yorker. Stumps splayed. It keeps swinging in, goes past the inside edge, and clatters the stumps of the No. 8 batter
yorker, middle and leg, dug out to midwicket for one
full toss, thigh high, hit wide of deep midwicket for two
that's one way of scoring them. Ferguson backs away early, Rabada goes short and at him. and Ferguson gets a healthy top edge over the keeper's head

if you just look at Ferguson, he will resemble the Guptill no-look six. But the ball si doing something else. Just like with Saha earlier, this cross-seam delivery has extra bouncer and Ferguson gets too much under it. Long-on takes the skier
yorker, dug out back to him
slower short ball, pulled into the leg side for one
slower ball, beats his drive, but Jitesh Sharma fumbles the take and allows them a bye
short, outside off, pulled to deep midwicket for one
yorker, angling in from round the wicket, dug out for one
yorker outside off, dug out to long-off
slower ball, on a length, wide outside off, just the single
short on sixth stump at 135 kph, Bairstow tries to steer this through third man but it's cut off on the ring.
back of a length on fourth stump at 137 kph, defended to backward point.
short on fifth stump at 133 kph, Bairstow goes to pull on the front foot and misses.
short into the ribs, pulled fiercely but straight to deep fine leg, fielded on a bounce for one.
short on sixth stump, cuts this firmly but straight to backward point.
back of a length on the legs, flicked to deep fine leg for a single to end the over.
short and wide on seventh stump, Dhawan lights this up with a cut over cover.
rinse and repeat! Short and wide again at 130 kph on seventh stump, this time Dhawan waits a fraction longer and slices this in the air behind point to the rope.
short and wide again, Dhawan misses a hat-trick of cuts to the point boundary with a flailing effort after charging down the track.
full on fifth stump, driven to mid-off for none.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended to cover.
gem! Back of a length shapes away at 134 kph from off stump to beat Dhawan's charge.
length ball swinging away from fifth stump at 141 kph, Bairstow misses with a flat-footed swish away from his body.

Sangwan clutches on after circling around to this top edge at deep fine leg! Length ball on fourth stump, another flat-footed heave results in a skier swirling behind square on the leg side. Sangwan jogs 25 yards to his left along the rope and steadies himself before lunging forward to cushion the ball in.
good length ball shaping away from seventh stump, flat-footed swish from Rajapaksa but doesn't catch the edge.
short and wide on the guideline at 142 kph, slashes this over point to the rope to get off the mark.
short and wide bouncer at 140 kph, starts to shape to cut before turning it into an awkward pull, either way Rajapaksa misses.

short on the hips, flicked wide of Ferguson at deep fine leg, sliding stop on the rope and relayed in for two. But the third umpire reveals his trailing leg has stepped on the boundary triangle when trying to get to his feet so it is four in the end.
bouncer over fifth stump, Dhawan goes to uppercut this but misses.
short ball again on fifth stump, gets on his toes trying to uppercut this again but misses.
back of a length on fourth stump, this time connects with a late cut guiding this wide of slip to deep third man for one.
short on the legs at 138 kph, pulled to deep fine leg for one.

sharp catch in the Titans dugout at third man! Joseph follows Dhawan backing away from leg stump with a bouncer but he's still crafty enough to get the uppercut connecting sweetly to fly over the rope.
short on the hips, flicked to the fine leg rope.
short on off stump, guided with soft hands behind point for one.
good length ball angled into the body at 141 kph, misses with a swipe.
length ball on fifth stump at 142 kph, left alone.
back of a length on fifth stump, beats Dhawan playing back on his toes.
back of a length on off stump, defended into the thigh off an inside edge and dribbles back to Shami.
Dhawan continues to pepper the point boundary as he did to Sangwan. Short and wide on sixth stump, freebie for Dhawan to crank with another cut in the off side gap behind point.
short and wide at 145 kph, too wide to reach and will have to rebowl.
short on the body, flicked behind square for one.
short and wide, goes to cut and catches nothing but air.
short on seventh stump at 141 kph, left alone.
in the slot on sixth stump at 147 kph, Dhawan shovels this flat over extra cover to the rope.
length ball on sixth stump, left alone.
short and wide at 142 kph, Ferguson is stubbornly persisting with a plan that results in two slashed wide of deep third man.
length ball into the body on off stump, heaves this across the line over midwicket.
Sangwan overcompensates getting this too full now on fourth stump, pumped back over the bowler to the mid-off rope.
length ball on fifth stump, punched into the off side for one.
short and wide, uppercuts this over wide third man, one bounce over the rope.
