knee high full toss on off, punched firmly to mid-onfor one. Shami misfields to ensure it is completed. That ball could easily have gone for six but Dhawan was merciful to Sangwan.
good length ball on off at 132 kph, tapped to long-on for one.
good length ball on off, spits off the pitch with extra bounce, tapped away awkwardly to cover.
good length ball on the legs, flicked behind square for one.
googly lands on a good length on fourth stump and spins away, tapped through point for one.
full on fifth stump, sweeps this along the turf through square leg for one.
good length ball on fourth stump, goes back to flick through midwicket for one.
googly on middle on a good length, Rajapaksa boldly exposes his stumps backing away from leg and misses a cut as the ball clears middle with extra bounce.
short on off, backs away to cut, chops this into the ground and the keeper can't corral it as it balloons over his head, goes to deep third man for runs before Ferguson slides to stop it.
bouncer on leg stump, fended away behind square for one.
short on leg stump, goes to pull and a top edge sails over the keeper and is slapped back in by Sai Kishore at deep fine leg to stop a boundary. He's on as a sub for Sudharshan.
back of a length on the legs pitching well outside leg, late on a flick and it comes off the pads behind square for one.
good length ball on middle, goes to flick through square leg for one.
fullish length on fifth stump, goes to drive and is beaten for pace.
googly lands on off and spins across on a good length at 95 kph, goes back to punch to long-off for one.
back of a length on fifth stump, slices a cut straight to short third man.
good length ball well outside leg follows Rajapaksa backing away, still makes enough room to cut behind point for one.
googly lands full outside leg, tapped away behind square for one.
half-tracker at 97 kph on leg stump, too easy to flick this with a pull over square and bisects deep square leg and deep backward square to the rope.
back of a length on fifth stump, punched to extra cover in the ring.
full on fourth stump at 144 kph, shuffles across and blunts this back to Joseph.
fullish length on fifth stump, punched behind point for one.
shuffles outside leg to heave this 145 kph that Joseph follows him with going full but doesn't cramp his enough to prevent a skied drive into no man's land over midwicket for two.
full and wide, driven through cover for one. Fire alarm starts blaring for a no ball signaled by the third umpire.
goes for yorker and spears in a shin high full toss on off, flicked through midwicket for one.
bouncer at 144 kph follows Rajapaksa backing way outside leg stump, misses a pull and Saha leaps to collect getting a hand to it, reducing four byes to one.
back of a length on off, shuffles across to flick into the leg side for one.
good length ball tapped away through the ring for one.
back of a length on the hips, flicked to deep fine leg for one.
full on fifth stump at 144 kph, pumped with ease past mid-off up in the ring to the rope. Half-century up for Dhawan, the 47th of his IPL career. What a machine.
back of a length on the hips, late on a flick and it comes off the pads into the leg side for an extra.

when this goes for six, you know it's Punjab's day! Short on the hips following him backing away from leg, Rajapaksa takes one hand off the bat to flick this as he's cramped for room, somehow gets enough of this to get it sailing over the fine leg rope thudding into the LCD ad boards.

Rajapaksa practically gave himself out lbw before the umpire could raise the finger! Slower ball cutter lands full on middle and leg stump, wild heave across the line misses and a big appeal is belted out. Rajapaksa turns his back to walk off past the keeper Saha before he sees the umpire's finger go up. It was that straight.
edge! Googly goes to the rope at third man! Floated full on fifth stump, goes to drive and there's no slip in place so the edge turns into four instead of a wicket.
full on off, driven back to Rashid.
back of a length on fourth stump, defends this into the ground.
full on fifth stump, drives at this and an inside edge goes to fine leg for one.
googly spins in from fifth stump, punched through cover for one.
googly lands full on fifth stump, drives at this and a thick edge goes through point for one.
full on fifth stump at 123 kph, sliced behind point for none.

length ball on fifth stump, slices a cut behind point where Sai Kishore sweeping does his best football central defender sliding stop to kick the ball back into play as if the keeper has been beaten and he's the last line of defense to prevent a goal. TV umpire taking his sweet time interrupts Ferguson charging in to bowl the next ball. Initially given as two and the third umpire says it's clean.
short ball tails down leg at 145 kph, wide called.
bouncer over fourth stump at 134 kph, sails over Dhawan's attempted uppercut and Saha's leap behind the stumps, five wides accelerates the charge to victory by Punjab.
slower ball on a good length on off, defended watchfully back to Ferguson.
fullish length on fifth stump, shovels a drive uppishly that lands just short of mid-off on the ring.
yorker on middle, jammed out to cover.
good length ball on the legs at 141 kph, flicked to deep fine leg for one.
googly lands on leg stump on a good length, defended on the back foot back to Rashid.
full on middle, driven to long-off for one.
full on fourth stump, punched to extra cover for one.
full on off, charges and drives this in the air to long-off for one.
good length ball tailing down leg, goes to flick and misses off the pads, no wide called, correctly.

googly spins in from a good length on off stump, spins in sharply past the forward poke. Big lbw shout denied. Rashid and Hardik agree to go for DRS. Live this looked like this was spinning in too sharply and missing leg. Ball-tracking shows it was in fact going over the top of the stumps. Same difference. Review lost.

into the third tier!!!! Or did it clear the roof altogether?! Length ball on middle, Livingstone annihilates this over deep backward square and it clangs off the 15th row of the upper deck before bouncing back toward the field of play. It went 117 meters. Shami has to crack a smile. Even he's impressed someone could hit him that far.
knee high full toss on the legs, heaves this a mile high but lands on the field level seats on top of a covered tarp. Just 96 meters this time. So underwhelming...

hat-trick of sixes now! Bouncer angled across fifth stump at 137 kph, goes to pull this and a top edge is produced by the angle that swirls over the keeper and over the rope. Just 69 meters now. They keep getting shorter and shorter but they all still count for the maximum.

slower length ball on the body at 119 kph, pulls this behind square and dribbles to the rope. Now this is seriously underwhelming. This is like the Benjamin Button of batting overs. A two must surely be on the cards now.
yorker speared in to middle, indeed he digs it out through wide midwicket for a sharply run two. My money's on a single for the next ball followed by a dot....

Livingstone finishes the match with a wild spray off the outside edge over the third man rope for another four! Full and wide outside off at 141 kph, slices a hack that clears short third man on the ring and goes to the rope.
Starts with a lovely length ball outside off that swings away after it passes Buttler, who shoulders arms.
Fuller this time around the fifth stump line, Buttler stays in his crease and pushes it to the off side.

The bowler will have a stare at the mid-on fielder. Narine was the man. Full on off, Buttler got it off the inner half. Narine didn't put in the dive and Southee, chasing from mid-off, came second despite the late dive. Narine didn't really move well there.
Fuller outside off, Buttler looks to drive away from the body. Gets an inside edge onto his pads.
Peach! The first over and Umesh Yadav has been a story this season. Pushes it fuller around off, getting it to move away. Buttler pushes at it but gets beaten.
Such a terrific first over, and would have been even more so if not for that boundary. Fuller ball on off, Buttler gets it off the inner half to midwicket. A proper, working over that.
Flatter on middle and leg, pushed back.
Fuller on off, pushed to mid-off.
Fired on the pads, pushed down to long-on for one.
Tossed up full on off, driven down to long-off for a single. Roy's keeping it tight.
Flatter one on the pads, sliding with the arm. Padikkal flicks it through square leg for a single.
Excellently bowled. Perhaps saw Buttler charging down and fired it on the pads. Buttler couldn't do much. Just three off the over.

And Umesh strikes in the powerplay, not for the first time this season! Another cheap dismissal for Padikkal. Spears it full on off and middle, Padikkal looks to work it away but ends up pushing it back off the face of the bat. Umesh stretches his right hand and takes it on the second go. Delight for the Knights, dismay for Royals.
On a length on off, would have hit top of off. Driven firmly to mid-off.
On a length again on off, pushed back to the bowler.
Full on off this time, finds mid-off with the drive. Four dots in the over.
Back of a length on the pads, pushed to midwicket. Five dots in the over, eight in succession for Umesh.

They wanted a quick run but Buttler had to be sent back. It was a firm push to covers. In fact, Buttler was the only one wanting a run, and eventually made it as the throw missed the stumps at the bowler's end. A maiden.
That crouching position from Buttler is back against the spinner. Pushes the slow, full one towards point.
Slower through the air, fuller on off. Buttler is very watchful in defense, unsure though.
Slow again, fuller on the pads, flicks it to long-on for a single after nine dots.
On a length, curving away just a touch. Samson punches it to covers.
What perfect timing that is! Again it was bowled slow and on a length outside off. Samson stood tall and pushed it through cover-point and had enough to get four, despite Roy's valiant chase.
A touch fuller on off, pushed back to the bowler. Quite a quiet start this.
And it's business as usual finally for Buttler! Full and outside off, Buttler drives it on the up through covers. Finds the gap perfectly.
Back of a length ball around off and middle, Buttler hops and pushes it back.
Length ball down leg, Buttler misses the pull. A stifled appeal follows.
Short ball on a slower pace outside off, guides the pull through square leg for one.
Banged in short on the stumps, Samson thinks of pulling before ducking. But Umesh has overstepped.

Doesn't matter how the runs come for Royals, Samson would take 'em all. That was hurled full outside off, Samson didn't connect the smash well. Gets it off the outer half and through third man for four.
Just over or did Southee get a hand to it? Finger tips! Length ball outside off, Samson takes the aerial route over mid-off and gets another four.
A yes and no call, but all's well in the end. Full on middle, driven to mid-on. 15 off the overs but I think KKR and Umesh will take 1/19 from his three in the powerplay.
Flatter outside off, hit to cover.
Side-arm ball on middle, pushed through mid-off for one.
Tossed up full on off, knocks it down to long-off for a single.
Floated up, Buttler charges down and takes it on the full to hit it to long-off for one.
That's hit straight over the bowler, but Mavi does well running to his right from long-off to keep it down to two. Samson read the flight well to go aerially.
A perfect finish to the powerplay, courtesy Sanju Samson. Sees the tossed up ball around middle, makes room by moving to leg and bashes it over extra cover for half a dozen.
Full on off, driven to cover.
Very full outside off, Buttler has a go and it but misses.
Well done, Russell. It was full on the pads, Buttler flicked it through backward square leg. Dre Russ covered good ground to his right to save two.
Punched off the back foot to cover.
Buttler's skied it but it lands in no-man's land! Ahh, the luck. He was done in by Mavi's slower one and managed to hit the attempted smash only as far as mid-on.
Full and outside off, steered to point for one. Another slower one to finish the over.
Fuller carrom ball outside off, gets it off the outer half to short third man.
Samson finds the gap expertly. Just a tad short and turning in, he goes back and opens the face in the cut to get it through backward point and short third.
Fuller on the pads, pushed towards mid-on.
Pushed back to Narine.
Samson works this through square leg and takes one. Just as he turned to go for the second, seems to have twitched his back.

Has Anukul done well? Yes he has, reckons the TV umpire. Buttler got forward and paddled the sweep fine down leg. Roy rushed from fine leg, put in the slide but didn't stop the ball cleanly. But the umpire thinks he's done well.
Sprays it down wide, Samson misses the flick.
Full on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on for one.
Narine's clearly struggling on the field. Makes a hash of the fielding attempt at fine leg to concede a four. Butler got the hack off the inner half against the length ball.

Brilliant catch from Mavi running to his right from long-on! And that's that tonight for Buttler. He had decided to tee off, clearly. Got a fair piece off the full ball on middle. Would have been a six, if not for Mavi, who timed his jump perfectly to catch that above his head.
Off the mark, courtesy the inside edge to fine leg. Looked to push the fullish ball on middle and leg to the on side.
Full and outside off, Samson glides it to third man and gets to the other end.
Super timing. Full and outside off, driven through covers for a brace. Nine runs and a wicket off the over.
Tossed up on a length on middle, pushed towards midwicket. Roy himself runs and does the fielding.
A touch shorter on middle, Samson goes back and punches it to long-on for one.
Flatter on middle, Nair goes back to wrist it to deep midwicket for one.
Fired on the pads, Samson is a bit late to the flick and gets it off the leading edge towards the bowler.
Slows it down and drops it full, Samson lunges and pushes it to cover.
Well bowled. Saw Samson back away again, like the last ball of the powerplay, and bowled it full. Could only push back to long-off for a single.
full and wide, timed firmly but straight to the point sweeper cut off and relayed in for one.
fullish length on off stump at 133 kph, Karun backs away and mistimes a heave through long-on for one.
fullish length outside off, shovels this in the air over cover and beats the sweeper to the rope.

pure class! Dripping like butter off this imperious cut! Not too much width on fifth stump for this delivery that is fractionally short, but Samson places this exquisitely behind point and the timing is just as good.
back of a length on fourth stump at 134 kph, punched to long-on for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, guided with soft hands behind point for one.
good length ball on off, punched to long-on for one.
back of a length on off, defended back down the pitch and fielded by Narine.
full on off, punched through long-on for one.
backs away to cut through the off side, Narine follows him and he mistimes this cross bat swipe back to Narine.

full on fourth stump, top edged sweep swirls toward deep backward square. The fielder on the rope takes a very interesting route to the ball and it results in it bouncing in front of him before relaying in for a single.
good length ball on the stumps, flicked into midwicket for one.
fullish length on the legs at 132 kph, Samson tickles this. very fine, keeper dives down the leg side but it's barely out of his reach and goes to the rope.
back of a length on off stump at 133 kph, tap and run with soft hands into cover for one.
fullish length on the legs, flicks at this and is late, comes off the pads into the leg side for an extra.
good length ball on the stumps, flicked into the leg side for one.
yummy! Fullish length on off at 124 kph, Karun backs away to create room to launch this with a drive over extra cover and times it deliciously to the rope.
fullish length on middle at 138 kph, backs away again looking to drive and pumps this straight back to Southee, who slows it down in his follow-through but it trickles past him for one to mid-off.

Karun charges this and telegraphs it way too early. Anukul drags the length back very short, Karun continues on with a cross bat swipe to a short ball on fifth stump. Rinku Singh came in off the rope initially at deep midwicket before backpedaling and taking a head high catch five yards in from the rope.
good length ball on off, flicked to long-on for one.
full on off, driven firmly to Russell at cover sweeper for one to bring up Samson's 17th career IPL half-century, and second this season.
full on fourth stump, driven firmly to long-off for one.
short and wide, slices this to backward point, tumbling stop on the ring.
overpitched on middle and off, Riyan dips the back leg to stroke this back over the bowler's head and into the sightscreen.
back of a length on off, defended to backward point.
Samson flirts dangerously outside off! Back of a length on fourth stump, not wide enough to cut. Samson tries to get too cute trying to run this to third man for one and is beaten.
slower bouncer on eighth stump at 124 kph, Samson flails aimlessly at this missing another cut.
full on sixth stump, flicked high over the ring and fielded at long-on for one.
short ball on fifth stump, gets on his toes to glide this to third man and misses.

sloppy from Finch at deep third man. Short and wide slower ball at 116 kph on seventh stump, guided with an uppercut over backward point. Finch circles around from deep third man on the rope and puts in a pedestrian effort reaching down rather than sliding and winds up fumbling the ball into the rope. What should've been two at worst becomes a boundary. Finch kicks the foam triangle in frustration.
good length ball on fourth stump, cuts this to backward point where a tumbling stop forces Parag to turn Samson back.
back of a length on middle, goes back to punch to long-on for one.
back of a length on middle, goes back to flick into midwicket for one.
darted in flat and full at 94 kph on off, driven to long-off for one.
short on off, goes to pull this 102 kph delivery but it skids on quick and results in a bottom edged drag to midwicket.
back of a length on the legs, goes to flick into the leg side and misses off the pads.

full on middle, heaves across the line and misses badly and is struck low on the back leg with the knee flexing. Big lbw shout upheld. It looks pretty straight ive but they go for the DRS review. And Samson is vindicated with the review as ball-tracking shows the ball hit him more in line with leg stump and was tailing down leg.
short on the body, goes to pull and mistimes this into the leg side for one.
back of a length on the hips, goes to heave this away and misses off the hip before dribbling back to Southee.
bouncer on fourth stump, goes for a wild heave and misses.
head for the chopper! The predator turns into prey as Parag slaughters this into the second tier! Length ball sits up on middle stump at 133 kph, Parag clubs this mightily into the third row of fans.

slower ball at 122 kph on off stump lands on a good length, heaves this toward deep midwicket but doesn't time it well. Anukul makes a casual jog 10 yards to his left along the rope and takes this at chest height in stride facing long-on three yards in from the rope.

Deep midwicket continues to be a popular catching zone today! Fullish length ball on off, Samson skies this a mile high but doesn't get the distance. Rinku Singh gets back into position very early to set his body before taking a step forward from the rope to take a safe catch at waist height.
back of a length on the stumps at 139 kph, tap and run into the leg side for a sharp single.
full on leg stump, defended.
full on off, tap and run into the off side.
full on middle, flicked through midwicket for two.
beamer on the chest tailing down leg, pulls this to deep fine leg for one. Clear no ball called from square leg. Free hit coming up.
slower ball lands full on sixth stump at 116 kph, Hetmyer scuffs the free hit into the ground dribbling to long-on for one.

Hetmyer may have flubbed the free hit to end the last over but he's creamed this straight out of the middle! Length ball at full pace from Southee, Hetmyer leans back and heaves this onto the tarp covering the field level stands over midwicket.
fullish length on fourth stump, half-volley length and Hetmyer rinses and repeats this heave over midwicket onto the tarp covered stands again.
bouncer down the leg side, Hetmyer misses with a pull, wide called.
fullish length on sixth stump, finally a miscue to a Southee slower ball at 123 kph and it dribbles toward long-off for one.
short on middle at 130 kph, pulls this gently to deep midwicket for one.
short and wide, Hetmyer cuts this wide of Russell at deep extra cover, tumbling stop running to his right along the rope to turn four into two.
bouncer over the stumps, this time a wide is called on height as Hetmyer misses a hook.
short and wide cutter at 122 kph, slices this again wide of Russell who dives to stop at extra cover sweeper and relays in for two.
full on the legs, flicked to deep square leg for one.

full and wide aiming for the wide guideline, Hetmyer shuffles across his stumps to get in line and bends the back leg to get under an extra cover drive. No protection there now on the rope and it's an easy four.
full and wide yorker lands past the guideline, Hetmyer shuffled past his stumps but then left it alone. Under the new law, the umpire rightly deems it a legal delivery.
short on the wide guideline, Hetmyer misses a wild heave after dancing across the crease.

slower ball lands short and wide on the guideline at 108 kph, Hetmyer toe slaps this high over mid-on and lands well short of the fielder charging in. Hetmyer beats the relay to the keeper's end for two.
Bowls it on a length, a hint of swing inwards. Indrajith stands tall, tucks it to fine leg and rushes off to get going.

Very good ball. The inswing and Finch don't really see eye to eye. Finch reaches out to drive it and gets it off the inner edge through backward square leg. Kuldeep runs to his left from fine leg and keeps it to two.
Beauts! Full and outside off, Finch fishes at it as the ball goes straight through. Just past the outside edge.
On a length slanting away, pushed towards covers for a quick run.
Fuller around off and middle, perhaps the one going away. Indrajith watchfully pushes it back.
Full and down leg, Indrajith misses the flick. Samson dives full length to his left to pouch that.
Length outside off, pats towards covers to get to the other end.
Full and coming in around off and middle, Indrajith gets an inside edge onto his pads as he looked to defend.
Delectable flick. Full on off and middle, he gets his bat down straight and works it through midwicket for four.
Full again, just around the fourth stump line. Pushed back to the bowler.
Lovely delivery. Angles in to Indrajith before leaving him, all just outside off. Beaten on the outside edge.
Quite full on middle and leg, flicked straight to Chahal at midwicket.
Quick run! Length ball on off, tapped towards cover-point. Hetmyer runs it from backward point and has a shy at the batter's end but missed.

Oh dear! What has happened there?? Prasidh Krishna has made Boult his target with a direct hit. Thankfully no harm done. Indrajith pushed the full ball to mid-on and set off. Prasidh got his aim wrong and Boult got hit on his shoe as he jumped. Jeepers! And they take another run off the overthrow.
Punched to covers from the crease.
Pushed towards cover-point for a single. Was slanting away from him.
Full outside off, hit straight to cover.
Length ball around middle and leg, Finch misses the flick now.
Full and swinging in, gets it off the inner half through square leg to retain strike.
Starts with a length ball down leg, that Finch misses tucking away.

A delightful sight for a fast bowler. The stumps lighting up the alley! Finch falls early yet again and he wouldn't want to watch the replay. Length ball outside off, he looks to force the issue through the off side and only ends up playing it on. Immediately throws his head back in disgust as Kuldeep leaps to celebrate.
Not the best-looking, ehh? That was perfectly timed and good to see. Length ball outside off, Shreyas goes back and punches it through cover-point. All timing and no power.
That was sheer pace! 148 clicks! Shreyas looks to swish and misses.
Full on off, worked to midwicket.
Outside off on a full length, driven to cover.
Length ball angling down, Shreyas flicks it aerially towards deep square leg for one.
Lands it on a length outside off, pushed to cover.
Short ball angling in, Shreyas works it through midwicket and wants two. Has to settle for one as Chahal mops it up quickly.
A bit fuller outside off, hit straight to cover.
Full and angling in, hoicks it all along the ground to deep square leg for one.
Boult sees Shreyas walking across and bangs it short. Passes down leg, wide given but Boult isn't happy.
Back of a length around middle, tapped to the on side.
Back of a length again, as Shreyas shuffles back and across. Pushes it towards mid-off for a quick single.
Played well. Iyer stands back and steers the length ball past the diving backward point fielder for two.

"He was done like dinner," says Matthew Hayden as Indrajith survives a run-out chance. He responded his skipper's call for a quick single, that was non-existent. Shreyas hopped and bunted a back of a length ball down the pitch and called for a run, Prasidh got to the ball and under-armed the throw at the striker's end but missed.
Bread-and-butter shot in this day and age! Full and on middle, Indrajith shuffles and scoops it over short fine leg for four.

Indrajith is bounced out with the fine leg coming into play right away. He only managed to get a top edge off the pull that was safely gobbed up by Ashwin at fine leg. Good comeback by Prasidh after the boundary previous ball.
144.2 kph length ball slanting away. Rana is beaten for pace as he looks to punch that.
Back of a length around middle and leg, pushed towards cover-point.
Delightful! Just a bit of width and not too short, either. Shreyas goes back and cuts it through backward point. Sweeper stood no chance.
Fuller and slower outside off, Iyer goes back and plays it with a closed face through mid-on for one.
Flatter on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on for one.
Carrom ball bowled full wide off the crease, pushed down to long-on for a single.
Flatter on the pads, worked to deep midwicket for one.
Fuller outside off, hit to cover. Eight runs off Ashwin's first.
Fuller outside off, Rana pushes it through point and gets to the other end.
Looped up on a length, turned well after landing. 74.3 clicks. Shreyas goes back and works it to deep midwicket for one.
Tossed up outside off, Rana charges down and hits it down to long-off for one.
Fuller outside off, hit to cover.
Flatter on middle and leg, Iyer works it through midwicket for one.
Rana punches it through covers for two after allowing the length ball to spin in towards him.
Loopy carrom ball, full on middle and leg, Iyer gets off the outer half to covers as he looks to flick it away.
A touch short, punches away through cover-point for one.
Quicker on the pads, worked through midwicket for one.
Fuller on off, again the carrom ball. Shreyas guides it towards point for a quick one.
Lovely Test-match bowling! Draws Rana forward before turning it well past his outside edge.
Quicker one to end, worked away through square leg for one.
length ball angled across seventh stump, goes to cut and is beaten for pace.

deflection down the leg side, was it glove or thigh? Or nothing? Umpire signals wides! Back of a length angled down the leg side, Rana misses a flick, the ball moves late and Samson gets a partial glove to it diving down leg to take some steam off it.
back of a length on middle, flicked straight to midwicket.
length ball on fifth stump, backs away to create room and slaps this in the gap between extra cover and mid-off before bouncing away to the rope.
yorker on leg stump, Shreyas backs away again trying to access the off side but checks to jam this out back to Sen, who fields and fires back at the stumps to keep Shreyas honest.
yorker at 146 kph is slightly off line down leg side, wide called.
back of a length on the hips, flicked to deep fine leg where Ashwin puts in a sliding effort to deny a boundary.
nearly a wicket! Full on middle, flicked loosely in the air just short of Chahal lunging forward at midwicket in the ring.
Rana breaks out the reverse sweep, picks a ball on middle and leg and whips this high over the keeper, backspins to the rope.
This time an orthodox sweep, and gets the maximum value! Flighted again on middle and leg, slog sweeps this high and deep over square leg.
<b>Rana playing binary sweeps here for boundaries. Instead of dots and ones, it's fours and sixes. Back to the reverse and lefts a full ball on middle over short third man to the rope.
full on middle, defended this time.
Ashwin darts this in flat and full, driven to long-on for one.
full on middle and leg, flicked off the pads to short fine leg for one.
charges down the pitch, misses prodding down the wrong line, carom goes behind point for a leg bye. Massive appeal from Chahal for lbw but way way down the track to even think about going for DRS.
good length ball on middle slowed up plenty through the air at 73 kph, spins sharply into the legs and flicked to short fine leg for one.
another charge, this time Shreyas gets to the pitch and clobbers a full ball on middle high and deep over wide long-on to bring up a half-century partnership off 37 deliveries.
short and wide, toe slaps this to extra cover, fumble on the diving effort allows a single.
darts in a quicker ball outside off, goes to cut and misses.
full on middle and leg, nudged behind square for one.
length ball on off, shuffles across to flick over the leg side but misses.
good length ball on off, opens the face to tap and run behind point.
back of a length on fifth stump, opens the face to guide this through third man to the rope. Third man was up in the ring, clever shot.
fullish length slower ball on off, tapped away into the off side for one.

short ball angled down leg, big nick on a pull shot and it looks like he's gloved this to Samson. The umpire incredulously signals it as a wide. Samson signals for DRS immediately and I think he'll win this. Sure enough, spike shows up on ultra edge passing the glove. Seemed fairly obvious live but Samson has DRS as insurance.
short and wide, goes to cut and a toe edge goes through third man to the rope.
full on off, flicked through square leg for one.
good length ball flighted at 74 kph on fifth stump, punched away through the ring for one.
short on the body, pulled behind square for one.
good length ball on off, tapped behind point for one.
full on middle, pushed gently into the covers for one.
short and wide, goes to cut this and misses.
good length ball darted in flat on middle on a good length at 97 kph, defended into the covers and fielded by Ashwin.
darted in very quick again on fourth stump at 99 kph, goes to nudge this through point and they sprint back for two.
flighted full on fifth stump, swept to short fine leg for one.
good length ball on middle and leg, prodded away into the off side for one.
full and follows him backing away from leg, punched to extra cover and they just beat a direct hit.
darted in quick and short on middle, backs away to pull and is hustled so drags it along the ground for just one.
back of a length on fifth stump at 140 kph, pokes this straight to backward point.
shot of the day! Rinku dinks a paddle flick/scoop to a 141 kph delivery on his legs high and mighty over fine leg onto the tarp-covered field level seats.
full on seventh stump at 144 kph, tapped gently to Buttler at extra cover.
back of a length on the hips, flicked to deep fine leg for one.
length ball across eighth stump, flashes at this and misses.
wide yorker on eighth stump at 144 kph, Rana can't get bat on this trying to jam it out through point.
short and wide at 138 kph, cuts this to deep third man for one.

nearly a catch to Boult at deep third man! Fullish length ball outside off at 138 kph on sixth stump, wild slash by Rana flies low toward Boult but the elevation wasn't there to give him time enough to charge in. He dives and knocks it down one-handed on a short hop.
short and very wide almost off the pitch. Rinku shuffles across but can't reach it still and wide is called.
fullish length on the wide guideline, this time Rinku shuffles almost in line with the ball but misses attempting to flick this over point.
short on the body at 138 kph, hooks this high over sort fine leg and dribbles away to the rope.
full and wide, slices this to the off side for one.
wide yorker on fifth stump, Rana plays over the top trying to jam this out.
slows this up short on fourth stump at 81 kph, Rinku has way too much time to wait on this and carves it up with a back foot punch through extra cover to the rope.

some kind of shot! Charges this early. Chahal sees it and drags it back and slows up the pace too at 71 kph short on off, still Rinku continues through and reaches out to get bat on this, not just to avoid a stumping but drags this over wide long-on to the rope.
full on middle, driven firmly to long-on, sloppy fumble by Riyan Parag turns one into two.

flighted on a good length on middle, missed sweep, big lbw shout denied. Looked pretty solid live. Surprisingly they don't go for DRS. Especially with reviews left in the 18th over. Comes off the pads to fine leg for one. Replays show it was umpire's call shaving leg stump. Chahal shouted loudly but got zero support from Samson. I thought it was a great shout.
good length ball lands outside leg, misses a flick and goes to cover for a leg bye.
short on the body, pulled to deep square leg for one.
full on sixth stump, driven firmly toward Boult at mid-off who runs right and dives on the ring to keep this to one.
full and wide yorker on eighth stump at 144 kph, Rana premeditated a scoop and it comes off the horizontal edge into the ground through midwicket.
wide yorker skids past the guideline at 144 kph, very very tight call as Rinku misses a drive but probably a fair call.

dreadful misfield from the man you'd least expect to see it from, Trent Boult at mid-off. Misfired yorker on fifth stump at 144 kph, driven firmly two steps to Boult's left on the ring at mid-off and he does a matador red cape effort over the top of the ball letting it go straight past without getting a hand to it and sizzles to the rope.

short and very wide, Rinku shuffles way across his stumps to uppercut and misses. Wide harshly called. Samson signals for a review. Is he mocking the umpire or is he genuinely asking for caught behind? There was no sound on the live action. Ball is miles away from the edge but Rinku was clearly playing at it well within reach after shuffling well past the stumps. Review lost.
slower ball wide yorker on the wide guideline, goes for a big heave to this 98 kph delivery and drags it into the leg side for one.
yorker on leg stump at 146 kph, backs away to jam this out to long-on for a sharp two.

full and wide practically off the pitch, Rana was also almost off the pitch trying to ramp this and misses. Nitin Pandit signals a wide as the ball passes beyond the white line return crease. Fumble from Samson and they pinch a second extra to get Rinku on strike.
goes for yorker on fifth stump but misses badly. Shin high full toss whipped away through wide long-on to level the scores.
Rana ends the match, and how! Short ball on off stump, backs away to uppercut this over the third man rope. KKR wins by seven wickets with five balls to spare.
length ball outside off, opens the face of the bat to steer it towards third man
length ball on the stumps, tucked away behind square leg. Both openers are off the mark
length ball around off, comes forward and defends on the off side
length outside off, goes for the cut but misses

length outside off, looks to dab it down but I think this is more of an outside edge, or at least the outer half. The ball bounces towards short third man, who has a shy at the stumps. He misses but think Gaikwad was back
length ball around off, pushed towards mid-off
fuller length angling across. Comes forward and pushes it towards covers
length ball around off, pushed to the right of the covers where Washington Sundar misfields but Williamson has him covered from mid-off
banged in short and Gaikwad takes him on with a pull shot. Swivels and sends it sailing over the fine-leg boundary
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards square leg
length ball around off, tapped towards cover-point from the front foot
back of length outside off, hangs his bat out and gets beaten
length ball on the stumps, defended back
length ball outside off, Conway comes forward and drops it on the off side. Gaikwad was quick to spot the single and sprints to the other end
length ball around off and middle, turns it in front of square leg for another quick single
a slower one but down the leg side. Conway goes for the flick but misses. The ball hits the thigh and rolls towards short third man who fumbles and concedes an extra run
short of length and Conway takes full advantage of it, pulls it away to the deep square leg boundary
length ball angling across, steers it towards third man
length ball outside off, pushed towards cover
length ball on the stumps, defended back towards the bowler
length ball angling towards the pads, goes for the glance but misses. A leg-bye to short fine leg

short and pulled away towards deep square leg. That made some sound off the bat. Washington dives to his left from fine leg and makes a partial stop but the first thing he checks on his thumb. He had split his webbing earlier in the tournament. Then he collects the ball but it spills out again. Finally he had to put in dive to stop it from touching the boundary line
short of length outside off, steered towards third man
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards short midwicket
length ball around off and middle, turns it behind square leg
length ball angling across. Gaikwad was walking towards the ball and looked to work it on the leg side. Gets an outside edge towards short third man
length ball angling in. Conway misses the flick, the ball hits the thigh and bounces towards backward point. They run a quick single
length ball on the stumps, punched towards extra cover
short of length and Gaikwad pulls it over midwicket. The deep square leg fielder cannot reach there in time
fuller length on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on for a quick single
into the stands. Short and down the leg side. Gaikwad takes full advantage of this and pulls it over long leg, a 75-metre six
length ball outside off, dabbed behind point for yet another quick single
length ball around off, moves across a touch and helps it behind square leg
short of length on the pads, tucked away towards fine leg
fuller length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards short midwicket, where the fielder makes a diving stop to his right
short of length outside off, looks to dab it fine and run but the ball is too close to him. It hits the face of the bat and bounces towards the keeper
short of length on the stumps, pulled towards deep square leg
fuller on the stumps, Conway goes down and sweeps it behind square leg for four
slightly pulls his length back, still on the stumps though. A drag-sweep from Conway this time towards deep-backward square leg
down the track but isn't to the pitch of the ball. Ends up mistiming it towards deep square leg
fuller from Markram. Conway brings out reverse sweep this time but fails to beat the point fielder
too full around off, pushed back towards the bowler
Gaikwad gives him charge straightaway. Looks to go over mid-off, he gets his timing wrong but clears Williamson with ease. Williamson runs back and keeps it to two
short around off, goes for the pull but ends up hitting it towards short midwicket
up and over! Short outside off this time. Gaikwad stands tall and slaps it over covers
Gaikwad is taking Malik on. A length ball around off, Gaikwad comes forward and launches it over long-on

A slower one from Malik. At 126kph. Gaikwad dabs it to the left of backward point and takes a step down. Conway commits and is halfway down before Gaikwad sends him back. The throw was a bit wayward which allowed him to get back safely
Malik goes short again, pulled towards midwicket for one
swept behind square leg for one
fuller but down the leg side. Conway goes for the sweep but don't think he intended to hit it this fine. Goes between the keeper and short fine leg for four
length ball outside off. Conway dances down the track and even though he wasn't exactly to the pitch of the ball, he hits through the line and sends it over the bowler's head for six
another sweep, this time only a single to deep-backward square leg
length ball down the leg side, Gaikwad sweeps it towards deep-backward square leg
fuller around off, comes down the track but fails to middle it this time. Ends up dragging it along the ground towards long-on
length ball around off, punched towards mid-off for one
154kph, fuller on the stumps. Gaikwad stands tall and punches it down the ground, between the stumps and non-striker. Long-on puts in the slide, but fumbles and gives away four

a bouncer outside off, goes for the pull, in fact only half a pull as he changes his mind in between. The ball takes the top edge and goes to the third man boundary. That brings up Gaikwad's fifty as well
length ball around off, pushed towards covers
length but angling down the leg side. Conway fails to connect the pull
length ball around off, comes forward and defends it towards the bowler
too full outside off, punches it towards cover
fuller on the stumps, goes for the slog sweep but doesn't get his timing right. A single to Suchith at deep midwicket
fuller on the stumps, sweeps it towards deep-backward square leg
down the track and launches it over long-on, this one goes 90 metres. The back-up fifth bowler proving to be costly for Sunrisers
and again, this time from the crease. Back-to-back sixes for Gaikwad. Fuller on the stumps, stretches out and slog-sweeps it over long-on
short of length, rocks back and pull-sweeps it towards deep square leg
length ball on the stumps, goes for reverse sweep but finds the backward point fielder
fuller outside off, comes forward and drives it aerially to the left of mid-off. Williamson dives full length but it falls just short
fuller outside off, Conway hits it through the line, on the up through extra cover
fuller on the pads from around the wicket, Conway misses the flick and gets hit on the pads. An appeal for lbw from Malik but it was heading down. The batters pick up a leg-bye to square leg
fuller and wider. Gaikwad leaves it alone and collects a wide
A slower one? Fuller length outside off, Gaikwad fetches it from there and hits it aerially to the right of long-on. The fielder cannot reach there in time, bounces inside and goes over
pitched up outside off, Gaikwad comes forward and lofts it over long-off. Holds the pose for the effect
a short one outside off, Gaikwad drops his hands and lets it go through
short of length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
slower one, length outside off. Gaikwad works it towards midwicket
a low full toss on the stumps, flicked between long-on and deep midwicket for two
short outside off, pulled in front of square leg for another couple of runs
short outside off, goes for the cut but finds backward point
down the track but Bhuvneshwar slips in a wide yorker. Conway fails to get the bat on it
length ball around off, pulled towards midwicket
short of length outside off, cuts it past backward point for four
length ball outside off, punched towards long-off
a slower one. Short down the leg side but Gaikwad fails to take advantage of it, ends up dragging the pull towards short fine leg
full outside off, hits it out towards covers
another slower one, short of length outside off. Gaikwad pulls it firmly to the left of deep midwicket. Suchith had to dive to make the stop
a top edge for six. Short of length from Jansen. Conway goes for the pull and gets it top edge over fine leg. Brings up his fifty as well
goes for the yorker but just misses his mark. Conway digs it out towards wide long-on for a couple
a whipped pull this time. Short and down the leg side, this is poor from Jansen. Conway pulls it to the right of fine leg
fuller around off, right in the slot for Conway, especially with the mid-off inside the circle. Conway goes over that fielder and it carries all the way. 150 comes up for Super Kings
fuller on the stumps, Conway looks to go over midwicket but misses. The ball hits the pads and deflects towards backward point
fuller on the stumps, was looking to flick it towards midwicket but gets a leading edge down the ground. Mid-off cuts it off
a length ball on the stumps, comes forward and works it towards wide long-on. Comes back for the second
too full outside off, steered towards backward point
goes for the yorker but ends up bowling a low full toss on the stumps, pushed towards long-on
Gaikwad is almost unstoppable. Moves into the 90s. Short of length, Gaikwad comes forward and slaps it in front of square leg for four
short of length again, this time he places it towards midwicket and sprints back for the second. A direct hit at the striker's end but Gaikwad was well in
full but down the leg side. Too far away to connect the flick
fuller on the stumps, clipped away between deep square leg and deep midwicket for two more
full outside off, digs it out towards long-off
another full delivery, on the stumps. Punched towards long-on
short of length, mistimes the pull. A single to long-on
short of length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
short outside off, drags it towards wide long-on for two
a wide yorker, Conway fails to get any bat on this. Excellent from Bhuvi, only six from that over
slower length ball outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover, moves to 98 as the fielder attempts a direct hit at the striker's end but misses and allows an overthrow
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards deep midwicket
fuller on the stumps, Conway clears his front leg and hits it over the bowler's head. Just clears the boundary
a full toss on the stumps this time. Natarajan hasn't been able to land his yorkers tonight. Flicked towards deep midwicket
falls for 99! It was a slower length ball, angling away from him. Gaikwad looked to cut it for a single but failed to keep it down. An easy catch for Bhuvneshwar at backward point
length ball around off, cuts it over cover but not enough power behind it. Only a single
length outside off, Dhoni looks to slash at it but fails to connect
short of length around off, goes for the pull but isn't in control. It lobs over midwicket and Dhoni comes back for the second
goes for the yorker, Dhoni digs it out towards long-off. That was bowled at 154kph
length ball, drags it towards deep backward square leg
short outside off, Dhoni finds the midwicket fielder with the pull
short of length outside off, stays back and hits it over covers for four
in the blockhole. Digs it out towards long-on
135kph, fuller but down the leg side. Dhoni goes for the flick but ends up hitting straight into the hands of short fine leg
a low full toss on the stumps, Jadeja chips it towards long-off
a low full toss outside off, Conway goes over extra cover, just evading the leaping fielder on his left. The sweeper cover didn't have a chance to cut it off
another low full toss, this time down the leg side. Conway helps it between the keeper and short fine leg. 200 comes up
another low full toss, hits it towards long-on, but only a single
Length ball is pulled from outside off to midwicket.
Good length ball shapes away from outside off and is left alone
Length outside off, steered to deep-backward point
Short ball outside off finds the bottom edge from the pull. It goes behind the batter, to his left to long-leg.
Extended off-drive is chipped inside out, it's two bounces into the fence. It was a full ball just outside off and Abhishek hit through the line.
Whack! Length ball is pulled through wide-mid on. It was on the chest and Abhishek swiveled after hitting it with ease
Length ball outside off, pushed to forward point off the backfoot
Creams the cut to send the length ball well outside off to the right of point. The debutant missed the line and Kane latched on to it
The Kane-tap (K-tap?) comes out to greet the back of a good length ball on the head into the ground, on its way towards short-third for one
Pulls a short ball under the armpit and it's pulled to deep-square leg. Unfortunately, for the bowler, it is a front-foot no-ball!
Banged short, it's banged over deep-backward square in reply. It was around the chest and Kane pulled it in the air, sent it into the stands with a comfy swivel again
Back of a length on the body, pulled into the ground this time, to deep-square leg
Full on off, clipped to short-midwicket
Full on middle, driven to long-off
Full down leg, capitalized with a swatty sweep past the keeper, well to the right of short-fine leg
Length on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
Extra-cover drive goes for a 77-metre six! It was full, outside off. The shot came off the bottom but the connection was good enough to go over the rope

Lolli goes on the ground! It was full just outside off, the batter tried to loft it again but did not get the elevation. Mukesh went to his right and tried to catch it in front of his chest while on the move. But the hands closed too early and he shelled it
Length down leg, clipped to deep-midwicket off the backfoot
Length outside off, swings and misses. 145.5 kmph ball beats the horizontal batted slash
Slightly fuller and slightly wider, Abhishek was still in launch mode but the ball went away to beat the bat
Back of a length outside off, Abhishek tries to glide it probably along the ground but the top-edge goes just to the left of the leaping short-third man fielder on its way to the fence
Length on the body, clipped in front of square for one
Short around the throat, Kane hangs back and pulls it late. The bat came from top to bottom to keep it on the ground. Goes to deep-square leg
More luck for Abhishek! Came down the track and slashed at a full ball outside off, it took the outside edge and went to the right of short-third who could not reach it and to the fence
Good length on the stumps, pushed to long on
Back of a good length on middle and leg, pushed to the left of wide-mid off for a quick single
Low fully on off, clipped to long on
Full on middle and off, Abhishek slashes and edges safely yet again! It goes wide of the keeper past short-third, who chases it down. It brings up the 50 partnership
Very full ball outside off is dug out to cover's right for one
Slow offbreak comes in from outside off to off and is driven off the backfoot to mid-off
Length ball comes in with the angle on the hips and is pushed with the fully open bat face to the left of cover-point
Back of a good length just outside off, the k-tap returns. This time to backward point
A bit of the Conway flick comes from Abhishek, it's off a good length ball on the stumps and goes to the right of deep-midwicket who cuts it off
Mishits a length ball on off after coming down the track and making room, it goes over the in-field at cover and is pulled back while the fielders pinch two

Well, the luck had to end, the timing was off on the pull. It was a cutter that had Abhishek going through with the shot a bit too early, he aimed for deep-midwicket but the ball went to wide-long on who had to move to his left and was able to take an easy catch. Ends an enterprising innings which gave SRH a good start

When it rains, it pours! That's the case for Mukesh as he gets Tripathi with a length ball angling away outside off from a ramp that goes straight to short-third man. The ball was at a regulation 130 kmph and Tripathi's placement was off more than anything
Kane manages to miss tickling a length ball outside off as he tries to glide it off the backfoot with an open-faced bat

Chance missed by Dhoni? Yes! It was a full ball outside off that turned away, it took a gentle edge and went to the right of MS who could not hang on. It went to the base of the glove and popped out as he clasped his hands down
Full outside off, pushed to the left of point for one
Makes room and cuts a length ball on the stumps to long-off
Drives a length ball on off to deep-cover
Length outside off, driven to point off the backfoot again
Flights a full ball on middle, Markram has an EA cricket on-drive in the gap to the circle
Full on middle and off, driven to deep-extra cover, in the gap for two
Edged and the cut goes past slip! Kane tried to cut the back of a good length ball outside off but it spun away and Kane had to reach for it.
Good length outside off, clipped to deep-midwicket
Full on the stumps, flicked to square leg
Full outside off, driven to deep cover
Full outside off, opens the bat-face to defend it in front of point in the gap
Glides a good length ball on middle and manages to get bat on it. Goes to backward point but that is risky business
Full on the stumps, defended to the right of the bowler

Leading edge falls in front of Jadeja! Length ball stuck in the pitch and Kane is through with the push off the backfoot with a slightly closed bat-face. It fell to the right of the diving Jadeja, and in front. So Kane was safe.
Length outside off, cut to deep point
Length on middle, backs away to the legside and drives it off the backfoot. Goes to short-third off the edge
Length ball spins away outside off and is driven to point's right for one
Good length ball on leg has Aidem make room and punch it on the move to cover
Smacks a full ball on middle over the bowler and the sightscreen, it was tossed up and Aiden got his front leg out the way to access it.
This loft down the ground is even better! Comes down the ground and drives the full ball with the full followthrough and sends it for a 90-metre six

Half-tracker is pulled to wide-long on! It was short and slow, Aiden backed away and pulled it with all his might but it hit the sticker as he fell away, the eyes were on the ball as it travelled through. But it did not have the distance, the ball ballooned for Jadeja to take it comfortably
Full outside off, swept off the bottom to wide-long on
Length ball sits up and Pooran goes through with the pull, deposits in front of square for an 81-metre six
Length outside off, cut through square to the deep on the offside
Full on leg, clipped to deep-square leg
Length outside off, underedges the pull onto his pad, it goes to his left
Beaten on the cut, the good length ball was 103 kmph outside off, and Pooran was late on it

Crazy extra bounce has Pooran retract from a horizontal batted shot, it spat up off a back of a good length and ballooned but well in front of short-third man who dove in front but could not get in, in time
Full down leg, beats the flick and hits the pad. Ricochets to the offside
Slouches and pulls a length ball on middle to the right of deep-square leg who chases it well to his left with a dive and assist to his partner who also ran in
Pulls a back of a good length ball to deep-square leg
Tries the pull does Pooran but misses. The carrom ball gets the inside edge in front of leg onto the thigh and then the offside
Tries to turn the length ball to the legside and it went to short-third man
Back of a good length outside off, punches it to sweeper cover
Good length outside off, driven to wide-long off
Cutter on middle and leg, defended with an open faced ball to the gap at cover

How did he do that?! Came down the track and heaved at the slower back of a good length ball outside off became a full one, by reaching out. One hand came off but the connection was sweet as the ball sailed over wide-long on
Length outside off, pushed to cover with the horizontal bat
Yorker outside off, tapped on the head to deep-point
Full on off, clipped to deep-midwicket

Very tight run is completed. It was a full ball outside off, Kane reached out and drove it to the left of cover. Jadeja ran and leapt but the throw to the keeper missed and he was extremely disappointed with himself
Ben Stokes 2019 Ashes reverse has a competitor! Pooran switched but the connection off the reverse was so pure that the full ball on the stumps had to go over deep-point
Length on middle, clipped to the left of wide-long on and they scamper for two
Misses out on the ball on the legs, manages to clip it to the legside
Full on the stumps, clipped to deep-midwicket
Misses out on the slow short ball, it was on middle. The 98 kmph ball did not bounce much, Pooran pulled but not off the middle. Went inside out to deep-square leg
Full on the pads, clipped to deep-square leg

Struck in front, given LBW! Kane reviews but it might be more out of hope. The ball game off a good length and Kane knelt and went with a heave, looked like he missed it. There was no inside edge, it looks to have come in further. Three reds, the impact was on middle and off and was hitting middle! Kane has to leave after anchoring the innings thus far.
Full on off, clipped to the left of deep-midwicket, who has to run a few metres and stop it with a slide as they run two
Slower full ball on middle and leg is flicked behind square gently to send it in the gap
Good length just outside off, the 127 kmph ball is defended to short-midwicket
Full and slow outside off, pushed to deep cover
Length on the stumps, tucked to deep-midwicket off the backfoot
Length outside off, clipped to the left of the bowler who dives and stops the single
Back of a good length outside off, whips it to wide-long on
Shashank slips as he flicks the low full toss to deep-midwicket along the ground and falls, but he gets back up and completes the run
Flicks a length ball on the stumps to deep-midwicket

Length ball outside off sticks in the pitch, the batter tries to play it with a straight bat. It lobs up slightly but falls well in front of the bowler but that is a 4-run over, brings Mahesh's excellent spell to an end.

Goes through with the swing to send the full ball outside off. It went into orbit and landed past the sightscreen, Pooran got it off the bottom of the bat. It came out like a golf swing and went up like a skier but somehow had the distance
Low full toss is flicked to deep-midwicket on the bounce for one.
Excellent fielding at deep-backward square! The full ball on the stumps was flicked behind square in the gap and it was speeding through but the fielder ran to his right and stopped it with a slide
Full on the stumps, clipped to deep-midwicket
Slower one outside off has Pooran slashing, it goes off the bottom to long off on the bounce
Low full toss on the legs is helped on its way to long-leg along the ground
Mishits a length ball outside off but it goes over mid-off, it went wider and in the air. The inside-out shot went to the fence beating the chase
Length outside off, chops it after attempting a heave. The pace was off and it went on to the pitch off the bottom edge
Premeditates and fails! Goes across and the bowler followed with a length ball angling across, the batter overran and tried to paddle-pull but mised

Given caught-behind. Shashank reviews. It was a short ball, seam-up, that went across outside off. Shashank tried to pull it with his front leg diagonally to the left of the back leg, there is a spike when the ball is close to the top-edge of the base of the bat. Decision stands.
Clips a length ball on the pads past the right of short-fine leg but deep-backward square, Conway, runs to his right and stops it with a slide
Mukesh has four! Sundar went across and tried to paddle-scoop it but the ball went straight, may have kissed the bottom edge, and hit top of off. That's how far across he went.
Skier dropped at deep-square leg! Full on the stumps, Pooran launched the flick but went straight up, the fielder had enough time to settle under it but could not hang on
Whacks a low full toss outside off down the ground, to the right of the bowler and it raced along the turf to the fence

Santner drops a twirler at long-off! He had a simple catch to his right, it popped out his hand and went back, he tried to take it with a couple of attempts but could not hang on after Pooran drove the full ball outside off with limited elevation
Way wide outside off, left alone
Full outside off, slashed behind short-third off the outside edge
Another outside edge, this off the full toss outside off and it went between the keeper and short-third on its way to the fence.

LBW denied, reviewed by CSK. Looks out, Pooran went across and tried to flick the full ball, he was slightly squared up. Maybe not, it missed the flick and hit the right of the front pad. Hawk-Eye says it's going down leg so Pooran survives
Back of a good length ball is heaved to deep-midwicket off the toe-end but far enough
Guides a low, wide full toss in the air over backward to the fence, it also brings up his fifty and reduces the effect of the NRR dent
In the arc... missed! Length ball over the stumps is heaved through but thin air is found.
Low fully down leg beats the attempted help down fine leg but it is wide
Going, going, gone! Length ball on the hips is pulled 86-metres over backward-square a few rows back for six
Full outside off, it was on the tramline. Pooran bent fully, the back knee was on the floor and he launched the drive over sweeper cover and it misses the car there by a bit on the right
Full on the stumps, heaved off the bottom to wide-long on

French cut first up! Lucky de Kock gets away with a four! It was a full length ball that had the batter try a drive with a slightly close-faced bat. It took the inside edge and went past the leg stump, it went fine after beating the keeper to the fence
Full on the leg stump, clipped to midwicket
Swings in on a full length just outside off, KL gets across and flicks it to the gap to the right of midwicket for one
Lovely on-drive but for no run. Quinton gets to the line of the good length ball on off and channels it to mid-on.
Pant drops the ball after QDK missed the fick. The ball took the pad on the way. The Fizz, like me, was excited to fall for the type-1 error
Full outside off, slashes and misses
Back of a good length ball outside off is waited for and tapped with a slouch with an open-faced point to deep point
Bowls from close to the stumps, the length ball on middle is pushed gently to mid-on slow enough to allow the single
Good length just outside off, taps it late on the front-foot and opens the bat-face slightly to send it to point. Slow enough for the run to be on again.
Back of a good length outside off, looked like the cutter that came in. It's cut with limited timing to cover, it helps the single
Wide down leg, KL tries to nudge the slower one but misses. But so does the keeper which allows the single

Pulled into the abyss! QDK saw it early, got into position quickly, and had plenty of time to smack the 130 kmph length ball on off over deep-midwicket by staying down and launching it with a free-swing off the backfoot
Creams an aerial cover drive. Chetan overcompensates on length as this one is too full, there was room too which allowed QDK to free his arms and drive through the line of the ball.
Full on off, pushed to long-off
Good length ball spins back in to off and is clipped to wide-mid on for one
Full and slow outside off, it comes in but is wide enough for the umpire to give it. Axar is not impressed
Good length ball down leg has KL making room and pushing to mid-on on the move
Back of a length ball outside off is cut to cover
Makes room and cuts the length ball just down leg but finds cover
Good length outside off, punched to mid-off who is standing wide
Good length ball is cut off the bottom to cover, the lack of timing allows the single which has been a common occurrence so far
Slight leading edge falls in front for the right of the bowler and goes to mid-off. It was on a good length and had KL check his push but got away with it

Comes down the track and reaches out to off-drive aerially, in fact it goes over the fence. One hand came off but the reach was far enough, even though it was not to the pitch of the ball, to give the ball flight and distance
Makes room this time and sweeps the length ball on legstump in the air over short-fine leg for an inside-out four
Hard one-handed chance pops out of Lalit's hand! An off-stump ball was tossed up and KL smacked it to the right of the bowler, he tried to clasp it but missed
Short, slow, and wide. QDK obliges with a cut past cover for four
Short and wide but it does not bounce as high, so KL's attempted heave gets the underedge and goes to mid-on

Skied... and Lalit takes it at point! It was on a good length and was angling away which meant QDK had to reach for it. He did go for it with a flurry but the ball came off the bottom of the bat and went straight up. Lalit settled under it for a while and took it with the sunnies on and hands pointing up

Almost a chop on, but Hooda's lucky. Length and really wide, the ball had the batter reach out and tried the drive with the horizontal bat. It took the underedge and the French cut went past the keeper
Full outside off, driven to wide-mid off
That wasn't wide, that was wild. There's another EA cricket reference. It was way down legside and KL could not have reached the flick had he tried
Good length outside off, tapped gently to the gap at the left of point
Shuffles across and taps a length ball to point with an open-face.
Length outside off, cut to deep-cover
Deftly guides a length ball angling away outside off, the feet stayed and the ball hit the sticker and went along the ground to the right of short-third man. Beat him on its journey to the fence
Length ball outside off is gently flicked to midwicket, who is well inside, almost at a catching position. KL wanted the single but Hooda wisely sent him back
Excellent running as they turn one into two. Hooda flicked a length ball just enough to the left of deep-midwicket and the running beat the throw
Length cutter on off is defended to the bowler
Length ball pitches outside leg and comes on middle, it's flicked to deep-micket
Full on middle and off, Hooda takes the back-leg out the way and drives it to sweeper cover
Full on middle, makes room and pushes it to cover
Inside edges a good length ball outside off onto pad while trying to push it to cover. It goes to the offside but not far, so no single
Clips a back of a good length ball to square leg
Length ball on the stumps is clipped to deep-square leg
Length outside off, driven to deep cover off the backfoot

Tosses one up on middle, KL greets it with a controlled off-drive by staying back and checking the follow-through. Thakur slides with his feet in front to his right while sliding at long-off but cannot stop it
Good length outside off, pushed to forward point for one
Sets up for the slower ball by waiting, makes room and cracks the overpitched ball on middle and off through cover
Full on middle and leg, pushed off the inside half of the full-faced bat to long-on
Length ball comes in to middle and is clipped to deep-midwicket
Back of a good length ball spins away to off and Hooda adjusts for the googly and pushes it to long-off
Full on middle and off, pushed to cover point
The width is used by Hooda to crash a flowing cover-drive to the right of cover, it was a full ball and Hooda went through with the shot and got it along the ground
Comes down the track and flicks a full length ball to long-on
Length outside off, cut to deep point
Good length ball on the legs is clipped to wide-long on
Tossed up on a good length, comes in to middle and off. KL was backing away and managed to get the underedge of the horizontal bat to send it on the offside of the pitch
Stays down and sweeps a full, slow ball on the yorker to deep-square leg
Not the famous Rohan Kanhai falling sweep, says Harsha on air as KL falls over on the sweep to the full ball to deep-square leg.
Opens up the offside with a cover-drive that went over short-cover. It was full on the stumps and Hooda got the elevation
Full ball on the stumps, steps down flicks to deep-midwicket
Hit me ball, says Karthik who'll come in in two balls. KL obliges and smacks the full, tossed up ball on the legs after making room. It goes over long-on for a 91-metre six
Length on the legs, worked to deep-square leg
back of a length close to off stump, punched towards sweeper cover
quick length ball darted in towards leg stump, goes with the angle, punched back to the bowler off the back foot
sees Hooda look to make room, fires a quick length ball outside his reach, ends up too wide outside off
lovely use of the feet. Quickly out of his crease to get close to the pitch of this leg-stumpish ball and whip it crisply over wide long-on
flat length ball on middle and leg, clipped off the front foot to deep midwicket
back of a length, straightens slightly towards off stump, goes back and clips to deep midwicket
fired flat at the pads, he knows Hooda wants to make room to target extra-cover. Clipped to deep square leg
starts with a half-volley on middle stump. Line is okay, length is too full, and Hooda gets his front foot out of the way and hits inside-out over his favourite extra-cover region
Fullish, angling into middle stump, clipped to long-on
wow, terrific hit. Length ball, angling down leg, and Rahul uses his wrists beautifully to whip it up and over the boundary to the right of fine leg
in the blockhole on off stump, looks to drive to long-off but ends up playing it back towards the bowler
low full-toss on middle stump, driven to long-off
back of a length outside off, looks like the cutter. Hooda is through his cut too early and is beaten
wide length ball, flat-batted firmly towards sweeper cover
short outside off, seems to stick in the pitch a little. Cross-seam, maybe. Jumps to get on top of the bounce and slaps it to sweeper cover. Good defensive bowling
and again looks for that wide short ball to try and give away the single to the sweeper, but ends up a touch too wide
shortish, closer to off stump now, opens his bat face and dabs to short third

stump-high full-toss close to off stump, punched to extra-cover, who's on the edge of the circle, and they hurry through for a quick single that Hooda completes with a dive to beat the throw to Thakur
attempted wide yorker, ends up marginally on the wrong side of the tramline. Left alone
shot. Length ball, offcutter, but offers just a hint of width, and quick hands and wrists send the cut screaming away to the right of the diving backward point fielder
another attempted wide yorker ends up outside the tramline. Well wide of it on this occasion

back of a length wide of off, and Rahul chops it away to deep point to bring up yet another fifty. Can he convert this one into his third hundred of the season? He's certainly gaining ominous momentum...
full on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
full, angling away from off stump, driven towards extra-cover who's on the edge of the circle. Didn't time it, which made the single more straightforward
slower length ball slanting into a wide-ish line outside off. Rahul looks for the front-foot square slash, but can't connect
in the blockhole on middle and off, opens his bat face to squeeze it out to deep point

another blockhole ball, just outsaide off, and Hooda stabs it to extra-cover and sneaks another quick single to bring up his fifty. Excellent innings so far, he's given LSG plenty of momentum since walking in. Gets to the landmark in 32 balls
middle-stump yorker, gets his front leg out of the way and jabs to the right of extra-cover
offcutter on a length fairly wide of off stump. Shuffles across and gets on his back knee for a slog-sweep along the ground to deep midwicket
length ball angling into middle and leg, clears his front leg and swipes to the right of deep midwicket

gone, big breakthrough. In the blockhole on off stump, and Hooda, looking to get his front foot out of the way and punch down the ground, ends up hitting it back to the bowler at stomach height. Good reflex catch too, even though it came straight to him
back of a length outside off, and that's a friendly sort of ball to the new batter. Sat up nicely for him to punch crisply to the left of the diving extra-cover fielder
back of a length, closer to off stump now, nips in slightly too, jumps on the back foot and defends it back to the bowler
full, angling down leg. Misses the flick, and the ball hits his pad and runs away past the keeper diving to his left
flat and full on the pads, shows the full face to push to long-on
nice length, stock ball straightening towards middle and leg, presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
wrong'un, turning from outside leg towards leg, goes back and looks for a single into the vacant midwicket region but the bowler reacts quickly and cuts it off
another wrong'un, on a length, finishing around off stump, goes back and slaps firmly but straight to extra-cover
flat stock ball, turning in to cramp Stoinis as he looks to open up at the hips to create hitting room. Hits a checked flat-bat swipe to deep midwicket
quickish length ball on middle and leg, gets down hurriedly for an awkward-looking sweep to the left of short fine leg
in the blockhole on off stump, opens his bat face to squeeze it towards deep point
slower ball, full and angling away from the reach of Stoinis. Ends up too wide and the batter simply leaves it alone
full, close to off stump, driven firmly but straight to extra-cover, who's on the edge of the circle

and the new glove brings him a sweetly struck six. Looks to slant it into that wide line again, but misses it, and Rahul, who's already taking guard on or slightly outside off, frees his arms to loft it over cover
in the blockhole on off stump, creates a bit of room and stabs towards backward point
back of a length slower ball slanting away from off stump. Looks to cut and is beaten by lack of pace
in the blockhole on off stump, clipped towards deep midwicket

chipped straight to deep midwicket, and straight out. Slower ball on the stumps, and Stoinis flicks it in the air, and it's at perfectly catchable height after Lalit rushes in off the boundary, but the ball pops straight out of his hands
another cutter, turning away from Rahul after pitching on a length, and he looks to hit over extra cover. Ends up slicing it on the bounce to deep point
back of a length cutter, finishing within the stumps, swiped to deep midwicket
that's a Rahul special. Looks for the on-pace yorker on the stumps, and those are incredibly quick hands to reverse-scoop the resultant low full-toss to the left of short third
slower ball on leg stump, quite full, makes a bit of room and steers to deep point
wide yorker, and Stoinis, looking to squeeze it away through point, only manages a bottom edge that rolls back towards the keeper
slower ball, fairly full, angling into off stump from wide of the crease, swiped along the ground to deep midwicket
looks for the leg-stump yorker, ends up sliding it down the leg side, and Stoinis, who's taking guard on off stump, can't connect with the big swipe

low full-toss outside off, slapped straight to extra-cover. The run-out chance was on at the bowler's end, but the throw is slightly wide of the stumps, and Thakur's attempt to catch and flick it onto the stumps is unsuccessful

amazing, amazing hands. Not sure he wanted to hit it that fine, but let's talk about how he opened his bat face there, to somehow get under a near-yorker outside off stump and slice it over short third. Carries all the way too

gone, Thakur gets a huge, huge wicket and the timing of it is perfect. So is the timing of Lalit Yadav's jump at the point boundary. Wide length ball, maybe a cutter. Rahul looked to slash it away over the fielder on the rope, but he can't quite clear Lalit, who jumps up, catches it, and turns around as he falls to the ground, holding onto the ball and making sure he doesn't touch the boundary cushions
looks for the slower yorker at his feet, ends up slightly down the leg side, past the attempted flick
back of a length cutter on leg stump, worked away towards deep midwicket, who has to run in quite a long way so they can easily complete two
back of a length, angling across to off stump, flat-batted past the bowler towards long-on
full and just inside the wide tramline. Slapped to deep point, who fumbles and allows Krunal to get back on strike
Length outside off, slashes and misses
Wide and short, it swings away and Shaw, after considering the upper-sliding paddle, pulls out. It's not given wide
Hangs back and clips a length ball to the fielder in front of square in the ring
Stays back and clips the ball on the armpit to short-midwicket again
Hangs back and taps the similar ball more gently to the left of midwicket to get one.
Length ball angling in beats the flick, hits the thigh pad and goes to short-leg
Cracked down the ground! Waits for the full ball just outside off and lofts it straight over the bowler's head. Off the middle and that raced to the fence.

Top-edges the pull and it's taken at midwicket! Cross-seamer on a length outside off has Shaw reaching for it. As Karthik observes, he tried to slice it from under than pull it with a fully horizontal bat.
Back of a good length ball on off is blocked in front
Meat and drink for Marsh, the length ball sat up for the cut. It goes to the right of the diving point fielder to his right and races to the fence
Length on the stumps, it was angling back in. Marsh blocks it in front
Back of a good length ball on middle and off is blocked in front

Warner reaches out and pulls the length ball from outside off, gets decent connection but not all of it. He went back and the waited for the ball to come back in, pulled it in front. It bounced over the circle and was stopped in the deep
Pulls a shortish ball from outside off to midwicket
Back of a good length ball is defended to forward point.
Length outside off, the cutter is steered to deep backward point
Full on off, Warner stays put and defends it to cover

Soft, mushy dismissal ends Warner's stay at the crease. Or has it? The catch has been referred upstairs. The third umpire, after multiple replays, says 'fingers are underneath the ball", so it's given out. But that sounds like a TV umpire cliche and Karthik Krishnaswamy was not happy with the call. But the length ball outside off was pulled in front, it came off the bottom and went to the fielder, Badoni, who lunged forward and clasped at the ball. There is no soft-signal, remember, and Paschim Pathak felt it was taken with fingers under the ball. It looked 50-50 because the fingers did not look so long that they were underneath the ball but convention currently often dictates fingers under the ball almost ensures the call of out
Full on middle and leg, flicked to deep-midwicket
Length outside off, beaten on the cut.
Full on the stumps, pulls it hard along the ground through square-leg
