Lucky four for Pant. He danced down and Pandya, probably saw him, so kept it full and wide. Pant heaved hard while reaching out and got the outside edge, it went through the empty slip area
Comes down and connects with the swing this time.

Misfield at mid-off by Holder allows four. It was a low full-toss and Pant whacked it off the bottom of the bat to Holder, who could get down with his big frame in time. It hit his wrist or the top of the palm and ricocheted behind to his left
Stands still and hits through the line does Marsh. This is what Stoinis was unable to do. It was full on the stumps and he lofted it with the straight bat and it went inside-out for four
Full on the stumps, defended in front
Flicks a half-volley, close to one at least, over deep-square leg. The timing was sweet, so it went over the fence. The wrists rolled and the bat-face closed in time. He got it off the middle
Full on off, pushed to deep-mid on
And it's a full ball outside off. So Pant opens the bat-face and drives it to the gap at the left of point for four
Length outside off, driven to cover off the backfoot
Slower one outside off is on a good length, the leg-cutter is creamed through point with a horizontal point. It was in the gap and went to the fence.

Marsh pulls it to the top-tier on the biggest boundary of the ground! Short ball, pace on. That's what he was waiting for and got. It was on the body and he pulled it ferociously. It took a direct flight and there was no doubt about that anywhere.
Low fully at 139 on off is pushed to long-off, good recovery from Chameera
Full outside off, driven well to the left of deep point for four. Pant used the room, stood still, and let his hands go through with the leaning drive which was timed to perfection
Length ball on off, defended to the left of backward point with the opening bat-face off the backfoot
Full on middle and leg, driven gracefully to long-on for one
Slow outside off, driven to deep cover with a horizontal bat
Darts one quicker after seeing Pant shaping up to come forward. The good length ball outside off is left alone
Good length outside off, cut hard to point. He gets his body in-line but could not stop it from going behind him. One taken

Gowtham misfields at deep point to allow another four. Might be the second of the innings after Badoni's earlier. It was a length ball outside off that was cut hard. Think he went to his left but could not stop it.
Length outside off, looked slow but it was at 104 kmph. Pushed to cover from a good length. Stopped well by the skipper
Beaten on the cut off a length ball outside off. Ranjith, the scorer, says it's a legbreak

Edged, taken, umpire waited and gave it out eventually! Arm ball landed on a good length outside off and went straight. Marsh tried to make room and drive it hard through cover but got the outside edge. Quinton completed the sharp catch, Gowtham looked sheepishly at the keeper when it was given not-out but was given out later to his delight, and that of his teammates. Marsh leaves in frustration. Ultra-Edge shows no sound when the ball is next to the bat! The comms on air feel he should have reviewed it, but there was a woody sound and Marsh walked back immediately on being adjudged out.
Length on the legs, clipped to deep-midwicket
Drifting into the stumps, defended back to the stumps
Comes down and thrashes a full ball to long-on along the ground
Length on the legs, clipped to deep-midwicket
Full on the stumps, clipped the gap at midwicket and they scamper two
Good length outside off, pushed to long-off

Slashes a length ball outside off. Krunal at deep-backward point had to run a few metres to his right but it was travelling. It was stopped but went back as he was recovering, then he tried to pull it back with his shoes. His feet and spikes were almost parallel to hitting the skirting. The marginal call is given in favour of the fielder.
Slashes a cover drive and places it well to the left of cover. He found elevation with the lean towards the good length ball outside off and creamed it inside out
Pant's in the mood, slogs the full ball outside off along the ground to long-on.

Googly turns in sharply and clatters middle and off! It pitched well outside off on a back of a good length and came in, Lalit tried to drive it but was playing closer to the original line which meant there was a gap between bat and pad. That's where the ball snuck to have Bishnoi upper-cut the air in celebration
Full on the stumps, pushed to long-on
Gowtham overruns to allow an extra as Bishnoi stops it behind him at long-leg. Middle and leg on a length, flicked behind square to the deep. Gowtham tried to stop it to his right but could not
Good length on the stumps, clipped to deep-midwicket
Slashes at a length ball outside off just to the left of the diving backward point fielder. It was close but he could not reach and it went through
Yorker just within the tramline sees Pant leaving it
Comes down the track and tries to whack-pull to the slower bouncer that deviated away from the bat
Bouncer outside off, let go but it's not wide.
ooh, nearly. Misses a slog-sweep off a wrong'un pitched outside off, doesn't finish too far from off stump
quick length ball outside off, another wrong'un, defended into the point region
a bit more air outside off, gets forward to push into the covers
full on off stump, clipped to long-on, I would assume with the turn
wrong'un finishing outside off, leans back and cuts, but can't beat backward point

dropped! Straightforward chance for Rahul at extra-cover. Pant gets down on his back knee to try and slap a wrong'un over the fielder, and ends up hitting it straight to him at just above head height. Very much catchable, and a potentially costly miss from the LSG captain
shortish, flat, angling into the body to cramp Powell on the pull. Drags it to short fine leg
back of a length close to off stump, chopped to backward point
shortish, close to off stump, makes a hint of room and slaps to deep point

shot. Tries another back-of-a-length ball fired into the stumps to try and cramp Powell, but he opens up his hips early and creates plenty of hitting room for a flat-bat pull over long-on. Superb footwork. The line was slightly off too, finishing around off stump rather than leg stump and giving Powell a few extra inches of room
change of angle, no change in result. Flat length ball on the stumps, and he gets his front leg out of the way again, drops down onto his back knee, and slog-sweeps cleanly over wide long-on

brilliant. Gowtham goes very full, almost attacking the blockhole on a stump-to-stump line, and Powell gets his front leg out of the way and drills a drive back past the stumps at the other end, hitting all along the ground with immense power to leave long-off with no chance
steps out first ball and looks to heave one from outside off stump and hit over the leg side. Swings through his shot too quickly without maintaining his base, and he fails to connect
slower ball wide of off stump, ends up on the wrong side of the wide line
length ball outside off, gets on the front foot, opens his bat face and steers to backward point
short, close to off stump, swivels to pull to the right of deep backward square leg. Was in the air for a while but bounced well short of the fielder
short, angling across to off stump, and Powell continues finding the boundaries with ease. Sees the length quickly and pulls well in front of square, to the right of midwicket

sliced in the air, but it doesn't carry to deep point running to his right. Fullish, and I think it's the cutter that's both angling and turning away from Powell. Looks to hit over the covers, ends up slicing it squarer than intended

bowled him, Mohsin's snuck one through! Full, on the stumps, and Pant looks to flick across the line and ends up missing. Not sure the ball did all that much. Pant simply played all around it, with his feet stuck in cement
quick length ball close to off stump, looks to open his bat face and dab a single but ends up hitting it too close to backward point
full and quick outside off, pretty much yorker length, and Powell goes hard at the cover drive and misses
back of a length slower ball close to off stump, legcutter, dabbed quietly to deep third for one
full, angling into the stumps, driven to long-on
nicely bowled. Knew Powell would look to make room and followed him with a hard length ball angled in towards leg stump. Can only clip it for a single to deep midwicket
fullish on off stump, clipped to long-on
floated up on off stump, and it's the wrong'un spinning away. Doesn't pick it, looks for the front-foot flick, and he gets a leading edge that runs away between the legs of the backward point fielder
wrong'un outside off, pushed into the covers
full on off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
flat wrong'un slanted into a wide line. Slapped to deep point
looks for the wide-line wrong'un again, but fails to slant it far enough from Axar's reach. Gets a good stride forward and launches it high and clears long-on with ease
quick wrong'un finishing close to off stump, gets forward and pushes towards deep midwicket
wide near-yorker, driven with a flat bat to deep extra-cover

and Holder bowls a poor ball. Full and wide, and he gets down on his back knee and slices it up and over the gap between backward point and short third. The field was set for precisely the opposite of that ball
short cutter-bouncer just outside off, pulled in the air but on the bounce to deep midwicket
slants a slower offcutter across Axar, back of a length, and the ball turns a long way to leave him with no chance of connecting with it
another slower offcutter, shortish, finishes closer to off stump this time, and Axar pulls to deep midwicket, all along the floor
yorker on middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket

looks for the wide yorker, slanting away from Axar, and he reaches out and flat-bats it down the ground. Does well to get that much power on it, forces long-off into a sprint and dive to his left to stop it, and he deflects it towards long-on who completes the fielding effort

and he gets the big wicket! Short cutter, angling across to finish just outside off. Powell looks to drag a pull from there and target the shorter leg-side boundary, but all he manages is to pick out deep midwicket
length ball angling across to off stump, clipped towards deep midwicket. Shardul wants a second, Axar sends him back
length ball outside off, presses forward and chops to deep point

Second wicket of the over, caught on that shorter leg-side boundary once again. Slants a cutter away from off stump, and Thakur shuffles across to try and drag a slog-sweep into the leg side. All he manages is to hit it straight to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, chopped to backward point
slower ball outside off, looks to slog-sweep, and drags it behind square off the inside half of the bat
full, angling across Axar, who plays a front-foot swipe down towards long-on, and Kuldeep turns quickly to run towards the danger end and enables Axar to take the second and regain strike

difficult chance, and Holder can't quite make it. Back of a length offcutter, finishing outside off. Looks to pull, top-edges it high over the wide mid-off region. No one there, and Holder turns in his follow-through to try and complete the catch himself, but he can't quite make it even with a big dive
slower ball wide of off stump, back of a length, slapped to deep point

appeal for lbw as Axar misses a thigh-high full-toss while looking to pull. He's down in pain, and LSG have reviewed... It's hit the top of his left thigh pad, and the ball was on its way down. It's hit him in line with off stump or thereabouts, but the angle from right-arm over is taking the ball past off stump, so LSG lose their review

slower length ball angled into a wide-ish line. Gets forward and flat-bats to the left of long-off. They look for a desperate second, because Hooda got to the ball very quickly, and get it because Holder fumbles the throw, which, to be fair to him, was wide of the stumps
looks for the yorker, ends up on Axar's pads, and he clips it away to find the backward square leg boundary
back of a length, on the stumps, denying the room that Kuldeep is trying to create. Flat-batted to long-off
misses the yorker on line, ends up angling down leg, and Axar clips it smartly, forcing Bishnoi into a sprint and tumble to his left at deep square leg
stump-high length ball on off stump, drags a whip-pull to the left of deep square leg. Bishnoi's been a busy man today
shot. Slower ball, legcutter, just back of a length on middle stump, and he clears his front leg and swats it away into the gap between deep midwicket and deep backward square leg
looks to make room and Chameera follows him with a full ball at his feet. Whipped to deep midwicket
bad ball to end the over. Ends up offering a half-volley at the pads, and Axar flicks it effortlessly and clears the short boundary at backward square leg
short, angling away from off stump to try and force Kuldeep to hit towards the longer boundary, but he steps across and pulls, and gets enough bat on it to clear the square leg boundary. What a hit!
looks for the wide yorker, slanting across from over the wicket, and he goes past the tramline. Juuust missed is line there
in the blockhole outside off, stabbed away to deep point
not quite an off-stump yorker, but full enough to deny Axar elevation. Drilled straight back to the bowler on the bounce
slower ball, full and wide of off stump, drags an attempted slog-sweep to long-on, all along the ground, and he refuses the single
handsomely driven, all along the ground, to long-off, who's stationed very straight. And that's the match, pretty much. Full again on off stump, too full to get under

full-toss, about stump-high, angling away from off stump, and Axar swats it for an effortless six over long-on. Shows how good these players are when the bowlers err even slightly, but Stoinis kept things together for most of that over
swing first up but too straight, and picked away for a single
more swing, but too full and wide, and driven to deep point for one
short ball, in the ribs, pulled down to fine leg for one
full, nearly a yorker, pushed to mid-off
swing again, and finally he gets it short of driving length while remaining full. Beats him as he pushes away from the body
this one angles in towards top of off. Defended from the crease
half-volley outside off, but it beats his inside edge on the drive
on a length, swinging in, defended with an open face
long half-volley, crisp drive, but straight to cover for a crowd catch

oh Daniel Sams has been lobbed at the deep square leg boundary. That's embarrassing always when you run in too far and then the ball clears you and lands inside or on the rope. This one has landed just short of the rope according to the TV umpire. Sharp bouncer from Bumrah, on the off stump, higher than the shoulder, and Buttler's top edge goes at catching height to deep square leg. Except that Sams comes in too far
lovely bowling. Short of a length, just outside off, making him play the angle, then leaving him after pitching. Beaten on the outside edge
and now the inswinger, Buttler right behind it in defence
sharp bouncer, above the shoulder, called one for the over. Padikkal bails out of a shot
high quality shot. On the up, off the back foot, punched between short cover and mid-off. This is short of a length and outside off. Not much wrong with the ball

makes room and shimmies down a little, he has the slower ball on his mind too, and once he picks it, he changes his shot from the chip over extra cover to a powerful thwack down the ground. Straight of mid-on it goes

and now it slips through the hands. Short, wide, asking to be hit, Padikkal gets a bit of a top edge on the hard cut, David comes around at square third man, gets under it, the ball arrives shoulder high, but it slips through the hands for four
good timing on this punchy drive but it goes straight to mid-off
looks for the upper-cut but this offcutter keeps following him and he is beaten even as he arches back
lovely timing. Just a push to a length ball outside off, all he does is open the face to use the pace. It goes between point and cover-point for three
short of a length, top of off, defended back to him
short of a length, into the ribs, Padikkal stabs at it with one hand off, and the ball goes down for a single. Hang on, he has overstepped
Buttler makes room, Bumrah follow him with a low full toss, and Buttler gets no elevation. Caught at mid-on, which doesn't count, but Bumrah has got out of the free hit with a dot
slower offcutter, full, middle and leg, worked wide of mid-on for one
slower ball again, full, on off, driven with an open face, beats the diving backward point, but the diving cover-point keeps them down to one
big lbw shout as Bumrah nails the yorker, but this is sliding down leg. They don't review the not-out call
too full, can't get under it, driven straight to cover-point

finally catch taken. Into the big buckets of Pollard. It is a good delivery, Drifts in, which means Padikkal is cramped after giving him the charge. And then the ball turns, ending up being sliced to long-off
nice dip on this. Draws a respectful defensive from Samson
again some dip and drift, Samson cuts short his big back lift and just pushes this between cover and extra cover. Lovely timing still

another good ball. Impressive over. He is getting good dip and turn. Buttler sees a full one in the air, looks to go downtown, but it ends short of his reach, takes the thick inside edge and goes between square leg and short fine leg for four all along the ground
low full toss as he bowls a flat delivery to protect the over. Buttler drives it between mid-off and extra cover for four more. A good over has gone for 11
short of a length, around off, Samson runs it down to third man for one
wide down the leg side
on a length, around off, punched crisply to mid-off
on a length, stops at him, draws a mis-hit towards mid-on
slower ball, sits in the surface, extra bounce too. Buttler defends to leg
early into the hook, hit on the back of the helmet, the stem guard falls, but next to the wicket and not on it. The physio and the medical team run onto the field
and a short one to follow it up, but this one doesn't quite get up. Only about waist high, and pulled down towards deep square leg for one
reverse sweep first ball but can't beat backward point
another reverse sweep attempted, but this one dips on him and raps him on the pad. He has got outside the line, though
sharp turn... Ashwin will love this if there is no dew. Hits him on the pad but headed down leg
that's one way to play spin. Sensational hit. He is saying he will not let him keep bowling sharp offbreaks. Jumps out of the crease, gets to the pitch of it, and hits a massive six over long-off
makes room, expecting a shorter flatter delivery, but Shokeen holds his nerve and bowls a length ball. Samson finds point
another biggie. Samson taking apart the youngster on a helpful surface. Shokeen goes flat with the final ball but still bowls full, and in Samson's wheelhouse. He goes ways over long-on this time
looks like wristspin, driven down to long-off for one
a wicket second ball for Kartikeya. Oh it is a typical wristspinner's wicket. A rank long hop, but Samson has ended up upper-cutting it straight to deep point
wristspin again, and paddled away fine of fine leg for two
quicker, flatter delivery, no turn, hits the pad, but because there is no turn, the lbw shout is muted
another dragdown, but hit straight to short midwicket
wrong'un, Mitchell defends it back to Karitkeya. This one is on a perfect length, around middle and leg
short, wide, Buttler late-cuts it creating the pace with a snap of the wrists. Places it between short third and point
slower ball, short of a length, outside off, worked into the leg side for one
wide on the crease, full, outside off, punched down to long-on for one
full, on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket for one
wide on the crease, slower legcutter, short too, punched straight to extra cover
short of a length, straight, pulled down to long-on for one
superb reverse-sweep, against the turn, but this ball is just too full for the turn to be effective. Places it to the right of short third man
quicker ball, goes with the angle, late-cuts it for one
short but not short enough to pul it for the big six. Buttler chooses to keep it down for a single to deep midwicket
wrong'un, starts outside leg, punched away to deep midwicket for one more
full, outside leg, clipped away for a single to deep square leg
goes back to work this length ball for a single with the turn into the leg side
on a length, wicket to wicket, worked into the leg side for one
digs this one in short, slower ball, pulled away for a couple in a gap on the leg side
this one is the quicker short ball, and gets Buttler just above the thigh pad
sees him shuffle across looking to go over short fine and slips in the slower bouncer. Buttler ends up looking to go over short third but is beaten
looks for the ramp again and this time Meredith has slid down leg for a wide
he is trying everything here, moving around and looking to cut this, but gets an bottom edge that lands in front of the keeper
slower ball, short of a length, Buttler opens the face for a single
full, middle and off, played with an open face but straight to point
flatter, on a length, cut away for one
wrong'un, Mitchell punches it to deep midwicket for one
tossed up high, a long half-volley, and it has been driven straight to extra cover
quicker, flatter, topsinner, defended back to him
wrong'un, short, but the turn away results in a bit of a mis-hit for a single to long-on
slower ball, yorker on leg, dug out to leg for one
slower ball, on a length, around off, pushed to extra cover
on-pace, wide down the leg side
slower bouncer, pulled down to long leg for one
full, on-pace, pushed with an open face for a single to deep cover
slower ball, full, outside off, driven to long-off
slower ball, beats him, hits the pad, but it is pitched outside leg
down the wicket, not to its pitch, pushes it for a single to long-off
Mitchell is down the wicket, is beaten in the flight, and his pad saves him from a stumping
short of a length, wrong'un, punched down to long-on for one
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
on a length, punched down to long-on for one
gets the short ball that he can hit, but the ball never arrives, and he ends up cue-ending it to short third

twenty-nine balls without a boundary already, and this pressure is building. Sams bowls an offcutter, short of a length, which sits in the surface and bounces extra. Mitchell has no option but to go after everything now, and gets a massive top edge to extra cover
on-pace, short of a length, good bounce, punched down to point
five wides as he digs this one in and the ball keeps climbing
slower offcutter, full, middle and leg, worked into the leg side
full toss down the leg side, helped away fine of fine leg for four. First boundary off the bat in close to six overs
slower offcutter, punched to point for one
slower ball, low full toss, hit square on the off side, but can't get it past the diving backward point
Buttler finally gets past a run a ball. Before Hetmyer, though, Buttler is on strike. He jumps out of the crease and lofts a length-ball offbreak over wide long-on
oh he gets too full this time, and effortlessly Buttler lofts him back over his head for a flat six. That brings up another fifty. Off 48 balls this time but this is not an easy pitch

oh too full and too straight again, and Buttler opens up to go over deep midwicket. A small six but big enough to clear the fielder. It is too close to him, which means he doesn't quite the elevation he wants but he gets enough
yes they are on still. Shokeen looks to slow the pace down and bowl wide outside off, but ends up bowling a gentle full toss. Buttler smashes it over long-off for another six. That's four in four

oh he gets away with one here. That is a wide outside off, especially with the angler, but the umpire doesn't call it. The idea is to hide it outside off, away from Buttler's swing, but this is outside the blue line. Not for the umpire, though, and that's what counts

and the wide angle has worked. Redemption for Shokeen. He has shown the smarts here. Again hides this well outside off, but this is not going to be a wide. Bhuttler goes after it and manages just the cue end. He is caught at long-off, just before the death overs begin
fast offcutter, beats him outside off after pitching it short of a length and getting it to straighten
sharp bouncer, 137ks, keeps rising and Hetmyer does well to keep his head out of its line. Kishan takes it one-handed overhead
short of a length, into the body, pushed to leg for a third straight dot. At least he has got bat on ball this time
slower offcutter, short of a length, runs it down to third man for one
low full toss, on-pace, driven square of deep cover for two
on a length, just outside off, runs it down to third man for one

short-arm jab to a short ball, and it goes straight to deep midwicket. Again looks like it has stopped a touch on him, and he has had to delay the shot. Just that mild pause in the downswing that has cost him the power
this is not a bad ball but is an opportunity to score a boundary still. Bouncer, at his body, he gets out of its line and ramps it over the keeper's head
short of a length, not much room, he runs it down to third man for one
slower short ball, Hetmyer gets no room to work with, opens the face and settles for a single

wow what a hit. Ashwin is giving himself a superb base to tee off. Front leg out of the way, strong base on the back leg, and he gets an on-pace length ball. Ashwin gets enough on this slog to clear deep midwicket
again sets himself up for the slog and the ramp failing it. This is a slower bouncer, and he tries the ramp. Beaten on it, but largely because it is too high and thus a wide
well done by Meredith. Ashwin's base doesn't allow him to play at wide balls, though, and he slips in a full and wide on-pace delivery. Beats him
full and wide, driven to deep cover for one
oh ho ho. Inside-out drive off Bumrah. Ashwin is playing a blinder here. Bumrah tries the wide slower offcutter, but Ashwin catches up with it and chips it over extra cover
yorker outside off, dug out for a single into the covers
quick low full toss, it just doesn't dip, pushed to long-on for one
whoa whoa whoa. He has hit a quick Bumrah yorker for four. Goes right on the stumps, then makes room and opens the face on it to thread the gap between point and short third man
another yorker, another open face, and the third man is back to keep them down to one

no he bowls the slower bouncer to follow Ashwin as he moves away from the wicket. Looks to pull this fine, but ends up gloving it to the keeper. He walks off, but I am not sure his glove is on the handle when the ball hits him
makes room and manages to get this past midwicket to hand over the strike to Hetmyer
slower ball, wide, away from his reach, he cue-ends it to long-off and turns down the single

superb yorker, between the wicket and his toe. Actually between his legs, and not a yorker but inches short of it. And Mumbai have wasted everybody's time by reviewing an lbw call. Last over doesn't count in over-rate calculations. This has pitched a mile outside leg
slower bouncer, beats the big Hetmyer swing, but it has been called a wide on height
short on the body, swivel to pull with one leg in the air tucking it to Hetmyer at deep backward square for one.
slashed over third man for six! Short and wide on eighth stump, plenty of width to attack and uses the pace to lift this over the rope behind square on the off side.
back of a length on the hips at 135 kph, misses a flick off the pads, ambitious lbw shout denied.
back of a length tailing down the leg side, Kishan is late on a pull, wide called.
back of a length on fifth stump at 133 kph, tapped to short third man for no run.

short on the wide guideline at 135 kph, goes to slap this down the ground but comes off the toe and flutters well short of mid-off. If he left it alone, more than likely would have been given as a wide.
back of a length on the hips at 134 kph, this time does connect with a flick to help it on its way to the fine leg rope.
short on fifth stump at 136 kph, Rohit goes back to defend and is beaten.
back of a length on the hips, flicked to deep fine leg for one.
full and wide, slices this off the toe and skittles along the ground to slip.
half-volley in the slot on fifth stump at 142 kph, pumps a drive back down the ground over mid-off, skids just short of the foam triangle for four.
in the slot again on fifth stump at 138 kph, goes for a big heave trying to clear mid-on, miscues it slightly but still has enough muscle on it to clear the man leaping on the ring.

dropped by Chahal leaping at extra cover! Full and wide, the back leg dips to get under this and Kishan fires a laser flat toward Chahal on the ring. Chahal jumps when he didn't need to and instead of it coming at head height, it comes to him at chest height with his feet off the ground. It bursts through. It was an 8/10 chance he turned into a 10/10 because of his awkward and unnecessary jump.
full on middle, driven to long-off for one.
good length ball on fifth stump, goes to guide this to third man with an open face and misses.

full on middle, goes to sweep and top edges this to square leg. Extra bounce from Ashwin, it was there to sweep on the length on fourth stump, but extra revs from Ashwin cause this to pop up to Mitchell adjacent to the leg side umpire for a simple catch at chest height.
fullish length on off stump, sharp dip and turn and flicked through square leg for one.
full on middle and leg, punched back to Ashwin.
full on off, driven straight to Hetmyer at extra cover.
good length ball on middle, punched straight to mid-on.
back of a length on middle, defended.
full on off, sort of a helicopter flick and clears mid-on bouncing away.
back of a length on off stump, guided with soft hands to deep third man for one.
a one-handed tennis backhand swat back over the bowler's head! Full on seventh stump, Kishan plays a shot that would make Federer proud.
fullish length on fifth stump, flat-footed poke at this and is beaten.
carrom ball lands full on middle stump, goes to flick through midwicket, leading edge floats short of cover.
full on off, driven intentionally to extra cover and picks out the fielder.
full on middle and leg, flicked through midwicket for one.
full on fifth stump, defended.
Kishan comes down the track initially but telegraphs it too early and Ashwin drags the length back on fourth stump to force Kishan to adjust into a defensive prod.
skiddy ball lands full at 101 kph on sixth stump, driven through cover for two.
back of a length on middle, goes to flick through midwicket but inside edges this into the family jewels. He's okay though. That box is worth every penny.
fullish length on seventh stump, width and the length to drive hard and flays this over extra cover to the rope.
back of a length on off, tapped behind point for one.
short on the stumps, goes to pull this and top edges this over the keeper Samson, who shuffles a few steps to pouch it with ease.
back of a length on fifth stump at 137 kph, defended to cover.
back of a length on off at 136 kph, defended.
starts with a slower ball gone awry, too full on middle and too easily picked, flicked over midwicket to the rope.
back of a length on middle, tapped gently to long-on for one.
full pace, full length, fully dispatched over long-off! Mitchell lands this on seventh stump, too much width and attacked with ease by Tilak.
slower ball dug in very short on fourth stump at 102 kph, pulled through the leg side for one.
slower bouncer again at 105 kph, getting too predictable now and it doesn't climb much, SKY shuffles across and flicks a pull behind square to the rope.
sloppy Joe delivery from Mitchell. Slips a slower ball full toss on the knees, flicked easily to the fine leg rope.
full on fifth stump, sweeps this to deep square leg. Hetmyer with a casual collection and relay opens the door for a second. Chahal is not happy.
full on fourth stump, defended.
good length ball outside off, punched to the off side, diving stop by Ashwin at extra cover turns four into one.
full and sliding down leg, sweeps this straight to short fine leg. If he left it, it was a wide.
flights this generously landing on a good length on fifth stump, punches wide of the cover sweeper for an easy two.

full on fourth stump, misses a sweep and a big shout for lbw is denied. Chahal is adamant to call for a review and Samson obliges. This is very ambitious though. Most likely hit outside off and spinning to miss off on the live camera shot. Middle and leg stump are visible on the down the pitch replay. He was hit just below the knee roll. In fact he is hit in line according to ball-tracking but the ball is only just clipping the bails so umpire's call shows up on the final part of ball-tracking. SKY's innings will continue.
good length ball on off at 138 kph, defended back down the pitch.
short on middle and leg, shuffles across to flick through backward square leg for one.
fullish length on the wide guideline at 142 kph, slaps this to the cover sweeper for one.
back of a length on the stumps, flicked away for one.
good length ball on off, pushed into the covers for a tight single.
back of a length on middle, defended.
good length ball on off, flicked to long-on for one.
full on middle, driven to long-off for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, opens the face to guide this wide of short third man for one.
back of a length on the legs, flicked straight to short fine leg.
good length ball on middle, reaches forward to nudge this into the midwicket gap for one.
back of a length on middle, goes back to flick through midwicket for one.
short and wide at 135 kph, slaps this to the point sweeper for one.
back of a length on off stump at 133 kph, flicked into midwicket for one.

back of a length into the legs, misses a flick and the ball dribbles behind the stumps to Samson. Athletic charge and flick after removing his glove but Varma beats the throw to the stumps to complete the single.
bouncer sails over Varma and Samson going all the way to the rope for five freebies.
back of a length on off, shuffles across to flick through midwicket for one.
fullish length slower ball on off at 113 kph, pushed toward mid-off.
back of a length on fourth stump at 137 kph, guided with soft hands to deep third man for one.

that ball goes bye bye bye over deep square leg! Chahal is not in sync on his first ball back, floats this down the leg side, slog sweep comes out and slaughters it over the rope into the covered tarp.
flighted full again but this time slows it up at 83 kph on middle stump, Another sweep attempted but this time misses high off the pads.
full on middle and leg again, another firm sweep this time skids along the turf through backward square leg, Boult dives along the rope moving to his right to save two runs.
good length ball on fifth stump, pushes this to cover.
flighted full and wide almost on the guideline, flat drive comes off the toe to the cover sweeper for one.
short and wide, slices this behind point with a cut for one.
full on the stumps, mistimes a flick to mid-on for none.
good length ball, shuffles well across his stumps and flicks this very fine past Samson to the fine leg rope. Didn't really look like he got bat on it, more like the thigh guard but given as runs.
short and wide at 140 kph, guides this with an open face wide of third man for two.
back of a length on off at 144 kph, defended off the gloves to the off side.
back of a length on the body at 138 kph, shuffles across to flick behind square for one.
back of a length on fifth stump at 139 kph, goes back to cut this fine but misses.
full on the stumps at 78 kph, reverse sweep through the off side for one.
carrom ball lands full on middle, goes to flick this through midwicket and a leading edge goes to cover.
Ashwin leaps wide of the crease before delivering this full on the legs, flicked into midwicket for one.
good length ball on fifth stump, skids on and straightens, almost a leg break of sorts, and is cut to backward point.
good length ball on off, goes back to punch to long-off for one.
what a way to bring up a half-century! Floated too full on seventh stump, slog sweep is creamed high and deep over wide long-on just short of the second tier of stands.
full on middle, shuffles forward and flicks flat through midwicket for one.
good length ball on middle, defended to the off side.
back of a length on middle, leans back to cut and the extra bounce takes it past the edge, off the gloves and fumbled away for a bye.

now Tilak mirrors SKY with a slog sweep over the midwicket ropes! Fumble by Samson proves more costly now putting Varma on strike. Floated full on fifth stump, gets onto a knee and yanks this 20 yards over the LCD ad boards.
short and wide, sliced to the sweeper for one.

flights this into the body, SKY tries to dance away to create room but is cramped trying to shovel this down the ground and a simple catch is taken by Riyan Parag shuffling 10 yards left before taking it at rib height with his hips swiveled sideways facing his friend at long-off to keep his body in control and soften the ball into his hands.
back of a length on off, defended to the off side.

full in the slot on off, goes to launch this down the ground and miscues this near the toe of the bat, it flutters gently to Riyan Parag at long-on who jogs forward and takes a very casual catch at thigh height 15 yards in from the rope before flicking it away with disdain.
back of a length on fifth stump, punched toward Hetmyer at backward point, diving effort but fumbles the collection and they take a run.
slower cutter lands on a good length ripping into the pads, Pollard pokes at this tamely and misses.
bouncer on middle and leg stump at 138 kph clears Pollard ducking.
slower ball knuckles down the leg side, wide called.
back of a length on off, defended to Prasidh.
good length ball on off, punched through cover for one.
good length ball on the legs, tapped gently into the leg side for one.
googly flighted too full on fourth stump, there to smash and David sends it into orbit over long-on.
back of a length on middle, goes back to punch to mid-on for one.
ripping legbreak! Plenty of air given at 78 kph, pitches on leg and turns past the forward prod and collected well wide of off stump.
short on the body, flicked through midwicket for one.
back of a length into the thigh follows Pollard backing away, misses this and they steal a leg bye.
full on fifth stump, goes to drive, toe edge dragged past the stumps and the ball goes to the fine leg rope.
length ball at 139 kph, drilled on the up by David and clears extra cover beating the sweeper easily.
slower ball angled down leg. A run-a-ball needed for victory now. Mumbai's long wait may be about to end.
back of a length on the hips, flicked to deep fine leg for one.
back of a length on the stumps, backs away to heave this and drags a bottom edge softly into midwicket for one.
slower ball lands full on middle, flicked to long-on for one.
short on off stump, pulled to deep square leg for one.
length ball on fifth stump, slapped over extra cover for two.
goes for yorker, too full and flicks this through wide long-on, Parag and Boult are still fighting to save every run and collide on the rope while trying to knock this back into play saving two runs.
full and wide yorker attempted, Pollard somehow toe slaps this one-handed over extra cover and they fetch two.
short on the body, Pollard tries to whack this over the leg side rope but miscues this into the ground.
length ball on sixth stump, slapped into the leg side for one.

Pollard falls at deep fine leg! Slower bouncer at 111 kph on the body, Pollard gets inside the line and pulls this flat to the fielder on the rope. It was judged supremely and without hesitation by Mitchell, who ran 10 yards to his right before settling and lunging forward to take an ankle high catch. Third umpire is reviewing this now. The ball looks like it has gone into the finger tips before the fingers then press against the grass but the ball is firmly in the fingers above the grass. Third umpire is taking his sweet time but finally the confirmation is given that it is a clean catch.

One ball is all it takes for Sams and the match is done and dusted! Mumbai no longer have a bagel in the win column! Length ball on off stump, shuffles across and launches this pull a mile high before it lands safely onto the covered tarp over the field level seats.
on a length, just around off, and he gets behind the line to defend it close to his body
outside off, fuller in length, and swings away late as it beats Kohli! The bat was coming down straight, but could do nothing about the late movement
fuller again, and driven down the ground, past mid-off. The Brabourne erupts in applause. A little press forward, and just meeting it with the full face of the bat, and gets good mileage out of it
on his pads, and whipped away. That's more like the Virat Kohli we know. Good length, but poor line, and put away towards the deep square leg fence, which is unprotected
short, down the leg side, and will be called wide. Kohli gets inside the line and drops his wrists
length, and he presses forward and pushes it to the left of mid-off with soft hands. Sets off immediately for a single, and gets a quick response from Faf
length, driven towards the man at cover, but not quite off the middle of the bat. No possibility of a run there
length, around leg and middle, with a bit of bounce, and he goes back to defend
back of a length, around middle, and he steers it between point and third, and pinches a quick single
good ball! Angles across du Plessis, as he opens up his stance to try and defend, and goes across his outside edge. Not far from the top of off stump, either
length, around leg stump, and he defends it towards mid-wicket. A pace of 134 kph

gets the outside edge, and what a return for Sangwan! Pitches around off, and angles across him yet again, and this time the RCB captain chases that. No foot movement, and gets a decent chunk of the outside edge through to Saha. Sangwan punches the air with joy
length, around off, and he defends it. Good bounce yet again. He's found a great length in this over, even though he is not operating at any great pace
length, outside off, and nips away a touch. Beats Kohli yet again, at good pace as well, 140.5 kph
length, but this time Kohli gets a half-cock forward to defend it close to his body. Test match lengths, and the right respect accorded by the batter. Great to see!
short, down the leg side, and he looks to pull it away. Gets a top edge, but gets it fine towards the fine leg boundary. The man is inside the circle, so it's a safe shot

shuffles a bit down the wicket, and he's anyway standing a bit outside his crease, and gets a ball nipping back in. Misses out on a flick, but it runs away towards short fine and they can pinch a leg bye. Wouldn't have been out anyway, though there is a stifled appeal from the fielding side
nips back in yet again, and gets Patidar on the pad this time. He was looking to whip it away off the back foot. Going down leg and hit him quite high as well, lobbing away on the off side
length, and he has drop-kicked this towards deep mid-wicket. Went quickly on to the back foot and flicked it over the infield. Pulled back in from the boundary by Joseph
length, around leg and middle, and he defends towards cover
length, and driven towards mid off. Doesn't place it well enough for runs
fullish, driven firmly, but just to the left of Hardik, who dives away and stops this from going through the infield. Just a single on offer
short of a length, and tapped towards wide cover. Patidar has come out a long way, and the fielder has a shy at the non-striker's end, but pings the batter!
length, driven firmly from the crease, but back towards the bowler
patted towards point, and again a bit of hesitation as Kohli sets off. A misfield allows them to complete the single quite comfortably in the end
that's full, angling in, and he just dismissively whips it away towards deep mid-wicket. Fine shot!

bowled from wide of the crease, full again, outside off, and he has punched this through the extra cover region. Fabulous bit of timing yet again from Kohli! Presents the full face of the bat, after a short trigger movement forward
full, on the pad, as he looks to flick it away. Could have picked up runs here, and must be disappointed at having missed out

this is a good ball! Pulls his length back a touch, bowled at 148 kph, and angles back in. Goes off the inside edge, and on to the thigh pad, and drops by Kohli's feet. They can pinch a single, though
quick, but short, and he runs this down to third. Ferguson comes across and puts in the dive, but cannot beat this lightning-quick outfield
back of a length, into the body, and played away with a defensive prod
length, played with soft hands towards mid-off, and they pinch a quick single, with Patidar responding quickly to Kohli's call

what a punch that was! Patidar stays tall in his crease, and allows this length ball to come on to him, angled across his body, and just punches this past Kohli at the non-striker's end. Superb timing
length, worked away towards square leg for an easy single
runs this down towards wide third with the angle of the delivery
back of a length, around leg, and whips this away towards deep backward square
length, punched down past the bowler, but not far from the man at mid-on, and they will pick up the single
fullish length, driven inside out along the ground towards a sweeper at wide cover
googly, around off, and slapped hard down the ground. Goes on a couple of bounces to long-on
googly again, but started around off and middle. Whips this away with the angle towards deep square leg
full, around off, and driven firmly down the ground towards long-on
full, whippy drive towards cover
slower through the air this time, eased away with a bit of wristwork towards midwicket
length, driven firmly to cover
wide of off, fullish in length, and he drives this, but away from his body. Firmly back into the pitch and back towards Lockie in his follow-through
angles in, and he defends this towards square leg
length, angles in, and he plays a crisp cut, but straight into the ground and to point
wide, outside off, and he looks to cut this. The pace takes it flying off the edge, and on to third on one bounce
goes back and across and biffs a short of a length ball inside out. Pandya dives away to his left, and stops a certain boundary! That puts paid to any fears about his fitness, I would think?
presses forward to drive this with the incoming angle towards long-on
tossed up a touch,and he has gone across the line, but very convincingly, down towards cow corner. Top shot from Patidar. Was a googly, and he read it perfectly
fullish, around leg and middle, and he looks to work this away towards midwicket. Skews off the inside part of his bat towards square leg
yorker, and he defends this. Wants to create room to go inside out, but that was fast and full
length, around off, and patted towards point to get a single
googly again, and didn't pick it this time. Wants to go down teh ground, but gets it off the inside edge, on to his left pad
short, and he looks to pull it away, but gets this off the inside edge on to his midriff
backs away, invites a change from Ferguson, who looks to go full but ends up bowling a low full toss. He has rifled this down the ground, and just clears long-on
short, outside off, and he has got this away towards backward point. It's an intelligent shot, because he has maneouvred his body such that he can get it between deep point and third.
length, tapped towards point. Wants a single, but wisely decides against it
length, punches this moving forward and gets it towards deep point
fullish, and bashed away through covers. Did well to step away initially towards the leg side, and that might have put Ferguson off. Good contact in the end
Hard length ball on off is tucked to midwicket
Short ball over fourth stump, pulled along on the ground square to the deep
Smacks the pull over midwicket for six! The ball was on a short length and was below the ribs, so he could get under it and swing through, which he did as the front leg went to the legside

Deep-square leg cannot cut it off, despite the dive! He made room and whacked it wildly to send the ball on a length that followed him, it went along the ground off the bottom of the bat. The fielder ran to his left but could not cut it off
Slaps a length ball outside off to deep point on one leg
Slaps a length ball to mid off, both players are making room by default to stay legside of the ball
Whacks a full ball, close to a yorker, on middle to long on. He dug it out and got it off the bottom of the bat, it hit the ground around the edge of the circle
Half-chance? Drives it to the left of the bowler and it, in fact, was in the air. Rashid stuck his left hand out but it did not stick and ended up at long-off
Punches a back of a good length ball on the stumps to long-on
Slaps a length ball outside off to long-on, that was slower at 86 kmph
Length on middle at 95 kmph, pushed to long on

Quarter chance? Maybe not, it may have been a googly, came in down leg to meet the agricultural hoick on the bottom edge. It went onto Saha's pad in milliseconds and his hands could not come down to take it
He's greeted with a ramp pull that is dragged from outside off, the ball was on a back of a good length. Rajat did not get all of it but cleared short-fine leg. Stopped by Joseph in the deep
Beaten on the pull off a length ball over middle and leg, goes to the space around square leg

First fifty for Kohli in IPL since 14 matches! It comes off a full ball on middle that's broomed to long-on, he stayed legside of the ball and revolved the bat to send it along the ground. But it has taken 45 balls.
Makes room and whips a full ball on the stumps aerially to long-on, on a bounce or two
Slower one into the pitch just outside off is nurdled gently into the gap at midwicket. Kohli had two on the mind from the outset and managed to get it
On the dance down the ground, flicks the full ball outside off to long-on
Good length on middle, clipped to long-on
Moves across early and is followed with a slower one, tries the paddle and misses. It takes the back pad and goes to short-fine leg
Back of a good length ball is clipped to square leg. Kohli's upset as he feels he missed out
Makes room and carves a length ball outside off over cover to send it over the ropes and bring up his maiden fifty! He's grounded Kohli's slow start and has risked big shots with good execution
Makes room and the bowler hides it with a yorker outside off. Rajat tries to reach with one leg in the air but can't
Length ball on middle, Rajat was backing away and swat pulled it to deep-backward square

Top edges a paddle to square leg. He was outside the offside tramline and tried to paddle it fine or find elevation, but it took the edge and ballooned to the Gill, who had to run just a few metres to his left to take an easy catch. Ends a productive, well-paced innings from Rajat. Sangwan gets his second.
Flicks a good length ball on middle and leg to the left of deep-fine leg, who runs in and keeps it to two

Falls just in front of long-on! Tewatia ran in diagonally to his right but could not reach the ball. It was a slower ball on a back of a good length, Glenn tried the slog but got it off the bottom. It was in the air for a while but in the gap
Short ball outside off beats the pull
Yorker on fourth misses the attempted cover-carve and the off-stump
Reverse sweeps a full ball outside off to the right of Joseph, who stops it with his right hand as he fell to his right.
Smart short ball from Joseph beats the cut. Maxi made room and tried to ramp it as the ball followed him but the ball was too quick for him
Reverse laps a full ball on the stumps to short-third man. The throw went past the non-striker's end but the overthrow was not on
Whips a back of a good length ball on middle off the bottom of the bat to deep-midwicket
Quick good length ball follows Maxwell as he made room again, he heaved but missed. It took the thigh pad on the back leg and trickled to third man
He tries with a pull but cannot connect well enough. It was a length ball on the chest that was pulled with a swivel along the ground to deep-backward square
Tries the reverse pull and misses. Maxwell shaped early for the shot but the ball was slow and into the pitch. It went over the stumps after the bat swung through thin air
Slaps a length ball outside off to long-on, the bat turned in the hand and went along the ground to the fielder
Smacks a slot ball on off over cow corner! The 141 kmph ball is swung through across the line off the meat of the bat, it sailed into the stands
Thrashes a good length ball around off from the bottom of the bottom to deep-midwicket
Yorker kisses the base of off! Kohli made ample room and tried the cover drive but the ball was through before the shot. Shami raises his finger as Kohli walks back in frustration
Length ball outside off is cut to deep point
Launches a pull over square leg! It was a slower bouncer but it sat up and Maxwell went through with the shot to end Shami's spell with a six.
Tries the sweep, probably got glove on it to send a full ball on the stumps to short-fine leg
Makes room and slaps a full ball on the stumps to long off

The match-up comes for Titans as DK top-edges a pull to short-fine leg! DK tried the sweep off a back of a good length ball on the stumps with a kneel but it was a tentative shot that took the top-edge and ballooned for Shami to take an easy catch
Full outside off, close to a yorker. It's scythed, as Deivarayan Muthu would say, along the ground to deep cover

Switch hit comes off! It was a good length ball on the stumps at a slow pace, Glenn switched his stance early and swept it hard in the air. The inside-out shot went to the deep cover fence on the bounce
Full outside off, flapped to long-off
Well, he starts with a slower one. Full on off and it's hit to long-off from the bottom of the horizontal bat. The fielder misfields, which allows the second
Yorker outside off is sliced aerially to the right of deep-backward point for four. Maxi fell over but connected well

Rashid takes an excellent catch at cover! A low full-toss on middle had Glenn make room and try the slice again. This over cover, but the bat turned in the hand and popped up. Rashid was running back to get it and somehow managed to grab it low.
Yorker on middle and off is blocked to the bowler with a fully horizontal bat.

Full toss just outside off is carved to the left of cover, Lomror was cramped for room but he went through with the shot. The ball was in the air but pitched in front of the fielder's right and went away in the gap to the fence

Followed! The good length ball followed the batter making room, he tried to adjust the shot but could not push it in front. It went to the keeper's right and allowed the single, which they took. Could they have rejected it? We'll find out in the next over.
Walks across outside the tramline, paddle-pulls it off the bottom to short-fine leg on the bounce
Lowish full toss close to the tramline is slapped to deep cover. The batter moving across meant he had to go with the shot
In the slot, and it is launched over long-on! It was a full ball and was swung through, it hit the low end of the bat but had enough to go 87 metres over straight the long-on area
Very wide full toss beats the slash. Pandya was not happy with the call but that was way wide
Full ball is semi-helicoptered to cow corner along the ground. They scamper for two and just about get in
Walks across and paddles the aerial pull over short-fine leg to take the score to 170! The bowler followed him on a back of a good length, the batter scooped it to send it over

Miller takes a catch sans cable interruption this time! It's a full, wide ball that had Lomror slashing. He got it off the bottom, it went up and stayed up. Miller settled underneath and took it with his fingers pointing up
short, wide, and cut away, past point. Easy peasy lemon squeezy for Saha
hangs back and works it after it straightens from around off, towards midwicket
length, around off, and he goes back to defend this
length, and he gets down on one knee and sweeps it towards deep backward square leg. Just a bounce or two, and it's into the fence
fuller, goes on with the arm, and goes under the edge as he looks to play it towards the leg side. Good take from Rawat
cut hard, but Shahbaz gets across to it to his left at cover-point, and keeps them down to a single
length, and punched away with the incoming angle towards deep midwicket. Easy two
on the pads, and worked away towards the man deep at square leg
short of a length, around off, and he gets up on his toes to punch this towards deep point. Some frenetic running from deep backward point keeps it down to a single
but it won't really help if you keep drifting on to the pads. Gill just gets enough bat on it, and a flick of the wrists takes it away towards long leg
length ball, perhaps a change of pace as well, and he plays it pressing forward. Indeed, was bowled at just 126 kph
back of a length, good pace at 138 kph, and he punches this to cover. Was shaping back into him
back of a length, outside off, and he taps this towards third, but point is quick to converge on the ball
shortish, and he punches it away towards midwicket. More of a short-arm jab, and he is able to get it deep enough to pick up a couple of runs
steers a length ball towards deep backward point
cut away firmly, but picked up by Hasranga at point. A bit of excitement from the crowd, who probably haven't spotted that he had crunched it into the ground near him first!
back of a length, and he seems to have gotten into a pull shot a bit early. Off the bottom edge, but he is alive to the possibility of a quick run as it dobbles away towards short midwicket
good length, around off, and forces him to go back and tap it towards point. Quick single pinched by Saha to retain strike
tossed up a touch, around off, and he drives this in the air, but past extra cover. Was always looking like four once it got past the fielder there
drags his length back a touch, and he is able to drive this towards wide long-off
length, worked away towards short midwicket
punched towards long-off
down the wicket, and whips away one fired towards his legs, getting it to the sweeper at deep square leg
fired in quick, and worked away with the angle towards square leg. Went quickly to the fielder stationed there
length, around off, and he swivel-pulls it towards short midwicket

length, and he looks to pull again. Inside edge, on to body, and drops on the off side. Anguished yelp from Hazlewood as they pinch a single. More so, because on another day, that could have been chopped on to the stumps
length, driven firmly, but straight towards wide cover
length, and he taps this with soft hands towards the man at cover. Easy single
short of a length, and worked away with a half-pull, half-flick, towards long leg. Good diving stop by Lomror, from deep square leg, away to his right, to prevent the boundary
tapped towards cover with a forward press, and he picks up the single on offer
on pace, but down the leg side. Will have to reload this
length, punched towards mid-off, and they set off for the single, There's an underarm throw at the non-striker's end, but I think he would have been well home

comes down the wicket, Siraj pitches it in his half of the pitch, and he has a swing and a miss. Good line, just outside off, which meant he would have been going across the line with an attempted slap down the ground

short ball, but he has hung back and just dunked this over extra cover. There's no fielder in the deep, and the ball teases and torments the two fielders chasing it, before rolling over the boundary skirting. Smart from Saha
length, angles back in, and he looks to steer it towards third. Stopped at point
short, but might need to rebowl this. Went down leg side, and also went high over Saha's head
short of a length again, and he punches this away towards midwicket. Gets his wrists into action, and just flicks it away into a vacant area in the deep
wide of off, and played towards point. Immediate response from Gill and they cut through for the single
cutter to start with, outside off, and Saha gets an inside edge on to pad. Drops by the off side, and they squeeze out a quick single
an off cutter, and beats Gill, who looks to defend from the crease. Comes in, and hasn't missed off stump by too much, as it dies on its way through to Rawat
worked with the incoming slant towards midwicket
down the wicket, and chips it away towards deep midwicket
slower ball, worked away towards cover, and they pinch a quick single
cutter again, and just bounces a bit excessively. Beats Saha's attempt to flick it away, as it drops just by his feet, and Harshal is quick to get across to the ball
length, around off, spins back in, and he presses forward to defend
fullish, and he sweeps hard but to the man at deep backward square leg

wrong 'un, and he looks to play a drive off the back foot. Ends up skewing it in the air, and Patidar takes a good, low catch running in from long-off! There's the breakthrough that RCB have been looking for
worked away with the spin, into him, off the back foot, and picks up two near deep square leg
length, turns back in, and he defends off the back foot

fuller, and he looks to flick it away. Off the inside of the bat, with a bit of pad perhaps and down towards long leg. Will pick up two, but Hasranga knows that might have been a close shout if he had somehow missed bat and struck pad straightaway
just a bit short, and swatted away towards deep cover
short, but outside off, and he pulls it away towards deep midwicket
short again, and he has cut this away well behind point. Lots of room to work with. Bad ball, and given due treatment by Gill

short, and wide, and he looks to cut. Belated appeal for caught behind, and given out! Gill has reviewed immediately. Nothing in it in the replays. That will have to be reversed. In fact, Rawat's gloves are in line with the stumps. So this will be a no-ball anyway
full toss, and slapped away some eight rows into the stands behind midwicket

fired in, and may have trapped him in front. Given out leg before! He reviews after a chat with the non-striker. This will only save him either on line or on bounce. This went on straight with the arm, and he was looking to flick it away. No bat involved. And it will also return three reds. Hits the top of leg stump. Gujarat lose an important wicket, and a review. Shahbaz with a quick redemption arc!
slides on with a quicker ball, and he drives this to long-on, evading a dive from the bowler himself away to his right
length, around leg and middle, and he defends with a forward press
goes on with the arm, and he works it away towards deep square leg
full, on the pads, and whipped away through the midwicket region. Fabulous shot, imperious even, from Sudharsan
full toss, on the pads, and he will be disappointed he has swept this hard, but straight to the man at deep backward square leg
length, punched towards long-on
fullish, outside off, driven to long-off
Length on off, tucked to square leg

Holes out to long-on! Hardik saw the full ball in the slot on off, he whipped it like he often does. But the ball went flat and into Lomror's breadbasket. Shahbaz is stoked as he's turning this game around. Think he got it off the bottom, the lack of elevation was also key factor that led to the dismissal
Good length on middle, clipped to deep-midwicket
Good length on the stumps, clipped to cow corner along the ground
Full on off, it went away with the angle and got the outside edge off the full-faced defending bat. It went behind square on the offside and a run was taken.
Full just outside off, flicked to deep-square leg
Back of a good length outside off, chopped off the bottom to the right of point
Good length outside off, cut to deep-cover point

Chipped accidentally in the air but it is safe. The slower one sticks into the pitch and has Sai go through with the full-faced push a tad too early. The ball went over the bowler to mid-off on the bounce
Cracks a cover drive to send the cutter on a good length outside off to the gap at the left of cover for four
Another cutter keeps low after pitching on a length. It's outside off and is glided to third man
Harshal errs on line and Sai capitalizes. It was a cutter into the pitch but was down leg. Sai pulled it on the move behind square into the gap to earn four
Good length ball on the stumps in defended back to the bowler off the backfoot
Backs away and flicks a back of a good length ball to midwicket

Misses the legstump by centimetres! It was a slow ball on a good length that went with the angle, Miller made room and tried to chop it and was beaten. It skidded through and went past the edge onto the keeper's pad and fell on the ground
Good length on the legs, clipped to deep-square leg

Rebound catch taken behind by the sub-keeper, Anuj! Sai tried to drive a back of a good length ball through cover, but it took the bottom edge and hit the keeper's pad. It lobbed up behind and Anuj had enough time to turn around, reach out and grab it. It's followed by cheers and celebrations.
Full on legstump, clipped to deep-square leg

Given LBW, Titans review! Where's it pitching? It's a full ball at a slow pace, it beat the flick and hit the pads. No inside edge but the ball is pitching just outside leg! It was a marginal call that was understandably given out, given the length. Tewatia breathes a sigh of relief.
Length just outside off at 141 kmph, pushed to cover
Low fullie on the legs is flicked with nonchalance through square leg along the ground into the fence, the fielder was not in the frame
Cutter on a good length goes away with the angle and bounces a bit extra to beat the attempted glide to third man
Length ball goes away with the angle outside off and beats the pull. The pace was 132 kmph but it looked slow, might have been a cross-seamer
Similar line and maybe a tad shorter, Tewatia tries the cut but misses
Makes room and whacks a full ball to wide-long on. The bowler followed him but Miller could get under it and deposit it to the boundary boards on the bounce
Makes room and slices a full ball aimed to hide it from hitting arc, and it goes flat passt sweeper cover

Bowler flicks the ball back and it allows a run that was not on. It was a full ball clipped to the bowler, Wanindu noticed Tewatia backed up too far. He flicked the ball back but it went well wide towards mid-on. Replays show the batter was well down and it may have been tight had it hit.
Full on the stumps, clipped to short-mid wicket.
Full outside off, touched gently to cover and they take off for one
Makes room and brooms a full ball outside off to long-on
Goes across and slaps a back of a length ball outside off to the right of deep point
Full outside off, driven along the ground to deep cover
Makes room and delicately glides a back of a length ball bowled at pace over the stumps past third man. Deep backward point runs to his left but cannot stop it
Lomror misfields and allows two extra runs. A length ball outside off is slice-cut behind point along the ground. The fielder got there but could not pull it back
Back of a good length ball goes across over off and hit the inside edge onto pad, between the back of the pad and the thigh

RCB review for an LBW. It was a full ball on off, Tewatia moved across and tried to paddle it. He looks to be lunging outside off. There was no edge. The ball was pitching in line, so was the impact, but it was going further away to miss off stump. What's worse, it went fine off the deflection to long-leg for four.

Fielder does not pick up the throw at cover which allows the single. It was a good length ball on off, Miller made room and pushed it to cover. It hit Siraj's closing palms and popped up. In the meantime, they completed the run
Wide of the crease. Short ball on the shoulder is pulled behind square to the deep. That was a cutter
Misses the line as the good length ball at 119 kmph goes way wider than the tramline
Underedges a pull off a cutter on the armpits, it lands in the gap in front of square and goes slow to allow two
Very short cutter at 121 kmph on off is pulled into the leg by Miller, the ball goes in front on the pitch
Full outside off, another cutter from wide of the crease. It's driven to mid-off
Slower one outside off on a full length, the 107 kmph ball is driven to deep cover
Slower one into the pitch over off is pulled by Tewatia after a shuffle across. It goes in the gap at midwicket to the deep along the ground, so they take an easy two
Lovely knuckle ball at a hard length just outside off bounces high, goes over the midriff to beat the push
Rahul helps himself to a flick over fine-leg for six! The full-paced ball was on a full length but down leg, so Rahul whipped it over long-leg for an 88-metre six.
Cover driven for four! Sets up for the knuckle ball. Gets a full ball outside off and he eases into the cover drive for a four
Another knuckle ball into the pitch goes outside off and is pulled to deep-mid wicket
Smacks a pull into the ground to the short side at deep-square leg! There were two men at the deep but none close, the length ball outside off is not a good option for Josh this time.

They push for two and get it! It was a slower ball on a good length on middle. Tewatia pushed it to deep point. The throw was a bit off, the keeper tried to flick it to his right on to the stumps but could not manage it. Would have been out had it hit!
Good length ball just outside off, driven to deep point
Slower bouncer into the pitch goes away with the angle outside off, it's pulled into the ground to the right of deep-midwicket

Yorker on leg goes to short-fine leg. Was there an inside edge? Did it go just off the boot? Was it in-line? We will find out as RCB review. It is clearly off the bat, the third umpire does not even need Ultra-Edge to confirm. Review lost.
Miller is frustrated with himself as he pulls a short ball around the head over middle to deep-midwicket. But it sat up and Miller had his front leg out the way which may have limited access

Tewatia has no issues finding access as he smacks an aerial extra cover-drive over the boundary! He danced down and went diagonally to manufacture room, he smoked the full ball off the middle and it sailed over. There were no fielders there so it was a safe shot.
Wide yorker, it was on the tramline and the marginal call is given in the batter's favour. Miller held back from playing at it.

Whacks a full ball on off through the gap at wide-mid off, and that should be goodnight nurse for RCB. He whipped it after using the crease to go back and get elevation and placed it to the left of long-on
Good length outside off, glided to third man for one
Finishes off in style, does Tewatia. Creams a lofted cover drive from a full ball outside off inside-out in the gap to the fence.
Length ball outside off is caressed to deep backward point.
Beats the flick with a back of a good length ball on the stumps, it swung back in after pitching on middle and would have gone on to miss leg-stump
Length on the top of the pads, gets behind it and defends to the left of the bowler

Full ball beats the flick and hits the pad. Kings do not review, suspecting it was going down which looks to be the case. It was a full ball on leg and the bat-face closed early which led to KL missing it.
Length ball at 129 kmph on the stumps is defended in front
Length ball down leg is flicked fine to the fence. Turns out it came off the thigh pad.
Full on middle and off, it swung away and took the outside half of the bat. Quinton was attempting a straight drive but it went to deep point along the ground
Slashes and misses! It was a length ball outside off, there was room and KL slashed at it with a horizontal bat but could manage to find only thin air.
Length ball on the stumps, tapped off the backfoot with a slightly closed bat-face to long on
Edge taken again! The 129 kmph ball on legstump on a good length has de Kock try to flick it. He played it with soft hands, so it went to slip on the bounce
Full on off, pushed to short cover, who comes in early and stops the single despite a wayward underarm throw
Tries the paddle sweep and gets beaten. It was a good length ball that went across outside off, de Kock premeditated the shot and missed
Good length ball on middle is gently defended into the gap to the right of the bowler for one
Low fullie just outside off, it's clipped off the bottom of the bat to the left of mid-on, who runs across and stops it
As Berta from two and a half men once said, "Dip me in butter and roll me in nuts!" A cover drive is creamed off a full ball outside off and it races to the fence
Good comeback from Rabada, length ball on middle squares up KL and gets the outside edge. It goes towards third man

Edged and taken! A length ball on middle has KL searching for it on the backfoot, he tries to defend it with a slightly open-faced bat. It looked like the wobble ball, it ended up taking the outside edge and went straight to the keeper who took it comfortably.
Full on the stumps, clipped to mid-on
Slashes and misses! It was full, outside off, and was angling away. de Kock flashed with a horizontal bat and got beaten
Slightly fuller and straighter, de Kock goes with a swing towards mid-on but missed out again
Around a good length, the wide ball is cut into the ground with the back knee on the ground to the gap at point
Back of a good length outside off, cut to deep point
Full outside off, off-drive with a full follow-through goes to long-off
Deftly channels a good length ball just outside off to third man with an open-faced bat while crouching down, the fielder stops it and takes out the option of the single
Full outside off, QDK is beaten on the horizontal batted slash again. But this was outside the tramline
Low full toss just outside off is met with a hard heave aimed towards midwicket but is beaten
Full just outside off, QDK goes through with a straight whack and hits the boundary cushion on the full
Lllaunched! Fullish cross-seam ball outside off is heaved over wide long-on, 93 metres away, thanks to the full swing timed perfectly.
Low full toss just outside off is pushed to mid-on
Length outside off, chipped to mid-off for a quick single. It was in the air for a bit but fell well safe in front of the fielder
Low full toss just outside off, the attempted yorker is pushed to mid-off for another quick single

Rabada runs behind and misses a tough catch! It was a length ball just outside off, QDK went with a heave and got the leading edge, it swirled in the air. So Kagiso had to run behind from short third man, it went three-fourth of the journey to the boundary. KG turned to his left late and got the ball on the wrist and it popped out.
Length on the stumps, clipped to long-on
Full outside off, beaten on a flayed drive aimed over cover
Length outside off, defended in front
Comes down the ground and tries to cut it downtown, he had made room but Rishi is offering no pace. The length ball on the stumps is cut to the bowler on the move
Length ball on the legs beats the flick, takes the thigh-pad on the way and goes fine to the left of the keeper to the fence
Full outside off, driven into the pitch to the bowler off the bottom of the horizontal bat
Back of a good length ball outside off is chopped to the gap at point
Length ball just outside off. Hooda makes room and tries to hit it hard to the offside but he had to adjust the shot and played it into the ground to the bowler
Full outside off, driven to the left of the bowler. The fielder at extra cover ran in and stopped the single
Full down leg, tries to help it fine with an aerial flick but misses. May have taken the thigh-pad
A wider length ball down leg beats the fine pull and is, rightly, given wide
Good length ball on middle is worked to the legside with a full-faced bat that turned slowly for one. He was staying legside of the ball and had to adjust the shot again.
Whacked over long-off! It is a full ball on the stumps, Hooda made room and went through with the swing to send the ball to the stands
Full on the stumps, defended from the inside half of the full-faced straight bat to deep-midwicket
Length outside off, cut straight to cover along the ground
Length outside off, walks towards it and slaps to deep cover. That brings up LSG's fifty.
Slower one wide of off beats the cover drive, Hooda tried to go through with the shot and was on the move after playing it waywardly as not making contact left him out of shape
Full outside off, driven to the left of long-off, the fielder ran a few metres but quick running allows the batters two
Drives a good length ball outside off with a horizontal bat into the ground through cover, it found the gap and beat the long-off fielder running in
Length outside off, cut to left of point
Length outside off, chops it to deep point. It was close to cut but he did it well by backing away at the right time
Beaten on the reverse! QDK shaped up early, so Liam went with a low full toss down leg to beat the shot
Full outside off, driven to long-off
Full down leg, follows the batter. The ball is heaved to deep-mid wicket on the bounce
Good length ball at 87 kmph spins away just outside off and is cut to the right of the diving point fielder, who got the fingertips. One taken
Googly on a back of a good length on off is clipped to deep-midwicket
Full outside off, thwarts a drive into the ground to wide long-off. Brings up the fifty partnership.
Good length ball just outside off, defended gently in the gap towards short cover for one
Full on the legs, sets up for the sweep and cracks it well to the right of short-fine leg
Full on off, defended towards square leg
The ball turns into a shooting star as the full leggie down leg-stump is smoked over wide long-on for a 98 metres six
Good length ball down leg is let go with the legs coming back
Length ball on the stumps, clipped to deep midwicket. There could have been overthroughs but they missed out
Full outside off, makes room and lofts a cover drive to the gap at deep extra cover
Good length on middle, flicked to the vacant square leg region for one
Full on leg, makes room and goes for the hard drive down the ground. Gets it off the bottom to send the ball, along the ground, to long on
Length ball on the stumps is clipped into the gap at midwicket for two
Chips a full ball on leg while trying to make room, did not go through with the shot. The ball went in the air and on the bounce to long off who was running in
A controlled clobber meets the length ball on the stumps, gone to long on

Caught and bowled (half) chance missed! it was a full ball on the stumps, QDK tried to whack it to long on and got it off the bottom, it went at good pace to the left of the bowler, who got his hands on it but it pops out
Length ball is pulled hard to deep square leg
Length outside off, cut to point. There are three of them close-by.
