Pulls a slow, length ball on middle down the ground well to the right of long on for four
Length ball outside off, crashes a cover drive with a horizontal bat. Uppish but that was in an acreage of space
Tries to stay away from the arc at a good length and QDK lets it go. It puzzles Simon Doull on air as there were three fielders outside the ring on the legside
Back of a good length outside off, tries the horizontal batted push. Gets it off the bottom of the bat into the pitch, straight
Low, wide full toss is steered behind point in the gap

QDK walks after an appeal that is turned down by the on-field umpire! It was a length ball outside off and de Kock tried to cut it off the backfoot behind point again but got a feather on it. The appeal was enthusiastic but was turned down. QDK walked before thoughts of the review coming in.
Good length outside off, beats the slash with a horizontal bat
Full outside off, pushed to wide-mid on
Full on off, driven in the air over the right of the bowler. It was well to the left of mid-off and goes for four

Run-out check upstairs off the direct hit! It was a length ball on the stumps which was tucked to midwicket, the fielder saw the mix-up between the two and threw down the stumps, but Krunal made his way back in time after being sent back

Direct hit at the non-striker's end! This might be out! Yes, Hooda is a goner! It was a short ball on the body that was pulled to deep square leg, Jonny ran in to the ball and, somehow, got a direct hit from the deep. The batter was a few inches short for the freak runout to be completed. Hooda was slow while turning which looked lazy but the bullet throw was accurate and took away any chance of Hooda coming back.
Good length ball on off is pushed to long on
Beaten on the hard cover drive. It was a good length ball outside off, Stoinis tried to drive it but seemed to be late on it
Bouncer seemed to go over the head but the umpire says it is fine, it was let go by Marcus with no movement

Holes out to long-on! Cross seamer at a back of a good length outside off was going away with the angle, Pandya tried to drag it aerially over long-on but the bat turned in his hand and the ball ballooned up in the air. Dhawan took a comfortable catch with the hands pointing upwards
Around a good length ball is pulled (cradled?) in the air through midwicket. There was hesitation as they went for the second run but made it safely in the end
Length ball outside off is pulled in front of midwicket in the gap for two
Tries to steer a length ball outside off very late but the ball zipped past him. Badoni practices the leave later

Skier taken brillianty by Liam! Another cross seamer on a good length on off, Badoni tried the whippy flick but got the top-edge. The ball went straight up, three fielders close by were converging, but Liam called it and took it with a forward lean as he came down.
Full outside off, pushed to mid-off
Slaps a slow, good length ball outside off to long-off
Paddles a full ball outside off to the gap around long-leg

Slapped off the bottom of the bat to the bowler! Stoinis was making room and tries to slap the back of a good length ball that was spinning away towards the stumps, toe-edged it and the ball went slowly. That allowed time for Chahar to leap to his left and clasp it.
Full on off, clipped to midicket
Comprehensively beaten on the outside edge! Full ball just outside off turns away, the slowness helped, and the slightly open-faced defence cannot make contact with the ball
Beaten again, this time on the cover drive. It was a full ball that pitched outside off and turned away
Good length outside off, steered low down to third man. That was going away with the angle and Holder's frame helped reach it, perhaps easier than others
Good length outside off, steered to the right of point. The fielder was running in but they scampered to complete the run
Walks down before the ball was released, Arshdeep saw him and pulled the length back and bowled it outside off. Holder pushed it towards cover and got one
Bottom edges a wide yorker around seventh stump with a horizontal bat, it is squeezed through to the right of the keeper towards long-leg for two
Good length outside off, steered to the right of deep-third man who runs across to his right and stops it
Length over middle at 138 kmph, Holder makes room and walks towards the bowler. The ball is slapped to long-on off the bottom
Full on the legs, makes room and slog-sweeps it off the bottom to deep-midwicket on the bounce
Full on off, swept along the ground to deep-backward square

Launched over long-on! Holder reaches out and swings across to send the full ball on the legs at 91 kmph over long-on. The reach helped get to the pitch of the ball, and the free swing ensured it went over the fence.

Taken by the deep-cover fielder at wide-long off! Full, slow ball outside off takes the top-edge off the swipe by Holder. It went up in the air and long-off and deep-cover were running towards it, the latter called early and took it well, to his right
Length ball pitches on off and turns away, as googlies do, and is pulled to the bowler
Nails it over long-on! Clubs a full ball outside off with a golf-like swing to send the ball over long-on for a 91-metre six.
Pulled... just over deep-midwicket! Length ball on the stumps is pulled with decent contact, the fielder was running back but the ball sailed further

Another six, comes off the leading edge. Around a length outside off, it was slashed and went over third man off the leading edge. The fielder leapt to his left as the ball was going over his shoulder but could not take it

Taken by deep-cover who ran in and held on to it with a slide! Chameera tried to go through with a straight swing but got it off the bottom of the outside half of the bat, it went up and Chahar ran in from deep cover and took it well
Beaten on the steer outside off from a length ball
Swings at a short ball just outside off with a pull but is beaten
Stays legside and tries to heave it but the ball was outside off and the bat, nowhere near
Yorker on off, takes the front leg out the way and tried to thrash it. Got it off the bottom to mid-off

Nails the yorker on middle, the batter made room and swung through. It hit the bottom of the bat and went to the edge of the legside. Arshdeep tried to kick it after coming in as the batters ran through but missed
Very low full toss outside off, takes the front leg out the way again and drives it off the horizontal bat to long-off
Makes room and swings through again, it was close to a yorker angling in on the stumps. Takes the base of the bat and goes to mid-off for one
Makes room and agriculturally harvests a swing, connects with the full-ball outside off from the bottom. The ball goes to long-on and they run two. But it looks like a short-run at the striker's end.
Drills a cover drive off a yorker on the stumps. Mohsin made room and managed to get below the ball and thrash it in the gap through cover
bouncer over middle at 134 kph, ducked under.
Length ball follows the batter, it swung very late. Mayank tried to ride the bounce with a cut while on the move but it swung in sharply after beating the bat. QDK could not get to it
short on fifth stump, leans back again to cut but picks out backward point.
good length ball on middle, defended behind point.
fullish length ball angled across fifth stump, fiddles at this and is beaten.
back of a length angled across fourth stump at 135 kph, beats Mayank again poking away from his body.
good length ball angled across fourth stump at 135 kph, beats Shikhar prodding inside the line.
back of a length speared into the hips defeating Shikhar's walk down the pitch trying to flick through the leg side.
fullish length speared down the leg side for an extra.
good length ball at 143 kph angled across seventh stump, left alone.
back of a length angled across seventh stump at 138 kph, left alone.
back of a length on sixth stump, goes to cut this 139 kph delivery and misses.
back of a length on the hips, flicked through square leg for one.
back of a length on fifth stump, guided with soft hands to deep third man for one.
back of a length on fifth stump, guided to deep third man again.
back of a length on off stump, guided through point for one.
spectacular shot! Full on fourth stump, aiming for yorker and Mayank backs away seizing on the length being fractionally off and scythes this over the point rope.
slower ball back of a length on middle, goes back to flick through midwicket for two.
another bit of flair from Mayank! Short ball on off stump, leans back to uppercut this over the keeper and slip to the third man rope.
short on the stumps at 128 kph, goes to pull and flicks this behind square for one.
back of a length on the hips at 126 kph, flicked through square leg for one.
short and wide, slashes this over point to the sweeper in place for one.
length ball on the hips at 129 kph, sits up for Mayank to shuffle, swivel and yank behind square to the rope past fine leg up in the ring.
back of a length on off at 129 kph, tap and run into cover for one.
slower ball lands short angled across fifth stump, balloons over an attempted cut by Dhawan.
hello! Rude greeting by Mayank to a half-volley on sixth stump, Mayank opens the face trying to drive over point, it flies flat over short third man and screams into the LCD ad boards over the rope.

good length ball on the pads, goes to flick to the leg side and a leading edge balloons just short of short third man. Weak effort from the fielder. Could have put in a dive but stayed upright and let it bounce in front of him.
short and wide, cuts this straight to backward point.

in the slot on middle stump, Mayank backs away looking to flay this 143 kph delivery over mid-off, he middles this drive but doesn't quite get the desired elevation. KL Rahul shuffles left and puts in a supremely athletic catch with a bunny hop reaching above his head going left to snaffle it.
good length ball on the legs, defended to midwicket.
back of a length on fifth stump, tap and run into the covers for one.
edge! Just eludes slip! Good length ball in the fourth/fifth stump channel, goes to cut and is cramped for room, edge goes just wide of slip to the third man rope.
fullish length ball on fifth stump at 133 kph, smashed on the up but picks out extra cover.
back of a length on fifth stump, guided with soft hands and an open face to deep third man for one.
back of a length into the ribs, goes back to tap this behind square for one.
short and wide on seventh stump, cuts this to cover.
length ball on sixth stump, cross bat swat through mid-off to the rope to end the Powerplay.
full on fourth stump, prodded to extra cover.
full on fifth stump, punched back to the bowler.

hmmm.... not a shot Shikhar will be posting on his Instagram stories later tonight... Bishnoi floats this very full, almost yorker length on middle stump. Way too full for Shikhar's attempted sweep shot, plays over the top of this and is bowled.
full on off, prodded back to Bishnoi, slight fumble but not enough to allow a run.
nearly a wicket at extra cover! Rajapaksa charges a full ball sliding across sixth stump, has the room to free his arms slamming a drive just clearing extra cover inside the ring leaping in vain.
short on sixth stump this time, guides this with an open face wide of slip and wide enough of backward point to pinch a run.
back of a length sliding down leg, wide called.
good length ball on middle, goes back to flick through square leg.
good length ball on middle and off, flicked into midwicket for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, flicked through long-on for one.
full on the stumps, sweeps this through square leg for one.
good length ball on off stump, goes to sweep but the length is wrong for the shot, top edge swirls over fine leg into no man's land for two before being collected by deep square leg.

Rajapaksa got away with a close shave on the previous ball but not this time! Back of a length on fourth stump, tries to casually flick this across the line into midwicket but it keeps skidding straight rather than turning into the body. A leading edge balloons over cover and KL Rahul charges in 20 yards from backward point to take this in stride at rib height reaching well in front of his body. Just got there in time to not have to get his uniform dirty with a dive.
back of a length skidding into the pads, can't flick it away.
back of a length skidding down leg side, beats a flick and wide is called.
full on fifth stump, prods at this and its a googly that barely clips the inside edge to go through fine leg for one... And the alarm goes off to collar Bishnoi for a criminal overstep!
googly again on middle stump, wild heave from Livingston catches air as the ball rips out leg stump, but no harm no foul on the free hit.
full on the stumps, punched to long-on for one.
full on the legs, goes to flick and keeps sliding down leg for another wide.
back of a length on off, goes back to flick through square leg for one.
quicker ball at 102 kph lands full on off, driven back to Bishnoi.
good length ball on fifth stump, pushed gently into cover for one.
full on off, punched out to extra cover.
full on middle, defended back to Krunal.
back of a length on off, hustles him onto the back foot and defended to Krunal's right fielded in front of the non-striker.
short on fifth stump, driven to long-off for one.
good length ball on the pads, misses the flick and comes off the legs behind square for an extra.
back of a length on fifth stump, cuts behind point, diving stop by Stoinis to deny a run.
full on fifth stump, shuffles across to flick through midwicket for one.
flighted full on fifth stump, charge from Livingstone and cranks this high over long-off beyond the LSG dugout to get out of the scoring rut.

the raging bull is on the charge again! Googly flighted too straight on middle and leg, Livingstone picks it and swings with the turn into the body sending this high and very deep over the long-on rope.
back of a length on the stumps, flicked through square leg for one.
overpitched on seventh stump, width for Bairstow to smoke a drive through the covers beating the sweeper easily to the rope.
drags the length back and gets it straighter on off stump to force Bairstow into a defensive block back to Bishnoi.
full on off, punched firmly down the ground for one to long-off.
full on off, defended to extra cover.
flighted full on off, sweeps this flat along the turf to deep square leg.
back of a length on off, defended to extra cover.
back of a length on sixth stump, guided behind point for one.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended behind point.

Livingstone trades power for finesse and pays the price! Shuffles across his stumps looking for a cute flick over the keeper and fine leg. He gets all the way across almost onto the wide guideline trying to flick this slower ball off a good length on eighth stump, the timing is off and a healthy but gentle connection off the open face of the bat goes through to de Kock at thigh height.
short of a length on fifth stump, guided to deep third man for one.
back of a length on off, defended to the off side.
full on fifth stump, punched into mid-off for a tight run.
bouncer clears Sharma with ease leaning back from off stump. Wide called on height.
short ball on fifth stump, opens the face trying to run this wide of third man but picks out the fielder on the ring.
back of a length on off, goes back to tap and run into midwicket for one.
full on the stumps, defended down the pitch.

arm ball skids onto middle stump as Sharma prods forward. Was it pad first or bat first? Big lbw shout denied as there's a double noise. LSG finally go for the review. Definitely pad first on the replays. Sharma is in trouble. Ball-tracking sure enough shows three reds. Decision overturned.
full on the stumps, defended.
good length ball on middle and leg, blocked out again.
full on off, prods behind point looking for a run to get off the mark but Bairstow is anchored to the non-striker's crease and sends him back.
good length arm ball skids on from fifth stump, Dhawan opens the face trying to run this fine past the keeper and nearly edges it into de Kock's gloves.

googly spins past the forward prod and hits Bairstow in front of middle and leg stump. LBW shout upheld. Bairstow reviews immediately. Live this looked like it was sliding well down leg. And indeed the ball-tracking shows the ball was missing leg stump. Second decision overturned in a matter of minutes.
full on the wide guideline, Bairstow charges and slams a drive past Bishnoi to the long-off rope.
flights this more but strays on the legs, Bairstow comes forward again and flicks to deep backward square for two.
edge! No slip and goes to the third man rope! Bishnoi skids this ball short and flat on fifth stump, a cut shot by Bairstow flies fine off the edge and beats short third man on the ring.
full on middle, charges again to flick through midwicket for one.
full on the stumps, charge again but can't flick this away cleanly.
short on the body, goes to pull and misses off the thigh guard, carom to the off side for none.

full and wide at 141 kph, slashes this to Krunal at deep third man where a very sharp catch is taken lunging forward! This didn't get more than 20 feet off the ground, it was screaming flat and fast. Usually a team's weakest catching fielders are at fine leg and third man but Krunal judges this like an elite fielder and has soft enough hands on his lunge forward from five yards off the rope to ensure he holds on with ease at knee height. It might not look like a great catch but that's only because he made it look so easy and casual but it was a superb technical display from Krunal.
length ball on middle, heaves for midwicket and a thick edge flies over point for one.
short and wide on seventh stump, goes to cut and misses.
short ball on fifth stump, goes to pull and is beaten for pace.
wide yorker on the guideline, scuffed out through point for one.
goes for yorker but sprays this down the leg side for a wide.
length ball on sixth stump, Dhawan tries to smash this on the up but continues to struggle for timing and misses everything.
length ball on the stumps, heaves this and finally makes contact out of the middle over wide long-on, one bounce over the rope.
back to the swings and misses... length ball on fourth stump, swat across the line fails to connect and is lucky not to be bowled.
short and wide, cuts this to the point sweeper for one.
full and wide yorker on seventh stump beats Rabada backing away trying to drive through cover.
half-volley on sixth stump, Rabada drives hard but can't get it past mid-off on the ring who dives to keep it to one.
slower bouncer over middle, Rabada backs away but is through his shot early.

short and wide, slaps this high toward the cover sweeper. It floats gently toward Badoni who settles 10 yards in from the rope and takes a casual catch at chest height swiveling his hips sideways to take it with palms facing into the torso.
back of a length on fifth stump, goes to swat this and misses.
length ball on off stump, heaved over midwicket past the leaping fielder and goes to the rope.
short ball over the stumps beats a pull, wide called on height.
back of a length on middle at 126 kph, goes to heave and the timing is thrown off by the change of pace.

slower ball at 127 kph on middle, clears the front leg to heave but top edges this to deep midwicket. Badoni remains on that side of the ground for the right-handers and runs in 15 yards before tumbling to his left for another sharp catch, holding on while falling to the turf.
length ball on fourth stump, wild heave for midwicket catches nothing but air.

wide yorker attempted, Dhawan shuffles across to get in line with this on the wide guideline and shovels this 141 kph delivery sharply over extra cover and with mid-off up in the rope it's an easy four.
slower ball on a good length on sixth stump, Dhawan way out in front.
back of a length on sixth stump, flubs a shot into the covers for one.
bouncer over the stumps, wide called on height.
offcutter on fifth stump continues breaking across right and past an attempted back foot punch.
length ball across fourth stump, Arshdeep shuffles across trying to scoop this over the keeper and misses.
one down, five to go! Wristy flick sails over long-on! The crowd is unmoved.... Length slower ball on sixth stump, holds his hands back to flick this over the rope.
goes for wide yorker, not full enough from Avesh and slams this drive back past Avesh's head and to the long-off rope.
Finch advances at Mustafizur who finds some inswing but it veers down the leg side for a first-ball wide
much fuller and slanting across off from over the wicket, Finch wafts and misses outside off

another inswinger from Mustafizur. Finch shimmies out once again, misses the inside edge and pings the pad. Not given out. This seems close, but DC decide against a review. The tracker returns umpire's call on height
Finch shimmies out once again and slices to short third man
just short of a good length and sliding across off, tip and run square on the off side
full and hung up wide of off, Venkatesh does not bite. Left alone
pitched up and swings away outside off, draws a flat-footed drive from Venkatesh, but he can't get the outside edge past the reach of wide slip
Finch shimmies out to Sakariya as well, ekes out an inside-edge onto the front pad
Dropped by Rovman Powell in the deep. He runs across to his left from deep square, slides, and shells it. Down the track and slogged in the air. Not middled but Finch gets away
Sakariya castles Finch next ball. Nice and full, hint of inswing against the angle, clattering into off stump. Finch swings for the hills once again, he does not touch the ball this time
another inswinger against the angle from Sakariya, kisses the pad and trickles away to the leg side. But this is heading down the leg side
back of a length and holds its line outside off, stabbed away between point and covers from the crease
lifter angled across off, Shreyas yanks his head out of the way rather belatedly
shortish and angling across off, punched away to deep backward point
pitched up and outside off, driven through the line to the right of Powell at sweeper
back of a length and ducks back into the hips, more work for Powell, this time at deep square leg for the left-handed Iyer
down the track and carved away between point and covers
another pitched-up delivery outside off, Iyer lays into it. Laces it through the covers, no chance for Powell at sweeper
Shreyas sits back for the short, wide offering. He cracks a cut to the left of sweeper cover. The ball continues to follow Powell
slower ball on a back of a length, 109ks, Venkatesh delays his punch and hits it to short cover
another slower ball from Sakariya, cuts into Venkatesh, wafted back to the bowler. Venkatesh gesticulates that it was the cutter once again
on-pace length ball, sliding into middle, dragged to mid-on off the inner half as Venkatesh gets off the strike
The continues to follow Powell, like I had said earlier. Full on the pads, whipped away to deep square leg
on the pads, Venkatesh can't put this away, which tells you something about his form or lack thereof. He crosses over for a leg-bye
another little cutter from Sakariya, Shreyas waits for the ball to arrive, then dinks a single behind point
pushed through outside off, taped to the covers, they take on Powell's arm for a tight single
down the track and jabbed back to Axar
pushed through on the pads with fine leg inside the circle. Venkatesh drops down to one knee and sweeps weakly as the ball lobs into the hands of Sakariya. Venkatesh's poor run this IPL continues
looped up and outside off, guided through the covers, the ball bursts through the hands of the infielder
flighted and turns away outside off, whisked away more or less straight to cover
darted into the hips, whipped away to deep midwicket
yorker dips at middle stump, squirted out to the leg side
sharp inswinger from a fuller length, Indrajith plays back, plays for the angle and watches the inside edge dribble past leg stump
good length and swings back in at middle, Indrajith reads the swing now and plays it back to Sakariya
signs of nerves? Almost a half-volley on the pads, Indrajith can't put it away. Brushes the pad and rolls into the leg side. Indrajith searches for the leg-bye but is sent back
pitched-up delivery outside off, Indrajith opens the bat-face and carves a single to sweeper cover. He will breathe easy at the other end
shortish and ducks back in at the top of off, Shreyas responds with a back-foot force through the covers
fullish and drifts in at a fourth-stump line, dinked into the covers
tossed up and outside off, here comes Indrajith: down the track and driven down to long-off
shorter and turns away outside off, slapped away to point
shortish and outside off, Shreyas manufactures additional room and cracks it away to sweeper cover
back of a length and skidding in just a shade outside off, Indrajith jumps back and punches it away to the left of Shaw at short-cover
slower, shorter, an angling into off, whipped away through the vacant spaces at midwicket
starts off with what might have been a googly, shortish and turns away outside off, chopped away to sweeper cover

The ball continues to follow Powell - he catches it at long-on. Stock ball from Kuldeep, Indrajith jumps out of the crease, gets too close to the pitch of the ball and does not get enough elevation to clear the outfielder. Sliced to Powell. Second-ball wicket for Kuldeep vs his former franchise

big appeal for lbw from Kuldeep, and umpire Pathak raises his finger. Was this wrong'un heading down the leg side? Narine thinks so and asks for a review. Nice and full, breaks back in. Narine plays back for it. The ball misses the inside edge and pings the pad in line. Ball-tracking suggests that it would have crashed into leg stump. Two in two for Kuldeep as Narine bags a golden duck
lobbed up on off stump, Rana averts the hat-trick. He stretches out and smothers it
tickled off the pads behind square on the leg side, another googly from Kuldeep
tossed up on off stump, shovelled away between deep midwicket and wide long-on
short and outside off, Shreyas leans back and cracks it away in the gap between point and short third man. Top-notch back-foot cut
much fuller and sliding into middle and leg, knocked into the midwicket region
clipped off the pads to the right of short fine leg
dangled up outside off, Shreyas gets closer to the pitch and bunts a single down to long-off
good length on middle and leg, punched away wide of Powell at long-on
arm ball from Axar, keeps snaking into middle and leg, Shreyas whips it away between deep midwicket and wide long-on
full and sliding across off from left-arm over, pushed down to long-off
First boundary by a KKR batter not named Shreyas Iyer, in the 10th over. Tossed up on middle, he dares to paddle-sweep from the stumps and places it fine of long leg
hoicked away between deep midwicket and wide long-on for a couple of runs
Rana drops down to one knee once again, this time he splices a sweep in front of deep square leg
stock ball from Kuldeep, dips at off stump, tip and run to cover
stock ball from Kuldeep, leaves Rana, who whips it away through midwicket off the back foot
worked off the pads through the leg side
just short of a good length and outside off, Shreyas closes the bat-face and turns it to short midwicket
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Shreyas punches off the back foot and finds point
short and angling into the body, but not short enough to bother Shreyas, whip-pulled away to deep square leg
pitched-up delivery outside off, driven through the line to deep cover
slower bouncer outside off from Thakur, sails over the head of Shreyas. Wide called
Shreyas gets inside the line of this short ball angling into him and pulls it confidently through backward square leg. There's protection in the deep
Shreyas goes inside-out and pings the cover boundary. Pushed through on off and middle, Shreyas backs away, manufactures swinging room and hits over the top
darted outside off, drilled along the ground to sweeper cover this time
whipped away through midwicket off the back foot
slapped away between short third man and point. Dropped short and outside off, Shreyas rocks back and picks the gap smartly
much fuller and sliding into off stump, forward and blocked to the covers
Shreyas backs away, Axar sports it and darts it very wide of off. Shreyas Iyer still reaches out and slices a single
spears a low full-toss outside off, which is hit down to long-off
slog-swept over wide long-on boundary for a six. Pushed through on the stumps, too full, Rana gets underneath it and powers it over the leg side for the first six of the night
Rana backs away, Lalit follows him, hits the inside edge, the ball rolls to short fine leg
fired outside off, belted through the line to sweeper cover
hard-length delivery on middle at 95ks, Rana dares to cut from the stumps and ends up chopping the ball through the cover-point region
wide of the crease, on a length and angling into middle and leg, clipped away through the midwicket region

Pant thinks he has his man. Umpire Pathak refers it to the TV umpire. Kuldeep snatches the bottom edge, but did Pant take it cleanly behind the stumps? Pant sticks his right hand out and takes a low, shin-high catch. Indeed, that is a fair catch and Shreyas has to go. Wrong'un from Kuldeep, he drags it shorter and wider of off. Shreyas searches for a cut and bottom-edges it behind
tossed up on middle, Russell is forward to block this stock ball on middle
pushed through outside off, zips past the bat

Kuldeep continues to smash his former franchise. He ventures wide of the crease, dangled up and turns in from outside off. Russell advances at him, swings and misses. Pant does not collect the ball cleanly and fumbles but manages to break the stumps, with the ball disturbing the timber after bursting out of the gloves. Lucky rebound for Pant and DC
dropped short and turns away outside off, slapped off the back foot to sweeper cover
pitched-up delivery outside off, driven with a slicing finish to sweeper cover
tucked off the pads to the right of short fine leg
wide of the crease, shortish and keeps a bit low outside off, stabbed back to Lalit on the bounce
starts on middle and off and turns, prodded into the off side
back of a length and angling into the hips, whipped to deep midwicket
short and drifts away outside off, cracked off the back foot to sweeper cover
another weak little prod, this time to the leg side for a scampered single
Rinku rides the bounce of this short ball outside off, uses the pace of Sakariya and glides it away past third man for four
back of a length and angling into the hips, tucked away to deep midwicket
short and angling across off stump, from left-arm around the wicket, Rinku or rather Rana leaps and carves an upper-cut fine of Kuldeep at deep third man. The last one was hit square of Kuldeep
back of a length on middle, dinked wide of point
overpitched and outside off, drilled into the covers, where Shaw fumbles and gives up a single
slower cutter on the pads, deflected away to short fine leg
flat and fired on middle, push-driven down to long-off
short and outside off, heaved away to deep midwicket
beamer wide of off, which is walloped over the off side for six. Full-toss that sails over the waist outside off, Rana still manages to launch it over point for six
darted full and outside off, Rana can't quite get underneath the length, squeezed away to point
short and wide of off, slashed away to deep backward point
slot ball - wide half-volley - Rana gets underneath it and crunnnnnnches it over point for a flat six
slower from Lalit, on a length and angling in to beat Rana on the sweep and strike the pad, but this seems to be heading down the leg side. 17 runs off the 17th over
full and outside off, driven with an open face to sweeper cover
Rana shuffles across off stump for the scoop, but Mustafizur bowls a slower offcutter. He top-edges it onto his helmet and falls over to the off side
wide of the crease, full and outside off, Rana slashes an does not make contact
slower ball dips outside off, but it comes out too full. Rana delays the drive and caves this back-of-the-hand slower ball to the left of deep point
on-pace yorker on middle, Rana shapes for the ramp, but can only get it to point off the toe end of the bat
on-pace ball, overpitched and outside off. Rinku gets underneath the length and opens the bat-face to drive this past point for four
Thakur searches for the wide yorker but misses his length. Too full and outside off, Rana sends it skimming over the covers for six. Rana brings up a 30-ball half-century in grand style
Rana shuffles across for the scoop, Thakur goes for the wide yorker once again, and ends up pushing it past the tramline. Off-side wide
acceptable yorker on off stump, squirted down to long-on
knuckle ball outside off? Hauled away to wide long-on

on-the-stumps yorker, shuffles across off, does not connect well with the scoop, tickles it past Mustafizur at short fine leg. Sloppy effort from Mustafizur. Rinku is more than halfway down the pitch for the single. Terrible mix-up, but DC can't capitalise on KKR's error
slot ball. Pitched up and outside off, heaved away past Thakur, straight of long-on, for four
acceptable yorker, which is squeezed down to long-on. Rinku tears across for the second. Lazy work from Powell in the deep
back-of-the-hand slower ball outside off, dragged to deep midwicket off the inside half

The ball has followed Powell this evening. He snags this catch running to his right from long-off. Just short of a yorker length on off stump, Rinku still can't get underneath it. Carves it in the air an Powell does the rest in the outfield
on-pace yorker from Mustafizur, thumps the pad. Not given out lbw by umpire Pathak. This is pitching outside leg. Pant still calls for a review and the on-field not-out call stays

Top catch from Sakariya running in from sweeper cover and diving forward to collect a low catch. Rana waits as they refer it to the TV umpire. It's a fair catch from Sakariya. Rana has to exit, he exchanges a few words with Pant while doing so. Misses the wide yorker, sliced in the air over the off side. Terrific effort from Sakariya
on-pace yorker from Mustafizur, knocks over the leg stump. Southee swings and misses. The ball dips and crashes into the leg stump
fairly acceptable wide yorker. Rana, the debutant, can't touch it. Outstanding last over from Mustafizur: three wickets and just two runs off it

athletic return catch first ball! Fullish length ball on leg stump, really a half-volley, but Shaw is through his flick too early and a leading edge floats low to Umesh's left at knee height and he shifts left in his follow-through before diving forward to pluck this with supreme grace.

edge doesn't carry to slip! On a good length in the fourth stump channel at 138 kph, Marsh prods flat-footed but with soft enough hands that it short hops slip and goes between keeper and slip to the rope.
good length ball on off stump at 137 kph, defended to mid-on.
good length ball on middle and leg at 137 kph, defended to mid-on again.
fullish length on fifth stump, shovels this high over extra cover and is slapped back just before the rope to keep it to three.
short and wide on sixth stump, crunched off the back foot with a punch through cover and sizzles to the rope.
fullish length on off at 136 kph, Marsh swings big but with a straight bat through the line and skies this over mid-on before it plops short of the rope for two.
half-volley on middle and off stump at 144 kph, punched much more flat over mid-on this time and bounces twice before going over the rope.

sharp catch at deep backward square! And what a scalp to get for your maiden IPL wicket on debut! A bit of luck definitely involved though. Leg stump half-volley at 141 kph, Marsh goes for another heave over mid-on but it clips the inside edge and flies flat and fast to deep backward square. Venkatesh Iyer judges it very well, comes off the rope five yards and takes a comfortable catch crouching at thigh height. That was not easy, probably 7 out of 10 in difficulty with the pace it had coming on the ball, but he made it look like it was never in doubt.
good length ball on the stumps, goes to drive and an inside edge comes off the pads.
short and wide, cuts this firmly but straight to. backward point.
short ball on sixth stump, Lalit aborts the pull halfway through the shot and winds up gently tapping it back to Harshit.
fullish length ball on off at 138 kph, defended to the off side.
good length ball on the stumps, defended back to Umesh.
fullish length swinging into Warner's legs at 142 kph, late on a flick and dribbles off the pads toward fine leg for an extra.
back of a length on fourth stump at 142 kph, takes a step forward and whips this through wide mid-on, chased down by Russell to keep it to three.
back of a length on middle, just a short arm jab pull through midwicket and it flies off the bat to the midwicket rope.
fullish length on fourth stump, Warner goes back to guide this behind point, mishits this into the ground but they take the run anyway.
overpitched on sixth stump, Warner shovels this high over mid-off to the rope.
Southee drags the length back on fifth stump at 130 kph, defended to point.
length ball on fourth stump at 133 kph, Warner slaps this through wide mid-on and it races along the ground to the rope.
back of a length on fifth stump, tapped with soft hands behind point for one.
back of a length on leg stump at 131 kph, Lalit flicks across the line, inside edge into the pads caroms to point.
back of a length on the legs, goes to flick and misses off the thigh guard, dribbles behind square leg for an extra.
good length ball on middle stump rips across into the pads, misses the flick and the ball dribbles in front of Lalit.
good length ball skids straight on toward off stump, goes back to cut and picks out backward point.
flighted a touch full on middle, Lalit reaches forward to sweep on the length and middles this to deep backward square for one.
flighted full and drifts down leg past Warner's attempted sweep.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended to cover.
Narine darts this in quicker at 95 kph on a good length on off, defended to midwicket.

nearly a wicket at deep midwicket! Flights this more on off at 91 kph, Warner slog sweeps this and a top edge flies out to the leg side. Shreyas Iyer at deep square leg charges 30 yards to his right but winds up about a foot short leaping for the ball. It lands just beyond him and bounces over the rope. Warner would've had heart in mouth there for a few moments. Even if Shreyas had caught it, there's a high probability his body momentum would have taken him into the rope unless he flicked it back into play.
short on the stumps, pulled flat to deep square leg for one.
fullish length on off, prodded to mid-off for one.

dropped at mid-on! Short on fifth stump, Lalit slams this flat to Finch on the ring, who is slow reacting to this before lunging forward late, it carried to him at ankle height but burst through his hands. Because he lunged forward late, he was moving forward with very hard hands and made it much more difficult. Had Finch judged it earlier, he may have been able to take it easier at knee height and cushion it better.
back of a length on fourth stump, goes back and slices this fine to short third man on the ring, knocked down to keep it to one.
short on sixth stump, goes for a cross bat whack and misses.
back of a length on middle, flicked through midwicket for one.
good length ball on fifth stump, punches this off the back foot to extra cover.
good length ball on middle and leg, flicked behind square for one.
fullish length ball on middle darted in quick at 98 kph, Warner shuffles across and paddle flicks this past the keeper through fine leg to the rope.
back of a length on the hips, goes back to flick to deep fine leg for one.
fullish length ball on middle, goes to paddle sweep this through fine leg for one.
fullish length on off, prodded behind point for one.
back of a length on off, leans back to guide this behind point for one.
back of a length on fifth stump at 139 kph, punched through cover for one.
short ball on off stump, awkward half-pull wristily flicked off the toe through square leg for one.

neck high full toss on fifth stump, Lalit unflinchingly uppercuts this over third man for six! Almost a carbon copy from a first innings beamer that disappeared to the same place, timed well enough to clear the man stationed there on the rope.
length ball on sixth stump at 133 kph, Lalit goes for a wild heave on the free hit and misses badly.
fullish length on middle and off, punched gently to mid-off for one.
full on fourth stump at 141 kph, prodded into extra cover for none.
yuck! Starts off with a sloppy half-tracker on the legs, Lalit goes back to smack this through square leg to the rope.
double yuck... but this time gets away with it. Even worse delivery yanked halfway down the track and well outside leg, middles a pull to deep backward square for one.

length ball on off, Warner slaps this on the up just wide of Rana diving left on his follow-through near the non-striker and it goes past him to the rope. Actually it went underneath his left hand. He reached over the ball. Technically a chance despite not getting a hand to it.
floats this short and wide, Warner spanks a cut through cover and beats the sweeper to the rope.
Rana is barfing all over the pitch this over. This time a thigh high full toss that Warner politely regurgitates through mid-on for just one.
extremely full outside leg, could easily have been flicked away for four through fine leg but mishits this off the pads.
back of a length on fifth stump at 139 kph, cuts this behind point for one.
short ball cramps up Lalit on the body at 132 kph, misses a pull off the gloves and it dribbles behind square for one.

bounced out at deep fine leg! Almost got Lalit with the ploy on the previous ball. This time he makes Warner uncomfortable with a bumper on middle that forces Warner to turn his head away while playing an uncontrolled hook that sails flat to Narine at head height two yards in from the rope. He shuffles back a step to take this at rib height with ease with palms facing into the torso. .
back of a length on middle at 139 kph, defended to mid-on.
short on fifth stump at 132 kph, pulls this flat to deep backward square for one.
back of a length on fifth stump at 132 kph, defended to extra cover.
full on off, defended to cover.
full on the stumps, sweeps this to deep fine leg for one.
good length ball darted into the legs, can't flick it away.
short and wide, slaps this straight to backward point.
back of a length on fifth stump, punched to extra cover.

fullish length on middle, prods forward and looked like an inside edge but a big appeal is upheld. Maybe not an inside edge though because Lalit curiously chooses to walk off rather than go for DRS. Indeed replays show he prodded down the wrong line on off stump as it turned past to hit him in line with middle. Still he was stretching a long way forward and the ball was turning sharply that it may have missed leg stump. Worth a review when you have two left but instead Lalit is on his way.
in the channel on sixth stump at 140 kph, Pant plays loosely well away from his body with no footwork and feathers a thin edge through to the keeper.
short ball on middle, defended after hopping on his toes.
short on the stumps at 133 kph, pulled flat to deep backward square for one.
short on off at 144 kph, guided with soft hands to deep third man for one.
good length ball on the stumps, goes to defend and flicks it through square leg for one.
good length ball on middle, defended to midwicket for one.
fullish length on middle and off, punched to long-off for one.
short and wide, sliced to deep third man for one.
back of a length on off, defended to extra cover.
short on the body, pulls this fiercely and picks the gap between deep fine leg and deep backward square to the rope, beating the effort of Umesh diving in vain.
full on off, driven firmly but straight to extra cover.
full on fifth stump, miscues this drive aiming for cover instead going off the toe through midwicket.
good length ball on off, defended.
fullish length ball on sixth stump, driven firmly but straight to extra cover.
short on fifth stump, goes to pull firmly through square leg for one.
short on fifth stump, miscues a pull off the toe that flutters well short of long-on for one.
good length ball on the legs, flicked behind square for one.
full outside off, driven firmly along the turf to long-off for one.
short on off at 131 kph, sits up for Axar to smash over wide long-on to the rope.

Dre Russ bangs this in very short on sixth stump at 133 kph, Axar bangs this even harder with an uppercut over third man for six! Too much width to trouble Axar at all, frees the arms and flays it over the rope behind square on the off side.
length ball on fourth stump, goes to hack this cross batted and an inside edge goes past the stumps through fine leg for two.
short on fifth stump, gets on his toes to pull this and drags it into the ground to mid-on.
full outside leg at 129 kph, whipped away through square leg for one.

Laser of a relay from deep midwicket catches Axar short coming back for the second! Knee high full toss on the legs, flicked casually through midwicket, Shreyas charges hard off the rope and unleashes a howitzer to the non-striker's end where Venkatesh Iyer covering the stumps collects on one bounce and breaks the stumps with Axar's dive a half-yard short.
good length ball on the stumps, defended.
short and wide, cuts this through point to the sweeper for one.
good length ball on the stumps, defended.
fu8ll on fourth stump, reaches across to paddle sweep this through fine leg for two.
good length ball on sixth stump prodded into the covers for one.
good length ball on off stump, defended back to Narine.
fullish length ball on middle, not full enough going for yorker and winds up as a half-volley creamed back down the ground over the long-on rope.
full and wide searching for the wide yorker, Powell slices a drive flat toward deep point, fielded on a bounce.

goes for yorker but it's a low full toss well outside leg stump, probably five wides if he leaves it alone, instead it is a miscued slap that balloons high over midwicket, no fielder in the ring on the leg side so it plops down safely inside the ring for one. Ugly cricket all around.
slower bouncer on middle, Powell struggles to keep the hands back and top edges this very fine but gets it wide enough of the keeper to go to the fine leg rope.
full on the stumps, flicked in the air through midwicket for one.
fullish length on fourth stump, flicked to long-on for one.
back of a length on fifth stump, goes back to punch wide of the cover sweeper for two.
length ball on fourth stump at 133 kph, goes to pull and it skids a touch low under the shot.
good length ball on the legs, flicked through the leg side behind square for one.
slaughtered over square leg! Length ball on middle, sits up for Powell to muscle a pull flat over the rope on the leg side banging into the covered tarp on the first tier.
fullish length ball down the leg side, will have to rebel it.
good length ball on middle, casually flicked behind square for one.
good length ball on the legs, flicked through the leg side for one.
full and wide, driven straight to extra cover.
full on the legs, flicked to midwicket.
good length ball on fifth stump, sliced straight to backward point.
full on the legs, flicked to midwicket.
good length ball on fourth stump, leans back to cut this in front of point for one.
Powell has enough of the foolishness and ends it with one blow! Flighted full on middle, clears the front leg and annihilates this over long-on.
oh a beauty. On a good length, seams away against the angle, squares him up, but doesn't get the edge
oh this one seams the other way. Also late swing. Lands on middle and and then seams further in to keep going away from the keeper for five wides
moving in again, Abhishek clios this off the pads, but can't get it past the ring
Shami stays on a length, but corrects the line to outside off this time. Played with an open face towards point
a lovely delivery again. Just slightly short of a length, you have to play the angle, and then the ball pitches and leaves him to open him up and miss the edge
and again he follows that beauty up with five leg-side wides. Again, late swing in towards middle and then exaggerated seam movement down the leg side
first run off the bat in a score of 11 for 0. Opens the face to get a single to third man
half a shout as this seams in from a length just outside off, but Williamson has got an inside edge on it
some shape first ball, Abhishek opens the face for a single
heave-ho to a wide length ball, and he is beaten on the outside edge as this one goes with the angle
late swing on a really full ball, Williamson jams his bat down on it and gets an inside edge for a single
short of a length, width, and punched away square, in front of point, where a bad bounce does the diving fielder in
another wide down the leg side
gets the width and languidly lofts this over covers. Doesn't get a stride in, just extends his arms through a wide length ball
wider, fuller, but this time Abhishek leaves it alone
looks like this is straying down leg, but then it pitches and holds its line. Williamson makes the late decision to defend this back to Shami
this time Shami does stray down the leg side, and Williamson clips it in the air over square leg for four
on a length, just outside off, Williamson dabs down on it, but can't get it past point
nearly played on. Short of a length, angling in, he looks to run it down to third man, but gets a bottom edge, which bounces in front of the wicket and then over it

lovely bowling. Seam movement. Too good. Might be good enough for a wicket in Tests. Slightly fuller than good length, Williamson looks to play it down the ground, but it seams through the gate to castle him
headed for top of off, Tripathi has no room to work with, and defends with an open face
hurries him up with the bouncer, but he is lucky it doesn't jump up in the air and goes right down for a single
Tripathi jumps out of the crease, Dayal shortens the length, he still swings hard, gets a front edge to mid-off

dropped by Rashid at point. Wide length ball, Tripathi looks to go over cover, but mis-hits it high towards point. Rashid seems to have gone early for it. High to his left. It just doesn't sit in the hand
again done in by the bounce, but again the top edge lands safely for one
looks to work this to leg but gets a thick leading edge towards third man for one
Dayal keeps digging it in for Abhishek. He manages to pull it down this time, but can't beat square leg
and it is doing things for him still. Again slight bit of seam movement from short of a length. Beats him as he looks to open the face for a single
on a length, headed for top of middle, defended back to him
Tripathi won't let Shami just keep bowling it on a good length. He jumps out of the crease, late but quickly, not letting Shami adjust the length, and then goes over cover for a six
sensational batting. Shami bowls early 140s but Tripathi is leaving the crease to cut the seam movement, and lofting him over covers. This time it is flatter, but high enough to clear the in-field
overpitched, and this time Tripathi stands his ground. Looks like a yorker gone wrong, and Tripathi crashes the half-volley through extra cover. All along the ground

half an appeal for an lbw, but this is headed down leg. Hang on, they have reviewed this. They'll be lucky to retain the review. This one has seamed in from a length, and Tripathi is caught defending and on the crease. Oh this originally looked missing leg to me, but the technology shows it is hitting top of leg. Deceptively accurate. Shami has had his own back after the three boundaries. Everyone is lucky I am not the umpire
languid aerial drive. On a length, angling away, room to swing hid arms, and he goes over cover
threads the needle now. He gets the width again, and also a good length that he can drive on the up. He does so, and finds the gap between cover and extra cover. Along the ground this time
effort ball, kicks off a length, beats his outside edge on the drive
easy single into the covers
on a length, just outside off, defended to cover
drives this time but can't beat the man at cover
really full, rught under the bat, dug out
short of a length, pulled to the right of deep midwicket for a couple
slog sweep this time, but just the single to deep midwicket
slightly short of a length, stays low a touch, Markram still manages to play it to deep midwicket for one
on a length, just goes with the angle, worked into the leg side for one
wrong'un, he plays this off the surface, but manages to get into the leg side for a single
short of a length, rising towards the ribs, 143ks, punched to cover
this one is not high enough, Markram plays a lovely back-foot punch through extra cover. Lovely lovely shot. On top of the bounce
slightly fuller, pinched to deep cover for one
short of a length, 147ks, into the ribs, drops it at his feet and comes through for one
short of a length, cramps him up, pushed down to long-on for one
dug in short again, into the ribs, can't find the single this time
really full, middle and leg, driven down to long-off for one
looks like the wrong'un, which he has picked and placed past point for one
another googly, Markram picks it off the surface, but still manages a single through point
a rare loose ball. A long half-volley, and Abhishek has slogged it for a massive six over long-on. Against the turn as this is a googly too. Down on a knee, and the ball is up in the stands
full again, just a touch too full to get under it, driven to long-off for one
legbreak, Markram is not picking them, and is beaten on the outside edge as he stays inside the line this time
short of a length, some width, it is higher than his chest but he has managed to punch this away to deep point. Doesn't bother keeping it down
slower ball, 129ks, on a length, wide, and he opens the face to run this to the left of deep cover for two
short of a length, 144ks, chest high, and he punches it down at the top of the bounce. Gets a single to deep cover. A difficult shot to nail
bouncer, right on the leg stump, 146ks, but just a touch too high. Called wide
short of a length, 146ks, hits his thigh pad, beating him for pace
slower ball, on a length, top of off, played with an open face for one
short of a length, 148ks, but down the leg side. Called wide
slower ball, on a length, wicket to wicket, gets a single off the inside part of the bat
good length ball on the hips, flicked through square leg for two.
back of a length on sixth stump at 149 kph, punched off the back foot through cover for one.
slower ball lands on a good length on off stump, guided with soft hands and an open bat face to deep third man for one.
length ball on sixth stump at 142 kph, Markram tries to muscle this with a flat bat pull through the on side but is hustled for pace and it flutters back past the umpire to mid-on for two.
fullish length on fourth stump at 149 kph, shoveled in the air to Hardik on the ring at mid-off fielded on a bounce and they don't take a run because it's hit so hard.

this is what Markram meant to do two balls ago! Back of a length on fifth stump at 142 kph, Markram smashes a front foot pull that this time sails over wide midwicket into the covered tarp section of the stands on the field level.

hello! And goodbye over deep midwicket! Floated a touch too full on fourth stump, slog sweep comes out and it's clobberin' time bashing this over the fence onto the top of the covered tarp stands on the field level just short of the second tier.
overcorrection from Rashid, drag down half-tracker skids low and is pulled flat along the ground through midwicket for one.
full on off, driven to the cover sweeper along the turf for one.
good length ball on leg stump, backs away to punch this through wide long-off for one.
good length ball on off is a googly prodded away behind point for one.
Abhishek is turning into the human torch in this over! Flighted too full on fourth stump and he flames another slog sweep over deep midwicket to bring up a fantastic half-century!
back of a length angled across fourth stump, defended to the off side.
full on the stumps, punched back to Dayal who knocks it down in his follow-through.
full on the legs, flicked through square leg for one.
slower ball lands full on the legs at 107 kph, tapped gently through midwicket for one.
full pace ball lands full on the legs at 135 kph, flicked through midwicket for one.
full on off, driven firmly but picks out extra cover on the ring for no run.
starts with a slower ball landing on a fullish length on fourth stump, shoveled uppishly through extra cover for one.

bold thinking backfires by the deep midwicket boundary rider! Fullish length on the legs, chips this loosely in the air toward the sub fielder Vijay Shankar, who charges hard but can't cover the ground and it short hops him then bounces past him to the rope.
full on the stumps, tapped away through the ring for one.
somebody check Markram's bat because there may be a hole in it. Attempted slower ball wide yorker goes horribly awry as a knee high full toss on seventh stump, but Markram swings straight through it.
length ball at 148 kph, smoked on the up high over cow corner onto the covered tarp stands on the lower level once again.
slower bouncer at 128 kph outside off, Markram gets on his toes trying to cut but misses.
googly lands frightfully short on fourth stump, punched firmly to long-off and gets away with just a single.
goog length legbreak lands on fourth stump, punched through cover for one.
this time the googly gets punished as it should! Fractionally short on off, Abhishek picks it very early and spanks this over extra cover to the rope.
another googly on a good length on off, this time plays it with soft hands through cover timed softly enough to come back for two.
lands this full and very wide almost on the guideline, swept along the ground through midwicket for one.

googly is landing horribly today for Rashid and this ball once again gets the treatment it deserves over midwicket. Too short on middle, Markram picks it spinning into him, shuffles across and pummels it over midwicket landing inches short of the rope before thudding into the foam triangle.

drag on! Slower ball at 125 kph lands in the slot as a half-volley on off stump, Abhishek goes for a massive heave but the pace throws his timing off and he miscues this off an inside edge into middle and leg stump.
Joseph greets his West Indian teammate with a sharp bouncer that gets Pooran ducking.
full on off at 148 kph, blunted to mid-off and Pooran bolts for a run to get Markram back on strike.
very full on middle, driven to long-on for one.
slower ball at 127 kph lands full on off, prodded into the covers for one.
goes for yorker and winds up sending down a shin high full toss on the pads flicked to deep midwicket for two.
full on the stumps, flicked away square for one.
goes for yorker, winds up bowling a shin high full toss on middle at 142 kph that is punched to long-off for one.

half-volley at 138 kph, Pooran powers it flat to long-on but doesn't get the elevation to clear the man on the rope. Safe catch taken at head height a yard in fro the rope by Shubman Gill. Three wickets now, Sham-wow indeed!

goes for wide yorker, another low full toss on fourth stump at shin height, very clever glide with an open face by Sundar that looks destined for four before Yash Dayal throws his body to the right at short third man to keep it to one.

Rashid's day in the field goes from bad to worse with a horrendous misjudgment at deep midwicket! Short ball banged in by Shami, should be a fourth wicket for him as Markram slams a front foot pull straight to Rashid at deep midwicket, but he charges in rather than staying on the rope only to see the ball sail over his head and land inches beyond the rope. Clear missed chance. Instead of being out, Markram has a half-century.
pitched up on fourth stump at 141 kph, driven firmly to long-off for one.
slower ball lands full on off at 105 kph, Markram keeps the hands back to punch this softly through mid-off for one.
knee high full toss on the legs, flicked through backward square for one.
full outside off, driven wide of Rashid at cover sweeper, who tumbles to stop this and keep it to two.
full and wide, driven firmly to extra cover, diving stop by Hardik on the ring keeps it to one.
yorker on off at 137 kph, jammed out to long-on for one.

slower ball lands on a good length on sixth stump at 106 kph, results in a miscued top-edged swat on a cross bat shot off the toe aiming to go down the ground. David Miller charges in 25 yards off the rope almost to the edge of the 30-yard circle and lunges forward to hold on to a good catch.
good length slower ball slides down leg beating a flick, deflection on the way through from the looks of it lands short of the keeper, but a wide is called.

super athletic effort from Joseph off his own bowling! Length ball into the hips, Sundar beaten for pace trying to swivel pull and belatedly sets off for a leg bye as the ball dribbles in front of square around short leg. Sundar was off balance with his body weight carrying him behind the stumps on the off side to slow his attempt for a run. Joseph charges forward, fields, spins, fires and nabs Sundar a foot short at the non-striker's end with a direct hit.
how about this to get off the mark! Fullish length ball on sixth stump at 150 kph, punched on the up through extra cover and beats the sweeper's diving effort to the rope.
good length ball on the body, flicked into the leg side and they scamper back for two.
back of a length on fifth stump, opens the face to guide this to short third man for one.
bouncer over middle at 146 kph, Jansen leans back to uppercut this over third man but misses.
length ball on middle, leans back to pull over long-on but miscues it well short of long-on for one.
starts with a slower ball that Jansen picks at 123 kph on a good length on fifth stump, Jansen reaches out with his lanky limbs and slaps this over wide long-on over the rope.
full and wide yorker, goes to drive but can't reach this 144 kph delivery.
length ball on the wide guideline at 149 kph, Jansen toe drags a heave wide of the stumps and the ball is cut off by the keeper on a bounce. Tight single pinched.
ka-pow! Another slower ball picked at 130 kph, Shashank goes back and across to bully a pull flat over midwicket.

Shashank can do no wrong! Where has he been all this time?! Lockie gets yorker terribly wrong, Shashank picks the right ball to shuffle across and ramp over fine leg, it winds up as a thigh high full toss that is redirected behind square and goes all the way.
wide length ball, played with an open face to point
outswinger, late swing, beats a tentative forward push from Saha
inswinger now, headed towards top of off, pushed to cover
short of a length, outside off, pushed to mid-on for one
on a length, wicket to wicket, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, some width, but he has a deep point to keep them down to one
on a length, on off, defended back to him
too full, and Saha closes the face and goes in the air over square leg for four. Right in his arc
similar slot length but on the pads this time, and Saha goes harder with the pick-up shot, going well over long leg for a six
pulls the length back, Saha drops this at his feet and they rush through for the single
lovely, on a length, around middle and off, and then seaming away to beat Gill
heavy ball, rising all the time, but down the leg side, and Pooran can't catch up with it
short of a length, worked into the leg side for one
short of a length, slight movement away, beats his attempt at a late-cut
on a length, swinging in, soft hands, takes a single to short cover
Saha gives him the charge, Bhuvneshwar shortens the length, Saha pulls, there is a deep square leg in place, but Tripathi misfields there to turn one into four
looks like the slower ball, on a length, worked away off the pads for one
on a length, outside off, pushed past cover for one
short of a length, into the pads, with fine leg up inside the circle. Saha helps it past that man for four
on a length, middle and leg, worked to leg
lovely shot. Natarajan bowls full, just outside off, and Gill has flicked this wide of mid-on for four. Great use of wrists
on a length, outside off, opens the face, gets a single
slower ball, short of a length, outside off, completely does him in for pace. Saha way too early into the shot
on a length, wicket to wicket, hits the pad, but too high
wide length ball, and Saha chips it over cover, using the field restrictions to perfection. Not great timing but enough to clear the ring
on a length, hits the inner half of the bat as he looks for a single to leg
slower ball, 123ks, on a length, cuts away from just outside off, beats his poke
full, driven hard, but straight to mid-off. They do take the single, though, because the fielder is right at the edge of the circle
Saha has been sensational today. As soon as he gets remotely driveable length, he has been going over the infield. This is on a length, but he goes after it, and deliberately over mid-off
short of a length, pulled to long leg for one
short of a length, into the hip, worked wide of midwicket for one
on a length, middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket for two
moves the line to off, and Gill pushes it to deep cover for one
oh that is poor. Well down the leg side, and Saha just helps it along, fine of short fine leg
Saha gives him the charge, and even though Natarajan shortens the length, Saha pulls him fine of deep square leg for four
yorker, middle and leg, dug out towards long-on for one
Saha's onslaught means Gill has set himself up for a long knock. Defends a length ball to end the powerplay
full, driven to long-off for one
nice drop on this, defended to leg as this is shorter than expected
this one is in the batter's swinging arc, and Gill lofts him over wide long-on for a six. Keeps the head down after he hits
flatter, shorter, Gill looks for a single to leg but can't place it wide of midwicket
short of a length, punched down to long-on
makes room to punch this down to long-off for one
hits the thigh pad, bowled at 144ks, Saha late into this
hurried into the pull, 147ks, gut gets a single wide of midwicket
short of a length, 147ks, punched to midwicket
top of off, 144ks. Gill is looking to make room and use his pace to go over the cover, but Malik keeps his length, keeps his line, and crashes through to the off stump
pace like fire. Malik is at his shoulder at 145ks. Pandya surprised by the pace and bounce, in no position, fends, is hit on the shoulder
152ks, but there is no mid-off as he has the field for the short ball. This is short of a length, and Pandya pushes this through mid-off for four
on a length, outside off, pushed to long-off
into the pads, paddled away, but can't beat fine leg
down the wicket, Washington pulls the length back, punched to long-on for one
some turn, but a touch short, punched to long-off for one
top shot. Saha backs away early, expecting a quick flat delivery, and punches this through extra cover. He has taken this from leg stump
this one grips a little, and hits the inner half of the bat. Goes straight to midwicket
oh that is harsh on Malik. Draws the mis-hit from Pandya, but it not only falls short of mid-on, it also squeezes past him for four

great field placement. The third man is fine, almost a back stop. Malik bowls the bouncer, Pandya is clearly late on it, and the top edge goes to that fine third man. Malik is blowing kisses in the sky. He is on top of the world
what a sublime shot to get off the mark. Umran bangs this in short on fifth stump, Miller just rides the pace and glides this wide of the keeper and third man to the rope.
back of a length on the body, defended to midwicket.
length ball slanted into the body at 144 kph, goes to flick and is late off the body to deep fine leg for an extra.
good length ball on middle at 143 kph, Saha shuffles across to flick to deep fine leg for one.
back of a length ball on middle, goes back to flick through to long-on for one to bring up a half-century off 28 balls. 9th career IPL half-century.
good length ball on off, defended to cover.
back of a length on the legs, flicked wide of short fine leg for one.
short on the body, pulls this firmly but straight to deep backward square for one.
back of a length ball skids on flat toward middle, Miller is hustled going onto the back foot and bottom edges a pull off his pads before it caroms through point for one.
good length ball skids on to middle and leg, Saha backs away to punch through cover for one.
short on the body, pulls this gently to deep midwicket for one.
back of a length on off, goes back to flick into midwicket for one.
124 kph wide yorker lands beyond the guidelines and is left alone. Extra called.
short on fifth stump at 131 kph, mistimes a pull into the ground and dribbles through midwicket for one.
knee high full toss on the legs at 134 kph, a genuine meatball, but it seems that Miller had his fill during the innings break and gently taps it through square leg for one.
slower length ball on seventh stump at 120 kph, Saha not fooled and swats this back over Jansen to the long-on rope.

dropped! In the slot on fourth stump at 135 kph, driven firmly in the air toward Sundar at mid-on. Sundar shuffles to his left and reaches up above his head but this shot has plenty of mustard on it to squirt through his hands and continues on to the rope. Went just off his fingertips. Maybe harsh to call it a chance but he made contact with it.
fullish length on the stumps, flicked away for one.
shuffles down the track to a length ball, beaten in flight badly but continues through with a pull that goes well wide of deep midwicket to the rope.
short outside off, backs away to toe-slap this to long-off for one.
flighted full and down leg, fumble behind the stumps after a missed sweep by Miller and Saha alertly calls for a sharp second run on a wide.
fullish length on leg stump, backs away to clear the front leg and scoops this over Sundar well short of long-on for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, slapped away wide of the cover sweeper for two.
back of a length on off, goes back to flick wide of long-on but they can only get one.
good length ball angled into the body, flicked through the leg side for one.

bullseye! 152 kph heat-seeking missile explodes at the base of middle and leg stump! It was going to take something electric to remove Saha and Umran provides that by lighting up the stumps before Saha can jam the bat down in time while trying to back away to access the off side.
good length ball speared into the pads at 147 kph, Tewatia is late on a flick and hit on the pads, the ball dribbles back to Umran.
short on fourth stump, classy shot from Tewatia leaning back to ramp this over the keeper to the third man rope, lands just short one bounce before going over.
back of a length on fourth stump at 144 kph, tap and run behind point for one.
fullish length on fourth stump, prodded into the off side.
good length ball angled across sixth stump, sliced high over backward point for one.

dropped! Length ball angled across seventh stump at 132 kph, Miller slaps this straight back to Bhuvi at waist height just outside his left thigh. Very good catching height for a return chance but Bhuvi shells it. 8/10 on difficulty because of the speed it came back at short range but he got two hands around it. Just clanged out.
yorker on middle at 126 kph, jammed out to long-on for one.
slower length ball angled across sixth stump at 129 kph, Tewatia kept the hands back long enough to slice this wide of the point sweeper and beats the diving effort at the rope.
attempted yorker on middle is an ankle high full toss flicked through midwicket for one.
short and wide, there to punish but Miller's cut picks out extra cover on the ring and Williamson dives to cut it off for one.
missed runout! Back of a length on off at 144 kph, backs away and taps this behind point. Abhishek Sharma unleashes a throw to the non-striker's end that is wide with Miller a foot short if it hit.
back of a length on off stump at 147 kph, tapped behind point for one.
fullish length on middle and leg, mistimes a flick into the leg side for one.
slower ball lands full on the legs at 130 kph, flicked through square leg for one.

bullseye again! A 50-pointer rips out the middle of middle stump at 148 kph! Fired on a good length, Miller goes for a big heave over the leg side and instead of hearing bat on ball, it's the harsh and unmistakeable sound of ball onto timber!
searing pace again on a good length but just gets the line fractionally wrong down the leg side at 140 kph, wide called.

one more bullseye! Five-for Umran! Fullish length on middle at 146 kph, Manohar fiddles at this more in hope than belief trying desperately to see off Umran's final ball before waging battle against someone else. Beats the bat and a faint deflection off the back leg onto middle and off stump halfway up. Umran runs away with arms aloft and kisses the sky!
full and wide outside off at 137 kph, this speed looks like military medium after Umran's spell, thumped over extra cover to the rope.
full outside off at 135 kph, goes for an audacious slog sweep and skies a top edge that swirls and lands just short of the deep midwicket fielder charging in.
wide yorker lands outside the guidelines at 135 kph, will have to rebowl.
goes for wide yorker again, sends down a shin high full toss on the wide guideline at 134 kph that is dragged across the line through square leg for one.
attempted yorker again on sixth stump at 134 kph winds up at shin height, driven firmly to long-on for one.
yorker on leg stump at 136 kph, jammed out into square leg for one.

yorker on middle and leg, looked like it was going down leg live as the flick is late and the ball shoots off the foot through fine leg. Appeal from the bowler but no support from the keeper but the umpire gives it out! DRS called for immediately, and rightfully so. No way was this hitting the stumps. Shocking decision. The ball pitched outside leg, hit outside leg, was missing leg. Tewatia stays but a leg bye is denied.
full and wide, slaps this high over extra cover, cut off by Markram at long-off for two.
full on the stumps, helicopter flick to wide long-on, diving stop on the rope saves another two.
length ball just inside the wide guideline at 127 kph, Rashid goes to cut and misses.
Rashid channeling his inner Dhoni! Helicopter flick to a full ball at 133 kph on fourth stump, Jansen is at wide long-on but even at his height he can't save this from going over the rope.
full and wide, punched into the off side for one.
full on the body follows Tewatia backing away from leg at 135 kph, flicked over midwicket for one.
full and wide at 133 kph, drives this in the air over mid-off up in the ring and clears the towering Jansen for a boundary.
goes for yorker on off stump, winds up as an ankle high full toss at 137 kph that is cross-bat swatted through midwicket for one.

alligator arms growing fast by Umran at deep fine leg! Full on the legs, flicked in the air and was floating for what seemed like an eternity but Umran never comes off the rope. It lands 5 yards in front of him and he relays for one. Should have been a simple catch.
yorker on fifth stump at 136 kph, Tewatia swings over the top of this trying to heave to the leg side.

Natarajan gets the yorker wrong and Tewatia punishes him high and deep over midwicket, the ball lands just short of the second tier! The full toss came in just below the knees and ended just below the facade of the second deck thanks to a pull.
wide yorker on sixth stump, jammed out through point for one.

slower ball lands on a fullish length on sixth stump, Jansen doesn't get it full enough going for yorker and keeps it within arms length too of Tewatia, who repeats his go to smear over midwicket sending it deep into the stands.
slower bouncer at 111 kph lands short on fourth stump, swats this fine to deep backward square leg for one.

Rashid tonks Jansen back over this head! He had a nightmare night with the ball, but could be producing a dream finish here with the bat! Slower ball lands on a length on eighth stump, Rashid shuffles across and isn't fooled one bit, cranks this high and deep over the long-on rope over the sightscreen.
short ball at 126 kph angled across eighth stump, Rashid shuffles across and goes to pull this over mid-on and instead sends a stiff breeze to the leg side.

Rashid magic trying to turn the tables on his former franchise! Goes for wide yorker on the guideline, doesn't pitch it and Rashid slices a low full toss and shin height high over the extra cover rope!

Rashid ends it with a six over fine leg! Jansen tried to bounce him, didn't get it nearly short enough, Rashid gets inside the line to this 125 kph delivery and launches it over Natarajan's desperate leap on the boundary! Rashid may have been the goat tonight with the ball, but tonight he's surely the G.O.A.T. with the bat!
round the wicket, onto a good length, punched off the back foot to long-off
round the wicket to the left-hander, fired down the leg side
stretching onto the front foot, tapped to the on-side
on the legs once more, flicked off the back foot to square leg. A tidy start so far
on the back foot, pushed to mid-on, and Pakkidul is off the mark too
driven with an easy flourish, into the gap at extra cover for a couple
tight line to off stump, Buttler pushes through the line, a hint of inside-edge on the drive
lumped through the line, high over long-off! Right into the slot, and slammed high and handsome! That's so in the slot, the postman has had his hand bitten off!
pulls the length back, under-edged into the crease with a semi-leave-alone
ripper! Jags off the seam, zips past the splice, that nibbles from middle and off, through to the keeper. Lively over!

nailed in front of the stumps, up goes the finger! Padikkal reviews, as well he might, it was back on the fuller length, did it pitch outside leg? There's certainly no inside edge... Ball Tracker is taking an age... the tension! Nope, that is very squarely pitching on leg! Hitting middle. That is plumb!
very full, shaping into the toes, and Ashwin clips sweetly through square leg! That's a gift first-up, but put away nicely
flowing drive! Who says it's a holding role? Ashwin is striking at 400, with an effortless glide through the covers!
tight line, off stump, shaping into the pads, Buttler leans forward to smother the threat
pre-meditated shuffle to off, Hazlewood sees him going, adjusts his line to a fourth-stump line, induces another block
hacked off the back foot, under-edge past the keeper! Short from Hazlewood, a bit flat-footed from Buttler, but DK can't get close!
chopped off the back foot, a tight line once more, finds a gap in the covers for the single
on the back foot, and slapped down to backward point
pops from a tight line, cramped on the back foot and fenced back down into the crease
