very full, angled in at off stump, blocked with a vertical blade out to point
back of a length, can't connect on the pull as midwicket intercepts
rocking back, and slapped through backward point! Not terribly wide, but climbs off the deck, into the middle of the horizontal blade, a fast outfield beats third man
yoinked off a good length, clean through cow corner! Scrambles the seam, deposited with a lot of bottom hand and a twist of the blade on impact
back on a fuller length, met with a firm push to cover

top-edged, Siraj calls and claims the catch! Short, but not that short, outside the batter's eyeline, as Ashwin commits to the front foot and can't get over the stroke. Straight up in the air, and plops into the bowler's hands roughly where silly point would be

pulled into the hands of the diving mid-on! Vast, vast wicket! Hazlewood rightly given a second over in the Powerplay, a tight line, a fraction short, but not short enough to get over the top of the stroke. Siraj, permanently in the action so far, leaps forward to grab hold inches from the turf. This is getting very rowdy now!
on the back foot, fenced out to point
full length, outside off, tight line and length once more. He's bowling on his terms, and doing it superbly
on the back foot, tight line once more, back of a length, poked to the on-side for another dot ball
drilled from the blockhole, nothing to dig as Mitchell's bat twists on impact and mid-on gathers in the long barrier
wider line, it was there for the shot, but the surprise eluded Mitchell's swish. A wicket maiden! It really is the Ashes all over again...
pushed through point, on the back foot, and that's rifled to the rope! Barely seemed to touch it, but point can't get close!
hang time on a fuller length, a dangled-batted defence on off stump
crashed up and over extra cover! Floated up to the blockhole, Sanju extends his arms through the stroke, breaks the wrists and launches it high and wide!
steadily onto the front foot, wider on the crease from Hasaranga for what might have been the googly. Blocked
that was the googly, played under the eyeline into the covers
solid defence into the covers. And there ends the Powerplay. RCB take the honours
wide on the crease, speared into the pads, flicked round the corner
rolls the wrists for a flick to the on-side
shaping into the legs again, nudged behind square and they sprint back for the second
on the legs, worked with the angle into the pads and another single
blockhole ball, thumped to mid-off
whipped to the leg-side, rolling the wrists into the angled delivery. A very tidy opening gambit from Harshal
reverse sweep, good intention but can't beat the man at backward point
hoisted up and over long-off! Oodles of hang-time on that one, right under the blow but a teaser for Faf on the boundary's edge, clears him by six feet
inside-out and up and over! Shimmies to leg, makes some room to the off-side, right under the blow again, and even further and wider over the covers! 150 sixes for Samson, 18 in this IPL
worked to the on-side
tapped to mid-on, a sharp single to keep things ticking. Mitchell's main role is to hand the strike back in this over
slides past the legs, we'll have that again
back of a length, clobbered out to the deep cover boundary. A 16-run over to reset RR's innings
sharp pace, bouncing past a loose cut! More of a dab really, through him before he could form his stroke
on the back foot, right into line to fend the pace back down the pitch
opens the face on the back foot, glided down to backward point
thrashed across the line, and not remotely timed. A spliced pull, high into no-man's land at short midwicket
right on top of another dabbed cut, connects well but a superb diving intercept at backward point
outside off, lifting off the deck, through to the keeper.
low full toss, clipped to the on-side, and Sanju gets the strike back. He's got going alright...
attempted reverse-sweep, can't connect outside off stump

ping! Out leaps the off stump! Another reverse sweep, but Hasaranga slides it through a touch faster and fuller, and that's a massive and timely breakthrough. Fifth time in T20s that he's got his man too
stretching forward helmetless-ly, and blocked with combination of bat and front pad
leaning out of the crease, accepting another dot as he calibrates his innings
bottom-handed bosh down the ground to mid-on, he'll keep the strike
panned with disdain, high over wide long-on! In the arc, and launched
stretching into the drive, not quite timed, cuffed to the on-side
opens the face on the back foot, and punched out to the covers
monstered back through the line! Maybe a fingertip on the ball as it fizzed back through, but it was so powerfully hit
eased to mid-off
round the wicket, cut to point
fired down the wrong line
nurdled around the corner to backward square
rolls the wrists on a drive to mid-on
flicked to the on-side
opens the face outside off, and glided to backward point
sliding onto the back foot, nudged with the spin to mid-on
tight line, another googly, no room to free the arms, as Parag settles for a nudge to the on-side
back of a length, cracked to cover, but can't pierce the field
on the legs, worked to the on-side, calm accumulation as RCB keep the screw tight
attempted pull, but that's onto him before the stroke can form. Spliced to nowhere, into the covers. Lucky!
attempted yorker, comes out as a knee-high full-toss, into the pads, cuffed to deep midwicket
right up to the blockhole, wide of off stump, thumped to the on-side but with no power
full once more, thumped firmly into the covers
tight and full, dipping into the body
quicker, flatter, pushed back at the bowler
attempted reverse sweep, pushed across the body, can't connect
nudged from a leg-stump line to backward square
crunched straight at the fielder at cover, this is an excellent restrictive over
flogged out to deep midwicket, excellently burgled over
big wind-up, attempted pull, but Hazlewood is through him too quickly
swings through the line, but straight at long-on! It was do-or-die time for Mitchell, Hazlewood took a nugget of pace off the ball, and Maxwell on the rope does the rest!
zipping past the outside edge, a Test-match length once more from Hazlewood and a hint of movement away from the left-handed Hetmeyer
dangles the bat outside off, swing away from the leftie, on a perfect length, and beaten
on the back foot, tight to off stump, and blocked out to point
on the back foot, opens the face, tapped to point, and Hazlewood's impressive figures get ever better. His only conceded boundary was an under-edged cut too
floated up to the full length, a googly to the leftie, who stretches forward to defend
on the back foot, chopped hard out to deep point

hacked high, high, high into the leg side! Hetmeyer kneels into a slog-sweep, but he can't connect properly, fetching it from outside off, a spiralling top-edge, Maxi settles for the catch, and another massive wicket as he punches his blade in annoyance!
so nearly two in two! Kohli leaps across to a flick off the pads, but his outstretched left hand at mid-on can't close round the ball
whipped into the gap at point
tidy to finish, probing dipping full length, blocked down into the crease to end a teasing spell
clipped from back of a length to the on-side
bashed back at the bowler, on a full length
cracked into the gap in the covers for a couple. They all count
fenced out to point, no way through there
pushed down the ground, just another single for Parag... he needs to get going soon...
clubbed from a full length into the covers once more

simply stunning take! Kohli at short midwicket flings himself into a full-blooded pull, low to his left and there's a moment of stunned silence before anyone really twigs he's clung on! He had a sighter from Boult's first ball, but that was quite the way to atone!
slower ball, dangled on off stump, poked to cover to get Parag back on strike. So much resting on him now!
outside off, boshed to deep cover. Singles just won't cut it here
edged and dropped by a leaping DK! A genuine nick, climbing into the splice and kissing high to the keeper's right. Karthik got two gloves close to the ball but that was travelling and climbing!
crashed out to the off side, can't beat the field once more
very full, tailing into the pads, deflected to backward point. Superb over and RR are drifting
too much width, and slammed high over extra cover! Hazlewood perhaps tried to hide the ball out wide, but that was telegraphed and launched!
drags the length back... and an appalling drop from Hasaranga! Oh my, that is a dolly, a top-edged slice into the covers, on the edge of the ring, plops in... and out again!
back on the full outswinging length, outside off, Prasidh chases ghosts as the ball eludes him
tighter to off stump, a cuff to the on-side, an instant call, Prabhu at mid-on gathers, runs up to the stumps and beats the batter in a race to the crease!
he can, but unconventionally! Full length, a swing across the line, a flying thick edge, whizzes past the not-really-catcher at short third and away to the rope!
full length, tucks the single, that's the right approach. Six balls to give RR a score
attempted pull, can't connect. Another dot
clonked through midwicket! A precious four as Parag swings into a pull, not terribly short but lots of bat through ball, high past the sweeper
fuller length, swinging into another ambitious pull, doesn't beat the field, but does rush back for the second. He's giving it a go
launched! Outstanding blow, breaks the wrists through the yorker-length, almost Jos-style, you have to say, right under the eyeline and high over wide long-off for a vital 29-ball 50
bouncer, swatted off the eyebrows, declines the single to deep midwicket in a bid for one last boundary
back of a length, battered over cow corner! That's a magnificent finish from Parag, he's singlehandedly hauled RR to a defendable total!
Starts off with a length ball around middle, defended back solidly. First ball survived!
Back of a length around off and middle, pushed towards midwicket off the back foot.
Third duck for Kohli? Just escapes! Tries to work the length ball of his hips to the on side. Lands JUST short of Mitchell at square leg. Is this Kohli's day?
The decibel levels in Pune tell a story. Kohli gets going with a boundary. Similar delivery, Kohli gets on top of it and works it away to the right of square leg and gets four.

Streaky but effective! The slice of luck that Kohli could well do with. Fuller and outside off, Kohli is still on the back foot. Throws his bat at it and gets an inside edge past the off stump and the wicketkeeper for four more.
Another escape! Similar to the last ball, this time goes to the left of the wicketkeeper for a single. Eventful start.
Another edge! Looks like the middle of Kohli's bat is on a holiday. Gets an inside edge on to his pads as he looks to push the full ball through off.
Banged in on a back of a length outside off, moves away a bit. Kohli leaves it alone, after thinking of playing at it.
Three dots in a row. This is full and solidly driven straight to mid-off.
Short ball outside off, Kohli has a half pull. But well away from him, wide given.

Has the bumper got the better of Kohli? Is it off the helmet or the bat? Kohli's walking! Only nine runs and a wry smile to show. Was banged in short, right at the badge of the helmet. Seemed as if he missed the pull and got it off his helmet. But after Parag ran in from backward point and took a good diving catch, Kohli shook his head and began the long walk back. Got it off the toe end off the bat and no helmet at all. Superb delivery, must give it to Prasidh for working Kohli over.
Stands tall and blocks a length ball around off.
A tad fuller, around off and middle. Patidar waits for it and pushes it towards backward point. Just one run - none off the bat - and a big wicket from the over.
Full and angling across, he leaves it alone.
Punches this one from the crease towards covers.
Shot. Good way to get going. Length ball, a touch short and enough width on offer. du Plessis stands tall and slaps it through covers.
Closer to the stumps this time on a length, nothing doing from Faf.
Fuller around middle, waits and guides it to backward point. Five dots and a four so far.
Length again around off and middle, taps it to the right of backward point for a quick run.
Full outside off, driven to covers.
Fuller on the pads, Faf directs it through front of square on the leg side and gets three. In fact, they'll get just two as Patidar didn't drag his bat in during the second run.
Back of a length outside off, steered to third to get off the mark.
Length ball on the sixth stump line, pushed towards backward point.
Prasidh bowled a bouncer to Kohli, got him out; does the same to Faf and gets pulled for four. du Plessis was standing tall expecting it and nonchalantly pulled it over midwicket.
And the idea was televised well before and executed well. A bumper on the stumps that Faf is happy to duck under.
Length ball on leg, misses the flick and they take a leg bye as the ball rolls to the off side. A stifled appeal but pitched well outside leg.
Stinger for Samson! That was a bit short and was climbing even as it reaches the keeper, past the batter. Samson couldn't collect it despite the jump and concedes a bye.
Length ball slanting away, Patidar guides it to third man for one.

du Plessis didn't get it off the middle of the bat yet manages to get four. Made a thunking sound as the fullish ball was pushed wide of Buttler at mid-off. He put in the dive but couldn't prevent the boundary.
Faf taps it towards point for a quick single. Patidar makes it despite the direct hit.

Where's the ball? Patidar misses the flick off the length ball and the ball lands next to the stump after going off the pad. But he is unsure and comes down in search of a run, before going back seeing Boult rush to the ball.
Tossed up ball outside off, pushed to covers.
A touch shorter and wider, slapped towards covers where Mitchell stops with a dive.
Fuller around off, defended from the crease.
Clean as a whistle. Makes room much before the ball is bowled. Picks the carrom ball early and thumps it way over long-off.
Flatter on middle and leg, flicked off the back foot through midwicket for one.
Dropped!- It was a sharp chance and Ashwin just stuck out his left hand. Another carrom ball, full on off and middle, belted back. End of the powerplay.
Full and wide outside off, Faf lets it be.
And Kuldeep strikes off his second ball. Soft dismissal. Length ball outside off, du Plessis looks to slap it over cover. Finds Buttler stationed there. He can't believe it but Kuldeep is ecstatic.

What a start for Kuldeep Sen and Royals! This is as clever as clever can be. Sets the field up for the bumper - deep point, third man, fine leg and deep square leg in place. Plays with Maxwell's mind to push him back. Then bowls a length ball outside off, which Maxwell just pushes at. Gets a thick edge straight to slip. Sen is on a roll and a hat-trick.
Just missed! Too quick for Shahbaz that. Length ball slanting away, he flays at it from the crease and sees the ball pass the under-edge of the bat.
Bangs in short, Shahbaz ducks.
Length ball, taps it to the off side next to the stumps. The non-strikers calls him through for a run. One run and two wickets from Kuldeep's first.
Length ball slanting away, Shahbaz stays deep and cuts it to third man for one.
Very full on off, worked through midwicket for a quick two.
Sprayed down leg, left alone.
Full on off, driven to long-on for a single.
Length ball outside off, pushed to backward point.
Shahbaz stands on middle and stump and works the length ball through square leg for one.
Driven down to long on for one.
Full on off, gets it off the inner half through square leg for a single.
Back of a length ball around middle and leg, Shahbaz can only hop and push it back.
Full on middle and leg, hit aerially to long-on for just one.
Fuller on off, Patidar looks to push it to the off side but gets an inside edge to fine leg for one.
Length ball outside off, slapped to sweeper for one.
Bashed nonchalantly! Length ball on the shorter side, on the hips. Patidar just swivels and sends it way over fine leg for half a dozen.
Flatter and quicker outside off, Shahbaz misses the cut.
Straighter around off, pushed back towards covers.
Loopy ball on off, Shahbaz takes it on the full and sweeps it to deep square leg for one.
Carrom ball on off, very full. Hit right back.
Fuller around middle, worked through midwicket for a couple.

150th IPL wicket for R Ashwin and gets it in some style. Again bowls it from wide of the crease, the carrom ball that skids after landing on a good length. Patidar is back to cut it but misses and loses his off stump. Ashwin is up and running towards covers in celebration.
Slower through the air on a length, Shahbaz misses the flick and steals a leg bye.
Tossed up full around middle, blocked.
Floated full on off, driven right back. Goes to hit the stumps at the other end but Chahal didn't get any hand to that.
A touch shorter around middle and leg, goes back to work it through midwicket for one. Thought about the second that wasn't on.
Looped up full outside off, Shahbaz slices it through covers for a couple. The fielder in the deep misfields and concedes a third. Chahal is not amused.

Has he got him? No says the ump! Samson and Chahal chat, think about it and then opt for the DRS. Chahal foxes Prabhudessai with the flight, landing it around middle on a fullish length. He goes back to defend but misses it due to the spin away. Impact should be interesting...Umpire's call says the ball-tracker and missing the wickets.
Fuller ball outside off, the carrom ball again, gets it off the outer half towards backward point.
Shorter outside off, cut away through backward point for one.
Flatter and outside off, glided through backward point for one more.

Catching practice for Riyan Parag, who gets the bihu dance out! Prabhudessai charges down to the tossed up ball and looks to go over long-on but fails to get the elevation. Easy take for the fielder there. It was the conventional offspinning delivery this time. RCB in further hole.
Fuller carrom ball on off, driven to long-off to get going.
Flatter arm ball on middle and leg, Shahbaz misses the flick. Ashwin was interested but no one else was.

A mix-up almost cost Shahbaz! Came down in search of a run after Karthik pushed one to the off side. Was sent back and had almost given up. But neither was the bowler up to the stumps, nor was there a direct hit.
Karthik executes the sweep shot to perfection. It was a tossed up ball at a full length outside off, he exploited the midwicket region with success.
Dances down and hits this one to long-on on the bounce.

Has Chahal missed running Karthik out? All reactions suggest so. Indeed! Karthik gave up and hence is run-out, wouldn't have been out had he tried to make it back in. Massive wicket for Royals, perhaps one of the weirdest run-outs. Shahbaz danced down and pushed it to mid-on and came down in search of a run. DK responded but midway, Shahbaz decided otherwise. Too late but Chahal fumbled. However, Karthik had given up quite early.
Flatter and quicker wrong'un outside off, misses the push.
Flatter outside off, chops it towards short fine leg. End of an eventful over calls for a break.
Length ball sliding down leg, Hasaranga misses the flick.
Another wide, this time over head. Banged in a bouncer, Hasaranga ducks.
Full on the pads, worked through square leg for one.
Smashed high and over long-off for half a dozen. Length ball in his slot, Shahbaz kept his head still as he hit that.
Length ball angling away, heave and a miss.
Good length ball around off and middle, Shahbaz stays back and taps it next to the stumps and hares to the other end.
Full on middle and leg, driven down to long-on for one.
Fuller again, outside off. Shahbaz walks across and taps it to the off side.
Creams the inside-out drive through covers. Tossed up full on off, Hasaranga makes room and just times the drive, bissecting sweeper to his right and long-off to his left to perfection.
Very full on leg, dug out through covers for one.
Very full on middle and leg, flicked to midwicket.
Low full toss on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler.
Tossed up again, Shahbaz charges down to work it to the on side, but gets it off the pad towards covers for a leg bye.
Flatter and shorter outside off, slapped to sweeper for one.
Nifty glovework from Samson! Collects the fired through carrom ball down leg and swiftly whips off the bails to ask the query. Hasaranga's back leg never came off the ground.
Quicker one around off and middle, pushed to the off side.
Shorter and angling in, doesn't give Hasaranga any room. Chops it on the pitch.
On a length this time around middle, driven through covers for one.

Keep Riyan Parag out of the game at your own peril! Shahbaz looks to tonk the shortish ball over long-on. But he ends up skying it up. Parag runs in from long-off even as the cover fielder runs backwards. The youngster puts in the dive to take that inches off the ground to give Ashwin his third.
Full on the pads, turned through square leg for one.

Deceived in flight and yet gets away with it. Hasarange wanted to push it through covers but the flight meant that it went off the outer edge to the left of backward point for one. Ashwin finishes with 3/17 tonight.
Not the line to be bowled that. On the pads at a decent height. Hasaranga swivels and collects a one-bounce four to fine leg.
Superb work by the sweeper running to his right. Trent Boult is the man! Hasaranga flayed the length ball through covers and it looked to have been timed well. Boult saves two.
Short this time outside off, Hasaranga looks to punch it off the back foot but gets it off the outer half. Boult has to run to his left this time and cannot prevent the double.

The bouncer gets too hot for Hasaranga. The heat in Pune is already high and Kuldeep is increasing it with his incessant short-bowling. Hasaranga looks to heave this but ends up skying it, hurried by the extra pace. Sen settles under it at where non-striker would have been and takes it comfortably.
Full on the pads, worked through square leg for one.
Short and outside off, Patel has a swish and a miss.
Length ball, Siraj misses getting it away.
Full and outside off, Siraj throws his bat at it to slice it over point for four.
Siraj is cramped for room for the pull and misses pulling the bouncer.
Aims Navi Mumbai goes Nagpur! Full ball, Siraj looks to smash it over mid-off. Gets it off the thick outer half and the ball carries to Kuldeep at third man.
Full toss outside off, hit to covers.
Banged in short, Hazlewood sways and misses the ramp.
Floated full on leg, misses the heave over midwicket.
That made good connection! Tossed up outside off, on a length. Patel stands tall and thumps it over deep midwicket. Both Chahal and Harshal play for Haryana, so there is the familiarity.
Flighted well outside off, Patel tries to reach to it but misses.
Very full on leg, squeezed off the inner edge to the off side.
Slower through the air, Harshal is through with his swing quite early. Toe ends it to long-on but denies the run.
Very full on the stumps, dug out to the off side.
Finally connects the slog, straight to deep midwicket for one.
Length ball outside off, Harshal misses the pull.
Back of a length around middle, steered to third man.
Fourth catch for Parag as Royal Challengers fold for 115. Length ball on the stumps, Harshal holes out to long-on, who didn't have to move an inch.
fullish, slanting away from off stump, gets forward for a push-drive between mid-off and extra-cover
length ball straightening back into middle and off, lets it come and defends into the point region

fullish, a bit of width outside off, and Agarwal drives crisply only for short extra-cover, Rayudu, to dive left and stop it. He's taken a bit of a smack on the wrist in the effort to field that ball, and he's going off the field
full but not quite driving length, close to off stump, opens his bat face for a front-foot push to cover point, who's on the edge of the circle
length ball, threatens to swing away from off stump before nipping back slightly. Lets it come and dabs gently into the point region for a quick single
misses out on a half-volley offering a hint of width. Drives straight to the fielder at short extra-cover, the substitute Subhranshu Senapati
back of a length, turning from just outside leg to middle. Hangs back and dabs gently into the covers to bring up 6000 runs in the IPL
full on leg stump, clipped down to long-on
quickish length ball on middle and off, and Dhawan picks up another quick single with a bunt towards extra-cover
length ball outside off, looks for the late-cut but can't beat short third, who's stationed quite wide

lovely. A bit quicker and closer to off stump, offbreak, and Agarwal leans back and opens his bat face - more a late dab than a late cut this time, and he places it nice and fine to leave short third with no chance
quick offbreak turning down leg, not close enough for Agarwal to play the front-foot flick

a bit slower on middle and off, stretches out for a push to mid-off. Risky, risky single, because it went to Jadeja's left side, and he sends in a rocket throw, but Agarwal's dive ensures he would have been home even if there had been a direct hit
flat one keeps going with the angle towards leg stump. Gets forward for a push to the right of extra-cover
flat outside off, a bit of away-drift but no turn back in, leans forward and chops to point
very full on off stump. Looks to whip it leg side and gets a thick inside edge to short fine leg

typical Santner delivery. A bit of in-drift as Agarwal looks to make room for the inside-out drive, and the ball keeps going inwards after pitching to cramp him for room. Can't beat the extra-cover fielder
again the ball goes with the arm to deny the room Agarwal is trying to create. Extra bounce too, beats the top-edge of a half-cut/half-drive, and bounces over the top of off stump!
another one going on with the angle into the stumps. Goes back and chops to backward point

fullish outside off, but the ball stops on Dhawan slightly as he looks to drive over mid-off. Doesn't get hold of it at all, but clears the fielder, who turns around and chases it back to the boundary

down the track now, and he ends up making himself too much room as Choudhary goes full and wide. Reaches out and slices it in the air, and it drops into no-man's land between the converging backward point, third man and cover point fielders
length ball straightening slightly towards middle stump, hangs back for a paddle-pull to deep backward square leg
shortish outside off, and Dhawan goes hard at a cut and misses
length ball close to off stump, opens his bat face and dabs to the left of backward point
back of a length, marginally down leg, and Agarwal can't connect with the glance after shuffling across his stumps

fullish, angling across to off stump, looks like a slower ball that Agarwal picked a bit late. Shapes to drive, then checks his shot, and the ball hangs briefly in the air but bounces before it can reach extra-cover moving to his right
poor ball. Back of a length and wide outside off, and Agarwal cuts it away to the right of backward point
arm ball, swings in and keeps going with the angle as Agarwal looks to work it leg side. Smacks into his pad but the impact is well outside leg stump
tossed up outside off, driven to extra-cover
steps out and Santner bowls a flat length ball wide outside off. Swipes it over midwicket, but long-on is wide, and he doesn't have to move too far to his left to stop the ball
fullish, close to off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length, another swinging arm ball, straightens along an off-stumpish line, and Dhawan uses his wrists to clip it back to the bowler
flat one at the stumps, goes back and flat-bats to the right of long-on

super shot. Targets the short leg-side boundary here. Offbreak turning away from off stump, and he takes a big stride forward but not across, to give him swinging room to slog-sweep high over midwicket
quickish length ball pitching outside leg and finishing on middle and leg. Lets it come and dabs into the covers for another quick single
tossed up full on off stump, too full for Agarwal to drive with any real power. Hits it straight to extra-cover

got him, carrom ball close to off stump. I think Agarwal picked it, but he didn't get the room he desired to be able to play that front-foot cut. Ends up hitting it in the air, straight to backward point
respectful start. Length offbreak finishing within the stumps, gets forward and defends it back to the bowler
length ball angling across to off stump, no turn back in, gets forward and nudges into the backward square leg region
back of a length, flat, on the pads, tucked quietly to deep square leg
premeditates for the sweep and Jadeja shortnes his length just outside off. Chopped to deep point

takes on the long boundary, and Ruturaj Gaikwad lets him off! Down the track, not to the pitch of this ball fired at his pads, and he whips it high, but Ruturaj, running to his right from deep square leg and diving, gets both hands to the ball but drops it
length ball around leg stump, gets forward to clip into the backward square leg region
fired flat down the leg side, can't connect with the flick
a bit slower around leg stump, gets forward and clips into the midwicket region
steps out, and Pretorius sees him coming. Tries to bowl a slower ball wide outside off, and ends up going past the tramline
another wide length ball, stretches out and chops into the cover point region. Seemed like another slower one
length ball outside off, and Rajapaksa slashes and misses, going hard with an angled bat. Ball seems to stop on him again
slower ball, back of a length, again attacking the inside of that wide line. Reaches out to cut and misses. Another slower ball, bounces twice before reaching Dhoni
fuller now, similar line, shuffles across initially and then gets forward for a drive to deep point
nice shot. Anticipated the wide line, got it, and gets a nice stride forward to drive with a full follow-through and find enough power to beat deep point diving to his left
sees him coming down the track and looks to deny him room, ends up firing the ball down the leg side
slower ball wide of off stump, sashays out and stabs to extra-cover
slants this across into a wide-ish line outside off, gets on the front foot to reach out and chop to the left of point
tossed up on middle and off, swept to deep square leg
looks to fire it across and ends up bowling it wide of the off-side tramline. Rajapaksa just leaves it alone
flat length ball on the stumps, clipped to the right of short fine leg
sees Dhawan coming and shortens his length on off stump, chopped out to deep cover point

through Santner's hands for six! Flat length ball fired across to off stump, and Rajapaksa gets down on his back knee, premeditating the slog sweep. Gets the length for it, but he's still taking on the long boundary, and the ball whizzes between the hands of Santner at deep midwicket, raised above his head
full, around off stump, driven quietly to long-off for one
full outside off, gets forward and eases a square-drive to the right of sweeper cover
steps out and Bravo bowls a slower ball that nearly yorks him outside off. Jabbbed gently into the covers for another quick single
slower offcutter outside off stump, on a length. Rajapaksa is too early into a sweep, and misses by a big margin
sees Rajapaksa coming down the track and looks to bowl a quick wide yorker away from his reach, ends up bowling it far too wide
bad ball. Stump-high full-toss outside off, offers room for Rajapaksa to free his arms and slash at the ball, Thick outside edge flies to the left of short third, who has been stationed very fine

full slower ball on off stump, clipped gently down the ground, and they can run a quick two because Santner has to come in a long way off the boundary and pick up the ball inside the 30-yard circle. Forces Rajapaksa to dive to complete the second, though
full outside off, Rajapaksa hits a flat-bat drive and hits it hard into the ground. Bravo jumps in his follow-through and catches it on the bounce over his head
off-stump yorker, digs it out and plays it back to the bowler
down the track, Pretorius looks to york him and bowls a low full-toss at his feet. Clipped to long-on
another blockhole ball angled into the stumps, and Rajapaksa clips it to deep backward square leg
slower short ball close to off stump, pulled towards deep midwicket

slower length bal lon off stump, clipped down the ground into the mid-on region. Again they look to pick up two with both long-on and the bowler chasing the ball towards the 30-yard circle, but this time they have to be content with one
steps out and Pretorius angles the ball into the stumps, quite full, clipped towards deep midwicket, picking up two with the fielder having to come in off the long boundary
yorker fairly wide outside off, brings his bottom hand into play to whip the ball towards long-on. I think he was targeting the mid-off area but didn't get hold of it
Dhawan shuffles across and Choudhary goes wider outside off, ends up outside the tramline
wide bouncer, ends up stopping on the pitch and ballooning into Dhoni's gloves. Again too wide outside off

super shot. Steps out, gets across his stumps, and the attempted wide yorker ends up being not wide enough and not full enough. Almost a half-volley, and Dhawan flays it away to the cover point boundary
short, a bit of width, and that's a lovely back-cut from Dhawan, rolling his wrists over on top of the bounce. Superb placement too, to find the gap to the right of deep point

this time the wide yorker is almost full enough to be a yorker, and wide enough to make Dhawan reach out despite his big shuffle across. Looks to drive into the covers, ends up dragging it back to the bowler with the bottom hand taking over

shuffles across again, exposing all three stumps, and Choudhary misses his line slightly while looking to cramp him for room with a full ball. Ends up on the pads, and Dhawan clips it away neatly to the right of short fine leg
wide length ball, chopped away towards deep point, where Senapati does the fielding. Rayudu is still off the field
flat length ball on the stumps, goes back and clips towards deep midwicket, who rushes in off the boundary to deny the second run

looped up, angling away from the left-hander, and Rajapaksa gets a good stride forward and reaches out, bringing his wrists into the drive to drill it into the gap between extra-cover and sweeper cover. Pretorius, at sweeper cover, could have stopped it, but he fumbles it while tumbling to his left
back of a length close to off stump, waits and plays a late dab towards short third
flat offbreak finishing around middle stump, looks to hang back and flick, ends up hitting it into his pads
carrom ball, turns down the leg side past the attempted flick
flat carrom ball on the pads, nudged away towards deep backward square leg
fullish on off stump, gets forward and clips to deep midwicket
wide slower yorker, and Rajapaksa shuffles across and gets down on his back knee to drag a sweep to deep midwicket
steps out, has to reach for the slower ball - aimed at the tramline - to drive it to long-off
looks for the wide yorker, ends up bowling a wide full-toss that isn't quite low enough to deny Rajapaksa elevation. Lofts this cleanly and clears Jadeja at long-off
slower ball wide of off stump, looks for that slog-sweep again and bottom-edges past his stumps towards short fine leg

slower ball close to the off-side tramline, and Dhawan shuffles across and gets close enough to the line to play a controlled sweep to bisect square leg and short fine leg. Super shot to bring up fifty, this has been an excellent innings given the conditions
full slower ball wide of off stump, reaches out and drives to long-off
flat carrom ball finishing around off stump, goes back and clips to deep midwicket
floats one full and down leg, misses the fine sweep and the ball deflects off the back leg and rolls towards short fine
shapes to sweep, and Theekshana bowls a ball that's too full for that shot, on off stump. Adjusts and clips to deep backward square leg
down the track, looks to clip this leg-stumpish ball into the midwicket region, and the offbreak turns to find the leading edge that rolls into the cover region
short offbreak fired into the pitch, slows down considerably as it reaches the batter on a stump-to-stump line, worked away to deep backward square leg
a touch too full to cut, and the ball hurries past the edge
low full-toss on off stump, driven with a lot of power past the diving bowler, to the right of long-on
slower length ball angling away from off stump. Rajapaksa looks to swipe it to midwicket but he's early on the shot, ends up getting a leading edge of sorts that rolls towards long-off

angles an attempted wide yorker across the left-hander, and it passes the wide line on the full and only bounces after crossing the return crease outside off, which means it's a no-ball. The ball didn't land within the defined area of the pitch
and Bravo gives away a freebie too. Slower full-toss on off stump, and Dhawan holds his shape and drives firmly to beat mid-off to his left
mid-off is a spectator once again. Full on off stump, and he clears his front leg and brings down a straight, straight bat to finish with high right elbow after lofting it cleanly over mid-off
slower ball, drags his length back a bit, finishes just outside off stump. Waits on it and dabs into the point region
finishes with a yorker, on pace, on off stump. Jams his bat down and digs it out. No single because the bowler runs to his right in his follow-through to intercept the ball
full-toss on off stump, swiped to long-on
yorker on middle stump, looks to drive down the ground and gets a thick inside edge to deep backward square leg

terrific shot. Shaped with his back foot as if he was making room to target the off side, but he holds his ground and then shuffles across when he gets the line and length he wants. Attempted yorker on the stumps, ends up as a full-toss, and he scoops it smartly over short fine leg
good yorker, on middle and leg, jabbed back towards the bowler
another yorker on the stumps. Wants to drive to long-off, ends up playing it to long-on off the inside half of his bat

back of a length, angling into leg stump to deny Dhawan the room he's trying to create. Looks to whip it leg side, ends up inside-edging into his back leg, from where the ball ricochets into the point region
and again, a wide full-toss angling away from Dhawan and bouncing only after clearing the off-side return crease. Another no-ball.

full-toss, around thigh-high close to off stump. Clears his front leg and swats it hard, but Santner does brilliantly to stop the boundary, diving almost full-length to his left after a proper sprint from long-on

down the track, Bravo slants the slower length ball away from his arc, and Rajapaksa goes hard at it, looking possibly to clear long-off. Doesn't get hold of it, slices it high in the air, and extra-cover settles nicely under it
steps out and across to the off side, expecting the line to be outside off. Gets a slower offcutter on that line and clips it towards short fine leg
wide yorker slanting away from Dhawan, opens his bat face and slices it along the ground to deep point
back of a length, angling down leg, and Livingstone throws everything into a pull and fails to connect
slower length ball wide of off stump. Goes hard at a flat-bat drive, ends up dragging it with no power into the mid-on region
steps across to leave all his stumps exposed behind him, and Bravo bowls a dipping slower ball, full, and wide of off stump. Looks to sweep, ends up bottom-edging it towards short third
in the blockhole, angling into the stumps, clipped to deep backward square leg
slower ball, back of a length, outside off, and Livingstone swipes hard, and finds the backward square leg boundary off the inside half of the bat
terrific. Goes for the wide line, bowls a slower ball, but it's in Livingstone's arc and he launches it with immense power over the long-off boundary
wow. Slower ball, back of a length this time, outside off, and he plays a shot that's more tennis forehand than pull, flat-batting it all the way over the long-on boundary
back of a length on sixth stump at 136 kph, gentle loosener defended to cover.
back of a length on off at 135 kph, goes back and across to flick through the leg side to get off the mark.
length ball swinging away from eighth stump at 137 kph, no footwork chasing this by Uthappa as it passes over the wide guideline and he misses a tame cut.
back of a length on middle at 137 kph, tap and run into midwicket to get off the mark.
short on sixth stump at 134 kph, not too much width but enough for Gaikwad to time a minimalistic punch off the back foot behind point to the rope.
even classier now! Fullish length ball on seventh stump at 141 kph, reaches forward to punch this on the up through cover, diving effort by the fielder on the ring is in vain.
short and wide, there to smash at 127 kph, but a cut is mistimed dribbling to point.
good length ball on fourth stump at 130 kph, shuffles back and across to defend back to Sharma.
fullish length ball on fourth stump swinging away a touch at 123 kph, defended into the off side.
short and swinging away a touch on sixth stump at 128 kph, sits up for Uthappa to whack a firm pull but picks out midwicket in the ring. Three yards either side and it was a boundary.

length ball swings the other way in to the body at 130 kph, Uthappa tries to heave this over midwicket but is off balance and it climbs on him a touch to produce a top edge. It swirls over midwicket on the ring, easy catch for Rishi Dhawan waiting for it to come down into his arms at chest height with palms facing into the body.
fullish length ball swinging away from off stump at 130 kph, Santner prods forward in defense and blocks this to cover but they pinch a tight run.
back of a length on fifth stump, prods at this and is beaten.
good length ball on fourth stump at 139 kph, defended to mid-off.
back of a length on middle stump at 136 kph, defended back to Rabada off the back foot.
hostile from Kagiso! Bouncer on middle at 142 kph, perfectly directed and Santner flinches trying to get his head out of the way.
yorker on fourth stump at 141 kph, punched out to mid-off for a tight run.
back of a length on fourth stump, goes back and across to flick through midwicket for one.
back of a length on fifth stump at 129 kph, Gaikwad tries to guide this behind point but can't pick the gap.
back of a length swinging in a touch toward middle, defended back to Sharma.
good length ball drifting down leg at 125 kph, left alone and wide called.
back of a length on the hips at 128 kph, very clumsy matador red cape effort at short fine leg by Arshdeep letting the ball go through his legs, turns at worst a single into two.
good length ball at 127 kph on the stumps, punched gently to mid-on for one.
back of a length angled across fifth stump at 130 kph, prodded into the covers for one.
good length ball on sixth stump at 133 kph, cuts this tamely to backward point.
good length ball on the stumps, defended.
back of a length into the pads at 130 kph, goes to flick through square leg but is late and thuds off the pads back to Rishi.
leg stump half-volley on the pads at 133 kph, flicked elegantly high and wide of deep square leg into midwicket for two.
back of a length on the hips at 125 kph, goes to flick and is late, big carom off the thigh guard goes well wide of the keeper to the rope for four extras.
good length ball on leg stump swinging into the pads at 132 kph, Santner again misses out with a freebie on the pads and it dribbles back to Rishi.
short ball tailing down leg, late on a pull, will have to rebel with wide called down the leg side.
fullish length ball goes down leg side at 127 kph past an attempted flick, curiously no wide called. It was nowhere near the body. Santner is as perplexed as anyone.
fullish length ball at 127 kph angled across sixth stump, mistimed drive goes past the stumps to fine leg for one.

edge! No slip and goes to the third man rope for four! Santner squared up by a delivery angled into off stump at 135 kph that straightens off the pitch, goes back to defend, thick edge flies wide of the keeper to where an orthodox first slip would be and goes for Santner's first boundary.

woof! This sums up better than anything how weak Santner was on his legs. He shuffles across and is bowled behind them! Fullish length ball at 138 kph, fairly innocuous except for the part where Santner goes too far across and leaves his stumps exposed. Misses yet another leg side flick and this time pays the price as it knocks out leg stump. Arshdeep cements the humiliation with a curious celebratory dance.
fullish length ball swinging away on off stump, defended to cover.
full and angled well down leg, wide called.
back of a length on fourth stump at 137 kph, goes to punch down the ground and inside edges this through square leg for one.
slower ball lands on a good length on fourth stump at 121 kph, guided to cover.
back of a length seaming away from off stump at 125 kph, prodded into the covers for one.
fullish length ball on seventh stump, punched through cover for one.
fullish length slower ball lands on sixth stump at 109 kph, miscues a drive and dribbles to the keeper.
short ball well outside leg, Dube is already well inside the line and pulls this fine past the keeper and beats deep fine leg who is way too square to have any chance at cutting it off.
slower ball lands on a good length on the legs, flicked wide of Arshdeep at deep fine leg for two.

drag on! Another fairly innocuous looking delivery angled across off stump at 130 kph, Dube doesn't really get his feet moving though throughout his stay and pokes at this with a big gap between bat and pad, gets an inside edge that cannons into leg stump.
what kind of shot is this!? Slightly short on fifth stump, Gaikwad leans back and spanks this on the up high over extra cover.
good length ball on middle, shuffles across to flick through midwicket for one.
too short on middle, rocks back to heave this high over wide long-on, didn't middle it though and plops well short of the rope before Livingstone relays in.
back of a length on fourth stump, punched through cover to the sweeper for one.

pitched up to encourage a drive and nearly produces a wicket! Very full on fourth stump, Rayudu leans back and shovels this in the air just wide of Mayank at extra cover to evade his leaping effort moving right and goes to the rope.
good length ball on fifth stump, prodded to backward point.
slower ball lands full on fifth stump at 99 kph, chipped with ease through midwicket for one.
fullish length on sixth stump, driven firmly to long-off for one.
back of a length on the stumps, flicked through midwicket for one.
strays short on the body with another slower ball at 102 kph, flicks a pull wide of short fine leg to the rope.
fullish length outside off, goes to drive and is beaten.

meatball of a full toss is chomped on before being spat back out into the top row of the upper deck over backward square leg! Rishi was trying for yorker but gets the length horribly wrong and sends this at thigh height on the legs, Rayudu gets a spoon out to sprinkle some marinara over the top of this to make it look a bit juicier before swatting it away.
good length ball on middle and leg, prodded to midwicket for one.
good length ball on off, prodded into the ring for one.
good length ball on middle, pulled flat to deep square leg for one.
back of a length on middle, tries to go back to flick through midwicket but is hustled and miscues it tamely back to Chahar.
full on leg stump, nudged in front of square for one.
full on off, driven to long-off for one.
good length ball on off, punched through the off side for one.
good length ball on middle, defended.
short and wide, cuts this in the air just wide of backward point, sloppy diving effort can't corral the ball and goes to the rope.
flighted too full outside leg stump, free license for Rayudu to break out the slog sweep and bludgeon this high and deep over the midwicket fence.
back of a length on fourth stump, goes to cut, chops it into the ground.
short on sixth stump, goes to cut and sends this to the cover sweeper for one.
good length ball on off at 135 kph, punched into the off side for one.
good length ball on the hips, drop and run into midwicket before Arshdeep can chase it down to deny a single.
short and wide, slapped behind point but picks out the fielder on the ring.
short on the body, pulled behind square for one.
bouncer on middle, doesn't climb that much and Gaikwad ducks under.
back of a length ball on middle at 136 kph, goes to pull and again it skids a touch low under the bat but not low enough to clip the bails.
back of a length on fourth stump, opens the face to run this to deep third man for one.
fullish length on seventh stump at 139 kph, pitched up enough to encourage a drive shoveling this wide over mid-off up in the ring and goes easily to the rope.

similar ball, similar shot, but a very different result! Fullish length wide outside off but Rabada may have dragged the length back ever so slightly. Mayank is still up in the ring at mid-off teasing Gaikwad to go over the top and it results in a miscued skier to Mayank who backpedals and takes the catch reaching above his head.
short ball on off stump, Jadeja sways under it.
fullish length into the pads at 140 kph, flicked through square leg for runs off the pads late on the shot.
full on sixth stump at 141 kph, driven to extra cover.
fullish length at 128 kph on fifth stump, miscues a drive into the off side.
fullish length outside off, backs away to drive and drags an inside edge into the leg side.
slower ball lands full and wide but passes just outside the wide guidelines as Rayudu can't reach this drive. Wide called.
full on leg stump at 127 kph, backs away and goes for a humongous heave and inside edges this just past leg stump to the fine leg rope.
full again on leg stump, this time charges down the pitch and slams it where he intended the previous shot to go, driving it powerfully through mid-on to the rope.
slower bouncer over middle, tries to uppercut this over third man but misses.
slower ball on middle and leg lands full at 114 kph, prods this gently through cover for one.
short and wide, slaps this to point.
nearly a wicket but just clears backward point! Short and wide again, goes to uppercut this a touch and just clears Rishi Dhawan at backward point leaping in vain.
short and very wide, left alone and wide called.
half-tracker on middle, Rayudu shuffles way across and launches a vicious pull into the stands over midwicket. Brings up a half-century in the process.
short and wide, slapped through the off side to the sweeper for one.
full on off, prodded into the covers, poor and unnecessary throw at the bowler's end leads to an overthrow and a second run.

full outside leg, big sweep attempted misses badly, carom goes to point for an extra. The umpire had a very long thought about this before saying not out. Long enough to sucker Mayank into calling for a review. But it looked like it pitched comfortably outside leg stump. Replays confirm the ball pitched several inches outside leg. Punjab Kings lose a review.
slower ball lands short and wide, Jadeja reaches out for a big heave but misses.
Jadeja goes completely across the stumps and gets in line with a length ball on the wide guideline, pulls this to Shikhar at backward square leg who dives to turn a boundary into a single.
yummy desserts continue to be chomped on by Rayudu! Juicy full toss at shin height on leg stump, slaughtered over wide long-on into the stands again.
the kitchen buffet is all you can eat tonight for Rayudu! Another badly misfired attempted yorker winds up as a full toss on the hips, chomp chomp chomp over backward square leg.

short and wide, uppercut high over third man! Massive overcorrection from Sharma after the back-to-back full tosses. Bangs it in way too short on sixth stump and Rayudu cranks it high over the boundary behind square on the off side.
length ball on middle stump, Rayudu charges and spanks this naughty delivery over wide long-on to the rope.
full on the stumps, flicked through the leg side for one.
full and wide yorker, Rayudu shuffles across to get in line to guide this behind point for one.
full and speared into the legs, misses a flick and the carom goes to the off side for an extra.
wide yorker, can't get bat on this well directed delivery by Arshdeep.
wide yorker again, stabbed out again with an open face behind point for one.
overpitched on off, driven firmly through long-on for a sharp two. Rayudu will have the strike for the start of the 18th with 41 off 18 needed to win.
goes for yorker on fourth stump at 133 kph, winds up as a shin high full toss and for once, Rayudu miscues one off the toe fluttering well short of long-off for one.
how good is that?! Slog sweeping Rabada through square leg! Jadeja guesses right on a slower ball wide outside off, shuffles across and mows this through the leg side.
wide yorker at 133 kph on fifth stump, this time jammed out through square leg for one. They wanted two but a sharp relay denies it.
slower bouncer over middle at 117 kph, Rayudu is foxed for once and can't get bat on this trying to go over the off side while backing away.

yorker cleans up Rayudu! He was looking gassed after the resumption from the strategic timeout following his dismantling of Sandeep in the 16th. Rabada was on top of him during this over and spears in another yorker following Rayudu backing away from leg stump. Rayudu misses with a tired heave and it ricochets off his pads onto leg stump.
bouncer on off stump at 136 kph, Dhoni sways back to let it pass. He's going to pick his battle against whoever the bowler is not named Arshdeep to bowl one of the final two overs.
full on leg stump at 137 kph, flicked out through midwicket for one.
goes for wide yorker, it was in the slot on seventh stump at 138 kph, Mayank gets across at extra cover though to deny four runs.

Rabada grows alligator arms at third man! Full and wide yorker, Dhoni slashes it completely uncontrolled with one hand flying off the bat. It was in the air forever but Rabada doesn't come off the rope and claims he's lost it in the lights. Arshdeep throws up his arms in frustration. Had Rabada judged it properly, it was a definite catching opportunity.
yorker speared into the legs, flicked out through the leg side for one.
goes for wide yorker again and gets it fractionally wrong, Dhoni shows no mercy! Shin high full toss on the wide guideline, Dhoni punches this between extra cover and wide long-off to the rope.
in the slot on fifth stump at 128 kph, Dhoni can't get under this as much as he wants to and shovels it flat to long-on, fielded on a bounce by Chahar.
One down, four to go! Length ball into the body at 127 kph, Dhoni swivels across and cleans this high and deep over backward square leg.
slower bouncer on sixth stump and Dhoni lets it pass before a steely glare at the umpires. Wide called on height. It ballooned well over him.
127 kph yorker on middle, jammed out back to Rishi.

it was a wide if he left it! Might have even gone for five wides down the leg side! Instead it's a leading edge skewed to deep midwicket! Half-volley directed well down leg, Dhoni tries to help it on its way over deep backward square ala the first ball of the over but instead it comes almost off the toe and flies to Bairstow who takes a safe catch 15 yards in from the rope at chest height.
slower ball lands full on leg stump, driven firmly along the ground to long-on for one.
goes for yorker on the stumps at 127 kph, but doesn't get it full enough and it lands in the slot for Jadeja to launch this over the long-on rope.
back of a length and nipping into the pads, de Kock doesn't connect with a leg-side flick
on a length and moves away against the angle after hitting the pitch, guided to the covers with an open bat-face
much fuller and outside off, de Kock drives through the line but can't beat mid-off
full on the pads, this is picked away to long leg
wide of the crease, shortish and sliding in, patted to point
shorter and largely holds its line outside off, Rahul rides it down to deep third man
the new ball slides on outside off, pushed back to Shokeen
flatter and quicker outside off, jabbed back to Shokeen once again
down the track, Rahul takes it on the full and stabs it back to Shokeen once again
Rahul manufactures swinging room, Shokeen chases him. A full-toss is drilled to extra-cover
pumped down the ground, beating Pollard to his left from long-on. Darted into middle from round the stumps, Rahul gets under it and lofts it over the bowler's head
speared across off stump, struck only as far as Shokeen once again. Good defensive first over from the 21-year-old offspin-bowling allrounder
short and wide of off, cracked to sweeper cover off the back foot
overpitched on the pads, from over the wicket, duly put away to the midwicket fence. Flicked away through the leg side
shorter and angling across off, Rahul camps back waiting for the change in length. He throws his hands at the ball and scythes it up and over the covers
change of angle, but similar length. Short and outside off, Rahul jumps on top of it and laces it to sweeper cover
Rahul rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and dinks it fine of short third man to steal a single

on a length and outside off, de Kock stays leg-side of the ball and punches it on the up to extra-cover, where the fielder gets his hand on ball, and slows it down. Sweeper cover mops it up in the deep
length-ball nip-backer from Bumrah, thuds into Rahul's pads. Umpire Erasmus shakes his head. The ball pings the back thigh actually, was it bouncing over the stumps? MI decide against a review
good length and bending back into off, defended back to him
Bumrah brings another one back into Rahul, he jams an inside edge onto the pad. The ball trickles away to the leg side
back of a length and veering into the pads, beating the inside edge, the sharp angle might have pushed it down the leg side. MI decide against another review

Dropped by Tilak Varma. He parries it over the midwicket boundary for six. Overpitched on the pads, de Kock picks it up and whips it over the top. Varma misjudges it at the leg-side boundary and gives up six

Varma's drop costs MI only six runs. de Kock is caught at short cover next ball. Low full-toss on off, de Kock drives weakly and chips it in the air. (Mis)hits it more or less straight to Rohit who snags a low catch in the infield
short and outside off, punched to point off the back foot
on a length and nips away outside off, Rahul aims to dink it down to deep third man but is beaten in the channel
shorter and outside off, Rahul rides the bounce and finds a single to the right of deep third man
shortish and skidding into middle, Meredith has Pandey hopping and fending to midwicket
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Pandey punches up to mid-off
back of a length and slanting into off, 138.5ks, Pandey closes the bat-face and turns it between mid-on and midwicket
fullish and angling away just a shade outside off, defended by Pandey
on a length and sliding across off, patted to point
kicks up from a length and angling away outside off, spliced in the air but does not carry to cover
Pandey whisks it to mid-off and takes on Shokeen's arm for a risky single. Shokeen lands awkwardly on his right shoulder and fails to release the ball properly
back of a length and slanting away outside off, run away to the right of backward point
Pandey backs away outside leg, but Unadkat follows him, flat-batted straight to mid-off. Good powerplay for MI. They concede only 32 runs for the wicket of de Kock
short and angling across off, slashed away off the back foot to sweeper cover
slower cutter from Sams, leaves Rahul and misses the outside edge
another offcutter from Sams, Rahul is early into the drive and is beaten once again
pitched-up delivery outside off, driven through the line to wide long-off
back of a length and angling across off, cut away off the back foot wide of sweeper cover
full and on the stumps, whipped away through midwicket
full and turning into middle, asks Rahul to hit to the longer side, worked away through midwicket
Pandey advances at Shokeen. He drags the length back and gets it to break in from outside off, draws an inside edge that rolls past leg stump
low full-toss on off, tapped away to wide long-off
shovelled away with the bottom wrist to the right of long-on. You can't get it past Pollard there
down the track and whipped away to the left of deep midwicket. Varma swoops down on the ball and keeps it to one
tossed up around off, eased down to long-on. Rahul will keep strike
guided to point as Unadkat takes pace off the ball
another cutter into the pitch, Rahul stabs it to Rohit at short-cover and takes off. Rohit can't throw the stumps down at the non-striker's end
wide of the crease, shorter and angling in from outside off, forced down to long-off
near yorker-length delivery on the leg stump, squirted away through square leg
Rohit makes a sprawling save to pile up the pressure on Pandey. He throws himself to his right from backward point and ensures it's just a single
hauled away over midwicket for six. 114.7ks slower ball from Unadkat, sits up to be smacked. Rahul obliges and pulls it from outside off over the leg side
full on the pads, whipped away to deep square leg
hard-length delivery, skids into the thigh pad, rushing Rahul for pace
Pandey finds the release. Overpitched on the stumps, Pandey lines up this slot ball and swings it over Pollard at long-on
Pandey backs away outside leg, Meredith follows him and keeps him to a single down to long-on
dug in short and angling into Rahul's body. He gets on top of it and pulls it away between deep square and deep midwicket, finding the longer boundary

forced away to the right of sweeper cover. Meredith attempts another short ball, the line is outside off. However, this one sticks in the pitch. Rahul has all the time in the world to crunch it away over the off side
short and holds its line outside off, Pandey stays leg-side of the ball and punches to short cover
flat-batted over mid-off. Spliced over Pollard rather. Dug in shorter and outside off, Pandey can't middle this, but enough to come back for the second
chest-high short ball, angling into middle, pulled away to deep midwicket

pulled away to the right of deep midwicket. Bumrah tests Rahul with the short ball now. He swivels on the back foot and heaves it away. Shokeen, I think, slides across to his right in vain, as the ball wins the race
short and holds its line outside off, punched away past extra-cover for a double
low full-toss angling into middle, tucked away to deep midwicket. Rahul brings up his fifty off 37 balls. He needs to turn up the tempo now
back of a length and outside off, 118ks and into the pitch, as Rahul flays and misses outside off. Pollard thinks he has his man, but that didn't kiss the edge
good length and on middle and leg, clipped down to long-on
Pandey shimmies out, manufactures swinging room, and thrashes it to the covers
short on middle and leg, this on-pace delivery is punched down to long-on

Pandey charges at Pollard and top-edges it to short fine leg. He falls for a run-a-ball 22. Pandey advances at the bowler, Pollard bangs it shorter and outside off to mess with Pandey's pull. Spliced to Meredith
slower one outside off, stabbed away to the off side
picked up and whipped away for six. Overpitched on middle, Rahul gets underneath it and shovels it over wide long-on with some nonchalance. He has turned up the tempo at the Wankhede
full and angling across off, too wide, off-side wide
another off-side wide from Sams. Shorter but past the tramline again
Sams tries the slower ball but can't get his line right. Sprays another off-side wide
on-pace full ball wide of off. Rahul reaches out for the ball and carves a six over backward point. Short third man is also inside the circle. Poor over from Sams
another cutter from Sams, hides it away from Rahul. Inside the tramline
Sams loses his line once again. Yet another off-side wide. The offcutter goes awry. Rohit isn't pleased
slower offcutter finishes on off stump, tapped to short-cover
Stoinis holes out to Varma at deep midwicket. Rohit applauds it. Slower short ball on the stumps from Sams. Stoinis pulls this chest-high delivery straight to Varma in the outfield
tip and run to point. Sams finishes the over well for MI

Pollard now nips out Krunal. Caught at deep midwicket. Cutter from Pollard, takes it away from Pandya. He fetches it from outside off and drags a pull to Shokeen. The Wankhede crowd roars. LSG continue to wobble around Rahul
whipped down to long-on as Hooda gets off the mark
slower ball, floated into middle and leg, tucked away to deep midwicket. Varma runs in and hunts down the ball
pitched-up delivery just a shade outside off, but there's no pace for Hooda to work with, played back to Pollard
back of a length on middle and leg, whipped through midwicket. They take on Surya's arm for a double. Good urgency from LSG
short and angling into middle and leg, Hooda flaps it away through midwicket
back of a length on middle, Hooda eyes up the leg side, but ends up chipping it to off via a leading edge
on-pace full ball, angling across off stump, driven with a slicing finish to sweeper cover
overpitched and outside off, Hooda lays into it, drilling a drive to the right of short-cover and left of long-off
slower ball on the hips, clipped away through backward square leg
low full-toss on middle and leg, chiselled out to deep midwicket
slower bouncer outside off, Hooda swings but does so early and hence can't touch it
on-pace short ball wide of off, with third man and point inside the circle. Rahul cracks a cut over point for four
slower short ball from Meredith, Rahul is early into the pull, off the thigh pad and dribbles behind to Kishan

Meredith gets away with that. He knows it and has a wry smile on his face. Short and into the pitch, finishes on the hips. Possibly a slower variation. Hooda flaps it weakly to short fine leg where Brevis pouches the catch
heaved away to deep square leg as Badoni gets off the mark straightaway
bouncer angling down the leg side, Kishan leaps to collect it. Wide called
slower ball outside off, Rahul delays the drive and opens the bat-face to find a single through the cover-point region
slower offcutter, which is nurdled through square leg for a couple of runs
Bumrah searches for a wide yorker, but this is overpitched and outside off. Rahul reaches out for the ball and carves it through point for four
back of a length and outside off, stabbed away to extra-cover for a single
bouncer outside off, Badoni aims to ramp it over the keeper, but the ball sails past him to the keeper
low full-toss on off stump, which is bunted down to long-on
perfectly acceptable yorker just a shade outside off, squirted to point
low full-toss on a fourth-stump line, Rahul waits deep in the crease for the yorker. Opens the bat-face at the last instant and manipulates it past cover for four. Beats sweeper cover in the deep too
low full-toss on middle and leg, tucked away to long leg
forced to sweeper cover
Badoni ventures outside leg, Unadkat chases the moving batter with a cutter and keeps him to a single on the off side
slower short ball, Rahul lines up this hip-high delivery and swats the offcutter over square leg
Unadkat searches for the yorker on the stumps, but ends up overpitching it. Rahul gets underneath it and drills it over Unadkat's head for four. Rahul even had the umpire ducking for cover
on-pace short ball on the stumps, Rahul brings out another pull, this time he pings the midwicket fence
off-stump yorker, dug out to long-on. Terrific execution from Bumrah
low full-toss on off, sliced away to Sams at deep point
another yorker that tails into off and middle, squirted down to long-on
middle-stump yorker, Rahul can only dig it back to Bumrah
low full-toss on middle, this attempted yorker is clipped away to deep midwicket

An over full of yorkers or low full-tosses from Bumrah. Outstanding bowling. Badoni shuffles across off even before Bumrah hits the blockhole. He goes for a scoop but can only miscue it back towards Bumrah
Rahul launches it over midwicket for six. His second century vs MI this season. On-pace short ball outside off, this hip-high delivery is pummeled over the leg side
yorker on middle, squeezed away to sweeper cover
smoked over long-on for six. Overpitched and outside off, slower offcutter but this is right in the slot and it disappears over the boundary
Picks put Pollard at long-on. On-pace full ball on the stumps, Meredith lands this in the swinging arc as well. But Badoni can't get enough elevation on this occasion
lifter climbs over the stumps, Holder hooks and misses
Holder swings and misses outside off once again. This is much fuller, but he can't touch it
length ball angling in, extra bounce as well. Kishan looks to flick it away but gets hit on the thigh
short of length but angling way down the leg side. de Kock dives across but had no chance to stop this
140.9kph. A length ball nipping in just touch. Extra bounce as well. Kishan looks to defend but gets an inside edge onto the body. Think he was a bit late on it as well
short of length outside off, steered towards third man. Kishan gets off the mark
length ball angling across. Goes for the cut but misses. Too wide
length ball angling across. Looks to work it on the off side but fails to connect once again
length ball outside off, defends it towards cover
up and over. One-bounce four. Short and wide once again and Rohit doesn't miss out on this occasion. Cuts it over backward point for four
length ball outside off, stretches forward and defends it towards covers
length ball, just outside off. Kishan defends it awkwardly towards backward point
length ball on the stumps, defended back towards the bowler

whoa! Short of length from Chameera and takes off. Kishan was on the front foot and looked to pull it away. Gets beaten and is hit on the left shoulder. The ball lobs behind the stumps. de Kock takes a couple of steps forward and pouches it. A mild enquiry but it seems everyone knows there was no bat involved. Kishan is in pain though. The physio comes out to tend to him
fuller length outside off, pushes at it and beats the diving backward point on his right. Third man cuts it off

a direct hit would have been interesting. Fuller around off, Rohit flicks it towards short midwicket and takes a step down. Kishan commits to it and is a quarter down the pitch. He retraces his steps as the fielder fields the ball and a shy at the bowler's end. He misses and Kishan survives
a length ball around off. Kishan dabs it towards point for one
nicely done! Short of length around off. Rohit goes back and across slightly and pulls it down to the left of short fine leg
Holder adjusts his line a touch, gets slightly outside off but Rohit tucks it away with the angle. A single to midwicket
Kishan tries to make room to exploit the short boundary on the off side but Holder follows him and cramps him for room with a length ball. Defended in the end
length ball around off, looks to drop and run but he played it with firm hands towards extra cover
fuller length around off, Kishan comes on the front foot but can only push it back towards the bowler. He is on 3 off 12 balls now
smashed down the ground. Length ball around off, Rohit uses his feet and hits it straight of mid-on. One-bounce four
length ball around off, defended towards point
length ball on the stumps, defended on the leg side
short of length around off, Rohit goes for the pull but ends up dragging it towards mid-on
a low full toss on the stumps, flicked towards long leg
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards mid-off
length ball around off, punched towards long-off
length ball around off, cuts it towards cover
length ball around off, checks his shot and works it towards point for a single
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards deep midwicket
length ball on the stumps, goes back and gives himself some room to drag it towards long-on
timed for four. Fuller around off, Rohit goes inside out and helps it over extra cover. Effortlessly done
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards deep midwicket
length ball around off, looks to work it on the leg side but gets an inside edge onto the pads

An offcutter. length ball outside off and coming into the batter. Rohit was looking to work it towards midwicket but gets beaten on the inside edge. de Kock does well behind the stumps, diving to his left and taking it low with one hand
use of feet to pull this short ball. Looked like more of a top edge but it sails over deep square leg boundary
Holder overcompensates but Rohit is up to hit. Clears his front leg and hits it over mid-off. Not the best of the timing but enough to clear to fielder for four
short of length around off and middle. Swivels and pulls it down towards deep-backward square leg
length ball on the stumps, turned towards midwicket
length ball on the leg stump, goes down on one knee and sweeps it towards deep square leg
length ball around off, punched towards extra cover
length ball on the stumps, flicked to the left of deep midwicket and they sprint back for the second
length ball on the stumps, stays back and punches it towards deep extra cover
short of length, darted towards the off stump. Goes back and pulls it into the ground towards long-on. Not the best of the timings

An appeal for caught at slip, off a rebound of de Kock's shoe. The umpires have referred it upstairs. Was short and wide outside off, Kishan had to really reach out for it. He ends up bottom-edging it onto de Kock's left shoe and bounces off towards Holder at first slip. A simple catch for him but it almost slips out of his hands as he takes it in front of his face, but he recovers well to hold on to it. The question is if it bounced just before hitting de Kock's shoe. No, it didn't. A bizarre end to a bizarre innings
length ball sliding on middle, tucked away behind square leg. Two is the call and they get it comfortably
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards deep midwicket
fuller on the stumps, digs it out towards extra cover
pitched up once again, pushed back towards the bowler
fuller outside off, Rohit goes for a cover drive but I think it was a googly. He gets an inside edge past the keeper and collects two
short of length around off. Goes for a pull but gets a bottom edge onto his thigh
length ball outside off, pushed towards cover off the back foot

short of length outside off, Brevis hops and goes for the upper cut but ends up edging it towards third man. Chameera takes a couple of steps in and takes it just inches above the ground. He was slow to start and for a moment, it looked like it might lands in front of him
length ball outside off, goes for the cut. The point fielder dives to his right and makes a partial stop
a touch fuller this time. Defended on the front foot
short of length around off, goes for the pull but gets the toe end of the bat, and the ball bounces towards long-on
fuller on the leg stump, goes for the reverse sweep but fails to connect and gets hit on the pads
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards deep midwicket
length ball on the pads, flicked in front of square leg for another single
Huge wicket! Fuller length around off, Rohit goes for the slog over deep midwicket but gets a top edge. Gowtham settles under it at short third man
length ball outside off, cuts it towards point and gets off the mark
length ball on the stumps, looks to push it towards long-on/midwicket but gets a leading edge on the off side. Well short of extra cover though
fuller outside off, digs it out towards extra cover
fuller around off, looks to work it on the leg side but gets an outside edge behind point
a googly on middle and leg. Looks to launch it over leg side but misses and gets hit on the pads. An appeal for lbw but this was heading down
length ball around off, punched towards long-on
length ball angling across, cuts it behind point where a diving stop keeps it to one
a half-tracker down the leg side and Surya helps it over the keeper for four
short of length around off and middle. Goes back and pulls it towards deep-backward square leg
and he gets Suryakumar. Length ball around off, angled across. Surya looks to whip it on the leg side but gets a leading edge towards extra cover. Rahul dives forward to pouch it with both hands
length ball on the stumps, punched towards long-on
fuller on the stumps, driven towards long-on for one more
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards midwicket. Rahul charges in but fails to collect the ball and ends up conceding an extra run
length ball around off, stays back and punches it towards long-off
fuller length around off, pushes it towards mid-off and sets off. Looked risky for a moment but Pollard makes it comfortably in the end
short of length, Varma moves across and looks to pull but he is late on the shot. The ball brushes the glove and hits him on the body on its way to fine leg
short of length on the stumps, Pollard defends it
short of length, Pollard hops and tucks it down towards deep-backward square leg
lands safe! Another short one from Chameera. Around off. Varma goes for the pull but is too late. Gets a top edge that lobs towards square leg. de Kock runs in but cannot reach there
another short one but way down the leg side. Left alone
short of length at the body, manages to work it behind square leg
fuller around off, clears his front leg and launches it over long-off. All the way
length ball going across, cuts it towards short third man
length ball way outside off and going further away from the batter who attempts another cut but cannot connect this time. Called a wide

length ball angling across, cuts it in front of point this time. Badoni makes a two-handed sliding stop to his left but the ball is still rolling towards the boundary. He gets up and dives again to stop it. Stays just inside the boundary all this while
is that the game-changing over? Fuller around off, gets down on one knee and launches it for a six. Over deep midwicket. The crowd has come alive
fuller around off, pushed through covers
fuller outside off, comes forward and smothers it
short of length on middle and leg, tucked away behind square leg
short of length on the stumps, dropped in front of square leg. The bowler fields it himself
short of length on the stumps, moves across and works it towards fine leg. Runs the first one hard but there is not chance to come back for the second
fuller outside off, driven towards deep extra cover
length ball around off, 126.9kph. Dabs it behind point for one
short of length angling across. Pollard looks to dab it behind point but fails to connect
short of length outside off and Varma hits it over extra cover for four. That will help in bringing down the asking rate somewhat
slightly fuller than the last ball. Angling outside off. But Varma moves across and pulls it over midwicket for one-bounce four. That's the shorter side
