goes for the yorker but just misses his mark. Varma takes it on the full and works it towards deep square leg
short of length but down the leg side. Pollard ignores it
walks towards the bowler but Holder bangs it short, into the body. Pollard had to take the evasive action in the end. It goes over his left shoulder
goes for the yorker but ends up bowling a low full toss on the stumps. Flicked towards deep square leg
ends up bowling a full toss but Varma can only hit it along the ground towards long-off
starts with a short ball at the batter. Varma moves towards the leg side and pulls it down towards deep midwicket
a flat six. Was short around off, Pollard rocks back and pulls it in front of square leg
a length ball around off, Pollard is caught in two minds. Looks to pull but ends up defending it. An inside edge onto the body
length ball around off, drags it towards deep midwicket
length ball angling towards the batter. Varma backs away and steers it towards short third man
length ball angled across, at 123.6kph. Pollard goes for the pull but is early into the shot and gets beaten
a full toss around off, hits it aerially towards long-off but didn't get the timing right. The fielder moves to his left and keeps it to one
fuller and wider outside off, Pollard mistimes it towards long-off
a slower one, way outside off though. Varma goes reverse and looks to scoop it over short third man but cannot connect. Called a wide
another slower one. Well outside off once again. Varma looks to fetch it from there and work it on the leg side but he fails to connect. Had he not attempted a shot, this could have been a wide
fuller around off, hits it aerially down the ground. Pandey at long-on moves to his right and gets low to stop the ball. He flicks it to long-off but they get two

hit well but hit straight to Bishnoi. A full toss outside off, Varma looks to go leg side once again but Bishnoi takes a smart catch at deep midwicket, moving to his left and getting on his knees to pouch it with reverse cups
almost a wide yorker. Sams gets an inside edge towards fine leg
fuller but wide outside off. Ignored
Full and wide outside off, Sams fails to connect this time. I think Chameera got away with it, should have been a wide
another attempted wide yorker. Sams gets it on the full and hits it towards long-off
fuller and wider, angling across the batter. Pollard hits it towards long-off for a single. He is on 18 off 18 now
fuller and wider once again. Sams throws his bat at it but cannot connect. He is looking towards the umpire again but this time it was inside the tramline
fuller and wider. Sams moves across and takes it on the full. Swings across and gets it to the right of square leg. Rahul there and he dives across to make the stop
another wide yorker, Pollard digs it out towards square leg
fired in outside off, straight into the gloves of de Kock. Called a wide

KP gets KP, for the second time in the match. Fuller on the stumps, Pollard flicks it uppishly towards deep midwicket but no real effort or power behind it. Hooda slides across and takes the catch. Pandya almost jumps over Pollard and puts his hand the batter's head. Pollard doesn't react to it
length ball on the stumps, mistimes the slog towards long-on

Unadkat has been run out. A length ball on the stumps, Sams swings across but manages only to short fine leg. Unadkat is three quarters down the pitch but Sams hasn't even moved. He isn't interested in single. Unadkat tries to get back to his end but even with a wayward throw he fails and Kurnal takes the bails off
length ball that curves away from off stump, Faf steers it to point
tight line around off, pushed into the off side
width and slapped away past a diving Williamson at cover. Absolutely walloped that
gets this full delivery to bend back into middle, defended into the leg side
flayed on the up to point, a half-stop means they'll scamper a run
moving across the left-hander, Rawat lets it go
length ball on middle and leg, defended

flattens the off-stump! The previous one nipped in, this one held its line. Faf is squared up by the length, he had to play at that alright, and he did so down the wrong line. What a ball, what a wicket.

snuffed him out in the slips! Golden duck for Kohli. A second in a row. Full and angling across, Kohli pushes with hard hands at the one that holds its line, and because he has jabbed at that, it flies at a comfortable height to second slip. Full marks to Williamson for bringing back the second slip for Kohli. He couldn't have asked for an easier offering.
slants one across, left alone. No hat-trick
zippy length ball but way down leg, good take by Pooran
looks to slash that over point but misses. Wide called and rightly so. It was sprayed too far wide across
floated full on off, pushed to cover as he scampers a quick single

another edge, another catch in the slips. Markram dives to his right in front of first slip to catch that. Jansen gets this to move away, drawa Rawat forwardf with the length, he pushes at that without any conviction and gets the edge that is pouched safely.
full and swinging away in off, pushed between cover and mid-off
rises with the bounce and pats it into the off side
shapes away off the seam from length outside off, left alone
pushes feebly outside the line, squirted off an inside edge to square leg
squared up but he gets a thick edge down to third man as he's nearly done in by late movement
full outside off, left alone
full and swinging back into middle and leg, Maxwell looks to whip it over square leg but is hit on the pad
neatly flicked into the gap at square leg and this races away. Welcome boundary. Rolled his wrists nicely to keep it down
has a heave at that but misses. Did he try to whack that across the road?
errs in length and ends up spraying it full and Maxwell opens the bat face late to drive this between cover and point. Top shot
drops short and angling in, pulled to deep square
dug in short and angling away, Suyash sways out of the way
length on middle, Maxwell gets a thick inside edge onto the pad as he defends

got him! Terrific from Williamson at mid-off. Maxwell looks to clear the infield but skews this off the bottom. Williamson still had to run in a bit from the edge of the ring, which he did, before putting in a full-length dive forward to complete an excellent catch inches from the ground. Didn't take too many replays for the third umpire to uphold the on-field soft signal. Willamson did superbly to get his body out of the way so that he could toll forward without much of an impact as he landed on his elbows. What thinking.
full outside off, pushed to point
attacks the stumps from wide of the crease, defended back
full and swinging away from outside off, left alone
free runs! Looks for some late inswing but ends up spraying this too far down leg, keeper had no chance.
squirted back down the pitch as he pushes outside the line of this full delivery
full but starts feom outside leg, so it's a wide down leg
full outside off, whipped to mid-on
zippy length ball angling away, left alone
chopped down to the keeper off a thick bottom edge. Was looking to steer it behind point
goes ocer cover, and just about manages to elude a diving Williamson running over to his left from mid-off. Superman like effort that time. Ah, just past.
thrashed to cover where a misfield allows a singe. Tripathi with the slip up. It was drilled by Suyash
gentle tap into the off side, looks for a single but is sent back
drifting down leg, misses the tickle. Wide
squirted to point. Hint of turn there as he bowls full on middle
drilled back to the bowler
skids one through on a length outside off, chopped wide of point for a single
tucks this wide of square leg, sensibly done
flicks the pad on the way through to Pooran down leg. Suyash was looking to pull this

worked with the drift to the man coming in from deep square, excellent running to get two and then one off an overthrow courtey a misfield at the bowler's end. Williamson, covering up, could have done better.
starts with a bouncer! Ah, thuds into the keeper's gloves to elicit a big grin from Pooran. <b>146kph! <b> Suyash beaten for pace as he tries to pull
145.1kph delivery moving away from outside off, beaten as he tries to flay that away
walks across the stumps and whips it into the gap at midwicket, neatly done
fires another length ball at 146kph outside off, Shahbaz plays and misses
snorter! Shahbaz can smell leather as Umran follows him with a short ball into the body. Somehow he managed to get out of the way
beaten as he shapes to pull. Second bouncer for the over, so it will be a no-ball Shahbaz is beaten for raw pace
came in like rocket, left the bat like thunder. Backed away, got underneath the length and lofted him over cover.
heaved across the line to get this into the gap at wide long-on. Suyash was looking to loft it straighter

have they got him? They're looking upstairs. Suyash is beaten as he looks to heave this over square leg. Have to see if his back foot was dragged back before the bails were ripped off. Because this has been referred upstairs, they will have to look for an edge too. Replays confirm there's none. Replays also confirm his backfoot was way outside the crease when the bails came off. Things are going from bad to worse for RCB.
drifting down leg, swept to short fine
nice tight line on the stumps, DK defends back

called wide as he sips it down. DK was looking to sweep, and may have appeared to have got some bat on it. Suchith and Pooran went up straight away and asked for a review. Yes, there's a spike as the ball passes the glove. DK is gone and RCB slip further Pooran did well to hold on despite being blinded, got the ball lodging between his legs.
driven straight to cover
steered down to square third man, a lazy effort in the deep allows a second

appeal for caught behind. SRH think there was some glove. The umpire was walking across, seemingly to send it upstairs. He does go up to check if this was a clean catch, but there was no doubt as to whether Shahbaz gloved it or not. The catch is clean too and RCB slip into the abyss.
has Wanindu hopping and moving in the crease. That was a 149kph thunderbolt. Beaten
full outside off, Wanindu's feet glued to the crease as he lets it go
floats it full on the stumps, squirted to the off side
attacks the stumps by bowling full from wide of the crease, somehow Wanindu manages to get behind the line and defend
tickled down leg, down to fine leg.
tossed up but slips it down, another wide called
lunges forward and blocks
steps out and slices the drive to cover
tossed up on middle, defended back
shortish outside off, slapped to deep point
fired in full, pushed to cover
hustled for pace as Wanindu hops back and tucks it to midwicket for a single
beaten for pace as he looks to punch on the up through point
slips it too far wide outside off, wide called as Wanindu misses the slash
given out onfield but looks as if it has come off Wanindu's pad as he played back to a full delivery. Wanindu went up immediately Yes, ultra edge confirms the sound was of the ball flicking the pad.
rooted to the crease as he tries to flick this full ball angling down, off the pad to the keeper
fiery length ball on the stumps at 145.8kph, defended back
squirts this full delivery off the outer part of the bat to mid-off
the off-stump goes on a cartwheel! Harshal plays down the wrong line as this full delivery hits the seam and jags away. Grave mistake
full on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
dug in short on middle, Hazlewood sways out of the way of this one
works it down to mid-on
gently pats it wide of point for an easy single
full on off, late tail away, squirted to point
floated full outside off from wide of the crease, driven wide of cover
full and angling in from wide of the crease, worked to midwicket
backs away and slashes to point
steered to short third. This one is a tad slower at 140.5kph
feeble push at this full delivery with his feet going nowhere, beaten
goes full on the stumps, kept out. Umran bowls out. 1-13
slashed down to deep point
squeezed wide of point for a single
sways away from this shortball on the stumps
saw this in his arc and absolutely bludgeoned that through the covers
beaten as Jansen takes the pace off this length ball he slants across
defended to the off side, the cover fielder hits direct at the striker's end and they get one off the ricochet
length on middle, defended
the stumps are flattened! Wanindu attempts a mow across the line but missed it completely.
goes full on the stumps, defended
tries to make room and slap this away but doesn't get power behind that, somehow gets it to mid-off and Siraj off the mark
nicely done. Arches back and helps this short ball over the infield to deep point
follows Siraj as he angles in a length ball from around the wicket, Siraj backs away and pushes it wide of point

straight up, so high that Williamson sizes up the distance and trajectory by taking a split second, then runs back two steps, stops and then again moves back to keep his balance as the ball descends ands completes an excellent catch moving to his left from cover. Siraj tried to give it the kitchen sink but had no timing.
fullish length angled across fifth stump, Sharma drives at this and is beaten by a 139 kph delivery.
back of a length on middle on 139 kph, defended back to Siraj.
back of a length angled across fifth stump at 132 kph, punched wide of cover but a stumbling stop on the ring prevents a run.
length ball on fifth stump at 138 kph, goes to swat this down the ground and bottom edges this to square leg to get the chase off the mark.
back of a length on off at 136 kph, defended to point.
back of a length tailing down leg, wide called.
back of a length on sixth stump at 137 kph, left alone.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended to backward point.
back of a length on off, defended back to Hazlewood.
back of a length on middle at 132 kph, defended in front of point.
whack! Short ball on fifth stump at 129 kph, sits up for a front foot pull to sail high and wide of mid-on, but dribbles short of the rope as they come back for three.
fullish length ball on fourth stump, driven wide of extra cover for one.
length ball angled across sixth stump, finally some width to free the arms with a back foot punch that finds the gap through point to the rope.
back of a length angled into the thigh, flicked behind square for one.

pow! Shot of the day (well there weren't really many nominees in the first innings) over extra cover. Length ball angled across fifth stump, flays this on the up high over extra cover and lands just beyond the rope.
short on the body, swivel short arm jab pull fine past the keeper just guiding it on its way to the fine leg rope.
fullish length ball on the legs, misses a flick off the pads and trickles to the keeper.
good length ball on off, defended to mid-off but they pinch a run.
back of a length on fifth stump, guided with soft hands to deep third man for one.
back of a length on off, defended to square leg.
short on the thigh at 131 kph, goes to pull and misses off the padding, goes to fine leg for an extra.
short outside off on sixth stump, sits up for a thumping pull wide of mid-on that teases the man on the ring into a fruitless diving effort before going to the rope.
good length ball on off, defended to the leg side.
short and wide, slashed high over backward point and beats deep third man to the rope.
back of a length on fifth stump, punched behind point, major hesitation between the batters but a run becomes possible thanks to a Kohli misfield.
length ball angled across sixth stump at 115 kph, sits up to be punished off the back foot through cover to the rope.
fullish length in the slot outside off on sixth stump, shoveled on the up high over extra cover and bounces away to the rope.
back of a length on fifth stump, tentative poke comes off a thick edge but lands short of short third man on the ring, fielded on one bounce.
good length ball on off, tap and run into the covers.
slower ball on off stump on a good length at 114 kph, defended to short third man.
full on the stumps, defended to midwicket.
back of a length on middle, defended to midwicket.
back of a length on fifth stump at 128 kph, guided wide of short third man for one.
pure class! Back of a length on fourth stump, Williamson just opens the face to run this between the keeper and gully to the rope.
back of a length on the hips at 132 kph, flicked to deep square leg for one.
slower ball strays on the legs on a good length at 119 kph, flicked through fine leg to the rope.

what a shot! Almost a carbon copy of the six he hit earlier over extra cover except this one doesn't carry all the way. Length ball on sixth stump, flays this on the up but gets more elevation than distance and bounces over the rope.
Kane uses his feet first ball and drives a full ball from off stump over mid-on to the rope.
missed runout! Good length ball on off, guided behind point. They scamper a tight run as the throw to the non-striker's end is just wide by Kohli running out from slip to field an throw.
good length ball on off, defended into the leg side.
good length ball on off, prodded into midwicket past the diving fielder for one.
full on middle, defended to midwicket.
full toss low on off, Kane charges and strokes this to long-off for one.
good length ball on off, guided to backward point, diving stop by Maxwell saves a run... until he needlessly chucks a wild throw to the non-striker's end from his knees for an overthrow.

Sharma falls trying to bring up his half-century and end the match all at once with a six! Length ball on fifth stump, shovels this high toward long-on. Easy catch by Rawat shuffling to his right about 10 yards in from his rope, catch taken at chest height.
wide yorker on fifth stump, can't jam this out.
another wide yorker, this time guided out to third man for one.
back of a length on fifth stump, guides this to deep third man for one.
leg-stump half-volley flicked over square leg ends the match!
starts on the pads and Saha tucks it down to fine leg off the pads. Not off the mark yet, it's a leg bye
good bounce for the length ball outside off, Gill watches it go to the keeper
shapes it into the stumps from off and Gill helps it down to fine leg too, for two
Umesh still not on target properly, another one coming in towards middle and leg, and Gill middles that flick just behind square with good timing to send that along the ground for four
pulls the length back, nips it in with good bounce, and Gill defends the rising ball to leg for a quick one
short and slightly wide, Saha steers it straight to point

wicket first ball for Southee, nicked down the leg side! Not a great ball, but lovely seam position for that length ball on middle and leg it goes down further with the angle, Gill wants to tickle it fine but he's done it too fine and Billings grabs it with both hands
covers for the outswing outside off and defends the length ball with his head down
nice outswing but too full outside off and he drives it into the covers for two, off the mark
more width, a touch shorter, and he crashes that into the point boundary off the back foot. Cracking shot! Stayed back in the crease, let it swing away and scythed that square
down the leg side again, Hardik chases to play it fine but it goes for a wide
driven over the covers for four more! Too full and wide, Hardik makes it fuller by taking a step down outside the crease and drives that over the in-field

nearly run-out by Southee! Hardik was gone by a few miles had Southee struck. He came down the track again and Southee adjusted well to pitch it short and bang the ball into his body, Hardik can only lob it on the pitch and he's way outside. Southee swoops in and has a shy at the stumps but just misses the leg sump. Hardik is grinning, obviously
too full, nearly in the block hole on off, and Saha pushes it down to mid-on for one
just short of midwicket! Fullish and coming in, Hardik flicks uppishly and it lands just short of a diving midwicket fielder to his left
short and wide, jagging in off the seam which means Saha can't middle the back foot punch
stays back to slash the short ball again outside off but finds cover
pulled over deep backward square for six! There is a fielder at deep square leg as fine leg is in, Umesh bangs in a bouncer and Saha pivots nicely on the back foot to middle that pull behind square

smoked on the other side of deep square leg! Another short ball, this one doesn't rise as much, and Saha does well to pick the gap on the other side of Andre Russell on the leg side, and dispatches it for four to deep midwicket
into the pads from Southee and Hardik flicks it behind square for two more in the gap
shorter and outside off, he stays back and pushes it down to mid-off
nipping into the stumps and he nudges it to leg for one
strays down the leg side again, another wide from Southee
short on middle and leg, Saha hops on the back foot and defends to leg for one
128.7kmh, takes one hand off the bat as Southee bowls a slightly scrambled seam and Hardik can't middle that push to cover
on length outside off and he drives to deep point for one
141.1kmh, slightly full outside off and he steers to deep point for one
back of length and he helps it to short third man for one
short and wide, but not that wide, and Hardik runs it down towards third man for one more
108.7kmh, slow offcutter outside off, Saha has enough time to see the change of pace and help it towards point
drives on the up, doesn't middle it at all as the ball seams in from length, the thick edge goes between mid-on and midwicket and the fielder does well to just keep it in at wide long-on
another good over for just six. He angles it in towards the stumps with good pace, and Hardik helps it to midwicket
slightly short and outside off with the angle, Saha steers it just wide of a diving point for one
hint of room outside off and he punches it into the covers for one
on the pads and flicked away easily for one
backs away a little, Narine bowls an offbreak slightly quicker at 92kmh and Hardik nudges to leg for one
slightly full but very straight on middle, Saha defends it back
shorter and outside off with the angle, he waits and cuts straight to point

137.7kmh, Nitish Rana is keeping Hardik on his toes, there's a chance of a run-out at the bowler's end. Short ball angling in, Hardik went on his toes to defend to leg and was ambling across to the other end but saw Rana swoop in and throw it to the other end quickly, which made Hardik rush. A direct hit also leads to overthrows
full around off and he drills it down to mid-off
ramps it for six! Hardik barely moves his body, it's all hand-eye. Short ball outside off, Hardik waits and waits and sticks his bat out in the end to send that fine for six!
the full ball after the short ball, it's a slow offcutter and Hardik drills that with disdain just wide of mid-off for a powerful four
and now a short ball after the full one, overdoes it and it's a wide outside off
good comeback to bang it in short and into the body, Hardik doesn't have any room and defends it back
goes across and taps the short of length ball to leg for one. Keeps strike
hello, Varun! Booming six over long-off. Not a bad ball, on length outside off but many good balls fall in Hardik's arc and he lofts that high over long-off
goes for another booming drive on the off side, but misses this time
length ball turning in from outside off, pushed to cover
makes room early for a bit shot but it's slightly short and he cuts towards short third man for a quick single
waits on the back foot and steers it wide of point for one
screams out a "no" after pushing the length ball into the covers
short ball outside off, he hops and punches it down towards mid-off
lands just short of deep square leg! Length ball on the stumps, Saha swings across the line to leg and nearly hands a catch in the deep
short and wide, slammed over the covers as Hardik gets width to free his arms, and gets two

just beats mid-off! The ball is stopping on this pitch a little, and nearly got Hardil's wicket this time. He looked to work it to leg, got a leading edge down the ground and Narine ran back from mid-off but it fell just wide of him
short outside off, Saha cuts but finds point
swings to the leg side and misses completely! A length ball shoots up from outside off, Saha wants to pull a ball that's not short at all, and doesn't even come close
short of length and turning in, pushes it down to long-on for one
on length on the stumps, he makes room but punches it straight to cover
some flight on leg, works it off the pad behind square for one
short on middle, Hardik works it square to leg for one more
full and flighted, Saha drives uppishly towards deep point for two
turning in towards the stumps and Saha wants a single by tapping it to point but he's sent back
Length ball angling in, flicked through midwicket for a single.
Cheeky and effective. Saha moves across the stumps and plays the scoop to the length ball. Gets it well over short fine leg and succeeds.

Soft dismissal. Once again Saha looks to go for the scoop but adjusts himself seeing Umesh bowl the length ball outside off. All he then manages to do is spoon a catch to backward point. End of the 75-run stand.
Full ball angling away, just pushed past mid-off to get going.
Play and a miss! Length ball outside off, Hardik fishes at it but misses.
On a length outside off, Hardik gets it off the outer edge through covers. It is the longer part of the ground and he hares back for two.
Fires it full on off, Miller digs it out towards mid-on.

Another soft dismissal! A soft six! Tossed up outside off, Miller looked to go over long-off but didn't get it off the middle of the bat. Venkatesh there takes the catch as he goes back but treads on the rope. 100 sixes in the IPL for killer Miller!
Fuller outside off, pushed through covers for one.
Third half-century for Titans skipper Hardik Pandya this season. Pushes it to long-on to get to the other end. Raises his hand to soak in the applause.
Quicker on the hips, worked through square leg for one.
Lands it on a length and spins in, Hardik waits for it before working it away through square leg to retain strike.
Full on middle and leg, worked away through midwicket for a single.
Length ball outside off, Miller flashes and misses.
Bowled on the pads with a slingy arm, misses the flick and collects a leg-bye towards square leg.
On a length on off, Hardik moves across and just times his push through wide mid-off for a brace.
Short and angling in, pulled to short fine leg. But Chakravarthy is off-balance and throws it over the wicketkeeper's head and concedes a run.
Pushed towards short third man for a quick run.
Lucky Miller! Saw the tossed up ball outside off and threw the kitchen sink at it. Got a thick outside edge that flew well over Rana at slip and for four.
Strays in line does Narine, swept through backward square leg for a couple.
Slower through the air this time, around leg. Miller misses the flick. A tad early into it.
Slow ball on a length, a hint of turn away. Pushed back towards the right of the bowler.
This was coming, wasn't it? Miller was itching to have a go. Fetches the tossed up full ball from outside off and smashes it over the relatively short side. Over deep midwicket.
Flatter this time around middle and leg, turned away to the on side. 12 off the overs, all off just three scoring shots.
Sprays it short and wide outside off. Hardik misses reaching out and cutting it.
Short again, punished. Hardik stands tall and pulls it through midwicket for four.
Shorter outside off, slapped through cover-point for a brace.
Fuller this time but wide outside off again. Pandya doesn't bother.
Fuller and outside off, thrashed to sweeper for one.
Sloppy from Narine. Miller gets an outside edge to short third man. But Narine fails to collect it and concedes another one.
Fuller on leg, drilled down to long-on for one.
Excellent ball. Full and outside off, Pandya has to reach out. Does and hits it straight to covers. A misfield allows him a single.
Slower on a length around off, mistimed down to long-on for one.
Fuller around off, Miller taps it to the off side but can't get a run.
The carrom ball on a length, Miller goes back and gets it off the inner half through midwicket.
Offspinner on a fuller length around leg, worked away through backward square leg for one.
A tad shorter, Miller goes back and pushes it through midwicket for another one.
Flatter outside off, pushed to the right of short third man for one. None for 31 for Narine today.
Slower offcutter outside off, on a fuller length. Hacked down to long-on, who's a bit wide, for one. Brings up the fifty-run stand.

Now then! Mavi strikes and his offcutter works. Bowls it on a shorter length, Miller stands back to heave it over the on side. The bounce means that it takes the top edge and settles into the safe hands of Umesh, who takes some steps to his left from point.
Another offcutter, on the pads. Pushed straight to midwicket.
Fuller outside off, pushed to cover for one. A shy at the striker's end misses and they take another one.
Sprayed down leg, Tewatia misses the flick.
Well bowled. Full on middle and leg, driven back to the bowler.

Well bowled again. Another offcutter outside off, driven to covers. Another shy at the keeper's end misses. No extra run this time around. Would have been tight had he hit. Hardik not happy, perhaps with his groin.
Length ball going away, slapped through cover-point for one.

Hardik holes out! How much did his groin issues have a role to play in that? Slower ball on a length, angling in. Pandya stands tall and pulls but doesn't connect well. Rinku Singh hares in and to his right and completes a tumbling catch. Massive wicket at this point for the Knight Riders.
Length ball on the pads, Rashid hops but misses the tuck. Takes a leg bye as the ball roles to the off side.
Length ball well outside off, once again Tewatia finds sweeper with the slap.

Two wickets in the over for Southee. Using the bounce in the wicket to good effect. Cross-seam ball on a shorter length, climbs as it reaches Rashid. Only spoons a catch to midwicket as he goes for the pull. Two-ball duck for Rashid and Titans are now withering away.
Almost a fourth! Another back of a length ball around off, Abhinav is early into his shot and gets it high on the bat. Lands on the off side. 3/24 for Southee today.
Short ball, another offcutter. Tewatia adjusts and pulls it towards fine leg for two.
Skewed away for four! Another offcutter slanting away, Tewatia goes at it with hard hands. Gets it off the outer edge over short third man.
Clever. Mavi saw Tewatia move across and spears it full on middle and leg. But Tewatia adjusts and swivels but gets it off the toe end to deep backward square leg for just one.
Slower full toss outside off, drilled down to long-on for one.
Another offcutter, fuller this time. Tewatia gets the outside edge that lands just short of Rana running in from backward point.
Another offcutter, but well wide.
Slower full ball on off, drilled down to long-on. Abhinav curses himself for missing out on a big shot as soon as he hit that.

Straightaway picks up a wicket! Knows that he is bowling with the longer boundary on his right and lands a slower one on a length. Abhinav gives it his all as he looks to go over deep midwicket but finds Rinku there. No distance only height.

And it's two-in-two for Dre Russ! Short ball around leg, Ferguson seemed to have connected well on the pull. But picks out Rink at deep midwicket again, who does well to stop just before the rope as his momentum was taking him back.
Spears it full on off and middle, Joseph works it through square leg. Russell knows it that had Joseph missed it would have been a treble and smiles as he walks past.
A shot of authority after a long time. Slower short ball outside off, Tewatia reaches out and pulls it through midwicket for four.
135.3kmh, starts with a length ball outside off, Billings lets it go
down the leg side, not very different from Gill's wicket earlier today, but no edge for billings and it's a wide
full just outside off, right in the slot and Billings drives that straight back with some power and timing for a scintillating four
139.4kmh, full and swinging away, drives off the front foot and finds cover point this time

top edge goes high, Saha gets under it and KKR lose their first! Shami with the bouncer that nips in marginally, Billings pulls but doesn't get in control at all because it's outside off, he can't get on top of it and ends up with a top edge that goes towards leg slip
jagging in from short of length, no room and he tucks it to midwicket
139.7kmh, nice and tight on off stump, pushes Shreyas back and he defends with a straight bat

scythes the short of length ball square, a misfield at point and Narine gets a gift first ball for four! It was short with some width, Narine timed it nicely but the point fielder should have stopped it
falls short of midwicket! Bangs in the short ball, Narine mistimes the pull and the top edge is lobbed towards midwicket but it falls well short of the fielder sprinting in
he's expecting the short ball, he swivels on the back foot and gets two towards long leg with a pull
on length on the pads, Dayal gets away with it because Shreyas flicks it down to mid-on
chipped in the air as the ball stops a little, he drives it down and it lands short of mid-off
taps the length ball angling away to point, three dots to end the over
Narine backs away, Shami bangs in a short ball well outside off and the batter can't get close to it

taken at short fine leg! He expected the short ball, this wasn't a bouncer though, only short of length. He stays back to whip it off his hips, towards short fine leg, and Ferguson does well to go low to his right to get both hands under it
angling in from short of length, no room, and he defends it to off
short of length and tight line, he defends it back off the back foot
good bounce for the back of length ball angling in, Rana works it to square leg and they are forced to settle for one because of Rashid's sharp fielding
Shreyas is not able to middle it. Tries to flick it to leg and finds only the inside half of the bat to midwicket
short of length with the angle around off, good pace, and Rana defends off then back foot

136.2kmh, not in control of that pull at all, Rana pulls awkwardly and it lands just out of Rashid's reach. Short and quick towards Rana's right shoulder, he crouches while pulling, getting into a tangle, and manages to lob it just over a sprinting midwicket fielder
rising short ball, he stays back and defends from the top half of the bat
backs away for a big shot, Joseph bangs it in and Iyer heaves and misses
finally connects properly and gets a one-bounce four on the off side! Joseph follows the short one with a full ball, Shreyas opens up again and this time scythes it over the covers for almost a six
really good ball angling in towards the body, he has no option but to defend it back
starts with a yorker right on the base of middle, Rana opens up and digs it out to cover

149.1 kmh, a lone appeal for caught behind but turned down. Ferguson appealed all alone there, he has convinced Hardik and they take the review. Rana backed away a little, probably because of the pace, it was short of length around off, Rana poked inside the line while on the move towards leg, and UltraEdge shows there's a spike, the crowd comes alive as the decision is overturned!
140.8kmh, angling into the pads from around the wicket, clips it off the pads for one
bangs the ball into the pitch from short of length with the angle, pushed on the back foot, Shreyas defends it back
backs away and slams a six over third man! There's a fielder in the deep there, but Shreyas fearlessly backs away, connects with the short ball and upper-cuts it for six!
144.9kmh, makes room yet again and drives the ball a bit late towards cover pint
back of length outside off and Shreyas taps it towards point for one
136kmh, good pace towards Rinku's arm, he's hurried onto the back foot and manages to defend just in time
doesn't time the pull at all, but luckily for him the ball lands between midwicket and square leg for one
backs away a long way, Joseph follows him with a short ball down leg and it's a wide. Excellent take from Saha to get his left hand to it, they sneak in a bye as well
142.5kmh, on length on the stumps now and he flicks it down to mid-on
whipped over fine leg for six! On short on the hips, Rinku doesn't go after it with power but uses the pace to work it fine on the leg side for six
Rinku charges on the last ball of the powerplay, Joseph replies with a bouncer and he sways out of the line eventually

edged behind, Dayal gets the KKR captain! Fourth wicket in seventh over, and all of them to fast bowlers. Dayal bowls a stifling line to Shreyas with the angle, makes him play outside off with his line around off, and he can only edge it behind to Saha. Dayal leaps with joy to celebrate the big wicket
back of length outside off, he steers it square for one
fuller outside off, Rinku drives on the off side and Hardik chases it from mid-off but he's not looking 100% at all. Doesn't give up in the chase, puts in a slide, but it's not enough
137.8kmh, tight line around off from length, he stays back and defends with a straight bat
angling down a bit too much and he pulls to deep fine leg for one
a bouncer too short and too high, called a wide
133.4kmh, short of length with hardly any room outside off, he slices it to point
145kmh, beaten by pace! Some movement as well as Ferguson pitches it just outside off, makes Rinku go fishing outside off and the bold holds its line to nearly take the edge
once again, almost like a replay. Rinku's feet are cemented on the pitch as the ball goes by him in a flash and he nearly gets an outside edge for Saha by poking outside off
comes down this time and takes the ball on the full, makes it a low full toss and drives it down past mid-on for four. That'll make him feel better
just outside off, Rinku slices and Tewatia dives to his right to stop it with one hand
153.2kmh, Rinku charges down this time, and Ferguson sends down a fiery, fast bouncer for a wide
126.3kmh, slower by nearly 30kms an hour, full and wide, and Rinku is deceived by pace again, but this time by the lack of it as he chases and misses
too full to end the over, Rinku comes down again and drives the low full toss through the covers for four more!
full on the pads and Venkatesh pushes it down to long-on for one
full again on leg, Rinku works it down to long-on as well
quicker and right on middle stump, the batter brings his bat down just in time
slower and fuller on middle, works it down the ground for one more

top edge goes high on leg, Drakes goes across to his right from long leg but can't get there. Rinku went for the sweep, got a top edge towards deep square leg and luckily for him it landed wide of Dominic Drakes
on the pads to end the over too and he works it along the ground this time to deep square leg, they sprint back for the second
137.5kmh, short of length towards the body, he defends it back
he makes use of the field on leg with fine leg in the circle, goes across and low and scoops that by getting under it nicely, fine on leg for four
back of length outside off, he works it square on off for one
good pace to angle the ball in, Rinku is hurried on the back foot and he defends
charges down, Shami replies with a short ball and Rinku manages to pull it just in time, but not with perfect timing, towards long leg
no room at all, short of length and coming in, he defends it back
Floated full on the pads, worked through midwicket for one.
Smashes just over Rashid's head. Tossed up around middle, Venky reaches the pitch of the ball and gets four.
Quicker this time, worked away to fine leg for one.
Flatter outside off, cut away through point for one.
Nicely driven through covers for a couple.
Quicker wrong'un, Vemky adjusts late and taps it to the off side.
Short and slanting away, Rinku misses the ramp.
Length ball on the pads, Rinku gets inside and looks to whip it fine. Misses and wears it on the pads.
Common sight when a pacer cranks it up. Joseph bangs it short, Rinku looks to come down the track but adjusts to pull. Gets a top edge over the wicketkeeper.
Back of a length ball, glided to third man for one.
Angling away on a length, Venkatesh stands tall and hits it through covers for one.
Another one going away from him, Rinku stays back and directs it to third man for a single.

Dayal strikes on the very first ball of the spell. Rinku's stay in the middle ends. Walks down the track to the length ball and looks to heave it away. Only manages an inside edge that Saha takes with a dive to his right.
Dayal welcomes Russell with a bouncer, which he ducks under. One for the over called.
Short again but Russell gets lucky. Looks to go big over the on side but gets a thick outside edge over the wicketkeeper's head. 1000th boundary for Dre Russ.

Impressive Dayal bounces Russell out! But is it a no-ball? Yup it is. Dayal and Gujarat's celebration have to be cut short as the pacer has overstepped. It was a bumper which made Russell fend awkwardly. Ended up getting it straight down fine leg's throat but it wasn't to be eventually.
That's full and wide, passed over the guide line. Dayal wasn't happy to see the umpire's outstretched hands.
Venky misses out. Gets a full toss as the free hit stayed, but only managed to hit it to long-on for one.
Thank you very much, says Russell as he gets a gift. A juicy full toss around leg, he makes room and hits it wayyy over deep midwicket.
Dre Russ is in the house! And it doesn't matter if the boundaries are short or long. Thumps the short ball with a swivel over long leg.
Flatter googly around off, punched to covers.

Brilliant catch from Abhinav Manohar at the deep midwicket fence. But has he touched the boundary cushion? Venkatesh went for the slog sweep against a wrong one that was full in length around middle and leg. Abhinav had his eyes on the ball but his momentum took him back and his back leg is the one in question. It is very close to tell. The cushion hasn't moved, so that is an indication. And that is all the TV ump needs, too. I am satisfied, says the TV umpire and Venky has to walk back. KKR continue to slide, as Rashid Khan picks up his 100th IPL wicket.
A mix-up and has it cost Mavi? Reckon not. He's made it in. Worked a wrong'un to midwicket and set off but was sent back.
Fuller on middle and leg, worked through square leg for one.
Fires in the googly, Russell misses. A stifled appeal but it was sliding down.
Another googly around off and middle, Russell goes back and blocks.
Short ball slanting in, pulled on the bounce to fine leg for one.
None of those fielders will come to play if it is a full toss like this. Juicy is the word as Russell makes room and mows it over long-off.
Banged in short, Russell looks to ramp but misses.
Well bowled. Legcutter bouncer around off and middle, Russell is early into his heave.
Another bumper, another swing and a miss. Russell looks to the square leg umpire for a signal but it never comes.
Short and wide outside off, hits it to sweeper for one. Just eight off the over.
Tossed up googly, hit down the ground to long-on for one.

Two matches without a wicket and now Rashid has two in quick succession. Another googly on a length, Mavi looks to pull but misses and sees his woodwork disturbed. Rashid knows and lets everybody know who's the boss in the duel.
Fuller outside off, Umesh comes forward and blocks. Rousing response from the crowd.
Quicker down leg, Umesh looks to defend but gets it off the leading edge to the off side.
Tricked everybody! Googly outside off, spins in sharply. Umesh gets an inside edge as he is late on the push. Goes over the stumps and to the fine leg rope.

Rashid thinks he has another on the last ball of his spell but Umesh thinks long before Russell asks him to take it upstairs. Looked plumb on the first look. He was nowhere near the wrong'un that was speared in on a fuller length around off and middle. Comfortably beat his bat and hit him on the front pad. Ball-tracking shows that the googly did enough for the ball to miss the stumps. So, Umesh survives. The crowd cannot believe it.
Bouncer angling across, Russell misses the pull.
Full and wide outside off, Russell fails to reach that. Smart bowling.

Nicely played and it has gone the distance. Short ball, angling away. There was a third man in place for the upper cut. Russell hops and cuts it well to the right of the man in the deep for half a dozen.
Low full toss on leg, drilled down to long-on for one.
Full and outside off, Umesh has a swing but makes contact with only thin air.

Russell won't be strike at the start of the next over. Back of a length ball outside off, Umesh hits it aerially towards deep cover-point and takes one. No scope of another one. 2/20 for Shami today. Top stuff.
Fuller and slower on the pads, Umesh gets some bat to it through square leg and does the task of giving Russ the strike.
Length ball slanting in to Russell. All he could do was make room and hit it back to the bowler. 149.2kph says the speed gun.
Length ball outside off, slapped to sweeper for one. These are wins for Gujarat and the bowler.
Umesh can strike those meaty blows! You beauty! Short ball angling in, Umesh clears his front leg and swats it over deep midwicket. Was the shorter end but he made good contact. Dre Russ likes it.
Length ball on off, played back to the bowler again. 149.6 kph
Clever bowling. Ferguson bowls a slower one full outside off, Umesh has a swing and a miss.
Very full outside off, squeezed through covers for one.
Very full on off, drilled down to long-off for a single.
In the slot and that's disappeared to Nerul Railway Station! Overpitched on middle, the front leg is out of the way as Russell thumps it over the sightscreen.
Excellent running from Russell to get back for two. Managed to dig out the very full ball through point.
Goes for the yorker but bowls a low full toss, all Russell can do is hit it to long-on for one.
Well bowled. Very full outside off, Umesh walks across but only digs it back.
That sounded goood and it is good for Russell and KKR! Yorker gone wrong, ends up being a full toss. Russell gets under it and smashes it over long-on. 96 metres.

Is this the decisive catch? Is it the wicket that seals it for the Titans? The decibel levels at the DY Patil stadium have soared. Short ball, tucked Russell up. Yet he continued with the pull and got more height than distance. Ferguson ran to his left and misjudged it by running in before going back to take that with a tumble. Massive. Everybody crowds him in celebration. Hardik's happy at the ropes.
Length ball, heaved to the right of long-on. Gill does well and keeps it to one. Advantage Titans.
Umesh aims UK and goes America! Looks to heave the length ball but gets a top edge over the keeper for two.
The perfect bouncer! Joseph is delivering under pressure. Umesh can only pull and miss. One bounce given.
fullish, on off. Shaping away instead of swinging in. Left alone
that one teases the outside edge. Khaleel gets this length ball on off to angle across and Buttler tries to have a poke at it. Through to Pant
once again. Fullish on off stump and angling across. Buttler shuffles onto the front foot to defend, but it goes past the outside edge again

lucky for Jos as Khaleel gets the better of him a fourth time, but this time it's flown over the short third man fielder. Back of a length on leg stump, and angling towards off. Buttler tries to pull, but is through the shot too early. Toe-ended, and over the infield
good length on middle and angling further away from Buttler. Pant has to move towards first slip to grab that
edged along the carpet past first slip for another four. Khaleel went full on off. Buttler poked at it with soft hands. First slip's dive is futile
full on off. Bit of swing into Padikkal. Defended off the front foot

big lbw appeal as this length ball lands around leg stump. Padikkal misses the flick, hits the pad, and rolls away to fine leg. Appeal turned down. Big discussion between Pant and Thakur. With a few seconds to go, Pant reviews. Two big questions: did it pitch in line and is height a factor? First question is answered straight away.... pitched outside leg so Capitals lose the review.
full on off stump. Swing, shaping across the bat. Defended off the front foot to mid off
good length, fifth-stump line. Buttler tries to cut, but the ball goes under the blade. On the bounce to Pant
bowls from a bit wide of the crease. Length ball around off stump. Blocked from near his chest
and that's a maiden over. Fullish on off stump, and Buttler presses forward to meet at it. Struck back to Shardul. Just the one legbye in the over
around the stumps. Length ball just outside off, and cut square
good length just outside off. Punched comfortably to long off for one
good length on off. Turning into him. Nudged off his waist to midwicket for one
fullish, fourth-stump line. Worked off the back foot in front of square on the leg side
nearly yorker length. Lands around middle and leg, and dug back to Lalit. Runs to his left in front of Jos, and intercepts the ball
tidy over even though he offered a couple of half-trackers. Full on off, and flicked off his toes square to the fielder in the deep on the leg side
starts off with a length ball outside off, and Padikkal crunches a cut square. Fielder in the deep runs around to stop the four
bit more luck! Fizz goes full and slightly wide. Padikkal reaches out to drive at it. Big drive offered, and it's taken a thick edge over short third man
first convincing boundary of the evening from a Royals batter. Length ball angling into middle and leg, and the batter gently flicks it off his hips to fine leg
best of the lot as Padikkal offers shades of Sangakkara in this cover drive for four. Leans forward, meets it low, and offers a proper follow through too
slows things up. Full on middle and leg. Worked to midwicket
full, fifth-stump line. Padikkal thinks he can put it away with a cut, but ends up mistiming it
full outside off, and he clatters a shot back past the bowler's left to long off
around the stumps. Length ball, around off stump. Extra bounce. Punched to cover
good length ball on off. Punched past cover to the fielder in the deep
good length on off. Turning in, so Buttler backs away to make a bit more room. Plays a flat-batted shot but under-edged onto the deck
length ball outside off and Buttler skips down the ground. Worked off his waist to midwicket
full toss, knee-high. Angling into his body. Flicks it, but can't put it in the gap. Stopped at square leg
forget those first over blues! Full on middle, right in the slot. Buttler clears the front leg and cracks a six over deep midwicket. That's brought the sedate crowd alive.

swatted away over mid off/cover as Khaleel bowls a gentle length ball on middle and off. Warner runs to the boundary from inside the circle and dives just inside the line to parry it back before tumbling over the line. Has he saved two? Oh yes, what commitment!
full toss, knee-high on middle stump. Struck towards cover point, but a dot
clobbered! In the arc, and Buttler ain't missing out. Length ball on middle. And swings across the line. Solid connection, and flies into the lower tier!
goes for full pace. Length ball outside off and angling away. Keeping it away from his arc. Buttler tries to cut but can't connect
44/0 after the powerplay as this full toss at shin height on leg stump is pushed to mid off
time for Kuldeep. Full just outside off. Turning into him. Fended to the off side
full on middle. Googly turning towards off. Tap and run off the front foot to cover with the batters taking the infielder on
good length, outside off. Turning away. Tries to cut but misses
swept in front of square. Padikkal plays against the turn. Full outside off, down on one knee, and put away
fullish outside off stump. Mistimed cut behind square for one. Fifty stand
full on middle. Turning into leg. Tucked off his pads to square leg for one
full outside off. Ball slides in with the arm. Buttler looks to play across the line for a big shot, but chopped between his legs to short fine leg
good length outside off. Cut to backward point
full outside off, and he goes for the reverse sweep. Decent connection, nearly beats Fizz at conventional short third man, but his dive saves a few runs

you expect that when you bowl in the slot to a left-hand batter who is set. Full just outside off, Padikkal trusts the turn that will come, and therefore he gets down on one knee to hammer a 97m six over cow corner
Axar overcorrects, and Padikkal punishes him again. Full ball, outside leg stump. Padikkal swats a sweep behind square, and Mustafizur cannot stop it at short fine leg!
good length, just outside off. Pushed back past the bowler to long on
tosses it up, ends up as a full toss since the batter gives Kuldeep a charge. Smacked straight past the umpire to long on
easy as! Full just outside off. Nice loop, and he skips down the track and then clubs the googly over long on for six
full on middle. Buttler puts his dancing shoes on again, and stays leg-side of the ball, before smacking it right over Kuldeep's head for a tracer-bullet four
full toss, around leg stump. Mistimed sweep to deep backward quare leg
full, just outside off. Turning away. Cut to point, and off they go for one
full on leg stump. Turning further down leg.
full and wide outside off. Clatters a cut to deep point for one
good length, on off stump. Tiptoes and fends it back
good length, fifth-stump line. Pushes at it with the bat's open face. Dribbled away to deep point
full on leg stump. Flicked well, but one bounce to deep backward square leg
top yorker. Aimed at the base of leg stump. Dug away towards the vacant mid-on region. But the ball is going there very slowly, so Buttler wants a run. But Padikkal doesn't

top tier stuff! Shardul bowls a length ball outside off. Buttler shuffles onto the back foot, and then brings out a baseball style swing... and the connection has taken it for a 100+m six over deep midwicket!
back to the yorker. Just outside off. Dug out, ball rolls away to midwicket

run machine! Half-century for Buttler. Tosses it up outside off but Buttler smacks it through the covers even before the ball can land on the pitch! Converts it into a juicy full toss and put away with ease
full on off, and flicked with the turn to square leg
full and wide outside off. Throws his bat at it, and crunches a drive through the off side
worked away square for one
Buttler backs away. Lalit follows. Ends up with a flat full toss on Buttler's shin. Clipped to the deep

beautiful swing of the bat. Lalit bowls full outside off from around the stumps and Padikkal's eyes light up as it lands in his arc. Reaches forward slightly, and clobbers it over deep midwicket for another six
full outside off stump. Slapped to cover point. Fielder intercepts
back of a length on middle and leg, Mistimed pull to midwicket but they scurry across for a single anyway
cutter, outside off stump. Cut to backward point for a single
good length ball on off and angling across. Buttler continues to struggle with the cut. Through to Pant

Padikkal has to take cover! Full on off stump. Buttler contorts his body so that the bat swing comes from the legside of the ball, and therefore drills a straight drive that sends Padikkal on the floor! Four to long off
can't get bat on ball with the ball angling aross
moves to 49. Full toss from around the stumps. Caressed to long off

curse of the nelson..... but for the fielder! Half-tracker on off. Turning in. Buttler drags a sloggy shot in front of square. Ball looks to go straight to Shardul at deep midwicket for the catch, but it appears like he's come in too much! Ball soars over him for six
nudged to the off side
full toss on his knee roll. Buttler swings across the line, and hammers a slog to deep square leg for four more
smacked with disdain! Full outside off from around the stumps. Enough room for Buttler to free his arms, and he clubs it over Lalit's head for six more
over the stumps. Full on off. Clatters a shot across the line again. Shardul in the deep gets behind it
reverse sweep to start the over. Tricky shot with backward point and point in place. Boundary.
full outside off. Reaches out to drive through cover. Bottom-edged onto the pitch
good length outside off. Cut to point

a well-constructed fifty, batting with the same wavelength as his senior partner. Length ball outside off, and the cut is placed behind square on the off side! Races away for four, and he raises his bat for the crowd
good length on middle. Padikkal dances down the track, ends up cramping himself. Tucked away to midwicket and Axar runs across to intercept
full toss, outside leg. Padikkal tries to play the paddle sweep, but it's hit Pant on the arm with the keeper moving to his right
crrrrrrunched! Tosses it up on leg stump. Buttler clears the front leg and creams it over deep midwicket. How long is that? 105m!

make that a double, please! Full on off stump, and this time Buttler wants to be an archer. Straight as an arrow.... and thuds into the sight screen. This was the quick one from Kuldeep, trying to surprise Buttler with the extra pace, but the Englishman is in the form of his life
moves to 95. Goes wide. Away from his arc. Cut to deep point
full and wide outside off. Turning further away. Padikkal is off balance as he swats it away to cover. They jog across for one

full just outside off stump. Buttler swats it across the line, and has enough in the shot to pierce the gap between long on and deep midwicket! Lost his shape in that slog, but was powerful enough nonetheless
top ball. Tosses it up outside off and big turn away from Buttler as he goes for a big shot. Past the edge

Khaleel is back. full ball on off stump. Padikkal tries to flick across the line, but it hits his pad. Khaleel goes for an lbw appeal as the ball rolls away rapidly past short third man for four. Capitals review after the umpire says not out. Is there bat involved? Tough to say since the ball is close to both the bat and the pad. But the umpire says there's a clear gap between bat and ball. And ball-tracking says it's crashing into middle stump. Correct review, umpire was wrong, and Padikkal has to walk back for 54.
welcomes Samson with a legstump yorker. Bug squirted away to the off side, and the pumped-up Khaleel runs across to stop the single
full outside off stump. Cutter. Angling across. Slapped to deep point for a single

full on leg stump. A simple tuck off his toes to wide long on for two, and he punches the air after getting back for the second! Three this IPL! A picture perfect moment as all the flash cameras flutter in the stands. Not a single person in the crowd is sitting. #JosTheBoss rules on
full outside off. Samson walks across to play a paddle, but misses out
starts off with the short ball. Samson mistimes a pull, and the ball is sliced over the bowler's head to long on
full toss, searching for the yorker but misses out. Hit back past the non-striker to long off
cheeky lad! Back of a length, angling across him, gets to him at shoulder height, and he ramps it to third man
smacked to deep midwicket
full outside off stump. Opens the bat's face and creams a drive to backward point
goes nowhere. Full on middle. Samson tries to play a cheeky ramp, but he ends up hitting the ball onto his helmet grille
full and wide outside off. Stays on the back foot, and hammers a crunched shot through the covers! Long off runs to his left, but that's absolutely futile
going, going, gone! Nearly a waist-high full toss just outside off but Samson showed how much power he has by lifting it over Khaleel's head and sending it over wide long on!
full and wide outside off. Samson tries chasing at it to try and play another ramp. But the ball is too wide outside the tram-lines for the umpire to even consider Samson's movements. Wide given
elegance! Full outside off. Samson just throws his bat at it, and meets it so well. Lofted drive, flourish of the bat in his swing, and it very nearly goes for six at wide long off
ridiculous! Full and wide. Samson tries to slap this through backward point. But it's flown off the bat, and it's a flat six over the boundary behind square! #Slashed
omg! Khaleel drops a sitter. Tests Samson with the short ball, forces the error as he top-edges the shot. Khaleel runs forward to take the simple catch, but it pops out of his hand!
low full toss around leg stump. Buttler shuffles across to the off side and sweeps the fast bowler behind square for four!

long off to take the catch? Oh hell no! Fizz bowls an overpitched delivery outside off. Nearly a yorker. But Buttler swats it with a quick swing of the bat, and it's flown over the stretched hands of Powell at long off for six more
yorker length, just outside leg stump. Drilled towards mid off
rolls his fingers over the ball. Full on off, and he drags a slog to deep midwicket. Team 200

hammered straight down the ground. Warner and Powell at long on and long off get together to stop the ball, and it's Powell who gets there first. Stuck his foot out, went down, and then collected it quickly to get the throw in. But the TV umpire is seeing if it's a clean collection from Powell.

holes out to long on and an exhilarating innings comes to an end. A pat on the back from Samson as he walks back. Fizz went for the yorker. Buttler tried to hit it, and therefore ended up meeting it at a very low full toss height. Gets some connection, but doesn't have the distance. Warner at long on takes a simple one
full and wide from around the stumps. Slower ball too, Samson reaches out to play at it. Misses, and wide given

full and wide outside off. Samson launches a lofted shot over cover but it's not got 100% connection. Up in the air but lands safely before the outfielder to get to it. Flat throw from the deep, and Thakur breaks the stumps, but Hetmyer  - the non-striker - was in

overpitched, fourth-stump line. Samson does not move, simply swings his arms, and muscles a shot straight past the non-striker for four to long off. Thakur was so close to the yorker, missed it by an inch or two
full outside off stump and angling away. But wide given! Tantalisingly close to the tramline
full just outside off. Drags a slog to deep midwicket
full toss, almost waist-high on middle stump. Smacked across the line to the sweeper fielder on the leg side

just one away from the season's highest team total! Bit of luck for Samson as Thakur induces an under-edge off the cut, but the ball flies through the grass to Kuldeep at short third man, and he fails to stop it with the dive. Bowler was not happy with the fielder!

Richie Benaud would be proud! 222 for 2! Full toss on his pads on leg stump. Samson nonchalantly flicks it behind square. And it flies over deep backward square leg! Highest total of IPL 2022 and the Wankhede is buzzzzzzing!
back of a length on off stump, Shaw shuffles across and whips this through square leg to the rope beating deep fine leg running across.

dropped! Nearly a return catch but it sizzles past Boult to the mid-off rope! It was full on the slot on fifth stump, Shaw powers a drive toward Boult at hip height just outside his left hip. He reaches to his left and it squirts through his hands and still has enough steam on it to skid to the rope. Boult got part of one hand to the ball but couldn't trap it with both.
good length wide outside off, defended to point.
good length ball defended again.
full and wide, goes to drive and hits bat on ground. Stifled appeal for caught behind denied.
full on fifth stump, driven firmly but straight to extra cover.
full and angled across sixth stump at 139 kph, Warner dips his back knee to get under this drive and shovel it high over extra cover to the rope.
full and wider on seventh stump, this time hammers a drive along the ground and picks out extra cover on the ring.
back of a length tighter on fourth stump angled across from over the wicket at 140 kph, Warner with a flat-footed punch away from his body and is beaten.
length ball on middle at 137 kph, heaved flat across the line and skids along the turf to Hetmyer at deep midwicket for one.
yorker on middle at 145 kph, jammed out to midwicket.
length ball on the stumps, prodded into midwicket for one.
length ball on middle, heaves across the line, bottom edge dribbles off the pads in front of square and they scamper a tight single before Boult can collect.
short ball on fifth stump, Warner goes to uppercut over third man and is beaten.
back of a length on the hips, flicked with flair behind square to the rope.
short on off, goes to pull and chops this toward mid-on.
short ball again, this time Warner sways under it.

short on fourth stump, Warner leans back from leg stump and slashes this 141 kph delivery high over short third man and it sails all the way over the rope for six thudding into the LCD ad boards just adjacent to the Rajasthan dugout.
short on fifth stump, guided to backward point off the back foot.
short on the stumps at 134 kph, Shaw latches onto a pull and laces this through wide mid-on to the rope.
length ball on fifth stump, smashes this flat to mid-off, too firmly in fact to allow the run.
length ball angled across fifth stump at 130 kph, goes to pull and slaps this off the toe to deep midwicket for one.
length ball on seventh stump at 136 kph, Warner reaches out to flay this high over backward point and backspins away to the rope despite the best efforts chasing from Riyan Parag.
slower ball lands full on off at 122 kph, prodded toward mid-off for one.
nearly drags on! Length ball angled across fifth stump, Warner goes to pull and toe drags this just past off stump and Samson behind the stumps diving in vain as well to the fine leg rope.
this time it goes where Warner intended! Length ball on off stump, Warner backs away from leg and slams a pull through mid-on to the rope.

the change of angle works! Length ball follows Warner backing away from leg, Warner tries to flick this behind point and a thick edge goes through to the keeper. Warner tries to sell it like he didn't touch it and that it came off the thigh guard. Krishna roars a celebration and then goes through a more formal appeal to the umpire, who gives it out. Warner's sales job fails and he doesn't bother reviewing. Clear edge.
starts to Sarfaraz with a thigh high full toss on middle at 147 kph, tame block back to the bowler.
fullish length ball on off at 141 kph, punches this flat toward mid-on, diving stop to turn four into a single.
overpitched on middle, picture perfect punch back down the pitch goes just wide of the non-striker's stumps and races through mid-on to the rope.

Sarfaraz gifts his wicket to square leg! Fullish length ball on sixth stump, tries to drag this into the leg side with a sweep but picks out Prasidh in the ring, who shuffles to his right taking a catch at neck height just in front of the umpire.
fullish length on middle, blocked on the front foot.
back of a length on middle and leg, goes back to flick this wristily through midwicket to the rope. A left-handed helicopter if you will.
back of a length on the hips, whipped away again this time squarer to deep square leg for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, goes back to flick through midwicket for one.
flights this on a fullish length on fifth stump, Pant with a very tentative poke at this and nudges it away into the off side for one.
fullish length outside leg, goes to sweep and misses off the pads, deflection to fine leg for a run, given off the gloves/bat.
good length ball on middle, defended back to Chahal.
full and wide, driven through cover to the sweeper for one.
fullish length on middle, falls over going to sweep and flicks this to deep backward square for one.
flights this more on middle and leg, swept against the turn and a top edge sails into no man's land in square leg for one.
good length ball outside off, cut to the off side for one.
short on the stumps, pulled to deep midwicket, sliding stop on the rope keeps it to two.
short on fifth stump, goes to cut, bottom edge goes into the keeper's toe.
short on the stumps, pulled into the leg side for one.
full on off, sweeps this to deep backward square for one.
spears this flat and fast down the leg side, Samson dives to keep this from being five wides but doesn't collect cleanly and they take a second wide.
short on sixth stump, slices a cut to the point sweeper for one.
length ball on the legs, pulled flat to deep backward square for one.
length ball angled across fifth stump at 128 kph, just sits up to be spanked over midwicket to the rope.

what an absurdly great shot! Slower ball lands full and very wide almost on the guideline at 108 kph, Shaw plays a one-handed Federer tennis backhand gracefully over extra cover and it just reaches beyond the rope.

this is an absurdly terrible delivery! Trying for a wide yorker outside off, it sails at head height wide of the pitch outside off, goes halfway between the keeper and short third man before bouncing to the rope. Called 5 no balls on height instead of 5 wides so a free hit will be coming.
bouncer over leg stump, goes to hook but it's too high. Wide called. Free hit still in play.
wide speared full down the leg side, Shaw can't get bat trying to flick this 140 kph delivery through the leg side. Free hit still in play.
low full toss on fifth stump, slapped through midwicket for one.
attempted yorker goes awry again on the pads at 139 kph, flicked through fine leg to the rope.

dropped! Hetmyer at long-on! Full on fifth stump, Pant heaves this toward cow corner, it's in the air for awhile and Hetmyer sprints 25 yards to his left. He gets there but may have been distracted by Riyan Parag coming across from deep midwicket and is worried about a collision. He gets one hand to the ball instead of two and it goes through before bouncing over the rope.
length ball just inside the wide guideline, Pant charges and misses a wild heave.
fullish length on the stumps, prodded away into the ring.
good length ball on off, goes to cut and cramped for room, picks out backward point.
short and wide, middles a cut this time to the point sweeper.
good length ball on the stumps, prodded away through the ring for one.
short and wide, slapped into the covers for one.

short and wide, backs away to slap this high over cover but makes the mistake of getting it anywhere within 40 yard-radius of Trent Boult patrolling the boundary. It floats in the air long enough for Boult to range 20 yards to his right and takes a safe catch tumbling to his right at thigh height.
starts with a full toss, Pant charges to meet it at thigh height and heaves it high and deep over midwicket.
good length ball on middle, defended into cover but they pinch a run.
full and wide, driven to long-off along the turf for one.

funky round-arm delivery, Pant hits an even funkier one-handed heave over long-on! Lands this full on middle and Rishabh gives it the Pete Alonso treatment into the stands. Or should I say Shohei Ohtani?
good length ball lands on the wide guideline and spins further outside off, left alone and extra called.
darts this flat outside leg following Pant backing away while charging down the track, punches this flat down the ground through long-on to the rope.
gives this some air flighted way down the leg side, left alone.
short and wide, would've been way outside the guideline had he left it but instead Pant slaps this toward extra cover, misfield on the ring turns one into two.
good length ball on off, prodded to long-on for one.

dropped! Chahal spills a skier at deep fine leg! Short on the hips at 135 kph, casual flick comes off a top edge and swirls toward Chahal, who is even more casual coming in off the rope. He needed to cover 15 yards and takes his sweet time getting to the ball, lunges forward at the last moment but it slips through his hands.
fullish length on off, punched to long-off for one.

Padkikkal shows Chahal how it's done! Length ball angled across off, Pant goes for a big heave over mid-on but a top-edge swirls over point. Padikkal calls off Samson who was running toward it and rightly so because Padikkal had a better angle and less ground to cover. He settles himself before reaching forward and takes a sharp steepler while going to the ground to cushion the ball as it comes back to earth.
thigh high full toss on off stump, blocked gently into the off side for no run.
slower ball lands short on off, defended back to Krishna.
full on off, slammed down the ground to long-on for one.
goes to sweep a full ball on his legs, bottom edge to fine leg for one.
yorker length ball on the stumps, defended back to Chahal.
good length ball spins away and crosses the wide guidelines but is deemed legal.
short and wide, this time toe slaps this to long-off for one.
flighted full on fourth stump, spins back in and defeats Axar's attempted slog sweep, middle and off stump are knocked back.
nearly another wicket! Length ball on fourth stump, slapped back low toward Ashwin and just skids under his lunging effort to long-off for one.
good length ball on the stumps, flicked to fine leg for one.
good length ball on middle, backs away to punch to extra cover for one.
good length ball on middle, flicks this high over mid-on for one.
good length ball on sixth stump, goes for a big heave and a top edge swirls wide of Chahal at short third man teasing him in a chase to the rope.

short and wide, slices this behind point, big effort by Boult at cover sweeper racing 20 yards left trying to slap this back into play to save runs. Looks like his knee was in contact with the rope when he put hand to ball. It'll be four by the third umpire.
good length ball on off, defended.
flighted full on fifth stump, goes to slog sweep, top edge swirls wide of McCoy at short third man for one.
full toss creamed into the second deck! Floated on the legs at thigh height, got on his knee to sweep and gets under this with extra elevation sending it high into the crowd.

charges this and doesn't get anywhere near the pitch to a ball wide on seventh stump, goes through with the slog anyway and skies this over extra cover. Chahal charges out, Hetmyer charges in from long-off but it lands in no man's land for two.
full on fifth stump, slices out to deep extra cover for one.

flighted full and wide outside off, goes to slog sweep and misses. Shardul is furious with the umpire that no wide was called, but he lost his bearings from where he was on the crease. It was well within the guidelines.
length ball angled across fifth stump, mistimes a slog to long-on for one.
bouncer on middle, and a towering pull sails high over backward square leg into the covered tarp area of the stands just below the second tier.

length ball on fourth stump, slaps this to wide long-on, Shardul is hesitant turning back for the second but Lalit wanted it and turned hard for the non-striker's end. Riyan Parag charges hard and fires a bullet to Samson, who whips the bails off with Shardul a foot short. His path back to the striker's end didn't help matters. Ran a pronounced zig-zag, probably covered 24 yards instead of 22 trying to make the second.
good length ball on off, prodded into the covers for one.
full on sixth stump, goes to paddle scoop this over fine leg and gets it wide enough of deep backward square to get to the rope.
slower bouncer outside off, Lalit tries to uppercut this over point and misses.
gem of a delivery! Flighted full on off, spins past a booming straight drive and just misses off stump.
short and wide outside off, toe-slapped to the cover sweeper for one.
full on sixth stump, slog sweep connects sweetly sailing high and deep over deep midwicket and clears the rope.
good length ball on sixth stump, charge from Lalit and beaten badly in flight, does well to get bat on this poking it behind point.
good length ball lands on the guidelines and spins wider outside off, left alone and wide called.
very full on fifth stump, driven to long-on for one.
fullish length on middle, prodded into midwicket for one.
length slower ball outside off, Powell is out in front with a big heave.
yorker on off stump at 135 kph, jammed out into fine leg for one.
length ball on the hips, mistimed tamely over backward square for one.
short and wide, tails too far outside the guidelines and left alone, wide called.
Powell has a different magic 8 ball than mine! Length ball sits up for Powell to crunch flat over wide long-on onto the covered tarps beyond the fence.
offcutter lands on fourth stump on a good length and breaks away at 120 kph, Powell well out in front of a heave and fans on the shot.
slower ball lands full on sixth stump, Powell not fooled this time by a 115 kph delivery, slaughters this high and deep over long-off.
juicy full toss angled across sixth stump at knee height, Lalit swings wildly, misses and then covers his face in embarrassment knowing he's missed out on a boundary opportunity.
length ball angled across sixth stump at 138 kph, Lalit gets on his knee to slog this and misses badly as it sails past him.

what an over from Krishna! The around the wicket ploy pays off! Slants this on a good length across Lalit on eighth stump, Lalit tries to shuffle across to get in line for a heave to the leg side but only manages to slice a healthy edge behind to Samson.
short ball over middle stump, Kuldeep shuffles way across his stumps to pull and misses. Kuldeep wants a wide called but it was clearly passing over the top of the stumps and correctly deemed legal.
yorker speared in between leg stump and Kuldeep backing away, he misses trying to flick this 139 kph delivery through the leg side.

full on middle, whipped straight to midwicket. Kuldeep turns down a single so Powell can have the strike for the final over where the Capitals will need six sixes. Prasidh Krishna has bowled a wicket maiden in the 19th over of a T20 chase! Take a bow!
one down, five sixes to go! In the slot on fifth stump, Powell tees off with the three-wood high and deep over long-off, lands in the front row of the upper deck!
two down, four to go! Half-volley bowled wider on seventh stump, gets the wide yorker fractionally wrong and Powell goes inside out with a drive screaming into the stands over cover.

three down, three to go! Meatball of a full toss on the hips, Rovman sprinkles some marinara sauce over the top before tucking into it and sending it over midwicket. Lucky not to be called a no ball on height.
swing first up. Full, middle and leg, dug out by Rohit, who gets his pad out of the way
that is catching practice for mid-on. Just a nothing little push to a length-ball inswinger, unable to keep it down even though he is not looking to hit a boundary off it. Easy catch for mid-on
full, swinging in, pushed back to Choudhary
full, swinging down leg, clears the front leg, works this wide of mid-on for one
appeal for catch down the leg side, but it has been called a wide. Jadeja decides not to review it. There is a clear noise as the ball passes Kishan but it is not the bat. It has come off the pad

Kishan is on his knees. The off stump has gone for a walk. Swinging yorker. Okay not quite a yorker. A half-volley more like, but it ha swung late, and Kishan has played the wrong line.
