He is off his feet as he gets into a tangle, and the ball takes out the off stump. Both openers gone in the first over. Projected score 158 now
on-drive first ball. He looks in good touch. Choudhary keeps looking for swing, but overpitches a touch and he punches it straight of mid-on
on a length, into the pads, worked away for a single
has he bowled him? How has this missed? Full, drifting, no turn, Surya misses it, and it misses the leg stump. Chance for Dhoni to stump him but he has been blinded by Surya
lovely extra cover drive, open face, just a push to a length ball
worked away for one
arm ball, defended back to him

dropped by Jadeja. Brevis expects no turn and looks to go down the ground, but the ball grips this time and takes a thick edge for a skier. Jadeja is going towards mid-off from cover, but seems to have been put off by the long-off running in. However, the fielder is nowhere in catching distance. Jadeja doesn't even get a hand to it and then looks at long-off as the ball hits the ground
Surya looks in excellent touch. Straight of mid-on, through extra cover, and now he goes wide of mid-off with a drive. Lovely timing too
pulls the length back, and draws a defensive shot
short of a length again, worked away for two into the leg side
another lovely shot. Short of a length again, and he punches this wide of midwicket for three
on a length, angling in, Brevis sets up for a big shot, punches this straight to mid-on

and Choudhary makes sure Jadeja's drop doesn't cost them much. He sees Brevis walking at him, Choudhary bowls the slower offcutter, in his half, Brevis looks for a sort of upper-cut, but the extra bounce does him in. Edged to Dhoni
carrom ball first up, takes a thick edge towards cover
offbreak, punched down to long-on for one
full, doesn't matter which way it turns when you bowl that full, pushed to long-off for one
nearly a yorker, dug out back to Theekshana
carrom ball, on a length, middle and leg, punched to long-on for one
carrom ball, Varma has picked it from the pitch because he is making room, expecting the ball to turn away. This one turns in to cramp him up. He still manages to get a single into the leg side

another drop. This time by Bravo. On a length, wide, Varma looks to open the face on it, gets a thick edge, Bravo is thereat first slip, it goes about chest high to his right, but seems like it has gone too quickly to him. Goes for four off the ricochet
slightly fuller, defended with a full face this time
wide on the crease, short of a length, angling in, defended towards point
closer to the umpire now, digs one in, Varma ducks under it
wide on the crease again, short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
wide on the crease, looks like an offcutter, on a length, defended to short cover
too full, punched down the ground, but straight to mid-off
looks like a top edge when the ball leaves the bat on this sweep, but it has sailed 20 rows back over deep square leg. Not quite the edge then
Theekshana pulls the length back, Surya punches him wide of long-on for two
low full toss, driven to long-on for one

again looks like Varma is not picking the carrom ball. He shapes up to play for an offbreak, but the ball turns back in and nearly gets the pad on the way to the bat. He gets off the strike with a single, though
Theekshana too full to Surya again, driven to long-on for one
full, on the pads, whipped towards deep midwicket
on a length, outside off, worked into the leg side for one
on a length, down the leg side, worked away to deep midwicket
on a length, outside off, defended to short cover
slower in the air, and this one turns back in, Varma adjusts off the surface, and is hit on the glove as he defends
pulled away hard and to the right of deep square leg but Choudhary does really well to keep them down to one
on a length, around off, worked away for one to leg
some turn from middle and leg, soft outside edge rolls along to point

Santner has a wicket finally after the drop in his first over. And he has the big one. Surya has been given no room by the spinners, and they have had a strong leg-side field. So the boundary options for Surya are to go over the leg-side field. He did that against Theekshana, but gets a flat top edge on the same sweep against Santner. Taken at deep square leg
on a length, middle and off, defended back to him
driven for a single to long-off, and Santner kicks the ground for letting the debutant get off strike so easily w3ith an overpitched ball
on a length, outside off, Varma opens the face for a single to deep point
looks for two with a push towards deep point, but Pretorius does well to keep them to one
full, on the pads, turned away for a single
on a length, outside off, pushed to short cover
and now to short midwicket. Two successive dots
punched to deep point for one this time
turn from a length around off stump. Shokeen stays back to defend, and is beaten
on a length, outside off, opens the face, gets a single past point
Shokeen walks at him, Pretorius shortens the length, draws a defensive shot
short of a length, they drop and run and take a single to short cover
slower ball, on a length, just outside off, and Varma uses soft hands to drop this at his feet and run
another slower ball, Shokeen runs it down to third man for one
yet another slower ball, Varma early into the push, ends up playing this straight to short cover
quick, into the pads, worked to leg for one

slow sweep but not the cleanest connection. There is a deep midwicket lurking and this has gone at a catchable height, but it has gone to the right of the man. Lands on the triangle on the full. First boundary in 30 balls, I think
worked to leg for one
one brings two. Shokeen opens the face late and manages to guide it just wide of slip. Enough pace from Jadeja for this to go to the fence
thick edge, goes wide of where the slip would have been Fielder by short third
swept away for a single to deep square leg
pulled in the air, bit for a six, but in the gap on the leg side. Santner drags it back a touch, and despite his extra bounce, Shokeen manages to pull it away
defended off the front foot
short of a length, some grip on this, defended from the back foot
nice dip and some turn on this, pushed straight to extra cover
slightly fuller, drifting in towards middle and leg, defended back

Jadeja has dropped a second catch. Santner has done Shokeen in the air as he looks to go big down the ground. The ball turns to take the thick edge for a skier. Jadeja moves to his left from extra cover, and lets a sitter slip through
cut away, but straight to point
this time he gets the cut shot past the infield and comes back for two
another mis-hit, this goes wide of long-on for two. Looks like Shokeen has made up his mind to go after everything. If he gets out now, his job is done
big wind-up again, Jadeja slows it down, and Shokeen recovers by playing a defensive shot with an open face
another big shot attempted, a pull shot this time, and the mis-hit falls wide of deep midwicket where Pretorius over-runs the ball before recovering well enough
he has nailed one finally. Driven on the up, with an open face, past the diving extra cover
full, on-pace, middle and leg, slight shape back in, beats the inside edge and hits the pad. They get a leg-bye
goes down for the ramp early, Bravo goes short and wide and draws a dot
down the wicket this time, and again a move a touch too early. Bravo digs in a bouncer, Shokeen goes ahead with a big shot, skies one to mid-off where Uthappa takes it calmly
half edge, half deliberate. On a length, on-pace, outside off. Pollard gets a thick edge but also opens the face late. It goes wide of short third man for four
shimmies down the wicket, Bravo goes short of a length, and beats his outside edge
Pollard is walking at him again, defends the ball, and then shadow-practises a big hit, which sends the crowd into a frenzy. Then he walks off to the other end with an arm around Bravo's shoulder
Varma cramped up by a carrom ball again, gets a single into the covers
on a length, middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
on a length, outside off, drop and run for Varma
lovely hit. Trademark Pollard. Gets a stride in, his long reach makes sure he reaches a length ball, and effortlessly lofts him over long-on for a six. Just casually flexing his arms
carrom ball, Pollard gets a thick edge to short third man for one
wide length ball, driven uppishly through point for one
slower offcutter, punched away to deep point
looks for the yorker, but ends up bowling a wide down the leg side
outside edge, but this would have gone wide of a first slip. Single to short third man
yorker outside leg, concedes a leg-bye
Pollard walks down the wicket and pushes it into the covers for one
overpitches a touch here, and Varma opens the face to go over extra cover for four
full and straight, past the inside edge, and they get a leg-bye
on a length, around off, opens the face for a single

and Pollard has found that very straight long-on. This is short of a length, Pollard goes back to pull him down the ground, looking to go dead straight, but he this has come off the toe end and goes shoulder high to that very fielder. CSK overjoyed
paddle sweep first ball, takes it from outside off, and places it fine of fine leg for four
on a length, outside off, pushed into the covers for one
on a length, angling in, punched wide of deep cover for two
full, offbreak, punched down to long-off for one
slower offcutter, swept away to deep square leg for one

dipping yorker. Slower ball dies on him dramatically and hits him on the pad as he is shuffling across for a big hit. Given out lbw. Reviewed too. The only question is if he has got himself outside the line. The replays show the ball dipping, falling inches short of the toe, turning in to impact the pad on off. It returns an umpire's call on impact, but is hitting flush. The original decision stays
the full slower ball, dug out for one to cover
looks for the reverse hit, and is. beaten comprehensively by the slower offcutter that pithes on a length and grips away from him
on-pace, short ball, gets it high enough, but strays down the leg side, and Varma helps it along for four to fine leg
back to slower balls, full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
Varma sets himself up for the slower ball, and it turns out to be the slower one, and he gives the hit his all, lofting him high over long-off for six
another slower ball, but this time wider and short of a length, beating his attempt to sweep it from there

another slower ball, this time Varma ends up slogging it towards deep midwicket. The mis-hit falls short of the charging deep midwicket. The three takes him to a fifty. Not the quickest but such was the match situation

another catch goes down. Dube this time. On-pace this time, Unadkat ends up slicing it towards deep point where Dube is hit on the chest. He has enough time to set himself under it, it looks like a sitter, but he has let it burst through
slower short ball, pulled over the infield on the leg side for two
big swipe, beaten by a slower ball. Plays completely down the wrong line and early
this is like gully cricket, Varma getting inside the line of an offcutter outside leg to earn the wide call. The ball turns appreciably but still called a wide
he has hit this one hard and straight into the stumps at the non-striker's end. This has denied him at least one run. Possibly three

he has got all deep fielders down the ground. All infielders are behind square. So Bravo has done the right thing by bowling a slower ball, and has drawn an edge too, but Unadkat has slogged so hard that the edge clears short third man
he bluffs him with an on-pace yorker here, and squeezes it under the bat. Varma doesn't want to take on Dhoni to steal a bye
on-pace, low full toss, driven wide of deep cover for two

Unadkat has hit as hard as he can and has got just enough to clear deep midwicket. Short ball from Bravo, a nd Unadkat gives the pull his all. Because he has had to drag this from outside off, the deep midwicket fielder stands a chance Santner leaps high, but can't get to it
low full toss, hits to the right of deep cover for two more

picks out backward point with a half-tracker first ball! Short and wide angled across seventh stump at 139 kph, there to crack with a blistering cut but doesn't keep it down and doesn't try to elevate it either. Middles it straight to Tilak at chest height behind square, where Tilak takes a bunny hop to get his hands in line and cushion the take.
fullish length and angled down the leg side. Extra to get the first run on the board in the chase.
good length ball on fourth stump at 136 kph, defended back down the pitch.
good length ball holds its line on fifth stump at 133 kph, Santner prods at this flat-footed and is beaten.

nearly another wicket! But it goes for four through the off side gap! Pitched up on a fullish length on fifth stump at 135 kph, not quite full enough to drive and shovels this in the air at chest height through the covers but picks a gap in the off side ring and it bounces away to the rope.
back of a length on sixth stump at 136 kph, again Santner is feeling away from his body and is beaten.
short ball on sixth stump at 134 kph, Santner slaps a front foot pull over wide mid-on and it bounces away to the rope.
good length ball on sixth stump, guides this with soft hands wide of slip to deep third man for one.
back of a length down the leg side at 124 kph, left alone and called a wide.
good length ball angled across middle stump at 143 kph, prods at this and a thick edge goes to ground wide of slip to deep third man for one.
good length ball on sixth stump, Uthappa feeling for the ball away from his body and is beaten.
back of a length angled in toward fifth stump, guided with soft hands off the back foot wide of Pollard at slip to deep third man for one.
short ball angled across sixth stump at 139 kph, left alone.
back of a length on the hips, flicked behind square for an easy two.
back of a length angled across fourth stump at 138 kph, defended to backward point.
back of a length on leg stump, tap and run into short midwicket and they scamper a single to beat Sams' effort fielding in his followthrough to turn and fire at the non-striker's end.

bounced out! Similar ball that Sams bowled to end the first over that Santner spanked over wide mid-on, but this time bowled tighter on a fourth or fifth stump line to cramp Santner slightly for room. Goes to pull this and top edges this to mid-on where Unadkat waits several seconds for the ball to come down before grasping onto it with elbows tucked into his torso and palms facing in.

Sams isn't going to get away with it twice! Bouncer but gets the line horribly wrong down the leg side, too easy to get inside the line and hook this well fine of Bumrah on the rope at long leg, screams flat over the rope and thuds into the LCD ad boards.
full on middle, blocked back to Sams.
back of a length on middle, defended into the off side.
back of a length speared into the legs at 140 kph, goes across to flick and misses, clips the pads and goes into the leg side for an extra.
bouncer on fifth stump, Rayudu leans back to sway under this.
back of a length again cramps up Rayudu at chest height defending awkwardly as the ball balloons well short of backward point.
bouncer again, but once more Rayudu doles out the punishment over the leg side! Short on leg stump at 136 kph, gets inside the line to swat a hook over fine leg and clears the rope by 10 yards.
back of a length on fifth stump, left alone shouldering arms to a 144 kph delivery.
another short ball ducked under sailing past leg stump at 137 kph.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended to the off side.
yorker speared in on off stump, defended.

nearly a wicket again at backward point! Fullish length on fifth stump, sucks Uthappa into a tentative and uncontrolled drive that floats just wide of Tilak leaping again at backward point and goes to the rope.
full on the stumps, driven back down the pitch and the non-striker's end timber goes anthropomorphic to become a valuable 12th fielder denying a boundary.
fullish length ball again on seventh stump, another nervy shovel that this time clears the covers comfortably and trickles to the rope.
good length ball on fourth stump at 140 kph, shuffles across to flick into midwicket for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended into the off side.
back of a length on off stump, tip and run in front of point for a sharp single.
gem! Good length ball angled across off stump and Rayudu pushes with hard hands, beaten.
back of a length on middle, another tip and run single to point.
back of a length on the stumps, defended into midwicket.
overpitched on off stump, Uthappa unleashes a hellacious drive with a 3-wood smoking this over Unadkat and thuds into the sightscreen over long-on.
144 kph deliver lands back of a length on middle, defended back down the pitch.
back of a length again on middle and off at 144 kph, defended again back to Meredith.
back of a length on off at 145 kph, defended to cover.
back of a length on fifth stump, left alone.
slower ball on a good length on middle, prodded gently into cover for one.

slower ball again on a good length on fifth stump at 117 kph, defended to short third man. Should be a dot but an overexuberant shy at the stumps flies wide and eludes the backup fielder to go for an overthrow single.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended.
back of a length on off, goes back to punch to long-on for one.
full on the stumps, flicked through midwicket for one.

fullish length ball on middle at 88 kph, walks through a flick sending it uppishly back to the bowler, who lunges right to claim a catch and flings it in the air. Uthappa is standing his ground though. To be honest, I thought he claimed it on a short hop watching it live. Replays show the ball hitting his palm at ankle height first before it then redirects/bobbles out of his palm and clangs off the ground before lodging back into his fingers. Given not out by the third umpire. There was a lot going on there. I thought it was not out live and the replays vindicate it. Kieron Pollard is not happy and voicing his frustration to the on-field umpires along with Rohit Sharma.

what a two-ball sequence this is! One ball after thinking Hrithik has Uthappa dismissed, the wily veteran seizes on an overpitched delivery on off and smashes it flat back down the ground over the long-on rope into the sightscreen.
full on the stumps, punched down the ground for one.
slower ball on the stumps on a good length, tap and run with soft hands as the ball settles adjacent to the stumps and Rayudu beats Unadkat in a footrace to the striker's end.
back of a length on middle, played with soft hands behind point for one.
back of a length on off, tap and run with soft hands to short third man for one.
bouncer over middle, left alone, too high and called wide on height.
back of a length, cuts this fine behind point and beats the man on the ring to find the rope.

missed runout! Back of a length on off, tapped toward mid-off. Rohit charges across from extra cover, scoops and underhands this from point blank range five yards away from the stumps, but he's off balance and the flick misses with Rayudu well short.

back of a length angled across fifth stump, Uthappa shuffles across trying to play a short arm jab paddle pull cheekily behind square but doesn't get it wide enough of Brevis at deep backward square leg and picks him out at chest height 10 yards in from the rope for a simple catch.
back of a length, goes back to flick through the leg side for one.
good length ball on middle, defended.
good length ball darted into the legs, defended again.
good length ball on off, prodded into the off side.
back of a length on off, prodded to extra cover.
full outside off, driven firmly to long-off for one.
in the slot angled across fifth stump at 141 kph, Dube likes pace on the ball more than what he saw last over and smokes a drive flat over long-off to the rope.
back of a length on the body, defended.
139 kph delivery lands back of a length on off stump, flicks this off the back foot through wide mid-on for two.
back of a length on middle, flicked through square leg for one.
back of a length on off, defended to backward point.
slower ball lands full on middle at 121 kph, miscues a flick aiming for midwicket and a leading edge goes short of mid-off.
back of a length on the legs, flicked behind square for one.
back of a length on the stumps, flicked to midwicket, diving stop in the ring to deny a run.
good length ball on middle, shuffles across to flick through the leg side but can't get it wide enough of midwicket.
full on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler.
full on the legs, flicked through square leg for one.
good length ball on off, defended.
slower ball lands too short on the body, Rayudu not fooled and slaughters a pull high over the leg side rope.
back of a length on the stumps, guided behind point for one.
back of a length slower ball on fifth stump, sliced to backward point.
short and wide, sliced high behind point wide enough of the sweeper for an easy two.

perfect delivery, sensational catch! Sams bangs this back of a length in the fifth stump channel at full pace angling it in toward off, flat-footed poke by Dube clips the edge and flies high toward Kishan's left at chest height. He does a salmon leap sideways to snaffle it.
yorker speared into off stump, jammed out back to Sams.
full on the legs, chipped over midwicket for one.
full on the legs, flicked to fine leg for one.
back of a length outside off, guided behind point for two.

tries to spear this low full toss flat down the leg side to get a stumping off a wide seeing Rayudu charging early, Rayudu somehow gets bat on this flicking straight to fine leg, should be just a single but a sloppy misfield by Meredith turns it into four.
another delivery darted flat down leg, this time Rayudu stays in his crease to sweep and is late. Wide called.
full and wide, sliced flat to the cover sweeper for one.
flighted more on a good length on the legs, tries to flick this away and misses off the pads.
full and wide, driven down the ground for one.
slower bouncer on fifth stump, keeps the hands back to pull through midwicket for one.
another slower ball this time lands short and very wide, cut to the point sweeper for one.
full on sixth stump, driven flat down the ground to long-off for one, cut off by SKY with a sliding stop to keep it to one.

goodness what a ball to get out to! Meatball of a full toss on the knees is skewed to Pollard at long-off! Junk sent down by Sams, but it's clearly his day when he can get a fourth with this kind of ball. Could have easily been deposited over midwicket but Rayudu awkwardly tried to punch this straight back over mid-on and instead it came off the outer half of the bat floating toward Pollard, who charged forward 20 yards off the rope and dove forward to pouch it with his bucket hands.
cutter on a good length on leg stump, Dhoni waits for it and flicks gently through midwicket to get off the mark.
full on the stumps, punched down the ground for one.
full on the legs at 139 kph, goes for a big heave over midwicket and misses off the pads.
slower ball lands on a good length angled toward the wide guideline outside off at 113 kph, miscues a slap back to Meredith.
good length ball on the wide guideline knuckles across further as a cutter, wide called.
wide yorker lands outside the guidelines, left alone as another wide.

slower ball lands full and this time within the wide guidelines at 113 kph forcing Jadeja to play at this but he's through the shot too early, shovels this high toward long-off, basic catch taken by Tilak running in and falling forward on his knees to claim it at waist height.
bouncer on fifth stump, left alone. Pretorius wanted a wide on height but it was deemed legal by the striker's end umpire.
full on seventh stump, strokes this wide of long-off and Dhoni hares back for an easy two.
starts with a wide angled back of a length down the leg side at 137 kph.
length ball wide outside off, slapped to the point sweeper for one.
gem! Yorker at 143 kph speared in on fourth stump just skids past the jammed down bat and off stump through to the keeper.
yorker again speared in on middle this time at 144 kph, flicked out through square leg for one.
back of a length on sixth stump, sliced behind point for one.
yorker speared in again on off stump, jammed out through long-on for one.
yorker on fifth stump at 142 kph, goes to jam this out and gets a thick edge to short third man. David fields on a bounce and fires at the non-striker's end but Dhoni is in for the single.
slower ball lands full on the legs, flicked away for one.
what a shot! Full ball outside leg at 128 kph, Pretorius reaches out and flicks this cross-seam ball flat and fine over long-leg well over the rope.
111 kph slower bouncer on middle, keeps his hands back to slap a pull through square leg for one.
Dhoni turning back the clock! Length ball angled across seventh stump, Dhoni reaches out to drive through cover and slashes this high over short third man backspinning away to the rope.
waist high full toss on the wide guideline outside off at 131 kph, Dhoni reaches out and toe-slaps this through cover for one.

full and wide at 127 kph, drills this drive through extra cover for a very long single. Pretorius turned back and wanted two but Dhoni didn't want to take on the relay arm of SKY and turns Pretorius back.

missed runout! Shin high full toss on fifth stump, Pretorius drills this straight to Rohit. Pretorius ran on contact but Dhoni stays put seeing the shot pick out Rohit on the ring. A throw to the striker's end is wide with Pretorius a few yards short.

overpitched on off searching for the yorker, Pretorius makes Bumrah pay with a sizzling drive past Bumrah's legs and beats the long-off fielder Sams, whose effort was quite weak diving over the top of the ball. Should've been two at worst.
searches for yorker again, another low full toss jammed out into the off side for one.
attempted yorker winds up full in the slot on fourth stump at 145 kph, Dhoni helicopters this flat to Pollard at long-on for one.

clever from Pretorius! But also very poor from Bumrah. Attempted yorker at 138 kph on sixth stump, but it's a knee high full toss and Pretorius picks the right ball to shuffle across and scoop this over fine leg to the rope.

yorker on the money this time on off stump at 141 kph, jammed down the ground to long-on for one. Dhoni wanted two to get the strike for the final over but Pollard's relay was too sharp to have any chance.

Pretorius shuffles way across his stumps and misses flicking across the line to a yorker. Looks stone dead live but umpire Oxenford gives it not out and they scamper a leg bye. Rohit calls for DRS immediately. Live, it looked like the ball pitched in line with leg stump. That was the only doubt. If it was, he's a gonner. Ball-tracking indeed shows the ball pitched in line. Oxenford has to overturn his decision to out! Pretorius was so far across his stumps, you could see leg stump showing live, so it was surprising that it was given not out on field.
full on the legs at 129 kph, whipped through midwicket for one.
in the slot on fifth stump and over the ropes at long-off! Unadkat gets the length terribly wrong at 127 kph with a cross seam delivery, Dhoni shows no mercy punishing him down the ground.

slower bouncer goes wrong now! Rohit pulls his cap over his eyes! Unadkat bangs this in on leg stump at 120 kph, Dhoni shuffles well across and flicks a pull very deftly over fine leg, one bounce over the rope.
Length outside off, steered to point off the fully open bat-face
Length outside off, uses the room by staying legside of the ball and cuts it behind square, in front of point. In the gap and to the fence
Around a good length outside off, opens the bat-face and steers to point again. The bat-face was perpendicular to the ground when the contact was made
Length outside off, steered to deep-backward point's left for two
Length outside off, pushed away from the body on the backfoot to deep backward point
Back of a good length on off, defended back to the bowler
Length down leg, retracts from the flick to let it go
Tucks a length ball on the hips to deep-fine leg
Inside edges a full ball angling in to off onto the pad from an attempted straight drive. It ricochets to the offside. Looked like there was some movement in there.
Length outside off, cut to deep point, the throw came in to the keeper and yorked him. It went back and the batters took an overthrow
Length ball at 140 kmph beats the slashing cut
Back of a good length outside off, driven off the backfoot to deep point
Back of a good length, turned with a close-faced bat to deep-square leg
Slaps a good length ball on off by making room and swinging through. Went over mid-off and into the fence
Hops and steers a length ball outside off to backward point
Full ball looks to have pitched down leg and came in to beat the flick, it deflected to the off-side into the gap toward point at a low pace which allows a single
Yorker close to the tramline has been jammed off the outside edge past the leaping wide slip fielder to his right and goes to the fence
Low full toss outside off, reaches out and steered it to the left of backward point, who stops it with a dive
Yorker length ball is taken on the full with a fine flick past the keeper for four. Thakur missed the line, it was going down leg which made the shot easier
Full ball follows the batter at a slow pace, Dhawan skied the aerial drive over cover. The fielder could not make it in time but chased it down to keep it to two
Quicker good length ball is defended to the bowler
Comes down and whacks a full toss in the gap to the left of the bowler

Whack-pulls a length ball to the keeper! It was going down leg, Dhawan made room and came back across and tried to hard-paddle, whack-pull, what have you past short-fine leg along the ground. It hit the sticker of the bat and went to the right of Pant, who moved and took it well. Dhawan walked straight after before being given by the umpire.
Good length ball just outside off is too close, and too quick, for the cut. Beaten.
103 kmph yorker around sixth stump is defended back to the bowler on the frontfoot with a full-faced bat
Slashes at a full, wide ball with a horizontal bat and is beaten
Full outside off, driven along the ground in the gap to the right of deep point for two

Chops it on! It was a back of a good length that was going away with the angle just outside off, The body went to the left as the bat reached out as he tried to dab it to third man. It took the inside edge and went back to hit the stumps on the bounce
Low full toss outside off is driven to deep cover along the ground
Good length outside off, the cutter was deflected gently between wide slip and backward point with the opening bat-face for four
Helps himself to a flick behind square on a length ball on the pads. Misfielded by short-fine leg, which allowed the ball to go to the fence
Full outside off, pushed to the right of mid-off
Full and slow on off, turned to square-leg

Runs down the ground and misses the straight loft, gets stumped! It was a good length ball over off, it straightened after pitching. The major issue was that Liam did not get to the pitch of the ball. The hands came through with the full bat-swing, the bottom hand came off, and so did the bails.
Around a good length outside off, pushed to long-off
Full outside off, driven to cover-point off the horizontal bat
Back of a good length ball at 91 kmph is defended back to the bowler on the backfoot
Opens the bat-face to a full ball outside off fully to run it down to third man. The head moved instantly with the ball
Around a length outside off, pushed with an open-faced bat past point, who misfielded it. Stopped behind square by deep point with a run to his left
Taps a length ball outside off on the head with an open-faced bat to deep backward point

Pulled straight to deep-fine leg! It was a length ball on the hips, Bairstow went back in the crease and judged the length well. However, the placement of the pull was the conundrum, as the the Fizz, took it comfortably under the bread-basket
Hostile bumper gives Shahrukh a welcome to the crease! It was rising and he tried to fend at it but realized that it was too late and got his hands down in time
Length outside off, defended off the backfoot to backward point along the ground
Good length ball spins in sharply to take the outside edge off the cover drive and goes past slip, where Shaw could not reach it and the fielder
Full outside off, defended to the off-side
Pulls a length ball that spins in sharply into the body in front of square in the air, it was at a catching height but luckily, for Jitesh, in the gap flat into the fence
Good length ball sits up outside off and is driven to cover. The back-leg came out the way as he made contact
The front-foot movement is on again, the bat-face is opened to direct a fullish ball outside off to point
Good length ball outside off is pushed to long-off
Full outside off, goes with the cover drive. It lands behind him off the bottom of the bat and goes to third man along the ground
Length on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
Good length ball comes to middle with the angle and is driven to long-on in a flat-battish manner
Defends to point and the striker takes off for the single with loud, multiple 'Ya's and is sent back. It was a full ball outside off.
Uses the room and slashes at the length ball outside off past diving point to his right. The ball spun finer in the gap on its way to the fence
A full cutter outside off, is defended to mid-off
Full on off at a slow pace, driven to long-off
Tossed up outside off, driven to wide long-off
Full and flighted again outside off, the 82 kmph ball is driven to long-off
Full ball down leg is swept hard, looks to have gone off the glove or off the top of the bat-face. The ball goes fine and beats short-fine leg
Length ball outside off is defended circumspectly off the backfoot to backward point
Full outside off, driven to long-off
length, around leg, punched towards long on
fuller, driven to cover. Firm but no placement
goes back and punches a length ball angling into him towards long on
lenghth, tossed up around off, and he pushes this towards backward point. Not a clean pickup, and that allows the single
driven towards cover
length, and he goes back to punch this towards deep point
tossed up, and goes across him, as he goes back to punch this down the ground. Beaten comprehensively!
down the wicket, and this turns back in. Looks to drive hard down the ground. Off the inside edge, on to his pad, and drops by his feet
firmly struck back at Kuldeep, and he floors a tough chance! Spins back into him, and he goes hard with a drive, and it just gets parried off his hands
sharp turn, at good pace, from middle towards leg, and he punches this towards deep midwicket. Wants a second, but the fielder is in quite a few paces
down the wicket, and looks to biff it down the ground. Comes off the inside of the bat, towards deep midwicket again
drives a fuller ball towards wide long off. Just another single in what has been a tidy over again from Kuldeep

full ball, and he looks for the sweep. Given out leg before, but he goes for the review immediately. He went across the stumps, and he was looking to get it fine. I think the question will simply be if he got a tickle on it. There's a slight spike, but that comes when the ball just grazes the ground. Goes on and hits the stumps, but with umpire's call on impact. He will have to go, but the review is retained
length, punched towards cover
angles in from outside off, and he punches it back to Axar
wide of the crease release, offers a bit of width, and he guides this with an open face towards deep backward point
fullish length, and he punches this towards long off
length, and he hangs back to punch it back towards the bowler
goes well down the wicket, and has a hoick. Off the inside of the bat towards deep square leg
tosses this up, with a slip in place, and he gets the outside edge as Rabada looks to play it from outside off towards midwicket. Goes in the air, but safely towards point
outside off, fuller length, and punched towards long off

fullish, and through his defence! Rabada has a hopeful poke at it, from the crease. Didn't really pick the length or the line properly. The ball goes through as he looks to drive, and it rattles somewhere between middle and leg. Kuldeep has deserved some reward for his spell today, and he gets it today
length, around off, and he defends after allowing it to pitch and go on with the angle

Kuldeep strikes again! Just tosses this up, around off, and with the angle of his release, it slides on, and also turns just a touch. Ellis has a tentative attempt at a drive, but his bat also comes down at an angle, and leaves enough room between bat and pad for the ball to sneak in and rattle the stumps
length, around off, and punched hard into the ground just ahead of him
length ball, outside off, and he strikes this hard down the ground. Cut off by long on, but enough time to get back for the second

edged through to Pant! That's probably the last surviving hope for Punjab to reach a fighting total. Length ball, angles across him, and he flays at it, but with little feet movement. Gets a decent edge through to the wicketkeeper, as Khaleel wheels off in celebration
short, angled in, and he ducks under this. Not totally convincing though
pins a yorker, with Arshdeep looking to back away. Goes between the batter and leg stump
wow, he has crrrrrrrunched this down the ground. Khaleel bowls a leg stump full toss, to be fair, and he backs away and simply singes this through the long on region
Axar from round the wicket, with a slip, starts with a length ball on the stumps, and he defends with a forward press
defends one slanting back into him
jabs this away towards deep point
goes back and punches this firmly towards the bowler. A half-stop by Axar, and then some hesitation as the batters consider a single, but then decide against it
punches one towards point
fullish ball, and he looks to flick this. Plays all around it, but perhaps struck just outside the line. Pant has a loud appeal, but no conviction in it from the bowler himself
length, and jabbed away towards point
on pace cutter, a bit short in length, and he looks to dab it down to third. Just drops it over on the off side
short, angles across Chahar, who has a stab at this, but makes contact with thin air
short, across his right shoulder, and he absolutely creams this towards deep backward square leg. May not have intended to send it this fine, but that is some shot!
short again, and he angles his bat to steer this down to third
wide of the crease, yorker length, and dug out towards midwicket
short, outside off, and he has cut this fiercely. A bit of a misfield from the man at deep cover, and he gets four for this!
flat, and driven back to the bowler off the back foot
advances down the pitch, and then defends a length ball around off

sweep, and straight to Rovman Powell at deep backward square leg! Chahar has just made too much of a connection with this ball. It wasn't tossed up a lot, but the line was teasing and tempting, angling in and on the stumps, at a fuller length. Probably there for the sweep, but he failed to keep it down
length, and he punches this towards midwicket with the angle into him
goes back and punches this back towards the bowler
fullish, across him, and he backs away in trying to drive. No contact, thankfully, neither with bat nor with the top of off stump!
slower ball, cuts across him, and he doesn't know a lot about it. Just loosely lets his bat hang out, and sees it go across him
backs away and just punches this to the left of Warner at cover. Quick single pinched
short, and he backs away too. Looks to scoop it over the keeper, but fails to make contact. The line was well outside off
backs away yet again, and has a swing and a miss, possibly with closed eyes. The line was on the stumps, but the length a little shorter
fullish, and he backs away and is somehow able to squirt it away towards deep square leg. This was homing in on the leg stump
fullish ball, off the inside edge, just misses leg stump, and would have run away for four, but for Pant. Superb, one-handed grab after it goes into the ground and to his right
yorker gone awry, becomes a leg stump full toss, and Arshdeep just nonchalantly slaps it down the ground. The footwork is identical, backing away to create room
fullish cutter, and he backs away and finds he has left himself with a long way to recover if he wants to lay bat on it. Smart from the Fizz
slower ball again, way outside off. Arshdeep backs away again, and tries to get back on time, but cannot
on pace, but full outside off, and he yet again creates a lot of room. Cannot make any contact with this

full, just outside off, and he has a swing and a miss. Wants a single, but won't be getting anything for this. Pant is quick to come over and whip the bails off. Unselfish, that is one way of looking at it, I guess
Back of a length ball is flicked to the deep in front of square along the ground
Good length ball swings in sharply and takes the inside edge of the cover drive that came with the bat coming from across and the French cut went through fine-leg along the ground for four
More prodigious in-swing pitches on a length well outside off and beats an attempted cover drive that was played with a slightly horizontal bat
Covers the swing and defends a full-length ball coming in to the bowler
Full ball is slightly overpitched and Shaw uses the swing and flicks it aerially over midwicket with the bat-face closing slightly
Good length ball almost on the tramline is creamed through the covers with a full extension of the arms. Aerially hit in the gap to the fence.
Good length ball is down leg, Warner flicks but getting outside the line by going across
Fullish ball outside off, pushed to forward point with a fully open bat-face
Full just outside off, stands firmly and lets the bat come through. Swings it straight aerially to the right of the gap between the bowler and mid-off
Full outside off, driven to the right of mid-off, who runs a few yards and stops it
Length ball on the belly is turned to the gap at square-leg for one
Length ball over off is pulled to deep mid-wicket with a roll of the wrists along the ground
Launches a ramp to a short ball outside off, it almost goes for six! The ball was wide and somewhat short but the elevation off the bat swing that went from bottom to up allowed the long takeoff.
Length ball outside off is cut off the backfoot to deep point
Good length ball just outside off takes the inside edge from the defence off the full-faced bat to square leg
Overpitches on middle and Warner drives it straight with the front-leg going away. Scoots to the fence off the middle of the bat
Punches a back of a good length ball off the backfoot through the gap at cover. Ellis rocketed across and dove to his right but could not stop it
Digs out a yorker at fifth stump to point
Back of a good length ball outside off is heaved with a horizontal bat. It took the bottom-quarter of the bat and went way up but it had the distance as well. Just cleared the long-off fence.
Fours and sixes are the new dots and ones! Flicks a length ball with a crouch past short-fine leg
Slower good length ball on the stumps is worked to the deep-midwicket gap for two
Aerially flicks a half-volley outside leg through midwicket with a lovely turn of the wrists
Goes back and pulls a length ball through midwicket for four more!

Lands between mid-wicket running back and the man from the deep! It was a length ball that took the top-edge off the pull. Dhawan was running back and went for the catch and Ellis, who was coming across, had not run in enough. The ball was past Dhawan's reach and fell into the ground. One taken.
Goes under a short ball over middle to let it go
Full toss down leg misses the attempted help past short-fine. Taken well by the keeper to his right
Good length ball on the stumps is clipped to mid-wicket
Half-volley down leg has Warner moving to the legside and flicking it with a whippy flourish past midwicket
Warner bluffs by moving away to the legside, the bowler followed him with a slower one down leg. But the batter went back towards the stumps as the ball was coming in to avail a wide.
Stands firm and flicks a full ball aerially inside-out behind square to the deep. The fielder took it on the bounce and threw it back
Whacks a length ball outside off with a pull that was dragged to midwicket. It came off the bottom but cleared the in-field and that the sole need for the ball to go to the fence
The ball slips out of Arshdeep's hands, the full-toss is outside the tramline just below waist-height. Beats the attempted slash and goes to the keeper
Short and wide and Shaw says, 'cut shot, city limits' with an aerial cut behind square on the offside
Full toss outside off is pushed to mid-off
Good length ball on the stumps is pushed to mid-on
Hits a good length outside off, defended to the bowler. Looked to have stopped on the batter after hitting the deck, not sure if it was a slower one. Looked like it, though.
Short ball dug into the pitch at a slower pace is ducked under to let go down leg.

Leading edge goes between point and short-third man! It was a length ball on the stumps, Shaw closed the bat-face way too early, it took the edge and lobbed up at a catching height to the right of point, who had no chance of taking it. Lucky four for them.
Back of a good length ball outside off is steered to the right of short-third, who parries it. Mix-up between the batters but it was a safe run
And again! This was slightly fuller, it was another flick that went to cover on the bounce. Shaw thought of going for the overthrow but it was not on
Length ball outside off is defended off the backfoot to short-third man
Good length ball is tossed up outside off, Shaw lifts it with a horizontal bat and an open-faced bat. Balloons off the edge to deep point who was running in diagonally to his left on the bounce
Good length on the stumps, pushed to long-on

Slog-swept to deep-midwicket, where Ellis balanced himself with a side-twist and took over his left shoulder! It was a full ball, tossed up outside off, the sweep got the top-edge and the ball was traveling, but Ellis kept his eye on it and settled in well, and maintained his balance
Full outside off, driven to cover
Good length outside off, slow again. Cut to point
Full outside off, drags a pull to deep-midwicket
Length over off, defended to the bowler off the backfoot
Short and wide, jumps and cuts it along the ground to the left of deep-cover, who runs in and stops it
Good length ball jumps up outside off, Warner is surprised but he checked the defence with the horizontal bat-face looking at mid-off. It lobbed up but landed safely on its way to the fielder
Whacks a pull off the length ball, it sails over midwicket past the fence.
Length outside off, cut off the backfoot to deep cover
Full just outside off, flicks it with limited control in the air. Finds mid-on on the bounce
Full outside off, pushed to cover
Full on the legs, flicked to long-on
Length outside off, Sarfaraz finally gets hold of one. It is a cut, which was waited for, that goes behind square in the gap. Well away from the deep point fielder who was running in.
Sits on a knee and pulls a length ball that was dragged back, it was on the body and was stopped well in the deep at square leg
Reaches out and sweeps a low full toss outside off to deep square leg to bring up 100.

Full on middle, Warner stayed legside and whacked a slog-sweep over midwicket. The fielder at the deep had come in because it was the long boundary but it went across and behind to his left and he could not run back.
Blocks a length ball over the stumps to mid-on on the backfoot
Length ball outside off is turned to third man off the backfoot with an open-faced bat
Warner brings up 50 with a cut, it was a short and wide ball, which was capitalized on with comfort.
Length ball on the stumps is flicked off the backfoot to deep square leg
Short ball goes across the right hander down leg, Sarfaraz tried to help it on its way with the bat-swing going from down the up but missed it.
Full on off, pushed to midoff
Low full toss outside off is driven to the left of deep cover for one
Tucks a slow, good length ball that spins into middle behind square in the gap for one.
Length ball outside off is cut to deep cover to level the scores.
Warner finishes the game with an effortless pull past midwicket along the fence to punish the drag-down.
length ball around off and middle. Defended on the leg side
RCB off the mark with a leg-bye. Was another length ball on the pads. Rawat misses the flick and the ball goes in front of square leg. And they come back for the second
fuller length, but down the leg side and it further shapes away from the batter

a great take from de Kock. Saved four runs. Chameera once again strays on the pads, with the ball shaping further down. Rawat goes for the flick but misses and the ball hits the thigh pad. de Kock dives to his right and grabs it with one hand
down the track and smashes it between the bowler and mid-on. Perhaps not exactly from the middle of the bat but more than enough on it to take it to the boundary

taken at mid-off. Or is it? Rawat once again looks to hit down the ground but ends up mistiming this fuller delivery. It goes towards mid-off, where Rahul dives forward and across to catch. They are checking upstairs and the third umpire is happy with it, the fingers were under the ball

two in two for Chameera. Kohli walks back for a first-ball duck. A wry smile on his face. Sadness on the faces of some of the fans in the stands. It was short of length outside off, Kohli played at it away from the body. But he couldn't keep it down and Hooda pouches it at backward point
length ball in the channel, left alone
short of length outside off, some extra bounce there as du Plessis looks to defend. Just manages to keep it down, on the off side
length ball around off, defended on the off side
short of length outside off, du Plessis cuts it over backward point for a single
length ball outside off, pushed through covers for a couple. Off the mark
beaten! A length ball around off and moving away. Maxwell pushes at it and gets beaten
fuller length outside off, du Plessis stretches forward and flays at it. From the outer half of the bat but it goes over backward point, for four
length ball around off, drops it towards cover and sets off. A quick single
length ball around off, stays in his crease and defends
Super shot, great placement. A length ball around off, and driven on the up. Through extra cover for four
even better. For a moment, it reminded me of Viv Richards' flick. Fuller length around off, Maxwell plants his front foot across and flicks it over midwicket/wide mid-on region

I am running out of adjectives. Majestic from Maxwell. Chameera shortens his length but it looked like it was all part of Maxwell's plan. He was standing back and pulls it over square leg. All the way for a six
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards square leg
length ball on the stumps, a bit of turn and looked like it came slower off the pitch. du Plessis was looking to work it on the leg side but ends up playing back towards the bowler
short of length around off, turned towards square leg
Maxwell is toying with the bowling here. Fuller length but he brings out the slog sweep. The key is the placement though, he plays it behind square leg, away from the fielder
length ball on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on for a quick single
fuller, angling into the pads, tucked away towards deep midwicket. The initial call is for two but they will have to settle for one
length ball around off, slaps it towards of mid-off
length outside off, waits for it before dabbing it towards backward point. At first, they thought there was a single there but soon realised it went straight to the fielder
that's poor from Avesh. Short and wide and du Plessis smashes it over covers for four
length ball outside off, that late steer once again, this time he manages to guide the ball towards third man
short of length outside off, Maxwell goes for the cut but gets beaten by the extra bounce
length outside off, Maxwell goes for the cut but it's not that wide. Ends up mistiming it. Was in the air but well away from the backward point. Third man cuts it off
length ball on the stumps, turned away towards midwicket

a superb catch by Holder. A length ball around off. Maxwell goes for the reverse sweep but fails to middle it. It goes to the left of Holder, going away from him. But he stretches and gets both hands to it. In the end, he completes the catch with his left hand, falling on the ground
length ball around off, clipped towards midwicket
length ball on the stumps, punched towards mid-on
fuller on the stumps, backs away and hits it along the ground towards wide long-off
quicker on the stumps, punched back
length but way outside off. Left alone to pocket a wide
length outside off, stays back and punches it towards sweeper cover
length ball on the stumps, sliding in. Whipped towards deep midwicket
length outside off, late-cuts it and sets off. But Holder moves to his left quickly, makes the stop and fires in the throw to prevent the single
almost an action replay of the last ball. Another late cut towards Holder but Bishnoi has bowled a huge no-ball. Free hit coming up
and Prabhudessai takes full advantage of the free hit. Fuller outside off. Prabhudessai gets down on one knee and launches it over long-off
a googly. Fuller around off and spinning in. Prabhudessai stretches forward and looks to push it towards extra cover. The ball hits the inner half and rolls in front of square leg
fuller outside off and smashes towards extra cover. Rahul misfields to his left there and Avesh at deep cover had no chance to cut it off. Fifteen from that over
short of length outside off, Prabhudessai pushes at it and gets beaten

a soft dismissal. Dances down the track to this length ball and looks to work it on the leg side. But looks like it came slower off the surface. Gets lobbed towards short midwicket where Krunal accepts the dolly
short of length around off, dabbed towards cover-point
short of length outside off, gets on his toes and cuts it towards sweeper cover
short of length around off, extra bounce there. du Plessis was looking to work it on the leg side, the ball hits the splice of the bat and drops in front of square leg
length ball outside off, steered to the right of short third man for one
short of length angling in. Helped behind square leg for a couple
short of length outside off, cuts it past the diving backward point, to the left of the fielder

momentarily confusion there between Shahbaz and du Plessis but all well in the end. Was a length ball outside off, Shahbaz dabbed it towards third man but backward point was moving to his right but was well away from the ball in the end. du Plessis shouted "no" initially but then realised it was safe single
smashed between the bowler and mid-off. Fuller around off and du Plessis absolutely smashed it. KL Rahul was holding his left leg there as he tried to move in an attempt to stop it
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards deep square leg
length but wide down the leg side
short of length outside off, steered towards third man
short on fifth stump, opens the face to steer this to deep third man for one.
back of a length into the ribs, cramps him up on the back foot and can't get this away.
good length ball on off, defended into the pads and trickles toward Holder.
back of a length on fourth stump, rises sharply into the gloves but is played softly behind point for one.
short and wide outside off, goes to cut but continues seaming away outside the guideline and wide is called.
short on sixth stump at 129 kph, sliced to deep third man for one.
short on fifth stump at 128 kph, sits up for Faf to whack with a firm pull over wide midwicket bouncing away to the rope.
good length ball slanted across fifth stump, prodded with soft hands through point for one.
good length ball on off, flicked through square leg for one.
back of a length on fourth stump at 98 kph, flicked off the back foot through midwicket for one.
back of a length on the stumps, goes back and across to flick into midwicket for one.
fullish length ball on middle at 99 kph, punched through cover to the sweeper for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, goes back to flick into midwicket for one.
flighted full on fourth stump, sweeps this firmly through square leg for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, skids on and is defended back to Bishnoi.
back of a length on fifth stump, goes back to punch to extra cover.
too full on fifth stump, Faf slams a firm drive past Bishnoi's diving effort through mid-off and beats the man who was fielding very wide on the rope.
good length ball on the stumps, Faf goes back for a gentle tap through vacant midwicket weighted perfectly to come back for two.
googly spins in on a good length from sixth stump, tapped through point for one.

Faf shuffles across to a wide yorker on fifth stump and tries to ramp this over fine leg, comes off the toe of the bat through the off side for one. Faf is clutching his left wrist/forearm after the shot in some pain after being hit by a very wild relay through to the bowler's end.
full on off, blunted back through mid-on for one.
Faf tries the ramp again, but Chameera drags the line wider outside off to counter. Faf tries to adjust with a reverse ramp over third man but misses.
short on seventh stump, toe slaps this to long-off for one.
slower ball lands on a good length on middle, flicked easily off the back foot through square leg for two.
full and wide, slices a drive toward the cover sweeper, horrendous relay 20 yards wide of the keeper is backed up by short fine leg to keep it to two.
good length ball on sixth stump, carved through point to the sweeper for one.
googly spins across from leg stump, prodded into cover for one.
good length ball on off, prodded to backward point for none.
flighted too full on off, Faf unleashes a massive slog over long-on sailing deep into the seats.
back of a length on off, goes back to flick into midwicket for one to bring up a half-century off 40 balls.

dropped! Clever bowling from Bishnoi but lets himself down with the catching effort running back to a skier! Flights this full but drags it very wide outside off on eighth stump to make Shahbaz reach way outside his body trying to slog sweep a googly, Top edge swirls behind Shahbaz who turns around and sprints back 20 yards for the effort with long-on nowhere close to be able to charge in from the rope. Bishnoi gets there in time, but then slows up his run to steady himself trying to catch this over the shoulder and winds up slowing up too much resulting in a dive late as the ball slips through his fingers. 9/10 difficulty chance running back over his shoulder, but he got there and should have taken it by his own standards.
back of a length on the stumps, flicked away for one.
slightly short on off, leans back to hammer a pull through wide long-on to the rope.
charges and is beaten in flight to a fullish length ball on middle, checks it back to Krunal.
Krunal skids this in fuller and flatter, punched down the ground through long-on for one.
full on fourth stump, flicks through long-on for one.

flighted too full again on middle, Faf slaughters a drive back over Krunal's head and thuds into the fencing over long-on. Faf turns his back after contact and doesn't bother to see where it lands because he knows he's hit it sweetly.
slower ball on a good length lands too wide outside off and cuts further outside the guidelines, wide called.
wide yorker this time on eighth stump, carved out to the cover sweeper for one.

back of a length on fifth stump, slapped into the covers straight to KL Rahul, Shahbaz sets off from the non-striker's end but Faf wasn't interested. Relay from Rahul goes to Holder on one bounce at the bowler's end as Shahbaz tries to scamper back. It goes to the third umpire to determine if his bat was over the line before the bails are dislodged. Looks like his bat is on the line, but not past the line and a fifty partnership is now toast.
Holder goes searching for yorker and pays the price. Too full in the slot on off at 134 kph, Faf shovels a drive flat back over Holder's head, one bounce over the rope.
slower bouncer on middle, pulled flat through midwicket for one.
back of a length on the hips, flicked through square leg for one.
short on the stumps and pulled through deep square leg, sliding stop by Bishnoi to keep it to two.
fullish length on middle at 140 kph, flicked to deep fine leg for one.
goes for wide yorker, but Faf is too good! Full on sixth stump, Faf creams this in the air through extra cover and it skids to the rope.
short and wide on the guidelines, uppercuts this behind point for two.
thigh high full toss on middle stump at 138 kph, Faf tamely chips this over midwicket for one. Really should have disappeared for six but he seemed caught off guard by the full toss.
good length ball seams in on fifth stump, tap and run into midwicket.
short on sixth stump, toe slaps this to long-off for one.
skids this on a good length flat on the legs, flicked gently into square leg for a sharp two.
short on the body, mistimes a pull but gets it wide enough of deep square leg to collect another two.
short on sixth stump, goes back and cuts straight to cover on the ring for no run.
half-tracker on middle, Faf picks the length early and goes back to clobber this flat through the gap between wide long-on and deep midwicket, one bounce over the rope.
good length ball on middle and leg, goes back to flick perfectly weighted to come back for two through midwicket.

everything going Faf's way at the moment! Bishnoi tries to skid this on quicker on a good length on fourth stump at 101 kph, Faf goes back to cut and is beaten somewhat with a very thick edge but is still able to pierce the gap between backward point and short third man to the rope.
Avesh goes for wide yorker at 136 kph, DK shuffles across and slog sweeps this along the ground through midwicket for one.
back of a length on fifth stump, guides this cut gently to the sweeper for one.
wide yorker on seventh stump, jammed out behind point for one.

harsh wide outside off! Harsh but fair though. Wide yorker skids just a touch past the wide guidelines and Faf leaves it alone. He had shuffled a touch outside off though. Could have been deemed not wide under the new guidelines.
full and wide, slices this through the off side.
knee high full toss on off stump, Faf mishits a meatball for the second time in the latter stages through midwicket for just one.

DK puts an exclamation point on the over! Avesh searches for yorker at 131 kph but doesn't get it full enough, instead sits up in the slot for DK to slaughter over long-off high and mighty over the rope.

another meatball of a full toss at knee height on leg stump, three times now Faf has gently flicked this into the leg side for one instead of crushing it over the ropes. Had he done it on any one of those full tosses, he'd have his three figures by now.

dropped! Stoinis spills a sitter at deep backward square! Slower ball on the body on a good length, pulled flat to Stoinis who stays back on the rope as the ball dips sharply late with topspin on the shot. He reaches forward from his knees but it slips through his fingers at shin height. Turned a straightforward chance into a difficult one and shells it.
short on the stumps, slaps this flat through the leg side for one.
fullish length ball on the stumps, driven firmly to long-on for one.

fuller length outside off, de Kock pushes it towards extra cover and KL Rahul sets off. The fielder dives to his left to make the stop but is not in a position to throw the ball. Just rolls it towards the stumps. No power behind that and Rahul is back safely

that climbed alarmingly. A length ball on the stumps, took de Kock by surprise who was looking to work it on the leg side. Hit him on the glove and lobbed in front of square leg. They run a single but de Kock is in pain. The physio is out to have a look
length ball around off, shaping away from the batter. Defended square of the wicket
length ball outside off, defended from the back foot
fuller outside off and Rahul drives it on the front foot. Bisects the gap between cover and point. Off the mark in style
back-to-back fours. Fuller length on the pads and Rahul has flicked it through midwicket. The fielder puts in the dive but cannot stop it. Then he puts in the chase, only to come a distant second
short of length outside off, goes back and slaps it towards short cover. A misfield there allows the single
length ball but down the leg side and spinning further down
length ball on the pads, tucked behind square leg. Two is the call and they get it easily
length ball on the stumps, goes back and punches it towards short midwicket
length ball on the stumps, goes back again and works it towards short midwicket

a drop? Looks like. A length ball down the leg side. Goes down on one knee to pull it behind square leg. Looks like he got some bat on it but a difficult chance for the keeper. Replay shows it hit the flap of the pad
worked towards short midwicket where he beats the diving fielder for one
length ball around off, tucked away towards midwicket
short of length around off, drops it towards cover-point for a single
short of length that nips back in. Rahul was looking for a flick but misses and is hit on the thigh
short of length outside off, goes back and pulls it towards deep square leg

taken at first slip. A length ball angling across de Kock, who pushes at it tentatively and gets an outside edge. Karthik puts in half a dive, leaving it for Maxwell eventually who grabs it with both hands to his right, just above waist height
short of length outside off, left alone
length ball around off, comes forward and nudges it towards point for a quick single
fuller around off, driven towards long-off
pushes it towards covers and sets off. A quick single
fuller on the stumps, whipped towards short midwicket. A fumble there but it doesn't cost

an outside edge past the keeper. There's no slip. Was a length ball angled in around off. Pandey looks to defend but it spins away to take the outside edge. Would have been an easy catch for slip, instead it runs away for four
fuller around off, pushed towards extra cover
length ball around off, angling in. Tucked away towards midwicket
length outside off, arches back and steers it towards third man
short and down the leg side. Rahul swivels to pull it over short fine leg, and it hits the boundary cushion on the full
length ball around off, coming in a touch. Drops it towards point for a quick single
an excellent stop by Hasaranga at point. Length outside off, steered towards point where Hasaranga dives to his left and makes a one-handed stop
a soft dismissal. Short of length at the body, Pandey goes for the pull but the ball hits him high on the bat. A simple catch for Harshal at forward square leg
length ball around off, comes forward and drops it towards covers for a quick single
length ball on the stumps, pushed down the ground for a quick single
a bouncer, just outside off. Pulled down in front of square leg
fuller on the stumps, driven towards mid-off
fuller and driven straight down the ground. Mid-off dives to his left but ends up diving over the ball
back-to-back fours. A length ball angling towards the off side. Stays back and drives it through covers
fuller, pushed back towards the bowler
pitched up around off, goes for the drive but ends up hitting it uppishly. A single through covers
length ball on the stumps, goes back and turns it towards short midwicket
length ball on the stumps, goes back and flicks it towards deep square leg
length ball on the stumps, slog-swept towards deep square leg, the fielder sprints to his right but cannot stop the second
length ball on the stumps and spinning in. Tucked away towards square leg
short of length outside off, smashes it through extra cover. The sweeper cover sprints to his left, reaches there in time but messes up the dive and the ball sneaks past him for four
use of feet this time but pushes it towards extra cover in the end
length outside off, cuts it behind point. Siraj moves across to his left from third man to make the stop

short of length down the leg side. Moves across and looks to pull it fine. Was there a tickle on it? Karthik goes up in the appeal, the bowler joins him but no one is confident. Not out, says the umpire
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it behind point. Third man didn't have a chance
a bouncer this time, well outside off, and way too short. Rahul leaves it alone and it sails over the keeper's head. Five wides

a slower one down the leg side. Looks to glance but misses. The umpire says it's not a wide. RCB have opted for a review. And the UltraEdge shows a murmur as the ball passes the bat. Rahul is surprised, he even gestures to the dugout if there was something on the UltraEdge. Kohli, meanwhile, lets out a roar
length ball on the pads, goes for the slog sweep but misses. The ball hits the pad and goes behind the keeper
fuller around off, driven towards long-off
down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball and launches it over long-on
length ball on the stumps, punched back
length ball on the stumps, Krunal was looking to work it on the leg side but the ball stops at him. He checks his shots and it falls just short of Kohli at short midwicket
length ball around off, defended
googly to start on off turning in to middle on a good length, defended on the back foot to midwicket.
full but straying on the legs, Hooda doesn't hesitate to sweep on the line and powers this behind square flat to the rope.
full on sixth stump, mistimes a flick to Kohli at midwicket.

uses his feet but is beaten in flight to a full ball on off stump, ambitious shout for lbw with Hooda several yards down the track missing a flick. It goes to cover for a leg bye. Replays show he was hit well outside the line of off stump too.
Shot of the day by Krunal over extra cover! Flighted too full on fifth stump, room to free the arms outside off and lofts this well wide of long off thudding into the LCD ad boards.
full on off, prodded into the off side ring.

what a fielding effort from captain Faf to deny a boundary! Hooda shuffles down the track to heave a flat drive to long-on, du Plessis charges left and slaps this back from going over and tumbles into the LCD ad boards on the landing. He clutches at his shoulder but gets up okay in the end and has saved two runs.

flighted full and very wide outside off, Hooda reaches optimistically well away from his body to sweep a ball just inside the wide guideline and misses. He reaches so far trying to connect that ball that he's off balance and DK whips off the bails with a stumping appeal as Hooda overbalances, but did DK time it right? Back toe appears to be safely just behind the line though. Hooda continues.
good length ball on sixth stump, backs away to cut and chops it into the ground instead.
full and wide, slices a drive in the air toward extra cover for one.
good length ball on middle, flicked into midwicket and chased down by Shahbaz but he fumbles to allow a single.
fullish length ball on sixth stump, goes to drive and it climbs with some extra bounce to sky off a thick edge over backward point that lands just safely beyond Kohli running back from the ring.
length ball on off, mistimes a flick into the leg side but works out to Hooda's advantage as it dribbles through the ring for them to be able to come back for two.
back of a length on leg stump, backs away to tap and run into the covers.
length ball angled across fifth stump, goes to drive over cover and a thick edge flies over short third man to the rope.
goes for a wide yorker, but gets it too wide outside the guideline and will have to rebowl.
shuffles well outside off to counter Harshal's attempted wide yorker at 133 kph, flicks this into the leg side for one.
120 kph slower ball lands full on middle and leg, jammed out to mid-off for one.
back of a length on off, taps this behind point for one.
slower bouncer wide outside off, tries to uppercut this over third man but can't get bat on it.

short ball into the ribs beats Krunal's attempted pull and trickles just past the stumps to allow a leg bye. Inches away from falling off the body onto off stump as he swiveled around missing the shot.

superb effort at deep third man by Suyash! Short and wide, Hooda goes to uppercut this over the third man rope but gets under it too much. It swirls toward the man charging in from the rope who judges it well sliding on his knees to soften the catch 15 yards in from the boundary.
full on off stump, jammed out into midwicket for one.
145 kph delivery lands back of a length on off, defended back down the wicket.
helicopter shot through midwicket! Full on fifth stump at 143 kph, Badoni is even better wristily whipping this away through the leg side.
too short to start with on fifth stump, Krunal has room to slice this in the gap between backward point and short third man to the rope.
charges now and is beaten badly in flight, throws his hands at it and gets bat on it to keep it out into the off side.
full on middle, defended.

he looked uncomfortable the previous few balls and now holes out to deep midwicket. Slightly short on off stump and sticks in the wicket a touch as Krunal struggles keeping his hands back on a pull. He can't get any power behind it and picks out the man on the rope who takes this five yards in at chest height.
good length ball on the legs, flicked through midwicket for one.
good length ball on middle, goes back and across to flick through square leg for one.

shuffle across the stumps to try to ramp a slower ball at 118 kph over fine leg, Siraj adjusts to bowl this on a good length almost off the pitch outside off, but Badone does even better to still flick this over the keeper and to the rope.
good length ball passes outside the guideline outside off, but Badoni had shuffled well across to play and the umpire gives some leniency to Siraj.
another good length ball passes over the guideline outside off, missed cut and no wide called.
full and wide, squirts this to short third man but can't get it past the ring fielder.
short and wide guides this with an open face to deep third man for one.
short and wide outside off, left alone and too wide to play at so he'll have to redo it.
goes for wide yorker and sends down a shin high full toss outside off punched through cover for one.
good length ball into the legs, follows Stoinis backing away to flick into the leg side for one.
flighted full on fifth stump, charge down the track and misses a flick off the pads with a carom going into the off side for an extra.
good length ball on the legs, goes to sweep/pull on a knee and picks out short fine leg for a tight single.
good length ball flicked into the leg side for one.
short ball on off, sits up for Stoinis to lean back and destroy this flat over long-on thudding into the sightscreen.
good length ball tapped gently down the ground to long-on this time for one.
great manipulation of the field by Stoinis! Short on eighth stump, Stoinis shuffles way outside off to smoke a pull through midwicket with the boundary stacked on the off side and he finds the rope.
full and wide outside off, this time driven firmly to long-off for just one.
slower ball short and wide, slices a cut well wide of Suyash at deep third man, sliding stop but fumbles to allow a second run.

Hazlewood sends down a knuckle slower ball full and very wide outside off, Badoni shuffles away across his stumps and tries to heave this ball from well outside the guidelines into the vacant leg side boundary but pays the price and feathers an edge through to DK.
short and wide, as tall and long-limbed as Holder is, he can't reach this delivery tailing well away from the guidelines. Wide called.
full outside off at 138 kph, driven firmly to long-off.
slower ball lands short on the stumps at 111 kph, Stoinis keeps his hands back to flick this gently into square leg for one.
back of a length slower ball at 118 kph on off, pushed gently into midwicket for one.
back of a length on fifth stump, Holder stays back to flick into midwicket for one.
slower ball angled down leg, Stoinis shuffles across to scoop over fine leg but misses, wide called.
full and follows Stoinis backing away from leg, punched gently into cover for one.

goes for a slower ball yorker that meets Holder at waist height at 116 kph on off stump, but he flubs the shot hitting the toe, more like a billiards cue scratch, and it dribbles just wide of the pitch for one.
short and wide on fifth stump, goes to cut and slices a thick top edge over the keeper to the rope at third man.
length ball lands on sixth stump, slapped back toward Harshal's feet in his follow-through and goes under him to long-off for one.

short and wide well outside off, almost off the pitch, left alone by Stoinis and not called a wide. Umpire Gaffaney claims Stoinis shuffled outside off and could've reached this. Stoinis did indeed shuffle outside off but the ball was basically off the pitch when it passed him. Stoinis is flabbergasted.

cover your children's ears! Stoinis shuffles way way outside off in the context of the previous ball that was not called a wide and is standing almost on the wide guideline trying to play a full ball into the leg side and inside edge's this onto the stumps. He lets out a massive "F*** you!" that can be heard through the stump mic clear as day all the way back to Australia before walking off.
length ball on sixth stump, Chameera tries to heave this to the leg side and misses.
wide yorker on sixth stump, plays over the top of this.
wide ball way outside off, can't hit this.
yorker jammed out into the leg side for one.
full and wide, squeezed to deep third man for one.
bouncer sails over off stump, can't connect with a hook.

fullish length slower ball on fourth stump at 115 kph, Holder shovels this high and deep toward the man at deep midwicket, Suyash, who misjudges his leap a bit and it just clears him to go over the rope.
length ball on middle, mistimes a heave through midwicket and they turn down a run. Holder staying on strike to play for tournament net run rate.
full and wide outside off, Holder flays this majestically high over the extra cover rope. Unfortunately for him, it'll be just a cosmetic adjustment to the final margin.
this one doesn't swing and Buttler is hit on the inside edge. The pad is in the way, though
another inside edge. Is this a slow pitch? Buttler looks to push at a length ball outside off, but is early into the shot
bouncer, sharp bouncer, 141ks, head high, just outside off, beats Buttler's attempt to hook. No way he could have controlled it from there had he got a touch on this
walks at him, and steers this yorker down to third man for one. It is a no-ball
and he connects thin air. Umesh goes full and wide, Padikkal doesn't move towards it as he tries to go over long-off. Good carry
on a length, just outside off, defended towards mid-off. Top start from Umesh again
