beaten on the inside edge as he pushes at a wide length ball. It moves in slightly after pitching
walks at him, pushes a length ball wide of mid-off for one
gets the line wrong. Stays on a length but strays on the pads. Padikkal flicks it through midwicket to beat deep square leg
starts outside leg again, and Padikkal fails to make a connection this time. A leg-bye ensues
inswinger, headed for top of off, Buttler punches it to extra cover
short of a length, uses soft hands to push this towards mid-off, who is right at the edge of the circle, for a single
Buttler has had enough sighters. Umesh pitches on a length, outside off, and Buttler lofts him over mid-on. Clears him with ease
this is out on the road. Buttler clears the front leg, and effortlessly slogs this length ball over wide long-on for a huge huge six. Either on the road or on the parking lot or tennis courts
Buttler is clearing the front leg early with bad intentions. Umesh this time is just full enough to not let him get under it. Also cramps him up. He still manages to drill it straight to mid-on
Buttler is ready with the front leg out of the way again, but Umesh squeezes in a full ball wide outside off to beat him
slower bouncer, beats him, Jackson doesn't collect it cleanly, allowing them a bye, and Venkatesh Iyer concedes an overthrow with a direct hit from point

we have an all-run four. Might be the first in the IPL? Without overthrows I mean. And this is an incredible shot. This is a yorker just outside off, and Buttler has squeezed it out between point and cover-point. V Iyer puts in an excellent chase, dives to keep the ball in, but the dive takes him far from the ball, allowing Buttler to come back for the fourth. Not without a dive of his own
short of a length, straight, worked into the leg side

that is disrespectful. And almost gentle. He just stands where he is, gets behind this length ball, and lofts it, off the back foot, back over his head for a six. All timing, no power. really difficult shot
pushes this into the big leg side, and comes back for two. It is way bigger that side. That is where he ran four last over
too short, but it skids through to hurry Buttler into the pull. He does well to keep it down and take a single to deep square leg
into the pads, worked into the leg side for a single

again lets him play off the back foot, and Buttler punches him through cover into the small boundary on the off side. Ian Bishop wonders on air if Varun is trying to stay short on purpose to make him hit into the big leg-side boundary. It is an excellent point
short of a length, just outside off, drops and runs, hands over the strike to Buttler
again front leg out of the way, looking for the long-on-midwicket arc. Beaten by the extra bounce on this length ball. Cummins not giving him the length to hit
not for long, though. He has overpitched right into the slot for Buttler. Buttler just caresses it in the air, and it sails well over mid-off
looks to go over mid-on but this is not the right length, and the thick outside edge goes high into the big off side. Just clears cover, who is running back

is that dropped? Bouncer from Cummins, Buttler goes for the hook, and the ball keeps going up. Beats him, and Jackson only manages to get a hand on it. No touch from Buttler so not a drop as the bye signal from the umpire indicates
on a length, outside off, Padikkal opens the face and takes the single
slower ball, timed too well to be taking the single to mid-off. Buttler is sent back
short of a length, Padikkal is beaten, but a leg-bye will do just fine to get Buttler back on strike
looks to back away early but is back in his stance. Mavi just goes ahead and bowls a wide yorker to beat him
dug in short, Buttler is right on top of it, and pulls it down and in front of deep square leg. Four into the big boundary
wide length ball with no protection deep on the off side. Buttler throws his hands at it, and he also has a short boundary there. The mis-hit lands on the full on the boundary triangles
short of a length, middle and off, defended back to him
short of a length, wide, Padikkal flashes at it, and gets a fine edge for four to third man
lovely shot. Short off-side boundary all right, but he has driven this on the up, through cover for four. Just hands, mind, as this is pitched slightly wide outside off
into the body now, and he has worked this into the leg side for one
short of a length, no room, Buttler plays this back to him

this is unreal. Buttler brings up fifty with just a push, which sails over mid-off. This is, firstly, not a driving length at all. Buttler has just pushed his hands through it, always meaning to play it in the air, and has timed it perfectly
short of a length, wide, cut away for a single to deep point
and immediately he is spot on with the length. Buttler works the offbreak into the leg side for one. You can't drive, can't go back. Phenomenal with the lengths
again spot on with the length, Padikkal works him into the leg side for one
slower in the air, just a touch fuller, dips on him. Buttler defends to cover
Buttler switches the stance, and I suspect Narine sees it and goes wide outside what would have been his leg stump. Gets a dot by keeping this out of his reach
on a length, angling across, Buttler opens the face, but short third man is in tight on the single
on a length, starts outside leg, goes on with the angle, worked into the leg side for one
short of a length wide, and Buttler goes back and across to crash this over cover. There is a deep point in place, but he stands no chance. Singeing the turf as it goes along
looks for the pull over midwicket, but the ball doesn't quite come on. Ends up cueing it to midwicket
that's a skimmer for a six. Hardly leaves the turf but keeps going long. Umesh misses the yorker by inches, and Buttler is deep in the crease to send him back over his head and into the sight screen
cut away to deep point. The fielder has moved to deep cover so that allows them two
wide yorker, steered through to deep square third man for one
short of a length, at his hip, pushed to midwicket
on a length, outside leg, angling towards the wicket, pushed towards deep midwicket for one

seems to have picked a carrom ball and slog-swept it over the short leg-side boundary. Uses his long hands well to access it. Excellent support act from Padikkal. Buittler not taking risks against Narine. Padikkal doing it
flatter, shorter, Padikkal is expecting it, plays the late-cut, but can't beat backward point
kisses the bail. Just short of a length, looks like a legcutter release, Padikkal goes back to try to hit it down the ground, but is early into the shot, and misses it altogether
short of a length, wide, punched to deep cover for one
stays outside leg for Buttler, who works this into the leg side again
full and wide, into the bigger side, square of deep cover, comes back for two
full, nearly a yorker, dug out wide of long-off for two
lovely slower ball, big drop in pace and big dip on the ball. Lands as a wide yorker. Buttler misses altogether
on a length, no room, pushed to straight extra cover for one
Samson is in the action immediately. Drives this on the up, with a slightly open face, gets it wide of mid-off
Mavi overpitches, Samson languidly lofts it over wide mid-off. Much better timing than the last one. Por length with mid-off up
on a length, for a change on middle and off, Buttler looks to open the face, and is beaten
this one looks like an offbreak, worked from middle and leg for a single into the leg side
offbreak, dipping, on a length, outside off. Defended
carrom ball, Samson goes back to open the face on this length ball and take a couple
looks for the revers-sweep, this is an offbreak, and turns down the leg side. Beats him but they get four leg-byes
offbreak again, on a length, outside off, he late-cuts it for a single
short of a length, into the ribs, Samson's bat face closes early, but the leading edge goes over Cummins for a single to long-off
short of a length, wide, short-arm cut in front of deep cover for two
a length ball into the pads with no deep square leg. Asking for trouble. He turns the bat face at just the right time to play this to deep square leg
slower short ball, pulled hard towards deep midwicket, and Russell puts in a dive after having over-run this. Saves three. Buttler applauds the effort
short of a length, into the body, Samson's bat slips out of his hand after he punches this into the leg side for one

this is almost unfair. Cummins has bowled a wide yorker nearly perfectly, making him play into the bigger side, but Buttler has managed to steer it to the right of backward point and to the left of deep cover. Look at the timing. No one stands a chance
no respect for spin. Samson skips out of the crease early, and ends up playing this higher than it is long. This is really really high, but just clears long-off too
short of a length, hit in the air, one bounce to deep cover

the rare edge from Buttler as he looks to go over cover with this carrom ball, but the thick edge goes square of short third man. Russel goes to his left from deep cover, puts in a dive, and saves one run
quick length ball, worked into the big pockets on the leg side, which is the big side. Comes back for two
on a length, middle and leg, and Samson uses the big leg side to his advantage again. Soft hands, into a gap, and Buttler is still charging back for twos
wide down the leg side. Not enough turn back in from that line
slightly short, Samson rocks back to pull, gets a bottom edge into the pad. Just not short enough for the big pull
wide yorker, dug out to deep cover for one
full, outside off, just too full for Samson to get under. Gets a single to long-on, though
slower ball, dipping full toss, Buttler has to adjust to it to get a single to long-off
Umesh misses the wide yorker by mere inches, and Samson lofts the low full toss over extra cover. Effortless

Samson is well outside off even before Umesh releases. Umesh ends up bowling a thigh-high full toss just outside off, and Samson mis-hits while going into the leg side. However, the extra deep fielder on the off side means there is no one to catch this. He gets two

oh this is brutal. After the low full toss earlier in the over, Umesh misses this yorker by inches on the shorter side. Samson is deep in the crease, turns this into a half-volley, and goes flat over long-off for a six
on a length, wicket to wicket, worked to leg for one
big leg-side boundary here. Russell goes slower ball, on a length, middle and leg, and Samson ends up skying it to deep midwicket. Samson does his job, going at 200 strike rate
short of a length, middle and off, leading edge to point for one
short, just outside off, Buttler pulls this hard and down, beating both long-on and deep midwicket. It is the big side but no one stands a chance
slower ball, down the leg side, turned away to deep square for a single
wide yorker, perhaps just short of being one, and Hetmyer takes a page out of Buttler's book to steer it past backward point for four. He beats him to his right, though
goes for the yorker to cramp him up but bowls too far down the leg side

gets to the hundred in style. Cummins tries the yorker, ends up bowling a juicy full toss, and Buttler clears the front leg to loft him over long-on. Lovely timing. Takes off the helmet and accept the generous applause
slower short ball, pulled in front of square, gets a single to deep midwicket
full, outside off, takes a single to mid-off

superb bouncer. Right at his badge, over the left shoulder, and Buttler gets a top edge on the pull. It carries all the way to the fine leg fence where Chakravarhty doesn't have to move. Buttler walks off with his bat and helmet held high
another sharp bouncer, but slightly down the leg side, and is called wide

short boundary, and slightly slow from Chakravarhty at fine leg. This is into the ribs, Parag tucks this away, Chakravarthy has to run to his left, but he is not the quickest out there. He doesn't need to be. At his best he brings with the ball that others don't
full and straight, punched down to long-on for one

Parag goes straight over his head, slightly towards long-off. The connection is not the cleanest. Cummins runs to his right from long-off, gets into a sort of a bicycle jump, catches it overhead, and while he is stumbling, he lobs it towards Mavi, who has run to his left from long-on. Mavi completes the catch one-handed with a jump of his own. The scoreboard, though, will say c Mavi b Narine
punched to long-off for one
tries to stay wide of Hetty's reach but bowls too wide
on a length, into the pads, worked into the leg side for one
offbreak, down the leg side, not called wide. Jackson appeals. No interest there either. Kisses the thigh pad on the way through
backs away early, gets back, sweeps into the big side, gets a single to deep square
carrom ball, down the leg side, called wide
Hetmyer plays the forward-defensive to the last ball from Narine, who beats him with a superb offbreak. Jackson appeals for a stumping but Hetmyer's back foot is not even close to leaving the crease
slower ball, wide length ball, gets a single to long-on
slower bouncer, offcuts off the pitch, beats his attempt to pull. Important dot
another slower short ball, mis-hit into the big leg side, comes back for two
short of a length, not much pace to work with, punched down to long-on for one. So far so good from Mavi
full and straight, no power in this slog. This is seam up and in the slot. Nair just doesn't make a good connection. Caught at long-on. This is proving to be a good over for KKR
no boundary in the 19th over. Slower ball, short of a length, wide, played to cover-point. Hetmyer takes the single. I expected him to say no and keep the strike
worked into the leg side for one. Over to Hetmyer
wide yorker, goes too wide, called too. Trying to make him play into the big side
Hetmyer is expecting something full and wide, and he shuffles across to access it and send it over the short leg-side boundary. It helps that Russell has erred with a full toss
Russell does nothing wrong here. Bowls full and wide, away from his reach, but Hetmyer goes back and across to reach it somehow and send it over long-off. The man is wide
Hetmyer lets out a big yelp as he misses out on this slower bouncer. He is seeing six over the short boundary but is early into the shot

Run-out comes from attempting a suicidal run! It was a full ball that was pushed to cover, they took off after Finch called. Narine responded but the run was not on. Hetmyer ran in from cover-point to his right, picked it up and threw it direct at the striker's end to hand a Diamond duck to Narine.
Length ball outside off is steered between point and third man in the gap to the fence
Full on middle, uses the swing in to flick it through mid-wicket
Bouncer over middle. Iyer sways away to let it go
Around a length, comes in outside off and is driven off the backfoot to point
Length ball around off, it was defended towards mid-wicket. They took off for a run and Boult ran towards it but could not pick it up. It would have been close had he done so.
Back of a length on middle stump, tucked to mid-wicket
Length ball outside off swings away and beats Finch on the move as he tried to fend it towards cover
Length on the chest, turned to the deep in front of square
Outside edge goes past slip and into the fence. It was on a good length outside off and Iyer pushed at it
Short on middle, backs away to the leg-side to make room and slashes at it to send it over deep point to the boundary cushion on the half-volley
Tries it again but the ball is slightly fuller and wider. Iyer had to adjust the shot and was in the middle of the push as it sped past him
Finch tries to counter the swing with a big stride down the ground but gets rapped on the pad after being beaten on the flick but the full ball was going down leg
Gets is this time. Finch comes across and flicks the full ball outside off aerially through midwicket
Good length outside off, open faced steer finds cover
Full outside off, he was on the walk towards the ball and smacks an off-drive in the air past and over mid-off for another four
Beats the flick again and Boult considers the review but they go against it. It was pitching outside leg and was swinging in further, so the non-review was a good call
Very low full toss goes away with the angle around sixth stump, the ball bounces on the pitch and goes to point on being square-driven
Short ball angles in and goes over middle and leg, Iyer moved across and tried to pull it. Beaten
Back of a good length just outside off. It is punched to cover off the backfoot. The fielder was at the edge of the circle
Full outside off, the front foot was out the way and the bat came down horizontally with a slash and it went to mid-off, where it was stopped
Back of a good length ball is followed by Iyer who went for the flick but he was too far across and could not access it
Back of a good length over leg, turned to deep square-leg into the gap where it was stopped
Yorker outside off, tries to steer it to third man but the ball was straighter and beat the inside edge by a few centimetres

Full toss outside off, it's driven off the splice towards cover. Shimron comes in from cover-point to take it and threw it to the striker's end. He missed and it looks like a close call where the batter made it in by a small margin
Full outside off, driven to mid-off
Yorker on fifth stump, gets the front leg out the way and steered it perfectly between short third man and backward point
Length ball over the stumps is cut to deep point. He made room with the front leg coming out the way again
Capitalizes on the field restrictions by slashing a fullish ball outside off, got it off the outside half of the bat and ballooned over backward point and steered away to the fence
Lets go of a slow ball down the legside
Shortish ball outside off, cut to cover on the bounce. Took off for the run, the throw was up over waywardly but there was backup
Makes ample room and is followed with a back of a good length ball, bottom edges a cut on the move in front
Length outside off, cut to mid-off
Good length on leg, pushed to long-on who fumbles it to allow the second run
Iyer was deep in his crease and cut a good length ball on middle by making room. It went past point to the fence
Length on leg, makes room and tries to work it on the legside. It hits the pad and ricochets to the offside
Full on the stumps, makes room and lifts it over long-off for his first maximum!
Length outside off, waited for the slow ball that was spinning away and cut it to deep cover
Finch was walking across a wide ball outside off that spun away outside the tramline from a good length but he was always leaving that. Given wide
Full and slow on off, stays legside of the ball and clobbers it along the ground through long-on
Full and too wide outside off again
Good length outside off, cut to deep extra cover
Around a good length outside off at 86 kmph, cut to deep cover
Full and slow on off, Finch was shaping up with his front leg well to the left of the back leg, he uses the room and smacks it past the umpire and it races to the fence
The swinging arc of Finch is perfect to send the full ball outside long over wide long-on. It hit the cushion on the half-volley
Short ball is not quick and is well down leg, beats the pull but costs an extra
Length ball over the stumps, flicked to deep square-leg
Length on off, gets to the Nataraja pose with the front foot up and pulls it square
Full tos outside off slips out and it is well outside the tramline and Iyer could not reach it
Full slower one on a full length on middle is flicked in front of square to the deep. It is stopped with a dive to the left from deep backward square
Short ball outside off takes the top edge of the pull and goes behind short-fine leg and goes to the fence
That is lifting the ball at its finest! It was a slower one on a full length and Finch went through with the lofted off-drive and deposited it over long-off
Flicks a good length ball on the stumps to deep mid-wicket
Low full toss outside off, square drive goes to deep backward point
Full and wide but a few centimetres out the tramline
Goes across and brings up his fifty with a pull, played with finesse and a closing bat-face from a slower ball on a length on the stumps
Pierces the gap between third man and backward point with a drive from an open-faced bat to punish the full toss outside off
Steers a yorker outside off to deep point with a step of the backfoot towards the ball
Yorker outside off, it was outside the tramline. Iyer dug it out but it took the bottom edge and fizzled towards square leg. It was in the gap which allows them a single
Slower one down leg misses the line. Finch lets it go last minute and practices the swing past fine-leg after
Finch moves across and Prasidh tried to hide the wide yorker but that was not too far from the return crease. It pitches just within the cut-strip so it is not a no ball

The extra balls work out for the Royals as Finch upper cuts a short, wide ball but it finds the bottom of the bat and skies to deep backward point running diagonally to his left. Nair had enough time to settle under it and take it comfortably
Back of a good length ball spins away to off and is driven back to the bowler
Premeditates the reverse and connects! It was length ball outside off
Full on leg, driven back to the bowler. The non-striker was out of his crease but Ashwin collected the ball and collected it
Carrom ball outside leg beats the flick and hits him high on the back leg and went behind
Full ball down leg, flicked to deep mid-wicket
Length ball down leg, comes down the track and negotiates the spin well. Pushes it to long-on to bring up his fifty.
Slow, good length ball outside off is cut to the left of short third man
Low full toss on off, gets down and sweeps it to deep backward square
Good length outside off, spins away past the tramline
Slow full ball on middle, makes room and thwarts it to long-on along the turf
Full ball down leg takes the edge of the bat. It hit the pad of the keeper and went towards short fine-leg
Full ball down leg is smacked down the ground to the left of long-on, they thought of two but settled for one
Full and slow outside off, it was floated and was a half-volley but was driven to deep point with a lunge across
Premeditates the reverse with a switch of the stance. It's a good length ball outside off, at least conventionally, and beat the bat
Yorker on leg stump is tucked to deep mid-wicket
Good length ball bounces well and is pushed to long-on
Full outside off, smacked to long-off along the ground. Did not seem to get all of it
Comes down the track and slogs the carrom ball over long-on against the spin
Helps a good length ball that spun in on to his pad with a pull to deep fine leg. Stopped by the fielder from deep square leg running to his right

Full ball down leg beats the reverse and looked to be going outside off. It has been given not out and RR review. The ball does not hit the bad but it is pitching outside off but the impact is umpire's call and so is the prediction on whether it was going on to hit the stumps
Full ball down leg, comes down the track and smacks it straight aerially in the gap to at the right of long-on
Slog sweeps a full ball on middle to deep mid-wicket. Just beats the jumping Buttler to go for an 89-metre six

Good length ball is flighted on leg-stump. Rana got on one knee and slog-swept it to the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on. Hetmyer ran in to take the catch and dove but could not get under it in time
Full toss on the stumps, driven to wide long-on

Full on leg-stump, it is slog-swept but in the air straight to Buttler at long-off! Rana tried to make room and go all in with the bat swing but could not get enough on it. It took the top edge and stayed up for a while in the air, allowing Buttler to settle under and take the catch comfortably
Full on middle, driven to cover
Good length outside off, makes room and reaches out to cut it to point
Good length on the legs. It is pushed to deep mid-wicket's right who runs in diagonally to keep it to one

The carrom ball knocks over Russell's defence! It was a good length ball that pitched on middle and turned away ever so slightly, past the full-faced bat to knock off-stump. Ashwin is off on a celebratory run! It was bowled from wide of the crease, which Ian Bishop, observes accentuated the angle
Good length ball on the legs. Shuffles across and flicks it to deep square-leg
Good length ball on the stumps is flicked to deep mid-wicket
Good length outside off, driven to deep cover off the backfoot
Back of the hand slower one misses the line and goes well past the tramline outside off. Left alone
Dropped by Samson! It was a length ball over middle and leg, there was extra bounce that meant Iyer's glove was found from the attempted pull and lobbed to the left of Samson but he could not grab it
Slower full ball on middle, it is pushed to mid-off. It was in the air for a bit but fell safely within
The drop has cost six so far, says Simon Doull, as the skipper moves across and helps a full ball on leg-stump with a flick over deep square-leg for a 72-metre six
Wide yorker pitches outside the tramline on a full length and goes away. It was a back of the hand slower ball that went wrong
Was on the move outside off, he flicked the full ball outside off to deep mid-wicket in the gap and beat Boult who dove to his right
Misses out on helping a short ball over the stumps with a fine pull as it goes over the bat to beat him
Full outside off, takes the inside edge of the horizontal bat drive to long-on
Carves a length ball over middle by making room and hitting the ball on the move. It was around shoulder length and Shreyas freed his arms and swung through to get a six over the shorter boundary
Short ball on the head is pulled to deep-square leg along the ground
Low full toss on middle and off is flicked to long-on. It had a low backlift and a low follow-through of the bat
Yorker on middle and leg is flicked to wide long-on
Full outside off, flays at it and hits it inside out over deep backward point. Shreyas was ball-watching and came down for the second but was sent back in time for him to return safely

Googly beats the full-blooded swing down the ground and has Venkatesh stumped! It was a full ball that turned away from off and the batter had danced down the track but missed the ball. The keeper completed the dismissal and Chahal is chuffed!
Tossed up outside off stump gets the inside edge of the cover drive. Falls in front
Full ball on the legs is turned to square leg
Wide outside off on a full length is well past the tramline

Given LBW, Iyer reviews! It was a full ball that beat the whip towards deep mid-wicket. Iyer is walking as the Hawk-Eye's prediction comes in, it shows the ball was pitching in line and was hitting leg. Chahal knew it was out right away and roared as soon as it was given out.

Taken at long-on! A full ball outside off has Mavi reaching out and trying to pull it to the legside, but he only manages to top-edge it. This ball went straight up for Parag to take the catch at a comfortable height and to have Chahal on the verge of a hat-trick.

Caught behind! Takes the outside edge of the cover-drive does a full ball spinning away from outside off. Cummins went across and pushed at it. It leads to Chahal celebrating with a leap and a slide to take him to the jolly pose at the boundary with the elbow on the ground. The hat-trick has RR firmly on top!
Full on on the legs follows Boult, who directs it to long-on
Yadav swings with all his might to send a full ball on off up miles and far enough over long-on. It is an 85-metre six
Slower bouncer on the stumps is pulled to the gap at deep mid-wicket for two
Full on off, Yadav takes a step across and settles under the full ball on the slot and smacks it over long-on. It leads Samson to come in and have a word with Boult
Slower ball into the pitch has been waited for and punched through cover off the backfoot. It was hit with the full follow-through with ease that emulated a shot from a video game
Pulls a short ball on the chest to deep mid-wicket to bring up the 200

Smokes a swipe off a low-full toss into his partner at the non-striker's raised left-hand! It was on off and Sheldon's reflex was quick enough to get a paw on it. The ball deflected to the vacant legside for one
Wide yorker has been channeled to deep point the gap towards the longer boundary which allows a couple
Full, wide ball going away with the angle is steered to deep-backward point
Full ball goes away with the angle and across, but past the tramline
Wide full toss has been slapped along the ground to deep point. Had he left it, it would have been a wide
length ball outside off, a little bit of shape away from the batter. Gaikwad slaps it towards backward point
length ball again, around off stump this time. Defended back towards the bowler
length outside off, once again a hint of away movement. Gaikwad dabs it towards third man to get off the mark
length ball straying down the leg side, Uthappa looks to tickle it fine but cannot put bat on it
fuller length around off, shaping away. Comes forward and defends it towards cover
length ball on the stumps, defended back
short of length outside off. Opens the face of the bat to steer it towards third man
fuller outside off, driven on the front foot but cannot beat the cover-point
length ball around off, defended towards cover
length ball around middle and off. Uthappa goes forward and across and flicks it towards midwicket
fuller length around off, punched towards the right of mid-off for a quick single
fuller length outside off, opens the face of the bat but cannot beat cover-point
length but way down the leg side
short of length at the batter. Uthappa was surprised by the extra bounce. Looks to defend but it hits the glove and bounces towards square leg
length ball around off, looks to pull it through midwicket but misses. Gets hit high on the back thigh

fuller and seaming in this time. Uthappa once again looks to smash it through midwicket. Once again he fails to connect. <b>An appeal for lbw but not given. Titans want to review this. No inside edge and the ball-tracking shows it would have gone on to hit the top of middle stump
length ball angling towards off and middle. Moeen drops it in front of square leg and sets off
length ball but straying down the leg side. Third wide in as many overs
lucky! A length ball around off that jags back in to cramp the batter. Gaikwad looks to defend but gets an inside edge past the stumps. Beats the keeper for four
length, room outside off this time. Cuts it to the left of the point fielder, who dives and gets a hand on it. Third man tidies it up
length outside off, opens the face of the bat to run it past first slip
length ball angling across, dabbed towards point
length ball outside off, tapped towards point once more
First six of the night. Down the track to this length ball on the pads, and just flicks it over deep-backward square leg
length ball around off, drops it towards covers and looks for a single but the fielder was quick to the ball
another streaky four for Gaikwad. Dayal goes short, Gaikwad goes for the pull but gets a top edge that almost carry all the way to the fine leg boundary. One-bounce four
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards square leg
length ball outside off, cuts it straight towards point
fuller but down the leg side. Gaikwad clips it behind square leg for his third four of the innings
short of length around off, Gaikwad looks to pull this one but gets beaten
length ball around off, goes back and punches it towards covers
length ball around off, pushed towards short midwicket
length ball on the stumps, opens the face of the bat to steer it to the left of backward point. No run there
fuller length angling across. Moeen goes for the drive but fails to connect
short of length outside off, Moeen looks to cut it away but it's too far from him
chopped on! Not for the first time this season. Was a length ball pushed across. Moeen looks to drive through the off side, playing away from the body, but gets an inside edge onto the stumps
short ball around off, Rayudu goes for the pull but is not in full control. Manages to get it over short leg, towards the square leg umpire
length ball around off, defended back
length ball around off, dabbed towards backward point
pulled away for six! Was a short ball around off from Joseph. Gaikwad sees the opportunity and swivels to pull it over deep square leg boundary
attempts a yorker first up but ends up bowling a low full toss. Flicked in front of square leg
beaten Length outside off, looks to help it down towards third man but misses
fuller outside off, flicked towards midwicket
length ball around off. Comes forward, drops it towards covers and sets off
short of length, angling towards the off stump. Defended back
pulled through midwicket. That's a shot and half. Short of length outside off and Gaikwad just smashes it to the deep midwicket fence
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller on the stumps, nudged towards midwicket for another single
looked like a googly. Fuller around off, comes forward and works it towards midwicket
another googly but this time too short. Goes back and pulls it towards deep midwicket. Fielder there
beaten! A big appeal for caught-behind though but given not out. And Rashid decides not to review it. Fuller outside off, Rayudu pushes at it and gets beaten as the ball spins away
length ball on the stumps, turns it in front of square leg
fuller around off, driven towards mid-off for a single
length ball around off, pushes it towards covers for one
short of length around off, moves across and pulls it behind square leg
fuller and wider outside off. Jumps out of his crease and steers it towards deep cover
short of length around off, Rayudu shuffles across and pulls it through midwicket for four
fuller on the stumps, Rayudu exposes his stumps and drives it towards mid-off

a googly around off. Uses his feet and looks to flick it away but gets hit on the pads. Rayudu wanted the leg-bye but the extra cover fielder was quick to the ball. He fields it, turns around and has a shy at the non-striker's end. Rayudu was home by then
another googly, cramping the batter. Flicked towards midwicket
length ball on the stumps, defended
fuller around off, Rayudu smashes it over the bowler's head for four
short around off, goes back and pulls it behind square leg
length ball, on the stumps. Punched towards long-on
and Gaikwad sends him over deep square leg. Short of length angling in, pulled away for an 80-metre six. Into the crowd
length ball around off, looks to drop and run. Gets an inside edge and the ball dribbles behind the stumps. Gets the single in the end
fuller outside off, looks to send it into the stands over long-on but fails to connect
over long-off! Down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball but ensures he stays leg side of the ball to allow himself the room to free his arms. Second six of the over
length ball outside off, stays leg side of the ball once again and steers it towards sweeper cover
fuller length outside off, stretches forward and pushes it towards covers
Fifty for Gaikwad. A length ball on the pads, tucked away in front of square leg
length ball on the leg stump, Rayudu creates some room and hits it through covers. Abhinav Manohar puts in the dive from sweeper cover but fails to flick it back
length ball on the stumps, worked in front of square leg but Dayal has overstepped here. Free hit coming up
looked like a slower one. But Gaikwad was waiting on the back foot. Stays still and pulls it over backward square leg for a six
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards deep midwicket
Rayudu is toying with Dayal. Was a short of length ball outside off, Rayudu stayed on the leg stump and just opened the face of the bat nonchalantly to ramp it over short third man
uses his feet and smashes it towards sweeper cover. Only a single but 100 comes up for CSK
starts with a yorker on the leg stump but just misses his mark. Worked towards deep midwicket
a low full toss on the stumps this time, pushed down the ground for one more
down the track and looks to push it down the ground. But gets too close to the ball and ends up yorking himself. The bottom corner of the bat comes off as he jams at it

dropped? No just short. Short of length outside off, Rayudu looks to forehand it over mid-off but gets it from the toe end of the bat. Rashid is at the edge of the circle at mid-off. He charges in and puts in the dive but it lands just in front of him
slower one. Short on middle and leg and Gaikwad smashes it over deep midwicket. Fifth six of the innings for him

Ferguson is struggling to land his yorkers tonight. Ends up a bowling a full toss around off. Gaikwad just chips it over mid-off. Rashid puts in the chase and flicks it inside but it hits his body and rolls on to the boundary line
a googly on the stumps, flicked between deep square and deep midwicket, and they sprint back for the second
dragged short, Rayudu rocks back and smashes it over deep midwicket. That's a rare poor delivery from Rashid
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards square leg
length ball around off, looked like a googly. Punched towards sweeper cover from the back foot
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards deep midwicket
short of length on the stumps, goes down and looks to sweep it but is early into the shot. The ball hits the toe end of the bat and goes back towards the bowler
short of length outside off, clears his front leg and looks to hit aerially through extra cover. No connection
short of length, wide outside off as well this time. Rayudu once again throws his bat at it, once again he fails to connect
fuller and wider outside off, 126.3kph. Rayudu had to stretch for it. Fails to get the power behind it and Vijay Shankar pouches it at sweeper cover
short of length around off. Dube arches back to let it go
short of length at the batter. Defended back
length outside off, Dube gets off the mark with a single to third man
fuller in the channel. Dube pushes at it without much footwork, gets beaten
length ball outside off, punched towards extra cover where Rashid makes a sliding stop
fuller on the stumps, backs away and chips it towards long-off

full and straight. Looks to hit it down the ground but misses. An appeal for lbw and given. Dube has opted to review this. Unless he got an inside edge, this is plumb. Oh, yes, there was an inside edge involved. Dube was almost walking off and reviewed it pretty reluctantly
Shami goes for the another yorker but Dube takes this on the full and flicks it in front of square leg
in the blockhole. Works it towards long-on for a single. An excellent over from Shami, only four from it
fuller and wider outside off, squeezes it out towards covers and comes back for the second
hit straight to deep-backward square leg. Was a full toss around off, Gaikwad goes down on one knee but ends up hitting it straight to the fielder
short, just outside off, Jadeja sways away from it and lets it go through to the keeper
short of length outside off, pulled down to the left of long-on
fuller around off, punched towards mid-off for a quick single
short of length outside off, pulled to the left of long-on once again but only a single this time
fuller around off, Dube hits it to the left of long-on but fails to get the timing right
fuller and wider outside off, hits it towards covers, where it bursts through Gill's hands
fuller around off, Jadeja looks to hit it down the ground but fails to middle it. A single to wide long-off
finally a somewhat better connection. A length ball angling across. Dube stands deep and pulls it wide of long-on for four
fuller and wider outside off, throws his bat at it but only a single to third man
fuller outside off, Jadeja goes straight but Miller sprints to his left from long-off and stops it just inside

an appeal for lbw and given. Jadeja wants to review this. Length ball around off. Jadeja pushes at it but gets beaten on the inside edge. The ball hits the flap of the pad and goes towards short third man. And there was an inside edge. So Jadeja survives but CSK robbed of another run
goes for the slog sweep but mistimes it towards deep square leg
length ball on the stumps, goes back and pulls it towards long-on
another slog sweep from Jadeja. This time he gets it in the gap. Deep midwicket cuts it off
length ball around off, pushed towards cover-point
length ball around off, goes for the pull but fails to middle it. A single to midwicket
fuller and angling in. Dube picks it up and skies it towards deep square leg. Manohar at the boundary was never sure-footed and in the end shelves it. And it goes for four
a wide yorker and Dube fails to get bat on it
once again in the blockhole. Digs it out towards long-off
fuller around off and Jadeja launches it over deep midwicket, all the way for a six. 91-metres
back-to-back sixes. Once again in the slot. Was a touch wide outside off but Jadeja manages to drag it over deep midwicket. Just clears the boundary-rider this time
a full toss around off, Jadeja smashes it down the ground but Miller moves quickly to his left from long-off and fires in the throw. Ferguson collects it and breaks the stumps. Dube was short
back of a length on off and shapes into middle and leg, surprising Saha. Gets in an uncomfortable position and the ball hits him near the chest
fuller. On middle stump, and a bit of shape into Saha's pads. Defended to the on side
full, outside off. Saha throws his bat at it, but can't get bat on ball
fullish, just outside off. Looks to cut, but the ball is not far enough for him to cream it properly. Struck in front of square
full outside off. Mistimed drive, ball dribbles away to mid off, and the wicketkeeper is off the mark

golden duck! A dream start for CSK. Choudhary bowled a length ball and offered width too. Gill walked down the ground and cut it well, but it's been hit straight to Uthappa at point, who takes it comfortably from near his head.
full on middle. Pushed to mid wicket's left, and they pinch a single
full on middle stump. Turning into him. Defended back off the front foot

another cut, another wicket. Shankar gone for a duck too as Theekshana bowls a length ball quite wide outside off. The ball doesn't turn in either direction, skids straight through, and Shankar tries to play square. Takes the edge, and MSD does the rest.
good length, on off. Bit of turn into him. Worked into the gap at midwicket
fullish, on middle. Played off the back foot to midwicket for another single
full on off. Closes the bat's face in his front-foot flick to deep midwicket
tempts Abhinav to drive with a full, wide ball. He does that, reaching forward to drive. Bit of a slice, in the air, and it flies over point for four
play and miss. Fullish outside off and angling away. Manohar looks to cut, but it's not short enough for it. Whizzes through to MS
length ball on off. Manohar punches off the back foot, ball rolls away to cover
back of a length on off stump and he uses the angle going across to slash a cut over the infield. Third man runs to his right, but it's a futile chase
good length, outside off, and cut to point
good length ball on middle and off. Tries to fend off the back foot. Ball flies off the edge to third man for a single
full on off stump. Defended off the front foot to the off side
fuller. Lands around his toes on middle stump. Tries to get his feet out of the way, and manages to hit it down the ground for a single
full on off stump. Turning into him, and he goes for a slog sweep. Along to ground to Ruturaj at cow corner
full, on off. Presses forward, and plays a defensive shot to short cover

Titans in tatters! Full ball. Manohar came down the ground and that has caused him his arms to lock. Gets too close to the pitch of the ball by skipping out, and therefore the attempted drive cannot generate the elevation to take it over the infield. Pocketed at cover!
close! Length ball on off. Miller backs away to cut, and very nearly chops it onto his stumps!
good length outside off. Jordan takes a tumble on his followthrough. Saha taps it away towards cover point, and calls Miller for the single
around the stumps with a slip fielder. Bowls length on off and angling into Miller. Worked off his waist to square leg for one
fullish outside off. Swivels and pulls along the ground. Timing not great, but placed in front of square, forcing Moeen at deep square leg to put in a long run
full around leg stump. Looks to clip it off his shin, but misses. Hits his boot, MS dives to his left, and palms it into his grasp, saving CSK some crucial runs

much needed four as Miller pokes at this length ball outside off, and guides it past the vacant slip cordon to third man for four. Fielder was there on the boundary line, but Miller played it very fine
full outside off, and he times a drive well. But straight to Rayudu at cover with a packed off-side field
hal-tracker on off. Turning into him. Conservatively flicked off his waist to deep square leg
good length, on middle. Miller stays on the back foot and drills a grounded pull to deep midwicket
misses both keepers! Saha misses the slog sweep from outside off. Ball stays low. Goes through Dhoni's legs too! This was a quick, skiddy one from MT
good length, outside off. Tapped away to point
Theekshana gets greedy. Tosses it up in search of a wicket. But Miller hits through the ball's line, hammering it over the young spinner
good length, on middle and off. Wants to punch it to the off side, but inside edge takes it to short fine leg instead
length ball angling into Miller, and he comfortably pulls along the ground to deep square leg
full on middle and leg. Saha meets it with soft hands, tries to work it to the leg-side gap, but ends up knocking it back to the bowler
moves on to 10 off 16. Guides this ball angling across to third man
yorker length, nearly spot on. Miller has to scurry to protect his toes, and ends up clipping it to midwicket
getting a move on! Smartly whipped off his shin as Choudhary goes full on leg stump. Miller places the shot behind square, making deep square leg's chase futile
bowling from wide of the crease this time. Overpitched, just outside the tram-lines with Miller not moving any closer

full and wide outside off again. Miller looks to clobber it through cover, but ends up inside-edging the shot onto the deck. Ball dribbles away onto the side pitches, and the duo take off for a single
good length, on leg stump. Nudged off his hips to deep square leg
good length outside off. Saha runs down the track, and clatters a punch to cover. Fielder gets something on it, but can't stop it. Man at long off has to run in to stop the extra run
good length on leg stump. Miller comes down the track and tries to work it leg side. But misses, and the ball hits him on the leg
good length, outside leg, craping Miller. Miller tries to cream a pull behind square, but hits it onto his body
punched towards cover and mid off for a single

misdirected from Saha! Jadeja bowls a length ball on middle. Saha rocks back and gets low. Plays across the line aiming for a leg-side boundary, but it's been hit in the air, and deep square leg runs in to end his 18-ball stay
around the stumps. Fullish on off. Cut to deep point for one
full and slow. Lands on middle stump. Moeen is searching for the turn, but none this time. Pushed to cover point
full on off stump. Bit of turn away, and pushed to cover
good length, on off. Punched off the back foot to wide long off

keeps the scoreboard ticking with another boundary. Full outside off. Miller backs away slightly to get a chance to free his arms. And then mows it right over Tewatia's head and into the long-on boundary
good length on off stump. Miller pushes it off the back foot to long on along the ground for one
length ball tucked away to square leg for a single
length ball, pitches around leg stump, maybe outside it. Tewatia wants to clip it leg side but misses. Hits his pad
full on leg stump, turned around to square leg
full on off stump. Tewatia leans into a gentle drive past Jadeja's left to long on
fullish, sliding across Miller. Cuts, but mistimed. Rolls away to short third
fullish, on off. Turns into middle. Miller punches to cover for a single. That was a quick over
length ball from around the stumps and angling into off stump. He drags a flat-batted shot off the back foot to long on
full on off. Bit more air. Tewatia skips down the ground and pushes it to cover with soft hands. Takes off for one
Mo has been mowed! Tosses it up on middle and off. Miller clears the front leg and swats it over long on with a lot of ease!
length ball on off. Guided to short third man for one
good length, on off. Pulled along the ground to wide long on for a single
turn and bounce. Comes over the stumps for the last ball. Length ball on middle, and going across Miller. Can't get bat on ball, with both batter and keeper surprised
fullish on off stump. Soft hand nurdle to the off side for a single
in his arc and punished. Jadeja goes full on leg stump, and he offers a proper golf swing into that clobber. Over long on, and into the stands
make that a double! Dhoni says 'don't bowl short' on the stump mic and Jadeja bowls full on middle and leg. Miller gets down on one knee, and sweeps it over square leg for another six
28-ball fifty and he gets there in style. Jadeja pushes it wider outside off, and he slaps it in front of square, and has enough to beat cover!
length, on off. Cut to cover point for a single
full on middle stump. Tucked away to the leg side for a single. 19 off the over
over the stumps. Rolls his fingers over this length ball on off that angles further away. Tewatia can't connect
fullish, pushing it wider away from Tewatia, keeping it away from his arc. Slapped to cover, who gets behind it to stop the ball
three dots to start his spell. Full ball just outside off and angling across. Tewatia pokes at it, but the ball goes past the edge
slower ball. Length ball just outside off. Tewatia comes down and tries to smack it over mid off. But the shot's been toe-ended, the ball's gone high up, and the captain settles under it at mid off
make that five. Welcomes Rashid with the short ball on a fourth-stump line. Goes for the pull but misses
wicket maiden to start off his spell. Bowls from well inside the popping crease. Fullish outside off, and Rashid creams a drive in front of square. But cover gets behind it

out? No, four! Miller mistimes this dragged leg-side heave in front of square, but Moeen is lurking at deep midwicket. Moeen runs to his right towards wide long on to try and take a catch, but the ball falls just beyond him!
full toss outside off. Knee high, and Miller clatters it to cover. Moeen - now at cover - moves to his right to stop the ball with a dive
struck along the ground to the sweeper fielder on the off side

good length, slower ball. Lands on middle. Hammered to cow corner, where Moeen was earlier positioned. This time, though, it's Jadeja manning the region. Stops this very powerful shot by getting behind it
good length, on off. Rashid swipes it to wide long on for a single
second boundary of the over and that four makes it 12 for the over. Full, just outside off. Almost a yorker, but missed the length by a few inches, and Miller has hammered it through the covers!
slower ball. Length outside off but angling into him. Nurdled off his waist to midwicket
falls between long off and deep extra cover. Miller looks for a big shot with Bravo bowling an offcutter wide outside off. Sliced, in the air briefly too, bu eventually safe
dipping slower ball. Full outside off. Rashid semi-helicopters a mistimed shot back past Bravo
full and wide outside off. But Miller was perhaps waiting for the wide ball because he leans into a lofted shot over cover as soon as the ball leaves Bravo's hand!
it's the offcutter. Length ball outside off and going further away. Miller can't get bat on ball
A good over from Bravo, barring that six. Another slower one, full and wide. Miller can't connect once again. Both Bravo and Miller smile as the umpire calls for the time out
half-tracker, wide outside off. Drags this flat-batted shot to long on

there it is, there's the big shot! Was wondering if these two would've seen Theekshana out, but Miller has no such plans. Theekshana goes short on leg, and Miller gets in position early to club a pull over deep square leg
fuller, on off. Punched to cover, and they pinch a single. That's eight off three balls with Titans needing 12 per over.
yorker, quicker from Theekshana. One of his variations. Rashid did well to dig it out
length ball outside off. Bit of movement away and he cuts to deep extra cover

goes for a big shot, but only one. Length ball on leg, but quicker, forcing Miller to play his shot a tad too late. Mistimed along the ground to Jadeja at cow corner, and they settle for one after seeing which fielder's arm they were trying to take on
full and wide, just inside the tram-lines. Miller throws his bat at it, and slaps it to deep backward point
another single. CSK won't mind these. Fullish outside off, and he went for a leg-side slog, but inside edged past the stumps instead

Bravo can't believe it as Miller gets a single instead of being caught in the deep. Miller tried to pull the slower ball, but it was hit in the air. Dube was running it from cow corner, but at the end pulled out of the catch. Jadeja. Did the floodlights cause Dube to pull out?

yorker. On middle and leg. Rashid gets low and digs it out. Bravo appeals for lbw even though it appeared to be bat first. Not out, but Bravo reviews. Yes, it is bat first, then the boot. 10/10 on the yorker, 0/10 on the review.
slower ball, full on his pads. Rashid winds up for a big shot, but his slog only finds deep backward square leg
overpitched ball, quite wide, and Miller can't get bat on ball. Lands inside the tram-lines en route to MSD

Titans are gonna attack from both ends! Full on middle, and Rashid uses his strong wrists to play a whippy clip off his toes, and the ball soars over deep midwicket! Nearly a no-look six, with Rashid looking out to the leg side only to see how far the ball went
captain's cameo! Jordan looks for the full and wide ball, but Rashid gets low and slices the ball so hard that it flies over point for six more.
squeezes it through! A full toss around off stump, and Rashid continues to attack. Throws his bat at it, and the ball has enough power to just about clear the two fielders at cover and mid off!

he's batting like a dream! Jordan goes fullish on a fifth-stump line, but Rashid stands still, sticks the bat outside off, and then simply flicks it nonchalantly. Uses the wrists once again to drag a six over deep midwicket, checking the shot late to ensure it goes towards deep midwicket instead of deep square leg. Flat six

aims for the wide yorker, but Rashid tries to drag this from outside off once again by sticking the bat out and looking to flick it to the leg side. Ball pops up in the air briefly, but lands at short midwicket. Hits the bat onto his helmet, disappointed that he could only get one
moves to 81 and the two will keep Miller off strike. Jordan bowls a yorker on middle, and Miller nat-megs a flick through his legs down to deep square leg.

perfect way to start the over for Titans. DJ goes full, wide and slow, but Rashid was waiting for the slower ball. Waits for it, doesn't commit early, and slaps a flat-batted shot over Bravo's head! Long off tries to cut it off, but alas.

a rare three as Jordan saves one run with his big effort at long on to run around and intercept. Bravo bowled a yorker, but Rashid went deep to helicopter a shot over the umpire's head. But top marks to Jordan for the effort too.
full and wide outside off. Miller creams a drive to deep extra cover
yorker outside leg stump. Rashid clips it to wide long on, and that allows the duo to return for the second

put the dancing shoes on, DJ! Bravo bowls a length ball, takes pace off, fourth-stump line. Rashid comes down the track and tries to hammer it, but he slices the shot. Ball goes high up, Moeen runs across to cover from mid off, and takes a running catch. Out for a 21-ball 40

holes out but the strategy was right. Bravo went fullish outside off, Joseph looked to clobber it over long off, but it's not off the bat's middle. Jordan races in from long off, and takes a catch despite his right leg getting stuck awkwardly on the grass as he was trying to slide in

massive first ball. Full ball, outside leg stump, Would've been a wide had Miller not moved to the leg side, making the ball clip the base of his pad. Dhoni did well too to move to his right and stop some legbyes
full on middle. In the slot, and Miller smacks it past Jordan to long on. Refuses the single.

this is why he refused the single! A half-century for Jordan with the ball as Miller whips this full ball outside leg to fine leg for a flat six. Jordan tried to cramp him by bowling near his heel, but Miller was quick to swing his bat across the line

caught at short third man but surely that's a height no ball?! Ball slips out of Jordan's hand, and the full toss outside off is sliced to the fielder at short third. Every CSK fielder is celebrating, but not Jordan. The umpires ask the TV umpire to adjudicate, and it looks like it is above the waist. Free hit and a no ball
full, quick, just outside leg stump. Miller clears his front leg way out to the leg side and then lets the bat do the talking by clipping it off his toes to deep square leg for four!

full toss, around waist-high again. Slapped down the ground to long off, and this time there's no single refusal. Takes off quickly, calls for the second run. Ferguson dives at the danger end trying to complete the two, and he is in! Gujarat Titans win by three wickets!
slightly full on off, Dhawan pokes and taps the ball to cover
nearly chops on! He goes on the back foot for the slightly shorter ball and gets an inside edge onto his pad
gives the charge and lofts the ball from outside leg over the infield to clear midwicket, and he gets the first four early on by targeting the midwicket boundary
charges down again, Bhuvneshwar pitches it shorter with some inswing and Dhawan can't put it away this time. Takes it on the body
just outside off on length and he taps to cover point for one
130.5kmh, tight line on off stump and he defends it down to mid-on
134.8kmh, back of length and angling towards off, he defends off the back foot
tad shorter on off, he taps it off the back foot towards point and they run across for a quick single
some width outside off, Dhawan goes for a big drive along the ground but finds mid-off
into the pads, Dhawan flicks it away in the air and gets a single because there's protection in the deep
Prabhsimran charges down and heaves against the short ball, doesn't get close to it as the short ball goes over his bat and to the keeper
bouncer to end the over on the leg side, he pulls and misses again
goes across to paddle but Bhuvneshwar pitches it wide outside off and Dhawan ends up edging it behind, reaches the keeper after a bounce or two
just clears mid-off as Dhawan miscues the swing down the ground from outside off, and the ball goes just over the fielder for two
short and wide, he slashes but finds backward point

miscues to mid-on and that's the end of Kings' captain for today. Dhawan had been eyeing those quick runs for a while but not getting any success. He dances down again, swings against the short ball and top-edges it to mid-on for an easy catch

a mix-up first ball and he was nearly run-out! Taps the ball towards point, looks towards his partner and ventures out, a yes and no, confusion in the middle, Prabhsimran finally hares across and Bairstow is late but he's running straight which means he's in between the fielder and the stumps, and survives because the throw is wide
a wicket has just fallen but Prabhsimran attacks and gets a top edge just wide of mid-off for two more
short and a bit wide, he steers it straight to point
good length ball outside off with the angle, Bairstow chases and misses
there comes the short ball, Bairstow pulls and gets one to deep square leg
edged over the keeper! He bangs it in too short outside leg with the angle, Bairstow hooks, gets a faint edge and luckily for him it goes straight over the keeper for four
scythed over a leaping short third man for four more! Another half a life for Bairstow, he gets this one outside off and cuts it fiercely to send that flying over the fielder in the circle
cuts and misses outside off. Some pace and angle on that length ball outside off and he doesn't connect this time
chipped in the air and reaches mid-off after a bounce. Full around off, he drives on the up and nearly hands a catch to Williamson
slightly full outside off again, he swings big this time with a step down the ground, doesn't middle it at all and gets two over the covers
crunched down the ground! Finally Prabhsimran gets his first four after so many attempts. Uses hard hands for the full ball on off and drills it right back
two bounces and into the long-on boundary. Too full again from Natarajan and this time Prabhsimran flicks it down the ground from leg, straight down over mid-on

a belated lbw appeal or caught appeal from keeper Pooran, SRH are chatting and chatting about the review call and Williamson signals just in time for the review! Prabhsimran went a long way outside off to flick this to the leg side and UltraEdge shows there's an edge! Pooran caught the ball near his right shoulder and even tried to stump Prabhsimran from far behind while appealing. What a strange, strange appeal, review and dismissal. And just the comeback Natarajan would have wanted
right on target first ball, a length ball on off and he defends it back with a straight bat
pushed on the back foot by the short of length ball and he taps to point for one
goes across and gets off the mark with a scoop! Length ball angling towards off, he goes a long way across and scoops it not far from the keeper
tries the same shot for a similar ball but misses this time. He's living dangerously
gets some width outside off, probably making Jansen change his line because of the attempted scoops, and this time he stands tall and drives it wide of cover point for four
scoops again, six this time! Similar approach as the second and third balls, and he laps it right from the middle of the bat for a clean six
he bangs it in short just outside leg, going just under Livingstone's armpit and it's not called a wide
goes on the back foot and tries to defend the dart back

loud, loud appeal for lbw, the appeal is not fading at all and the finger finally goes up for lbw. Bairstow gives it a though and reviews. Bairstow went for a sweep for the ball that pitched just outside eoff, it came in with the angle and ball-tracking shows it's hitting middle. Kings lose their review and Bairstow falls for another low score
full on off and he pushes it down to long-off for one
goes back for the short of length ball and punches it down to long-off
excellent fielding effort from Suchith to sprint to his right and stop the ball after Jitesh punched it down
shorter outside off and he cuts to deep point for one
143.2kmh, short and wide, rising ball and Jitesh slashes at it to send that crashing to the third man boundary
145.7kmh, some late inswing for the near-yorker on off and he digs it out to cover point
slightly full around off and he drives to mid-off for one
147kmh, tries another yorker but it's a low full toss on the stumps and Livingstone gets one to long-on
full and into the pads, loose ball, and all Jitesh has to do is time his flick so that he can bisect the gap between mid-on and midwicket. And he does that

top edge goes high and Malik takes a return catch by extending his follow through! Rushes Jitesh with his short and fast ball, he pulls but mistimes it and the ball lobs up straight before Umran Malik runs forward and takes it comfortably
goes back and punches the ball down to long-on for one
leans forward and drives the full ball to cover
much straighter and he bunts it back to Suchith this time
84.5kmh, thick edge to short third man as SRK goes back and doesn't middle the cut
goes back again and punches the ball hard into the ground as Suchith darts in one more
five dots in a row to Shahrukh, as he cuts off the back foot and finds point
pushes him on the back foot and he defends it back
reaches third man after a bounce! Short and quick outside off, Livingstone uses quick hands to whip the ball behind square and it flies away to Jansen
147.3kmh, sixth dot in a row for Shahrukh as he's stuck on the back foot for the incoming ball and takes it on the body
short, quick and wide, he swings big with a horizontal bat and misses again
some with again, and this time he steers to deep cover for one. Finally off the mark
upper cut for six! Second six for Livingstone already as he gets one short and wide, third man is deep, and he still goes for the shot and connects well enough to send it all th way
Full on the stumps, turned to mid-wicket
Full and slow on middle and leg, clipped to wide long-on
Full outside off, driven gently along the ground to deep extra cover, long-off stops it
Full on the legs, stays legside and drives it to the right of the bowler to long-on. Was in the air but was away from the bowler's reach
Good length outside off, cut towards cover off the bottom of the bat
Comes down and clobbers a full, slow ball around off-stump down the ground, hit hard and beats the diving long-on who was running across to his left
Length on the chest, defended to the right of the bowler
Attempted yorker outside off lands as a low full-toss that looked to have come in. Beats the hard cover drive that was played from the spot
Length ball is deposited over deep mid-wicket. He waited for the length like a baseball batter and swung freely, the pace of the ball helped, so did a decent connection to take it 106 metres away

Backs it up with a short ball that angles in, Liam tried to swat it behind square with the bat swing going from bottom to top but is beaten by the 148.5 kmph ball. He was crouching, it's been given one bouncer for the over

Nails an aggressive on-drive off a full ball. It was around off and the timing was so pure that the ball zoomed away, the non-striker had to sway and fall to keep safe, which he did but in the last millisecond
Good length outside off, tries to steer it fine but misses
Full down leg, dances down and extends the aerial on-drive over long-on for an 85 metre six
Back of a good length outside off, slow again. Cut to deep point
Slow good length ball spins away from outside off, outside the tramline. Left alone
Full on the stumps, channeled to long-on along the turf
Good length outside off, driven to cover off the backfoot
Full on the legs, clipped to long-on
Full ball down leg is lifted over long-on with relative ease and a free swing for another massive six! Ends the 16-run over with a dance down the ground and a fill-thy-boots smack.
Good length on the stumps, whipped to long-on off the backfoot
Full outside off, driven to deep point
Full on middle, makes room and hits a hard off-drive along the ground to long-off
Low full-toss, almost a yorker on the boot, clipped to deep square-leg, who runs in quickly to keep it to one

Bouncer looks to have lobbed off the helmet to backward point, the umpire reckons there was bat involved, so it's given out. Shahrukh reviews. There's a flat line as the ball beats the attempted pull on to the helmet, so the decision is overturned. There was a woody noise, which Harsha Bhogle suspects came off a loose handle. The review did not come in immediately which created some ambiguity but all was well for Shahrukh there.
Shift + right arrow + S! It was full on the legs and the batter, who had made room and was followed, helped it on its way with a free swing with a close-faced that sent the ball to the stands.
Slower ball into the pitch on leg-stump is turned to deep square-leg cautiously for one
Length ball under the armpits, flicked to deep backward square
Full ball goes along with the angle but is far down leg
Liam gets to fifty with a fine pull through long-leg. It was a bouncer that angled in again, was around head-high but he moved across and got into position quickly to help it along
Full toss is just below the waist and is turned to mid-wicket. The bowler showed his palm to the batter as a gesture to indicate it was an error.
Around a length ball outside off, steered to third man. He made room and was followed
Beaten on the upper-cut off a back of a length ball over the off-stump
Full outside off, goes away with the angle and past the tramline
Wide, low full toss is slapped to sweeper cover flat and inside out, cut-off by the fielder running in to his left
Full outside off, beats the swinging bat but is a bit too far away

Full ball down leg, lucky for the bowler that the swing to help it along the way missed. The keeper was backing up towards the off-side and had to run in to his right stop it. Got a glove and parried it, the batters take one
Full outside off, changes his shot from a slog to a check defence off the open-faced bat to point
Low full toss outside off is driven to deep extra cover, long-off comes in to stop it. They just take the one
The upper-cut comes off the bottom and lobs up to the right of the keeper's front. But he cannot make it and it lands safely. It was a bouncer outside off
Low full toss outside off beats the cover drive
Another wide, this time with an attempted wide-yorker outside off. Beats the flaying bat which might have benefited the bowler
Full outside off, driven aerially to deep cover. It was inside out and bouncer just over the ring. Ends the 10-ball over

Short ball outside off is skied to cover! It was wide and short, looked a cross-seamer. Shahrukh tried the aerial cut but got a top-edge that went up for a while but Kane settled in and took it safely with his fingers pointing up
Back of a good length ball cramps Odean as it comes in onto his body, he defends it in front, came off the shoulder as the flick was his intended shot
Length ball outside off takes the inside edge off the full-faced push and went to deep square-leg
Short and wide, slapped to deep point
Short ball goes just over off-stump, Odean jumped and tried to play at it but pulled out in the end
Looked like a slower ball, it was outside off on a length. Odean fended at it and was beaten. The keeper appealed for a catch but Bhuvi gesticulated that he did not hear a sound
Full on off, stays on off and drives it to long-on
Yorker outside off at 134 kmph, tries to carve it but bumps it to the bowler off the lowest bit of the bat
Full outside off, front leg comes out the way to allow the cover drive to go to wide long-off
Length ball angles away outside off, Odean made room and tried to carve it off the backfoot but couldn't make contact
Yorker on middle, he was standing on off but had to come back to channel it towards cover
Whips a full ball, low full-toss, straight. It beats long-on to his right. Liam somehow managed to create elevation and power on a ball that was not too far from a yorker
Odean is beaten again, this time outside off on a good length. The swing was towards cover off the backfoot.
Low full toss on middle is whacked to the left of deep mid-wicket for two
Makes room and muscles a swat-pull to the sightscreen! He had made room and was on the move, looked like he hadn't got enough but it sailed and somehow cleared the fence
Fullish wide ball outside off beats the bat-swing.
Full toss on off-stump is whacked to deep mid-wicket on the bounce

Caressed to cover, Kane takes an excellent catch with a leap and a tumble forward! It was short and wide, looked slow too. Liam, who had been starved of strike, tried to cut it aerially without too much power. He toe-ended it aerially and Kane spotted it early and used his acrobatic skills effectively with forward movements, leap and the tumble.
Into the pitch, pace to burn as Pommie Mbangwa says. It was into the body, the batter tried to make room but the ball came in and beat the pull, hit him on the belly and deflected in front.
Back of a good length ball is skied to the bowler! It looked a slower one, Smith backed away and tried to whack the pull out of the city but it took the top-edge and went to the leg-side.
Good length ball on the pads zooms in at 142 kmph to beat the flick. Goes to point off the deflection but to the fielder

Off-stump flies behind after being clattered by the full ball! Chahar went across before the ball was bowler and came back far enough to make room and tried to slap it to the off-side but was castled. Umran enjoyed that.

Was that a replay? No, it's another rocket that knocks the top of off! This was slightly shorter, the room-making was on again. Vaibhav tried to carve it but missed and the ball smashed the top of the stump to take Umran on the verge of a hat-trick and a wicket-maiden.
starts with a short ball down the leg side and Abhishek tucks it nicely off the hips to collect four runs on the first ball!
short-ish again, this time outside off and he punches it towards point for one
goes on the back foot and taps the offcutter late to third man. Off the mark straightaway
short of length and swinging away this time, Abhishek watches it go to the keeper
touch closer to off stump and she steers it to point

nearly caught and bowled! Abhishek chipped the length ball on the stumps back to the bowler but it was too low for Arora, and it either fell just short or there was barely any time for the bowler to go low immediately and get his hands under it. Replays show it fell just short
nearly in the block hole and he digs it out back
tight line on off stump and Williamson defends it back
lovely outswinger and nearly takes the edge! That's like a Test match ball - pitched up outside off, draws Williamson into the drive and the batter drives too, nearly edging it behind
gets the short of length ball to jag back in this time, and a watchful Williamson shoulders arms to let it go
fuller on the stumps now and he flicks it wide of midwicket for one. A single after four dots
back of length on the hips and he tucks it away to fine leg for one
angles it away from outside off and Abhishek lets it go to the keeper
steers it off the back foot straight to point and they take one after it goes off the fielder's hands
stays back and pushes the length ball without much room to cover
comes down the pitch and steers it late to third man for one
beats him with the angle! On length on off, angling away and Abhishek pokes and misses
goes after the full and wide ball as he gets to swing his arms, and gets just enough to send that flying to the third man boundary for his second four

taken at mid-off, Rabada gets the big wicket! Williamson started slow today, and he wanted to clear mid-off with that full delivery, but it kind of held in the surface, Williamson was through with his shot and he chipped it towards mid-off where Dhawan went to his left and leapt to grab it with both hands
stays back to cover the stumps and screams "no" after defending it back
137.4kmh, attempted yorker is a low full toss and he drives it to cover
pulls the short ball, doesn't quite middle it, but gets more than enough to clear the fielders in the circle and get two over midwicket

Dhawan leaps again but the ball sails over him this time! Tripathi goes for a big shot and wants to clear Dhawan, doesn't quite get the distance or power, Dhawan leaps, Tripathi's heart is in his mouth, but the ball goes well over

mid-on gets a hand and saves two this time. Rabada angles it into the stumps and Tripathi flicks it just wide of mid-on but Arshdeep does well to dive to his right and get a hand and slow the ball down before he gets up again and chases it down
outside leg and Abhishek clips it off the pads for one
nice and tight, the ball angles in from length and Tripathi defends it back
pulls the length shorter and jags it in, Tripathi cuts this time and finds point
charges and slashes hard, sends that crashing to the point boundary! Arora pitched it short and Tripathi swung really hard to dispatch that over cover point
makes some room while coming down and punches that wide of cover in the gap. There's a deep point now and he runs to his right to slide and save two

scooped for nearly a six! Wonderful timing and placement from Tripathi. Fine leg is in, Tripathi goes across and low and stays pretty still - unlike Livingstone who was hitting such scoops on the move - and scoops it high and fine
nice outsing from off stump, Abuishek taps it to cover point for a quick one
slips in the slow offcutter full outside off and Tripathi is deceived by pace while chipping it towards cover
shorter and wider, angling away by a mile, Tripathi chases it way outside off and misses. Almost a wide
shorter outside off and he runs it towards backward point for a quick single
Abhishek patiently pushes the length ball swinging away into the covers
finishes the powerplay with a four! Gets a short ball on leg and he pulls it away behind square with fine leg in the circle

misfield at point from Rabada and Chahar must be feeling like he's still playing for MI, the way they fielded yesterday. Tripathi went back to cut straight to point but the ball went right through Rabada
short and turning away, he goes back and slices to deep point for two
more turn outside off and he taps it late towards short third man for one
covers the stumps on the back foot and defends the ball turning in patiently
goes back again but this time it turns well down leg, past his pads, and even past the keeper's gloves for five wides
too short but turns in sharply and cramps his for room, he manages to steer it to point in the end
some flight for the length ball on off, he leans forward and nudges towards point for one more
full toss angling in, Tripathi plays a KL Rahul-like stunning pick up shot to the fine-leg boundary. The third umpire is checking if it's a six or four, and it landed straight on the boundary rope
nearly in the block hole and he digs it out this time
full around off and he middles the drive to cover

direct hit and he was gone! There is no need for a run that can end your innings when a big part of the chase is still left. He drives it down to mid-off, takes off for the run, and survives because the throw was inaccurate
angling away from outside off, he lets it go
fuller around off and he pushes it down to mid-off for another quick single
short ball outside off, he pulls but mistimes it down to long-on

easy catch for long-off, Rahul Chahar strikes! Lovely release from Chahar with good revs, flight and some drift into middle and leg. Tripathi goes for a big shot and miscues it completely for a high and simple catch to Shahrukh who comes in from long-off to get under it
shorter and turning away, he cuts with power but mistimes a little
flatter and tighter on the stumps, he defends it back
outside off now with some turn and he gets off the mark with a cut to deep point
short and turning into the batter, he pulls it over midwicket in the gap
flat and outside off, he bunts it down to long-off
short and turning away, steers it to deep cover for one
full toss launched over long-on for six! Gives it a lot of full toss on off, it's a little low and in the slot for Abhishek to loft it down the ground
