nudges the ball to deep midwicket and he turns around for the second quickly, but Markram says no and Abhishek is a long way down but the throw comes at the wrong end. Abhishek survives
outside off, he drives straight to cover
some width outside off again, driven down to long-of for one
Length outside off, cut to deep cover
Length outside off, cut to the gap and they manage to get two

Holes out at long-on! It was full and floated up on middle and off at 85 kmph, Abhishek came down the ground and tried to go over long-on with an extended aerial loft. He got to the pitch of it but the connection was good enough only to hand a comfortable catch in the deep around his bread basket.
Full on the stumps, the 87 kmph ball is paddled fine in the gap past short fine-leg, goes to the deep and is cut off by deep square-leg running in to his left
Full on the stumps, turned to deep mid-wicket
Slow on a length, pitches on leg and spins away, takes the bottom of the bat on the pull. The ball hits the boot on the bounce and swings across safely to the other side.
Full on the legs, flicked between long-leg and deep square-leg for two. The latter cuts it off.
Bowls from close to the crease. The bumper outside off is over Pooran's head and is left alone
Length ball on the body is pulled along the ground to deep backward square. That was a cutter at 113 kmph
Wide of the crease. Hits a good length and angles it in on the body, it's been clipped to mid-wicket off the backfoot
Length outside off, carved along the ground through square on the offside. Stopped by deep point with a quick, longish run to his left and a dive
Length outside off, cut to deep point
Full on middle, close to a yorker at 135 kmph. Flicked to deep mid-wicket along the carpet
Reverses a full ball on leg to deep point along the ground
Full around off, it's slow and may have turned a bit. Markram stayed legside of the ball and tried to drive it straight. It takes the outside edge and goes to short third-man
Full on the legs, pushed to long-on
Length outside off, pushed to cover
Slow ball on a length sits up and angles in for the pull to deposit it over deep mid-wicket into the stands
Length on off, clipped to deep mid-wicket
Cutter on a good length is deftly defended late to point with a full-faced bat off the outer-half
Just makes a tight run after driving it to mid-off! He made room and drove it off the backfoot and took off, the throw came in on time but missed

An easier run-out chance is missed! It was a full ball on the stumps that was defended towards point, Rabada ran in and spotted the non-striker who had completed three-fourth of the run. Rabada went for the direct hit while the fielders were swarming in. It goes past all of them
Length outside off, cut to deep point
Half-volley outside off is driven firmly between cover and mid-off with a full follow-through
Around a good length outside off, hit to the gap at deep cover for two
Length ball spins back in sharply to the top of off and is cut to deep point
Length outside off, it's slow and spins away. It's cut to deep cover
Full and slow outside off, it's defended towards point. The keeper runs to stop the single
Good length ball is cut to deep cover who fumbles but it's only one
Length ball comes in with the angle at a flatter trajectory. It goes down leg and the batter moves across, flat-bats it to long-on mostly along the ground
Short ball outside off at 91 kmph, pulls it into the ground to long-on
Length outside off, pulled to long-on
Noticeably wide of the crease, the full ball on middle in dug-out towards long-on
Yorker on middle, dug out with a close-faced flick that goes to the vacant deep mid-wicket region. The fielder runs in diagonally to his left but they take an easy two
Full outside off, driven to cover. He looked to hit it hard. Pommie says, "he's looking a bit restless"
Short ball outside off goes over the batter's head, left alone after shaping up for an upper-swat
Yorker on middle again, this at 131 kmph. It hit the bat low and the flick went to long-on
Wide half-volley is creamed aerially over cover with a horizontal bat in the gap to the fence to release the pressure built through the over
Good length ball is driven on the up to mid-off's left on the bounce, Dhawan there gets his hands on it but it goes further down and it allows time for the second run
Good length just outside off, tapped towards point gently enough to make time for a single

Punjab are ticking the scoreboard smartly, this time with a well-placed slash on the move off a good length ball outside off to the right of deep cover. They push the fielder for the second and make it easily to Rabada's frustration
Brings up the fifty partnership with a swat through cover of a slow length ball outside off
Drags a length ball outside off to long-on with a pull into the ground
Good length on off, defends it towards point. Hits it too well for the single to be on but Punjab will take a ten run over with both their hands.
Almost a yorker on off at 134 kmph, the batter makes room and lets his hand drive through to long-off along the ground
Length outside off, slapped to the bowler on the bounce, who parries it in front with his palms. Looks okay

Yorker on off, squeezed to deep square-leg. The lack of timing helped them get back, the call for two came in early and the running was quick. Chahar's chase was not quick enough, so he had to throw it direct at the non-striker's end which he couldn't.
Marginal over-head wide not given as Pooran crouches and lets it go.
Squeezes a wide yorker behind point with precision. The bat-face opened at the right time to manufacture a shot to a well-executed ball around sixth stump
Full on middle, flicked to deep mid-wicket
Length ball on the hips, beaten on the pull and it goes to third man after taking the thigh-pad of the back leg. He walked across and was outside off too
Follows Markram who made ample room with a full toss that tucks him, the ball is whacked along the ground to deep mid-wicket along the ground
Full on off, gets the front foot out the way and drills a drive to long-off along the turf
The boundary ball is created by Markram by making room by taking his front leg out and crashing a hard cover-drive of a full ball around sixth stump
Clears the wide long-off fence and the game with another lofted drive! It was on a similar line and length and Markram was ready with a high backlift and the front leg out the way
a bit of shape back in, defended back to him in front of middle and leg
inswinger, goes past the inside edge, big shout for lbw, not given, and rightly so because it looks like headed down leg. DC don't review it
too straight, and the swing takes it down leg, and du Plessis gets a bit of a feather on it for four runs to fine leg
full, outside off, this one doesn't swing back in. Pushed to cover
short of a length, around off, pushed towards cover
he goes slower ball but starts too wide and it cuts away too. Called wide
back to that good length, slight shape back in, and defended back to Mustafizur
that is plumb. Full, shaping in, at the middle stump, and Rawat falls over trying to whip this square on the leg side. Doesn't show it the full face of the bat
full, swinging away, Kohli push-drives it through the covers and comes back for two by the time deep point gets around
short of a length, still some shape away, punched to deep point for one
slight shimmy to thread the gap between extra cover and mid-off. Just a push to a length ball, and it beats the diving extra cover to his right and mid-off to his left
beaten trying to punch this wide length ball. It sort of seams back a touch
short ball, du Plessis sets up for the pull, but it is the slower one and he is well early into the shot. Hit in the chest
full, outside off, slight mis-hit allows him take a single to mid-off
short of a length, just outside off, punched to cover

big wicket. Du Plessis taken out before he can start accelerating. That deep point instead of a third man has worked. Du Plessis skips down the track, Khaleel shortens the length, de Plessis slashes at it in an upper-cut, and Axar Patel runs to his right to complete the catch
full, slight shape back in, pushed back to him
this one goes across from just short of a length. Pushed back to him again
Maxwell exploits the absence of a third man. Uses the pace on this shortish ball, opens the face and gets it past short third man
short of a length, bunted into the leg side
full, on off, driven to wide long-off for a single
slower in the air, wide, full, driven to wide long-off for one
on a length, 95ks, Maxwell looks to cut, but this is the arm ball that keeps coming at him. Maxwell does manage to get a bottom edge, though
this is a turning delivery, and Maxwell doesn't mind repeating that cut shot. Gets the timing and placement both, beating backward point to his right
full, outside off, looks to go over mid-on, but is beaten on the inside edge. Again no turn
short of a length, just outside off, runs this down square for a single
mis-hit into the leg side as he shuffles across to go over midwicket. Lucky it has fallen safely, to the right of midwicket. Slower ball it is, drawing the cue-end from Maxwell
full, outside off, looks for the single, but hit straight to cover-point
through him. Some movement off the pitch. On a length, middle and off, he looks to open the face on it, and is beaten
through the diving Warner at mid-off. Looks like a bad bounce. Kohli pushes this straight of mid-off, Warner hares to his right, puts in a dive, and it bounces over his hand
full, nearly a yorker, dug out to cover by Kohli
quick cutter, on a length, just outside off, and beats his attempt to steer it
lovely shot. Delays the downswing of the bat to catch up with this slower ball. Helps that the Fizz has overpitched. Opens the face on the drive. Goes through cover
the quick cutter again, Maxwell opens the face, takes a single to short third man
short of a length, tucks him up with the angle, pushed away to midwicket
short of a length, no room, nut he manages to drop it in front of point for one
superb shot again. Against the turn if you will. Short of a length, cutter, and he manages to get inside the line and flick it over short fine leg. Incredible shot
skips down the wicket, Thakur shortens the length, Kohli pushes it to cover

Lalit Yadav has hit the single visible stump. Off we go to the third umpire. What an incredible piece of fielding. He has caught Kohli short with a direct hit while being off balance. Kohli again looks to drop this to point and run. Maxwell knows it is too close to Lalit, and sends him back. Lalit is falling over as he lets the ball go, and catches Kohli short by a frame
on a length, top of off, runs off a thick outside edge to third man for one
short of a length, wide, cut away, but straight to point
risky single to mid-off as he drives on the up, but Axar doesn't collect cleanly and they make it easily
bouncer to end the over. Good one too. Between the shoulder and head. Left alone
really slow in the air, pushed into the leg side, the bigger side of the field, and Maxwell takes a risky second. A direct hit catches him short, but this one isn't
on a length, middle and leg, defended back to him
fired into the pads, single to deep square leg
makes room to look to go over extra cover. With lack of turn, he ends up hitting this to long-on off the inside half of the bat
looks to push this length ball to long-off but Shaw makes a diving save at short extra cover
short of a length, into the pads, worked around the corner for a quick single
drops it slightly short first ball, and Maxwell is deep in his crease to turn this into a long hop and pull it over midwicket
short of a length, middle and leg, punched between long-on and deep midwicket for two
Kuldeep has dropped all three balls short, and he has a short boundary on the leg side. Not great from Pant to bowl him from this end. Maxwell pulls him over deep midwicket
goes wide outside off and overpitches this time. Maxwell opens the face and slaps this drive to the left of extra cover. Kuldeep yet to find his length

Maxwell making big use ot the short boundary on the leg side, and Kuldeep yet to bowl a wrong'un this over. Kuldeep get the length almost right this time, but Maxwell clears the front leg and goes over midwicket. Not the cleanest connection but this is a short boundary
drops this one into the leg side for a single
full, outside off, pushed down the ground for one
down the wicket, pumps this length ball between long-on and deep midwicket for four

mis-times the reverse-pull. He switches his stance early, Axar drags the length back, Prabhudessai still manages to get some bat on it, but the fielder at point, Kuldeep, times his jump perfectly to catch him overhead
quick length ball, defended into the leg side
stays quick and flat but provides some room this time, Shahbaz opens the face on it, and the quick outfield takes it for four the moment it beats short third man
fired down the leg side. A wide. Plus they get another bye as the best Pant can do is get a hand on it
short of a length, slight turn, pushed to long-on for one
short of a length, no room, and they steal two leg-byes off his thigh. The ball goes perfectly to the 30-yard circle with all men deep on the leg side
half-volley outside off, but driven straight to extra cover
bouncer, too short, and called a wide on height. Also perhaps the line. It is a legcutter slower bouncer
looking for the yorker, goes too far down the leg side, Maxwell glances it square of short fine leg for four more. That's a fifty off 30 balls for Maxwell
short of a length, just outside off, pushed back to Thakur
full, outside off, mid-off is up. Gets away with it as Maxwell hits this straight to mid-off
on a length, into the pads, punched between long-on and deep midwicket for two
quick, on a length, pushed into the covers for one

and immediately he gets his man caught at long-on. Nice dip on this, Maxwell looks to go downtown with this, but just gets it on the toe of the bat. And he is looking to just play through the line and not hit the pants off this ball. Easy catch for long-on
on a length, pretty straight, defended to leg
nearly two big wickets. Wrong'un from Kuldeep. Karthik has not picked it and is shaping to pull this over midwicket. He is lucky this has not carried as far as long-on
drop and run, and makes it before cover can come in
full, middle and leg, flicked to deep midwicket for one
on a length, fired into the pads, worked into the leg side for one
on a length, wicket to wicket, worked to leg
top edge on the sweep but it falls short of deep square leg
on a length, outside off, worked into the leg side for another single
slightly slower in the air, around off, punched straight to extra cover
shuffles away and back before the release, Axar stays on his length and doesn't give up the stumps. Concedes a leg-bye as he goes past the inside edge. Just a touch high perhaps
wrong'un, full, middle and leg, turning towards off, defended. Looks like he picked it from the pitch again and not out of the hand
slightly shorter, Karthik looks to turn but can't beat the man at point
is that a drop? Karthik is not picking the wrong'uns, and seems to have got a bit of a feather on it. Pant fails to collect it cleanly
full, dipping, pitching middle and leg, punched back to Kuldeep
slow in the air, just outside off, pushed to cover for one
quick in the air to protect a good over. On a length, on off. Shahbaz works it into the leg side for a single
digs the first one in short, Shahbaz looks for the upper-cut, but is beaten by the extra bounce
this is short too but not bowled in anger. Also wide. Shahbaz sees the cut is on, and throws everything at it. Beats point and deep cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
short, chest-high, pulled for a single to deep square leg
short of a length, wide, cut to deep point for one more
flat six. The fourth short ball of the over, and this one sits up nicely for Karthik to dispatch over deep square leg. Just the over RCB needed
short of a length, wide, punched to deep point for one
short of a length, into the body, pushed with an open face for one
on a length, outside off, hit hard but straight to deep cover
short of a length, angling in, looks for the pull, gets a bottom edge for one to fine leg
wide on the crease, looks for the wide yorker, ends up bowling a low full toss, but manages to beat him
keeps bowling to his field. Full and wide, driven to deep cover for one
on a length, Shahbaz makes room and swings big, but it is a slower ball so he has to adjust and push this for a single only
slower ball again, Karthik gets some width and length to work this wide of deep cover. Comes back for two
targets the short boundary. The first on-pace ball, Khaleel has stayed wide outside off, but Karthik is on a knee to slog this over deep midwicket for a flat six
Karthik is shuffling across to target the short leg boundary, but Khaleel goes even wider. Karthik toe-ends it to the keeper. On the bounce
ha ha, cat and mouse. Karthik goes across again, Khaleel goes full and wide. Karthik knows he can't drag it so he looks for the reverse shot, but ends up cueing it to deep cover for one
on a length, angling in, placed between the two deep fielders on the leg side for a couple
on-pace, wide length ball, Karthik is looking to ramp it by shuffling across, and gets an outside edge between the keeper and short third man

improvisation. Reverse upper-cut sort of. Or a reverse pull. Yeah pull it is. Mustafizur bowls the cutter and pitches it short, looking to make Karthik pull into the bigger side. Karthik goes the other way, switches his stance, and manages to pull this over short third man
now the orthodox cover-drive. Again a slower ball, Karthik goes deep in his crease and drives this between mid-off and extra cover. Strange that he is bowling wide to the short off-side boundary
and now he goes one better. Mustafizur goes on-pace, pitches on a length, just outside off, and Karthik lofts him back over long-off for a flat six

this is huge. On-pace, in the slot, and Karthik is deep in the crease to send this sailing over long-off. Nonchalant hit. Think the Fizz is looking for the yorker and has missed the length by inches. Karthik has turned this into a poorer delivery by go0ing deep into the crease

boundary off each ball in this over. Sensational batting, sensational fifty. Twenty-eight off the over. Mustafizur misses the yorker again, giving him a low full toss. The line is good, though, and is cramping him up. Karthik, though, makes room and gets enough bat on it to clear mid-off
full, into the pads, misses out, but takes the leg-bye to bring Karthik back on strike

trapped in front, given out, but he has called for a review immediately. Has he got some bat on it? Forget some bat, it is all bat. He is moving across, Thakur bowls a cross-seam yorker, it looks like the toe of Karthik but it has hit the toe of the bat
smash. Thakur goes for nose after toes. Karthik pulls it over deep midwicket for another big six. Lovely sweet connection
yorker, outside off, Karthik looks to open the face but ends up playing inside the line of it
another wide ball, just short of a yorker, Karthik sweeps this for a single to deep square leg

Shahbaz joins in. He was always going to swing hard as he doesn't want a single last ball and doesn't mind getting out with one over to go. Thakur bowls short, but doesn't get it really high. Pulled away for four
quick and full, 111ks. Full toss outside leg, Karthik can't get it past short fine leg
full enough to not let him get under the ball. Karthik ends up playing it along the ground into the leg side, but comes back for two
looking for the reverse-hit, Kuldeep bowls a good in-between length, around off, and Karthik manages to get an under edge for four fine of short third man. Unfortunate for the bowler
full and fast, over 100ks again, and Karthik ends up hitting the full toss to deep midwicket for one
Kuldeep tries to hide it outside off, ends up bowling a wide
oh Shahbaz anticipates perfectly, stays deep in the crease, and covers the wide line superbly to loft him over long-off for a six. What a hand Shahbaz has played too
fired in wide outside off. Called
another wide outside off now
good length on middle and leg. Turning further into the leg side. Worked off his pads to midwicket to get off the mark
continues around the stumps for Warner. Full outside off, and he gets low - down on one knee - to swat a slog-sweep against the turn over deep midwicket. #Intent
full on middle. Defended with soft hands right back to Maxi
good length, on off stump. Shuffles onto the back foot and mistimes a pull along the ground to the leg side
full outside off again. Turning away. Warner offers minimal footwork in his attempted slog once again. This time it is inside edged, and the ball just goes past leg stump! So close
good length, on middle. Turning into Shaw, and he nurdles it off his waist to square leg for one
starts off with a back of a length ball outside off. Pokes at it off the back foot, and cuts to point
good length, outside off stump. True bounce, and punched from near his chest-region to deep extra cover for one
back of a length outside off. Bit of seam movement away. Punched through cover point
good length ball on a stump to stump line. Warner raises his front leg and swats across the line to deep square leg
deposited! Siraj bowls a length ball on a fourth-stump line, but Shaw stands tall and drags a lofted shot over long on for six. Smacks it through the ball's line
good length outside off. Guided to short third, where a dive stops a four

whippy from Warner, clipped off his waist behind square to deep backward square leg for four. Hazlewood welcomed by Warner with a four. Scratch that, it's the short side of the ground and it's gone for six!
another length ball. Middle stump, and he checks a pull to the leg side.
fullish, on middle stump. Back-foot tap to the off side, and they scurry across for a single
good length, on off stump. Shapes to pull, but bottom-edged onto his body
good length on off stump. Backs away, and tries to cut. Edged over the slip cordon. Bit of luck, and races away...
good length outside off stump. Ball seams away slightly, and he tries to cut. Edged to third man for one
easy pickings! Full on off stump, and turning into Warner. He goes low, down on one knee, and sweeps over short fine leg! Controlled aggression, well placed four
tosses it up more. Full on leg stump. Whipped to square leg for a single after making some room
good length ball on off stump. Defended to the off side
full on off, around the stumps. Swept in front of square
full ball on middle stump. Sharp turn into him, past his pads, down the leg side
swatted away! A length ball from Shahbaz. Warner goes deep in his crease, letting the ball get to him. Once it does, he flat-bats a six over long on!
fullish, on middle and leg. Turning down the leg side
good length, on middle and off. Worked off the back foot to backward square leg for a single
the faster it comes, the quicker it goes! Siraj runs in, goes full on off stump. Warner stands tall, and drills a straight drive past the umpire and Shaw for four to start the over
good length on middle. Punched from near his knees through the off side, but Kohli dives at point, sticks a hand out, and stops a very certain four!
good length ball on leg stump. Angling into his body. Fended off the back foot to cover point

the stand is broken and the blazing partnership has been stopped. Shaw got a bit overshadowed by Warner's assault after his initial blows. Siraj goes length outside leg stump having seen Shaw back away, and the batter is cramped. Tries to clobber a slog over the leg side, but mistimes it in the air. Anuj Rawat gets under it in the deep
full on middle stump. Marsh wants to play the straight drive. Inside edged onto his pads!
slower ball, good length around off stump. Gets to Marsh with pace off, and he is through the pull too early. Hits the body
around the stumps. Starts off with the pace-off ball. Full on leg stump. Misses the clip, hits the leg. LBW appeal turned down
length ball, backs away, and cuts firmly through the off side!
good length, on a fourth-stump line. Pushed towards point for a single
good length just outside off stump. Gentle nudge to cover, and he calls early for Marsh to take the single

full on middle stump. Warner gently pushes it down the ground, and it's pure timing that the ball races along the grass to the straight boundary. But Prabhudessai runs from long on, all around the boundary line, and dives to stop two more runs
around the stumps. Slower ball, length ball. Warner taps it back to Harshal
rolls his fingers over this ball. Full on middle and leg. Pushed to mid on, carefully
full outside off stump. Drives away from his body, struck to fellow Aussie Maxwell lurking at cover
full on off stump. Checks a drive, plays along the ground to mid on

good length, fourth-stump line from around the stumps. Warner drags a pull along the ground, and it appears to be placed between deep midwicket and deep square leg, but Maxwell puts in the dive to stop the four!
full on his toes. Pushed to midwicket for one
good length on off stump. Backs away to pull. Bottom-edged onto his toes
full on off stump. Gets low, down on one knee, and sweeps it well! Replays show that's hit the boundary skirting on the full! Six.
an uppish drive to the off side
ends the over with two dots. Drives this flat-ish ball to cover
around the stumps, length ball angling across. Mistimed cut to the off side for a single
good length, on leg stump. Backs away and punched to cover. Quick call for one, and comfortably done. His 52nd IPL fifty!
good length, outside off. Cut in front of square for a single
struck for one
good length, outside off. In position for him to cut, but can't connect

sloppy! Overthrows allow them to take a single, and a sloppy back-up that is not collected properly safely lets Warner come back for the second. This was struck to long on, and Suyash throws it in hard to the bowler Maxwell, who fails to collect it cleanly. Hasaranga backing up fumbles too
length ball, but quite wide. Turning further away. Toe-ends a cut to the off side
good length, outside off. Bottom-edges the cut past the keeper
drilled to long on for a walking single
full on off stump. Walks across to the off side and tries to play a slog sweep, but misses the connection he desired. Hits the glove and rolls away to deep backward square
fullish, on middle stump. Backs away, opens the bat's face, and guides it to point
full outside off. Shahbaz offers Marsh width for him to chase at it, uut his timing is off tonight. Goes for a drive, reaching away from his body, but bottom-edges another shot onto the deck
good length ball, pace off. Lands around off stump. Worked away behind square on the off side for a single
over the stumps. Fuil, in the slot just outside off. But Marsh can't get under it in time. Driven to long on along the carpet
prepare to take off! Around the stumps. Full on middle, near his toes. The angle works perfectly for Davey, as he clips it with quick hands, and sends it for a six over cow corner
yorker length, on middle and leg. Dug away to mid on for a single
another bottom-edge and this nearly crashed into the stumps. Slower ball, short on a fourth-stump line. Marsh is through the pull too early.
delightful! Slower ball, back of a length outside off. Warner expected that perhaps. Waits for it to get to him before gently playing a shot that is essentially a chip over point!
good length, on middle. Backs away to slap it square, but ends up flat-batting it back to the bowler
googly. Full on middle. turning into leg. Marsh goes for a slog sweep. Decent connection, but finds deep midwicket

switch hit! Can't connect! LBW appeal! Not given! But Royal Challengers review. Full on the left-hander's middle stump. Skids into the left-hander's off stump. Three reds according to the TV umpire and the umpire has to change his decision. Kohli gives a big fist pump, the camera pans to Warner's daughter in the stands who looks very sad. The Capitals dugout gives Warner a warm welcome back into the dugout
full on middle. turning to off stump as Pant wants to start off with a slog sweep. Mistimed to the leg side
good length on leg stump. Legbreak turning into Pant to cramp him for space. Backs away and slaps a cut to the sweeper fielder on the off side
length ball, just outside off stump. Ball stays low and Marsh looks to pierce the gap between point and cover point. But can't do that
full and wide outside off. Pant throws his bat at this, and clatters a shot to cover. Can't get the run
good length on off stump. Pulled along the ground to deep square leg. Timing still not 100%, but gets back for two
drilled to long on for one

Is Pant out? Hasaranga is getting under it..... but it pops out! Length ball, wide of Pant. He tries to cut, but it flies off the edge behind square on the off side. Wanindu runs in from the deep, but the ball doesn't settle into his palms as he falls onto the ground due to the momentum. And that's a chance gone
slower ball. Marsh tries to find a big shot, but the ball goes past him
good length, fourth-stump line. Bit of extra bounce as Siraj bends his back. Marsh wants to clatter a square cut, but the extra bounce takes the ball over the blade to the keeper
much needed as Pant improvises to get low and play a flick over short fine leg. Hasaranga bowled a length ball on leg stump
full on middle stump. Mows a slog across the line. Mistimed to deep square leg, and the lack of pace off the bat allows them to take two
full outside leg stump. Pant plays a "Sachin style" paddle from next to his pads, but intercepted by short fine leg
full on off stump. Slogs across the line, and the googly is hit to deep midwicket
great use of his wrists as Pant gets a boundary over short fine leg again. Hasaranga goes length outside leg, and Pant got low to play a whippy shot that ensured the ball would clear the infield

what a way to get out! Full ball on middle stump, and Pant hits the straightest of straight drives. Hasaranga moves to his right, sticks a hand out to stop the ball, but the ball hits his finger and rolls onto the stumps! Marsh is not in his crease, and the Aussie has to go for a 24-ball 14. No chance for Marsh to sing a redemption song tonight

two wickets in two balls as Hazlewood bowls a fullish ball on a fifth-stump line. Powell wants to feel bat on ball first up, and plays away from his body. Gentle edge and gobbled up by DK. Looks like it was a legcutter, according to the replays
good length ball just outside off. Lalit looks to cut, but the ball is a tad close to his body for the perfect execution of the shot. Ends up missing the shot altogether
sticks with the fourth-stump line outside off. This time short of a length. Extra bounce as Lalit comes down the track. Wants to play another cut. Misses again
offcutter, back of a length on off. Mistimes a pull in front of square for one
another cutter. Back of a length on middle. Pant mistimes a cut to deep point. Pant wanted to clobber that in front of square
good length on middle, and angling down the leg side as he misses the clip

third wicket in less than ten balls as Hazlewood is making deep impact in his return spell. Bowls a short ball, Lalit appears to have connected well with the pull, but there was an outfielder at deep square leg prepared for the ball to come to him.
full on leg stump. Wants to play a cute sweep, but misses. Hits the pad and the ball rolls away to the leg side
praise the Lord! Hasaranga tosses it up, ball lands just outside off stump, turning away, and Shardul clears the front leg before hammering a six over long on
Hasaranga has Shardul confused. Fullish on off, and the googly turns in. Tries to defend, but under-edged onto the deck. Ball bounces over the stumps!

the audacity! Hasaranga goes full outside leg. Pant moves to the off side, looking for a very fine sweep, and gets the connection. Pant, in fact, falls over after playing the shot since he played the sweep very very fine

Maxwell's getting under it....but it soars over him! Heart-in-mouth moment briefly for Capitals fans as Hasaranga goes full and wide, and Pant came dancing down the track. Has enough power to clear long off, but only just
good length ball on middle. Cut to point, where Siraj misfields. The ball bursts through his hands, and the single is comfortably taken. Pant keeps the strike

full toss outside off. Slapped in front of mid off, and Maxwell runs to his right to stop it with a dive. Ball bursts through him too, very powerfully hit, but his finger did reduce the ball's speed thereby saving the boundary

punished! Short ball on middle, and angling towards off stump. Doesn't have extra bounce either, and Pant can easily muscle a pull in front of square. Cow corner is the short boundary from this end, and that has flown!

hand of God moment! Kohli's athleticism at its best. Siraj tried to bowl a cutter. Ended up as a knee high full toss. Pant wanted to hit it over cover, but ends up slicing the shot. Kohli at cover times his jump to perfection, sticks his right hand up over his head, and the ball has stuck! Siraj strikes, Pant goes, and Kohli is off to celebrate!
full on leg stump. Wants to flick it through the leg side but inside edged onto his pad
well disguised cutter. Takes the pace off slightly as he bowls a length ball angling into the batter. Shardul tried to explore the leg side but couldn't connect. Ball hits his body
no man's land is where this ball goes after Siraj bowls short and Shardul slices the pull. Ball flies over Siraj, and lands around mid on where there's nobody. Axar has strike
good length outside leg and angling into his pads. Punched to deep midwicket for one
length ball, drags it wide outside off stump. They collect the extra run

full and wide outside off. Shardul throws his bat at this, and toe-ends a lofted shot that could've seen him hole out at long off. But the ball falls a few feet short of the fielder on the boundary line
shin-high full toss on off stump. Drilled past the non-striker to long off for just a single. Harshal escapes without much damage
A dot ball. Rolls his fingers over this fullish ball outside off stump. Thakur swings somewhat blindly with minimal footwork. Ball goes under the bat, on the bounce to DK
finds cow corner! Harshal errs by bowling a full toss on off stump. Shardul clears the front leg, has a proper swing across the line, and has enough power to clear the boundary by a few metres!
full just outside off stump. Shardul targets cow corner again with another leg-side swipe. Could be four, but Kohli is straighter this time. Runs to his left to stop the ball

How's the Josh? It's high for Royal Challengers as JH takes his third. Starts the over the short ball on a stump to stump line. Shardul goes for the pull, and it's been sliced high up. DK calls for the catch and takes it from point
cutter. Fullish outside off. Angling across. Tries to get bat on ball but can't
fullish outside off. Cut in front of square for one
slapped in front of square to keep Capitals' slender hopes of a win alive. Hazlewood offers width, and Axar climbs into a cut in front of square!
full toss, quite wide outside off stump. Slapped to backward point for a single

four for Josh? Not today! Another short ball to end his day. Axar goes for the pull. Sliced in the air, and the ball falls between the bowler and keeper as both try to get under it for a catch. 3 for 28 for Hazlewood
nudged past the keeper for four. Good length, outside leg, and gently placed to short fine leg with soft hands
Kuldeep trying to innovate but can't connect. Tried to use the back of the bat to ramp it over the keeper, but can't connect
good length, outside off and angling across. Kuldeep swings across the line and misses out. Mathematically, Royal Challengers have the game in the bag
short of a length on middle and leg. Swivels to pull behind square, and it very nearly goes for six!
full on leg stump. Kuldeep wants to play a cover drive, but inside edged to fine leg instead
And Harshal Patel marks his return to the IPL with a win. Length ball outside leg, and whipped to fine leg. Royal Challengers Bangalore win by 16 runs
pretty full and sliding across off stump, Rahul props forward and jabs it away to extra-cover

dragged down on middle, loose ball, Rahul rocks back and pummels a pull through the leg side. Fabian Allen into the action in the first over - slides across to his left from deep midwicket and ends up parrying the ball to the fence. Good commitment, though, in the outfield
much fuller and pushed across off, stabbed to mid-off
on a length and a hint of turn, worked away with the break through midwicket
dangled up on middle, de Kock punches a single down to long-off
pushed through on middle and leg, Rahul drives a single through wide mid-on
good length and slanting away outside off, Rahul rides a single down to deep third man
back of a length and angling into middle and off, quietly played back to Unadkat
fractionally short and outside off, enough for de Kock to slash a cut between square third man and backward point inside the circle

terrific comeback from Unadkat. Almost snags the outside edge. On a length, angling in towards middle, de Kock plays for the angle but it straightens away late past the outside edge and bounces over the stumps
crunnnnnnnnnnnched. Short and width, barely 130ks, de Kock throws his bat at ball and pings the cover-point fence
pretty full on the stumps, de Kock gets forward and stabs it back to Unadkat
back of a length and the new ball slides into the hips, whipped away through midwicket
swiped away to the midwicket fence. Legbreak sliding across off, de Kock heaves it wide of the outfielder on the leg side
sliding into leg stump or further down with third man inside the circle, de Kock drags a sweep past that infielder for another boundary
tip and run to mid-off
wide of the crease, fizzing into off stump, might've been a wrong'un. Rahul meets it with an open face and glides it to cover-point
low full-toss on middle, picked away to the right of mid-on, where Pollard puts in a dive to stop the ball
full and slanting into middle and leg, Rahul taps it defensively to midwicket
shorter and straightens a wee bit outside off, Rahul meets it with an open face and steers it to point
Rahul now closes his bat-face and tucks this length ball on middle to midwicket
fuller and straighter, tucked away past the right of midwicket
back of a length, Bumrah brings this back into Rahul who aims leg side and ends up wearing it on the thigh pad
short and angling into the body, Rahul rides the bounce and secures a single to square leg
pumped over the infield for four. Pitched-up delivery outside off, Rahul gets underneath this half-volley and lets his hands flow through the line
shorter and skidding into the top of off stump, stabbed into the covers
hauled away to the left of deep midwicket as Mills digs it short once again
Mills gets away with that. Pitched-up delivery on the pads, de Kock can't make contact with a flick. Off the pad and trickles away towards the midwicket region
on-pace bouncer angling down the leg side, Rahul is late onto a pull but manages to tickle it away to the left of a diving Kishan for four
scythed over point for six. Another on-pace short ball, Mills goes wider of off. Rahul reaches out for the ball and creams it over the infield once again. Mills concedes 15 runs in his opening over
dragged off the inside half to short fine leg
slog-swept over midwicket for six. Pushed through fuller and outside off, de Kock drops down to one knee and hauls it away over the leg side. de Kock brings up LSG's fifty in style

Allen provides MI with the breakthrough. Given out lbw. This looks fairly adjacent, and de Kock decides against a review. Much fuller and darted into middle, too full for the sweep or the reverse-sweep rather. The ball also skids off the deck and thumps the pad in front of middle. Looks plumb although ball-tracking returns umpire's call on leg stump. Some respite for MI
first-ball four for Pandey. Welcome back. Tossed up slower and higher outside off, Pandey stays leg-side of the ball and drills it straight of mid-off
shorter and outside off, played into the covers
hip-high short ball outside off, heaved away to deep midwicket
speared down the leg side, Pandey sweeps it into the pads of Kishan
floated up outside off, Pandey shovels this legbreak down to long-off
loopy legbreak from Ashwin, starts around off and breaks away, run away fine of short third man for a single
tossed up outside off, Pandey shovels it with the bottom wrist to long-on
shorter googly from Ashwin, the length allows Rahul to go back and tuck a single through square leg
lobs a full-toss outside off, stabbed to Rohit at short cover
pushed through on middle, Rahul manufactures some room and drives it to deep cover
darted shorter and wider of off, forced off the back foot to deep cover
down the track and knocked away between deep midwicket and wide long-on
Allen shifts his lines wider of off, asks Pandey to reach out. He does so and drives it to deep cover
fractionally shorter and turns away outside off, Pandey opens the bat-face and late-cuts away between backward point and short third man

Pandey ventures down the track and whips it with the angle through the leg side. The man in the deep fumbles and gives up four at deep square leg. Surya puts his hand up in apology straightaway. Rohit is frustrated
Ashwin errs in length, lobs a full-toss on middle, a real gift for Rahul. Duly swatted over midwicket for six
shorter and hides it away from Rahul's swinging arc. This legbreak is slashed to sweeper cover
chopped from outside off to short third man
fractionally short and turns away outside off, Pandey can't get it past backward point
on a length and sliding into off stump, heaved away to long-on
slower through the air and turns away outside off, this legbreak is driven inside-out to the left of long-off
Length on middle, clipped to mid-wicket along the ground
Length on the hips, turns the pull to the right of deep square-leg who fumbles and allows two.
Back of a good length on off, waits for it and clips it to deep mid-wicket. Rahul is standing back almost by default to the left-armer.
In Mark Nicholas' voice, "Six from the moment he hit it!" It was a length ball that sat up and Rahul deposited it over long-on for a 98m six
Full outside off, opens the bat face for the square drive but he finds point along the turf
Good length on middle and off, closes the bat-face on the flick to direct it to the gap at square-leg for one
Full outside off, slashed to deep cover, it was in the air for a bit but there is no fielder there in the ring
Full on middle, driven to the bowler on the bounce. He pretends to throw it behind him to keep the non-striker in check
88 kmph ball on the stumps, defended to the bowler. He had to change his shot after realizing it was slower than he expected
Full outside off, driven to long-off with a horizontal blade
Length outside off, gets away with it as it is clubbed to long-off along the ground
Fullish ball on the stumps, clipped to long-on
Good length comes in with the angle and beats the flick, it's going down leg
Full on the stumps, driven down the ground on the up. Bumrah deflects it to towards cover with his boot
Good length but down leg, deep backward square parries in front. It looks like they're okay. But it brings up Rahul's fifty
Back of a good length on middle, closes the bat-face on the flick which goes to mid-wicket
Low full toes beats the flick and goes to cover off the deflection. Direct hit at the non-striker's end but the batter looks okay

Shortish ball over off, pulled to the right of square-leg. Brevis, there, covers the ground but lobs it behind him accidentally and allows it to go the fence and Bumrah expresses his frustration with a yell behind his face covered under a towel
Low full toss around seventh stump, glides it fine to the left of point. Third man comes across and fumbles to allow another unforced error that leads to a boundary
Back of a good length, the farmer's slog takes the inside edge and it goes along the ground to deep square-leg
Full outside off, slashes at it and opens the face of the bat to keep it away from point and sends it behind square on the off-side for four
Helps a length ball on the hips with a fine paddle like pull past fine-leg to his right for four more!
Full outside off, driven to long-off along the ground
Short ball at 135 kmph just below the armpit but Rahul bent to his right and accessed fine-leg to end the 18-run over with the fourth four
Full and flighted outside off at 84 kmph, beats the slashing cover drive with a horizontal bat. Keeper misses it but there was no edge

Knocks over leg-stump with another flighted delivery! It was full and invited the slog-sweep which Pandey went for but was beaten comprehensively by the ball that came in with the angle, the leg-spinner may have spun away a bit to to hand Ashwin his first wicket
Full on off, Stoinis pumps it over long-on with a free-swing. The googly came in and he was ready for it and enjoyed it with a smile
Fuller ball on middle and leg at 88 kmph, makes room late and flicks it to long-on along the ground
Length ball on middle creates a leading edge off the flick. It lands at mid-on which is vacant and goes behind to the fielder
Length ball on leg is played out with a flick to the bowler
Length outside off, cut behind square to the right of point in the gap for another four
Another length ball sits up over off and it's pulled to the left of deep mid-wicket. It went 89m and just over the fielder who tried to reach it with a leap but couldn't
Around a good length outside off goes away with the angle and beats the glide
Length on off, worked to wide long-on
Slow on a good length at 96 kmph on leg, Stoinis makes ample room and tries to slap it down the ground. Doesn't get all of it. Goes to long-off
Full ball on leg is swept fine and miles away over short fine-leg for a maximum that brings up the 150
Low full toss just outside off is driven to the stumps at the other end. No contact was made along the way. It came back and Bumrah tried to run the batter out but he had made his way back
Slow on a good length just outside off, checks the full-faced defence to mid-wicket on the move
Slower back of a good length ball outside off takes the inside edge off the open-faced fend towards cover misses leg-stump and goes to long-leg along the ground
Yorker on middle and leg is dug-out with a flick to long-on
Good length outside off, pushed to cover gently who's back which allows the single
Full toss on off at 141 kmph, clipped to cow corner along the ground in the gap

Bottom-edge skier goes high and is taken low-down by Rohit at cover! It was full outside off and was angling away, Stoinis flashed at it with a horizontal but could not reach far enough to find the middle. Rohit kept his eyes and almost let it slip as he was going down with a crouch but managed to hold on.
Length outside off, driven to long-off off the backfoot along the ground
Tries to hide a full ball outside off at 128 kmph but it is outside the tramline and is left alone.
Low full toss outside off, close to a yorker and it's driven expertly by Rahul to the left of deep cover who fumbles again, this time Allen, for four
Length over off, cuts to point for one. He fumbles but it's in front and does not cost an extra
Slow length ball down leg is clipped to deep square-leg after the batter made room and was followed
Whips a full ball on middle to deep square-leg. Rahul is shaping with a high back-lift and the front foot out the way.
Nails a yorker on middle, it's dug out to long-on with a flick along the ground
Full just outside off, makes room and thinks of slogging through but he had to adjust to the lack of pace and hit it off the bottom to mid-wicket
Full outside off, left alone. A marginal call on the wide is given to add to Bumrah's frustration
Yorker on middle and off, driven to long-off along the ground
Another yorker at 144 kmph on middle and leg is dug out to the wide long-on area for one
Full outside off, tries to use his hands for the flay but misses. It was just outside the tramline, Bumrah concedes with a smile this time
Full outside off, beats cover who fumbles and lets go the drive with a horizontal bat to the deep
Low full toss on off, pushes it to long-on with a full-faced drive to end Bumrah's spell which ends economically but sans wickets
Length outside off, uses the room and directs the 140 kmph ball over short third man with an aerial cut. Goes to the fence after a bounce
Full just outside off, the 114 kmph demanded an adjustment in shot from a slog to a push to long-on
Slow ball sits up off a good length outside off. Hooda waits for it and deposits it over long-on with a pull that went 91 metres away
Outside edge off the full-faced slog aimed down the ground goes over third man. It was full and slow just outside off, Hooda threw his bat at it
Bouncer way down leg beats the pull and is taken with one hand by Kishan to his left

Length outside off, pierces the gap in front of point to bring up a century. He meditates in the middle, probably signalling the outside noise does not affect him. Excellent century from the stylish opener
Length ball just below the hips the beats the pull and goes leg-side off the deflection from the thigh pad
Low full toss on legstump, tries to natmeg it but finds fine-leg off the bottom of the bat
Slow, low full-toss outside leg follows the batter. Flicked to cow corner along the ground, the fielder stops it by rushing in
Full outside off, clobbered but without full connected to wide long-on along the ground
Caught behind off the upper-cut! The slower bouncer was close to going above the head but Hooda went through with the shot and bottom-edged it to the keeper who took it comfortably. No celebrations.
Comes in from wide of the crease. Low full toss on the stumps is whipped to cow corner along the ground
Yorker goes away with the angle and pitches within the tramline. Rahul left it thinking it was wide but for once in this innings, misjudged a ball.
short and on the hips, with fine leg inside the circle. There's only one result and that's a glance fine of short fine leg for four
nice and full, angling across Kishan, who presses forward and push-drives it to mid-off
Holder hits that in-between length and gets it to slant away outside off. Skewed into the covers off the back foot
back of a length on leg stump, knocked into the midwicket region for a single
full and drifting into the pads, picked off to long leg
back of a length and on off and middle, chopped away to wide slip to close out the over
full and fizzing through just a shade outside off, left alone in the channel
back of a length and slanting into off, no room for Rohit to free his arms, jabbed to mid-on
Kishan is a touch early into a flick as he chips it in the air, but it bounces in front of mid-on
back of a length and slanting across off as Kishan wafts and misses in the channel
drilled away over Chameera's head. Fuller and around off stump, Kishan clears his front leg and swats it down the ground
Chameera responds by pounding the middle of the pitch. He rushes Kishan into a hook, he might have top-edged it onto his body
full and sliding down the leg side for a wide
top ball from Avesh - unplayable. Kicks up from a length and straightens away past the outside edge. Rohit dangles his bat out in the channel and is beaten emphatically
regally whipped over midwicket. Pitched-up delivery, fairly straight in line, Rohit shuffles across a bit and stylishly hits it over the top
full and just a shade outside off, forward and guided to extra-cover

Has Rohit nicked off? Yes, the finger goes up. De Kock goes low and pouches a low catch. Back of a length and keeps veering in from outside off with the angle from over the stumps. Rohit searches for the dink down to deep third man, but doesn't have enough room to work with. He simply guides this 141.3ks delivery into the gloves of de Kock
first-ball four! On a length and outside off, Brevis punches it on the up with a high elbow through point
shorter and ducking into middle, defensively pushed to mid-on
wrong'un, sliding across off, driven away past the right of mid-off
edged but flies past the right of slip and left of short third man. 104ks dart, full and turns away outside off, snatches the outside edge, but Brevis gets away
half-tracker down the leg side, wide called
googly, on a back of a length on off, forced back to Bishnoi
another googly, which is shovelled down to long-on off the back foot
another quick wrong'un sliding across off, driven to extra-cover
full and on the stumps at 101.6ks, driven down to long-on
hip-high short ball into the pitch, but skids onto Kishan. He can only flap a weak pull to short fine leg
rapid full-toss on middle, swivels on the back foot and hauls it away to deep midwicket
absolute peach from Chameera. On a length, threatens to angle in from over the wicket, so Brevis plays for that incoming angle, but it veers away late past the outside edge. Outstanding bowling

lofted over wide long-on for a stunning six. This is a fairly blameless length ball outside off, not a half-volley, he extends his arms and launches it down the ground. Monster six from the 18-year-old South African. He holds the pose and rightly so
bumper outside off, sails over the half-ducking batter and leaping keeper. Five wides to the total

belted through the off-side gap. Back of a length and outside off, Brevis punches it between backward point and extra-cover. It was the slower variation from Chameera, Brevis delayed his punch and found the gap
down the track, waits for the slower ball to arrive, then wallops it straight of mid-off. Incredible ball-striking from Brevis in the powerplay
on a length, starts on middle and moves away, tapped into the covers for one
swiped away between midwicket and mid-on. Fuller and outside off, Brevis doesn't middle it but still packs enough power in this slog to find the fence
hip-high short ball wide of off stump, Brevis sizes it up and flat-bats it down the ground, having the umpire ducking for cover. Bam! He has raced to 31 off 11 balls
bumper outside off, beats Brevis on the hook

Drilled straight to Hooda at extra-cover. Avesh gives Brevis a send-off. Brevis pre-meditates by shuffling outside leg, even before Avesh delivers. Full-toss on middle stump, belted more or less straight to the infielder. It was hit hard, so Hooda did a good job hanging onto the ball. Brevis' fireworks are over
shortish and outside off, Surya slashes it hard into the ground, but can't get it past cover-point
slower cutter into the pitch, stabbed back to Stoinis

Two in two overs for LSG as Stoinis produces a drag-on. Offcutter into the pitch from Stoinis, Kishan wants to force it away through the leg side, he can only chop it back onto his own stumps. Kishan is filthy with himself for giving his wicket away once again
tucked away off the pads to the right of long leg
fullish and outside off, defended away
back of a length on middle and leg, this on-pace delivery is flicked to long leg
Badoni and Krunal collide near the deep square leg boundary and end up conceding a double. Picked away off the pads through square leg
Pandey throws himself to his left at backward point and makes a spectacular one-handed save. Shortish and angling across off, punched away with an open face
back of a length and into the pitch, this slower cutter loops into the off side off the thigh pad
pitched-up delivery outside off, suspect another slower one, which is driven through the line to deep cover. They steal three, courtesy a wild throw from Stoinis that balloons over the keeper
bouncer down the leg side, wide called
slower legcutter outside off, punched away wide of cover-point, the fielder makes a half-save as the ball rolls away to deep cover
full and outside off, driven away to the right of sweeper cover
floated down the leg side for another wide
on-pace short ball outside off, Surya stands tall and punches between deep midwicket and wide long-on

helicoptered away over midwicket. Stoinis hit good lengths in his first over, but this time he pushes it too full and on the stumps. Surya gets underneath it and whips it over the infield in grand style
shortish and Stoinis hides it away from Surya's swinging arc. Chopped away to deep third man
on a length, chopped away from a middle-stump line to point
hip-high short ball on leg stump, offcutter into the pitch, Varma delays the pull and hits it in the air. Avesh runs in from deep square, and dives, but the ball lands in front of him
full-toss, angling into the stumps, whipped away to deep midwicket
another offcutter from Stoinis, Varma ekes out an inside-edge onto the pad
back of a length and into the pads, deflected away to short fine leg
darted into middle, punched down to long-on
Varma backs away outside leg, K Pandya sees it and sends a full-toss on middle, stabbed away to the leg side
whipped away off the back foot to Avesh at deep midwicket
full-toss on leg stump, hauled away between deep midwicket and wide long-on
K Pandya hits a hard length, angling into middle, punched down to long-on
Full outside off, driven inside out to deep cover on the bounce
Flatter length ball outside off gets the underedge and goes behind the keeper. Chased by short third-man in the deep
Full on the stumps, clipped to deep mid-wicket
Full outside off, driven to long-off along the ground
Length outside off, cut to deep point
Back of a good length on leg at 102 kmph, tucked to deep mid-wicket
Length just outside off, stays leg-side of the ball and cuts it to the left of deep cover
Good length outside off goes away with the angle and beats the late cut
Full toss on middle and leg, flicked to deep backward square
Full on middle at 89 kmph, whips it to wide long-on in the middle of a big gap in the deep
Back of a good length ball on the stumps, worked to long-on off the backfoot
Low full toss outside off, switch hit comes out of the lower half of the bat and goes well past short third-man to the fence
Full outside off at 102 kmph, uses the pace and opens the face of the bat and slices it between short third and point
Full outside off, driven to long-off
Full on the stumps, worked to deep mid-wicket
Full on the stumps, flicked to deep mid-wicket
Carves a backfoot cover drive off a back of a length ball outside off with the elbow up. The right foot went to the legside to gain access
Good length outside off, reaches out and cuts it to deep point
Late cuts a good length ball on middle and off to backward point
Low full toss on off, the attempted yorker is worked to long-on for one
Full toss on leg-stump beats the flick and goes to mid-wicket off the pad. Avesh's appeal is turned down, he did it while chasing the ball to the circle
Short over middle, shaped for the pull but had to adjust and went for the ramp. Beaten
Follows the batter who was making room with a full ball, flicked behind square to the deep. Finds the gap for two
Very low full toss, almost a yorker - up to the observer's judgement, on the stumps is driven back to the bowler
Low full toss on middle, stays back and flicks it to deep square-leg
Yorker hits off! It came in with the angle. Tilak had made room and tried to dig it out to the offside but could not get the bat down in time and gets castled. Holder punches the air in celebration.
Slower yorker on the stumps, stepped down and pushed it to long-on
Good length outside off, goes across and paddles it off the lower half of the bat to square-leg
Short just over off, the slower ball is pulled into the ground to deep square-leg
Length on off, whipped along the ground to wide long-on
Short at 106 kmph on middle, pulled to wide long-on. It did not sit up to the relief of the bowler
Low full toss outside off, a yorker? Yea, why not. Reaches out and drives, gets the inside edge to deep mid-wicket

Long-hop is pulled to deep square-leg! It was slow and went over middle and leg, Surya turned and tried to pull it hard but got the top-edge and Gowtham took it comfortably at the deep. Yadav played well but could not finish things off, Bishnoi will take it however they come, particularly off his last over.
Low full toss outside off at 94 kmph is driven along the carpet through cover to the fence
Darts a full ball that's close to the tramline, the batter left it alone
Very low full toss outside off, driven to deep cover
Full outside off, carved along the ground to long-off
Full outside off, whacks it over wide long-on off the inside half of the lower end of the bat but Pollard closed the bat-face and had got enough power to clear the fence
Short ball is pulled over mid-wicket over the fence. It was on a length over middle, Pollard looked to have premeditated it, he made room and clobbered it with a bend and sent it 92 metres away
Wide and full outside off, tries to slap it straight. Hits it to long-on off the bottom
Full outside off, swing and a miss. It was going away with the angle, Allen stood back in his crease and had his front leg away and threw his bat at it but could not make contact
Full outside off, driven to cover's right. It was on a long, fast drive but hit Holder on the knee as he was going down and the deflection went to long-off. Saved two runs but he looked like it stung
Full outside off, clobbered through wide long-on
Good length outside off, Pollard heaved at it but it took the bottom of the bat and went to the leg-side. He looked to have tried to over-hit it, says Graeme Swann on air.
Low full toss outside off, tries to direct it to wide long-on with the bottom hand coming off. Goes to deep mid-wicket off the bottom of the bat

Flayed, goes to short-third man off the edge! It was full outside off, he tried to whack it over long-off with his front-foot out the way but found Chameera, who took it comfortably with his hands pointing up
Full outside off, it's been dug-out with a cover drive in the gap for four crucial runs
Low full toss on off, tries to tee-off through long-on. Goes to cover off the bottom of the bat
Full outside off. It's been dug out to deep cover and gambles for the second run and makes it.
Yorker on leg beats the flick, it looked like bat hit pad and the ball hit the boot on its way to third man. Single taken as there is no other option
Full outside off, the 102 kmph ball is slapped over wide long-on after going on a knee. Connects with an 89-metre hit
Full outside off, slapped down the ground. Bisects long-on and long-off who were running in towards each other. Jaydev sat back and waited for it really well
Luck is on Unadkat's side as a full ball angling in beats the whack, takes the inside of the pad and beats the diving keeper to his left. Goes fine and into the fence
Full outside off, the unofficial free-hit is hit to long-off on the bounce to fuel Unadkat's frustration but he's done his job this over. The single is rejected

Run-out comes in as they tried to attempt the second! It was full outside off, close to a yorker and was dug-out to deep mid-wicket with an attempted heave. It went along the ground and Stoinis sped in to stop and threw it at a good height to ensure Pollard could not get back.
Connects one over long-on off a full ball just outside off. It was a slog that came off a stable diagonal base and a free swing

Run-out on the non-striker's end comes in from an attempted bye! It was full outside off and beat the swinging horizontal bat, Pollard ran in and the underarm through beat the striker's end. The bowler took it and underarmed it to the stumps at the other end
Full outside off, hit to deep mid-wicket along the ground. It is mathematically impossible now for MI without extras.
Taken at deep mid-wicket! It was full just outside off, close to a yorker and took the bottom of Pollard's swinging bat and was taken in front with a lunge and a tumble by Stoinis
Full outside off, beats the swinging bat and Lucknow pick up their fourth win!
length ball pitching within the stumps and swerving away from the left-hander. Presses forward and dabs with soft hands into the backward point region
steps out of his crease and across to get close to the line of an outswinger pitching outside off, clips it towards mid-on, who's on the edge of the circle
down the track, and Bhuvneshwar swings one into the left-hander, beating his inside edge on the leg-side whip and swinging past leg stump. Pooran dives to his right to half-stop the ball
inswinger, shuffles across and a long way down the track to try and work it leg side, gets a thick inside edge into his pad
shot. Full inswinger, attacking the stumps, and he clears his front leg and extends his arms through a straight-bat punch to launch the ball over mid-on
back of a length outside off, stops on Finch a little. Wants to punch through the covers, ends up hitting it towards mid-off instead
full, angling down leg, can't connect with the flick
fullish, swinging away from the left-hander outside off, drives crisply and Suchith dives to his left at short extra-cover to make a terrific stop

inside edge, and Finch's debut innings for KKR ends early. Length ball, angling across the right-hander and veering back in slightly, late. He's in an open position, looking to sit back and punch through mid-off, and he ends up getting a thin inside-edge on it through to the keeper

fullish, slanting across into a wide-ish line outside off. Looks for the flat-bat drive, ends up hitting it off the inside half of the bat and it rolls slowly to the right of short extra-cover. Early call for the quick single and he makes it fairly comfortably

oh, lovely delivery. Length ball, angling into the fourth-stump channel and straightening just a touch. Not much footwork from Venkatesh, pushes hard at the off drive without really getting forward, and it zips past his outside edge
beaten again. Similar ball to the previous one, but a different response. Tries to move a little more leg-side to make room and flay the ball over the covers, but he can't make contact
back of a length close to off stump, straightens a bit, but no room to free the arms. Stands tall and punches to backward point
full, close to off stump, driven to the left of mid-off, with the bottom hand coming off the handle at impact. Doesn't quite get the timing he wants, but he finds the gap to pick up three

edged, and it runs away for four. Just the one slip in place now for Bhuvneshwar. Length ball angling across to finish close to off stump, and nips away slightly off the seam after threatening to swing in. Looks to drive down the ground, on the up, and gets a thick edge that runs away wide of the lone slip
back of a length on off stump, punched firmly into the covers, but the ball comes back in a little so he doesn't have the room to extend his arms and hit it with power
length ball on leg stump, pitching just outside. Looks to work it leg side and only manages a deflection off the pad towards square leg
beauty. Lovely length, and swing away from the left-hander after pitching within the stumps. No real feet from Venkatesh, looks to punch into the covers and is beaten on the outside edge
and again, past the edge. Another one that swings away from the left-hander, but this starts from outside off, inviting the cover drive away from the body
fullish, angling across towards off stump, gets forward for the checked drive to mid-off

ooh, Shreyas finds some luck here. He's looking to make room to target the off side, and Jansen follows him with a bouncer that keeps coming in off the pitch. Somehow he falls away from the line and manages to get some bat on it, semi-intentionally, to ramp it over the slip fielder diving to his left
nicely bowled. Good seam position as he slants this length ball away from Iyer's off stump, and then it nips away to beat the outside edge as he aims a cover drive at it
a little fuller and closer to off stump, and he takes off quickly for one after a push towards mid-off

the ball's really doing all sorts here. Short, rising ball outside off, beats the outside edge of Venkatesh's cut with bounce, and then it swings after passing the bat, away from the diving keeper, and first slip sticks a hand out to half-stop the ball

wow, big movement again. This is a length stump pitching on around leg stump, and the away movement takes it to a seventh-stump line by the time it's reached the batter, who pushes at it from the crease and finds his outside edge beaten. Good take from Pooran diving to his right

What a delivery! Length ball, pitching just outside off on a length, and Venkatesh's lack of footwork does him in. Barely half-forward to drive this, and that creates a big gap between bat and pad for the ball to seam back through and crash into the stumps

terrific shot. Length ball on off stump, and he clears his front leg and makes himself ample swinging room to club the ball over wide long-on. Great hand-eye coordination to come out and hit that shot when the ball's been doing so much

got him, not the most dangerous delivery he's bowled, but he'll take it. Low full-toss angling into middle and leg, and Narine, looking to make room and slice the ball over point, fails to get the desired elevation even though he hit the ball quite cleanly. Straight into Shashank Singh's hands
length ball straightening towards middle stump. Squares up a little and defends into the covers off the outside half of the bat
past the edge. Fullish, swinging away outside off, and Rana ends up playing inside the line while trying to drive into the covers
length ball straightening close to off stump, gets back and across to defend into the covers
length ball slanting across and straightening into off stump, defended into the cover point region
overpitched, on middle and off, and Iyer shows it the full face and strokes it smoothly past the fielder diving to his left at mid-on
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to the left of fine leg
back of a length, swings back in to cramp Shreyas for room, finishing at around stomach height over off stump. Punched into the covers
Fullish, angling across to off stump, and Iyer seems a little early on his attempted push into the covers, gets a thick inside edge down to fine leg
bouncer climbing quickly over middle and leg, Rana ducks to get under it
length ball on off stump, hangs back and punches to the right of deep cover point
back of a length in the corridor, a bit of extra bounce to beat Iyer's outside edge as he gets on his toes and squares up while looking to jab into the point region
extra bounce again, and some late outswing too. Back of a length, slightly wider than the previous ball, and Iyer is beaten again while looking to punch with a diagonal bat
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs with an open face to the right of deep third

appeal for lbw as Malik gets this to nip back and beat Iyer on the leg-side clip. Was on the back foot and it hit the thigh pad, so height was probably an issue, plus it might have been angling down leg as well
he was sitting deep in his crease, expecting the short ball, and gets one that's angling into his body. Uses the pace nicely on the lap shot and finds the gap to the right of fine leg
back of a length outside off, lets it come and steers it to deep third
back of a length, slanting across to finish outside off. Looks to make room and cut but fails to connect. Not short enough for that shot
shot. Jumps out of his crease and away from the stumps to make room, converts a short ball into a length ball that he flat-bats cleanly over the covers
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to deep square leg
slower offcutter finishing around off stump, goes on the back foot and works it to deep midwicket
back of a length, angling away to finish wide of off stump. Reaches out to cut and misses, and the umpire signals wide
shortish offcutter outside off, chopped away to deep backward point
floaty ball angled down the leg side, and Iyer hammers it as it should be, sweeping it firmly and fine of the long leg fielder
flighted ball drifting in towards leg stump, driven inside-out to long-off
fires a length ball across the left-hander and away from off stump. No turn back in, and the ball beats the attempted flat-bat cover drive
slanted across again, quite flat, gets forward and opens his bat face to dab to backward point
poor bowling. Second one outside leg stump, this one to the left-hander, and Rana sweeps fine and to the left of short fine leg

lbw appeal as Rana misses a reverse-sweep. Quickish length ball, I think it pitched outside leg stump. The ball runs away into the short third man region and they sneak a leg bye. Or was there an inside edge as well? No leg-bye signal
back of a length, following Rana's movement away from the stumps to make room. Chopped into the backward point region

awkward. Back of a length, angling into the body, and Iyer is on his toes to work it away. Inside-edges into his thigh pad, and it pops up into the short leg region. The bowler tries to get there in his follow-through but can't manage it
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed down to deep third

Rana's expecting every ball to be short here. He's deep in his crease, stepping across to try and target the fine leg region. Gets a length ball that hits his thigh pad and rolls away for a leg bye. Was angling down leg

zips past the edge again. Iyer made a lot of room to try and target the off side, but this was a quick, shortish ball outside off stump, and he ends up having to reach for the ball, and ends up missing

148.8kph, in the blockhole, and bails fly all over the place. Perfect response to the batter moving all around the crease. Again tried to make room to target the off side, and ended up exposing all his stumps to a fast, straight, full one
Short in length around middle and leg, pulled to deep midwicket for one.
Floated full on middle, a perfect solid forward defence in response.
Jackson went back to one he should have come forward. Arm ball on middle. Does well to get his bat down in time and play it through square leg to get going.
Smart batting. Rana gets forward and turns it through square leg for a brace. No pace on the delivery, so he plays it with soft hands and runs two.

Where did that pitch? SRH are appealing their hearts and throats out for lbw. Was the arm ball, full in length. Rana got down to sweep but missed it and wore it on the front pad. The only question is where did it pitch. Outside leg says the ball-tracker and that's that. A review lost.
Fuller on leg, flicked through square leg for one to retain strike. Just five of the over.
Length ball around off, heaved over midwicket. Lands on the cushion, confirmed after a few replays.
Full on off, driven to mid-off.
Length ball outside off, punched through covers for two.
All wrists that. Length ball outside off, Rana goes deep in the crease and lifts it over covers. The timing is perfect and sweeper stood no chance.
This one is flicked through midwicket for a single.
Jackson misses the length ball and is hit on the pads. A stifled appeal follows. Inside edge, in fact.

A mirror image of Shreyas Iyer! Rana makes room by moving to the leg side early. Gets a length ball and plays the cut, goes over third man. Damages the fridge in the dugout. That was bowled at 149.6kph!
Stands on off does Rana this time. Gets a full ball that he flicks through midwicket. Enough for him to get three.
Back of a length ball outside off, hops and defends it to the off side.
Yorker on middle, almost a low full toss. Patted back to the bowler. Did well to get his bat down in time.
Action Jackson! That's a 140.6 kph length ball slanting in to him. He stands tall and just pulls it nonchalantly over long leg. Looks skywards after that.

And then he goes! Umran comes back in some style. Chest high short ball on off, too quick for Jackson. Goes for the pull and gets a top edge towards fine leg. Seemed as if Natarajan wasn't under it but adjusted well to take it safely with a dive forward. End of Jackson's action.
Length ball angling in, tucked away nicely to fine leg for a single.
Banged in short, Russell ducks.
On a length, clears the front leg to hack it through midwicket for two.
Long boundary or otherwise! Doesn't matter for Dre Russ. Gets a length ball and deposits it over deep midwicket for a 95-metre hit.
Full outside off, Russell steers it through cover-point for a single.
Very full on middle and leg, squeezed down to long-on for a single. End of Jansen tonight, 1/26.
Banged in short outside off, Rana moves towards off and ducks. Looks at square leg for the signal, gets none.

Nice anticipation from Natarajan but Rana is too good for him. Expected Rana to walk across to play the lap and served a full offcutter outside off. But he got enough bat on it and cleared short fine leg despite the chase.
Fuller on off, pushed back to the bowler.
Very full on the pads, whipped through square leg to bring up the 14th half-century for Rana. After 19 innings, says Ian Bishop on air. He's played well thus far.
Fuller on leg, clipped through midwicket for a single.
Very full outside off, squeezed to backward point.
Low full toss on middle and leg, hit straight to midwicket.
Nice shot that. Short ball outside off, Russell makes room and slams it through cover-point. Good effort in the deep keeps it down to two.
Length ball slanting in, Russell misses the slog. Goes past leg stump.
That's serious pace at 146.8 kph. Short and outside off. Makes room early to cut but misses due to the extra bounce. Some battle this.
A bouncer that fell Russell! Short and angling in, he is down on the ground as he ducks belatedly.

Terrific over to sign off by Umran. Another length ball well outside off, Russell makes room to cut it but fails to make contact. Russell is disappointed that he didn't connect; Umran is unhappy that he couldn't add the big wicket.
Rana dances down much before Bhuvneshwar's jump. Gets a full ball on the pads as Bhuvi follows him. Off the pads for a leg bye.
Easy pickings! Bouncer outside off, harmless with Kumar's pace. Russell stays leg side and dinks it over short third man for four.
Sprayed well wide outside off, Russell doesn't bother reaching.
The yorker is always a top bowl, irrespective who the batter is. Kumar nails one on middle and leg, De Russ does well to dig it out. Gives the ball back to the bowler with a thumbs up.
Onto Marine Drive! Length ball outside off, enough width on offer. Russell clears the front leg and thumps it over wide long-on for a 99-metre hit.
Another yorker at 129.9kph, Russell digs it out well again.

Just wide of deep square leg! Full and on the pads, Russell whips it aerially to the on side. Abhishek runs to his left from long leg and puts the dive but it was just out of reach. Lands just short of the boundary cushions.
Aims for the yorker but bowls it full in the slot on off. Rana holds his shape and hits it over the umpire and gets four.

Natarajan gets his man! Or does he? Rana moved away to smash one over the off side as Natarajan spears one full outside off. Seemed to be a sound as he missed and the ball went to the keeper. The keeper and the bowler appealed but the umpire stayed unmoved. Sunrisers take it upstairs and find that there's a spike as the ball passes the bat. Rana has to depart. There was a definite sound in real time too.
Low full toss on the pads, hit aerially towards deep square leg for one.
