That's a gift that Dre Russ is always ready to receive. A juicy full toss on middle, slammed over midwicket for four.
Almost nailed the yorker and also ran the non-striker out. Russell manages to smash it back but it goes off Natarajan's hand past the stumps at the other end for one.
Excellent running. Cummins digs out the yorker towards midwicket and hares for the first. Completes the second too as Natarajan chases the ball and throws it to the keeper off balance.
In the air but lands in the vacant wide long-off region. Was a length ball and Russell gets two.
Very full on the pads, gets an inside edge to the on side for one.
Catching practice for Jansen. Length ball outside off, it was the legcutter. Cummins gets more height than distance. Long-on runs in and completes it easily.
Wow! What a touch! Length ball outside off, reaches out and hits it over extra cover. Has enough for him to get four.
Very full on middle and leg, clipped through square leg for one.
Perfect ball from Bhuvi! Nails the yorker and Russell can only dig it out to midwicket. No chance of a single.

Cleans up Aman Khan! A spinner and his deception skills. Was bowled with the index finger and the thumb, angling in to Aman. He goes for the swipe across the line but misses and loses his leg stump. Russell off-strike still, just what Sunrisers wanted.
Umesh still manages to get a single and get Russell back on strike! Punches it with soft hands towards where short mid-on was. Rahul got to the ball but couldn't gather it. A single results.
Excellent ball. Fuller outside off, slapped straight to long-off. No run.
This has gone the distance. Was almost similar to the ball that got Aman. But Russell deposits it way over deep midwicket.
Not the length he must be bowling. Short again, Russell heaves it over wide long-on for another six.

Poor from Suchith! Fired on the pads, Russell manages to get some bat as the ball goes to the fine leg fence. As far as Suchith and Sunrisers are concerned, it's a win that it didn't go the distance. 17 off the final over.

back of a length outside off, and the outside edge is beaten as Abhishek pushes hesitantly at the ball off the back foot. A defensive shot without a great deal of foot movement, and the angle across beats his edge
back of a length, a touch too straight, tucked off the hip to the left of fine leg, where Varun Chakravarthy makes a tumbling stop
back of a length on off stump, defended towards cover point
back of a length, a bit of shape in towards middle stump to tuck the batter up for room. Clipped watchfully to midwicket
back of a length, angling across into the corridor, shuffles across and dabs to backward point

fullish, angling away from off stump. Doesn't really get forward for the attempted drive through the off side, ends up whipping it almost inadvertently towards mid-on. Doesn't time it, and that allows time for the quick single
back of a length outside off, goes hard at the cut and bottom-edges it towards the keeper, on the bounce
looks to cut again, and this time the round-the-wicket angle cramps him for room. Chops it down into the pitch off the inner half of the bat

now he's beaten on the outside edge. Just stands there and looks to slash through the off side as Cummins goes back of a length again, and this time the ball straightens off the seam and leaves the left-hander just a touch

not the greatest over of Abhishek Sharma's career. Back of a length again, a little closer to off stump, and Abhishek looks for the pull, once again without moving his feet a great deal. Ends up bottom-edging into his stumps
short of a length again, angling in to try and tuck Tripathi up, but ends up slanting it down leg, past the attempted flick

looks to shuffle across premeditatedly and play the lap over his shoulder to fine leg. Judges the line okay, but it's short of a length outside off, and the bounce ends up undoing his plans. Ends up getting some part of his bat onto it and it rolls gently into the leg side for one

and he splits the two fielders, unintentionally. Length ball close to off stump, rising steeply. Makes a late decision to leave alone, and leaves a bit of bat in the way. Deflection perfectly bisects slip and gully
a touch too full, a touch too straight, and Tripathi, who's already shuffled across his stumps, flicks wristily and beats fine leg easily to his left
length ball tight on off stump, hops to ride the bounce and dabs with soft hands into the point region
nicely bowled. Back of a length, nips back in from outside off, and Williamson, trying to adjust with a hurried flick, is beaten and hit on the flap of the pad

back of a length on off stump, looks for the quick single worked into the leg side, but he's played it too close to the right hand of midwicket. Nearly a mix-up, but Tripathi - who hared out of his crease - is sent back in time
back of a length on off stump, keeps a touch low, gets back and across to defend and manages to keep it out with a judiciously straight bat
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come and dabs it wide of that wide second slip, out to deep third
length ball angling in to leg stump, stays deep in his crease and pushes with soft hands towards mid-on

shot. Tripathi will go for anything in his hitting zones, and this is definitely one of them. A touch too full outside off stump, and he gets a good stride into the ball to loft with a high left elbow over the covers

back of a length, angling in towards off stump from wide of the crease. Nips back a touch too. Tripathi was looking to stay leg-side of the ball and dab towards point, and he ends up cramped for room. Dabs it into the ground by his feet, and the ball nearly rolls into his stumps. Ends up rolling past leg stump and they pick up a quick single
length ball on off stump, defended compactly back towards the bowler

bouncer, and it climbs steeply and leaves Sheldon Jackson with too much to do. Bounced well over head height for the batter too, and Williamson just ducks out of the way. Jackson's jumping up with arms at full stretch, but the ball eludes his gloves
length ball on off stump, stays on the back foot and defends towards extra-cover

back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and dabs with soft hands into the cover point region. Quick call from Tripathi and they steal a quick single. Tripathi is at full stretch to beat the underarm flick, but he would have been home even if there had been a direct hit at the keeper's end

did this keep a bit low? Maybe. Plays back to a length ball on off stump, and defends with soft hands into the pitch. Umesh has to rush to the ball in his follow-through to try and stop the quick single, but he can't manage it. That single brings up 2000 IPL runs for Williamson
back of a length, tight on middle and off. No room for Tripathi, who rides the bounce and defends with soft hands into the gully region

shot. Short ball on off stump, and Williamson was hanging back already, back foot deep in his crease. All he does is unweight the front foot and swivel on his back foot to pull with authority to the square leg boundary
sashays out of his crease this time, and Umesh hits the pitch hard with a hard-length ball that nips in from outside off. Williamson looks to jab through the covers, ends up beaten on the inside edge
back of a length outside off, looks for a pushed single between cover point and extra-cover, but the latter fielder moves quickly to the ball and cuts it off
short and wide, and the ball seems to veer away - Umesh delivered with a pretty low arm - and go past the wide line outside off, even as Williamson tried to reach out and slash it away
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and dabs to deep third

well played. Starts with a short ball dug into the pitch just outside off. He's challenging Williamson to pull that, because the ball gets up to a decent height, but Williamson sees it early and hits it nicely over wide mid-on

got him, Russell's hard lengths produce the big wicket. 139.3kph. Back of a length this time, not as short as the previous ball, though the line is similar, and it seemed to come in off the deck like an offcutter. Williamson looks to pull again, and only succeeds in inside-edging into his stumps. Both openers have played on while looking to pull
greets him with a sharp bouncer over off stump, and Markram ducks his upper body under it. Russell falls over in his follow-through, but he looks okay
back of a length outside off, plays a trademark Markram punch with both feet in the air, but doesn't quite middle it, only managing a single to the left of mid-off

bam. That seemed to cramp him for room, but he created some room for his arms with quick footwork. Short, angling into the midriff, and he swivels on his back foot to pull over backward square leg and gets it to carry all the way
short again, up at chest height over off stump. A little late on the pull this time, off the high part of the bat and towards midwicket on the bounce
low full-toss on off stump, driven down to long-on
slower ball on off stump, fullish, but not quite in the slot for the attacking shot. Tripathi spots it a touch late, and defends to extra-cover
unlucky. Short ball outside off, gets some extra bounce, and Tripathi, throwing everything into a pull, gets a top-edge that flies high over the keeper
back of a length outside off, another slower ball, I think. Opens his bat face and steers to deep third
length ball angling into middle stump, stays leg-side of the ball and punches to the right of extra-cover
short and wide, and Tripathi puts it away easily. Back and across early to establish a stable base, and from there an effortless uppercut all the way over the backward point boundary
length ball angling into middle stump, not a lot of turn either way, clipped to the right of midwicket

lovely shot. Tripathi is one of the best exponents of this shot in the IPL, I think. What distinguishes him is the length of his front-foot stride. Full stretch out to get close to a length ball outside off and loft it cleanly over extra-cover. Long-off, haring to his left, can't get to it in time

even better! Wrong'un dangled wide of off, inviting the drive over extra-cover, and again the big stride forward gets him close to the pitch, allows him to hit against the turn comfortably and clear the rope to the left of long-off

wow, this is some over, but you'll have to question Varun's wisdom of bowling three successive balls in the same sort of area. Stretches right out and lofts it with a straight, straight bat over wide long-off
quicker, flatter, back of a length wrong'un finishing around off stump. Hangs back and dabs to the right of short third
length ball wide of off stump, reaches out and stabs to extra-cover
back of a length, turns in towards leg stump, goes back and works it to deep square leg
back of a length offbreak finishing around off stump, jumps back and makes room to punch to sweeper cover
length ball just outside off, another offbreak, stretches out and dabs with soft hands towards backward point
quick length ball on off stump, gets forward and clips into the short midwicket region. No one in the circle there, so the keeper and bowler give chase
nice change of pace, maybe the quickest ball of the over. Back of a length outside off, beats Markram who looks to make room to cut and ends up with very little time to play the shot
slower offbreak, turning from off to middle, gets forward and clips to long-on
good ball, quick wrong'un finishing around middle and off. Plays back even though it's quite full, because it's delivered quick. Punched to long-off
back of a length finishing on middle stump, goes back and works it to long-on
wham. Still flat, but a touch too full again from Varun, angling into the stumps. Clears his front leg and absolutely muscles him over wide long-on
too full again, and there's width outside off stump too. Another wrong'un, but it doesn't matter, as Markram frees his arms and flat-bats it hard to elude the extra-cover fielder leaping to his right
full and flat on middle stump, whipped to deep midwicket

back of a length outside off, and Tripathi leans back, waits, and steers to the left of sweeper cover to bring up an outstanding half-century. He's been an absolute intent monster today, and his footwork has given the bowler's very little margin for room with length
wow. Now Tripathi's long front-foot stride gets to work against Narine. Length ball, offbreak, pitching just outside off, and he stretches out and slog-sweeps high over long-on
quicker, close to off stump, leans back and dabs to short third
length ball turning down leg, tucked to the left of short fine leg
length ball on the pads, clipped to long leg
flat offbreak on the pads, worked away towards deep midwicket, and they scurry through for two with the fielder having to run in quite a way off the boundary
quick length ball on off stump, stretches out and dabs towards backward point
Length ball on off, pushed off the back foot to covers.
Short and angling down leg, Markram doesn't connect the pull properly and throws his head back in disappointment. Gets a single to fine leg though.
Shot! Full and on middle and leg, driven nicely to long-on for one.
Markram is an attractive stroke-player. Drives this to mid-off, who stops it with a slide. Just a run.
Back of a length ball around off and middle. Rahul wanted to tap it and run but ended hitting it well towards covers.
Short again, pulled on the bounce to fine leg for one.
Fuller outside off, Tripathi wrists it through midwicket and takes two.
A touch short, Tripathi nudges it straight to short fine leg.
Fuller and down leg, scoops it straight to short fine leg again.
Straighter outside off, punched to long-off for one.
Flatter outside off, cut off the toe end towards backward point.
A touch short, chopped towards cover-point for a quick one.
Speared full outside off, Markram gets it off the inside edge to fine leg as he goes for the drive to the off side.
Back of a length outside off, chopped to backward point.
Short ball at a slower pace, pulled to fine leg off the inner half for one.

Just out of Jackson's reach! Perfect bumper around off and middle, got high on Markram going for the pull. Ended up taking the glove and just past Jackson's left. Also beat Finch running to his right from long leg.
Much in command this time, Markram. Length ball outside off, he stands tall and slaps it through covers for four.
That's crisply timed as well. Sounded too good. Fuller this time from Umesh, just punched it through covers and easily beat sweeper to his right. Suddenly the momentum's back with the Sunrisers.
Welcome to the bowling crease, says Tripathi to his former team-mate with a six. Length ball on the hips, he stays put and whip-flicks it over deep square leg.

Russell gets back at him in the tamest manner possible. Off-pace offcutter on a length around off. Tripathi stands tall and pulls it straight to Venkatesh at long-on. Tripathi cannot believe what he has done and has a lot of stern words with himself as he trudges back. Lots of gestures involved too. End of the 94-run partnership with that.
Back of a length outside off, Pooran hops and punches it to covers, where Narine makes a diving stop.
Length ball slanting away, Pooran has a swish and a miss. Russell not happy with the wide call.
Short ball on the hips, tucked to fine leg for one.
On a length on middle, placed through midwicket for one.

Russell cannot believe what he's seen. Throws his head back in disgust. Offcutter on a length outside off, Pooran is through his heave early and misses. Jackson gets a bad bounce, though, and lets it through his leg for four byes.
Flatter and quicker on middle, pulled to deep square leg for one.
Flatter on a length, angling away, scooped to fine leg for one.
This is streaky. Quicker one on a flatter trajectory outside off, Markram goes back and reaches out to cut. Gets a bottom edge through Jackson's leg again for four.
This is a hit-me ball and Markram obliges. Half-tracker outside off, he goes back and puts it over the deep midwicket rope.
Quicker one on a length outside off, slapped through cover for one.
On a length this time around leg, pushed back to the bowler.
Length ball outside off, slapped to sweeper for one.
Slower through the air on off, punched down to long-on for one.
Punched straight to cover-point off the back foot.
Fuller on middle, pushed to long-on to bring up his second half century this season.

That was self-harming by Pooran. Pushed it towards the left of the bowler and wanted a run, thinking it went to long-on. But Narine got to the ball and had a shy at the bowler's end but missed and Pooran was nowhere in the frame. Lucky escape.
Driven to sweeper for another single. No wicket for Narine tonight.
Length ball around off, pushed down to long-on for one.
On a length on off, pushes it towards mid-off with soft hands and hares to the other end.
Full on middle, heaved through midwicket for four. Markram is stepping it up now.
This is even better! Angling in on a length, Markram throws his weight on the back foot and coming forward and hits it over deep midwicket for half a dozen.
Finishes it off in style does Markram! Banged in short around off, he pulls it way over deep backward square leg to help Sunrisers win by seven wickets.
and he starts with a fullie on the pads. Just the ball Wade would have wanted. Clips it away for four through square leg
on a length, just outside off, driven to mid-off
fuller now, straighter too, driven to mid-on this time
another full toss. Wade must be loving this. This one also gives him width. Wade square-drives it in front of point for four more
short of a length, some width, Wade punches it square on the off side, but finds cover-point
short, wide. A pretty ordinary start. To Wade this must be like an oasis in a desert. He has cut this away through point for four more. Twelve runs without breaking a sweat
hard length, outside off, Gill looks to pull, ends up playing this to mid-on

oh Wade's gifts have dried up. That oasis was a mirage. RR have stung him in the second over. Gill walks at Krishna, who bowls the hard length again. Gill drops and runs, Wade responds. Rassie van der Dussen swoops in from cover, and runs down the wicket at the striker's end. Direct hit. Caught short
short of a length, no room, soft hands, but this time they don't try any quick single
same length, same line, defensive response
dug in slightly shorter, he goes back and runs this down to third man for one
Gill looking for the pull again but Krishna is not short enough to pull. The bottom edge goes to square leg
starts off with a full ball, just outside off, pushed wide of mid-off for one
short of a length, slight shape back in, runs off the inside edge for one
nip back in from short of a length, goes past the inside edge as he pushes just outside off
on a length, wicket to wicket, defended off the back foot
short, wide, nip away, and and he gets a wicket off what is not his best delivery. Shankar cuts hard but it is too far from him, and manages only an edge through to the keeper
full, wicket to wicket, punched hard down the ground, just to the right of mid-on. Krishna makes a diving save, but can't prevent the single
full, really full, outside leg. Pandya makes room to drive him to mid-off for one
nice drift, middle and leg, worked into the leg side for one
legbreak on a length, turning away from around off, pushed to long-off for one
slider, it skids on from a length, Gill has to hurry up to get his pad out of the way and the bat down
slower in the air, legbreak this time, defended off the front foot. Not the driving length
jumps out of the crease, Chahal shortens the length, Gill pushes this to long-off for a single
hit hard and just marginally to the left of mid-off. Sets off immediately, and makes the single
slapped back. This is short of a length, has a bit of width, and Pandya plays a forehand down the line, between the bowler and mid-off. This is hit hard
upper cut. Short, wide, and Pandya doesn't repeat Shankar's mistake of trying to play the traditional cut. He goes up and over. This is the Pandya we want to see
no-look drive. Looking to go over mid-off, trying to maximise the power by keeping his head down. Takes an outside edge and goes fine of third man
wide length ball, he goes hard at this one too, but hits it straight to mid-off
shuffles across the way he used to do at the death, waiting to go big, but Sen doesn't give him the length. Pandya pushes at it, gets an outside edge for a single to third man
short of a length, no room, Pandya respects the hard length
full, right up there, nearly a yorker, dug out back to Kirshna
another near yorker, this time he opens the face on it for a single to third man
short of a length, into the body, tucked away for a single to deep square leg
on a length, hits the inner part of the bat. Also the higher part. They get a single, though
high full toss, just above the waist, Gill is cramped up, is not able to hit, but this is a no-ball
Krishna goes for the yorker, misses the length, and Gill drives this half-volley through cover for four
and Pandya says he is not bothered about Parag. Smashes the first ball over long-on. Flat low six
whips this into the leg. side, gets a single to deep midwicket
Parag drags this short, and Gill has got a move on now. Pulls this through square leg for four more

oh Parag has got a wicket. Gill a touch too greedy? He doesn't pick the carrom ball, and looks to go over long-on. It is wide outside off, and holds its line because of the finger flick on it. Gill doesn't time it perfectly, and he finds long-on
googly this time, from the back of the hand, hits his pad, but headed down the leg side
again into the pads, worked into the leg side for one
on a length, outside off, single to deep point
slower short ball, Pandya ramps it to third man for one
short of a length, no room, defended back to him
on a length, just outside off, runs off the thick outside edge for one to third man
yorker, maybe just short of one, dug out towards deep midwicket for one
that spoils a good over. Neesham spot on with his in-between length just outside off. Manohar pushes at it, gets a thin outside edge but thick enough to go wide of the keeper. Gets four for it
nice dip on this, Pandya is not close to its length so he pushes this to long-off
carrom ball, drops it a little short, but he has protection for the pull. Just the single
looks like a carrom ball, Ashwin will not be happy with the width he has provided. Cut away past point for two
again a carom ball, pushed to the right of Ashwin. The non-striker is in his way so he can't field cleanly. They get the single. Manohar takes the single. Something Ashwin will approve of
carrom ball, dipping on him, defended back to him
lovely length again. Can't drive, can't pull, there is no room. Defended back to him
a touch too full, Pandya gets the drive in, Chahal gets a hand on it, but they get a single
goes inside-out but doesn't make a good connection. It falls just short of the charging deep cover
nice drift into the pads, Pandya looks to paddle-sweep, gets a front edge back to Chahal. Right off the cue
nice drift again, worked into the leg side for a single
goes wide as he does time to time. Punched away to deep cover for one
stays on the leg stump for Pandya. Worked into the leg side for another single
slightly short of a length, no room, punched down to wide long-on for one

carrom ball, past the edge, is he stumped? Lovely dip on it again, he in nowhere close to the length of it. That he is beaten in the air means the slight turn on the carrom ball is enough to beat the bat. His back foot gets dragged out of the crease but he pushes it back in before Samson breaks the wicket. He bats on
wide on the crease, carrom ball again, beats him outside off again. Manohar is thinking too much about the ball that will come back in
wide on the crease again and ends up pushing this too far into the pads. Not enough turn on the carrom ball to bother him. He plays this over short fine leg for four
corrects the line, stays on a length, and Manohar drops this into the covers for a single
cramps up Pandya, hits his pad, but it is clearly headed down the leg side
short of a length, no room, pushed into the covers for one

big swing of the bat, powerful connection, hits this wide of long-on, Buttler puts in a dive, keeps the ball in, but it hits his left hand as he recovers. So he has to go back to pick it up and in the process he flicks the boundary skirting with the ball in his hand
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover for one
slower legcutter, but gives him the width. He opens the face on it, and ends up slicing it over point for two
wide length ball, runs off the inner half of the bat for a single to deep midwicket
full toss, thigh high, punched to mid-off
Manohar opens up. Just a slight shimmy down the wicket to get close to the pitch of the ball, and lofts him back over his head. Dead straight

Chahal does what he usually does when under the pump: go wide. Manohar anticipates it, and plays a lovely extra-cover drive in the air and clears the field with ease. Just a touch too full from Chahal
wrong'un. Manohar plays it off the pitch but does well to open the face on it and take a single
stays on the leg stump for Pandya, who drops this into the leg side for one
wide length ball, punched to deep cover for one
fullish, on the leg stump, turning towards off, punched to long-off for one
smashed down the ground. Long-on stands no chance here. This is a length ball, Pandya clears the front leg and just wallops it
good comeback from Sen. Short of a length, beats Pandya who is moving across and deep into his crease just like he does in the death overs
high bat speed again. This is a wide length ball, and he hits it hard and to the left of point. This is not a cut. Just opens the face on the square drive. Brings up his fifty
wow that is not a wide? Samson has to go full length above his head to collect it. But it is the perfect bouncer as it has gone head high for the batter and then kept climbing
hard length, no room, pushed down to long-on for one
slashed away. Sen has been guilty of providing width this over. Also short of a length. Manohar throws his hands at it with an open face, and beats the man at point
on a length, on off, pushed to cover. Doesn't let him get under it
goes wide of long-off but can't find the boundary

dropped by Padikkal at deep midwicket. Ashwin looking to cramp Pandya up, but he finally has a go at him. Padikkal is right at the edge of the deep midwicket boundary, and this is going over his head. He gets both his hands to it, but is about to go over so he is getting ready to throw it up but the ball slips out of his hands
oh that is too short, and Pandya pulls this over deep midwicket for six. A rare loose ball from Ashwin
back of a length, no room, pulled to deep midwicket along the ground
carrom full, full, on off, driven to long-on for one
goes wide as he does when batters are going after him. Drags it too wide. Called
into the pads now, cramps him up, hits the pad. Rare dot
back to the wide like, also slow in the air, Manohar looks for the big hit, cue-ends it into the covers for one
short of a length, wicket to wicket, punched to long-off

that is some shot. Chahal has gone slow in the air and wide again, but Manohar has managed to drag this across into the leg side and got enough on the slog-sweep to clear deep midwicket. Against the turn, mind

looks for a repeat dose, but Chahal is too clever for that. He pulls the length back, bowls quicker, and on the leg stump. Big top edge from Manohar, skies it, and Ashwin takes the difficult catch calmly at short fine leg
sharp legbreak, just outside off, defended
follows him as he backs away
looks to go wide this time as Pandya is backing away, but ends up bowling too wide
punched hard to deep midwicket for two
ha ha ha, Pandya sees this down the leg side and leaves it alone for a wide, but the carrom ball turns back in to hit him in the bum
driven hard to long-on for one
slides in as Miller goes back to a full ball. Hit on the pad but the angle is taking it down the leg side
slower in the air, offbreak this time, pushed into the leg side but not timed perfectly. That gives him time to come back for two
looking for the wide yorker, Pandya is already across and deep in the crease. He misses the length a touch, and Pandya has driven this through extra cover for four
wide length ball, and he has a fielder for that ball. Punched straight to deep extra cover for one
and he goes wide yorker, Miller tries to drive but is beaten. Ends up playing inside the line
big slower ball, just 99ks, completely does Miller in, and it rolls along the ground to Samson
slower short ball, on the leg-stump line, 111ks, and this one he doesn't have a field for. Miller pulls this to deep square for four. Bluff gone wrong, I think
looks for the wide yorker, but misses both his line and length. Ends up with a half-volley not wide enough of his reach. Miller drill this straight and over mid-off for four
low full toss outside off, hit straight to deep cover for one
goes for the wide yorker, but ends up with a fullie, and the third man is in. Miller is looking to open the face but also gets a thick edge to beat that short third man
that's pressure. In the slot, not wide of his reach, and Miller tucks into this every day of the week. Goes over wide long-on for a massive six
short of a length, wide outside off, punched in front of deep cover and comes back for two
goes wide again, but misses the yorker length. Right in the slot again, and he goes over extra cover this time
misses the length again. Low wide full toss, and all Miller has to do is open the face and use his pace. Goes over point for four more
gets the length right but the line is too wide. Called
another wide yorker, Pandya tries his best to reach it but can't. The umpire says Pandya has shuffled across so he doesn't call it
and misses the length this time. Low full toss, wide outside off, and Pandya slices it up and over point for a six. He is the highest run-getter in this IPL now
nails the wide yorker, Pandya digs it out for a single
length ball, angling in, Miller stays leg side of it to look to go over cover, but is beaten by the pace
low full toss, hit down to long-on for one. Buttler's orange cap comes off as he charges in to keep them down to one. Which is just as well as it belongs to Pandya for now
not quite the yorker but a low wide full toss, which should be good enough, but Pandya swings hard at it and gets a thick outside edge for four. The third man is up inside the circle
There's a sound as the ball passes Buttler's flick down leg. Titans review! Wade was quite sure and urged them to go upstairs. But Snicko shows a spike when the ball makes contact with the pad.
No half measures. Shami spears it full outside off, expecting the swing. Ends up overpitched and Buttler just times it through covers.
Overcorrections, pays the price. Length ball on the pads, Buttler walks to the off side and flicks it through square leg for another four.
Four balls and Buttler is the leading run-getter again! Very full on middle and leg, clipped through midwicket with ease.
Fuller around off, hit back.
Length ball around off, tapped to the on side for a quick one. Fine start to the chase.
Not the best of starts. A gift to Buttler, who doesn't actually need one. Length ball on the pads, ticked fine on the leg side for another four.
Shortens his length, across the batter. Mistimed towards cover-point.
Stand and deliver! Buttler's got off like cars on F1 track. Length ball angling away, hops a touch and punches it through covers. Bounced well over the tumbling fielder at short cover.
Audacious! Walks across the track to the full ball with fine leg inside the ring. Ramps it high and well over fine leg for half a dozen.
Pulled away to deep square leg for just one. 28 off 11 already, Buttler.

And finds slip without fuss! Length ball outside off, gets good bounce due to his height. Padikkal goes for the punch, cramped for room. Gets a thick outside edge to Gill, who times his leap perfectly. A but of mirror image to the Vijay Shankar dismissal in the first innings. Early IPL success for Dayal.
Buttler tries to play the ramp yet again. Length ball from Shami. Misses it, passes just past the leg stump. Rightly not called wide.
Short in length, pulled powerfully to deep square leg for one.
Length ball on middle, times the clip to midwicket. Only the second non-Joss ball this.
Thick outside edge lands well short of third man! Was a back of the length ball that Ashwin tried to heave. Ferguson ran in from the deep but it fell well short. Intentions clear.
On a length outside off, chopped towards backward point for one.
Short in length and angling in, tries to be cute and guides it straight to short third. Either side of that fielder and it could have been the desired result. Good over from Shami.
What's with Jos the boss and his timing today! Another length ball on the sixth stump line, transfers his weight back quickly and punches it through covers. Exquisite!
Gets away! Short ball, hurries Buttler up with the pull. Hits him high on the bat and lands short of mid-on.
Plays tennis with a cricket bat, Jos! Short ball again, clears his front leg and thumps it over midwicket a la a tennis forehand.
Another ball please! Buttler's on a rampage. Stands in readiness for another bouncer. Gets a short ball at a comfortable height. Smashes it wayyy over deep midwicket. 44 off just 18 balls.
Fuller around off and middle, hit straight to midwicket.
Creamed away! The beauty about Buttler is that it isn't always about power with him. Gets an overpitched ball well outside off, just times the cover-drive to perfection.
Quicker one around off, slapped to cover.
If not Buttler, Ashwin will get you. Tossed up ball on off, Ashwin just hits him straight over his head for six.
Streaky. Gets an inside edge off the googly straight to short fine. Just past leg stump.
Another googly on a length, worked away to square leg for a single.
Tossed up full on off, defended back to the bowler.

Lbw? Not given! Wade thinks it turned too far but Hardik reviews. Buttler went back to play the googly but missed it completely. Struck him on the front pad that was on leg. Clipping the stumps and Buttler is saved. Rashid is not pleased.

Stunning catch by Miller and Ashwin's stay ends. Full ball outside off, Ashwin is deep in his crease. Looks to smash it through covers but finds Miller at short cover, who dives low to his left and pouches it safely.
On a length around middle, worked away to the man in front of square on the leg side.
Nicely timed to get going. Full and outside off, driven through covers for a brace.
On a length just outside off, steered to third man for one.
23-ball half-century for Jos Buttler! What a start this has been. Moves across to play the scoop yet again. Ferguson's extra pace helps it carry over fine leg.

Timberrrr! Killer blow from Ferguson. Yorker at 126 clicks, the legcutter. He roars as Buttler's blitz ends. Such a contrast to the previous delivery that was north of 146 clicks. Buttler had no clue against it, misses digging it out and trudges back ten times slower than his knock. How big a blow is this for Rajasthan?
Slower through the air, on a length, Samson goes back and punches it to long-on for one.
Shorter but slower, Rassie is through his pull early, gets it off the toe end towards short fine for one.
Samson is a clean-striker of the cricket ball. And this is another proof. Tossed up around middle and leg, he clears his front leg and sends it soaring over deep midwicket.
Fuller on off, driven straight back.
Flatter outside off, mistimes his chop towards point. Tewatia has kept it quiet so far.
Well bowled. Lands it fuller around off and middle, worked towards long-on for one more. Good over despite the six.
Full outside off, driven to covers.
Length ball at 146.1kph, pushed to point again.

Bull's eye from Hardik Pandya! Gujarat are on the money. Samson was nowehere in the frame. Pushes the quick, full ball straight to mid-off and takes him on. Wasn't on the front foot and took that extra millisecond to take a start. Costs him. Rajasthan in deep waters now.
Fuller on off and middle, flicked to midwicket.
Back of a length outside off, glided to third man for one.
Fuller outside off, driven through covers for a single. End of a lonngg over.
Flatter around middle, flicked to midwicket.
A touch shorter outside off, goes back and slaps it through covers. Excellent running and they run three. Wanted a fourth after Rashid missed the stumps at his end with the flick.
Well bowled. Tossed up wrong'un around middle, worked fine to short fine leg.
Flatter and quicker wrong'un. Misses the flick and goes off his pads for one.
Quicker one on the pad, from outside leg, easily clipped through short fine leg for a brace.
Fuller around middle, pushed to mid-on.
Short ball to start, swats the pull straight to deep square leg for one.
Fuller on leg and middle, pushed back to the bowler.
Slower length ball, offcutter. Guides it off the outer edge to third man for one.
Banged in short at 137 clicks. Misses the pull and given wide. A wry smile from Pandya.
Offcutter on a length, whips it through square leg for one more.
Bouncer, pulled to deep square leg for another one.
Fuller outside off, not much pace. Works it away through midwicket and hares back for two.
Very full on the pads, misses the flick and takes the leg-bye.

Can't keep Hardik out of the game. Another direct hit, another referral. Hetmyer just makes it in. Was a slower one outside off, van der Dussen pushes it to mid-off. Hetmyer was wandering out but made it in.

Nicked behind! Van der Dussen has to walk back now. Fuller and outside off, angling away from over the wicket. No footwork from the batter and all he manages is a thin edge behind. Royals falling apart...
Length ball angling away, Parag is squared up but opens the face of his bat. Plays it fine enough to beat third man to his left.
Full and outside off, driven to cover, where Jayant makes a half-stop.
Bouncer at 135.5 kph. Parag hops and keeps it down.
Length ball around leg, worked away through midwicket for one.
Length ball on middle, flicked to midwicket.
Fuller ball, slow in pace. 126.6 kph. Pushed back to the bowler.
Length ball around off, chopped to the off side for a single.

Walloped! Offcutter banged short in length, Hetmyer pulls but doesn't make the cleanest of contacts. But there's no one at deep midwicket and he gets four. Hardik high-fives Hetmyer for reading the change of pace, perhaps.
Another bumper, but well outside off. Hetmyer was early into the pull and missed it.
Length ball angling away, at 134.8 kph. Slapped through cover-point for one to retain strike.
Length ball angling in, hacked towards wide long-on for a couple.
Dismissed from his presence. Short ball climbing at a comfortable height. Hetmyer pulls it way over deep midwicket and straight at the platform of the car.
Tough chance, goes down. Slaps the length ball towards mid-off, where Hardik leaps but fails to hang on. Such is the power that it goes away to the straight boundary
Full on leg and middle, heaved to square leg for a couple.

Toe-ender finds long-on! End of the Hetmyer show. It was a length ball angling in, he looks to go over long-on but fails to get the distance. He was tired as well and has a look at the bottom of his bat.
Fuller on middle and leg, flicked through midwicket for a couple.
Fuller on middle, played back from the crease.
Fuller but Neesham goes back and works him away through midwicket for one.
Quicker wrong'un on a length, worked fine on the leg side for a quick one.
Full on the pads, nudged through midwicket for one.
Short one but hurries Parag. Goes back and pulls it to deep midwicket.
Gets down and fetches the sweep from outside off through backward square leg for one. Just five singles.
Full on off, drilled down to long-on for one.
Full and in the slot, heaved through midwicket for two.
Yorker on middle and leg, dug out to long-on for one.
Very full, almost a yorker on middle. Chipped over the bowler for another run.
Another yorker, this time on off. Dug out over the bowler for another one.
Full outside off, looks to smash it but gets it off the inner half through in front of square on the leg side for a couple.
Sweet as! Full and angling in, Parag whips it high and long over deep midwicket. 141 clicks and that helped too.
Back of a length on off, goes back to cut but misses.
Very full on off, pushed to mid-off and takes a run. Rashid misses the shy.
Back of a length on the pads, worked away through square leg for one.
Slower full ball outside off, hit back to the bowler. Was another legcutter.

Holed out to deep midwicket but was it over waist high? They are having a check. Was a high full toss that Parag failed to get under. Replays show that it was alright. He was slightly crouched and yet it wasn't above waist. Parag is not happy but he has to walk back.
Quicker googly, no clue for Neesham. Misses it completely.
"Caaatch!" screams Wade as Neesham flays the short ball towards deep midwicket. Goes on the bounce to Shami.
Wrong'un on a length, plays it off the inner half to the on side. They think of a run before settling against it.
The legspinner now outside off, worked through point for one. "I thought you'd bowl the wrong'un mate," says Wade.
Full and in the slot, finds the gap between long-on and deep midwicket with the flick. It was very full and Rashid knew as soon as he bowled that.
A touch short, cut towards backward point for one. End of Rashid for tonight.
Slower one on a length, not much pace. So Neesham can work it away through square leg and take two.

Hardik bats, Hardik bowls, Hardik fields and Hardik catches it off his bowling too! It's his night tonight. Slower offcutter. Neesham looks to go across the line but ends up getting a top edge. Easy catch for Pandya moving towards mid-off.
Short in length, hits high on Chahal's bat as he looks to heave it. Just clears Gill at midwicket for one.
Length ball outside off, Prasidh has a swing and a miss.
Length ball, swatted down to long-on for one.
Chahal walks across to play the ramp and Vijay sprays it wider. Misses, not called wide.
Pushed through cover-point for one.
Chahal had no clue about the pace. Misses it completely.
Length ball on the pads, tucked to fine leg for one.
Banged in short, looks to sway back and ramp but misses.
On a length angling in, pushes it towards point for one.
Full toss on off, hit through cover-point for another single.
Length ball outside off, Chahal has a swing but only connects with thin air.
Chahal hits it in the air but in no man's land at deep midwicket. Gets a couple.
Slower delivery from Dayal, Chahal is early into the shot. It was bowled back of the hand. All he manages is to get it in the air towards point, where Vijay runs in and pouches it.
On a length outside off, massive swing and a miss.
Slower and full outside off, Kuldeep has another go but misses.

Bumper to end the game! A half-hearted appeal for caught-behind. Not given and they review. Dayal wants a fourth. Ball nowhere near the edge of the bat. Kuldeep looked to pull but then ducked. Nonetheless it's a 37-run win for Titans to go atop the points table.
super intent from PBKS. If there is width on the first, the first ball shall go. Cut away by Agarwal in front of backward point. Poor start from Thampi. Short and wide
wide still but fuller, and Agarwal lets it go
short and wide again. Okay not very short, but short enough for Agarwal to just use the pace of it with a late-cut even though he is on the move. Finds the gap between backward point and cover-point
shortish, widish again, and this time it will be just the single to deep point
better to the left-hand batter. On a length, shaping back in towards top of off. Defended with an open face
off the thigh pad as he tucks him up. They get a leg-bye
what a welcome to the bowling crease. Skips down the wicket, gets close to it, and extends his arms through it. Goes over mid-off for a flat six. Sensational caress
yorker, on middle and leg, dug out for one to the leg side
cramps him up with one short of a length and pretty straight. Agarwal can't do much with that
good line again. At the hips. Unadkat knows he can't afford to give Agarwal any width with nobody outside the circle on the off side. Another dot
slower offcutter, starts outside leg, ends up at off. Agarwal opens the face, but can't find the gap on the off side

gets a slight bit of width, Agarwal looks to open the face and thread the gap between short third man and backward point. Fails to do so. A good comeback from Unadkat after a six first ball. Just seven off
ordinary start. Well outside leg with fine leg up. Dhawan manages to glance it fine of the man for four. A rare gift from Bumrah. But it has been called leg-byes
excellent take from Kishan. Dhawan is down the wicket, Bumrah digs it in, but the line is outside leg again, and Kishan has to dive to his right full length to save four extras
again down the leg side, big wide again. Dhawan wants a tickle on it, but fails to get a touch on it. Kishan dives again to save four extras
yorker, middle and leg, dug out to square leg for one
better line against the right-hand better. Agarwal opens the face for a single to third man
dug in short, just outside off, Dhawan looks to ramp it over Kishan, but makes no connection
down the wicket, takes this on the full, clips it to deep square leg for one

driven on the up, and in the air. This is not a half-volley by any means. Agarwal just goes hard at this wide length ball, and manages to clear cover-point. Replays show it is catchable but M Ashwin is late in the attempt to get his hands up
on a length, at the stumps, dropped into the leg side for one
Agarwal looks to give him the charge and make room but has been done in by a slower one from Unadkat
again a slower one but this is outside leg, and Agarwal clips it past short fine leg for two
big back lift, looking for a big drive, but he is cramped up again. Pushes this towards mid-off for a quick single
on a length, angling across hi, Dhawan stays back to run it down but can;'t beat short third man
down the wicket, Unadkat counters it with a slower short ball, Dhawan adjusts and manages to upper-cut it over cover. Not enough pace on the ball to take it to the fence, though
on a length, middle and leg, no turn, Agarwal clears the front leg to push this wide of mid-off for one
down the wicket, gets too close to the pitch of the ball, pushes it along the ground to long-on for one
a matter of time if you bowl spin to Agarwal inside the powerplay. Stays leg side of this by clearing the froint leg and square-drives it between point and cover-point
more emphatic this time by skipping down the track and lofting him over mid-on

mid-off is back but it doesn't matter to Agarwal. Lovely shot. This is just an off-drive in the air. Clears the front leg again, and then reaches out because he is not very close to the pitch of the ball. Still manages to clear long-off. Lovely, clean swing of the bat
looks for another big into the off side, but Ashwin bowls it full enough to not let him get under it. Just the single into the covers
short ball, on the leg stump, pulled to long leg for one
slower short ball, but enough time for Dhawan to adjust to it and then upper-cut it over cover. Makes it look easy
short again, but a wide down the leg side
on-pace this time, and Dhawan looks to use the pace by opening the face on it. A touch late on the shot, and is beaten
on a length, into the pads, worked to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, well down the leg side, Agarwal fails to get a touch on it
short of a length, wide, Agarwal opens the face on it, beats short third man to his right, and also deep point to his left
yorker, squeezes it under his bat
on a length, middle and leg, worked around the corner for one
drifting into the pads, Agarwal is beaten on the sweep. They still get a leg-bye
full, on the pads, whipped into leg side, but can't get past deep backward square leg
long hop but comes slowly off the surface, and Agarwal has to adjust to it and has to settle for the single to long-on
full, outside leg, beaten on the sweep, but they get a leg-bye
no room, good length, draws a rare dot from Agarwal
poor start again. Short, wide, and Dhawan upper-cuts him over point. Bisects third man and deep point
short of a length, no room, Dhawan drops this at his toes, and Agarwal calls him through for a quick single
short of a length, offcutter, cramping him up, Agarwal still manages to chip it to wide long-on for two
pull off the front foot, in front of square, and deep square leg has to rush to his left to save two runs
short, wide, cut straight to deep point this time
uppish extra-cover drive, Rohit puts in a dive at extra cover, but can't get to it on the full
wide yorker, just inside the blue line. Under the bat it goes
short of a length, on-pace, punched to deep midwicket for one
on a length, into the pads, punched down to long-on for one

no deception, it would appear, in this slower ball. Or just that he has erred too full with it. Agarwal loves it. Delays the shot a touch and clears mid-off with ease. That brings up an exciting fifty
short of a length, into the body, punched square on the leg side
full toss, slightly strange that Dhawan doesn't go after it. Merely pushes this to deep midwicket for one

down the wicket, Ashwin bowls it outside leg, and Dhawan lofts it towards deep square leg. Brevis runs to his right from long leg, puts in a full-length dive, but can't get close enough to catch it. However, he does get enough of a connection to actually parry it over the fence
drops this into the leg side for one

finally a wicket for Mumbai Indians. Well bowled by Ashwin. Agarwal is clearing the front leg again to look to go over long-off or straight. Ashwin makes sure he doesn't bowl it under his bat. Just short enough to make him drag it. Agarwal gets the toe end on it, and manages to only sky it as far as long-off. He is filthy with himself
full on off, defended.
full and wide on sixth stump, slammed straight through cover for one.
flighted more full on off, prodded gently to long-off for one.
back of a length on fifth stump, guided with soft hands to deep third man for one.
back of a length on middle at 136 kph, defended back to Bumrah off the back foot.
good length ball on off stump, guided with soft hands to deep third man.

uppercut over the keeper nearly picks out robocam on the boundary! It was a well directed bouncer by Bumrah on middle stump but Dhawan was even better angling the bat to play the billiard cue shot straight behind the stumps, one bounce over the rope.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended to the off side.
touch fuller now on off, tap and run into the off side for a sharp single.
good length ball on middle, flicked softly through square leg for one.
flighted full on leg stump, goes for a slog sweep and misses as the ball ricochets behind point. LBW shout is hopeless, but there's some confusion before they finally set off for a leg bye.
gives it some air on off stump, goes for a big slog sweep and misses as the ball bounces over the stumps.
flighted on a fullish length on leg stump, goes to sweep and this time connects behind square for one.
short and wide, slaps this behind point wide of the sweeper for an easy two.
good length ball on sixth stump, cracks a cut straight to the sweeper for one.
overpitched searching for the yorker and instead misses badly full on middle, Bairstow clocks this straight back over his head, one bounce over the rope at long-off.
slower ball lands short on fifth stump, pulled gently to deep backward square for one.
good length ball at 140 kph on middle, Dhawan backs away to slice this to deep third man for one.
full on middle, goes to drive for mid-off and gets a thick edge through point for one.

dropped! Back of a length at 133 kph on eighth stump, Dhawan charges to smash through the off side and barely reaches this, gets a toe edge that flies to Ishan Kishan's left at chest height. He flings his body out and gets a glove to it but it doesn't stick. Very hard chance, but plenty of keepers have held on to them in similar instances.
back of a length at 140 kph tailing away from the stumps, goes for a big heave and misses.
clever from Shikhar! Length ball on middle, shuffles well across his stumps to paddle this between the keeper and short fine leg for a sharp boundary.
low full toss at shin height on leg stump, flicks this gently through the leg side to bring up 50 off 37 balls.
fullish length on the stumps, flicks this out to deep midwicket for one.
full and wide outside off, Dhawan drags this drive back through mid-on for one.
slower ball at 103 kph produces a drag on! Good length ball angled across off stump, Bairstow tries to heave this over midwicket but is through the shot early and drags a bottom edge onto the stumps.
slower ball at 107 kph lands full on off, prodded gently into the off side for one.
low full toss at shin height, Livingstone doesn't punish the misfired attempted yorker and instead prods it down the ground for one.
full again on the stumps, simple punch down the ground again for one.

143 kph bread and butter yorker! So much for all the people flooding the feedback desperate for a tactical retired out so Livingstone could enter. Bumrah slings in a missile at the base of middle stump and Livingstone can't jam the bat down in time to keep it out.
searches for yorker again on middle at 141 kph, Jitesh is able to blunt it out to mid-on for one.
yorker on off stump, jammed out into the off side for one.
yorker on middle, defended to mid-off.

fullish length on middle and leg, goes to prod this into midwicket and misses, big lbw shout denied as the ball caroms into the off side for one. Inside edge on the replay so a DRS review would've been wasted. In fact they have called for DRS, so it will be a wasted review.
back of a length on fourth stump at 133 kph, guided to deep third man for one.
back of a length on fifth stump at 135 kph, goes to cut and is beaten.

uppercut just clears short third man on the ring! Not quite as much pace on this scrambled seam delivery from Mills on fifth stump, Dhawan leans back to ramp this up over the ring and a leaping effort by the fielder goes in vain.
short and wide at 140 kph, slices a cut straight to backward point.
length ball on fifth stump, swats this through midwicket for one.
yorker on middle at 134 kph, jammed out into the leg side for one.
yorker again on middle, jammed out to extra cover for one.
another attempted yorker on leg stump at 139 kph, shuffle down the track and toes this with a shovel over the bowler to mid-on for one.
hello! And Goodbye over deep midwicket! Fullish length ball at 137 kph on middle, Dhawan heaves this across the line sailing 15 rows back.
full on off stump, driven back down the ground to long-off for a well-run two.

another slower ball produces a wicket. Fullish length ball on middle, Dhawan tries to go over the leg side again but splices this high to long-on. Pollard stands 10 yards inside the rope and waits a few seconds for the ball to come down into his hands at chest height.

almost another wicket on an offcutter. Unadkat floats this full on sixth stump and the drive is sliced high and wide of Pollard at long-off, he tries to reach a hand up to smack it back into play but it just clears him.
fuller and straighter on off, driven firmly and wide of long-off, another effort from Pollard diving left can't save a boundary.
shot of the day over extra cover! Another attempted slower ball at 108 kph wide outside off, Sharma isn't fooled and smokes this flat over the rope landing 15 yards beyond the LCD ad boards.
slower bouncer on the body, Sharma tries to pull and is hit in the ribs.
slower bouncer is too high to play a pull shot, wide called on height.
fullish length ball on fourth stump, goes to heave and drags this gently through square leg for one.

well this is a tactical reverse ramp over third man for boundary! Full on off, shuffles across and flicks this back over the ring. Jonty Rhodes in the PBKS dugout lets fly with a few expletives to underscore how Sharma punished that delivery.
yorker on the stumps, jammed out through the ring for one.
fullish length on off, goes for a big leg side heave and a thick edge is sliced over short third man for two.
attempted yorker is a shin height full toss on off, punched back through long-off for one.
yorker on off, jammed out tamely through long-on for one.
yorker on fifth stump, jammed out past extra cover and long-off Pollard circles around to relay in for two.
143 kph yorker on fourth stump, shuffles well across his stumps to flick this out to wide long-on for one.
yorker full on off, jammed out through long-off for one.
bouncer sails over Shahrukh, wide called on height.
kaboom! Thampi misfires searching for yorker, instead it lands full on middle and Shahrukh slaughters this 20 rows back over long-on.
wide yorker almost lands off the pitch outside off, left alone and wide called.
another misfired yorker at 139 kph targeting the wide guidelines, lands too full and Shahrukh crushes this flat over Pollard watching helplessly at long-off.

yorker finally lands on the proper length at 142 kph on sixth stump, Shahrukh tries to punch this out through the off side and it tails in late to produce an inside edge that cannons back into off stump.
swinging in, tucked away off the hip for one
short of a length, angling away, punched to the covers
opens the face on this one to get a single to third man
looks for the ramp, Arora goes wide, and he gets a top edge over the first slip for four
left alone outside off

connects with the ramp this time. That is a shot decided on the analysis table the way he has gone down on a knee twice in the first over. The fine leg is square, and he has got this fine enough of him
Kishan is late on this one. At the wicket, slight shape away, and the outside edge goes down and through to third man for one
dreamy little cover-drive. No foot movement, just extending his arms into this wide length ball. Through extra cover it goes
Rabada goes wider, asking if he fancies another drive. Rohit doesn't. Leaves it alone
outside edge. Soft hands to defend this wide length ball, and the edge goes right down, wide of slip, but fine of third man. Odean Smith dives but can't keep it in
that's a bit of a waft at a wide length ball. Beaten
wide length ball, left alone
on a length, angling in, slight seam too perhaps, beats the inside edge, hits the thigh pad
slight shimmy down, Arshdeep drags the length back, Kishan cuts it to square third man
shuffling across to look to work this to leg, Arshdeep gets it to swing back in and beat his pad. A touch too high for the lbw
after the last ball that swung, this one goes with the angle, and perhaps seams a touch. Rohit ends up stabbing at it, and gets a thick edge to point
tracks the movement back in this tine, and pushes this into the leg side for one. Chahar's throw from the deep is on the half-volley and goes for an overthrow
short of a length, angling across, runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, wide, square-driven off the back foot but can't get it past backward point
thick outside edge as Rabada pitches this up and gets some shape away. The ball goes down and square to point
superb shot. Clears the front leg and goes inside-out over extra cover. Just a touch too full, and he opens the face on the drive and doesn't bother keeping it down

Rabada handcuffs Rohit. He is surprised by this short one, which doesn't give him any room. He tries to short-arm pull it, but gets a massive top edge. Vaibhav Arora gets around from short fine leg, and takes s safe catch. Rohit just didn't have room to push his hands through this one
short of a length, good carry, Brevis stays inside the line
swings at thin air. Rabada pitches it up slightly, Brevis looks to loft him down the ground, but is beaten by the movement back in. The length is not full enough to hit the wicket
full, angling away, beats his drive
lovely delivery. Slight shape back in, pitches on a length, middle and leg, and then seams away to take his outside edge. A T20 wicket on a defensive shot. Superb bowling
wide length ball, gets the bottom edge for a single to third man
big swing back in from outside off, hits Brevis in the thigh pad. Arora is excited in his lbw appeal but this is always sailing over
it's moving both ways. Brevis walks at him, setting himself up to loft an inswinger down the ground, but this one leaves him and beats him
really full, opens the face on it, can't beat the man at point
big swing at a wide length ball, looking to go over wide mid-on. Not even in the same post code as the ball moves away
wide length ball, runs it past slip for a single to third man
finally Brevis makes a connection with a big swing, but hits this straight to mid-on
shape in in the air, and then movement away after pitching. Beaten. The ball is doing much more for PBKS than it did for MI
lovely shot. Brevis finally makes a sweet connection. Short of a length, angling away, and he stands tall, meets it on the top of the bounce and punches it through cover
too full, which means Brevis can drive it hard despite the swing back in. Through mid-off it goes for four
looks like an offcutter, he has to adjust his shot to the lack of pace. Defends to cover
wide length ball, too wide, and called
short of a length, angling away, runs this down to third man for one
short ball, pulled away, not very convincingly, but the man at deep square leg is a few yards in. He has to back-peddle. Had he been on the fence, who knows
big swing down the ground, ends up playing down the wrong line. Beaten on the outside edge
driven hard but can't get it past mid-off. Does get the single, though
looks to steer one to third man again, but finds the man to point. Just too close to him
short, but no room. Cut away to deep point for one
offbreak to the left-hand batter, Varma has no room, but he still looks to cut. The outside edge goes fine of short third man
offbreak again, into the pads, punched to deep midwicket
legbreak to the right-hand batter now, but too short, and is cut away to deep cover
offbreak, short, wide, Varma is not missing out on this. Cuts this slightly in front of backward point for four
legbreak this time, hit back in the air, but just wide enough and quick enough to not give Livingstone to catch this
driven hard but straight to extra cover
slightly short of a length, bottom edge on the pull, Varma gets a single
walloped. Short again, and Brevis doesn't bother beating deep midwicket. He just smashes it back where it comes from, but at various times the speed. Four towards the sight screen
this one is into the sight screen. Superb straight drive back over his head. What a lovely clean swing of the bat. Needless to say, very AB-like
this has gone farther, but this one is not full enough so he has to drag it, which he does, and goes over wide long-on
thrice as nice. Chahar goes short and fast, Brevis is quick enough to pull this over wide long-on. Another sweet connection

this is sensational hitting. 6, 6, 6, 6. Zero respect. Absolute disdain. Chahar looks to hide this wide outside off, but he has bowled it too full, and Chahar lofts this over wide long-on again. All sweet, clean connections
now everything is running for MI. Varma looks to pull, the angle takes the ball away, but the top edge flies over the keeper's head for nearly a six
shuffles across to work this length ball into the leg side for one
walks at him, Arora bowls the slower one, he punches it down to long-on for one
looks to cut it, but is beaten by the length. Just not short enough

superb shot. Uses all of Arora's pace. That seems to be the strategy against him. Rohit ramped him twice too. Varma goes deep into the crease, also gets inside the line of this short-of-a-length ball, and ramp-pulls this over short fine leg for a flat six
full, middle and off, driven to long-off for one
spectacular six over the off side! Short and wide, blazes a cut over backward point flat and beats the fielder leaping at the rope unable to knock it back into play.
back of a length on off stump, defended.
full on the legs at 140 kph, flicked through square leg for one.
short on sixth stump at 137 kph, Brewis backs away from leg stump trying to emulate Tilak with a cut over point but is beaten.

dropped at deep third man! Full on fifth stump at 142 kph, Brewis goes hard at this and slashes a thick edge to deep third man, the fielder judges it very very poorly and is slow getting into position before lunging forward late and it slips through his hands. He should've been able to take it easily standing upright but makes a huge mess of it and it bounces to the rope to compound the error.

the drop only costs four runs! Short on the body, Brevis slams a pull flat to deep backward square. Arshdeep is in perfect position and judges it very well coming 10 yards off the rope to pouch a head high catch.
short on off, goes back to pull to long-on for one.

good length ball on fifth stump, prods at this and is beaten. Speculative stumping appeal goes to the third umpire but there didn't seem much excitement from the keeper. And the third umpire confirms that we've just wasted 90 seconds of our lives we'll never get back.
good length ball on fourth stump, goes back to flick to long-on for one.
full on leg stump, clears the front leg and heaves this flat to long-on for one.
another gem spins past an awkward prod on off stump on a good length.
good length ball on sixth stump, slapped to the cover sweeper for one.

length ball on fourth stump, heaved high and wide of deep square leg. The ball is in the air an eternity and Chahar circles around 30 yards but winds up five yards short and it plops into the turf for two.
good length ball on off, goes to flick this away and misses off the body.
length ball seams in from sixth stump at 136 kph, lame swish by SKY misses. The no ball siren goes off and we'll have a free hit. Replays show he landed on the line, but not behind it.

full on leg stump at 136 kph, heaves at this and a leading edge swirls to deep third man again where the ball is clumsily dropped once again at waist height, though it doesn't matter off the free hit in terms of a possible wicket, but they turn a single into two.
short ball on the body after shuffling across the stumps, sits up for Yadav to cream with a pull high over deep backward square leg into the third row.

horrible mixup results in a dreadful runout! Full on the stumps, flicked into midwicket. It was well wide of the fielder and Tilak sets off. Looked like an easy single on there but SKY is ball-watching at the striker's end. The fielder has plenty of time to throw to Arshdeep with Tilak stranded having completed 3/4 of a run. The bails come off with him 10 yards short. Tilak is spewing plenty of unrepeatable as he walks off.
full on the stumps, defended.
good length ball on the legs, comes down the track but can't flick it away.
full on the stumps, uses his feet again and chips this over wide midwicket, boundary ride has no chance to cut it off.
full on seventh stump, goes to slog sweep over mid-on and miscues this to deep square leg for one.
short and wide, slaps this to backward point.
short and wide on sixth stump, slaps this through cover for one.
full on seventh stump, heaves a one-handed tennis backhand into midwicket for one.
full on the stumps, heaves this off an inside edge to deep square leg for one.
yorker on fourth stump at 140 kph, jammed out wide of the keeper and they can't steal a run.
slower ball lands on a good length at 111 kph on fifth stump, SKY launches a pull flat over midwicket into the second row.
length ball again on sixth stump this time at 136 kph, goes to drive and an inside edge skittles past off stump to deep fine leg for one.
short and wide, slices this to short third man.
yorker on middle at 139 kph, jammed out straight to midwicket.
full on sixth stump, driven straight to the cover sweeper for one.
googly lands on a good length on middle and leg, spins in past an attempted midwicket flick and hits the pads but it was missing leg stump.
charges a full ball dragged wide on seventh stump, toe drags this through midwicket for one.
length ball on middle, sliced out to backward point.
full on fifth stump, driven to the extra cover sweeper for one.
googly on fourth stump on a good length, prods this off an inside edge into midwicket for one.
length ball flirting with the wide guidelines, Pollard shuffles past off stump to heave and misses. The ball is just outside the guideline but Pollard moved a long way, harshly called a wide.

Pollard runs himself out trying to steal a second off a misfield! Full on sixth stump, Pollard drives to long-on and slow jogs the first run. Odean Smith fumbles and SKY suddenly calls for two. There's hesitation from both of them, Pollard puts his hands up to signal he doesn't want to run but then sets off late. SKY stops midway then keeps going. A huge mess. The relay from Smith to the keeper is in time as the bails come off with Pollard two yards short. If Pollard ran the first run hard, there was definitely two there, but he got himself into trouble by slow jogging/walking the first run.
back of a length on fourth stump at 132 kph, punched away for one.
back of a length on sixth stump at 137 kph, chops this into the ground to the keeper.
what a shot! Full and wide, slices hard at this and the drive goes very square over cover point into the stands, really over backward point.
goodness he outdoes himself with this one! Wide yorker on sixth stump, again he drives inside out using the pace to slice this flat over deep backward point.
length ball on sixth stump, slaps this to the off side sweeper for one.
yorker speared in on the legs at 133 kph, misses a flick and a stifled lbw shout is turned down.
bouncer on sixth stump, goes to pull and top edges this over the keeper for... one? More very slow running. Should have been an easy two and now Unadkat is on strike.
full on off stump at 140 kph, miscues a drive over cover and falls into no man's land to be able to come back for two.
wide yorker on fifth stump at 139 kph, Unadkat clears the front leg for a big heave and misses.
yorker again, this time jammed out into cover for one.
goes for yorker again, winds up as a low full toss at shin height on off stump at 139 kph, driven to long-on for one to keep the strike for the 18th.
searches for yorker and it goes pear-shaped on leg stump! Low full toss on the pads at shin height, flicked with ease through backward square to the rope.

yorker on the money this time on off stump at 138 kph, jammed out into square leg, these two hustle all the way on the first run and are able to capitalize on a sloppy misfield by Chahar charging in so they get two in the end.
knee high full toss on middle stump at 138 kph, punched straight to long-on... and Unadkat turns down the single from the non-striker's end so SKY stays on strike.

knee high full toss on middle stump, could've easily disappeared over long-on for six but flubs the heave trying to clear long-on! It goes straight up in the air to Odean Smith 10 yards inside the rope for a straightforward catch at chest height. Smith slams the ball down in a raucous celebration!
Length ball on sixth stump, slaps this off the toe back to Rabada.
back of a length ball on the wide guideline, Ashwin shuffles way outside off and then tries to fiddle this fine through third man but misses.
Smith gets his clock cleaned over midwicket! Bangs it in short on the body, Unadkat blitzes a pull over the car sponsor over the rope and just short of the seats.

angles this ball full across Unadkat on sixth stump, Unadkat smashes a drive off the lower end of the bat but very straight toward long-off. The fielder on the boundary is very wide and they come back for an easy two.

another fullish length ball angled across sixth stump, Unadkat goes for a huge heave back over long-on but skies this over extra cover. Mayank backpedals from extra cover on the ring and takes a safe catch at rib height 10 yards from the edge of the circle.
angled short and way outside off, too wide outside the guideline for Bumrah to reach. Wide called.
length ball on fourth stump, slices this high over short third man. Dhawan runs from backward point to circle around and complete another catch before doing his customary thigh slap celebration.
Back of a length ball on middle, Mills sends a stiff breeze to midwicket with a wild heave but the ball passes through to the keeper.
triple-wicket over for Odean Smith to end the match! Length ball on fourth stump, another top-edged slice finds Mayank in the ring at extra cover for another chest high catch. PBKS win by 12 runs.
On the money first ball. Fullish around off with a hint of movement away. Defended solidly towards covers.
Length ball outside off, tapped towards point for a quick run to get going.
Fullish well outside off, Uthappa gets it off the outer edge of his blade to third man to get off the mark.
This is what lack of form does to you. Gaikwad looks to leave the length ball outside off alone. A bit of fortune for him though as the ball goes off the edge past the slip and to the rope.
On a length in the fourth stump channel, defended towards off.
Length ball on middle, defended to the on side. Decent start for both sides.
Starts with a length ball in the sixth stump line, Uthappa gets forward and presents a straight bat in defense.
A bit fuller, around off, worked to mid-on for none.
Quick run! Takes on Faf's arm does Uthappa. Pushes it back past the non-striker and hares to the bowler's end even as du Plessis gets to his left from mid-on. Direct hit would have been curtains.
Outside off on a length, steered to third man for a single.
Back of a length around off, punches it straight to Faf at mid-on.
Fuller than a good length on off, driven straight to mid-off. Just two from the over, Uthappa has been quiet too today.
Beautifully driven but straight to the fielder. Overpitched around off, finds wide mid-off with the drive.
That sounded well! Short in length, Gaikwad stays back and pulls it aerially in front of square on the leg side for four.
Good length outside off, leans into the drive and straight to covers.
Angling in on a length, plays it with soft hands through midwicket for a couple. The pressure created by the batters makes Maxwell there fumble.
Back of a length around off and middle, Ruturaj taps it to the off side and wants one. Sent back as Siraj gets to the ball quickly.
Back of a length outside off, guides it wide of the fly slip for one.

That's smooth as silk. This is what Gaikwad is capable of when in flow. Gets right behind that length ball, uses the very little width on offer. Cuts it through cover-point and third man had no chance running to his right. Highest score this season for him already.
Finds backward point this time with dab off the back of the length ball.
Another length ball outside off, guided straight to backward point.

Gaikwad is ruled out lbw. Height the factor? He asks for the review. He didn't connect the attempted heave off a length ball and got hit on the back thigh. Surely high? No! Clipping the stumps! One of those things that goes against you when you are not it form. Looked good but has to walk back. CSK don't lose a review even though they lose a wicket.
Fuller on off, driven straight to covers.
Length ball on off, punched towards mid-off.
Length ball outside off, steered to wide third man for a single.
Length ball angling away, punched back to the bowler.
Edged but well wide of slip. Goes for the drive against the fullish ball angling away. Towards third man for a run that gets him off zero.
Outside off on a length, Uthappa defends it towards cover-point. This has been a bit different from him this season.
Trying to do something different. Three of nine now for Uthappa. Walked towards the off side and used his wrists to try and play it wide of mid-on. Finds Rawat there, just short of him.

Managed to breach the fortress on the off side. In the sixth stump line on a length, Uthappa frees his arms and cuts it through cover-point. The point, cover-point and covers were quite tight and yet he found the gap.
Pushes it towards mid-off for a quick one, where Faf misfields.
Length ball around off, flicked aerially to the man in the deep in front of square on the leg side.
Back of a length on the pads, gets an inside edge onto his pads for a single.
Once again Uthappa trying something different. Gets a length ball outside off, on his pads as he is already outside off. Misses the flick though.
Straight as arrow for a maximum! Will this get Uthappa and CSK going? In the slot outside off, goes straight over the bowler's head for a 76-metre hit.
Short ball, misses the pull. Gets it off the back thigh for a leg bye. 35/1 at the end of the powerplay.
On a length around off, Uthappa goes for the punch but gets an inside edge onto his back pad.
Flatter around off, punched off the back foot through midwicket for one.
A bit short outside off, Moeen presents a straight bat off the back foot.

Sensational fielding display. Suyash Prabhudessai making an impression early in the game. Flatter and quicker outside off, cut towards backward point. Seemed to be passing the fielder but for a diving stop. Moeen was down in search of a run and stood no chance of getting back after an accurate throw to the wicketkeeper.
Full on off, driven back.
Outside off this time, played through cover to get going.
Timed nicely. Angling away on a length, punched through point for one.
Placed well. On a length well outside off, Uthappa just had to guide it past short third man. Sways back and does so. His second four.
Back of a length on off, punched down to long-on for one.
Second four in the over. Erring in line, Akash Deep, pays the price. Short but well down leg, gets enough bat to get it fine to the leg side fence.
Middles the push straight to covers. Was angling away on a length.
Shortish again, makes room but finds backward point with the push. Ten runs off the over, the most expensive so far.
Quicker on the leg, misses the flick. Maxwell appeals but he is the only one.
Quicker around leg, pushed through wide mid-on for one.
Slower through the air around off, guided to short third.
Dube goes high and long. Leading run-getter so far for CSK and shows in the confidence. Tossed up around middle, in his arc. Swings his arm for a 94-metre six over long-on.
Slower through the air around middle and leg, defended.
Half-tracker outside off, punched to the sweeper for one.
Almost sneaks through. Tossed up outside off, Dube looks to flick it away, gets it off the inside edge to short fine leg.
Quicker on middle, worked through square leg for one.
A touch short outside off, slapped to deep point for one.
Floated full outside off, worked away with the turn through midwicket for a single.
Short again and wide, a bit of turn. Uthappa goes back and has to reach out as he gets it through covers for one.
Saw Dube charging down and shortened his length a touch. Worked away through square leg for one. Good start for Shahbaz.
Tossed up wrong one, Dube goes for the big one immediately but connects with only thin air.
