Sixy Shaw! Bouncer on middle and angling in to him, Shaw rides the bounce and pulls it way over the man at deep square leg to bring up the fifty partnership. Didn't bother keeping it down. Expensive start for Cummins.
Slower and fuller on off, Warner defends it off the inner half towards midwicket.
One ball's enough for Warner! Sees the tossed up ball well outside off, fetches the slog and deposits it over deep midwicket. Long day on the field for KKR bowlers, ehh?
Quicker and fuller on middle, goes back and turns it to midwicket.
Very full on off, driven to mid-off.
A touch shorter outside off, mistimes the chop towards cover-point for a quick one.
Fuller on off, worked away through midwicket for one. Eight off the over despite that big six.
Flatter on middle and leg, worked away to deep midwicket for one.
A mix-up, thankfully doesn't cost Capitals. Warner works it to midwicket and is in the crease, but Shaw is down in search of a run. Sent back and would have been gone had he hit.
Shot! Flatter and outside off, Warner gets out the reverse lap and hits it over short third man for four.
Quicker one on middle, played through midwicket for one.
Floated just outside off, Shaw looks to go over covers but gets a thick edge to short third man. Well short.
Now the sweep. On the pads, Shaw hits it through backward square leg for four more. Delhi end the powerplay on 68 for none.
Starts with a short of length ball outside off, the offcutter at 105 clicks. Cut through covers for one.
Short in length again, pulled to midwicket, where a misfield, or a half-stop, allows them a run.
Short in length, on the pads, pulled away to deep square leg for one.
A bit of yes and no again. Russell is not cranking it up yet. Ambles in and lands it on a length on the pads, worked away to short fine leg. A misfield there and Shaw wants one, but Warner disagrees.
Short in length, pulled to deep midwicket for one.
Short in length well outside off, Warner hops and glides it to third man for a single to retain strike. Just five singles in the over, a quieter one in comparison.
Short in length, pulled to deep midwicket for one.
Very full on middle, whipped away through midwicket for one.
Length ball outside off, punches through cover-point for a single.
Shawwt! Full ball, in the slot. Plays the pickup shot and the ball sails over deep midwicket rope.
Over correction from Venky, pays the price. Short and wide outside off, Shaw reaches out and cuts it over point for a four. Ten runs off the last two.
Slower one well outside off, Shaw drives it to long-on to bring up his 12th IPL fifty off just 27 balls. Second in a row and he's just decimated the KKR bowling thus far.
Fuller on middle and leg, worked through midwicket for a single.
Warner nearly pays the price for the switch hit. Changes stance and plays the right-hander's sweep aerially just past a diving backward point for four.
This one has been played to long-off for one.

Bamboozled! Chakravarthy has the last laugh as the Shaw show at Brabourne ends. Tossed up around off, Shaw played for the one going away but this one came back in. Bowled him through the gate. End of the 93-run opening partnership for the Capitals.
Tossed up carrom ball outside off, Pant gets it off the inner half towards the bowler.
Strong appeal but only from Chakravarthy. Pant misses the paddle and gets hit on the front pad. But he was long way across outside off.
Quicker on the pads, Warner misses the flick and the ball rolls to short fine off his pads.
Pant gave it away early. Looks to play the reverse early but had to adjust. Pulls it towards backward point for one to get off the mark.
Flatter on middle and leg, punched towards mid-on, but Narine stops it in his followthrough.
Landed on a length around middle, seemed to stick a bit. Warner chips it over the bowler for one.
Swept away nicely. Flatter and quicker on middle, once again he gets his front leg across and plays it well to the right of short fine leg. One hand off the blade as he played that. 100 up.
Tossed up around off, Pant dances down and pushes it to covers for a quick run.
swept away over deep midwicket! Full length ball on off, and he is down on his knees early to hammer that far and wide

reverse sweep over short third man in typical Pant fashion! Slightly back of a length on middle, and he swivels with his bat off his hands and while losing shape. The bat just evades the stumps as it drops off his hands
fuller ball on off, and tucked towards point
clips this fullish ball on middle towards fine leg after a step back in the crease. And it is a no-ball
full and outside leg, and he readies himself to switch-hit but misses. The ball goes past the keeper too, and races away for four behind the wicket. Another no-ball
shortish in length on leg, and he pulls that to deep midwicket. Rahane there runs and slides to his right to cut that off
slashed over cover, and Capitals make merry! Bowled full and outside off, and was also tossed up. Warner steadies to loft that comfortably to deep extra cover
tucks this fullish ball on middle and leg towards square leg. They wanted a second, but the bowler gave the chase
on a short of a length and angling into middle. Pulled to fine leg from deep in the crease
slashed hard and on the bounce to point. Short and wide of off, and he went forcefully at that. The take wasn't clean by the fielder, and that allowed a single
shapes to pull, but it isn't short enough. On a back of a length on middle and angling in, as he his hit on his back thigh. The ball rolls for a leg-bye
slower ball on a shorter length on middle. Pulled away to fine leg almost after taking his eyes off the ball
change of pace again. Bangs it in short on middle and off, as Warner makes room and then has to pull to long-on realising there is no pace on ball
slower-ball bouncer, but called wide. Short of a length on middle and off, as Pant tries to pull but the ball goes over his head, and then bounces and turns before going to the keeper

fired over the bowler's head! The extra delivery in the over resulting in the maximum for Capitals. Right there in the hitting length and full on middle and off. Pant waits before swinging his bat full stretch
short and a bit wide of off. Cut to deep point away from his body, and they pinch two

almost taken! Would have been a dream catch had it come to hand properly, but it's fifty for Warner instead. Slower ball on a shortish length on leg, as Warner makes room and clobbers that to long-on, where the man runs and flies to his right. Gets it into his hands for a second, before falling on the other side with the momentum taking him there.
on the bounce to deep point. Went slicing at that full and wide-ish ball outside off, and sent that flying. The fielder had to rush in there
whipped to wide long-on. A full toss on middle, as he swings across the line between long-on and deep midwicket

swats at that, but finds third man! Pant falls while trying to keep going after the bowling. That was short and outside off, and seemed to have bounced more than what the batter would have liked. Pant had to get on top of the bounce to try and rap that, and ended up sending to the third man fielder
short of a length a touch wide of off, and he finds the man at midwicket with his pull
short of a length on off and turning in. Pushed to long-on from deep in the crease and with his front leg out of the way
back of a length outside off, and punched to deep point
much fuller on off, and driven to long-on
turns into him off a good length on middle and off. Hit on his back pad while trying to clip

appeal for leg before, and given in a flash! The finger went up even before Narine and the keeper completed their appeal. Lalit went to sweep that back of a length ball on middle, which went on straight after pitching. There was no turn there as he missed his sweep and was hit on his back thigh, and that looked plumb to the naked eye. Quick wickets for Knight Riders here
looks to paddle that fullish ball outside off, but is struck on his front pad. The impact is outside off, and so not out
short and outside off, and slashed to deep point
full and outside off. Tapped to deep point to get off the mark
shuffles across off to that short and wide ball outside off. Ends up slashing to the right of the man at cover
goes flinging, and gets six! Swings at that full ball outside off, which hints to turn into him. Not quite off the middle of the bat, but still over deep midwi
pulls his length back a little, and goes wider of off. Patted down towards cover
much fuller and outside off. Run down long-off

grabbed at fine leg! Powell went for the slog sweep to that full ball on off, almost as if he thought of playing that shot no matter the line and length of the ball. He sends that up into the clouds, as Rinku at fine leg has to keep an eye on it for a long time. But he maintains his calm, and takes it well
fullish on off, and defended down towards the bowler
fullish again on off, and quicker. Blocked back
good length on middle, and hinting to come into him with the angle. Clipped to fine leg
slower this time. On a good length on off and turning away. Nudged back to the bowler
this turn into him now. On a shortish length on middle, and turning in sharply. Finds cover with his punch
on a back of a length on middle at 139kph. He gets his bat down, and ends up getting an inside edge on to his pad. A single stolen after the ball dribbles to the off side
slower ball. Full and wide of off, and has Warner trying to reach out for it after a step across as he is beaten. But it is a no-ball
shuffles across off early, as Umesh bowls a near yorker outside off after seeing the batter move early. Half-swept towards short fine leg
dropped by Billings tumbling to his right! He went diving with both hands, but the ball went off his gloves, as Axar tried to pull a slower ball on a short of a length on leg

nabbed at deep midwicket! Warner's party ends. On a scrambled seam on a back of a length on middle and off, as Warner makes room early. He goes for the swish to the on side, but finds Rahane lurking on the boundary, who is content to only give a thumbs-up after taking the catch. Capitals losing their way in the death overs
lofted off the outside edge, and on the bounce to point. On a good length outside off, and he went driving at that
good pace and bounce! That was fired in short on middle, and took off from the pitch, as Axar came down the pitch to try and have a swing but missed. Billings had to collect it high to his right
flayed away on the bounce to deep point. Full and outside off, and bowled with a scrambled seam. Thakur has a heave, but mistimes it
slower ball, and chipped back towards the non-striker. Cummins chases to his left, and there is a bit of yes-no between the batters, before Axar is sent back by Thakur
wow, that somehow ended up finding the gap between fine leg and deep square leg! Change of pace on a short of a length on off, and he pulls well with the bounce and the movement away
this time paddles to fine leg. The keeper gives the chase. On a back of a length on middle, and runs that down
slower ball again. Fullish in length and wide of off. He has a hoick at that, but ends up pushing to deep midwicket off the inside half of the bat
good bounce there, and Axar climbs on to that short delivery on middle at 116kph. Pulled with a swivel to long leg

what a sound off the bat! That goes 29 rows over deep square leg. A reminder of Thakur's heroics at The Oval last year. On a short of a length on middle and leg, and he waited before pulling that forcefully into the stands. That went 95 meters
good comeback. Sends that yorker a touch wide of off, and Thakur lets that pass
six more! Thakur flays that away over extra cover. Cross seam, and full a touch wide of off. All Thakur does is swing it using his bottom hand, and send that flat and flying
attempts a yorker, and that lands on middle at 144kph. Thakur is hit on the pad as he tries to flick

six for me too, says Axar! Lofts that with high elbows, and waits for the slower ball to come to him. It is there in the arc, and full on middle and off. Axar dumps that over the bowler's head for the third six of the over

23 off the over! Who cares if there is no Sarfaraz? This time Umesh goes full and wide of off, and Axar lifts that off the length to play that like a half volley. The ball flies off his bat, and goes with a couple of bounces into the extra cover fence.

over mid-off now! That brings up the 200. A slower ball, and full and wide of off. Thakur spots mid-off was inside the circle, and swats that flat and hard. The man there jumped to his right, but didn't get a hand
yorker length on off, and he swings across the line. Gets that off the inside half of the bat, and they rush for two
drills this full ball outside off to long-on from deep in the crease
loses his bottom hand in trying to slash at that back of a length ball outside off at 140kph. Deep point chases that to his right
pulled away to deep square leg. He makes room early, and Cummins follows by bowling a slower ball on a shrotish length on leg

it is six! Just clears the rope at deep midwicket. Another slower ball from Cummins which is on a full length on off. Thakur knew he had to swing no matter the line and length, and the ball seemed just full enough for him to have a heave. That landed beyond the rope in between long-on chasing to his right and deep square leg to his left

Strong appeal and the umpire gives Rahane the marching orders after a thought! Speared in on a length from over the stumps, Rahane is a tad late in getting his bat down. The ball goes off the front pad to the wicketkeeper. The players appeal and get the decision but there was no bat at all. Pant now asks the umpire to check for the lbw as per the protocol and the impact is well outside off. Eventful beginning.

Rahane has been given out lbw again and he review again. Survives as there is a thick inside edge. Fuller and on middle, gets it off the inner half onto the pads but the umpire failed to spot that after a strong appeal. Rahane is amused.
Full and well outside off, Rahane goes fishing at that.
Hint of swing inwards, fuller on off and middle, driven to mid-on.
On a length on off, Rahane plays it with soft hands towards covers and gets going.
Full on off, steered towards backward point for a single. End of the eventful over where the Fizz should have had a wicket.
Starts off with a peach. Full and outside off, swings in as it pitches. Venky goes for the drive but gets beaten on the inside edge.
Fuller on off, played solidly from the crease.
Easy peasy! Short ball down leg, Venkatesh pulls it way over deep square leg with a swivel. But he seems to be limping a touch. He was out after injuring his knee in the first innings.
Short again, six again. Similar half-tracker from Thakur after having a few words with Warner. Venky is happy to pull it way over deep backward square leg again.
Offcutter on a length but on the pads, nudged through backward square leg for one. Limps to the other end.

Another lbw appeal against Rahane. Not given this time. Fuller around off, Rahane played around it and was rapped on the pads. Warner says height as Capitals ponder for the review. A leg-bye taken as the ball rolls to the off side.
Fuller outside off, pushed through covers for one. Wanted a second but had to turn it down since Iyer is not really running well.
Iyer dances down and goes hard at it. Gets a good deal on that as the ball flies over short third man for four. He's grimacing after playing every shot.

Venkatesh's short, dashing stay ends. Pulls the length ball straight to Axar at deep square leg. Despite not having enough room to free his arms for the pull, he made a good contact. And that brought about his downfall. Early strike for Capitals.
Shreyas expects the short ball and makes room a bit early. Gets a length ball instead. But he has a stable base and thrashes it through covers to get going.
Back of a length ball down leg, Iyer misses the flick. Not given a wide and Shreyas isn't pleased.
Fuller on off, driven straight back for a single.
Length ball angling in around off, bowled from wide of the crease. Patted towards wide mid-on for a quick single.
Now Rahane dances down, gets it off the inner half through mid-on for a single.
Almost chopped on! A touch fuller, Shreyas clears his front leg but then has to adjust. Tried to run it towards the off side but gets it off the inside edge past the stumps for another quick one.
Pleasing to the eye. Length ball on the pads, Rahane just lifts it over short fine leg and gets four.
Once again Rahane comes down the track early. Misses the pull and it goes off his shoulder towards short third.
Yet again Shreyas shuffles in his crease before the ball is bowled. Gets a full toss as Thakur goes for the yorker. Smashes it through covers for his second boundary.
Run out chance but Khaleel couldn't pick it up cleanly. Runs across to his right after Rahane got it off the leading edge. Was an offcutter hence Rahane was through his attempted flick a bit early.
Length ball punched to covers.
Length ball outside off, Rahane walks across but finds mid-on with the heave.

Straight up in the air and Lord Shardul can do no wrong! Had to run all the way back from mid-on towards the ropes. Keeps his eye firmly on the ball, fumbles it three-four times but eventually hangs on with a slide. Superbly done by Thakur. Rahane looked to go over the bowler against the length ball but has to walk back now.
Fuller and outside off, Rana judges it and lets it go. Wasn't too far from the off stick.
Spears in full on the pads, flicked through midwicket for a brace to get going. Just two runs and a wicket off the over, job well done, Khaleel.
Length ball angling across, steered to deep backward point for two.
Very full on off, driven to mid-on.
Fuller on middle and leg, Shreyas wants a run as he pushes it towards midwicket. But he is sent back by Rana, who spots a fielder swooping in.
Short in length, pulled to midwicket for a quick one. Shaw has a shy but the ball misses the stumps and hits Shreyas on the side of the right knee.
Length ball around middle, flicked to midwicket.
Full on middle, worked away straight to midwicket. Another tide over from the Fizz.
Short and wide outside off, cut away through point for one.
Shortish again, slapped through cover-point for another one.
Shortish again, Shreyas goes back but finds point with the cut.
Excellently struck. Slower through the air but very full outside off. Shreyas slams it through covers and beats long-off running to his left.
A touch shorter, punched through covers for one.
Slower one on a length, Rana comes forward and clips it through backward square leg for one.
Starts with a shorter one, pulled to deep midwicket for a single.
Shortish again, pulled to deep midwicket for another one.
There goes Rana! Half a dozen rows back into the stands. Tossed up ball outside off at 86 clicks. He gets down on a knee and slogs it over deep midwicket for a 91-metre hit.
A cry of anguish from Rana as he cuts a short one straight to point. Missed out.
Worked through the on side for a single. Was very full on middle and leg.
Short ball, pulled through the ground to deep square leg for one more.
Fuller on middle, pushed to long-on for one.
Flatter outside off, Rana gets across and slaps it towards cover-point for one.
Floated full outside off, Shreyas makes room early and smashes it through wide mid-on for two.
Soars Iyer! Tossed up around off, Shreyas dances down and deposits it way over the sightscreen.
Fired in quicker and shorter, Iyer misses the pull. But the ball goes off his pads fine down leg for a couple of leg byes.
Sees Shreyas charging down and fires it on middle. Worked away off the inner half to deep square leg for one.
Stiff shoulder perhaps. Short ball at very low pace and outside off to start with. Shreyas stands tall and slaps it over covers for four.
Fuller outside off, driven through covers for a single.

Excellent effort in the deep, it's Thakur again. Covers a lot of ground to his left from deep backward square leg to save a couple. Rana had moved across the stumps and ramped it over short fine leg. He got more height and not much distance or pace on that.
That's very wide as Rana lets it be. Pant misses it and concedes a bye.

Clean strike! Full and outside off, Rana has enough room to swing his arms. Goes over wide long-off and gets a six. Lalit tried his best with a jump at the ropes but almost hurt himself by crashing into the ad board.
Fuller on middle and leg, hit aerially towards wide long-on for one.
Fuller on middle, eased through midwicket for a brace. 30 runs have come from the last two overs.
skips down first ball, and pulls that shortish ball on middle to deep midwicket
full and wide of leg. Left alone, and wide called

swiped across the line and over the bowler's head! Tossed up full and very wide of off, as he reaches for that to send that back down the ground. Thakur chases to his left from long-on, but can't stop it
swings to the on side off a full length on middle. A few to deep midwicket

misses another attempted sweep. There is half an appeal for stumping from Pant, as Iyer goes heaving at that full ball outside off and is beaten. Replays show Iyer's back foot never moved out of the crease there
goes for the reverse sweep that full ball outside off, and ends up patting Pant's pad. A single to short third man
pulls this short of a length ball on off to deep midwicket after it turns away from him. A flat shot

loud, loud appeal for leg before, but not given. Pant reviews after a thought. Rana goes reversing first ball, and is hit on his front pad. Good length ball on middle and leg, and going on with the angle there. Replays show there is no inside edge, and the ball would have gone on to miss leg stump
bam! Six over deep midwicket! A long hop on a short of a length on off, and Rana hammers that blow over the fence. Lalit apologises for that immediately
fuller length on leg stump. Rana is down trying to sweep, but the ball hits his front pad

finds long-on! Lalit does the trick. Comes back with a wicket one ball after being hit for a six, although it was a dipping full toss on middle and off, but not low enough for him to miscue. Rana cleared his front leg there to facilitate the slog, and found the fielder as he ended up hitting that off the bottom of the bat
good length ball outside off, and swat-pulled to long-on, as Lalit bowls from wide of the crease
Lalit dives in front of the non-striker, but the ball passes him to long-on. Shortish ball on off, and punched from deep in the crease
down the pitch, and slogs on the bounce to deep midwicket. Pretty full ball on off, and he was ready to swing his bat early
sweeps this full ball on middle to fine leg. That was hit hard
misses his reverse sweep to this good length ball outside off
tonked over long-on to raise his fifty! Skips down the pitch again, and Kuldeep goes fuller and in the hitting zone on off. Iyer obliges, and sends that ramming

gone, stumped! Kuldeep hits back right away. The googly gets the opposition captain out. Pitches it on a slightly good length on off, and gets it to turn away from the right-hander. Iyer is down the track prepared to clobber that over the on side again, but is beaten. Pant has a lot of time to clip the bails
fuller ball on middle, and he sweeps the first ball he faces to fine leg
just sends that reverse sweep over short third man! Good length ball on off, and he got a top edge, but it doesn't matter for Billings and his side
backs away to this fuller ball on off, and punches to the man at cover from deep in the crease
this time short third man dives to his right, and just gets a hand. The point fielder does the cleaning after that. Another reverse, but this ball is fuller outside off
just beats long-off! Billings knows there is only one way to get to the target. Full ball on off, and he backs away to send that lofting with the full face of the bat
Pant has to turn, run and dive to his left, but falls short of the ball. Another reverse from Billings to a full ball on middle and off, and this seemed to have taken the back of the bat
blocked down. Full on off, and tapped
back of a length just outside off, and pushed to point away from his body as he backed away
slashes to deep point. Fuller in length and just outside off, as he cuts that after clearing his front leg
shapes to sweep that fullish ball on middle and off, but is struck on his front pad. Went down on his knee early

goes slogging, and falls! Taken by Lalit running forward from fine leg. Billings was sitting deep in the crease, and again went across off to try and repeat that slog sweep. The ball was full and outside off, and he could only send that high up without any real timing. Knight Riders staring at a defeat now?
drills that for four! Starts from where he had left in the last match. Steps across, and fires a full ball outside off to beat mid-off to his right
has a hoick at that back of a length ball outside off, and plays away from his body. Finds the man at midwicket
skips down, and stands outside leg. Kuldeep bowls slow and on a good length on leg. Pushed back
wide down the leg side. Turns in after pitching on a fullish length outside leg
good  legnth ball on leg, and clipped to short fine leg

given leg before, and Cummins' dream ends for the day! But he has reviewed. Goes swinging to the on side, but is beaten by that good length ball on middle which is turning in, and is hit on the back leg. There is no inside edge, and the impact appears to be outside leg. Ah, it pitches in line and shows umpire's call on hitting leg stump. So the decision stands, as Cummins is left frustrated
has a heave to the off side, and manages four! Full and wide of off, and turning away. He lofts, and beats a sliding deep point to his right

taken at long-off! In and out for Narine. Fuller line and again a little wide of off, turning a tad away after pitching. Narine is ready and prepared to send that into the stands, but can send that only wide of long-off, where Powell does well to keep watching it

excellent take by Kuldeep! Oh my, catch of the year so far! Kuldeep rans across to his right, and ends up almost where an imaginary midwicket would have been placed. He keeps focusing on the ball while continuing to sprint, and has to stretch out his hands to his right to complete the grab! Pant was chasing the ball too, but gave up there. Fullish ball on middle, and Umesh went sweeping but top-edged it
hammered wide of long-off. Full and outside off, and goes inside out for four
yorker length on middle, and he jams the bat down. Single to fine leg
back of a length on middle and leg, and he closes the bat face. Gets a leading edge to point
hoicks that fuller ball on off at 114kph. They steal three there, or try doing that to get Russell back on strike. Rasikh just about made his ground at Fizz whipped the bails off
goes slogging across the line to this fullish ball on middle and leg. Single to deep midwicket
makes room and skips down, but the ball is too full and just outside off. Beaten there
slashes that hard and flat wide of long-off. Full and on off, as Russell drags that along
short delivery now. Bangs it in on leg, and Russell has to duck
great stuff from Khaleel. Yorker length on middle and leg, and jammed down towards square leg

dropped by Pant, but that was a very difficult catch! And he has banged his head on the floor, looking a bit hurt for a second. He ran forward as far as until a short midwicket position, and dived forward. But the ball fell in between his gloves. Good length ball on middle, and Russell went slogging but got a top edge
looks to reverse ramp that back of a length ball on off, but is beaten
yorker length on off, and sliced to deep backward point. Pretty full, and he clears his front leg to send that slicing. Deep point chased to his left and dived, but the ball went past
launched down the ground! Bowls full and in the length on middle, and lofts that from deep in the crease
slower-ball bouncer to fox Russell. Short of a length on middle, and rising up steeply. He ends up swatting towards square leg after shaping to pull

another swat, and Warner has stopped that brilliantly at deep point after running to his left from long-off! He looks to have hut himself there, as he ran to his left and patted the ball back from his left hand very late. Warner ended at the other side, and collided with the fence. Short ball again on off, and Russell played with the bounce there
full toss on middle, and swung away to the man at deep midwicket
pretty full and wide of off, and he tries slashing. Finds short third man after playing away from his body
crunches that full ball on off to long-off
yorker length just outside off, and heaved wide of long-on as he played with his bottom hand off. Not a great-looking shot, but four still
swatted right to the man at deep point! Tries to get on top of the bounce of this short of a length ball on off while hopping in the crease, and finds the man there for an easy catch
pushes that at good length ball outside off to deep point while playing away from hid body
game over, as Thakur takes his second! Rasikh looks to have some fun by lofting that full ball on middle, but ends up ballooning the ball towards long-on, as Powell runs forward for another catch
starts with a full delivery on off from wide of the crease, Kishan has a good look at that as he leaves
nibbles away as Kishan is beaten trying to waft at the delivery with an angled bat
full on off, Kishan gets to the pitch of it and stabs it away
full and swinging away from a fourth-stump line, Kishan slices a drive to sweeper cover
slants one across on a length, it hits the seam and comes back in as Rohit leaves
top over this. Rohit charges down but is beaten on the pull
cracker-jack of a delivery! Kishan plays for the late swing in but this one nips away to beat the drive
beaten again. This time, Siraj shortens his length but gets the ball to cut away. Kishan is looking to run it down but misses
extra bounce off a length. Rears up as Kishan stabs this into the point region. Took the bottom hand off as he made contact.
swinging into the pads, flicked to Shahbaz at long leg
lovely on drive, right out of the top drawer. Top notch wrist work from Rohit as he punches this perfectly acceptable delivery on off down the ground.
finishes with a full delivery on off, Rohit is solid in defence
hint of width and Kishan nicely steers it away behind point for a couple
pulled off the front foot! He has absolutely nailed that. Bisected midwicket and mid-on perfectly
floats it full on the stumps, worked to midwicket
tries to steer it wide of backward point but can't pick the gap
tries to break the shackles by slapping that over cover but the timing isn't quite right, down to the sweeper
beaten as he tries to run this down to third man. Another top over from Willey
checks his stroke as this full delivery stops on him a touch, one bounce to cover
it's the short-arm jab but doesn't have the legs, midwicket hares back to cut that off. Willey with the effort
charges down the track and boom! He has disdainfully slapped that over wide long-on. By no means a bad delivery. Just solid striking from Rohit
works this into the gap at midwicket for a couple of runs
full toss and picked away. Beats Akash Deep's sprint from deep square to deep midwicket. Poor from Siraj and Rohit takes full toll of that. Didn't have to hit it hard. Pure timing
slower ball angling down leg, Rohit held his shape to try and pull that away but missed. Wide called and rightly so
length on off, turned to midwicket
serves up a buffet ball and Kishan wallops it to the square leg fence. Too short
clubbed down the ground! Went full thsi time, Kishan absolutely gave it the tonk
<s> dropped! </s> The wrong'un that Kishan didn't pick. Leading edge and it went straight in and out. Okay, looks like it was a bump ball.
belted down to wide long-on
sweeps it off a length and picks the gap at deep square. Mumbai revving up
lunges forward and blocks
beaten as he looks to slash it over point
swing and a miss. This is full and slanted across, Kishan threw the kitchen sink at it
flayed to sweeper cover
flicked to short fine leg, on the bounce to Kohli there
square driven to deep point
width and walloped! Gets into a great position to play a picture-perfect drive on the up.
length ball into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket

got him and it's a big breakthrough at a time when Mumbai were running away. Rohit is deceived by this slower off-cutter, is looking to work it to the leg side but gets a leading edge back to the bowler.
stops on him as Brevis pushes with hard hands, lands short of cover
full and angling into the pads, works straight to a stategically placed short midwicket
slower and fuller on off, yorker-length, jammed back
driven into the covers, a misfield allows the single
edged and just wide of a diving Kohli at slip. Races to the boundary. Looking to cut but got a thick edge, Kohli was diving low to his left but couldn't grab it one handed.
squirted off a thick inside edge past midwicket
cramped for room as he short-arm jabs it to deep square
looks to go downtown but is beaten as Akash hits the hard lengths. excellent carry to DK
superb delivery. Rears up on Brevis as he tries to punch on the up. Whizzed past the edge
cut hard to deep point
wrong'un on middle and leg, nudged to fine leg
wrong'un on the shorter side, pulled from outside off to deep midwicket

has he got him? Yes! Brewis plays for the turn but this one drifts in and skids through to hit him on the back pad. Brevis made the mistake of playing all around the delivery. Would've smashed into the off stump.
driven to sweeper cover to get off the mark
low-armer from Wanindu, tucked into the leg side
fizzy delivery back in, turned to the leg side
beaten as he looks to slash this short ball angling across
ramped to Siraj who takes an excellent catch running around at third man. Kishan used the pace to steer it up and over. Fine margins. Little over elevation and it would've been six
length ball angling away, pushed to point
nearly chopped on! Akash lands this on a length, excellent seam position, the ball nibbles in and bounces over the stumps as Varma looks to dab it behind the wicket

Woah! Terrible running. Misjudged the run completely. Varma bunted it into the off side and simply took off. He didn't anticipate how close Maxwell was at short cover as he swooped in and flicked an under-arm throw direct at the bowler's end
zips through to beat Surya's slash. Once again reared up off a length. RCB have MI in all sorts of trouble

googled! Hasaranga welcomes him with a fullish ball just outside off, and the googly zips in sharply with Pollard on the back foot. Hits the back leg, Hasaranga starts to celebrappeal. Umpire raises his finger. Pollard walks up to SKY, and then takes the review This has gone through Pollard as he fell over trying to play a flick, and impact is clipping leg stump (umpire's call). Pollard gone for a golden D.
googly, length ball on off and turning into middle. Flicked off the back foot to the leg side
full, just outside off. Googly turning in and blocked off the front foot
full on off. Legbreak this time. Big stride forward to defend
off the mark. Full on off, and driven to long on
slower through the air. Drifts one in, full on middle and leg. Driven past the bowler to long off
back of a length outside off but jagging into Sky's body. Hits him on the glove in front of his throat, and the ball rolls away to short third
good length ball on off. Ramandeep was shaping up for a big leg-side shot, but checks it at the last second. Fends it back
good length, fifth stump line. Ramandeep takes his eyes off the ball as he tries to clatter one through the off side. Through to DK
good length ball, angling into Ramandeep's body after pitching outside off. Blocked back
back of a length outside off. Cuts it behind square to third man for one
driven on the up! Pitches it slightly full outside off, and Suryakumar is on it in a flash. Holds the pose after connecting with the drive. High elbow and all that
around the stumps. Half-tracker from the left-arm orthodox tweaker. Flat-batted off the back foot to long on
full on off. Turning away after gripping. Presses forward to drive. Outside edge rolls away to short third man
fullish, wider ball. Suryakumar goes onto the back foot and cuts. Finds the infielder
full outside leg. Worked off his pads to deep midwicket for one
good length, outside off. Flat-batted to wide long off
poor effort from Siraj at deep point. Does all the hard work to get to the ball after Suryakumar cut this length ball away. But the ball bursts through his hands as he gets low to collect
length ball just outside off. Punched through the off side for a couple as the infielder gives the ball a chase

Harshal is appealing, DK is interested but the umpires want to probably send this upstairs. What's the soft signal? None, of course, since that rule has been scrapped. Is Ramandeep caught behind? Full offcutter outside off. Ramandeep presses forward and plays away from his body. It's taken the edge and DK takes a low catch while being off balance and almost falling over.
edged first ball through the vacant slip cordon to third man. Length ball outside off and Unadkat kept his bat hanging outside the stumps. Takes the shoulder of the bat past the keeper's right
full on off, and he drives with the full face of the bat. Straight as an arrow, but Harshal dives to his left and gets a palm to stop what could've been a four
offcutter. Length ball outside off, and coming in to Surya after pitching. Cut from near his body to the off side

slower ball bouncer. Suryakumar dropped his knees to get low, but the ball didn't bounce as much. He ends up getting some bat on it as the ball was coming straight for the helmet. Bunted towards short third man
good length on off. Turning away. Cut towards backward point
good length outside off. Cut off the back foot to deep backward point
dances down and goes inside out. Shahbaz goes full around middle. Suryakumar does the jig and keeps the bat's face at a 45-degree angle to lift it over cover for half a dozen
fullish just outside off. Skids through with the arm. Bunted back to the bowler
important runs as he sweeps this very fine! Shahbaz goes full on leg, and Suryakumar's sweep comes off the glove and races away before short fine leg can put the dive in
keeps the strike. Full on middle, and flicked to wide long on
pulled with ease as Siraj goes short. Suryakumar stands tall and pulls in front of square for a boundary
fullish outside off. Tries to guide it fine but finds backward point
full on middle. Quicker ball. Dug away, helicopter-ed along the ground to long on
back of a length outside off. Drags a pull from outside edge and its gone up in the air! But falls between the outfielders on the leg side, around the deep midwicket area
quick ball. Full outside off stump. Ball's past him before he could get the bat forward to meet it
back of a length, angling into his chest area. Bottom edges the pull onto his own body
good length on off. Googly turning in. Backs away and cuts to point, can't get any run
tosses it up, full on middle. Flicks with quick hands to wide long on for a single. Team hundred
length ball on off. Googly turns in, and Unadkat cuts through point's left. Soft lbw appeal from the bowler, he thought it might have grazed the flap of the pad before going to the bat
that's 20 rows back! Full on middle. Extra air, slower through the air. Surya gets down on one knee, and deposits a six with a slog sweep
full on middle, and clipped off the front foot to deep midwicket for one
full on off stump. Turning in, and defended off the front foot, this googly. Hasaranga 2/28 tonight

chest before wicket? Harshal bowls a slower ball, but it's a full toss. Suryakumar bent low to get out of the ball's way, but the ball follows him, and it has thumped into him. They appeal for lbw, but not given out. RCB review and the first thing the TV umpire checks for is "waist-high no ball" and he confirms it is fine. Ball tracking says it is hitting him in line, and impact on stumps is "umpire's call", appearing like it would've clipped leg stump. Suryakumar survives, and aren't we glad it was the slower ball that hit him near the chest.
yorker length, on off. Dug away to the on side. Suryakumar could've taken a single, but didn't
short and wide. Suryakumar flays this with the bat's face looking up on purpose. Sliced over the infield for four
slower ball. Length ball on middle. Suryakumar swivels, waits for the ball to get to him, and then flicks it to the left of Siraj at fine leg. Akash Deep runs around, and dives to stop a four
in the slot, just outside off. Unadkat gets forward, and drills it over Harshal's head for four. Full face of the bat, and a brave shot with mid off inside the circle
full just outside off. Unadkat tries to drive again. This time it's a mistimed slice over cover, but still yields him two with Faf chasing after the ball
length ball, full outside off. Suryakumar stands tall and punches it off the back foot over extra cover for six!
fifty partnership as Suryakumar gets this full ball through midwicket. The siren goes on very late....no ball!

good comeback Length ball outside off, SKY tried to slap it through the off side but mistimed back to Siraj. Siraj aims at the stumps, and even though he misses, Suryakumar is on the floor since he put in a dive anyway
full on his pads, and flicked to deep midwicket. His 15th IPL fifty. Applause from the dug out, they know how important this is as Mumbai now inch towards 140
top edged but lands well short of fine leg. Short ball, and Unadkat gave the pull an attempt. Too late into the shot, with Siraj cranking the speed up
glorious strokeplay. Full on leg, Suryakumar clears the front leg, and uses his wrists to play a flick in such a way that the ball flies high into the night sky before landing in the stands. Wristy.

ridiculous! Attempted wide yorker at 145 kph. Suryakumar just sticks the bat out and slices the ball. It flies over first slip, and not only that, it has hit the boundary skirting on the full! 23 run over
slower ball full toss outside off. Tries to go for a big heave over the off side. But misses it altogether
another dot. Two top balls keeping Unadkat on strike. Short ball, full pace. On off stump. Unadkat goes for the pull but the ball whizzes past his ears

there's the single to bring SKY back. Yorker length on middle, and Unadkat hits it straight past the diving bowler. Suryakumar wanted to get on strike desperately, he had started running even before Unadkat had gotten bat on ball
can't put it away! Suryakumar fails to connect. Back of a length slower ball on off. Suryakumar walks across to the off side and tries to play it towards short fine leg. On the bounce to the keeper
what a final over this has been from Harshal. Offcutter, full outside off. Suryakumar tried to drag a slog from outside off but the ball dipped, went under the bat, and through to DK again
breaches 150! Harshal bowls a full toss wide outside off, and Suryakumar swings across the line. Top connection, flies over deep midwicket and Mumbai finish on 151 for 6
full and moving away from outside off, left alone
play and a miss. Hint of width, Faf looks to slash that away through point but is beaten by the low bounce
short of a length on off, Faf bunts it into the off side
bowls a lifter on middle and leg, Faf beaten for pace as this deflects off the thigh pad to short fine
short and angling away, Rawat drops his wrists and sways out of the way
right behind the line as he turns this back to the bowler
full and swinging into middle, pushed into the off side for a quick single
angling in on a length from wide of the crease, Rawat is hit high on the pad as he tries to work it to the leg side
squared up by the length but he somehow manages to defend it nicely into the off side
flat-batted for six! A sashay down the pitch as he swatted that short of length delivery over mid-off. Sailed over comfortably
even straighter, same result! This time moves leg side of the ball as he advances and goes through with the shot. More elevation than the previous delivery but enough to carry it over
slower and fuller on off, defended
welcomes himself into the attack with a toe-crusher, except Faf manages to keep it out of the way as he digs it into the leg side for a single
nicely worked into the gap between midwicket and mid-on
looks to work it off his hip, may have come off the thigh pad, rolls wide of short fine leg
full toss honing into the leg stump, worked to mid-on
tucked to short fine as they scamper a quick single
neat roll of the wrists as he works it to deep square
full and angling down leg, Faf misses a tickle. Wide called
worked through square leg for a single
full and angling away, Rawat toe-ends a wallop to mid-off
full, straight and fast on middle and off, Rawat defends and gets a thick inside edge onto the pad
moves leg side of the ball and glides it nicely, a half-stop at backward point keeps it down to just a single
off a thick inside edge down to fine leg. Excellent work by Unadkat
just wide of Rohit, the diving midwicket fielder. Rawat with an uppish flick. Lucky to get away
full on middle and leg, turned to deep midwicket
skiddy delivery on a length, defended
flatter and fuller, Faf is well forward as he defends
full but Faf nearly has to dig it back to the bowler because he doesn't get to the pitch
wrong un that breaks back in off a length on middle, impact outside leg as it hits Faf's pads as he tries to whip it square
punched straight to mid-off
backs away and swipes this away between cover and mid-off, Pollard with a laboured effort behind that before he puts his boot out to stop
full toss, worked straight to mid-on, couple of bounces to the fielder
cracking cutter on a length. Deviated wickedly off the deck to square Rawat up. Beaten
full on the stumps, kept out
was lining up for a big swing into the leg side but didn't get the free swing of the arms, defends to get a thick inside edge to short fine leg
squirted away but an excxellent stop at backward point by Brevis saves four
picked away! Juicy full toss and Rawat is down on one knee as he slog sweeps over deep square leg
drilled down the ground, outstading from Surya to cover ground from long-off to stop it with a dive. That was traveling
bludgeoned! Backs away and hammers this overpitched delivery between cover and mid-off
shortish outside off, cut asway into the gap at deep point, two more. RCB getting a move-on now
wrists this down to long-on
slides this across, Rawat has to reach out to cut. Wide called
wrong'un on leg, defended as he gets forward
short of length outside off, pulled to wide long-on

chopped down to backward point, good stop. Terrible mix-up with the running , Rawat with a desperate dive but a better throw to Pollard may have been curtains. That is if he collected the throw properly
bunted wide of point
neatly tucked off his hip behind square for a single
slower and fuller on off, Faf looks to pick the gap between point and short third but can't
thulps this to a diving cover fielder but scampers a quick single. Jeez, he hit that really hard
there's a breakthrough! Faf has holed out to long-on. Unadkat with a cutter, Faf got it off the top part of the bat which meant the timing wasn't quite right. straight into Surya's basket.
defended back first up
tucked down to fine leg to get off the mark
another cutter on a length, Rawat pats it gently for a quick single. A mere eye contact with Kohli and off they went
back-of-the-hand slower ball on a length outside off, Kohli bunts it behind square on the off side for a single
pushed into the gap for a single behind point
was looking for the big mow into the leg side but this delivery got stuck into the pitch and deviated a long way to beat Rawat
swung away to deep square
there was deep point no more than 10 yards away from the ball but Kohli still beat him to the fence! Stepped out and used the width to wallop that hard.
runs it down to third man
hit hard, one bounce to long-on
drilled! Full on off, and Rawat hammers it over Kohli's head for a boundary. Races away off the grass
back of a length, extra bounce. Pulled in front of square to the deep for a single
full and wide. Googly turning in as Kohli presses forward and tries to swipe it through the off side. Inside edged onto his body
dancing shoes are on! Full on off. Gives Ashwin the charge and flicks it off his toes through midwicket for an exquisite four
flatter ball, played towards short third for a single
good length on leg. Turning to off. Stays on the back foot and fends it to point
welcome to the attack, says Kohli. Full on leg stump. Kohli had moved away anyway, exposing all three stumps, and simply chips it off his toes courtesy his wrists to midwicket for four
back of a length on off stump. Kohli bunts it off the back foot to midwicket
short ball. Risky ball with fine leg inside the circle and Kohli looking to attack. He aims to pull after taking a few steps down the ground, but then gets low to let the ball through
back of a length, off-stump line. Fended off the back foot, and the ball rolls past Thampi. They scurry across for one

sounds so s-w-e-e-t! Full on middle and leg. Rawat nonchalantly flicks it off his toes, and the ball sails over deep midwicket! The replay shows how he used his wrists to give the shot a whip that took it upwards
slashed but slashed hard! Good length ball angling across. Looks to cut, and has enough in that shot to fly past point's right!
fullish outside off. Played square to Tilak in the deep on the off side, and he cruises back for the second run
pace off. Length ball angling into Kohli with that angle. Tucked off his hips to midwicket with soft hands, and they race off for the first one quickly. Is two on? Nope, choose not to
moves to 48 with that single. Unadkat around the stumps, length ball on leg and middle. Fended off the back foot to the off side
over the stumps. Full outside off and angling across. Driven away from his body to deep extra cover
around the stumps to Rawat. Slower ball bouncer on leg stump and angling across. Rawat is interested to slap it square, but eventually misses getting any connection
full slower ball outside off stump. Rawat pushes at it to cover, and they take off for a single. Brevis attacks the ball, picks, and has a shy at the batter's end, but no direct hit

full ball on middle. Nurdled away to midwicket where there's a gap for one. Off they go, and Rawat raises his bat after getting to the other side. Strike-rate of 132 so far, and he'll want to stay there till the end now
good length ball on a fourth-stump line. Kohli pokes at it, and sends it down to third man for a single
guides this length ball outside off to point for a single
Kohli 1 - 0 Bumrah. Back of a length outside off and he drags a pull from outside off and sends it in front of square. One bounce four to cow corner and Kohli gives Rawat a heavy fist bump
bouncer. Back of a length outside off. Kohli can't put it away behind square on the off side. Through to the gloveman
length ball angling into his hips. Kohli flicks it behind square, forcing deep square leg to run to his right. A dive on the boundary line saves the four, but Kohli's placement was spot on there

Brevis! Nerves? The crowd rejoices. Length ball pulled to deep midwicket, where Brevis was lurking. It's turned out to be a low catch for him, but he can't hold on. The ball goes through him and that's four more for Kohli. Dropped
full on his toes, and whipped to the right of long on. Couple more for Virat

length ball on an off-stump line. Kohli shapes to pull but the ball stays low and goes under the blade to Kishan. There was some sound from the stump mic, and replays show the ball kissed the trousers
good length, on off stump. Places a pull to wide long on for a single
good length ball on middle and off. Rawat wants to pull but he's not in position. Uncomfortably dragged to the bowler's left
wants to pull this length ball in front of square but ends up flat-batting a mistimed shot to mid on instead. He'll keep the strike as we take the evening's final time out
dibbly-dobbly pace. Length ball, wide outside off. Slaps a cut, past point's right for a run
gives Pollard a charge as the bowler goes wide and full. Rawat mistimes a dragged shot past Pollard's left to long on for one though
full on middle. Tucked with soft hands to midwicket and he runs the first one hard. But Tilak runs in quickly to ensure they don't think of a second
Pollard bowls a wide full toss, way outside off stump, with Rawat offering no shot
slower ball, full and wide outside off. Rawat loses his shape as he tries to swipe across the line, Misses it completely

Rawat swats Pollard away after that! Pollard bowls a gentle length ball on leg stump, and Rawat has smacked it across the line by going deep in his crease and exploring the region behind square on the leg side
full toss wide outside off. Drilled to deep extra cover with a cut
around the stumps. Length ball on off stump, and angling across. Cut in front of square, finds the fielder at cover

gets to double six with a six! And that's his sixth sixth! Full on middle. Rawat skips down the ground and hammers a slog from his pads over deep midwicket. So confident right now that he took on the player positioned on the boundary line there

\yorker, on leg stump or maybe just outside it. Rawat misses any connection, hits him, and they scurry across for one. Huge lbw appeal but turned down. Mumbai review but pitching just outside leg. Rawat survives
full just outside off. Ball angles into VK sharply as he can't connect with the cut. Ball whizzes over off stump

length on off. Bunted to mid on's right, but Kohli wants two. Rawat does as Kohli says, but he's fallen short! Direct hit from Ramandeep who runs in from the deep and throws at the base of the stumps. Ends Rawat's knock of 66
full just outside off. Knocked to the off side for one

Almost a run out, but then overthrows as Kohli punched this length ball outside off to backward point. Brevis dived and threw it to the batter's end, which would've had DK run out for a 0-ball duck, but he missed. Poor backing up from Tilak allows the overthrow run
takes a single by knocking it to the side
length ball just outside off. Wants to guide it to third man but the ball ends up hitting the bat's inside half instead
crucial dot. Back of a length on off. Kohli wants to ramp it over the keeper, but can't connect. Bit of a groan from him after missing out

terrific from Kohli and DK, forcing the pressure and errors from Mumbai. Length ball on middle, and Kohli very gently tapped it to midwicket. Called for two early, and DK was going to be in comfortably at the bowler's end, but the fielder Tilak makes an awry throw, and that's another overthrow run for RCB.

DK turning it on!. Usual transmission from Dinesh Karthik, so quick off the blocks always. Doesn't bother to see Bumrah's final ball of the evening off, instead sees the short ball and pulls in front of square for six.

over the stumps. Full on middle, and Kohli presses forward to defend. Ball doesn't turn as much, and the ball goes past the bat's inside half. Hits the front leg, and lbw appeal is given out! Has Brevis taken a wicket off his first IPL delivery? And that too Kohli? Hold on, young man, Kohli has reviewed.- This is close because the ball is close to the bat's edge AND the pad. What will the TV umpire decide? He decides that the ball is too close to the bat and pad at the same time, so he has to go with the on-field umpire's decision (of out) on the bat/pad issue and doesn't have evidence to overrule it. The rest is decided by technology, as ball-tracking says that's crashing into middle. Kohli isn't happy, but he has to go for 48 and Brevis has a first baller!
welcome back, Maxi! Half-tracker outside off. Maxwell goes for the switch hit, and thumps a left-hander's pull behind square for four
length ball outside off. Maxwell stays on the back foot, thumps a cut in front of square, and that is GAME OVER. Royal Challengers Bangalore win by seven wickets
good ball first up. On a back of a length on middle and off, and angled in but going on straight off the pitch. Tapped down
outside edge, and past the lone man at slip! Bhuvi is left amused. On a fuller length and around fifth stump, as Uthappa went driving only to get it wide of slip for four to third man

chips that to cover, and survives again! This was again bowled full and wide of off, as he reaches out for it while playing a check drive. Sundar at point dived to his left at point to get a half stop
pushes this full and straight ball down the ground, and beats mid-on to his left. That was played softly, and they managed two
punches this good length ball wide of off to the man at cover-point. Presents the full face of the bat to play at that
and this time dabbed to point with an open face of the bat. Again on a slightly back of a length outside off from Bhuvi
good length ball on off, and straightening off the pitch. He opens the bat face to tap that to point
on a shorter length on middle and leg, and he gets good bounce. Clipped down towards square leg to get off the mark
pretty full line and just outside off. Pushed to mid-off after coming right forward
pulled to deep square leg! Jansen goes short on middle, as Uthappa swivels while pulling to the right of square leg. Fine leg chases to his left and pulls the ball back last moment
on the fuller side of a good length on middle. Defended forward off the inside edge
pleasing cover drive! Presents the full face of the bat to that full ball outside off, which is right in the driving length. Drills that to beat cover to his left

has a big heave, and sends that off the outside edge over cover! The longer boundary there means it is pulled back by the point fielder chasing that. Full length ball outside off, and looked like Uthappa wanted to flick that to the on side
fuller on middle this time. He closes the bat face to clip to midwicket
deep point was pushed back, and so Uthappa gets only a single. Full and in the channel outside off, as he drives all along the ground now
full and just about on off. He goes low to block to mid-off
pulls his length back just a touch, and again goes outside off. Tapped to point
cut away to third man! Point and third man were both inside the circle, and Gaikwad got the width he wanted. On a good length and wide of off, as he effortlessly places that between the two men

Uthappa goes after the spinner first ball, and gone! Looks to slog-sweep that full and tossed-up ball which is bowled wide of off. He almost had to fetch that from that wide line, and so ended up skying that wide of mid-on, where Markram ran and went low across to his right. Sundar strikes first ball, and Sunrisers right in the game after an expensive first three overs
pretty full on off, and he jams his bat down for a single to long-off
full and closer to off, shaping to turn in. Blocked towards point
on a much shorter length outside off. Turns in with good bounce, and is punched back to the bowler from deep in the crease

Gaikwad's turn to sweep, and that is great fielding by Tripathi at deep backward square leg. Full ball on off, and Gaikwad is down on his knees early to slog that. Tripathi from fine leg runs and dives to his left to save a few for his side
this time the sweep gets him four! Plays this in front of square towards deep midwicket, where no man was present. Full length and there to smash on off, and Gaikwad was ready to launch into that
cuts hard at that short and wide ball outside off, but finds point. He played away from his body there
the short delivery, which was a matter of moments away with Moeen at the crease. Digs it in short just outside off, as it sails off the pitch after he sways out of the way
clips this back of a length ball on middle and off to deep midwicket, as deep square leg runs across to his right to cut that off
on a shortish length on fourth stump. Tapped to point from close to his body
and some tight lengths here. On the shorter side of a good length on off, and Mo blocks it down with a loud call of "no"
looked like was ready to pull, but the ball wasn't all that short. On a good length on off, and he eventually has to clip to deep square leg's right

nails it first ball! What a dream start to have. On a pretty full length on middle, and bowled with an upright seam. That threatened to angle in, as Gaikwad shaped to flick, but the length was a bit too full to facilitate that shot. There is gap between bat and pad, and the ball rams through to shatter the stumps
stands outside leg already, as the ball is on a good length on middle while also swinging in. He has a poke, but the ball takes the bottom edge

skips down the pitch now - in a hurry here - and hoicks that rather uncomfortably. The ball was a touch fuller on leg, and Rayudu played from the inside half of the bat to fine leg while almost losing his balance
Short fine leg runs and slides to his right, but in vain. And he himself signals four, so no need to go upstairs. Mo clips this full delivery angling into his pads, and gets his first four of the day
full length on off this time. The length is not all that different to what got Gaikwad, as Mo defends to the off side
tucked to the bowler on the bounce. Full again outside off, and this time he nudges at that a bit away from his body
on a back of a length on off, and shaping to angle in at 140kph. Blocked down after opening himself up
excellent dive by Abhishek diving to his right at point. A touch fuller from the bowler and a little wide of off, as Rayudu looked to punch
outside edge, and four! No slip there, and that raced away. Pooran could only look on. A very late attempt to have a poke at that shortish ball just outside off, and manages four in the end
on the shorter side of a good length in the channel, as Rayudu looks to punch but is beaten. That was fired at 145kph
dances down to try and smack that short of a length ball on off, but is beaten. Rayudu looking impatient from ball one today, wonder where he'll end up
looks to pull, but the ball isn't short enough this time. On a fullish length outside off, as he walks across to pull with his front leg in the air but gets an edge on to his pads
good length ball on middle, and clipped off the inside edge to square leg
punches that to deep backward point. Short and wide of off, and he plays with a slightly open face of the bat
on a good length and just outside off. Cuts towards deep point
short of a length on off, and pushed to deep point after a step back in the crease
much fuller on middle and leg. Softly nudges that to long-off while playing from outside leg
skips down, and Sundar bowls on a shortish length on leg. Pulled to fine leg with a hint of turn into him
fullish ball angling into him and finishing on middle and off. Fired at 153kph. Rayudu goes across and tries to flick to the on side, and gets that off the inside edge
bangs it in short on middle and off. Mo has to ride the bounce while hopping in the crease, and pats that down
slashed to deep backward point! Pretty full length this time, and in the channel outside off. Mo uses the pace of the bowler to send that flying over point for four
good length ball on middle, and clips to deep midwicket with a closed face of the bat
reaches out for that short and wide-ish ball outside off, which climbed on to him off the pitch. Manages to swat that over extra cover while leaping in the crease

flayed away over cover! Malik gives his second boundary of the over, and provides Rayudu with what he has been waiting for ever since he came to the crease. Full and right in the hitting zone outside off, as Rayudu lofts that with high elbows to deep extra cover
on a good length on middle and leg, and clipped to deep backward square leg from deep in the crease
again skips down after making room, and the ball is a on a shortish length on middle and leg. Presents the full face of the bat for a single to long-off
pretty full and quick on off. Pushed to deep point
goes slashing hard at that pretty full ball on off, and sends that on the bounce to deep backward point
off the inside edge to the on side, as he goes pushing at that good length ball on off which is coming into him
again goes heaving, but this ball is fuller on middle and leg. Gets a bottom edge towards fine leg
Sundar at cover has to turn and run, and he stretches his hand out only for the ball to land wide. On a back of a length outside off, and Mo looked to loft
goes flashing at that, and gets four wide of third man! Fuller in length and wide of off, as he gets a top edge to fly behind the wicket for a rusty four
heaved to deep midwicket! This was hit cleaner, as he went low and swung across the line to this fullish ball on middle and off. Four more
steps across late, and dabs that good length ball outside off to point on the bounce
makes room and dances down, as Jansen spots that and bowls with a scrambled seam on a short of a length on middle. Rayudu pulls and is beaten by the bounce
again he makes room and dances. Fuller length and wider of off, and swatted to long-off
short and wide of off, and he slaps that to deep point from deep in the crease
a swinging yorker that was tailing into Mo. He ends up clipping that to deep midwicket and plays it like a low full toss
change of pace there. On a back of a length on leg, as Rayudu again stands after making room. Dabbed to point for another single

dropped by Malik at short third man! He nearly clung on to that, having to dive to his left with the ball being highish there. On a fuller length outside off from Nattu, and Mo went slogging but got an outside edge
drills this drive to deep point, as he plays this fullish ball after backing away
a near yorker length ball on off, and jammed to long-off
pulls this to the longer side of the boundary to deep square leg. On a short of a length on middle, and whacked

gets a top edge, and that flies for six nevertheless! The pace of 146kph from Malik means Mo ends up benefiting, since it wasn't a long boundary either at fine leg. On a short of a length again on middle and off, and he went for the pull

four to third man! Mo gets the ball rolling after a slow start. Another shortish ball, but this a touch wide of off. Mo waited for the ball to come before ramping late. Beats third man scampering to his right
much fuller on middle, and angling into his pads. Flicked to deep square leg
a yorker length ball on off, as Rayudu is across the stumps early. Jammed down from deep in the crease
short and wide of off at 152kph, and he goes across while trying to slash at that away from his body
goes pulling but gets an inside edge towards square leg, with the ball not being short enough on middle and off
skips down, and the ball is there in the length on leg. But he gets an inside edge on to his pad

finds long-on this time! Wanted to send this out of the ground, and once again he made room and cane down the pitch to this full ball on leg. The ball was a bit tossed up, and also in the hitting zone, but Rayudu doesn't get the placement there
pretty full on middle, and flicked to deep square leg
goes to lap-sweep that, but the ball is a touch short and outside off for that short
back of a length on middle and leg, and floated at 98kph. Clipped to deep square leg
and Mo dances down first ball, with the ball being fullish and on leg. Hoicked to long-on off the inside half of the bat
slower, and on a good length on middle. Nearly chipped to midwicket there
shortish and wide of off. Slashed to deep point, who does well to cut that off to his right and keep it to one
six over long-on! Never looked like that was going all the way, but such is his power. On a shortish length on middle and off, and he pulls from deep in the crease. Great placement there

taken at long-on now! The Markram gamble works for Sunrisers. Slower and fuller in length on middle, and a hint of turn away. Mo goes for the slog over the on side again, but this time finds the man right at the edge of the rope. Super Kings lose two set batters in quick succession
goes to sweep first ball, as the ball is full on off. Can only nudge that close to his right, as the keeper threatens to whip the bails off after collecting that
on a back of a length outside off, with Dube standing on leg stump. He closes the bat face to clip to deep square leg
much fuller and a little straighter on middle and leg. Pushed to long-on with the full face of the bat

gifted to short third man! Soft dismissal there. He tries to use the pace of the bowler while attempting to guide that short of a length ball outside off over third man. Finds the man placed inside the circle as he plays late, and that lands another blow for Super Kings
runs that down third man from close to his body, with the ball being on a good length just outside off
driven down to long-on. Much fuller length on off, and he plays with the full face of the bat
slower ball now. On a back of a length on off, and he waits before dabbing it towards point
guides that back of a length ball outside off after playing late to short third man. A rapid run stolen even as the throw went at the bowler's end
past the outside edge! On a good length on off, as he looked to poke at that but was beaten. Good accurate stuff from Bhuvi
back of a length on off. He closes the bat face to clip to square leg, as the bowler gives the chase to his left. They rush for two there
a full toss on middle, and clipped to deep square leg. Perhaps Bhuvi missed his yorker there
has a jab at that good length outside off, but doesn't get bat on ball
slower ball, and beaten again. This one angles away after pitching on a good length outside off again, as Dhoni has a flash but is beaten
shapes to swing to the on side, and ends up sweeping to long leg. On a back of a length and wide of off, as he fetches it from outside off after going down on his knees
much fuller length and angling into him. Clipped to deep square leg

finds fine leg with his pull! Jansen sends Dhoni packing with his first ball to him. He bowls a slower ball on a back of a length on middle and leg, and that rolling of the fingers on the seam means the ball angles away after pitching. Dhoni pulls from middle and off, and finds Malik right where he stood
another short of a length ball on middle. He skips in the crease before clipping down towards square leg
pretty full on off, and that is driven down the ground. Tripathi at long-on runs to his right and tumbles to save a few
looks to swing to the on side, but the ball is fullish on his pads. He misses and lets out a roar, as the ball hits his pad
lands a yorker on middle. Clipped to fine leg after bringing the bat down late
another yorker there. Great bowling at the death. Lands that on middle, as Jadeja gets an inside edge on to his pad
a yorker on off this time. He can only manage to jam that to extra cover with an open face of the bat
he tries to back away, but it is another perfect yorker on off. He loses his bottom hand, and ends up pushing to long-off
that goes wayyyy high, and is called wide. Bangs it in short - why would you after nailing those yorkers - outside off, and Jadeja lets that go
drilled down the ground! That was a fine shot considering the length was a bit too full on off for that. He lofts that back, as Nattu hangs his left hand out before withdrawing it

six to end the over! Jadeja gets the hitting length this time, and the extra delivery in the over results in six. In that length outside off which allows a free swing of the arms, as the ball flies off the bat over the bowler's head
wide down the leg side. Bravo shuffles back and across, and Bhuvi lands that full and wide of leg
full toss on middle, and launched over the bowler's head! A one-bounce four there. He swings off his bottom hand, and sends that bang straight
goes to pull this back of a length ball on leg, but gets that off the inside half of the bat to deep midwicket
another wide. Short and wide of off, and Jaddu goes flashing at that away from his body but doesn't connect
and the third wide of the over. Bhuvi feeling the pressure. This was much fuller but still pretty wide of off. Left alone as it was angling away

taken at extra cover! Williamson there had to backpedal his way while keeping his eyes on the ball. He took a few steps to his right, and nabbed that. A low full toss on off - maybe a yorker that Bhuvi was aiming - as Jadeja ended up ballooning the ball since the length was too full for that attempted loft. Williamson takes that with a reverse cup
more wide balls. Pretty short outside off, and that flies over the batter. Left alone
loses his bottom hand to that slower ball bowled full outside off. But the ball takes off, and somehow lands between both long-off and long-on running forward. 150 up though
low full toss on middle, and clipped to deep midwicket. The longer boundary there allows them to bag two
swats that full and wide ball outside off to long-off, who chases to his right. They manage two more, as they rush for the second run
Almost catching practice to start off! Short in length outside off, Abhishek pulls it towards the left of mid-on to get off the mark. Went on the bounce to Jordan there.
Length ball outside off, angling away. Williamson shoulders arms.
On a length around off, Williamson hops and defends it back.
Fuller and honing in on the off stump, Williamson pushes it towards covers.
Back of a length now, around the fifth stump. Williamson is on his toes as he pushes it towards point and shouts "NO!"
Full and swinging in on off, squeezed towards backward point. Five dots, just a single. Good start for Choudhary.
Darted it fuller around middle, Abhishek defends with a straight bat.
Slower this time, fuller on middle. Driven through wide mid-off for a single.
Fuller and outside off, pushes Williamson back in defence.
A 'hit-me' ball, Williamson obliges! Half-tracker outside off, he stays deep and cuts it through cover-point for the first four of the innings.
Very full on off, dug back towards the bowler.
Flatter trajectory, just outside off. Punches it back to the bowler. Good way to end the over.

Done him for pace but lands just short of Shivam Dube running in! Dug short around middle, Abhishek is hurried as he goes for the pull. Ends up getting a top edge. Dube runs in from fine leg and dives but lands just short.
Length ball outside off, pushed towards the off side.
Excellent running. Taps the full ball to the off side and hares to the other end.
Length ball angling in, worked away through backward square leg for a couple.
Fuller around middle, driven to mid-on.
Nails the pull this time! Short in length, Abhishek was anticipating it perhaps. Stands tall and hits it over midwicket for four.
Quicker one on a length around off, pats it towards midwicket for a quick run.

Slices it hard and gets the desired result. Floated outside off, spins after landing. Abhishek looks to go over covers but ends up getting it off the outer half over the short third man. Has enough in it to go to the rope.
Fuller around off, pushed towards covers for one.
Fuller around the fourth stump line, defended solidly off the front foot.
Tossed up fuller around middle, Williamson gets to the pitch of it and drives it to long-on for one.
Fuller on middle, whips it through midwicket with a call of "two, two, two" and gets it comfortably.
Length ball on the pads, flicked to short fine leg.
Fuller outside off, driven to covers.
Beauty! Length ball, just a touch short. Williamson hops and looks to punch but the nip-back cuts him into half.
Length ball outside off, taps it to the right of short third man for one.
Angling in on a length, tucked towards midwicket.
Similar delivery on a length, defended from the crease back towards the bowler. Just one run of the penultimate over of the powerplay.
Quicker and fuller around middle, pushed towards midwicket for a quick run.
Majestic hit! Tossed up outside off, Sharma brings his wrists into play as he goes inside out over cover.
Slower through the air on a length on middle, Abhishek lets it come to him before tapping it in front of point for one.
Fuller on off, driven towards covers. Abhishek wanted a run but it was hit straight to the fielder.
Very full on middle and leg, drilled to long-on for one.
Mighty! Floated around middle, Abhishek gets down on his knee and under the ball. Thumps it over deep midwicket to sign off from the powerplay with a six.
Tossed up around off, Williamson reaches out and defends.
Fuller on middle, pushed to cover. Williamson is on 10 off 23.
Flatter just outside off, goes back and taps it towards the left of backward point. Uthappa misfields and concedes a second.
Flatter on the pads, worked away through midwicket for one.
Darted in on a length, angling away. Goes back to punch it through backward point for two.
Flatter one on middle, punched back to the left of the bowler.
Flatter ball outside off, slapped through point for one.
Pushes this fuller one to the off side for one.
Loopy ball on off, driven to long-on for one.
Flatter on the pads, works it through midwicket. Wants a second but isn't on as Moeen does the mop up.
Lovely shot that. Tossed up ball, Williamson dances down to get to the pitch of it and hits it straight over the bowler's head to bring up the 50. "No, Mo!" shouts Dhoni.
Quicker outside off, smashed straight to cover.
Flatter on the pads, worked away through backward square leg for one
Fuller on middle, turned through midwicket for one.
A touch short, cut away in front of square on the off side for a brace.
Fuller, driven towards deep midwicket for one.
Fired in on a length, punched off the back foot through midwicket for one.
Picks the length early. A bit short, Abhishek transfers his weight back and pulls it to the vacant deep square leg region.
Length ball around off, climbs a bit more than Williamson expected. Fends it to the off side.
Fuller on middle, pushes it with the full face towards mid-on for one.
Angling away on a length, Sharma stays back and cuts it through point for a couple. Was the longer boundary.
Clever running. Abhishek works it away towards the vacant midwicket region for a couple. It is the shorter end, so the fielders in the deep are very deep.
Well outside off, Sharma lets it go.
Full and outside off, driven to sweeper for a single.
Full outside off, finds cover with the drive.
Fuller and angling away, Abhishek opens the face for one towards short third.
Williamson is happy to go back and tap this length ball towards covers for one.
Fuller this time, easily pushed towards covers for one.
Slower and fuller around off and middle, pushed towards Moeen at covers for another quick one.
Abhishek dances down to the length ball and heaves it to deep square leg. Longer part of the ground and gets two.
Flatter and fuller outside off, hit to backward point.
Shot! Length ball angling in. Williamson stays back, just pulls it through backward square leg. No chance for fine leg running to his left.
Fuller this time, pushed towards covers for one.

First half-century in IPL for Abhishek Sharma! Stays back and steers the length ball through point for a couple. One run short and he stays on 49. Didn't get his bat across the crease at the other end.
Gets his fifty now, Abhishek! Guides the length ball to third man to get to the other end. He's been at the forefront of this chase so far.
