On a length on the pads, tucked to fine leg for one.
Ho, ho, ho, it's a beauty! On a length from around the wicket, he clears front leg and swats it over long-on for a maximum. Easy to the eye.
And there's the wicket! Choudhary gets Williamson. Soft, soft dismissal. Full ball outside off, catching practice for Moeen at short extra cover. The SRH captain is livid with himself.
Length ball on the pads, tucked away to fine leg to get going.
On a length outside off, hit straight to backward point.
Punches the length ball through covers to get to the other end.
Nails the pull! Short ball down leg, Tripathi uses the pace to help it wayyyy over fine leg. Just the second ball he faced. Wow.
The extra bounce on the length ball means the ball passes above Tripathi's attempted glide.

Full length ball outside off, enough width for Abhishek to swing his arms. Thrashes it through covers for four. The sweeper runs to his left and jars his knee on the surface as he gets out the dive, all in vain.
Yorker on off, dug out back to the bowler.
Low full toss outside off, swatted to long-on for one.
Just past midwicket! Full and on the pads, whipped it just past a diving Jadeja and gets four.
Slower one on a length, mistimes the pull through midwicket for one.

Dropped! And it's Jadeja. Slower one on a fuller length, away from him. Abhishek had to reach out to it but checked his shot. Spooned a catch to the right of backward point. Jadeja dived full strength but only got his finger tips.
Length ball on middle and leg, pushed back.
On a length outside off, flayed over cover-point for one.
Short ball angling away, Tripathi moves to the off side and guides it to third man for one.
Stand and deliver! Effortless, brilliant and maximum. Stands tall to the length ball and bashes it right over the bowler's head for half a dozen.
Fuller now, pushed to long-on for one.
Now Tripathi gets into Choudhary. Hits the length ball well over the leaping cover fielder for four. 13 runs off Mukesh's final over.
Flatter on middle, turned to midwicket for one.
Length ball on the pads, tucked away to short fine leg for one.
Fired in on the pads, worked away through square leg for one.
Flatter outside off, punched back past the bowler for one.
Fuller around middle and leg, defended. "Doesn't matter," shouts Tripathi from the other end.
Fuller outside off, driven to covers. Just four runs from it.
Perfect start after the time-out! Overpitched on off, Tripathi lofts it straight over long-off.

Troubles compound for Jordan and CSK. Short ball down leg, Tripathi gets a top edge over the wicketkeeper's head on the pull. Jordan's right hand clips the bail at the bowler's head and it's a no ball as a result.
The free hit doesn't cost much. Full ball, hit straight to sweeper for one.
Off-pace ball on a length, slammed to long-off for one.
That's timed and placed to perfection. Full and outside off, Tripathi just slashes hard at that. Connects it perfectly and hits the square drive beating point and third man.
Full and outside off, hit to sweeper for one.
Very full on off, squeezed towards covers for one. 19 runs coming off the over.
Sprayed well outside off, left alone.

End of Abhishek's brilliant stay in the middle! Bravo's slower ball does it for CSK. Takes the aerial route but ends up finding long-off on the bigger side of the ground. Greeted with a standing ovation by the SRH dugout and rightly so.
Edged but four! Full ball on a length, angling away. Pooran hangs his bat at it but gets a thick edge. Short third dives over it as Bravo is on his haunches.
Full and outside off, goes past the flashing blade of Pooran. Wided.
Fuller ball at a slower pace, steered to short third man for a quick single.
Tripathi trickles it fine to get SRH their first points this season. A low full toss on the pads, gets enough blade to leave Dhoni behind with no chance.
fired in full on off stump, presenting a beautiful seam, starts to wobble back in as Agarwal defends towards point
length and holding its line, comes off the outer half of the bat as Agarwal gropes forward
touch shorter, 136kph and he jumps across to defend square on the off side
pumped over the head of mid-on, Shami gets a little too full and straight and Agarwal gets the scoreboard ticking with a lofted four
back of a length and steered towards point from the crease
banged in and he's hanging back, opens the face on a single to third
over the wicket, back of a length into the hip, comes off the padding for one
chopped past the dive of Wade! Too close to cut but Dhawan throws the hands, gets away with a thick inside edge
length ball sliding across the bows, 136kph and Dhawan lets this go
short length on the body and worked down to fine leg
[itched up in the channel, Agarwal is watchful defending with an open face towards point

bumper, flapped to midwicket! Another low score for Agarwal, and he's chewed up quite a few balls this time, too. Banged into the pitch and he took on the pull, but it came high off the bat, presenting Rashid Khan with an easy catch. Kings lose their captain early, and it's Titans' captain who does the job
another streaky edge to fine leg, Dhawan neither back nor forward and the bat scissors down, chopped past the stumps for four once again
short and swerving away at 139kph, he watches this one through
jumps down, shortish length and Dhawan follows it with the hands, almost slashes to third on the full
tickled off the pads, Bairstow gets going with four! Nibbling back in but he was on his toes and times it well through square leg
slightly back of a length, tucked to midwicket
back of a length, 137kph on fifth stump and YJB defends, the ball bouncing down close to the off stump as he comes across and wards off any danger
back of a length length, zipping through outside off as Dhawan hangs the bat out
beats the inside edge, lovely line from Pandya and again Dhawan nearly comes a cropper hanging his bat in the channel

tight single, there's a direct hit from Miller in the covers... it's going to the third umpire, but YJB is okay! Hard running from the Yorkshire terrier, slid his bat in adeptly as the diving underarm throw came in
back of a length, 132kph and tucked to the leg side
short, room to swing the arms, Bairstow connects well but picks out Miller at cover
creamed over midwicket! Casual as a walk on Scaborough seafront from Bairstow... short outside off and he serves up a portion of battered cod
lofted down the ground, slightly overpitched and Dhawan seizes on it, front elbow pointing the way as he clears mid-off with ease
crunched through the covers! Hit off a length with an angled bat, Ferguson's line was wide and he pays for it with another boundary
pace of to 147kph, dabbed down into the covers for a quick single
145kph, shortish and angling in, tucked to the leg side

goes for the ramp, picks out short third! Bairstow won't be improving that powerplay strike rate today. Fiery short ball and it veered back at him like a barracuda in the shallows, maybe struck the glove, otherwise it was travelling... well intercepted by the leaping Tawatia. Sachin Third ump wants to check the catch, but it was clean
short into the body and flicked fine, 143kph and he uses it to his advantage to get off the mark first ball. Went in the air but short fine leg wasn't a chance
floated up from over the wicket, clipped off leg stump through the infield
flicked off the stumps through midwicket
full and straightening, tapped back on the front foot
flighted and Dhawan is able to get down, works a couple in front of deep midwicket
googly, 99kph and spinning away on off, comes off a leading edge
possibly another wrong'un to finish, flicked through midwicket on the back foot
round the wicket, banged in and defended on off stump
length in the channel, tapped away warily
145kph on fourth stump and Dhawan punches on the up, gets it past cover for a couple to the sweeper
short and into the body as he walks across, flicked through backward square leg
slower ball, 127kph and loopy wide off off, Livingstone steers it into the point region for one
back of a length, hauled away through midwicket for a couple more
starts with a slower-ball bouncer, sailing through above Livingstone's noggin
banged in short on fourth stump, defended behind square for a quick single
skiddy length ball, 134kph wide of off as Dhawan slashes and fails to connect
skips out and throws the bat for a single to deep backward point
by the beard of Zeus that's gone far! Dances out and crumps him off a length, clean bat swing and it disappears over long-on for Livingstone's first six of the night. There could be more to come
slower ball wide of off stump, settles for a cut through point
length on off stump and Dhawan dabs it down square of the wicket
scuttles in and loops the ball up, worked through the leg side for two
flattish on off and dabbed into the point region
fizzes down a 96kph legbreak, Livingstone pokes a leading edge back towards the bowler

slapped hard into the leg side... but taken on the rope! Excellent running, jumping catch from Pandya - or so it looked on first glance. But his boot just slid into the boundary marker as he took a step and then attempted to throw the ball up and complete the catch; didn't quite let go in time. Livingstone is straight back to the middle as soon as he sees it on the big screen
steps out and punches to long-off
quick legbreak, coming back at Dhawan as he chops down and gets an inside edge
Livingstone scoops all the way! Twists the knife for Titans, walking across and using the pace on the ball to flick it for six
goes again, walking miles across and clearing Wade! Nalkande had shifted his line well outside off but couldn't prevent Livingstone playing the safe shot, this time for four
loses his shape attempting to slog down the ground. Decent slower ball that spins through wide of off stump
length ball, pace off again, dragged through midwicket on the pull. Looking to give it some proper welly, but came off the inside half of the bat
Dhawan takes a step down to a 134kph short ball, glided for one down to third
hammered through cover point! Livingstone cashes in on a short, wide ball. Punishing bat speed as he cuts in front of square

Tickled to the keeper! Full length ball on middle and off, and turning away from the left-hander. Dhawan has a poke at that with a slightly open face of the bat, but the ball turns away more than he perhaps anticipated, as the outside edge lands right into the keeper's gloves, who goes up straightaway
good length ball outside off, as he dabs that to point with the ball turning away
the googly now. Full ball on off which comes into him, as he tries to defend but gets an inside edge towards square leg. He is off the mark though
chips that to deep midwicket. Closes the bat face to that pretty full ball on middle and off, and gets a single in the vast space there
pretty full on off, as he opens the bat face a little to play a combination of sweep and loft to long-off, since he was down on his knees early to try and sweep
full delivery outside off, as he taps that towards point
good hard length on middle and off, and angling into him. He steps back in the crease to clip to deep midwicket
Slashed wide of third man! Short and wide of off, as he waits for the ball to come before lofting that late while using the width. Beats the man in the deep to his right. Great placement
on a back of a length and a touch wide of off. Tapped to point on the bounce from deep in the crease

backs away, and lofts that down the ground now! Jitesh wanted three, and they manage that in the end. That is excellent running. And great fielding by Gill to at long-on, as he dives to his left after chasing at the ball, and gets a left hand to push the ball back last moment. On a short of a length on off and rising on to him, as he swats that over the bowler's head
another short delivery on middle, and again there is extra bounce. He ducks, and that is called wide as the ball angles away into the keeper's gloves
goes to pull that wide-ish ball outside off after shuffling across, but the length isn't all that short. Gets an inside edge on to his body, as he sends Jitesh back

skips down a step after also shuffling across off, and ends up chipping the back of a length ball wide of off. Just places that close to the non-striker for a single to long-on, as Pandya tries to dive to his right and get a hand, but doesn't manage it
crashed through cover! Short and wide of off, and turning away, as he slashes that away from his body to beat deep point way to his right
short again, but closer to off. Again swatted to cover, where Pandya fumbles and allows a single
clears the longer boundary! Six over deep midwicket. Fuller length, but right in the hitting zone on middle and he gets down to swipe that across the line for a big six
More punishment for Tewatia! Six more! Fullish length on middle, and just about short enough for Jitesh to launch a pull over deep midwicket again
dropped by Manohar at long-off! Jitesh dances down early, as Tewatia bowls full and wide of off. Jitesh has to launch at that nevertheless since he is down the pitch

fifty for Livingstone, the second-fastest this season! He gets there off 21 balls, and they pick 24 off the over. Short of a length on middle, and again too short and friendly for a six over deep midwicket

taken at long-on! Jitesh's fun is over. A slower ball on a full length on off, and although that was there in the slot to put away, Jitesh was perhaps beaten by the lack of pace there since the ball didn't come to him as well as he would have liked. Gill in the deep comes running forward, and goes low to take a good catch pretty close to the circle

Another catch for Gill! Nalkande on a hat-trick on IPL debut. Smith looks to send that firing first ball, but finds long-on. It was a full ball on off - a knuckle ball - as Smith had a free swing of the arms as if all he had to do was dispatch that at any cost. There is only height that he can manage to get, as Gill runs to his right this time, and waits patiently for the ball to land into his bag
much shorter in length, and a touch wide of off. Punched to deep point after a step back in the crease
top-edged four! Change of pace from Naklande, as he bowls short on middle and off. Livingstone has a pull at that, but the ball goes over the keeper's head and beats fine leg running to his right
this time to the left of fine leg! Another short ball on off, as this time Livingstone has a swivel while pulling well and wide of the man in the deep
and a slower ball again. Pushed off a back of a length outside off to cover, where Pandya tumbles to his left to cut that off
returns with a yorker tailing into middle. Jammed down to long-on
that is a sharp bouncer! On a short of a length just outside off, as he pulls but the ball goes over his bat. First bouncer called

just clears long-on! Looked like the fielder there had a chance, but no way! Shahrukh lofts that fullish ball on middle and off, and although that was not off the middle of the bat, it had the power to travel
this is much cleaner, and goes much further! In that hitting zone on a full length on middle and off - and a slower ball too - as he hoicks that away with full freedom
now that hurries on to him. On a short of a length on off, and climbing on to the batter, who pulls unconvincingly to midwicket, as Shami chases to his right

wow, that was gracious! Can Livingstone look so free-flowing too? I thought he was all about power. On a full length just outside off, as he drills that down the ground between the bowler and mid-off, almost nudging that with disdain as if Shami were a newcomer
full ball on middle and off, and tucked back to the bowler
much shorter in length on middle and turning in. He pulls late towards square leg with the turn into him

gone, taken at deep square leg! This time there is no doubt about the catch. Rashid pulls his length back to go even shorter on middle and off, as Livingstone goes deep in the crease to pull. But he finds Miller, who has a little leap before taking that well inside the rope. Kings losing wickets in a hurry here
full and on off, as he drives to long-off with the full face of the bat

the umpire waits for ages before giving that out! Rashid had run away to the keeper while celebrating already with his right hand up before realising that there had no response from the umpire, as he looked back. But Shahrukh reviews. No inside edge there, as he goes down on his back knee to sweep this good length ball on middle and leg but the ball hits his back thigh. And replays show the ball would have crashed into middle and leg
full ball on middle and off, as he goes down to block but gets an inside edge towards fine leg
on a short of a length on middle and angling in after climbing steeply. He looks to pull but gets that on his body

run-out at the keeper's end? Yup, he is short of the crease. They wanted a second for once, but Rabada was sent back after they realised it wasn't possible, as he had to dive to try and get in. Not sure where they saw the second run there. Shami at third man scampered across to his right to pick the ball and throw back flat to the keeper after the ball was bowled on a back on off, with Chahar opening the bat face to beat diving to his right
good length ball on off, an tucked back towards the bowler
bowls short of a length on middle and leg, and angles in. Bowls from wide of the crease too
taps at this fullish ball on off to point. A direct hit at the bowler's end would have had him in trouble
short delivery on off, and slower in pace too. He has a ramp at that, but is beaten
back of a length on middle, as he clips to deep midwicket with a skip in the crease. They gobble two this time
good ball. On a good length just outside off at 140kph, as he has a poke at that without any foot movement, and the ball just passes the outside edge
on a back of a length again on off. This time he dabs down towards the bowler
a touch fuller on middle and off, as he gets bat on ball to have a little tuck towards mid-on. Pandya rushes in to hit the stumps at the bowler's end, but the batter is safely in
pretty full on middle and off, as he stabs that to deep point after making room

those stumps are splattered! Kings in danger of getting bowled out with two overs left. On a good length with an upright seam - that enviable seam position of Shami - and pitching on middle and off. That goes with the arm, as Arora's poke is late, by which time the middle and off stumps are destroyed
lofted over cover, and some useful runs for Kings here. On a fullish length and angling into middle and off, he chips for a chase for deep point to his left
pretty full ball just outside off, as he jams the bat at that after getting the front leg out of the way
drilled for four! Chahar says if Livingstone can, so can I. A slower ball on a pretty full length in the channel outside off, as he drives that to the left of deep point after clearing his front leg
on a back of a length on middle, and rising on to him. He fends at that uncomfortably
shortish in length on middle, and he pulls to fine leg
takes his eyes off as he tries to half-pull that short ball on middle, which is angling in at 141kph. Beaten by the pace and bounce

wohooo, six four for Kings from the No. 11 too! Falls just short of the rope at deep square leg as Rashid chases to his right. Their strategy paying off well and deep into the order, or so you can say. On a short of a length on middle again, as he pulls with a swivel after again taking his eyes off
bingo, six and fun! A slower ball on a short of a length on off, as he just beats fine leg with that classy pull off the middle of the bat
on a much fuller length on off, and change of pace. Pushed to deep point
makes room and manages to push that back of a length ball on leg towards cover, as Pandya follows him

flung away for four! If you turned away after that famed line-up fell, here you go now. On a yorker length and wide of leg, as he gets his front leg out of the way to swing between fine leg and deep square leg
a leg-before review by Pandya out of hope! Chahar looks to heave that good length ball on middle, which is angling in, and replays confirm the inside edge

some fun off the last ball too! Ball falling one bounce short of the deep midwicket fielder when it nearly felt like going for a boundary, then the batters' attempted two followed by a fumble by Ferguson after the throw from the deep, and a third then tried by them. After all this, Pandya takes the ball at his end, and crashes the stumps only to give the impression that he has done that off his body instead off his hand. There are replays and relays and replays checked, and finally the Tendulkar-like voice of the third umpire says that the stumps were clipped with his foot even while the batter was miles away. So forget about the run-out. All in all, they took the three runs. Just to get back to the actual ball, it was a short of a length ball outside leg, as Pandya saw the batter make room and followed him, with Arshdeep pulling flat and with force
length ball on leg stump and swinging across the left-hander, 129kph, Wade is slightly squared up, edging through backward point to get off the mark first ball
short, wide and spanked! Looking for inswing but the line was wide and Gill latches on with a breezy swing through the covers
too straight and flicked fine, past the man on the edge of the circle. Arora gets taken for back-to-back boundaries
length ball, 133kph and shaping back in, past the outside edge as Gill dangles his bat
on a length and coming back in, worked through midwicket
round the wicket, back of a length and stabbed to backward point. "No run!"
fired across the right-hander from over the wicket, signalled wide
timed down the ground past mid-on, beats the dive and it keeps on going as if on rails
cuts but picks out backward point
smashed through midwicket! Arshdeep drops short and is collared on the pull
pitched up, defended uppishly back to the bowler
full and wide, larruped again! Gill is seeing it big already, bends the front leg and frees the hands to thrash a cut through the covers
length ball, 132kph and sliding towards the tramlines again, cut for a single out to deep backward point
pitched up, 132kph and punched towards mid-off, they take one
carved through the covers, Wade rocks back and gets his innings going with a meaty cut. Too much width from round the wicket from Arora
straighter, 136kph and flicked off the hip coming across, just a single to deep backward square
over the wicket, 132kph length ball on the stumps, turned quietly around the corner
on the stumps, tucked to the leg side
pitched up straight from over the wicket, Wade clips to Dhawan at midwicket
slung down full on leg stump, 140kph and whipped away to deep backward square

got him, gobbled up in the corridor! Immaculate line and decking away just a fraction, Wade wants to force it off the back foot, only manages to feather through to Bairstow behind the stumps! Rabada makes the breakthrough for Kings
fullish on middle and leg, tapped back
helped to the fence past short fine leg! Rabada lets go a low full toss down the leg side, just needed some bat on it
pitched up, 139kph and pinged neatly back past the bowler, mid-off comes across
fired in towards the blockhole, tapped back to the bowler
flicked through square leg, they thought about two but Dhawan's throw keeps them honest
short and wide, 135kph and Gill threads the gap again, clattered through point! Scrambled seam but drifting away and steered in front of the sweeper for four
brings it back in on a length, tucked to leg
pitched up in the channel and punched towards cover
fullish and ticked towards mid-off, not fielded cleanly
length ball, 132kph and shaping in, Gill works one more to mid-on
short of a length outside off, 137kph and Gill pings a back-foot punch, well stopped in the covers
touch short outside off and nicely chopped but he picks out backward point
swatted confidently over short fine leg! Sudharsan is smoothly across and tackles the bumper with aplomb, front leg flicking up as he pirouettes on the shot
fuller, 140kph and steered through backward point for one
steps out and punches a length ball to mid-off, continues on through for the single

skids into the pads, tucked leg side... Rabada gives up a lone appeal. Agarwal uses up almost all of the time before calling for a review. Looked like it pitched outside leg to me... Yep, by a good few inches, so Kings lose that review
Sudharsan sinks six over deep midwicket! Straight out of the blocks against the leggie, plants the front foot and creams the ball high into the stands!
goes back and flicks with the spin to backward square leg
flattish legbreak outside off, 93kph and punched in front of the cover sweeper
floated up outside off, pushed to cover
goes back and forces this into the gap between long-on and deep midwicket. Livingstone goes sliding along the boundary to cut it off
rolled out on middle and leg and Gill works wristily into a gap at square leg for two more
back of a length outside off, 133kph and sliced through point for one
munched over deep square leg! The bouncer got up pretty high but Gill fetched it with a cross-batted hoick, goes all the way
dropped! Smith can't hold on in his follow through! Came off the cue-end with Gill looking to pull, Smith got his hands to it, and then had a second go, but it bobbled free
back of a length outside off, 133kph and cut for a single
fired in straight, raps him on the back thigh with Sudharsan attempting to pull. Smith was convinced by his lbw appeal, but Agarwal goes with the umpire. Pitched outside leg again, I think
shortish and sliced through backward point
floats up a legbreak outside off, cut off the back foot for a couple
belted through the covers, that's fifty! Lovely shot to get there, leaning out to stroke a drive. Brings up the mark from 29 balls
shout for lbw as Gill defends around his front pad. Livingstone thought it was pad first... replays suggest otherwise
crashed through backward point, four more to the Titans opener! Cut hard off the back foot, beats the fielder's dive
tucked into the leg side
round the wicket, tosses up an offbreak that Sudharsan works through the leg side
dug in, 139kph and Sudharsan miscues this into the on side, lands safely between midwicket and long-on
back of a length outside off, cut through the inner ring for one
low full toss wide of the stumps, 141kph, Sudharsan swings and misses
pitched up and tonked through cover! Sudharsan nails his shot, deep in the crease and makes a full 141kph delivery look like a gentle half-volley
round the wicket, fizzes through in the channel as he loses his shape looking to cut
short of a length, 137kph on fifth stump, chopped into the turf through to the keeper
pretty full ball on middle, and nudged towards deep midwicket. They steal two there after great running
much fuller on middle still, and he jam the bat down to get that back to the bowler
short of a length on middle, and pulled on the bounce to deep square leg
short and wide of off, and turning away. He has to reach out for that to slash to deep point, and he wanted a second too before he was sent back
short and wide of off, and hammered for four to deep point! Cuts that hard and fast to beat a diving deep point to his right. Gill on song
short again and outside off. Turns away, as he slaps to deep point
bowls on back of a length on off from wide of the crease. The ball angles into the batter, as it is clipped to deep midwicket
much fuller length on middle, and again coming into him a touch. Goes to flick but the ball hits his pad
change of pace, and beaten. On a short of a length outside off, as Sudharsan pulled but missed
makes room, and the bowler follows. Bowls a yorker way outside leg, as Sudharsan tries to flick but the ball balloons off the pad for a leg-bye to the off side
swats that between long-on and deep midwicket! Waits for the slower ball to come to him, as it was also short on off. There was good bounce there too, as he rammed that late
nearly  a yorker on off this time. Gill presents the full face of the bat to drill that to long-off
makes room and skips down the pitch, as the ball is on a back of a length outside off. Punched to deep point
follows the batter to go on a shortish length outside leg, as Sudharsan is backing away. Pulled to deep square leg after almost being cramped for room
crashed for four to deep extra cover! Flat, fast and furious. A back of a length outside off, and he swats that powerfully to beat cover to his right and deep point to his left
good length ball on middle, as he closes the bat face to clip to deep square leg
pulls for a single to deep midwicket. A slower ball on a short of a length on middle and leg, and angling into him. He gets Gill back on strike
on a hard length on off. Again Gull clips happily to deep backward square leg
full delivery on off, and flicked to deep square leg rather nonchalantly. They scamper two more
pulls his length back to go on a good length on off. A little clip to deep square leg again
lifts that nearly miraculously! What hands there! Four to deep midwicket. Bowled with a cross seam on a length on middle, as he plays that impressively on the bounce for four
fuller on middle and off, and flicked to long-on
short of a length on off, and pulls to deep square leg all along the ground as that makes a pleasing sound off the bat
fullish length on off, as he opens the bat face to tap to point
full ball on off, and towards deep extra cover softly. They rush for two. Quick running
clears short third man turning around and running! Goes for the reverse sweep, but the ball is not that full on middle and leg. Gets a top edge there, and is lucky
much fuller on off, and pushed to long-off after leaning forward

goes for the big one, and skies that to cover! This was a googly bowled from back of the hand on a full length outside off, and so threatened to turn away from him. Sudharsan wanted to loft over the off side, but only got height without any distance. Mayank at the edge of the extra cover circle takes that to his left after keeping his eyes on the ball all along
full ball outside off, and tapped to point after a good stride forward
opens the bat face a touch to nudge that full ball on off to long-off
slower ball on a full length outside off, and angling in. He drives, but gets that off the inside half of the bat to the man at midwicket
pulls that to deep midwicket. That was hit hard off a short of a length on middle and off, and to the longer side of the boundary
jams that to short third, and doesn't find the gap. Full and wide of off, and Gill can't place that well with third man in
a near yorker just outside off, as he has to again push that late to the man at extra cover, who is placed on the periphery of the circle. Gill in the 90s
good delivery. He executes that wide-ish yorker well. Around sixth stump, as Pandya has a slash but the ball is too full. He is beaten, and that is another dot

four this time! Pandya finishes it off with a boundary. Another pretty full ball outside off, but not quite a yorker. Pandya runs that down well to beat point to his left for four to third man, with no man on the fence there
missed stumping! Gill skipped down the pitch, and Chahar bowled full and wide of leg. The ball wasn't collected cleanly though, and they ran one there
full and straight. Pushed back to the bowler
slashed for four to deep point! Short and outside off, and turning away. He capitalises on the width, and sends that crashing
down the ground, and four more! This is much fuller and just outside off, as the tossed up full is sent over the bowler's head
dives to his left to stop the run off his own bowling. Good length ball on off, and punched back

top edge, and dropped by Rabada! He was running forward from fine leg, and the ball was dying on to him. He had to eventually dive forward, as the ball popped out after kissing his fingers. Short of a length ball on middle, and Pandya went for the pull only to miscue it
short in length on off again, and swatted wide of long-off. They pinch two

bouncer, and that seemed to have bounced too high. Pandya wanted a wide, but not given. This rushed on to him of a short of a length on middle and off, while angling in. He wanted to pull, but swayed away in the end
yorker now. What a ball! Lands that really full on off, and all Pandya can do is jam that to extra cover
slices over extra cover, as long-off runs and slides to his left to cut that off. The ball was swerving away, as Gill opened the bat face to that full ball outside off
another yorker on middle and off, and that is clipped to square leg. Smith throws at the keeper's end, where Pandya had given up, but the ball is wide of the stumps
low full toss on off - perhaps he missed his yorker - as Pandya crashes that to long-off after getting his front leg out of the way
goes to scoop, but he is hit on his pad after shuffling across off to this really full ball just outside off. Precious dot for Kings
nails that yorker on middle, as Pandya flicks that to deep backward square leg off the inside half of the bat. But... it is a no-ball
low, dipping full toss on off, and lofted to long-on

one-handed four to deep midwicket! Beats the man there to his left. A low full toss again on off, as he heaves across the line with his front leg out of the way, as he uses his bottom hand to whip that away

wide yorker, and four wide of long-off now! This is turning around now. The ball was dying on to Pandya, and was a very full length wide of off. Pandya reached out for it, and beat long-off to his left
another pretty full length outside off, and driven to deep point

taken at extra cover! Gill falls for 96. Another full toss from Rabada that is on a near yorker length which is really wide of off. Gill reaches out for it, and ends up pushing that to Agarwal placed a step closer in than what he has been today. We've seen a no-ball, then two fours this over, and now a wicket. This game nearing a twist, maybe?
full and a little wide of off. Driven aerially to long-off
wide called, and Bairstow is not happy. Good length ball pitching on middle and off, and angling away. He leaves it alone, and gets what he wanted

Pandya is run-out! Bairstow shatters the stumps at his end by dribbling the ball with an underarm throw to dislodge the bail on middle and leg stump. Pandya can only walk back with a little mutter to himself. It was a good length ball wide of off, as Miller had a swing at that away from his body but was beaten. They had to run - that is all Miller knew - and Pandya fell well short
slashes to deep point. Pretty full and wide of off, and he lofts that away from hid body
one-bounce four to deep square leg! It was a slower ball on a shortish length on middle, and he pulled firmly there. Miller keeping them ticking here

Smith misses his throw at his end, and that allows an overthrow. Tewatia wanted a run after Miller biffed the back of a length ball on off back to the bowler. Tewatia was well out when the throw came, but alas

Tewatia gets the first of those! Only just six that one! That was nearly gone. The man there at deep midwicket was falling back and even grabbed it for a second before he fell on the other side with the ball also dropping beyond the rope after it was heaved off a length on middle and leg. A clean swing, and six over deep midwicket

He is a hero! Dial Tewatia for six! He looks at the dressing room with a swagger of Superman, and why not? He is pumped, chuffed and thrilled. 12 were needed off two balls - two sixes of course - and Tewatia smacks them with the calmness of Bevan, Dhoni and Klusener combined. Walks across off, and nails that slog-sweep off a full length wide of off beyond long-on
fullish length on the pads and squirted away, well chased down by AJ Tye in front of the rope at deep midwicket. Did brilliantly to flick it back before crashing into the boundary marker
length on off stump, Warner leans out and defends, accompanied by a growl of "Wait onnnnnnnn!"
back of a length, jumps across and blocks into the off side
extra bounce for Holder, climbing up around the ribs as Warner fends off towards square leg for his first run
touch short outside off, Shaw dabs towards backward point with an open bat face
short, holding its line as Shaw jumps across, connects well with his pull but only succeeds in picking out midwicket
round the wicket, angled in flat and tapped down
flat off break and he drops back to work one into the leg side
slashed through the covers, floated up outside off, no real turn and Shaw just hits through the line
straighter, prodded away in front of the stumps

rockets off the edge, Holder takes evasive action! Huge, windmilling hoick at a length ball from Shaw, and it flies high and to the left of slip, who barely sees it. Holder was just looking to avoid a ball in the mouth
fires this down at 96kph outside off, swing and a miss from Prithvi
sliced up and over cover, Lewis can't quite get to the chance running back! Aggression from Warner but it's nearly his undoing
smashed! Short ball, 125kph and Shaw steps out to greet it, baseball batting the ball flat through midwicket
cleaned out over deep midwicket! Back of a length, nothing ball and right in the arc ffor Shaw to unleash more cross-batted pongo
bouncer, clears Shaw as he looks to ramp. Slower ball, in fact... and called wide on height. Holder not happy
pitched up and there's some outswing for Holder here, prodded away
back-of-the-hand slower ball, dipping wide of off, dug out towards cover point
another slower ball, disappears down the leg side
pace off again, driven to the man on the edge of the circle at cover
starts well, 139 clicks in the channel, nibbles back inside Shaw's flailing attempt to hit down the ground
boshty from Prithvi! Length ball, slightly wider line and he can swing the arms, thrashed mercilessly between two men in the covers
width again and carved in front of deep third! Tad fuller but he's got time to adjust and guide it off the back foot
flashes hard, gets four more to third! The man back had been moved but again Avesh serves it up wide of off, and is punished
short into the body, swatted out in front of square for one. Warner was pushing, Shaw not interested
back of a length on the stumps, defended down to the leg side
over the wicket, fizzed down outside off at 102kph. Shaw tamps down in it
pushed through outside off, cut firmly but straight to backward point
spanked through point - literally! Gowtham gets his fingertips singed by a rasping cut for four
flattish outside off and cut again, this time Gowtham fields
tossed up and punched down to long-off
pushed through from over the wicket, possibly a wrong'un, Warner pokes it back
back of a length outside off, mistimed into the covers
fuller, 131kph on fourth stump, Shaw looks to go down the ground and ends up chipping it off the toe of the bat, just about clears mid-on and mid-off running back
struck amidships! Back of a length and skidding on as Shaw looks to pull. Takes a blow squarely on his fourth stump
crunched over backward point, Shaw responds to that painful blow with one of his own! Touch short, 137kph and he opens the shoulders to carve it away
slower ball on the stumps, nudged to leg
back of a length outside off, Warner opens up with a crisp cut, but can't get it through
pushed through on the stumps, tucked to deep midwicket going back
fired into the pitch, 92kph and swung away on the pull, just one to wide long-on
skiddy trajectory, maybe an arm ball and it does Shaw on the inside, deflecting off the pads. Heading down leg, though
makes room and slices a couple more through point, brings up Shaw's fifty! Eleventh time he's done so in the IPL
angled in straight and flicked around the corner
tossed up, Warner bunts it back to the bowler. Still searching for some rhythm in his first outing, is Davey
launched over long-off! Dances down and hurls the bat through the line, creaming the offie waaaaaaay back over his head
smoked! Floated up outside off and Shaw cracks it through cover. Just opens the face a little, beats deep point running around

nicks him off! Gowtham changes the angle, gets a bit of extra bounce, and makes the breakthrough for LSG! Round the wicket, Shaw went back to cut, but a fat top edge nestled in de Kock's gloves. Prithvi 100 walks slowly from the field, won't be getting 100 today
over the wicket, tossed up slower outside off, Powell plays over the top of it
pushed through and tapped down from the crease
darted, 97kph outside off, Powell taps it into a gap in the cover to get going
fires this in straight, skids into the pads... maybe some inside edge?
flat legbreak on middle and off, worked ton leg for one

Bishnoi's got him again! Third time in six balls in T20... and Warner's lengthy-but-unproductive stay is over! Went back looking to cut one angled across him, but only managed a limp top edge to short third. Looking at the replay, Warner made the tiniest motion to change his grip, so Bishnoi threw in a wide googly
tossed up leg side and spinning into the pads
flattish googly wide of off stump, toe-ended in front of square for a single
another wrong'un, hits Powell on the pads going back
floated up from round the wicket, punched to backward point
nicely bowled, bit of flight and grip, beats the outside edge
reaches out and steers into a gap
round the wicket still to the right-hander, nudged down and Gowtham runs after it
stays back and works this away through square leg
tossed up and Pant nurdles off his pads into the leg side as Gowtham again gives chase
sliding into the pads at 103.3ks, Pant can't get hold of the flick. Leg bye
fizzing wrong'un from a short of a length, Powell wears it on his thigh pad, having missed the pull

Another wrong'un. Another wicket for Bishnoi and he celebrates this with a big roar. Googly from over the wicket, fizzing in to hit off stump. Powell has a roundhouse swipe to the leg side and fails to touch the ball in the end. LSG are well and truly back into the contest
Sarfaraz presses forward to defend this full googly sliding into off
tossed up full and outside off, allows the batter to stretch out and drive it with an open face to the right of sweeper cover
pushed through flatter and quicker, googly from Bishnoi. Sarfaraz dares to reverse-sweep from the stumps and places it fine of short third man for a timely boundary for DC
short dart, skidding through outside off and beating Pant on the cut. Some extra bounce for Gowtham
sliding on outside off, chopped straight to short third man
pushed through on middle, forward and drilled to extra-cover
sliding in at off from round the stumps, inside-edged to the leg side
darted into middle stump, played back towards the bowler
on a length and sliding in with the angle from round the wicket, cramps Pant on the cut. He nearly drags it back onto the stumps before a timely intervention with the bat. Pant plays out a maiden
full and angling into middle and leg, tucked away behind square
good length and sliding across off from round the stumps, Pant aims for a slog-sweep and ends up top-edging it past the keeper towards short third man
back of a length and darted into middle and leg, punched down to long-on
full-toss on off and middle, hauled away to wide long-on
whipped with the angle between deep midwicket and long-on
dinked into the vacant midwicket region for one
pitched up on off, sort of stops on the batter, chipped in front of Tye
dug in short and outside off, Sarfaraz aims for the ramp, but does not connect in the end
slower bouncer, aimed at the body, 116ks, flapped away to deep midwicket

Run-out chance missed? Back of a length and angling across off, another slower ball, sliced away to short third man for an urgent single. Tye breaks the stumps before even collecting the ball. Replays indicate it was a chance
Sarfaraz goes for the lap-sweep and tickles it done to fine leg
slower yorker from Tye, pushed wide of off, squeezes underneath the bat
full and breaking into middle, this googly is whisked away between deep midwicket and wide long-on
Pant stays back to this full one that dips at middle, and wafts it down to long-off
on a length and breaks into middle, Sarfaraz hangs back and flicks through the midwicket region
full and sliding across off, this wrong'un is prodded through the covers
near yorker-length delivery pushed wide of off, chopped wide enough of short third man for a single
marginally too full on middle, Pant camps back, swings for the hills and swishes it away to the cover fence
slower dipper on off stump, jabbed away to the left of sweeper cover with an open bat-face
Tye searches for a yorker, comes out as a low full-toss outside off. Pant sizes it up and pumps it away straight of long-off for four
Tye goes for another yorker. Marginally misses his mark. Pant doesn't quite get underneath the length, but manages to slice it over Tye's head for six
wide full-toss, Pant reaches out for the ball and scythes it away only as far as extra-cover
lifter angled across off, sails across to de Kock, wide called
wide yorker from Tye, finishes just inside the tramline, as Pant can't touch it
sliced over long-off for another six. The attempted yorker goes wrong for Tye again. Marginally overpitched and outside off, Pant sits back and launches it down the ground
full and wide of off, with third man up inside the circle, Sarfaraz slashes and sends an outside edge flying over that infielder for four
low full-toss outside off, Avesh misses his yorker, but not by a long margin. Sarfaraz makes it look a whole lot worse by pumping it over mid-off
bouncer outside off, slower ball into the pitch, hauled away to wide long-on
another slower variation outside off, Avesh hits a hard length, Pant drags it down to long-on
back of a length and outside off, another slower ball, which is heaved away to the left of deep midwicket
another slower ball into the DY Patil pitch, Avesh hides it away from Sarfaraz's swinging arc. Plinked down to long-on
fullish and just a shade outside off, Sarfaraz aims for a reverse-sweep but can only get it to the right of de Kock. Leg-bye
pretty full and Holder takes it away from Pant, asking him to reach out. Sliced in the air, but lands in front of deep third man
slower offcutter veering down the leg side. Brushes the pad on its way to the keeper
pitched-up delivery on the pads, picked up and whipped away to the left of long leg
full and into middle and leg, thrashed down to long-on
lifter, angling across off, slower one into the pitch. Pant slog-pulls at it and winds up top-edging it over the keeper's head
low full-toss outside off, Pant opens the face and drives to Krunal at sweeper cover
another low full-toss outside off, dragged down to long-on off the inner half
helicoptered away to the left of deep midwicket. Avesh misses another yorker. It comes out as a full-toss outside off, picked up and whipped with a flourish, placed wide of the outfielder
wide yorker from Avesh, asks Pant to reach out and swing. Pant does so, but misses
near yorker outside off, Pant looks to helicopter it away over the leg side once again. This time he connects only with a whole lot of thin air
wide yorker, stabbed back to Avesh
too full and on middle and leg, this slower ball is hoicked away between deep midwicket and long leg
low full-toss, angling across off, Pant goes low and slogs it away to deep midwicket
back of a length and on middle, hauled away to deep midwicket
wide yorker, squirted away between keeper and short third man
slower bouncer, veering down the leg side, Sarfaraz pulls and misses. Wide called
another slower cutter from Holder, pops up after hitting the pitch. Sarfaraz is early into the pull and top-edges it onto his helmet
full and sliding across off, near yorker-length delivery, whipped to deep midwicket
over the wicket, hard length and defended coming across on off
back of a length in the channel, Rahul slaps it through backward point for one to third
good length just outside off, de Kock is into line and dabs into a gap
pitched up, 136kph around off stump, prodded cautiously into the covers
fullish outside off and Rahul is on to the front foot, cushions a slower ball through backward point for another single
looking for inswing, sprayed down the leg side
touch short of a length outside off, 138kph and steered down to third for one more
round the wicket, tossed up and drifting in to the pads, tapped back
runs across in front of the umpire, drops a little short but de Kock picks out a fielder in the ring
floated up and punched down the ground to long-off
flighted on off stump, punched with a high front elbow to mid-off... where Lord Shardul misfields it to give up one
chopped into the midwicket region
flattish outside off, 104kph and Rahul picks out cover with a back-foot punch
back of a length, 133kph and de Kock dabs it down into the off side
whipped off the pads through midwicket, meat and drink for Rahul as he times Lucknow's first boundary of the night
bites back with a little in-dipper, 136kph and beating Rahul on the inside
back of a length outside off, drops back and angles a cut out to the point sweeper
pitched up and punched towards cover point
superbly stopped! Driven on the up back past the bowler, looked like it might beat mid-on and scuttle away.... only for Warner to throw himself full length and cut the ball off
lobs up a gentle offbreak, punched through mid-off
darted down at 101kph, into the hip and Rahul can only shovel one into the midwicket region
slugs a half-tracker through midwicket! Didn't quite nail the pull but had enough to clear the leap of midwicket
tossed up and stroked through the covers, picks up a couple out towards the rope
pushed through at 100kph, takes a piece out of the pitch as QdK drives, ends up chipping a couple wide of long-off, not entirely in control
fired down outside off, de Kock cuts but finds backward point
back of a length and cracked through point! SA on SA conflict, 141kph but the line was a touch wide and de Kock flays his compatriot for four
pinged down the ground, back-to-back boundaries to welcome Nortje into the game. Lovely strike stright drive, beats mid-off's dive to the left
three in a row, stroked past mid-off again! This was even better timing, Thakur thought he stood a chance and then was left for dust
tighter line, 142kph and he's across to block this time
splat! Into the stands! Pace on the ball, and de Kock is taking his percentage... short ball, into the body and hauled dismissively over deep backward square leg
132kph, dinked into the covers
slightly short outside off, de Kock raps a cut down to deep backward point
pitched up. 139kph and driven to the man in the covers
full, straight and punched with the bottom hand into the covers, Shardul again doesn't field cleanly
slower ball, but it disappears down leg
back of a length, 136kph and de Kock wears this on the thigh pad
full outside off, 138kph and de Kock steers through backward point for one
slower ball, bunted towards cover - powerplay done, and time for a strategic timeout
round the wicket, angled in and pushed to cover
this straightens a touch with Rahul coming across the line, pops off the splice
floated up and worked leg side
over the wicket, 95kph on the stumps and tucked leg side
angling in on off stump, punched back
touch quicker and straighter and flicked into the midwicket region
smashed into the boundary boards! Dragged down and Rahul climbs into him, crunching six over wide long-on
flattish stock ball, worked with the spin through midwicket
attempts to reverse-sweep, the ball loops up in front of slip... did it hit the pads? DC think so and review, but that assumption is quickly disproved. Straight off the top glove
goes back and punches down the ground
pushed through on the stumps, 90kph and Rahul plays a French cricket paddle down to fine leg, Nortje sliding along the soaking outfield to prevent four
hard-spun and jabbed away with the turn through midwicket for one more
tossed up, drifting in on middle and off stump as Rahul makes room, slapped to cover
nurdled into a gap on the leg side
pushed through and flicked into the midwicket area, they have to hustle hard for the second but make it safely in the end
reverse-swiped through backward point! Lovely from Quinny, takes the ball from on the stumps - Axar bowling round the wicket - and skims it past the man on the edge of the circle
darted on the stumps, 97kph and patted back to Axar's left
lobbed up and de Kock plays an aggressive orthodox sweep for one
floated up, spinning from middle to off, dabbed into the covers
stock ball outside off, Rahul doesn't move the feet and punches through mid-off
flattish and spinning away from QdK as he drops back and thumps one out to deep cover

Rahul miscues, taken by long-off running in! From nowhere, DC get the breakthrough. Rahul skips out and looks to launch this into central Mumbai, but sends it more or less straight up. Shaw doesn't hold it cleanly, but still manages to do the job
nicely bowled, draws him out and hits the front pad with Lewis defending
flighted on the stumps, Lewis is sweeping and gets a good chunk of it for his first run
darted into a hard length outside off, punched into the covers, where there is a fumble, allowing a single
speared into the leg stump, de Kock swats it away to deep square
much slower and dipping into off stump, quietly played back to Lalit

Lalit and Pant belt out a big appeal for lbw, not given out. DC review the on-field not-out decision. Lewis aims for the sweep, but does not connect. Rapped on the pads, but this seems to be sliding down the leg side. Smacked on the front pad in line with middle and leg, no bat/glove involved, but ball-tracking confirms that this is angling down the leg side
back of a length and skidding into middle, punched back to the bowler off the back foot
Lalit darts a yorker, squeezed out to long-on
sliding across the left-handed Lewis, he throws his bat at ball and bottom-edges it behind to slip
tossed up on middle and breaks away just a shade outside off, tip and run to short extra cover
pushed through on middle, push-driven to extra-cover off the front foot
floated up on middle, a touch too full for Kuldeep. De Kock steps away outside leg, manufactures swinging room and lifts it over the covers. De Kock gets to his fifty in style
darted on top of middle, backs away and scythes it away through the cover-point region
driven down to the right of Powell at wide long-off
back of a length and angling into middle and leg from round the stumps, stabbed back to him
darted into middle, Lewis jumps back and punches to short cover

Lalit takes out the left-handed Lewis. The other Yadav - Kuldeep - settles underneath this skier at midwicket. Bowled into the pitch on a hard length, and angling in towards off stump. Lewis miscues a pull and holes out to give DC more hope. He falls for 5 off 13 balls
offbreak on a back of a length, outside off, worked to short midwicket
dropped short and wide of off, Hooda leans back and cracks it away to the left of sweeper cover
speared outside off, Hooda shuffles across off and smartly scoops it away fine of long leg
beamer angling across off from over the wicket at 141.4ks, de Kock half-ducks and carves it up over short third man
wide yorker, which is sliced away to sweeper cover
short and angling into the hips, tucked away to long leg with the angle

another wide yorker, which is squirted through point with an open bat-face. Warner chases the ball, fumbles, and throws it to the keeper. Pant has to deal with some awkward bounce and seems to have hurt his thumb. He's grimacing in pain. The DC physio is out to tend to Pant. The magic spray is out. Time for a time-out at the DY Patil Stadium
low full-toss outside off, driven with a slicing finish to sweeper cover
dug in short and ducks back in Hooda, who makes some room and guides a single to deep third man
slower ball outside off, de Kock hauls it away to long-on
slower ball, floated into the thigh at 110.6ks, de Kock flicks early and misses
back of a length and outside off, another slower ball, which is swatted past the outstretched hand of Thakur
on-pace full ball outside off, de Kock uses it to his advantage. He jumps across off and cleverly scoops it over short fine leg
slower ball, Thakur hides it away from de Kock's reach, swished to cover
good length and angling across off, another slower delivery from Thakur. De Kock almost drags it back onto his stumps
back of a length and outside off, de Kock hits it to long-off and keeps strike
full and wide of off, sliced away to the right of sweeper cover for one
Hooda makes room, but is beaten for pace outside off. He is late onto a cut

Caught at extra-cover by Sarfaraz, but is this another beamer from Nortje? The two umpires converge and refer it to the TV umpire. Nortje's front-foot is fine, but this is above the waistline of Hooda. Umpire Tucker eventually signals a no-ball. Nortje has been taken out of the attack
flat and quick on middle, heaved down to long-on
pinged straight of long-on. De Kock makes room, shimmies down the pitch and unleashes a smooth swing
back of a length and breaks away from de Kock. He stands tall and swats it straight past the right of Kuldeep for another four

Sarfaraz takes another catch, this time at short third man off a legal ball. Starts outside off and breaks away from de Kock. The batter backs away and aims to hit it over cover, but instead slices Kuldeep's stock ball to short third man off an outside edge
full-toss sliding across off, driven to sweeper cover
very full and angling into middle and leg, clipped away to deep midwicket
slower offcutter outside off, carved away to the off-side sweeper
slower offcutter, dips sharply at Krunal, hits the pad, but this is heading down leg
slower ball on a length on middle, played back to Mustafizur
rolls out another cutter, on middle, forced down to long-off. Just four off that Mustafizur over
full, just short of a yorker length and sliding across off, Krunal slogs and misses
off-stump yorker, dug out to the leg side for a quick single
wide yorker, carved away to sweeper cover. Good bowling from Thakur
Thakur nails another wide yorker. Krunal can only jam it back to the bowler. Top bowling from Thakur
111.7ks slower ball outside off. Krunal swings at it and skies it. It drops between deep midwicket and wide long-on
Thakur closes out the over with another yorker outside off. Jammed to long-off
slower cutter, on middle, heaved away to deep midwicket
another cutter from Mustafizur, finishes well wide of off, carved over extra-cover
Launched over long-on for six. 99ks offcutter on middle, Krunal camps back, waits for the ball to land in his slot, then muscles it away
wide of the crease, angling into leg stump, this on-pace full ball is belted down the ground for a double. Warner slides across to his left from long-on and swats the ball in
wide yorker, which is stabbed away wide of sweeper cover
full-toss outside off, Krunal chips it over the covers, for another double

Holes out to Axar who throws himself forward at sweeper cover. Full and wide of off, as Thakur hides it away from the batter's swinging arc, sliced away in the air to Axar. Hooda-Krunal pair can't bring it home for LSG
slower lifter outside off, balloons through to Pant. Badoni lets it go. One for the over
low full-toss outside off, as Thakur misses the yorker. Badoni stretches out and coolly drives it between extra-cover and mid-off. He pumps his fist and toasts that strike
Badoni sends it over extra-cover for six and finishes off another game for LSG. Pitched-up delivery outside off, Badoni gets underneath the length and laces it over the top
zippy line and length, skidding through at the top of off stump, and squeezed away uncomfortably via an inside-edge... probing!
on the back foot, and dabbed back down into the crease, and nearly played on...
swinging delivery, very full again, inside-edged down into the crease once more, this is an intense opening gambit!
a scamper to the pitch, and a wild slash across the line to the leg side, Rohit scuffs his way off the mark
back of a length to the left-hander, Dre Russ hurtles in from square leg to cut off the single
stretching onto the front foot, head right over the ball, and blocked to cover with a big stride. That's a mighty over to open his account
back of a length, open face, swinging away and poked to point
decent shape on his outswinger, fractionally short of a good length, but Rohit plays with respect, back through the line outside off
big inswinger! That's a well-controlled variation, lovely straight seam, hooping at a good pace back into the stumps, and fenced to leg by the watchful Rohit
another inswinger, or outswing to the leftie, Ishan is deep in his crease and pushing with the angle into the off side, just back of a length on this occasion
width outside off on the inswinger, but kicking through at a good lick off the deck, Rohit shapes to cut but settles for a pat to cover
slower ball, tight lines, back of a length, nudged out to point, two excellent overs to launch the powerplay
back of a length, middle-and-leg line, Rohit looks for the clip to midwicket but can't time his stroke
thuds the thigh-pad on a tight line, bending into the right-hander, and they pinch the leg-bye as short backward square gathers
head over the ball, solid block back down the wicket. Lovely length so far, and with the subtle swing, there are no liberties to be taken
attempted pull/paddle, not quite sure what he intended that to be! Down on one knee, flapping the bat across the line, and gloving the not-very-short-ball behind square

that was coming! Rohit never looked comfortable, and now falls to Yadav for the fifth time in their IPL rivalry! Short, skidding into the pull, a spiralling top-edge, Billings calls as he runs back to fine leg, and avoids the collision as he pouches the offering!
tucked up on the back foot, sharper pace to welcome the new man, fended to the leg side to get off the mark
panned off a good length through wide long-on! Baby AB doesn't need to go 360 when he can just mosh it through the line! High and handsome for the first boundary of the night!
what a riposte! Nibbling, wobbling, zagging round the outside edge, a Test-match delivery, beating the bat with aplomb!
genuine edge! And is the lack of slip a missed trick? Ball is dominating bat right now, and that just kissed off the splice with half a bat's movement... down to third man
swinging away from the leftie, who leans into his stroke and is beaten outside off
fuller length, into the pads, clipped to mid-on. This is a fine comeback from that first-ball four
another edge, wouldn't have carried, but dangles the bat outside off and picks off the single to third man. It's a struggle out there!
corker! Proud seam, perfect length, fizzing off the deck past a vertical blade. You can't lay a bat on that!
plants the front foot, and pumps on the up, over the covers. Good response to the mounting pressure
rocks back and wallops! An initial gallop to the pitch, then transfers his weight to clobber across the line, one bounce, inches short of long-on!
fierce straight punch! That's such a fine strike, but too straight for the stumps' liking. They get splattered, and Brevis is robbed of a boundary
tucked up by Umesh as he drags his length back, Umesh hurtles through in his followthrough to field, but his over-eager shy gives away extras. Full marks for commitment!
zippy lines to finish, Umesh's figures take a relative dent, but that's a fine powerplay effort
full and straight, back through the line of the ball, and gathered by the bowler
shaping in on a full length, flicked off the pads to deep midwicket
pushed across the left-hander, just back of a length, and Ishan goes fishan... just a nibble in the corridor outside off
he lands this one alright! Back of a length, a hint of room to free the arms, Kishan throws the kishan sink across the line and pumps the four through long-on
chopped to the off side, hopping into line
Brevis has a swing, and that's fizzed over the keeper's head! Banged in short, a fling of the bat, Cummins gets a dent in his first over
tight lines as ever, pushed into the off side
outside off, enough width to cut but skidding through to limit Brevis's options, third man tidies up
flashed back through the line, Narine gathers
much wider on the crease from round the wicket, Ishan chases the drive but straight at cover
nurdled off the legs, and gathered at midwicket. Slim pickings so far
over the wicket, wicket-to-wicket line, Brevis sets a solid base outside leg, and clonks through the line, but can't beat the field. The stranglehold is maintained
twirled into Brevis's arc, angled onto the pads, and out roar those wrists! Plinked high and handsome off the toes, up, up and away, picking the googly and hitting with the turn
makes room to leg, creating an angle for a slap into the covers, but straight at the man
zipping through a touch faster outside off, misses a hurried cut
pushed into the crease, high-elbowed drive back into the off side. Cramped on the angle

huge swing, and off come the bails! Billings is quietly confident here, his toe seemed anchored, but it did wobble with the force of his yank across the line. Nope, in fact, it was already well out of the crease! Smart glovework, and so ends a sparky cameo
leaning onto the front foot, pushed to mid-off, and that's the end of a fine opening over. Six first ball, then nothing on offer
pushed through outside off, a dangle of the bat outside the eyeline and deflected to backward point
skidding through, hint of spin back into the right-hander, who adjusts late to squeeze to the off side
fuller length, into the toes, clipped with the spin through mid-on
nudges another single, just feeling his way into the innings
stretching onto the front foot, smothering the ball outside off
cautious block, back foot anchored, jabs the hands into a push to cover
fullish ball and quick ball turning into off. Pushed to cover with his front leg out of the way
turns away after pitching on a shortish length on middle and leg. Clipped to deep square leg away from his body
fuller length and straighter on off. Tucked to the man at cover with the full face of the bat
the man at cover dives to his right and gets a hand, but can't prevent the single. Another full ball on off, and this was driven hard
swept away after going down on his back knee. Beats short fine leg to his right, with the ball being full on his pads
turns in now. Full length on off, as Surya has a nudge and gets the ball off the inside half of the bat to deep midwicket
fullish length in the channel outside off. Surya shuffles across a touch before pushing it back to the bowler
shorter in length, and wider of off too. He has a slash at that without any foot movement, and plays away from his body. Beaten there
and again, but this angles in before moving away. On that back of a length but closer to off, shaping to come in before Surya's cut sees the ball go above bat
good length again on off. This is tight stuff from Cummins. Surya can only slightly open the bat face to nudge to point
pushed aerially to deep point. On a back of a length and outside off again, as Surya has a poke away from his body

gone! Gifted to the man close in at midwicket. Kishan was struggling all this while, and he falls to Cummins for the third time in his career. On that hard length again from Cummins, and with good pace. That pitched on middle and leg, and Kishan looked to pull. But that seemed to have hurried on to him, and went bang to Shreyas, who took it in front of his stomach
good length ball on off. Driven off the back foot to long-on
full ball on off, and tapped down after leaning forward
backs away, with the ball being on a good length on middle and off, and turning away. Tucked to point
closes the bat face to this fuller ball on his pads. Clipped to fine leg for two quick runs
good length ball on middle. A hint of turn away, and clipped to deep midwicket after getting deep in the crease
good length again on middle, and turning in. Surya has a slog to the on side, but misses and is struck on his back pad
on a back of a length around fifth stump. That is tapped towards point, and they set off for a rapid run
shortish ball on off, and he pulls to deep square leg. Another single only, as Mumbai struggle to get going

dropped by Rahane! There seemed to be no clear calling between him and Billings, who was running forward towards the stumps at his end. Rahane went low and stretched forward to try and grab, but the ball popped out after kissing his fingers. It was a short delivery on middle, as Tilak pulled and got a top edge
fuller length on leg, and he clips that off his pads to fine leg
slower ball, and pulled to deep midwicket! On a friendly, back of a length, and the lack of pace means Surya has a lot of time to smack this ball on off. Four runs. Can this get them going?

six over third man, and that goes 15 rows back! He leaps in the crease to ramp that shorter ball, which is a touch wide of off. Presents the full face of the bat - much like that man Sehwag did years ago - and sent that flying. The boundary there wasn't too big either, for what it's worth
fullish ball on middle and leg, and angling in. He tries to clip to the leg side, but the ball takes his pad to dribble to the off side
on a good length on middle and leg again, as that is half-pulled-half-dragged to deep square leg
sweeps that for four to deep backward square leg! A change of pace from Rasikh on a pretty full length and just outside off, as Surya is down on his back knee to send that away in style
another slower ball, but this time he pulls his length back and also goes wider of off. Driven to deep point with a good sound off the bat
a gentle push to mid-off off this full ball on off, and they complete a rapid single
the bowler sticks his right hand out in his follow though while falling to his left, but doesn't get a hand. Surya pushed aerially at that fullish ball on off, and managed a run to mid-off
fullish length outside off, and turning in a touch. He goes to sweep, but the ball takes his front pad outside off
that is lofted expertly off a good length on off. He plays with high elbows, and sends that to deep point on the bounce
good, hard length on off. Whacked to long-on with a Dhoni-style whip
short of a length on off, and he pulls to fine leg with a swivel
much fuller and straighter on middle and off. Swiped to deep midwicket
backs away early, and Narine bowls on a fullish length turning into the stumps. Nudged towards mid-off for another single
scoops over fine leg! No respect for Cummins there. On a fullish length and wide of off too, and he goes across really early to just use the pace of the bowler and send that ramping
makes room, with the ball being on a good length and angling away to end outside off. Has a slash, but is beaten
slower ball on a short of a length outside off. He pulls to deep square leg after letting the ball come to him
change of pace again, and on a good length on middle. Cramping him for room there, as he can only pull unconvincingly to fine leg
drilled down the ground! Much fuller from Cummins on off, and he clears his front leg to have a hard go at that. Nails that between the non-striker and mid-off after playing from deep in the crease
short delivery on middle, and he swats that to long-on with a flat bat

sends that flying over deep midwicket! Tilak continuing his good season. Full length ball outside off, and he gets down to sweep that away for the maximum. Not quite middled, but the short boundary meant it was six
makes room, and slashes over cover! That's the fifty stand too. Bowled full and a little wide of off, as he backed away and tonked that over the man inside the circle's head
hoicks this fullish ball on middle and leg to deep midwicket
off the inside edge, as he looks to heave that full ball on off. A single to deep square leg, as Surya is not in control
tossed up full outside off. Driven to mid-off all along the ground
swept over short fine leg! Surya and Tilak taking it away now. Full delivery just outside off, and again he goes down on his back knee to loft that comfortably over the fielder's head
makes room, and the bowler follows. On a good length on middle, and turning into leg, as Tilak pulls to long-on after getting cramped there
tonked highhhhh over deep square leg! What a sound that made. Where were you Surya, ask his fans? Full length ball on middle and off, and that is absolutely thrashed for six
gets that off the bottom edge, as he goes chasing to that shortish ball which is wide of off. Short third man chases to his left, as the ball would have been a wide had he left alone
flies off the inside half of the bat to the man at deep midwicket. Full length and turning in, as he tried to play after making room

slashes that elegantly! Pure timing there after that powerful six. Short and wide of off, as he uses the pace of the bowler to cut that late and to the right of point. Deep point had no chance to his left
much fuller and outside off, as he sweeps but misses. The ball rolls over off Billings' gloves, and that allows a bye
he is having fun here! Fifty for Surya on his comeback. On a good length and outside off, as he waits for the ball to come before slashing over short third man. He is in command
yorker on leg, as he jams the bat down. A single to fine leg off the inside half of the bat
good ball. On a short of a length on middle at 136kph, as he pulls, but the ball is past him. Good pace there. Billings appeals for caught behind, but he is all alone there

how did that go for four!? He has to reach that for that short and wide ball outside off, which seemed to have been a slower ball. He lifts that away from his body, and goes over mid-off with his front leg out out the way
Fire from Russell: a short ball at 139kph. On a short of a length on middle, and cramping him. He sways away, and then thinks to ramp but doesn't connect
more short stuff, and that is another dot. On a short of a length, but on off stump this time. Tilak has a pull, but is beaten

that is a wide yorker, and Surya has a slash but is beaten. There is half an interest for a caught behind, and Shreyas goes upstairs with some hope. That pitched very full, and around an imaginary seventh stump. Surya had a go at that away from his body, and guess what... There is a spike as the ball passes bat, and out of nothing, Surya has to leave. Woah, maybe a luck break for Knight Riders since nobody really looked convinced with that review

this time there is an appeal for run-out. No breather for the third umpire. Tilak is diving for life, and he is in. Looked like the bat was in the air for a while, which prompted multiple replays. But he is safe in the end, with the bat grounded in time. That was another wide yorker outside off at 138kph, as Pollard managed to get some bat down in time. Pushed to long-off, and they manage two

launched flat and hard! Typical Pollard there. Stands across off expecting the wide yorker, and Cummins obliges. Pitches it bang in that full length and in the arc outside, as Pollard hammers that 141kph ball over long-on
much wider of off, and called wide. On a slightly good length, and he tried a slash but was beaten
change of pace, and that is hoicked to deep square leg. On a fullish length on off, as Pollard gets that off the inside half of the bat

gets a top edge, and gets six! The pace of the pitch, and that of the bowler takes that away. On a short length outside off, as Pollard pulls but gets a top edge over short third man. Bonus runs there

six more! Pollard comes and tonks 22 off five balls. That is now 23 off the final over, as Mumbai get past 160. Leading edge takes that over short third man yet again. He closes the bat face to clip that fullish ball on off, but does that too early. The pace of the bowler helps it sail over the off side though
zip off the seam, back into the right-hander, and thumped on the thigh pad. Tight lines
back and across, and nurdled into the gap at midwicket to get the chase up and running
full length, flicked through the line to the leg-side, another single to get the left-hander up and running too
pop from a good length, and spliced over gully! This are zippy, seaming conditions, Test-match vibes, and it's a struggle out there.
drawn forward to the full length, and pushed into the covers
skids on, on a leg-stump line, attempted clip to midwicket but can't connect. Tidy opening gambit
back of a length, skiddy off the deck, hurries on a pull to leg

swings across the line, and inches short of backward square! Diving forward, unsure whether it would carry, but committing all the same, and doing very well to watch the ball all the way and prevent the four
opens the face, back of a length, dabbed to third man
very full length, and a big appeal from Sams! Nothing doing from the umpire, pinned on a leg-stump line, but a nick saves the lungs
dabbed behind square, just back of a length
tip and run to cover, a fine pounce and under-armed flick at the non-striker's end, but Iyer is into his stride early and safely home
massive wind-up, but just thin air as Iyer throws everything through the line outside off
dinky dab through fine leg! A gallop across the crease, to the off side, opening up his stumps, and flipping the length ball past the catcher on the leg side. Nifty
good follow-up, just zipping past the edge as Thampi backs the pitch to do his work as he hits a good length
back of a length, cramped on the crease by a hint of nip back into the left-hander, poked down the pitch
leaning back, and cracked at backward point, timed well but excellently pounced
full toss, low and straight, so effective enough, no room to free the hands as Iyer settles for a push to cover
Lovely line and length, across the left-hander, climbing past the splice into the keeper's gloves
wonderful seam, climbing past a loose drive, on a tight line. Bowling
hurried on an off-stump line, a fraction fuller, Iyer slashes down to backward point
tight lines again, forward to meet the full length, squeezed back down the pitch
more hustle on a full length, at 144kph, Rahane comes forward but can't get it away
wider on the crease, bending the inswinger back towards off stump, a open-faced tap to third man and that's two off the over. That 162 target is looking better already...

banged in short, and strikes first ball! That's a wonderful start, Rahane climbed into the pull, but the left-arm line, into the body, had him cramped from the get-go. Sams backpedals at deep midwicket, clings on inside the rope, and KKR lose their first!
on the legs, flipped around the pads, down to fine leg. Fuller length from Mills, and the wrong line on this occasion
hops back into the crease to fence back down the pitch
excellent bowling, fuller length but climbing into the body all the same, bending back into the right-hander and cramping him on the back foot at 142kph

down the leg side and dropped! Not a brilliant ball, but the pace from Mills nearly prised another opening, a flashing pull across the line, off the face of the bat it seems, and though Kishan leapt with both hands he could only palm it to fine leg
fenced out to deep midwicket.
onto the front foot, tight lines from over the wicket, punched back to the bowler
swished up and over third man! A lusty hoick across the line, and a steepling top-edge, high over the keeper's head
back on a better line, pushed back down the pitch
