opens the face, outside off, clattered through backward point! The width does the trick, a despairing dive from the fielder
on the back foot again, pushed firmly out to cover. Just ticking along now

banged in short, and the short ball strikes again! Left-arm over, into the body, grip off the deck, Iyer tried to roll his wrists, but like Mills' bouncer, it just came on quickly from a lively deck, and square leg stoops to gather, five metres in from the rope
over the wicket, tight lines, blotted into the off side on the front foot
a two-step to the pitch, and a measured drive past short cover
reverse sweep, pushed across the right-hander, who can't connect outside off
advances to the pitch this time, meeting the round-the-wicket line with an uppish flick to long-on
there's some meat in that sweep! Boshed off an incredibly full length, but the sound off the bat said it all. Wide long-on couldn't blink before he was beaten
good follow-up, can't get this one away. A precious boundary in that over, but the struggle is real...
skiddy outside off, outside off, and Billings almost undercuts into the stumps
into position early for the sweep, play it from the other end for now
pulled to the leg side, not timed but shimmying at the pitch to make an angle
lumped over long-on! Strong from Billings, a forceful march to the pitch, and a clean-lined pick-up high into the stands!
swept again, good timing on this stroke too but backward square is well positioned, and they have to bail out of an ambitious second run
pushed across the left-hander, back onto the stumps to defend back to the bowler
firmly onto the front foot, punched with a full face to mid-off
open-faced glide, on the back foot, outside off, backward point leaps and pounces to cut off the run
swivelled into the stands! That's the way to pull them! Rocking into the stroke, skidding into the middle of the bat, and flat over square leg's head
another sumptuous stroke, guided with high hands and a full face out to cover, picked up by the sweeper, but this is a confident pick-up in tempo
back of a length, tight line outside off, and Iyer flashes off the back foot and nearly nicks off
another fine delivery, lifting past the outside edge. Just seven off the over in spite of Billings' big hit. Time for a Time Out
misfield by Bumrah at short fine leg, and that allows a single. Full ball outside leg, and he went to sweep that away

shapes to reverse sweep, but is not in control. Invites a leg-before appeal from Ashwin and Kishan, and Rohit thinks... thinks... and decides not to review. Full ball outside leg, and that hit his front pad after turning like a googly
crashes a sweep over deep square leg! Full ball on off this time, and he sweeps with command with his back leg down. That was nailed
backs away before returning to his original stance, and slashes that shortish ball outside off to deep point

skips down, and ends up slicing to long-off! Surya right on the edge of the boundary, and takes it with a little leap. Billings is left with his hands and bat on his head. He came down the pitch to that full ball outside off, and once he was jumping out, he always had to get bat on ball. Ended up slicing with an open face of the bat, and ends up departing
plays the reverse sweep first ball to this full delivery on off, but finds short third man. Iyer wanted a single, but was sent back

off the inside edge, and four behind the wicket! Yorker on off, as Iyer had a swing and got that nowhere from where he wanted. There was an appeal for leg before from Mills, but of course there was no pad there
crunches this drive to cover, who dives to his right and just gets a hand to stop the momentum. Full and wide of off, and Iyer drove away from his body
slower ball on a back of a length on middle. Pulls to fine leg with a swivel
shorter in length, and around fourth stump. Rana tries to ramp after trying the reverse sweep first ball, but fails to connect. No bat there

slashes over third man! That was short and wide outside off at 140kph, and Rana loved that pace. He backed away early to that cross-seam ball, and got his front leg out of the way before lashing out on that to go over the rope
change of pace, and pulls to deep midwicket running forward, as the ball falls just short with the fielder diving forward
low full toss on off, as he tosses that up. Swept away to fine leg for a single
shmmies down the pitch, and sees the bowler bowling short and wide of off, turning away from him. Slashes to deep point
full and just outside off. Nudged back to the bowler's left

taken at deep midwicket! It was there to be hit by Rana, but alas! That should ideally have been six. Short delivery pitching on middle and leg, and nearly going on straight off the pitch. He went to pull by getting his front leg out of the way, and ended up gifting the man there a catch, as he was placed well inside the rope. Knight Riders losing momentum here
Pretty full and wide-ish of off. Dragged back to the bowler with a flat bat

tonked down the ground! Right into the action. Full and tossed up on middle and off, and right where someone like a Russell would have loved it. He smells something with his blade, and lets that ram over the bowler's head
good length ball on middle and leg, and straightening off the pitch. Cramps him for room, as he uncomfortably dabs towards cover

top edge, and four over the keeper's head! We've seen those a few times today already. Good pace off the pitch, as Bumrah digs it in short on off at 143kph, as Russell swings for the leg side, but the ball flies off somewhere else
this is a good ball. Cramps him for room with a hard length ball on middle, which hints to angle in. Pulled unconvincingly towards midwicket
makes room, and pulls to long leg! Bumrah followed him by going back of a length outside leg, and Iyer obliged. Pulled that to beat fine leg to his right. Bumrah going for some runs here
back of a length on off, and this was closer to his body. He dabs that from close to his body, and beats point to his left. Deep point scampers across to his right
good ball. Change of pace, and goes short on middle and off while getting it to angle away. There is good bounce too, as Iyer misses his pull

taken at point, and the Russell storm/cyclone/earthquake lasts only this longer today! A short delivery with an upright seam on middle by Mills, as Russell is prepared to pull that early. The ball goes off really slowly off the pitch, as Russell goes to pull with his front leg out of the way. Gets a top edge - again, like he did against Bumrah last over - and gets it to balloon to point
good length ball wide of off, and dragged to cover away from his body

another top edge, and this lands beyond the keeper and short fine leg running back. Short of a length on off, and Iyer seemed to be in his shot early. There was a fumble in collection from Bumrah near the rope after he ran back, but that is two still

another miscue, and this lands well short of the man running in from deep square leg. Some luck for Knight Riders here. A slower ball on a short of a length on off, and he is not in control of that pull
Cummins lands from Pakistan, and sends that flying to Mumbai! Good length ball on middle, and right in the slot. Hoicked over fine leg for six

four this time! These are valuable runs for his side. Finds the gap between point and short third man, as he drags this fullish ball wide of off. Plays away from his body, but still manages to place where he wanted
fifty for Iyer!. But he needs to hang on. Gets an inside edge as he looks to drive forward to that good length ball on middle. The ball dribbles to the off side
slower-ball yorker just outside off. Cummins almost looked prepared to dispatch that, before realising he never had the pace he wanted
on the bounce to extra cover! Another slower ball, but full and wider of off. Pushed away from his body

that flies off the bat to deep midwicket! Bring on Mills and Bumrah, but Cummins is not going anywhere. Pretty full on off, as he gets his front leg out of the way, and swings with freedom. Although that didn't really come off the middle, it still went a long way

short third man dives to his left, but doesn't get a hand! Would have been wide had Cummins left it alone. Full and pretty wide of off, as he goes for a fish and manages to get off the outside half of the bat
a low full toss on off at 140kph, as Bumrah goes for the yorker. Jammed to long-on
over long-on now! Cummins making up with the bat after being expensive with the ball. Slower ball on a hitting length and full on off, as he swings after waiting for the ball to come
between long-on and deep midwicket now! Sams bowls a slower ball, which turns out to be a full toss on off. Cummins clears his front leg, and sends that heaving

six more! Over deep midwicket. You know how he did it, didn't you? Anyway, waits for the slower ball to come, gets his front leg out of the way, goes down on his back knee and really nails that over the fielder
6, 4, 6, 6. He is on 44 off 12 balls now. On a shortish length on middle and leg, and he swivels to pull over fine leg. Great shot, as he piles up boundaries after boundaries

is that an excellent catch by Surya at long-off? That was taken extremely well, but it is called no-ball for height. Oh my, everything happening here. Sams ends up bowling a high full toss on off, and Cummins swats that to long-off with his bottom hand off. Surya there was falling back while he took the catch, with his back leg very close to the rope. He ended up going outside the rope and pushed the ball back in, only to be back in and take it again. So an outstanding effort all in vain there
Cummins equals the record of the fastest IPL fifty! Just 14 balls for his fifty. Slower ball on a short of a length on off, and he pulls to deep square leg after letting the ball come to him

Oh God, Knight Riders have won with four overs to spare! They needed 35 from 30 balls, and Cummins got them all in six deliveries. Unbelievable stuff! Cummins ends with 56 off 15 balls. Four fours and six sixes in that innings. Slower ball on a full length on fifth stump, as he went slogging over the bowler's head. A lifetime of a T20 innings there
fuller around off and shaping away. Buttler is watchful and pushes it towards cover
length ball around off, defended back towards the bowler
fuller outside off, manages to push it past the diving cover this time and sneaks in a single. Off the mark
fuller and swinging in, Jaiswal looks to flick but misses. An appeal for lbw, du Plessis thinks for a while and decides not to review this. Replay shows it was a good call, it landed outside leg
fuller outside off, steered towards third man
length ball around off, stays back and defends. Just two from the first over
length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
length ball around off, Buttler was a bit tentative as he looks to push at it. Gets a thick outside edge towards short third man
fuller outside off, the ball wobbling in the air. Jaiswal goes for a big drive but gets an inside edge past the stumps
fuller in the channel, pushes at it and gets beaten on the inside edge. Looked like he was playing for the swing but the ball just went with the arm

Royals lose their first wicket. Jaiswal was playing for the swing once again and Willey sneaks this one through his defence to rattle the stumps. A length ball in the channel, Jaiswal goes for the drive away, from his body and leaving the gap between bat and pad. The ball just holds its line and castles him
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-off
fuller but angling down the leg side. A wide
an appeal for lbw. A length ball around off that nips back in to beat the inside edge. It hits Buttler on the thigh and would have gone over the stumps
fuller and swinging in once again, flicked in front of square leg
picked it up nicely. Fuller on the pads and Padikkal just sends it over the deep square leg boundary. Off the mark in style, with a six
fuller on the pads once again, this time Padikkal goes along the ground, between midwicket and mid-on. The mid-on puts in the chase, and the slide, to keep it to two
length ball on the stumps, defended back
length ball on the stumps, pushed gently towards mid-on for a quick single. Eleven from that over
length ball shaping away, goes for the cut and gets beaten
short of length on the stumps, Padikkal goes for a Nataraja pull but cannot connect. The ball hits him on the pads and goes towards the leg side, allowing a leg-bye
length ball angling away. Buttler takes a step towards the bowler but ends up chasing it with his hands and gets beaten
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards short midwicket where Anuj Rawat lets it go through his legs and costs three runs to his team
fuller on the stumps, flicked in front of square leg
length ball outside off, pushes at it, gets an outside edge that beats the short third man on his left, and the ball races away for four
length ball around off, punched to the right of mid-off for a quick single
136.9kph, nice shape on that one. Pitching on a good length around leg stump and going across the left-hander. Almost squaring him up and beating the outside edge
short of length on the stumps, gets on his toes and tucks it away towards square leg for a couple
length outside off and leaving Padikkal once again. He goes for the cut but gets beaten
length ball on the stumps, too straight once again. Padikkal flicks it in front of square leg for two more in that region
136.5kph, this is the line he should bowl more. On a good length, around off and leaving the batter. Padikkal is stuck in his crease and tries to follow it with his hands. Beaten
short of length around off, goes for the pull but gets an under edge on this. Ends up dragging it towards short fine leg
length ball around off, steered behind point where Akash Deep makes a diving stop to his left
fuller around off, comes forward and flicks it towards short midwicket. A bit of a fumble there
short of length around off, pulls it towards deep square leg
short of length around off once again, pulled towards deep square leg
length ball around off, goes for the drive but gets beaten on the inside edge

through the hands. A length ball around off, Buttler pushed at it but failed to keep it down. Luckily for him, it caught Akash by surprise and he couldn't react quickly enough. Long-on moved across to cut it off
length outside off, looks to drive it through covers but gets beaten
length ball leaving the batter, Padikkal manages to work it towards covers and sets off for a quick single. The fielder has a shy at the bowler's end but misses. Think Padikkal would have made it

dropped by Willey! A length ball outside off, Buttler moves across and slogs it across the line. Couldn't middle it and ended up skying high towards deep midwicket. Willey moved to his left but I think it was swirling in the air and fell just away from him as he dived
insult followed by the injury. Fuller around off, Buttler clears his front leg and smashes it over long-off, a six after a drop
length ball outside off, stays leg-side of the ball and pushes it towards sweeper cover
length ball on the stumps, goes for the flick but misses. Will get a leg-bye to square leg though
short of length on the stumps, pulled towards deep-backward square leg

another drop?! Was a short ball from Willey, Padikkal pulled it in the air towards deep square leg. Siraj charged in, dived forward and got his hand to it but it went though. Full marks for the effort though and maybe a touch harsh to call it a drop
driven down the ground for one
a length ball around off, pulled towards deep square leg
fuller, in the slot for Padikkal and he launches it over long-on. The fielder puts in the jump with an outstretched hand but it goes just over him. 14 from that over
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards midwicket
a googly, around off. Padikkal stays back and turns it in front of square leg. By the time the fielder from the deep fields it, they are on their way to complete the second run
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it to the right of the diving extra cover. Willey from sweeper cover cuts it off
length ball around off, looked like another googly. But Padikkal is staying on the back foot and flicks it towards short midwicket. Should he bowl a touch fuller?
down the track but Hasaranga bowls it on the pads. Buttler goes for the flick but fails to connect
second tier?! Maybe first. Buttler dances down the track once more and this time he is to the pitch of the ball. Smashes it over long-on for a biggie
length ball around off, pushed towards extra cover
length outside off, stays back and punches it to the right of the extra cover fielder who dives across to make the stop
length ball around off, flicked towards deep square leg
fuller around off, pushed to the left of the bowler who stops it in his follow-through
length outside off, steered to the right of the diving point fielder. But only a single as the sweeper cuts it off
a slower bouncer. Padikkal was looking to pull but changes his mind and lets it go through. Called a wide for height

another slower ball. Fuller length around off, Padikkal goes aerial but fails to middle it as the bat rotates in his hand. It goes up high in the air, Kohli pedals back from mid-off and takes it with reverse cups, and falls on his back after taking the catch. The third umpire wants to make sure if Kohli was in control of the ball and the ball didn't touch the ground as he fell down. Replay shows it was a fair catch, nothing wrong there
pitched up and squirted towards backward point, opening the face for one
back of a length, 136kph/84mph angling in towards Samson, who tucks towards midwicket
length ball on off stump, punched down to long-on coming forwards
short and swatted away through backward square leg on the pull
effort ball, banged in and climbing through above shoulder height outside off as Samson squints at it warily
shortish into the body, whipped away towards deep backward square leg - tidy over from Deep
tossed up on middle and leg, nudged towards midwicket
c-r-u-u-u-u-u-u-u-u-u-u-n-c-h-e-d! Full in the slot and Samson clears the front leg, belts it all the way over long-on for his first boundary!

hit on the back leg, excited appeal for lbw - not given but RCB review. Samson through his shot early, missed the ball by a distance, but Hawk-Eye has it sliding well down leg. Impact was outside, too

chipped back, simple caught and bowled! Hasaranga gets his first of the night, looked like a wrong'un or maybe a topspinner, it dipped and then kicked up to hit the splice with Samson attempting to defend on the back foot. Looped straight back to the bowler
over the wicket, pushed through and dabbed towards slip on the back foot
flighted legbreak on off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
pace off, Buttler dinks it into a gap in the covers
round the wicket, pitched up on middle and off, 134kph/83mph, blocked back down the track
short and sliding down the leg side
slower ball, 115kph and Hetmyer can't do much with it
another change of pace, tapped away
over the wicket, dug in short and must have been close to a wide. Cleared the ducking Hetmyer over his right shoulder
back round the wicket, slower ball nurdled off the stumps for one to short midwicket
floats up a googly wide of Hetmyer's hitting arc, misses attempting to drag a slog-sweep across the line
picks this one and slashes through point, forced away behind the sweeper off the back foot for his first runs
clobbered! And Hetmyer nearly falls over after heaving up and over cover, ends up somewhere near square leg...! Ungainly but effective, picks up four more
floated up and prodded into the covers
flighted, steered into a gap on the off side
flattish legbreak on middle and off, worked through midwicket. Buttler keeps the strike - which he's not had much of recently
back of a length, angling in and pulled hard and flat out to deep backward square, who does well to keep them to one
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, slapped down the ground
width, Buttler frees the arms but doesn't connect with a scything cut

slower ball, pinned in front - and given! But Buttler reviews straight away. Looks like he's got an inside edge on this. Yep, umpire Khalid will have to overturn his decision. Well bowled, nevertheless, by Harshal
another slowie, 112kph on the stumps, nudged down to long-on
banged in short from round the wicket, 130kph/80mph and pulled through the leg side
tossed up and worked for one off the front pad
starts to come down, Hasaranga bowls quicker into the pitch, clipped off the pads through midwicket
another Bosie wide of off stump, cut off the back foot through the infield
lovely bowling, topspinner going on to miss leg stump by a whisker! Buttler beaten swishing across the line, so nearly another victim for Hasa
tossed up and Buttler just looks to rotate, nudged leg side for one
flat googly outside off, Hetmyer picks out cover on the cut this time. Hasaranga is done, solid figures of 1 for 32 today
back of a length outside off, carved down to long-off
dug in, 129kph/80mph and Hetmyer gets bent out of shape looking to pull, sends it back to the bowler
munched into the stands! Length ball, into the arc for Hetmyer, and he duly smashes it over deep square leg for a much-needed six
fired in full outside off, punched through the covers for one
moves across early, Siraj sprays a 141kph/88mph full toss down the leg side
short and into the body, pulled through midwicket for one more
banged in again, 129kph/80mph and Hetmyer just gets one swatted out to deep square leg
back of a length, 121kph/75mph and slapped down the ground to long-on
low full toss, pace on and Buttler can only plink it through midwicket
short outside off, Hetmyer cross-bats it down the ground again
slower ball, taken on the full but again he can't put it where it wants it, plopped towards deep square
drilled past long-on! Finally Hetty gets hold of one, and sends it skidding into the rope despite a despairing dive from du Plessis
short and wide, Hetmyer throws the bat, comes off the toe through the covers
fired into the tramlines, full and wide with Hetmyer reaching for it, legs akimbo. Umpire happy, Hetmyer less so
clubbed through the hands of Faf! Fantastic diving effort at long-off, and he got the fingertips to it... couldn't cling on. He's such a good fielder you almost expect him to hold those
full and wide, Hetmyer opens the face on a lofted drive through point, Willey has to throw himself after it and they come back for two
another wide yorker, driven along the carpet to deep cover
creamed over long-on! Steps across and gets a half-tracker with pace on, bullied back down the ground and over the head of the fielder. Buttler nails one
bludgeoned... and he gets enough on it! Buttler clears long-off and brings up his fifty. Wide full toss and he connects, despite slicing across the ball slightly
pitched up outside off, mistimed down the ground
well bowled, spears a yorker into the pads with Buttler looking to make room
pounded into the boards! Short and lashed back, high over the man standing out at long-on. Maybe pace off, but it flew regardless
bottom-handed boshing! Misses the leg-stump yorker and Buttler's timing is right back, clean swing and he crunches six more down the ground
goes full and wide, 127kph and he has to reach for it, squeezed between short third and backward point
wide full toss with pace on, Deep gets away with one chopped to long-off
smoked! Hetmyer butters Royals' parsnips with six more from the final ball! Length ball and Hetmyer gets low to slam it up and over deep square leg, an emphatic finish to the innings
length ball on the stumps, a bit of swing into the batter, flicked towards square leg
length ball around off, comes forward to defend. An inside edge onto the pads. A loud call of no as the ball rolls towards cover-point
length outside off, stays on the leg stump and steers it towards backward point. Parag makes a good stop but sends in a wayward throw to Samson and ends up conceding an overthrow
length ball around off, looks to defend but gets a thick outside edge towards point
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards backward square leg
length ball around off, defended
length ball around sixth stump, left alone
length ball around off, comes forward and defends. The ball hits the inner half of the bat and gets entangled in his legs

an excellent stop at cover. Jaiswal the fielder. Was fuller outside off and swinging away, du Plessis drives it to the left of cover where Jaiswal dives across to make the partial stop. Hetmyer from point collects and has a shy at the bowler's end but misses. du Plessis gets a single
length ball around off, defended
down the track and smashes it over mid-off. Was a length ball outside off, Rawat stayed leg side of the ball and allowed himself the room to free the arms
back-to-back fours. A length ball down the leg side and Rawat is happy to tickle it down to the fine-leg boundary
length, a little bit room outside off. du Plessis stays back and punches it through covers for four
fuller and wider, du Plessis drives it to the left of mid-off. Buttler makes a sliding stop to keep it to one
length outside off and du Plessis is simply picking the gaps through that off-side ring. Goes between cover and extra cover this time to fetch four more
fuller and wider, driven to the left of Buttler at mid-off who dives to his left and gets his body in front of the ball

length outside off, moving away from the batter. Rawat just hangs his bat out, gets a healthy outside edge that goes to the left of Samson. If there were a first slip, it would have been a simple catch
length ball on the pads, flicked towards square leg
length ball on the stumps, glanced towards short fine leg
tossed up around off, pushed towards extra cover
fuller and sliding in. Rawat pushes at it and gets beaten on the inside edge. The ball hits the pads but was heading down. The umpire offers no response to the lbw appeal
fuller around off, lunges forward and blocks
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards square leg
fuller outside off, du Plessis stretches forward and lofts it over mid-off to ruin the over somewhat
length ball around off, steered towards point
down the track and looks to loft it over mid-on but he is somewhat cramped and gets beaten on the inside edge
down the track once again and this time Prasidh has bowled it fuller. Not the best of the connections but he ends up dragging it between the bowler and mid-on
length ball around off, comes forward and pushes at it. Gets beaten
a slower one but gone wrong. Pitches on a length but way, way outside off. Ignored
use of feet once more, this time it's full outside off. He manages to dig it out towards mid-off

an excellent yorker, du Plessis was walking across and looks to flick. Misses and gets hit on the pads. They run a leg-bye but RR want to review this. This could be close. There was no bat involved and it hit him in front of middle and leg but ball-tracking says it would have just clipped the leg stump. Umpire's call there, so du Plessis survives
a carrom ball around off, defended
looked like another carrom ball. du Plessis backs away and cuts it between cover and point for four
fuller length on the pads, flicked towards deep midwicket
fuller on the stumps, Rawat drives it towards long-on
length ball around off, goes back to cut but cannot middle it. Was in the air for a while but well short of short third man
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards square leg
length ball on the pads, flicked towards square leg
fuller on the stumps, gives himself a little bit of room and smashes it over the non-striker. Too straight for the long-on to cut off
flatter around off, goes back and punches it towards cover
fuller and quicker around middle. du Plessis backs away and pushes it towards cover. Padikkal mis-fields there and concedes a run
length ball outside off, some turn for Chahal. Rawat goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover

taken at long-on. Fuller on the leg stump, du Plessis moved towards the leg side and tried to hit over non-striker once again. But this time the ball dips at him and he ends up mistiming it. Boult takes a couple of steps to his left and takes a tumbling catch
fuller and wider outside off, Rawat goes for a drive but gets an inside edge past the stumps. A loud call of no from Kohli for the second run
fuller length on the stumps, flicked towards midwicket and they sprint back for the second
short of length around off, Kohli looks to flick it away. Gets an inside edge onto the body and it rolls towards square leg
fuller and wider outside off, uses his feet but had to reach out for it in the end. Drags it towards long-on
short of length outside off, opens the face of the bat to run it towards third man

Saini strikes. A soft dismissal. Was a length ball outside off, Rawat opens the face of the bat to run it down to third man but ends up playing it too fine. Samson tumbles to his left and takes it just above the ground
too full around off, pushed it towards extra cover
length ball on the leg stump and spinning back. Kohli turns it on the leg side. Samson is quick to the ball to stop any runs
fuller on the pads, flicked behind square leg

Has Kohli been run-out here? A length ball on the pads, Willey flicks it towards square leg, think it hit just his pad, but Kohli charges down the other end. Willey takes half a step down before saying no but Sanju Samson swoops to the ball and throw it off-balance to Chahal, who collects and breaks the stumps. The umpires have sent this upstairs and Kohli has been run-out by a frame

through the gate! The last two balls have titled the game hugely in RR's favour. Was tossed up around off. Willey came forward to defend but the ball spun back to go through the gap between bat and pad and castle him
fuller around off, comes forward and defends it on the leg side
length ball on the stumps, turned towards short midwicket
length but down the leg side
another length ball, once again down the leg side. Another wide
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards short midwicket
fuller on the stumps, this time he pushes it to the left of short midwicket
fuller around off, defended back towards the bowler
length ball but angling down the leg side once more. Third wide of the over
fuller on the stumps, lunges forward and works it in front of square leg
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards square leg
tossed up full on the stumps, Rutherford taps it back
is that a drop? Shouts of "catch!" as he pulls and it goes low to the right of the diving Ashwin at midwicket. Yep, it carried, though would have been a superb take
rags back at Shahbaz, over the wicket and spinning big into the left-hander, who chops down
flighted, can only poke this back to the bowler
tosses up a slow legbreak on the stumps, Shahbaz drags a sweep through square leg for one
skidding through quicker, 92kph outside off and Rutherford chops it away on the back foot
back of a length, 140kph and skids into the thigh pad with Rutherford playing across the line
short ball, climbing through past the top edge as Shahbaz swings at a pull. Signalled wide on height
blootered just short of the boundary marker! Shahbaz clears the front leg and crashes a length ball away to cow corner
goes full, 134kph and dug out back over the bowler's head
full length outside off, carved out to the cover sweeper
powered down the ground... just clears long-on! Misses the yorker and Shahbaz spanks it towards the RCB dugout, beyond the outstretched arm of Buttler. Just brushed the fingertips, I think
back of a length, 127kph and jabbed down into the covers
back of a length, Shahbaz hops down and mistimes a cross-batted hack
length on off, pace off the ball, makes room to cut for one

Saini bags a swirler! Boult strikes, RCB five down. Short and Rutherford hacked across the line, the ball flying up and over the keeper... but Saini circled around from short third, and then judged it well as the ball dropped a yard or so in front of him, clinging on at full stretch
back of a length from over the wicket, 136kph and Karthik shows it a solid straight bat
hard length on fourth stump, punched to cover
short, swatted away on the pull to deep backward square leg, well stopped by Prasidh Krishna
lobbed up from over the wicket, clubbed out to deep midwicket on the bounce
round the wicket, pushed through and pushed down to long-on
poor ball, carrom down the leg side, I think, Karthik smashes it through backward square! And Ashwin has overstepped, too
DK donkey kongs it over long-on! Tossed up in the slot and he connects sweetly with a thrash down the ground
chipped over mid-off for four! Lovely from Karthik, uses the feet and just picks a spot, beats long-on running around
carrom ball, 90kph outside off and gripping, beats the bat
brings out the reverse, and he gets enough on it. Beats the half-dive of Chahal at short third and races away
shortish outside off, Shahbaz dabs it behind square and takes one
full and straight, slower ball, whipped through midwicket! Basically a slow full toss from Saini, but DK again times the pants off it
lap-sweep, four more! Another pace-off delivery and he's down early, across his stumps and shovels through backward square
full, another slower ball, whisked into a gap leg side for two more
full and wide, 138kph and DK slog-sweeps, not the sweetest connection and it's cut off by the boundary rider at deep midwicket
short and flipped over short fine leg! Another slowie, but he doesn't have cover there. Shahbaz rocks back and swings it away
length ball, punched on the up into the cover region
wide yorker, but squeezed through! Gets it past the despairing dive of short third, and that's another boundary!
hit off a length, 139kph and thick-edged out to deep backward square leg
length ball on the stumps, tucked through square
slower delivery, pace down at 101kph, Shahbaz can only poke it back to the bowler
into the hip, swung all the way! Swivel-pulled up and into the empty first tier at fine leg. Shabash, Shahbaz!
tosses up a legbreak on off, defended towards cover
pushed through flat, 87kph and DK jumps back to cut, can't get it past Jaiswal in the covers
flighted, full on the stumps and swept firmly, straight to deep backward square leg
fizzed down at 90kph on leg stump, clipped out to deep square
floated up wide, Karthik reaches for a slap through to the covers to the sweeper
big-spinning legbreak angled across the left-hander, he steers it carefully down in front of backward point and takes the one
nearly bowled attempting to scoop! Just clears leg stump as Shahbaz goes a long way across and fails to connect
carted past long-on! Makes room and slaps a length ball into the boundary boards, fine of the man running around
smeared, flat over midwicket! Boult goes short but it sits up nicely, Shahbaz connects with a full-blooded mow to cow!
slower ball, he's waiting for it and lifts a couple more over short fine leg

bowled 'im! Full and straight, tailing in as Shahbaz went across looking to scoop again. Actually deflected off the glove and then through his legs into the stumps. RR break the stand, but is it too late?
leg-stump yorker, dug out calmly for one to mid-on
low full toss, swatted down to long-on
length ball wide of the stumps, 136kph and driven out to the cover sweeper
hard length, into the body and dabbed down in front of backward point. Gets Karthik back on strike
slung down short and wide, just straying into the tramlines!
dragged through midwicket, 140kph full-length ball outside off, DK gets enough on a meaty swing across the line. Brings the rate below a run a ball
tonked! Slower ball, short and inviting Karthik to happy-slap it away over deep backward square leg. One-bounce four
beaten with a beauty! Length ball on fourth stump, 142kph and sliding past the outside edge
smashes a lollipop into the stands! Patel dumps Jaiswal's tentative legbreak over deep midwicket, sealing a four-wicket win for RCB
length ball straightening along the fourth-stump channel, defended with an open face towards backward point
fullish, close to off stump, presses forward and pushes to the left of mid-off
full, slanting away from off stump, checked drive to mid-off
length ball on middle stump, hangs back and whips wristily to long leg
length ball angling into middle and leg, stays back and clips to midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, takes a big step back and back-cuts crisply to deep third
starts with a half-volley, though, and Rahul steps away from the line to make room and drills a drive to the left of mid-off
quickish length ball turning in towards middle and off, hangs back and clips to deep midwicket
a bit of in-drift towards leg stump. Wants to drive inside-out, ends up playing it back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat

got him, a terrific catch from Kane Williamson at short extra-cover, slightly squarer than an orthodox short extra. Again the leg-stump line, again QdK making room to drive inside-out, but he drives in the air, and Williamson throws himself to his right to take a superb catch

big lbw appeal, not give, and SRH have reviewed... Lewis was going for the sweep there, and Washington gets this length ball to mostly slide on with the angle into the left-hander. Beats the bottom edge to hit the knee roll. Was there any bat on this? No bottom edge, no glove. Where's the impact? He stretched across, and it's juuuust inside the line of off stump, but ball-tracking suggests the ball was bouncing quite a bit. Umpire's call on height! Nearly a first-baller for Lewis.
another lbw appeal after Lewis misses another sweep, but this one's clearly angling down leg. Speared in flatter and quicker too
length ball straightening slightly towards off stump, clipped watchfully to mid-on
length ball nipping in towards off stump, makes a bit of room and jabs wristily to deep point
yorker outside off, jams his  bat down to dig it out but the angle causes it to slide past his outside edge
length ball angling across to off stump, was premeditating a pull but it's nowhere near short enough, and he whips to deep square leg instead
back of a length, straightening towards off stump, lets it come and clips to the left of deep square leg
timing! On a length, but offers a bit of width, and Rahul drives on the up with a slightly open face and beats deep point to his left though he didn't have a lot of distance to cover

three balls, three missed sweeps, three lbw appeals, and this one's given. Washington has completely tormented Lewis today. Flat slider, pitching on a length just inside off stump and mostly going on with the angle. Clears his front leg to slog-sweep, and he misses and is hit on the thigh pad, right in front. Doesn't review either, and it just looked very out. Umpire's call on leg stump, it turns out.
tossed up slow outside off, driven firmly, and short extra dives left to stop it. Williamson again
length ball dipping and bouncing extra outside off. Looked to dab it behind point, ends up beaten on the outside edge. Less turn and more bounce than expected
flat length ball outside off, leans back and chops towards backward point
sharp turn this time, from just back of a length. Looks to work it into the square leg region, and is hit on the front pad. Clearly turning down leg though
flat offbreak finishing on off stump, goes back and punches to long-on. Terrific over, just the one run off it
back of a length on off stump. Hops to ride the bounce and defends to midwicket
drops a touch too short outside off, and Pandey plays his trademark topspin pull, swats it hard to the right of midwicket

short again, this time looks to tuck him up for room. Opens his hip up to make up for the lack of room, and pulls in the air, but times it sweetly enough to clear the leaping Samad on the square leg boundary
back of a length on leg stump, hops and defends to midwicket

got him, the persistent hard length works for Shepherd. It's on off stump, and Pandey, stepping out and opening up at the hips, ends up with no room for his arms to play what ends up as a straight-bat drive on the up. Ends up hitting it straight to mid-on at stomach height
back of a length on off stump, defended towards midwicket
back of a length, turns towards off stump, punched to cover point, who deflects the ball to extra-cover
tossed up slow on off stump, gets forward and clips to the left of square leg
flat length ball turning in towards off stump, driven to long-on
flat and fairly full outside off, gets forward to clip to deep midwicket
flat, back of a length, speared in towards the stumps, punched to long-on
flat full-toss close to off stump, shows the full face and drives to long-on
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face and steers towards third man

back of a length, angling into leg stump. Looks to work it into the leg side and is beaten by extra pace and bounce, and is hit on the flap of the front pad. Not much of an lbw appeal because it's going down leg
full outside off, gets forward and drives with an open face. It's in the air briefly, but to the left of the diving backward point fielder, and down to third man
in the blockhole, a hint of inswing towards the stumps. Jams his bat down and blocks it back to the bowler
short ball in the corridor, looks to lean back and ramp it over the keeper, but the ball bounces too much for him to make contact. 145.6kph
full, angling into middle and off, clipped to the right of midwicket, who makes a diving stop
terrible start. Loopy full-toss at thigh height on off stump, and he clears his front leg and hammers it back over the umpire's head
wide of the crease, spears a full one in towards off stump, driven down to long-off
flighted and very full outside off, opens his bat face and jabs to backward point
short ball skidding on towards off stump,flat-batted to long-on
back of a length on off stump, punched watchfully down to long-on
length ball outside off, slapped firmly to the left of sweeper cover
back of a length on middle and leg, stays leg-side of the ball and whips to mid-on
length ball angling away from off stump, punched to deep cover point
length ball nipping from leg to off, maybe a cutter. Watches it well and shows the full face to punch down to long-off
back of a length angling away from off stump, punched to the right of sweeper cover
fullish, slanting across to off stump, clipped to long-on
beaten. back of a length, slanting away from off stump and then it nips away further. Rahul looks to slice it towards third man, and the ball goes past his outside edge
sees Hooda looking to make room, tries to follow him with a yorker, but ends up bowling a low full-toss. Punched firmly to beat extra-cover diving to his left
full, close to off stump, makes a bit of room and drives to sweeper cover
shot. Superb hands from Rahul. Back of a length, angling into off stump at 151.8kph, and he leans away and creates just enough room to ramp the ball away through the vacant slip area
length ball outside off, offers just enough width for Rahul to hit on the up over cover and beat the sweeper to his right
low full-toss on off stump, punched down to long-on

oh, nearly a catch at third man! Good field placement, kept that fielder fine for just this sort of shot, the ramp. Sharp bouncer, and Hooda leans away and middles the ramp. Bhuvneshwar gets a hand to it while leaping and stretching upwards, but he can't hold on to this half-chance. Ends up tipping it over the boundary
back of a length outside off, cut away to the left of deep point. Swift running to pick up two
back of a length angling into middle stump, clipped away to the left of deep square leg
slower ball angling into middle and leg, lets it come and clips down to long-on
full, close to off stump, opens his bat face and squeezes it to the left of deep point
cutter, straightens in the fourth-stump channel. Rahul was looking to use the initial angle and clip down to long-on, ends up getting a leading edge that rolls along to deep point
length ball on off stump, punched to extra-cover

bang. Steps away from leg stump to make room, and Shepherd looks to follow him, but he bowls a length ball that Hooda can get underneath and slog away over the square leg boundary. Bat turned in his hand and the bat face closed a little early, but he still hit it a long long way
full, angling into off stump, clipped to long-on
back of a length close to off stump, flat-batted down to long-on
slower legcutter angling down leg, looks to step across and sweep over short fine, can't connect. Hits his thigh pad on its way to the keeper
steps out while making room. Bowls another legcutter straightening towards middle stump. Punched to long-off
on the fuller side of a length on middle stump, looks to clip it to long-on, plays a touch early and nearly pops a return catch to the bowler, but it drops just short
steps out and the ball nips back in towards the stumps. Looks to hit down the ground, ends up dragging it to the right of midwicket
full on off stump, whipped to the right of midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, chopped to the left of deep point
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on
low full-toss on middle and leg, clipped to the right of long-on
length ball on off stump, punched to the right of sweeper cover
full on off stump, makes a lot of room and that's a terrific shot. Opens his bat face to slice the ball to the right of backward point
in the blockhole on leg stump, makes room and plays another open-face drive to deep point
length ball, offcutter, finishing around middle and leg. Looks to make room but can't manage it, swatted into the on side off the inside half of the bat
shot. Length ball angling into leg stump, makes a lot of room and flat-bats it firmly between the stumps and the non-striker
back of a length in the corridor, beats the outside edge as Hooda makes room and tries to drive through the covers

what an innings this is from Hooda. Another terrific shot. Shortish, angling into the hip, and you would think he has no room to hit it cleanly, but he whips it away over the backward square leg boundary, finishing with his front leg prancing in the air
appeal for lbw as Rahul misses the flick, but the ball pitched outside leg. Ricochets into the backward point region

ooh, nearly a chance! Slower ball, and he's into the flick too early. Leading edge pops up in the air, to the right of backward point, but the fielder there, Bhuvneshwar, doesn't get close to the ball in time
full on middle stump, hit firmly, on the bounce, to long-on. Too full for him to get the elevation he desired
full on middle and leg, clipped to long-on to bring up a 31-ball half-century. Outstanding innings given the team situation when he walked in
back of a length on leg stump, tries to make room, but only manages enough to punch to the right of extra-cover for a single
steps out and Natarajan spears a full one at his feet. Good over, this, not given the batters too much of a chance to free their arms. Clipped down to long-on

got him. Caught on the midwicket boundary. Hooda steps away from the stumps, looking to make room, and gets a back-of-a-length offcutter that finishes around off stump. He has the room to free his arms, but he doesn't quite hit this pull/slog cleanly, ends up finding the man on the boundary
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face and dabs to third man
back of a length offcutter outside off, pulled to the left of deep midwicket to bring up his 50th T20 half-century. Wow
shot. Full outside off, gets down on his back knee to drive crisply to the left of deep point. Samad makes a sprinting, diving save, but he might just have touched the boundary along the way
back of a length close to off stump, steps across and clips to midwicket
length ball just outside off, nips away a touch. Steps out and punches it back to the bowler

bang. Spears a flat length ball at leg stump, and Rahul clears his front leg to try and swipe it over the leg side. Hits the high part of the bat but he gets it into the gap to the left of short fine leg

bang. Drops a touch short outside off, and he offers enough room for Rahul to free his arms and flat-bat cleanly over 
wide long-on
sweeps from outside off, a touch too full for elevation, drags it along the ground to deep square leg
steps out and Washington bowls a flat, shortish one turning into the body. Swiped along the ground to deep backward square leg
another one that's a touch too full for elevation on the slog-sweep. Hit along the ground to deep midwicket

floated up wide of off, and that's nicely done by Badoni, stretches out and sweeps to beat deep backward square leg  sprinting and diving to his left. Samad the fielder once again. Could have stopped this, but let it slip through his fingers
awkward full-toss, angling into leg stump and finishing around thigh high. Whipped away to the right of long-on

length ball outside off, and Samad puts down a difficult chance at sweeper cover. Rahul hits it up and over, and Samad creates the chance with a quick sprint to his right, but the ball bursts through his hands
blockhole ball on middle stump. Gets his front leg out of the way and jabs it back to the bowler
in the blockhole again, on off stump, clears his front leg and swipes to long-on, all along the ground. Hit it on the full, but it's so low he can't do much about it
low full-toss, angling in and denying Badoni the room he craves as he moves to the leg side. Whipped down to long-on
another low full-toss on the stumps, makes a bit of room and drives to long-off

given! Natarajan goes for the yorker as expected, and Rahul looks to sweep and misses. Looks very out, but Rahul has reviewed... Wasn't quite a yorker, but pitched quite full. Did it pitch in line or outside leg? Juuuust in line, and it's going on to hit middle and off stumps. Rahul finishes with 68 off 50. Hasn't quite managed the late acceleration to make up for the slow start, maybe, but a decent knock given the situation LSG were in
full-toss angling into the shins, whipped away to deep square leg
short now, gets up to shoulder height on off stump, and that's superbly done by Krunal, gets on top of the bounce and pulls firmly to the backward square leg boundary

bang. A bit of late inward swerve on the attempted yorker, and he was looking to clear his front leg and hit into the leg side. Ends up as a swinging full-toss that beats Krunal's inside edge and goes between his legs to hit the base of leg stump
goes deep in his crease to drive this attempted yorker, angling away from off stump, towards long-off
nice shot, but the field is set for it. Attempted yorker slanting away from off stump, and he shuffles across to lap-sweep it to fine leg
nice shot. Length ball outside off and he steps across for the sweep to the left of fine leg
half-volley on off stump, poor ball given the field. The batter was always going to look to make room. That's what Badoni does, and he drives crisply over extra-cover

this is a difficult field to bowl to. Now he expects the batter to make room and bowls a slower ball down the leg side. Badoni just allows it to go through for a wide, and then the ball nutmegs Pooran behind the stumps
slower ball close to off stump, flat-batted down to long-on
terrific shot from Holder. Drags the slower ball a touch short, outside off. Plenty of room for Holder to free his arms and clear long-on with the flat-bat hit
follows Holder down the leg side with a blockhole-ish ball, clipped away to deep midwicket

steps out, looking to make room, and Shepherd bowls a slower length ball wide of off. Slashes and misses, and then they hurry through for the bye. The throw from the keeper comes back to the bowler in his follow-through, and he dives and flicks it onto the stumps at his end to catch Badoni short of his crease
full on middle. Bit of movement into him. Nudged off his pads to midwicket for a quick run
full on off stump. Presses into a defensive shot off the front foot
full just outside off. Defended off the front foot with soft hands. Takes the outside edge and rolls towards the slip cordon
full outside off stump. Bit of movement away and driven along the ground to cover
good length outside off and angling into his body. Fended off the back foot to short cover. Early, quick call for one
turned around the corner! Holder tries to test him with the short one on leg stump. Sharma moves towards off side, and gives it a flick from near his shoulder behind square for four
good length on middle. And flicked towards midwicket for one
good length, outside off, and nudged off the back foot to point
good length on off. Gets onto the back foot. Flicked from his hips to midwicket
good length just outside off. Backs away and punches to long off for one
low full tos or might've pitched near his toes searching for the yorker essentially. Around leg stump. Bunted to wide long on for one
good length ball angling into him from off. Flicked off his waist to midwicket, which is vacant, for one
back of a length on off. Bit of extra bounce near his chest. Soft-hand flick to the leg side with short midwicket lurking
back of a length around off and angling into him. Flicked from near his gut region to deep square leg
full and very wide outside off. Wanted Sharma to reach out, but the angle takes it quite far away from him
length ball angling across, and he slaps a cut along the ground to Krunal at deep point

innovation! Good length outside off. Williamson walks across to the off side, waits for the ball to get to his waist-height, and then ramps a lap shot with ease over the keeper. Did that hit the boundary skirting on the full? Oh yes it did!
full and wide outside off. Williamson came down the track and tried to clatter a cover drive. But the ball swung away from him, goes past the outside edge too
full toss, shin high on middle and leg. Driven to mid on's right for one
good length, fifth stump line. Williamson waits for it, bends his knee, and then cuts gloriously through point's right!
good length, around off stump. Tapped off the back foot to mid on's left with soft hands

pays the price for being too cheeky! Avesh stays full and wide. Williamson walked across to the off side to play that lap/ramp over the keeper and short fine leg. But this time it comes off the bottom of the bat, and Tye at short fine got under it for a sliding catch
overpitched, fifth-stump line. Driven with the toe end of the bat to deep extra cover
good length on middle. Flicked off his back foot to midwicket
full just outside off stump. Stays low and drills a drive to the fielder at cover
seam up. Length ball on middle. Worked off his waist with soft hands to square leg for a single
good length on middle and off. Opens the bat's face and guides it to point

nearly goes for six! Full ball just outside off. He loses his shape as he tries to muscle a slog. But still gets enough connection to get it over mid off, and one he achieved that, it was a question of four or six. Still Tye won't mind that, Sharma was not in control
good length on middle and leg. Dabbed off the back foot to the off side for a quick single
good length ball on off and angling into his pads. Tripathi tries to turn it off his hips down to fine leg, but misses. However, it hits the thigh pad and rolls past the keeper for four legbyes
good length, just outside off. Back-foot push to the off side

into orbit and Manish Pandey holds on. Avesh Khan gets his second. Went fullish on off, but went with the cutter. Sharma didn't pick the change in pace and went for the loft after clearing his front leg. Sliced in the air, and Pandey runs in from outside the circle and takes the catch around the cover region
good length, fifth-stump line outside off. Puinched off the back foot, but played behind square
dropped! Tough one for Hooda, with the ball dipping after Tripathi tried to play a cut. Hooda at gully dived to his left... but in and out
full ball just outside off. Uppish drive that goes to mid off on the bounce
bowling hard into the deck. Good length outside off, and some extra bounce as Tripathi tries to ride the bounce and cut. Finds the infielder
good length ball on off. Pulls from near the chest to deep backward square leg
full outside off. Starts off with the legbreak. Driven rather confidently to deep extra cover
full outside off. Now the googly. Slaps a drive to KL manning the cover region. But the buzzer comes on....cardinal sin - front-foot no ball!
full on middle. Bit of turn away. Markram clears the front leg and drills it down the ground along the grass. Long on and long off get together and do a 1-2 combo effort to stop the four
fullish outside off, googly turns in as he scurries to play a cut to deep point
gets it over! Full outside off but turning in. Tripathi looks to play with the straight bat, and uses the bottom hand to loft it over the bowler - but just about
half-tracker on a fourth-stump line. Worked off the back foot to square leg for only one
full and wide outside off. Slaps a drive but Rahul commits to a dive to his right, and stops a certain four
good length ball outside off. Put a lot of shoulder into that delivery, grunting as he delivers. Punched off the back foot to deep extra cover
back of a length outside off. Tripathi backs himself and drags a pull from way outside off. Places it at the vacant cow-corner region

deft! Tye goes for a short ball, pretty good ball, aimed for near Tripathi's ears. But Tripathi waits, and then just sticks the bat out late to play a cheeky ramp/guide over the vacant slip region for four
pace off, full outside off. Mistimed drive that's sliced to backward point on the boundary line
full on middle and leg. Flayed away to wide long on, with two fielders protection the region there
low full toss on middle and leg as he misses the yorker. Hard flick off his boots, and gets it between deep midwicket and deep square leg! Four to bring up the time out
Krunal around the stumps after the time out. Fullish on middle. Straightens after pitching. Worked off the back foot to deep midwicket
enough to clear fine leg! Full on middle and leg. Tripathi gets low, and then uses his wrists to flick it over Gowtham manning the boundary!
length ball on the stumps. GUided off the back foot to the ap at midwicket. Calls fo two early, and successfully done
full on middle. Flicks this from near his toes to deep midwicket once again
full on middle and leg. Closes the bat's face in his flick, but finds short fine leg
good length on off. Punched off the back foot - after backing away - to wide long off for one
good length just outside off. Backs away and clatters a cut to the sweeper fielder to the deep
fullish, outside off and turning in. Late dab to short third's right for a single
good length, outside off stump. Cut to deep point for a single
full outside off. He moves to the right side to try and playing a ramp by getting low but gets a glove onto his pad, and past de Kock.
good length, on off. Cut to the off side
good length outside off. Legbreak. Fended off the back foot

inside out but can't clear cover! Krunal goes around the stumps, on off stump. Markram backs away and tries to play an inside out cover drive, but doesn't have the elevation! Rahul puts both hands up and the ball sticks!
full on middle. Defended off the front foot
full and wide outside off. Forcing him to stretch. Swatted towards the non-striker but Krunal runs to his right to intercept
flatter ball. Length on off. Pulled along the ground off the back foot for one to the man in the deep
full on middle. Skidding into him as he misses a defensive shot. Hits the front pad, soft lbw appeal but not given. Going down leg, this slider
back of length outside off but comes in sharply with the arm such that Tripathi cuts this from around off stump! To the point fielder
peach of a ball to start a new spell. Length ball on middle but there's lateral movement away after pitching the deck. Pooran pokes at it, almost, and the ball whizzes past the outside edge
back of a length on middle and off. Pulled in front of square to wide long on for one
full on a fifth-stump line. Slaps a drive through the covers. Bit of an uppish shot, and Evin Lewis' slight misfield in the deep allows them to take the second
back of a length, fifth stump line. Stays on the back foot and plays a cut. Gets it between backward point and gully!
back of a length, outside off. Wants to play a late dab to try and beat short third man but can't on this occasion
aiming for the yorker, ends up as a low full toss. Drilled to wide long on for a single
tossed up, wider outside off stump. Driven to deep extra cover for a single
could've been out around his legs! Bishnoi goes full outside leg and Pooran tries to sweep. He misses, but its dangerously a googly, and very nearly clipped leg stump
full on off and the googly turns further away as Pooran presses forward to defend. Whizzes past the edge leaving the keeper and bowler groaning
fullish on off stump and the googly is punched off the back foot to long off
full outside off. Legbreak is tapped off the front foot to cover point for a single
full outside off and the googly turns further away. Pooran tries to cut but misses out
full outside off. Turning away and Pooran throws his bat at this to cut. Misses again!

slog sweep straight to deep midwicket. Full on off, Tripathi went for the big shot, and Bishnoi is a good catcher in the deep. Did Pooran's scoring rate force Tripathi to do that? We'll never know ..... this is a shot that Tripathi does enjoy, just didn't come off this time.
good length, on middle. Clipped off the back foot to square leg for a single
full toss on off and slapped to long off. Mistimed though
slows it down. Fullish, but wider. Sundar waits, and plays a late-ish cut towards point for one
baseball style! as Krunal offers it in his arc. Comes over the stumps. Length ball from outside off turns into him. He stands and drags a hammered shot over wide long on
full on off stump. Flicks this with a flourish of his wrists, only to deep midwicket for one

back of a length on middle and he swivels quickly to pull along the ground in front of square. Holder didn't really bend his back for his first ball, with the delivery not really bouncing despite being back of a length
full outside off. Reaches out to drive, and thereby converts it into a low full toss. Sliced to deep cover
back of a length outside off. Cuts, but in front of square, where there are big gaps. Lewis has to run around from deep point to cut it off

full, wide-ish and he reaches out to try and clatter a drive. Toe-ended to mid off, and the poor timing actually tempts him to take the single. Pooran running to the danger end, but the throw is not a direct hit. Would've been tight if that hit
full on his toes. Flicked away to deep midwicket for one
full ball, wider outside off. Beyond the tramlines with Pooran not attacking
smartly played! Holder over-corrects. Full on his toes, and Pooran's flick is placed square, instead of in front of it, and the ball rolls away to the boundary! 15 off that over
full on leg. Flicked off his pads before the ball could turn in either direction
fullish on off. Turning away. Stays on the back foot and cuts to deep point for a single

top ball! Full outside off and turning away. But the length is such that Sundar is tempted to drive. Nearly falls over after missing the shot, and the back leg may have been up while the keeper whipped the bails off. Side-on umpire wants to go upstairs to check. The back leg came back inside the popping crease in time.
tossed up. Full on middle and leg. Places a flick to wide long on, and the placement allows them to take the second
full on middle and off. The googly is driven to wide long off, albeit mistimed
full on off and the googly is met with a controlled drive. Along the grass, past the cover fielder, and too much for long off to do! Ends the over on a high!

Slower ball. Full and wide outside off. Hard hands as he sticks the bat out. Hard ping off the bat and goes to cover. They're off for a single, and take off for one, but its a direct hit from cover! Totally safe though
full and wide outside off. Forcing him to stretch. Mistimed drive away from his body to wide long off
top yorker, on middle and leg. Plays the Nat-Meg between his legs as he gets the bat down and its squirted away to square leg
back of a length around off stump. Walks across the stumps to play a flick behind the keeper but couldn't connect
full and wide outside off. Throws his bat at this in a bid to try and drag a shot through wide long on. Mistimed, ball goes away to deep midwicket

great use of the wrists! Uses the bottom hand too, to get it up and over cover. Full outside off. Sundar cleared the front leg early and then just stroked the ball through its line. There was long off and deep cover in place, but both were spectators
short ball as predicted but not quick enough. Pooran stands tall, and smacks a pull from near his chest, and gets enough behind it to clear deep square leg
good comeback as he bowls a yorker on the fourth-stump line. Pooran can't get anything on it

lucky wicket for Avesh! As the knee-high full toss is mistimed down to long off. Avesh wanted the yorker but overpitched it, Pooran's adrenaline makes him go for the big shot anyway. Not off the sweet spot, and Hooda gets behind it. The Lucknow supporters go up in delight, the Sunrisers owners sink into their seats
two in two! Raw pace, nearly a yorker outside off. Samad tries to drive, but its taken a tiny edge through to the keeper! Two more balls left to get a five-for! Samad falls for a golden duck tonight
yorker for the hat-trick ball. But Shepherd digs it out and the ball settles near his toes
short and wide. Way beyond the tram-lines. He'll have to rebowl....
end of a top spell as Avesh finishes with 4/24. Fullish outside off but the ball takes off after hitting the pitch. Shepherd shapes up to play a cut, but is beaten by the pace of the delivery
full outside off. Rolls his fingers over this ball. Smacks one to deep extra cover for just one
yorker length, trying the wide yorker. Nearly successful, but just over the wide line
yorker length, fifth-stump line. Shepherd moved to the off side to get closer to the ball, but couldn't get any connection
slower ball, delivery slipped out of his hand. Loopy full toss, wide outside off. Mistimed slap to long off
full outside off. Sundar gets low and tries to get under it for a loft. Struck well, but one bounce to long on
game is alive as long as a West Indian is here! Full toss on his shins. But Shepherd's bat swing is simply sensational. Golf-swing with great connect....and its over long on for half a dozen!

OUT! NO! Dropped! Slower ball, full and wide. Shepherd tried to smack it over cover, but didn't have the elevation. Straight into Bishnoi's gut, but he can't hold on! #InAndOut and Shepherd survives. Importantly its a dot.

perfect start for Super Giants as Sundar holes out at long on. This was fullish on a fourth-stump line with Holder coming around the stumps. Sundar tried to clear the straight boundary, but the bat's face turned. Not a great connection, and provides enough time for both Manish Pandey (deep midwicket) and KL Rahul (long on) to both attack the ball, with the latter eventually taking the catch
full and wide outside off. Bit of a dab to deep backward point for one
low full toss, outside off. Tries to go for a big shot, but totally mistimed. Ball rolls away to deep midwicket, and unfortunately for Sunrisers, Shepherd is stranded at the bowler's end

that should seal it unless there are extras. Holder knew Bhuvi must go for a big shot, and therefore he totally takes the pace off. Full loopy ball on off. Bhuvi is through the slog too early. Ball pops right up in the air, and de Kock gets under the swirling white ball. A fist pump from a few key Super Giants players.
full outside off. No eyes on the ball as he tries to swing across the line. Sliced to short third man
length ball on the stumps, a bit shape in to the batter, which actually helps Agarwal who flicks it fine and gets off the mark with four
what a comeback! It was a length ball, bowled wide outside off. Agarwal went for the drive but couldn't keep it down. A simple catch for Uthappa at cover
...and he strays down the leg side. Fuller but way too down the leg side
length outside off, a hint of away movement. Goes for the cut but gets an under edge that bounces towards the keeper
excellent running between the stumps. A length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards square leg and they sprint back for the second
fuller and wider outside off, pushes at it and gets an outside edge as the ball swings away. Too far away from the second slip
length ball in the channel, Dhawan leaves it alone
short of length angling down the leg side. Rajapaksa goes for the pull. The bottom hand comes off as he gets a top edge. Sails over the fine-leg boundary

that's some athleticism and presence of mind from Dhoni. Was a length ball on the stumps, Rajapaksa pushed it on the leg side and set off. Dhawan took a couple of steps down but he waiting for it be clear of Jordan, who ran across - in front of Dhawan - fielded that ball and had a shy at the stumps. Rajapaksa turned around but was never going to beat the throw. The ball missed the stumps, but Dhoni was charging in. He collected with both hands and threw it underarm at the stumps while diving forward to find the batter short
length ball around off, defended
length ball on the stumps, flicked uppishly behind square leg. It lands just short and the fielder collects it and flicks it back as the momentum takes him over the line
short of length outside off, defended
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards square leg
fuller and wider outside off, left alone
fuller outside off, pushed towards covers
short of length outside off, defended
short, down the leg side and Livingstone has pulled over fine leg, all the way for a six. No half-measures when it comes to Livingstone
length ball around off, punched towards extra cover from the front foot

over extra cover this time! It looked like it bounced just inside the boundary line but it has been given a six. Wait, the third umpire is having a look and he decides it's four. It was a length ball and Livingstone stepped down the track and smashed it over extra cover
length ball around off, dropped towards cover-point for a single
almost nails the yorker, Livingstone just manages to clip it towards square leg
Dhawan dances down the track this time and cuts it hard. Bravo at point puts in the dive and gets a hand to it, which slows it down. Two in the end
length outside off, cuts it straight towards the point fielder this time
length outside off, stays back and punches it towards backward point. Ruturaj Gaikwad intercepts it
fuller outside off, driven firmly but straight towards the cover fielder

this is one of the most disdainful sixes you would ever see. And one of the longest too, 108 metres. He is standing on the off stump and pulls this length ball way over, I mean way, way over, the deep-midwicket boundary
a good comeback from the bowler. Bowls a cutter in the channel. Livingstone looks to slice it but gets an outside edge. Luckily for him, it bounces just in front of Dhoni
down the track and converts this into a leg-stump half-volley. But he goes inside out and blasts it over mid-off
use of feet once again and Choudhary slips in wide outside off, too wide actually
the same drill as the last ball. Livingstone gives the charge and the ball bowls way outside off, even wider than the previous ball

fuller and wider outside off and Livingstone scythes it over extra cover. The sweeper sprints to his right but cannot reach there in time. A couple of bounces and over the boundary line. That's the longest side
four more! Fifty comes up for Punjab in just 4.5 over! Fuller and wider and he throws his bat at it. And it sails over short third man

Six? Four? fuller around off, this time Livingstone takes a step towards the off side and launches it over deep midwicket. Looks like it hit the boundary cushion on the full, and that makes it 26 off the over
down the track but Bravo bowls it way outside off
length outside off, cuts it towards extra cover
free swing of the arms. Fuller around off, Dhawan takes a step towards the ball and launches it over long-on. Easily done - 84 metres
fuller and wider outside off and smashed through covers. Too much width from Bravo

Dhawan shuffles around in his crease before finishing outside off. Bravo slips in a slower one outside off, Dhawan leaves that alone hoping for hit to be called a wide but the umpire thinks he was close enough to the ball to play a shot

a low full toss on the stumps, flicked towards mid-on where Jadeja is stationed. Dhawan was looking for a single but decides against it. Jadeja fires in a throw at the non-striker's end but Livingstone was back I think
length ball on the stumps, Dhawan pulls it down past short fine leg, who dives but cannot stop it
but it doesn't seem to matter for Livingstone. He goes down the track first ball and launches it over long-off. Another massive six
length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
length ball on the stumps, use of feet and flicks it towards deep square leg for a couple
length ball on the stumps, goes forward and back and eventually flicks it behind square leg

Dropped by Rayudu! Goes down the track again but gets an outside edge that lobs to the right of short third man. Rayudu circles around it, gets under it but it pops out. Was a straightforward chance but he messed it up completely
a low full toss outside off, Dhawan moves across and looks to paddle it fine. Gets hit on the pads. Will get a leg-bye

fuller down the leg side, goes for the flick but gets a fine edge. Dhoni dives to his left and catches it but looks the half of the ball was out of the gloves and when he fell down, it brushed the ground. Dhoni in his heart knows it and hardly celebrates even though the bowler is excited. Dhoni signals the square leg umpire to check upstairs and the replay confirms the ball did touch the ground
fuller around off, gently guides it towards cover for a single

fuller outside off, Dhawan goes down and slogs it across to the left of long-on. Bravo moves across and stops it just inside. For a moment it looked like the momentum would take him over the boundary line but he showed great control and kept jogging around the boundary line, just inside
fuller but way outside off. Called a wide
down the track and takes it on the full. Tapped towards long-off
fuller on the stumps, flicked with the wrists towards long-on
length outside off, goes for the cut but mistimes it towards mid-off
length outside off, goes for the cut again but misses
fuller outside off, smashes hard but cannot beat extra cover
length but well outside off, left alone for a wide
fuller outside off, looks to drill it through covers but mistimes it towards extra cover. Gets a single
fuller length on the leg stump, Dhawan moves across, goes down and laps it between the keeper and short fine leg
short of length, goes back and pulls it towards deep square leg
fuller but way outside off, left alone
fuller around off, skips down the track and stays leg side of the ball. Drives it through extra cover and hundred comes up for Kings
fuller around off, driven towards deep extra cover
Fifty comes up for Livingstone, off just 27 balls. Fuller length on the stumps, he goes down and looks to sweep it. Gets a top edge that sails over the keeper's head and carries all the way
a slower one outside off, more like a dipping yorker. Livingstone swings across but was a touch early and fails to connect
a low full toss on the stumps, swings it towards deep-backward square leg. Not the best of the timings on this
fuller outside off, Dhawan looks to go over extra cover but mistimes it and it goes straight up. Jadeja runs sideways to his right at extra cover and pouches it
Jadeja drops it short and wide of Livingstone, he reaches out for the ball and crunnnnnches it away to the left of sweeper cover
similar ball, but this is carved more or less straight to that sweeper cover fielder
pushed through outside off, driven down to long-off off the front foot

Rayudu clings on at short third man and flashes a wry smile. Relief for Rayudu and CSK. 100ks dart, shorter and outside off, Livingstone aims for a cut and ends up slicing a thick outside edge to short third man. CSK are well and truly back in this contest
on a length and drifts into off stump, played back to the bowler
back of a length and quicker on the stumps, blocked back off the front foot
pushed through on middle and leg, knocked to midwicket
down the track and swiped over the longer leg-side boundary for six. Jitesh holds nothing back, staying true to Punjab's playbook
forced back to the bowler after stepping out
whisked down to long-on
worked with the spin to midwicket
dragged down on middle, hauled away to deep square leg off the back foot
just short of a length and outside off, punched down to long-on off the back foot
back of a length and angling across off, run away to short third man
Choudhary hits an in-between length and aims for the stumps, forced back to him
slower short ball into the body, Jitesh lines it up and muscles a pull over long leg for six. Clean strike from Jitesh
back of a length and angling across off, but fairly close to off, played back to Choudhary
pitched-up delivery, sliding across off, Jitesh chips a drive down to long-off
full and fired outside off, driven on the up to wide long-off
sliding down the leg side, Shahrukh sweeps and misses. Wide
pushed through on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket off the front foot
speared outside off, chopped to sweeper cover off the back foot
veering down the leg side for another wide
Jitesh smokes a six down the ground. He backs away outside leg, Jadeja follows him and bowls into the pitch. Jitesh, however, launches a straight six
down the track and flat-batted down to long-off. Jitesh looks more comfortable against spin
Shahrukh chews up another dot against spin. Darted into the top of off stump, pushed back to him
slower ball, 114ks, floated wide of off, dips underneath the swing of Jitesh. Good start from Pretorius
another slower cutter, full and wide of off, carted away to the left of Choudhary at sweeper. He slides across and stops the ball
Does not carry to Gaikwad at deep cover. Pretorius rolls out another cutter, pushed wide of off, sliced in the air. Bounces in front of the onrushing Gaikwad
on-pace hard-length delivery outside off, Shahrukh splices it down to long-off

Pretorius bests Jitesh with the slower delivery. Caught at short third man. Pitched up and outside off, Jitesh aims to reverse-scoop it over Uthappa at short third man, but does not have enough pace to work with or elevation. Simple catch for Uthappa. Pretorius continues to impress in yellow
another slower one floated outside off at 108ks, stabbed into the covers as Odean gets off the mark
very full and sprayed down the leg side, wide called
middle-stump yorker, dug back to Jordan. Well bowled, CJ
another middle-stump yorker from Jordan, squeezed down to long-on
low full-toss on off, hacked away towards deep midwicket off the inside half. Good bowling from Jordan

Shahrukh holes out to deep square leg, Jordan celebrates. Jordan misses the yorker, comes out as a low full-toss on leg stump. Shahrukh picks it up and swings it to Pretorius. First wicket for Jordan at CSK
wide yorker from CJ, squeezes underneath Rabada's bat outside off
