this is some outfield. Full outside off, tried to make Dhawan reach out as he looked to step out. Reaches out to hit over extra-cover, and ends up slicing it over the gap between backward point and short third. Both give chase, in vain

got him. Steps out again, and it looks like the three-quarter ball/offcutter that straightens from a length outside off. Looks to crash it away through the covers, and gets a thick edge that Billings does very well to catch low down, diving forward
fullish outside off, gets forward to defend to short extra-cover
back of a length, straightens slightly towards off stump, goes back and whips to long-on
legcutter/carrom ball finishing on off stump, punched back to the bowler off the back foot
tossed up slower on off stump, another carrom ball, gets forward and defends with an open face to backward point
back of a length on off stump. Wants to punch to long-on, the ball stops on him and he ends up dragging it to midwicket
quickish length ball on off stump, opens his bat face and steers to deep point
length ball nipping in towards leg stump, gets on the front foot and clips to deep backward square leg
offbreak, tight on off stump, clipped off the back foot to deep midwicket
gets forward to the length ball and dabs with an open face to backward point. He's anxious to get off strike, and has to hurry back and dive to beat the throw
flat, fired into the pads, clipped to long leg
quick offbreak turning down leg, past the attempted flick
back of a length carrom ball, sticks in the pitch as Livingstone goes back to punch down the ground. Has to check his shot to ensure he doesn't offer a return catch to Narine
fuller now, on middle stump, gets forward to clip to long-on
full, angling into off stump, driven to long-off
full, angling across to off stump, shows the full face and eases it down to long-on
shot! Fullish, offers quite a lot of width, and Livingston collapses his back knee to get down low and frees his arms to slap it extremely hard to beat the diving extra-cover fielder to his left
again goes for that wide yorker. Gets the length right this time, but the line juuust overshoots the tramline. And he's overstepped too. No-ball overrides wide
again goes for the wide line, looking to make Livingstone lose his shape while hitting. That's what happens as he looks to hit down the ground, and he ends up slicing it down to third man
length ball angling across to off stump, clips into the on side, and it just beats midwicket diving to his right to roll down to long-on
slower ball, full and fairly wide of off. Reaches out to drive, and he's beaten by the lack of pace

fullish, not as wide as the previous balls, and Livingstone takes on the big hit down the ground. Doesn't quite middle it, though, and Southee catches it right on the edge of the long-off boundary. A very, very timely wicket for KKR
floated up outside off, stretches out and drives to the left of sweeper cover
full on off stump, and that's superb wristwork to create power on the drive. Drills it away and beats long-off to his right

bowled him, that's a Narine special. Flat, quick, angling into off stump from wide of the crease, and it straightens dramatically from there to beat the outside edge and knock back off stump. Bawa's feet were stuck in the crease, not going forward, back or across, and he looks to defend and plays a long way inside the line
stretches out to defend a length ball pitching outside off. Nips in to take the inside edge and roll away towards deep midwicket. Was probably playing for the one going away from him
quick length ball straightening towards off stump, defended down the pitch
carrom ball finishing close to off stump, punched towards midwicket, was probably looking for the single to long-on
fullish carrom ball on middle stump, stretches out and defends it back to the bowler
nice. Now the one that goes the other way. Angled a little further across initially as well, and Brar, stretching out to push to long-off, is beaten
quicker length ball spinning away from off stump. Jabs at it from the crease and is beaten again
fuller on middle and leg, clipped to the left of midwicket
carrom ball, angling in and straightening towards off stump, gets forward to clip it back to the bowler
quick length ball turning in from outside off. A little late on the forward defensive, ends up getting a thick inside edge into the on side
nicely bowled. Floated up slow, angling in from wide of the crease and then straightening outside off. Stretches out to defend and is beaten on the outside edge
fuller outside off, stretches out and pushes to short extra-cover
fired in quick, and prompts the lbw appeal, Brar ending up playing around his front pad in the attempt to get a single. Probably angling down leg
now he stretches out for the lap-sweep and is hit on the pad again, but impact is outside off

third lbw appeal in a row, and Anil Chaudhary shakes his head. Another carrom ball coming into the left-hander as he gets on the front foot to flick. This looked closer than the other two - was the impact in line? KKR have reviewed... No bat, the bat was well on front of his pad, and it strikes him in line with the stumps, but it's turning too much and is heading down leg

shot. He's been struggling badly to pick Narine, but he backs his sweep and picks up a six to end the over. Narine goes to a wide line outside off, and Brar gets down low and uses his wrists to drag the ball from that line. Nails that wristy sweep and hits it over the boundary to the left of deep midwicket

another attempted at a big hit, another wicket. Good ball from Southee, back of a length outside off, and Shahrukh is caught in that awkward zone between a straight-bat hit down the ground and a horizontal-bat pull. Ends up skewing the ball high in the air over the on side, and Rana moves to his left from short midwicket and settles under the ball
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and defends into the point region. Thinks of a quick single but the backward point fielder closes in quickly to make him change his mind
back of a length outside off, steered with an open face to third man
nice shot. Back of a length close to off stump, and Brar leans backwards, opens his bat face, and dabs it smartly to the left of the keeper. Third man is too square to cut it off
there's that three-quarter ball. Angling in from round the wicket, hits a good length close to off stump, and straightens. Brar is beaten while opening his bat face and looking for another fine dab
beaten again. Similar ball, a bit quicker maybe, and Brar was looking to open his bat face and steer through point on this occasion
big offbreak turning down leg. Looks to go back and across and work it away, but can't connect. Beats the keeper as well, hits his thigh pad and runs away into the backward square leg region
full outside off, driven to long-off
carrom ball close to off stump, gets forward and defends to extra-cover
quicker carrom ball turning away from off stump. Looks to defend from the crease, gets a thick edge that rolls to backward point
back of a length outside off, punched towards deep cover point
flat length ball close to off stump. Looks to punch through the covers, gets a thick edge that rolls to the right of short third
tossed up slow on off stump, stretches out and defends it back to the bowler
back of a length on middle and leg, cramping him for room. Looks for the clip to midwicket, plays it too close to the bowler's follow-through to get the single he wants

stumps all over the place, and Harpreet Brar is dismissed for the first time in seven IPL innings. Length ball angling across to off stump, doesn't do all that much. In fact, it looks like it deviates slightly inward to straighten a bit, but Brar, opening his bat face to play it square on the off side, is beaten on the outside edge. Off stump is knocked back, as are the other stumps
back of a length outside off, gets extra bounce to beat the attempted dab to third man

got him, that wide slip is immediately in play! Banged in short on off stump, gets it to bounce steeply, and Chahar, trying to get his upper body out of the way while also looking to get his bat up and defend, ends up hitting it to the right of the slip fielder off the sticker of the bat. Nitish Rana dives to his right and completes a good catch
back of a length, finishing around leg stump, defended back to the bowler
length ball angling away from off stump, no feet but nice hands to punch to extra-cover
steps out to whip an off-stumpish ball to deep square leg
length ball turning away outside off, defends inside the line and lets himself get beaten
another wrong'un, pitching within the stumps this time, gets forward to defend and is beaten again
three in a row. Tossed up fuller, inviting the cover drive, and it rips away to beat the outside edge once more
quick wrong'un, beats Rabada for the fourth time in a row as he looks to defend from within the crease
carrom ball straightening towards off stump, goes back and punches to long-on
lovely. Full outside off, and Rabada leans into a smooth drive over extra-cover
full again, closer to off stump this time, and Rabada plays another lofted drive, chips it higher this time but just as cleanly, over the wide mid-off region
wow. What an over this is. Rabada backs away to make room and Southee follows him with a full ball. Rabada just frees his arms again and launchres it high and straight, smacks into the sightscreen
full-toss outside off, looks to lean back and steer it behind point, but can't connect. Adjudged a no-ball for height
full, outside leg stump, follows Rabada's attempt to make room. Driven down to long-on
yorker outside off, looks to make room and jab through the covers, but he ends up playing it off the inside half of the bat back to the bowler
wide yorker. Looks to drive through the covers, and inside-edges into the ground and then into his body

wow, what a glorious shot this is. Length ball slanting away from off stump, and that's just room for Rabada to free his arms. Clears his front leg and flat-bats it hard and flat, back over the bowler's head
Goes full and slants it wider, looking to go away from Rabada's arc. He does, but Rabada, reaching out to slash, gets a thick edge that flies between the keeper and a fine short third
wham. Back of a length, angling away from off stump, flat-batted hard and along the ground to long-on
132.4kph, but it looked quicker. Full and just angling past leg stump. Odean, looking to make room and launch it down the ground, is beaten on the inside edge
slower bouncer wide of off stump, too wide for Odean to be able to reach out and slash it away
fullish legcutter close to off stump, and it straightens to beat Odean on the outside as he looks to clear his front leg and launch it down the ground
another slower bouncer, this time the bounce is too high for Odean to reach it with the slash. Called wide again
unlucky for Mavi. Hits a hard length around off stump, and Odean, early on the pull, only manages a top-edge, but it absolutely flies and goes all the way over the fine leg boundary

what a terrific catch from Southee! Runs all the way from long-off to mid-on and finishes by throwing himself forward to grab the ball in both hands, low down. Russell bowls a slower offcutter, angling it away from Rabada's hitting arc. Clears his front leg and goes hard at it, but manages more height than distance

and it ends with a run-out. Odean hared out of his crease even before Arshdeep played the ball, and in the end both batters were stuck at the same end. Back of a length, angling across, and he opens his bat face and dabs it straight to Rana at backward point. All he had to do was lob the ball back to Russell
very wide outside off stump, on a length at 136kph. Left alone
full, swinging into the pads, and Rahane whips the half-volley away through midwicket with a roll of the wrists. Easy pickings. 133kph
on a length, very straight and angling across him. Steered out to point
length ball, on the pads. 129kph, another freebie aimed at leg stump, and Rahane nudges it calmly off his thigh to pick up four more, going past 4,000 IPL runs in the process
full, wide outside off stump at 137kph, looking to entice him into the drive. Rahane shoulders arms
angled across him, back of a length, and rolls his fingers over it. Punched to point off the back foot, where Chahar fields
angled across him, good length at 138kph. Venky opens the face, steering behind square on the off side. Rahane scampers through
wide outside off stump, good length. Rahane shoulders arms
half-volley, hint of width outside off stmup at 136kph, and Rahane leans forward, pressing it away through the covers on the drive. Compact shot, just steering it through the gap in the ring.
sprayed very wide outside off stump, left alone
fuller, and tighter to the off stump, but still wide enough to leave alone. 140kph, Rabada finding his rhythm
offcutter, back of a length, coming back into Rahane to cramp him on the cut. Steered to short third

gobbled up at short third! Rabada has his first Punjab wicket. Wide outside off stump, slightly full of a length but not quite a half-volley. Rahane comes forward looking to drive but is playing away from his body, and his thick outside edge flies to Odean, who takes a good, comfortable catch on the edge of the circle, moving to his left with his weight coming forwards. Punjab will need early wickets to stand a chance here and they have one
full, sliding down the leg side. Dribbles away into the leg side via the pad as Venky misses out on the flick
angling across him on a length, Shreyas opens the face and steers out into the covers
full on off stump, driven to wide mid-off for a single. Looked like an offcutter at first glance, but clocked in the mid-130s kph
back of a length, angled across him. Shreyas looks to punch through the off side but can't beat short cover. 134kph
slower ball, Shreyas waits for it and drills it through straight extra cover. Picked the offcutter. Pitched up, and comes forward to punch imperiously through the off side

wide outside off stump on a length, slashed away over backward point! Back-to-back boundaries for Shreyas. Poor ball from Arshdeep, and Shreyas sat very deep in his crease, slapping it on the up. Knew he only had to beat the man at point in the circle and did so with ease
half-volley on the stumps, 138kph, driven firmly to mid-off
hard length, nipping back into the left-hander. Steered away to point
skips down, turning a yorker into a low full toss, and squeezes out a single to mid-off via the toe. 138kph
just short of a length, angling in. Clipped away through midwicket and they cruise back for a couple. 139kph
full toss, sixth-stump line, and Shreyas punches through mid-on. Rabada overpitches looking for the yorker, and Shreyas is in complete control, driving straight down the ground
half-stopped in the covers. Drags his length back and Shreyas can't quite pierce the infield
sprayed down the leg side, Shreyas helps it on its way! Pitched outside leg stump and flew further down the leg side. Just a roll of the wrists from Shreyas, and falls just short of the rope
132kph, much better line and length. Squeezed out into the off side and they scamper through for one

slapped into the off side, but Brar clings on at cover! Banged in on a length, wide outside the off stump, and Venky frees his arms, standing tall to slap it away through the off side. But it flies straight to Harpreet Brar on the edge of the ring. It reaches him so quickly that he hardly has time to react, but he sticks his hands in the way. It bursts out, but he reacts brilliantly, grabbing it with his left hand as he tumbles forwards. Superb effort in the field and Odean has a breakthrough
phwoar, what a way to get off the mark. Full of a length from Smith, angling into the pads, as Billings comes forward to whip him away through straight midwicket
back of a length, outside off stump. Steered into the off side with a cry of "NO RUN!"
wide outside off stump, just full of a length. Fenced to short cover. 138kph
shot! Wide outside off stump, short of a length, and Shreyas gets up on his toes, threading a square drive away through point towards the shorter boundary
back of a length, rides the bounce and dabs behind square on the off side

thick inside edge skews past short fine leg, Livingstone does well to get round from deep backward square. Angling in from a good length, and it skews away off the inside half of the bat as Billings looks to whip through midwicket
back of a length, outside off, dabbed to short third. Billings set off but was sent back
full bunger, whipped away through the leg side for a couple as Livingstone gets around to his left
angling in from short of a length, steered into the off side. 134kph
ripping legbreak, drops a little short. Slapped straight to point
fuller, flighted, and rips past the outside edge as Shreyas lunges forward. Beaten on the outside edge
flat and full outside off, stabbed to point

tossed up, and Shreyas is lured into the big shot. He top-edges his slog sweep, looking to hit towards the short side, but it flies miles up into the air. Rabada settles underneath it, and takes a straightforward catch. Shreyas falls - he looked a million dollars against the seamers in the Powerplay but much less comfortable against Chahar
fullish at the pads, nudged to short midwicket

full googly, smacked on the pad. Chahar is convinced, pleading with the umpire, and the finger goes up! Rana reviews. Nowhere near the inside edge as he lunged forward to defend. Pitched in-line, impact in-line, smashing into the top of middle stump. Saiyed Khalid's decision is upheld and Chahar starts with a double-wicket maiden!
skids on with the angle from around the wicket. Billings backs away to give himself room, and punches down to long-off
on a length outside off, no turn. Slapped straight to point, but the misfield lets them through for a single
skids on with the arm, Billings backs away looking to punch through the off side but Harpreet fields in his follow-through
wide outside off, tossed up. Threaded through the off side
full and straight, no real turn. Dre Russ comes forward to defend
full on off stump, prodded back down the pitch
full googly, Billings looks to whip through the leg side but Chahar fields off his own bowling
full toss, on off stump. Billings gets out the reverse-sweep, but slaps it straight to backward point. Half-stopped, and they squeeze through for one
legbreak on a length, nudged into the covers. Thinks about the single but Billings sends him back
full legbreak, comes forward to nudge to short cover

full legbreak, outside off stump. Steered straight to backward point but Billings sets off... and <strike>just about</strike> comfortably makes his ground, diving at full stretch. He's lightning-quick between the wickets
flat, length ball, skidding on. Punched into the covers on the back foot
fired down the leg side, starts with a wide after the timeout
skids on with the angle, Russell bottom-edges his cut into the off side

clears the front leg, smokes it into the second tier! This is a monster. 90 metres, swiped over midwicket. That was the longer boundary, but Dre Russ clears it comfortably. On a length, into Russell's arc, and disappears into the stands
looks to go again, clearing the front leg, but he's slightly late on it. Bottom-edged through short fine leg, and they sneak back for two

does go again. This one looks even bigger than the first... though measured at 89 metres, one shorter. Clears the front leg, high backlift, and mows it over midwicket. Much more height on this one, and again reaches the second tier
full, yorker at leg stump. Whipped down to long-on
on a length, punched out to wide long-off to retain the strike
full and straight, nudged down to long-on for one
sharply spun. Pitches a long way outside leg stump, and Russell has to dead-bat it into the leg side after it rips away from him
width outside off, slapped out to deep point with a swish of the wrists and they cruise back for two
on a length, pushed through very straight, nudged away out to deep midwicket
tossed up, full outside off stump. Driven down the ground, out to long-off
sharply-spun legbreak again, on a good length. Nudged into the off side, tip-and-run to keep the strike

freebie, and Russell cashes the cheque. Russell cleared his front leg because Odean released, and he looked to follow him by firing it full and down the leg side. Russell keeps his composure, and flicks it over short fine leg
smoked into the stands! Clears his front leg, his back hip drives through, and he crashes him over midwicket, 88 metres. Absolutely nailed

slower ball, on a length outside leg stump. Russell plants his front foot outside leg stump early, and the knuckleball is slow enough that he has to wait a while. He swings hard, thumping him 84 metres, over square leg. Russell is on one tonight!
hard length, angling in, and Russell is beaten on the pull

half-a-dozen more! Russell is taking his compatriot to pieces. This wasn't out of the middle by any stretch of the imagination, but it still clears the boundary easily enough. Back of a length, Russell clears the front leg and swings him cross-batted over his head
banged into the pitch, 137kph, and drags the pull out to midwicket
on a length, wide outside off stump, and Billings gets in on the act! Frees his arms, swinging him cross-batted, dead-straight back over his head
wide, flat legbreak, pushed through. Slapped out to deep cover
full and flighted, punched out to long-off, giving the strike back to Russell
full, outside leg stump, nudged out to deep midwicket
quicker one, full and straight, whipped out to midwicket
looking to stay out of Russell's arc, and hangs it very wide outside off stump. Too wide
quick legbreak, fizzed through, and beats the bat as Russell looks to drag him through the leg side
full and wide outside off, tossed up. Russell looks to crash him over cover but only manages a thick outside edge, which drops short of short third
short ball, Billings pulls out of his shot as he shapes to pull
wide on the crease, angling in from a good length. Defended back to the bowler
slightly fuller length, angling into the pads. Billings clips down to Odean at wide long-on

full toss, and Arshdeep has to take evasive action as Russell drills it back towards him. 50 for Russell off 26 balls... and he'll have a free hit too, as Arshdeep has overstepped. Rabada couldn't get round from long-off. Pure power from Dre Russ, drilling it back past the bowler
clears the front leg and pulls hard through the leg side. Mistimed to midwicket, and they get back for two
slower ball, angled across him from over the wicket. Russell is through the shot early, and can't lay bat on ball

stunning shot. Angles it across him, looking to hide a wide yorker outside off stump. His length isn't far off at all, but Russell manages to chip him effortlessly over cover for six. Outrageous batting!
legbreak to start, quick and into the pitch. Whipped out to midwicket
tosses up a full lebgreak, which Russell clubs over long-off. Clears his front leg and slams it back over his head. Nowhere near the middle, still 85 metres!

finishes it with a six! What a player. Russell has announced his arrival at IPL 2022 tonight. He's only faced 31 balls but he's hit eight of them over the rope. This one is nowhere near the middle of the bat again as Livingstone drags one down, but has enough on it to clear deep midwicket, running round to his left. KKR win by six wickets with 33 balls to spare.
first ball four and that's classic- Uthappa. Full on leg, and he flicks it nonchalantly through midwicket for a boundary.
back to back as Avesh goes short and wide after going full on leg the last delivery. Uthappa stays on the back foot, and scythes a cut through point!
length ball on off and angling into middle. Fended back to Avesh

bang on the helmet as Uthappa does not duck in time. Avesh cranked up the pace, went short, and Uthappa took his eyes off it without dropping his knees quick enough. Hits him near the maker's name and pops up to short third man. Fielder catches, soft appeal for out, but obviously no bat involved.
full just outside off. Looks to defend but closes the bat's face late. Ball dribbles away to backward square leg region for a couple more

Uthappa had no idea where that went as Avesh troubles him with the short one once more. Back of a length slightly outside off, and coming in. Uthappa looks to sway away, but his hands are close to his face. Flies past him, over the keeper, and four more
length ball angling in, and worked away to midwicket
good length just outside off. Stays on the back foot, opens the bat's face, and nurdles it to backward point
goes short on off and middle. Uthappa scurries under it, and de Kock has to give a mighty jump to grab it
fullish just outside off stump. Confident defensive shot off the front foot

that's a hit of nostalgia as Uthappa flicks it behind square for half a dozen! Chameera errs in line, goes full on leg, and Uthappa doesn't need a second invitation. Uses the bottom hand to clip it so well for an 83m six
full, just outside off. Uthappa defends with hard hands. Ball rolls back to Chameera
fullish on middle, and that's in Uthappa's slot once again. Flicks it, albeit not as convincingly, but gets it over square leg umpire. Fielder at deep backward square has no chance in cutting it off
full on middle and leg. Wants to flick, but hits the outside half of his pad. Ball rolls towards short fine leg for one
good length on off. Angling in. Tries to pull, but mistimed to square leg for one

massive appeal for lbw and the umpire hasn't reacted, but that doesn't matter! Because Gaikwad has been run out with a direct hit! Bishnoi with the bulls eye with Gaikwad a metre short. This was full on off and Gaikwad missed the flick. Ball hit his pad and rolled away to point and he wanted a single, but Uthappa did not, forcing him to turn back. Either way, whoever was going to run to the batter's end was going to be out with a rocket throw like that. Another failure for Gaikwad.
full on off. Crunches a drive, and stopped at cover
full on middle and leg. Pushed towards mid on
good length on leg stump. Wants to push at it, but the chance of pace forces a mistimed defensive shot. Ball lands near his toes and that's a top over from the returning Tye
sublime! Avesh goes full, outside off stump, and he shuffles into a drive despite the lack of much movement of his feet. The timing is so pure that it races through cover
back of a length, fourth-stump line. Fended off the back foot towards cover point
good length on off stump. Tap-and-run towards mid on off the back foot
hooked! Avesh goes short on leg, and he gets inside the line of the ball before swiveling and connecting with a six over fine leg
good length on middle and off. Tapped towards mid on off the back foot. Wants a run, but eventually they decide against it
fullish on leg. Wants to work it leg side, but the bat's face turns and rolls away to the off side
drags a pull in front of square! Not short enough, bit of width, and he pounces onto the pull in a flash. Another classical Uthappa shot
on purpose! Fullish, outside off. Waits for it, opens the bat's face, and just helps it with a late nudge past short third man for four. #SoftHands
Tye goes back to what Uthappa has struggled the most again. Short quick ball on off stump, and once again de Kock has to jump high to intercept

premeditated but executed with perfection! Full on middle, but Uthappa walks across to the off side and having seen fine leg inside the circle he uses the bottom hand to turn a paddle over the infielder for four

shoddy fielding and that brings Uthappa back on strike. Nudged this length ball to square leg and they scamper across for one. But the two fielders on the boundary line are way too slow to attack the ball - thinking the other would do it - and therefore the batters can take two
my oh my oh my! Length ball from wide of the crease but angling into Uthappa. Quick swivel, fast hands, and pulled to the right of deep backward square for another four
full on middle. Worked to wide long on for a single
full on off, and worked off his pads to deep midwicket for a single
fullish, on middle and leg. Clipped to square leg
superb timing as he pounces onto a ball that's angling across him. Length on middle and going towards off. Moeen just nonchalantly drives standing tall, and pierces the off side gap
gets low, hits high! Full on middle, and Moeen goes down on one knee before flicking a sweep over deep square leg! Hits the boundary skirting on the full.
ends the powerplay in style as Moeen waits on the back foot and meets this length ball with a dragged pull across the line in front of square!
good length outside off. Pushed to point for one
pushed off the front foot to the off side for a single
fullish outside off. Presses forward to push a shot towards cover for a single
Mowed by Mo! Length ball angling across. Moeen stands tall and punches a back-foot drive through the covers!
takes pace off. Length ball on middle stump. Pushed to mid on for one
full on middle, slower one again. Flicked off his boot to cow corner for a single.

full on middle. Skidding into his pads. Flicked off the back foot to deep backward square. Huffs and puffs back for the second and there's his fifty! 25-ball half-century from the experienced man. His 26th in the IPL. He's never got a hundred though - will it be tonight?
good length, outside off stump. Punched off the back foot towards point

pinned him on the back foot but lbw appeal is turned down! Bishnoi asks KL to review. This was a skiddy delivery that landed around middle and went right through. Uthappa was caught on the back foot, surprised by the speed it got to him. Hits his front leg, no bat involved, so the only question is whether the googly took the ball down the leg side or not. Ball tracking says that's crashing into middle and leg! Umpire has to change his decision, and that's a second wicket for Bishnoi - first the run out, now this lbw.
good length outside off stump. Cut off the back foot to deep point for one
full on middle stump. Nudged off his toes to wide long on for a couple
full on leg. Clipped to Krunal at square leg. A successful over for the young leggie
back of a length on leg stump. Stands tall and fends from near his chest
punished for the poor line as Chameera goes short outside leg. Dube just flicks it from near his armpit, and the dive from fine leg can't cut it off
with a flourish! Full, on off and Dube simply smacks it over cover for four! Met it almost parallel to his eyeline, and tonked it for four
full and wide outside off. Mistimed drive to mid off
rolls his fingers over this ball. Length ball outside off, Dube stands tall and punches a glorious shot through the covers. Chameera's scrambled-seam change up makes no difference!
almost chopped on as this length ball outside off is met with an attempted cut. Ball hits the deck and rolls away to the off side
outside edge and it runs past short third man for four! Full on off, and as expected the googly to turn away from Moeen. He looks to push through cover, but nicked instead
good length on off, and turning across. Moeen can't connect with the back-foot punch
full on off, and turning across. Presses forward to play with soft hands. Outside edge again, but this time short third man can't cut it off
good length ball outside off. Turning further away. Slapped to deep point
top ball. Just past the outside edge as he presses forward to defend. But the turn takes it away.
full on off. Drilled to long on for one, and that's a tidy finish from Bishnoi.

aw, gone so soon! Moeen stands and attempts to deliver as Avesh hits a good length at good pace... but he's thrashed clean through the wrong line there, flat feet, flatter off stump. Fizzes through his loose mo(w) towards midwicket. A fine cameo ends at the halfway mark
outside off, at 137kph, a hint of inswing on a good length, and left alone! Gosh, it's like watching Kraigg Brathwaite all over again
full length, just short of a yorker, but arrow-straight, and dug out, back down the pitch. Avesh on the money in this over, and some
banged in short, and waves the bat on a delicate uppercut! Sticks up the stick, as if trying to knock an apple out of a tree, and picked off through third man!
dabbed out to point, full length outside off
back of a length, opens the face, and nudged to the off side
tossed up on the left-hander's off stump, tapped to cover
back of a length, punched out to cover, sliding into the crease as Bishnoi probes on a full length
swishes and misses, holding its line outside off, zippier off the deck
clattered hard through the covers, and through the sweeper too! Big spin as the ball pitched and ripped past the floundering Chameera! Ends up on his backside, but that turned like a massive offbreak

down on one knee, swept hard on the angle, and so nearly holes out to backward square. Despairing dive inside the rope, leaping forward, but just gets a palm as the ball reaches him on the half-volley. Saved four though
zips past the off stump, that's a fine finish to the over
looped up on a middle-and-off line, nudged with the angle to the on-side
rocks back, and slapped firmly out to deep cover, and another misfield inside the rope! Over-runs the ball, and fumbles! That's poor fielding from Chameera
donked into the stands! Good length, languid hands through the line, launched into the stands at long-off!
opens the face to work to backward point
chopped hard behind square, from round the wicket, and not quite timed
round the wicket once more, banged in short, that's a quicker ball and is met on the back foot with a full face, and a push down the pitch
low full toss from over the wicket, flicked out to midwicket across the line
round the wicket this time, worked to the leg-side with the angle
back over, and that's a wild wide... the dew is likely kicking in as Pandya flings out way outside off, keeper does well to pounce
flicked to leg, just a minor lull in the wild momentum of this innings
skidding on, middle and leg, round the wicket and straightening. Pushed back down the track
tries to give it the charge, pulls out as he fails to get to the pitch, and deflects off the knee-roll past the keeper
squeezed to the on-side, another very tight over as CSK are pegged back after the loss of their early chargers
fired across the left-hander, on a wide line
tighter line, back of a length, pressed on the up to the covers
back of a length, Rayudu hops back into his crease for a measured pull to midwicket
back of a length on a tight line across the left-hander. Dube swings into a cramped pull but Tye pounces in his followthrough
spanked hard out to deep midwicket, solid connection on the back-of-a-length ball, but straight at the sweeper
Hacked over wide long-on! That wasn't timed, but there was enough oomph through the slog to leg as the ball sat up in the pitch. Flat into the gap, out of the fielder's reach
outside off, poked to backward point, another single to end the over
worked to the on-side, midwicket tidies up for another single
over the wicket, too much width this time! Short and wide, and clobbered on the cut in front of square, a big splashy dive from Avash but can't keep it in
another shocker from Chameera! Full-toss, close to no-ball height, and slapped around the corner to short backward square. Into the fielder's hands and out again!
heave-ho! That'll dry it out! A massive great panning slap through the line, high and mighty over the bowler's head! 88kph, and launched!
fired into the pads, nurdled to the leg side
low full toss, clipped hard to wide long-on, Manish slides well on the boundary's edge to cut off the four
a hacking great swipe to leg, and a fine deflection through third man! Down on one knee, eyes leaning skywards, half an appeal but struck outside the line, and the runs are flowing now
another massive wipe to leg, and the leg stump is plucked out! A gallop to the pitch, fired in flatter, beaten all ends up and that's a timely strike from the Giants' main man of the night so far
on the back foot, and glided out to deep cover
plonked through the line, full length outside off, hard and flat to long-on, where Hooda tumbles brilliantly to gather a fast-travelling ball inside the rope
skips through outside off, a tricksy little spell taking shape here
biffed on the up through a very straight long-off! The fielder was back but couldn't get round in time. A dent at the end, but that's an excellent spell from Bishnoi
back of a length, leg stump line, a hurried pull but not timed, Bishnoi rushes in off the rope at fine leg to tidy up
short again, and that's superbly timed! Launched in front of square with a flat pull, Chameera's bouncer skids onto the bat nicely and a gallop round the rope can't cut it off
back of a length, slower ball, pumped with a full face to deep cover, intercepted with a tumble
tight lines, aiming for the yorker, but comes out as a low full toss. Straight enough to respect though, pushed to long-on
rocks back, and hoisted high over backward square! It's an 80 metre boundary, but that's almost into the tennis courts! Slower ball, picked like a mango, high and mighty!
round the wicket, aiming for the yorker, scuffed to the leg side, behind square. No redemption just yet for Dushmantha
full length, just the single, to deep backward point

mashed into the night sky, but it doesn't have the legs! That was clobbered through the line, on a good length, seemed to have been timed well enough, but it was all height, not enough distance. Lewis steadies himself well at wide long-on, and pouches the catch!
Banged in short, and flogged hard over extra cover! Rocks back, no messing around, forearms through the wide line, into the stands!
inside-out, hacked over backward point! Fuller length, wide line, blitzed through the gap!
a thrash at thin air, and oohs around the ground as his strike-rate plummets
Whoops, we had a blackout for that ball. Nothing much seemed to happen
low full toss, biffed off the pads, through backward square, another boundary to bring up the 200!
flicked off the legs once more, but Pandey is lurking in the deep and swallows the chance

fires in the yorker, angling in on leg stump... that's a decent appeal but probably doing too much. It's a review either way... No under-edge, so all on ball tracker... ooh, it's hitting leg stump! Very full length, which did the trick, a very brief encounter for Pretorius
low full toss, clipped calmly out to deep midwicket, and the old stagers cross. It's like the last decade never ended
wide full toss, Dhoni thrashes through the line, but he can't connect properly. A flat slap to wide long-off, the runs are drying up a touch here
210 it is! Width outside off, and chopped down through third man. Dhoni's cameo does the needful to post a very challenging total on the board.
starts off with the short one on middle. Angling across towards off and Rahul semi-ducks and watches the ball go through
good length on middle and off. Shaping in slightly. Fended off the back foot
good length on middle and leg. Nudged off his waist to midwicket to get off the mark for the season. Rahul lost his shoe while taking off for the single
full on off. de Kock carefully fends off the front foot. But struck off the bat's sweet spot

full on middle, and angling into leg. Wants to push it to mid on but a leading edge takes it to the off side. Falls a few metres in front of cover. de Kock was off for a single, but Rahul sends him back. Throw from Dube is a direct-hit at the batter's end, but de Kock is in
solid opening over from Mukesh as this full ball on middle and leg is caressed down the ground to mid on for a single
full on off, and he drives well, but it is hit straight towards the mid off fielder
full on off. And the drive is slapped with a bit more power. Mid off moves to his right to stop that
de Kock loves that shot. Stays put on the back foot for this short of a length ball on leg stump, and polishes a pull in front of square over the infield
fullish on middle, and de Kock opts to play a cut, even though there is very little width. Slapped behind point for one
misses the line by a little bit, and Rahul sends it past the keeper for four. Length on leg, and he whips it off his waist to fine leg with a tiny swivel
top ball. This is length outside off but the ball takes off, surprising Rahul with the extra bounce as he tried to play a back-foot punch. Whizzes past the edge to MSD
worked off his waist through to midwicket for one off the back foot
good length on middle. Stands tall and offers the full face of the back in his back-foot punch. Ball rolls back towards Mukesh
scythed away! In the slot, just outside off, and Rahul holds the pose after slapping this over cover for six. Played from under his eyeline

putting pressure on the rookie as he goes full once again just outside off. This was overpitched which meant that Rahul couldn't totally get under it, but he knew that as long as he offered fast hands, he would generate enough power to clear the infield. Sliced over point
full on middle and off. Gentler drive, rolls away to mid off
length ball on a middle-stump line. Pulled along the ground behind square, and Dube on the boundary line runs around to keep the boundary at bay
smacked right back as Deshpande goes full on off, and de Kock smacks it through the ball's line. Ball races between the gap between the umpire and the non-striker
full on middle, and off. de Kock wants to mow a drive, but the ball doesn't angle across the way he imagined. Ball whizzes past the bat-body gap to the keeper
drilled and four. Full outside off stump, and he throws his bat at this to smack a boundary through extra cover. #LikeATracerBullet
length ball outside leg. Quick to spot that line and he swivels to hammer it from around his chest to fine leg for four. Deshpande also took the pace off, but it didn't quite work out
full ball, pitching just outside leg. de Kock looks for a slog over midwicket but can't connect. Hits the pad. Appeal for lbw turned down
goes full, but de Kock gets low for the drive, and therefore the ball ends up as a full toss. Sliced to cover, but stopped
hammered through cow corner. Full on his toes, and punished
good length on middle, and angling across. Rahul looks to pierce the small gap to the left of the fielder at short fine leg. But Pretorius dives and stops
full on middle and leg. Almost a yorker, in fact. Dug away to the leg side
full toss on middle. Lets the ball get to his pads before flicking quite easily behind square for four. Fine leg didn't bother moving much
back of a length just outside off. Too high, and de Kock knew that, offering no shot and taking the extra run that comes with it
fifty up in style for LSG! Goes short, ends up head high for de Kock. He rolls his wrists over this pull, playing the shot along the ground past the square-leg umpire for four
full on middle, and he drives to mid on's right for a quick single

around the stumps to QdK. Full and wide, and de Kock plays a drive through the off side. Went for placement over power, and therefore it does not go for four with Gaikwad running around the boundary from point to cover and sliding to intercept

easy catch for Moeen..... but wait! Dropped. Slot ball outside off, de Kock creams a drive but its uppish. Moeen is behind it at a square-ish mid-off, and it pops in and out! Bravo is nearly on his knees
full outside off, this time de Kock drives along the ground. Cover gets behind it
wide yorker, inside the tramlines. de Kock offers no shot, and that's a dot. Top ball
sticks with the wide line and a full ball, but takes the pace off. de Kock slashes at it, and gets a sliced shot down to deep point
continues around the stumps to Rahu. Full on middle, and Bravo takes a tumble thereafter. Struck down the ground past the bowler to mid-on/long-on for one
length ball on off. Gets back and flat-bats a shot to long on
full on middle and leg. Clipped to deep square leg gently enough to get back for the second run. Nobody there on the leg side behind square inside the circle
full on middle. Gets onto the back foot, and taps it to square leg for a comfortable single

gives Jadeja a charge and lofts him over long off! Maybe Jadeja saw Rahul come down since he went a bit wider outside off stump. But Rahul stayed far enough from the ball to truly get the bat swing right, getting under it, and smacking it for half a dozen
good length, on off. Slapped to long on off the back foot
appeal for lbw but not given. Length ball, outside leg stump and skidding through. de Kock tried to pull off the back foot, but couldn't connect
full on off and he pushes a drive to the left of mid on
full on middle. Driven with the turn to long on
so smart! Moeen is coming around the stumps, but de Kock gets to the leg side of the ball before dispatching a four through cover after making room. He created that boundary
slapped to deep extra cover for one

going, going, gone! Innocuous offbreak and Rahul has got his eye in. Fullish on middle, and Rahul skips down the ground and hits it straight 88 metres. Taken by someone in the crowd, and he gives his pals a high five

tough chance! But has to go down as a drop. Moeen went slightly wide knowing Rahul is in the mood to dance down. Rahul slices the attempted loft after skipping down, and slices it. Fielder inside the circle runs towards the cover boundary, but the ball is always going away from him, making it tough for him to catch. Dives facing away from the action, but the ball pops out while he hits the floor. Top effort from Deshpande though
full on leg. de Kock is quick to get low, almost on one knee, and sweeps it hard enough for fine leg's dive to end up as futile
full on leg. de Kock tries to play the reverse slap, but it hits his body
full on off stump. de Kock taps it to the left of Jadeja, but he's quick. Runs to his left and keeps it down to zero

does he have Thor's hammer?! Struck sooooo sweetly! Length ball on middle, but de Kock backs away creating some more room to give his arms a proper leg-side swing. Slapped in front of square to deep midwicket for four
full on middle. Pushed to the left of Jadeja for a single
length ball on off. Cuts it from close to his body to the off side. Time out
leg-sided, on a full length, nudged off the pads to mid-on
round the wicket, full length on a wide line, opens the face for a jammed steer to deep point
right up to the toes, punched fiercely back at the bowler, who half-stops with a leap forward in his followthrough, the ball deflects to mid-on
round the wicket, aiming for the tramlines on a very full length. QDK leaves alone, fishing for the wide
overcooked again, swinging away, the wrong side of the tramlines. Out of QDK's arc, at least
he reaches for this one, another wide line, but inside the lines this time, a open-faced slap to deep backward point and up comes his fifty
right up to the toes, slower ball, eased down the ground with a whip of the wrists through the line, long-on gathers
open face, full length from round the wicket, that's a fine over, QDK is forced to wait for the ball to reach him and pushes the single to point
round the wicket, slower ball to start, good length angled into the bat and pushed to the off side

over the wicket, a pre-meditated pull, but Pretorius spears the short ball out on a wider line, out comes a steepling top-edge, and a fine running take at short backward square! Rayudu judged that well, watching it over his shoulder all the way. And a key breakthrough comes just after the halfway mark... as in CSK's innings in fact
rolls the fingers on another wide line, back of a length, punched at the top of the bounce to backward point
outside off, another slower ball, back of a length, chopped to cover
back of a length, cracked hard through long-on, a sliding stop in the deep
fired outside the tramlines this time, keeping it out of the right-hander's arc, but just too much on that
and again, the right tactic, the wrong line. Outside off
looping slower ball, clipped out to midwicket where Deshpande the fielder loses his footing on the practice wickets, but just about gets in the way
poked off the back foot to mid-off. The momentum has just gone out of this innings for the moment

battered at Bravo, who clings on at mid-off! Crashed through the line, clearing the front leg for extra oomph, that is travelling fiercely, but those are good hands, and an even better jog of celebration. Big shift in this chase now!
right up to the left-hander's blockhole, a calm press through the line, and he's off the strike to mid-off
wide full toss, would have been called as such, but de Kock touches his cut out to deep cover for the single
A rare boundary! The first in three overs, and it's a skewed drive out through backward point. Just opening the face on impact, on a wide line
guided down to third man, no pace on the stroke, and they hustle back for the second as the fielder swoops round
nurdled off the toes, round the corner to backward square, enough lack of pace to pick off two more
round the wicket, angled into the hip from back of a length, can't connect on the pull to leg
slower ball, wide line, de Kock waits and waits, and picks off another measured steer to deep point
fuller length from round the wicket, speared in at leg stump and worked to backward square
slower ball again, back of a length, Lewis waits on his crease and taps the single to midwicket
fenced off the pads, round the wicket, pace off the stroke and another two runs as the fielder rushes in from the deep. In the absence of boundaries, these twos are handy
excellent bowling, right on the tramline, outside off. No stroke offered...called wide, but that was marginal
crashes through the wide line this time! Gets underneath the stroke to skew it through backward point...
opens the face, down to third man
wide line once more, very full length, another chop into the covers
wide full toss, clobbered out to deep cover, and Jadeja's safe hands do wonderfully to pick up on the dive and fling it back in one motion
clears the front leg for a hack over the leg side, looks like a firm contact, but the sweeper at wide long-on is on hand
launched over long-off! A priceless end to a decent over, just missed his length this time, and Lewis was onto it immediately, with a lean-back-crack up and over the ropes!
round the wicket, into the blockhole, punched to long-on
round the wicket, hopeful appeal as the batter gets in a tangle in front of the stumps, but Dhoni indicates that is sliding down leg... clipping as it happens, so umpire's call
crunched down to long-off, thrashing through the line, struck well but straight at the man back on the rope

spirals straight up in the air, and Dhoni takes a cool-as-cucumber catch! Clears the front foot, round the wicket, into the arc, de Kock makes room to drill over the off side, but gets right underneath his stroke, and the keeper calls loud and early. That's a big old breakthrough. Runs on the board looking handy now!
wide line, full length, bashed hard to cover
beats the man at backward square! Clawed around the corner with an urgent fling of the hands across the line. Useful boundary to end the over. Three-quarters done...
over the wicket, angling across the right-hander with some outswing on a full length, cunning bowling, poked to cover
cuffed with an open face down to third man, shaping in on a full length round the wicket. Excellent line and length, to a perfectly set field
flogged through the line! That was so hard and straight, it might have vaporised the non-striker's stumps, and the umpire's shins, had it hit either. Full length and crashed!
hops inside the line, takes the deflection to the leg side
spanked through the covers! Bravo misses his length, serves up a full toss on that wide line, and it's punished!
full again, tighter to the stumps, punched to the man on the edge of the ring, a precious dot to finish the over.
round the wicket, into the pads, attempted pull but can't connect
too much on that one, outside the tramlines, on the full.
slower ball, back of a length, another hopeful pull but worn in the midriff. Singles won't cut it from here
fired past a wild swing for the hills, full length outside off
width again, on the full length, and a fat edged slog down to third man. Good areas from Pretorius, changing his pace to good effect
pummelled over long-off! Pace back on the ball this time, at 124kph, but it's in the slot, and Lewis was waiting for that one! The balance tilts again
slower ball, and Dhoni reckons there's a nick on that! It loops down to the bat, an ambitous swipe through the covers, and there seemed to be a sound in real time... but not on UltraEdge!
crushed down the ground! It's a length ball, with a bit of pace, and high over the sightscreen! Hoo-da-man indeed!

slower ball, low full toss, launched to the leg-side ... into Jadeja's hands! It was high, it was handsome, but it didn't have the legs it appeared to have. And Bravo is the leading wicket-taker in IPL history!
bangs in the bouncer, a flashing pull, a bit of excitement from bowler and keeper, but mostly to blag the non-wide. It doesn't work...
slower ball, nudged off the legs, they push for the second
pace on this time, outside off, steered to backward point with an open face
full again, squeezed out to deep point, no pace on the stroke so they push for the second and get there easily
chopped out to deep cover, a decent end to Bravo's spell.

down on one knee, and lumped over square leg! That's a huge hit, sweetly timed, from outside off on a full length, and it hits a girl on the head in the stands too... she seems fine, but that was travelling!
width, too much width!. This is a suboptimal start to the over
better from Dube... no, a late call from the umpire! Swinging away on a wide line, and though Badoni throws his hands at the ball, it's the wrong side of the line!
smashed out to deep cover, solid connection, but that's a win for CSK this time
round the wicket, length ball, angled into the bat, an open-faced slash from Lewis, and Dube gets away with it... off the toe of the bat, and it plugs out of the reach of deep backward point
pongo-ed through the covers! I wonder if Jaddu or Moeen might have been a better bet after all. A non-descript length ball, no pace, or lack of pace. Just dobbed, and flogged!
belted up and over long-off! The worm has turned in dramatic fashion! Another length delivery, from round the wicket, in the arc and dispatched again!
driven, inside out, over long-off! A 23-ball fifty from Lewis, and that was a throw-down from Dube! In the slot, slammed with a full face!
whoops, a rank wide, and the equation is down to eight
slower ball to start, on a length outside off stump. Dabbed into the ring, behind square with soft hands, and they race through for one
full, swinging away just a fraction. Iyer steers into the off side
back of a length, no swing at 126.8kph. Clipped off the hip, past short fine leg. Deep square runs around to cut it off
angling into the pads, 125.6kph. Clipped out to deep backward square, and they jog through for one
angled across him, just short of a length and no swing. 127.2kph. Steered out into the off side with an open face
uses his feet, shimmying down, but can't lay bat on ball. Willey angles it across him, and Rahane misses out looking to guide it into the off side
crunched through point for the first boundary of the match. 137.5kph, Iyer steps across, frees his arms and slaps it away square of the wicket with an open face. Too much width, in the slot
hung outside the off stump, left alone. 137.8kph

so nearly chopped on! 135.1kph, hard length, and Iyer bottom-edges into his back thigh pad, looking to slap it away through the off side. It almost got stuck on his thigh before dropping down, just past off stump
beauty. 142kph, a touch fuller, and swings past Iyer's outside edge as he looks to drive through the off side
tucks him up, on a length towards the hip. Iyer looks to work through the leg side but can't get it away, pushing it back to Siraj. 142kph

on a length, angled across him, and skews away via the shoulder of the bat, behind square on the off side. Good bounce from Siraj. The fielder at backward point takes a tumble as he fields, allowing them to sneak through for two
full, swinging in. Clipped out to deep square leg off the pads. 128kph, gentle pace from Willey so far
beaten while fiddling outside off stump. Just back of a length, decent bounce and a hint of shape away, and beats the outside edge as Iyer looks to steer wide of gully
fuller and straighter, looks to clip into the leg side and they scramble through for a single, via the front pad. Strangled appeal, but looked to be missing leg
angled across him, Rahane shuffles across and punches away through backward point off the back foot. Rahane was thinking about two, but Iyer had other ideas
tight to the stumps on release, looking to hit the top of the stumps from a good length. Nudged into the leg side, and Willey bounds around to his left to field in his follow-through
shuffles down, so Willey drags his length back. Venky pushes into the off side with soft hands - soft enough that they can squeeze through for a single to the man on the edge of the ring at cover

back of a length, chipped up into the leg side, and Deep settles under it in his follow-through! Venky was looking to pull, but was cramped for room as the ball got big on him. He skewed it up via the top edge, presenting Deep with a straightforward chance, changing direction and running to his left as the ball hung in the Mumbai air

half-volley outside off stump, pounded through the off side! 144kph, nipping in just a touch off the seam, but Shreyas sees the width and flogs him away, cover-driving with real power as well as timing
back of a length, 132kph, nipping into the leg side. Clipped off the hip, out to deep backward square
back of a length, pulled away in front of square for a couple. 141kph, dragged through midwicket with a short-arm jab
lifts past the bat. Extra bounce from Akash, 138.7kph. Back of a length, width outside off stump. Rahane was up on his toes trying to cut over point, but was late on it
back of a length, width outside off again, and this time Rahane gets it away. Hangs on the back foot, sitting deep in his crease, and dabs it away past short third with soft hands and an open face

beats square leg on the dive. 134kph, back of a length but straying onto the pads. Shreyas rolls the wrists, clipping off the hip. Past short fine leg, and deep backward square couldn't cut it off. Flying start for Shreyas
on a length, nudged to short midwicket for one
on a length, 141kph. Clipped out to square leg, via the pad

caught-and-bowled chance? Yes, but a difficult one. Shreyas cleared his front leg, looking to go through the off side, and Siraj cramped him for room with a back-of-a-length ball. Miscued back to him, Siraj couldn't quite cling on in his follow-through. Arrived at shin-height
on a length, a touch fuller than he has been. Nudged to mid-off, pressing forward to drive

back of a length, Rahane frees his arms and pulls... straight down the throat of Shahbaz at deep backward square! Cross-seam, sets the trap by dropping a touch shorter. Rahane took on the shorter ball, pulling off his ribs, but picked out the man in the deep
good length outside off stump, pressed out to the sweeper on the off side
hammers his first ball over midwicket for six! Where did that come from?! On a length, angling across the left-hander and dagged 83 metres over the leg side. A statement of intent from Rana
back of a length, good carry through at 139kph. Rana clears his front leg, looking to flay him over the off side, but can't lay bat on ball... hold on, Akash has overstepped!

looks for the wide yorker, but it's a low full toss at 140kph outside off stump. Rana keeps his composure, reaching for it with no foot movement, and steers it away between short third and backward point, through the ring
angled across him on a length. Looks to nudge a single into the leg side, but a leading edge skews it back down the pitch

superb diving catch by Willey! Akash has two, and RCB have three in the Powerplay. Hard length again, angling across the left-hander, nipping away just a touch off the seam. Another attempt heave over the leg side from Rana, but horribly miscued via the top edge. It loops up into the leg side, miles up in the air, and Willey, running back, slides onto his knees and clings on
tucks him up, back of a length at 136kph and angling into the body. Narine looks to clip a single into the leg side but can only push it back towards the bowler
googly, 83kph, delivered with a low arm. Shreyas, batting without a helmet or a cap, comes forward and looks for a single into the covers but Hasaranga fields well in his follow-through
flat legbreak, steered out to point with soft hands and an open face
flat outside off stump, Narine clears his front leg to give himself room and punches away through point

holes out to long-on! Hasaranga strikes as Shreyas picks out Faf on the boundary. Very full legbreak, hit hard and flat down the ground, but straight to Faf, just above head height. Shreyas throws his head back in frustration
googly, ripping in to smack Billings on the pad. Hasaranga goes up in appeal, but it's turned down. They don't review. Looked like it was sliding down the leg side
another flat wrong 'un, and Billings can't beat short midwicket

clears the front leg, and hammers it over mid-off! On a length, angling across him. Mid-off is up inside the ring and Narine backs himself to clear him. He does so comfortably, slapping it over the rope after one bounce
top-edged for six! Flies over the keeper, and just over the rope. Back of a length, Narine clears the front leg looking to pull over midwicket, and a thick top edge skews away
banged in short, Narine pulls out of his shot as he clears the front leg, shaping to pull
offcutter on a length, 123kph, slapped out to deep cover
on a length, angling into the pads. Clipped away, behind square on the leg side
full, wide outside off stump as he angles it across the left-hander. Narine looks to slap through the off side but can't put bat on ball. 139kph
full googly, Billings brings out the reverse-sweep and drags it out to deep point. Long square boundary, so they scamper back for two
clubs a full toss over midwicket! Hasaranga lets this one slip out, and Billings skips down the track. Reached him at thigh-height, a couple of steps out of his crease, and his drills it 84 metres
googly, Billings hangs back looking to punch through the off side but is cramped by the turn and can only push it back to the bowler
leading edge, but past Hasaranga's left hand as he flings himself low to his left. Looking to work it down to long-on, but skews it out to mid-off as the bat face closes early

miscued to backward point, Hasaranga has two! Googly, which Narine looks to club over the leg side, clearing his front leg. Leading edge skews up, and Akash takes a couple of steps to his right, before taking a straightforward catch. Fullish length, and plenty of turn on the wrong 'un. Not at all sure Narine picked it.

knocks him over with a ripping googly, Hasaranga yelps in celebration! Hasaranga's trademark, the sharply-spun googly which nobody can pick. Expansive drive from Jackson, leaving a gap between bat and pad, which the ball squeezes through. Knocks back his off stump, and Hasaranga has his Ronaldinho hands out again. KKR six down and in deep trouble!

hard length, outside off stump. Steered down through the off side on the 45 with an open face, and Harshal races round, diving to his left to cut it off. He doesn't quite slap the ball back cleanly and it dribbles back towards the toblerone, but he recovers well, diving back to his right to flick it back
fuller, tucked off the pads out to deep midwicket. Slight fumble by Anuj Rawat on the rope, but it doesn't cost them a run

short ball, aimed at the right shoulder. 140kph. Russell drops his hands, pulling out of his shot and swaying inside the line, and DK can't gather cleanly. Siraj glares at him as he concedes a couple of byes
hard length outside off stump, cross-seamer, but width for Russell to free his arms. Plants his front leg and slaps it cross-batted, away through cover. Pure power
yorker at 141kph, tailing in towards the stumps as Russell looks to back away and create room. Jams his bat down on it, pulling out of the attacking shot
short, Russell ducks underneath it. Not given as a wide - might have got away with one.
drifting in, defended gently
steps out and works it through to deep midwicket
skids a length ball on off, Russell defends
slower through the air, gets it to dip and spin back in as it hits Russell's pad as he prods forward
muscled over wide long-on! Saw this tossed up and couldn't hold back. Down on one knee as he walloped that deep into the stands. 94-metre hit.
pushed through quicker on off, Russell solid in defence
length ball on off, flayed on the up, good stop at extra cover
slants one in from wide of the crease, Billings is squared up as he squirts this into the off side
slower delivery dug into the pitch outside off, Billings looks to steer it behind square but misses

he has hit this straight down long-on's throat. Harshal's slower variations to the fore. Gets it to rear up from short of a length, Billings goes for a flat-batted pull but got it really high on the bat, Kohli ended up taking a dolly.
goes full and fast outside off, Southee digs it out
goes for a skiddy bouncer outside off this time, he looks to rise with the bounce and upper cut but is beaten
flatter length ball from around the stumps, defended

he's hit this into the stands at deep midwicket! Length and drifting in, Russ is down on one knee as he plays the slog sweep to perfection. Was hitting against the turn but when you're hitting it with the kind of power Russ is, no worries about the returns especially when the ball isn't spinning big.
smeared wide outside off, he tried to bowl outside Russell's hitting arc but looks like it slipped
width outside off, slapped into the gap at sweeper cover
believe me he hit this off the toe end but he's still managed to swing this over the long-off boundary. Shahbaz throws this up on a length and gives him width too - asking for trouble.
fired full on the pads, worked to deep square
drifts this into middle, Southee is well forward as he defends
dug into the pitch again, Russell sways out of the way of this short ball on the stumps
helps this pull along but it's a good stop at short fine leg by Akash Deep
excellent from Harshal. Bowls the heavy ball this time, Russell is beaten by the skid and bounce as he shapes to pull
makes some room to use the pace, but steers this straight to short third. Harshal yet to concede a run in 1.4 overs
kept frustrating him with his variations and eventually has Russell! He reaches out to slap this up and over point but ends up reaching out to this wide delivery that he nicks through to DK.
slower and fuller on the stumps from wide of the crease, squirted to mid-on
mistimes this slog to long-on
tossed up on the stumps, worked to long-on

swung away but no timing behind that as Faf, running in from long-on, takes a comfortable catch. Hasaranga did him in with the length. Didn't allow the batter to get underneath the flight. Fourth for him
flatter one on off, defended
defended from the crease again
flatter one on off, bunted away
hits the hard lengths as he bowls from wide of the crease, Umesh mistimes a slog to long-on
goes full and straight on the stumps, eased down the ground for a single
attempted the dipping yorker but executed wrongly, ended up being a high full toss that he helps to short fine.
excellent short ball outside off, Varun arches back to let it pass after initially harbouring hopes of an upper cut
dug into the pitch and angling in from wide of the crease, Chakravarthy lets it go
right into the blockhole from wide of the crease, kept out. RCB have asked for an lbw referral. And it's the most ridiculous review you'll ever see because it was straight off the bat.
swings this Yorker-length delivery to long-on
cramped for room as he looks to pull, bounces to short midwicket
hit high on the bat as he's thrown off balance trying to pull, squirts to the off side
drives hard, gets a thick outside edge to third man
off a thick inside edge, beats short fine leg for four. Umesh was looking to wallop this through midwicket
appeal for lbw as this zips back in off a length to hit him on the pad. Siraj calls for the captain to refer. Faf politely says no.
slower length ball on middle, defended
this one's off a thick edge again but it's so fine that even a fine third man can't stop that. Useful runs
full and straight on the stumps, squirted to the leg side
beautiful slower variation again, this one's the split-finger one, I think, Umesh reaches out to drive but beaten
cutter off a length, he steers this to short third where Wanindu makes a right royal mess and lets it through his legs.
snorter of a short ball, wasn't far from Varun's gloves as he tried to steer it away
misses his length, bowls a full toss and Umesh wallops this over wide long-on!
swing and a miss! This time he went fuller and just around the wide line, basically away from his hitting arc
swing and a miss again. Looked to scythe this length ball over point

drilled over the infield, Wanindu runs around from square third man but overruns the ball to let it through to the boundary. Poor, poor effort. That can really be embarrassing. Am sure he doesn't want to watch the replay of that any time soon

cleans him up finally! Goes full and fast yorker on middle and leg from wide of the crease, Umesh, clearing his front leg, looks to swing this to the leg side but misses and sees the leg stump knocked back. The pesky final-wicket stand has added 27 to help give KKR's bowlers something to defend.
nearly chops on! Back of a length, swinging away appreciably. Faf shapes to punch through cover off the back foot and gets a thick inside edge, past leg stump and away to deep backward square
angling in, looks to clip off the hip but gets a leading edge back to the bowler. 136kph

nicks him off! Umesh strikes with his third ball. Umesh steams in and bangs it in, short of a good length. Rawat is turned into an 'S', unsure whether to play or leave, and pokes at it. It takes the shoulder of the bat and flies through to Jackson. Plenty of pace and bounce for Umesh
wide outswinger, back of a length. Kohli sees the width and his eyes light up, and he punches elegantly through cover point, away from his body. Off the mark with a boundary

full, swinging into the pads. 140kph. Kohli leans forward and clips effortlessly through straight midwicket, tucking it away for four. Russell catches up with it, sliding into the rope as he tries to flick it back. They check it, and it is indeed four
on a length, clipped off the hip to square leg. 132kph
fullish, angling into the pads and swinging away. Leading edge into the off side, lands short of the fielder
back of a length, tight line, clipped into the leg side
back of a length, Kohli shimmies down so Southee goes very wide outside off stump. Steered away behind square on the off side, opening the face
back of a length, hint of width outside off. Faf punches back down the ground, and Southee gets a fingertip on it in his follow-through
on a length, very wide outside off stump, gentle pace at 132kph. Faf's feet are rooted to the spot as he stands tall, flogging Southee over cover, cross-batted

leading edge, squirted to point! RCB have lost both their openers, including their captain, inside the first two overs. Fullish length, angling into the pads. Faf's bat face closes too early as he looks to clip into the leg side, and it skews up and away to Rahane at backward point, who takes a simple catch. KKR are still in this...

nicks him off, KKR on fire! Kohli feathers one through to Jackson and Umesh has two. On a good length, sixth stump line, and Kohli fiddles at the ball in the channel. Outside edges it through to the keeper, and RCB are wobbling here... surely we couldn't see a repeat of the 49 game?!
short ball, aimed at the shoulder. Rutherford ducks underneath it. Steepling bounce through to Jackson, and it flies away to the rope for byes
back of a length, nudged to short midwicket. 139kph
angled acorss him on a good length, 138kph. Rutherford shoulders arms
tight to the stumps on release, dug into the pitch. Rutherford cuts it away behind square
back of a length, Willey is up on his toes to clip off the ribs towards square leg
fullish length, wide outside the off stump. 131kph, left alone
fuller, still very wide outside off stump and can't tempt Rutherford into a drive
full outswinger, angled across him. Three leaves in a row
tighter line, dragging his length back slightly too. Rutherford looks to clip through the leg side but the ball stops on him just a touch, and he nudges it back down the pitch
full, angling across him. Clipped to Billings at short midwicket
back of a length, Rutherford swivel-pulls off the hip, on one leg, out to square leg. No maiden for Southee
full, on a sixth-stump line and angled across the left-hander at 143kph. Left alone, not suckered into the drive
back of a length, defended into the leg side. 138kph
back of a length, pushed back down the pitch with a loud cry of "NO!". 134kph
back of a length, angling into him from wide on the crease. Pressed towards mid-on
wide outside off stump, nipping away on a good length. Willey thought his back-foot punch had got through the infield, but Rahane did well diving to his left at backward point
angling into the pads, clipped away to deep backward square leg to retain strike
back-of-a-length, Willey is up on his toes and plays tip-and-run, nudging it to point with soft hands. Rutherford is alert, and scrambles through for the single
back of a length, defended with a straight bat on the back foot. 130kph
dug in short, Rutherford is cramped but gets a half-cut away to deep backward point

short ball, Willey swats at the pull and it flies over the keeper! Don't think he got a top edge on it... nope, given as wides. Extra bounce, way over the batter's head and Jackson had no chance behind the stumps
extra bounce form a length again. Angled across him, 139kph on a good length outside off stump. Flies over the top of Willey's bat as he looks to flay Russell through cover
width outside off, Willey gets up on his toes and flays him through the gap between point and short third, opening the face and playing with a straight bat
on a length, slapped into the off-side ring
wide on the crease from around the wicket, turning it away from Rutherford and beating his outside edge
skids straight on from a good length, Rutherford punches down to long-on
cramped for room as he angles it into the left-hander. Steered to point
offbreak, punched out to deep cover for a couple with a straight bat
skids on, full and wide outside off stump. Slapped out to deep cover
full, carrom ball which angles into the left-hander. Defended into the leg side
on a length, but enough width for Willey to free his arms. Slapped away cross-batted, and it skids away through cover towards the short boundary
somehow misses everything! Fuller length, tighter line. Willey was turned into an 'S', and it turns away from the bat, past the outside edge and just about misses the top of off stump

bludgeoned over midwicket! Extra bounce from Varun, and Rutherford looked like he was cramped on the pull shot. But he got so deep in his crease that he still managed to get it away, sending it high into the night sky. 85 metres, into the stands
shows him more respect, coming forward and poking a fuller ball back to Varun's right hand
googly, nudged into the leg side. They set off for a very tight single, taking on Shreyas at short midwicket, but his bounce-throw is wide and Willey was probably in regardless
squared up again, squirts it away towards point via the shoulder of the bat as the face closes early
full, drifting in. Rutherford lunges forward, defending into the off side
full, outside off and spinning away. Steered into the covers, and they scamper through for a quick single
full and flighted, steered into the covers with an open face
extra bounce from a length, no real turn. Prodded into the covers. Willey thought about setting off for a single but Rutherford sent him back
keeps a touch low, skidding through. Willey jams down, steering into the covers
lunges forward to a good length ball, defending into the off side with a high front elbow
googly, spinning away from him and drifting across him. Dabbed into the off side and they scamper through

tight to the stumps, dragged down. Willey sits deep, clubbing a pull away through straight midwicket. Not right out of the middle and in the air, but largely in control, and Billings can't get round to his right
googly, full on the pads, defended cautiously
fired down the leg side, Willey misses out on the clip

googly, ragged past the outside edge. Willey is completely foxed as he comes forward to defend and Jackson whips off the bails. Loud, lone appeal, and it's sent upstairs for the stumping. Nothing on Ultra-Edge, and his back foot never left the ground.
tossed up above the eyeline, flighted, full googly. Defended into the off side
extra bounce, punched back to the bowler
shortish outside off, Rutherford looks to cut behind point but is beaten

Wiley may be in trouble trying to scamper a single. Saved by the dive in the end.. Rutherford tapped it into the off side and set off for a single. Willey responded even as the throw came in to the striker's end from cover. He dived full stretch to make it in the end.
gentle bunt into the off side for a quick single
drifts in a full delivery from wide of the crease, Rutherford plays a copy book forward defence
works it with the angle to short midwicket, a clean pick up and throw from Rana at the striker's end may have made things interesting.
he has chipped this straight to midwicket. Looking to whip it up and over but didn't get the elevation. KKR continue to chip away. Make no mistake, this ain't over yet.
bowls full on leg stump, worked to deep midwicket
sweeps this full toss to long leg, gets off the mark immediately

that's a delightful cut shot from Rutherford. Used the depth of the crease superbly to transfer weight back and crash that behind point. Russell with a dive but the body was in contact with the ropes as he tumbled over.
pats it gently with soft hands to point for a quick single
works it gently back down to the bowler
punched down to long-on
punches straight to backward point
flayed on the up to sweeper cover. Oh, dear. Russell has overstepped. Free-hit coming up
toe-ends a lofted drive to cover. Russell went for a wide yorker and executed it superbly. They scamper a run though
he has walloped this pull to clear deep midwicket! Brute force of Shahbaz to the fore. length ball slanting away, he trusted his strengths and swatted that away.
bunts it to backward point
terrific pick up shot! Clears deep backward square this time. Russell tests Shahbaz with another short ball but he swivels back and pulls it superbly
slants this full and across, left alone
driven hard to deep cover
