backs away, Umesh follows him by bowling full and tucking him up, Shahbaz pats it gently behind point and scampers a quick single. Rahane with the shy at the stumps at the striker's end but Rutherford was well in
lofted but has he found the man? Just short of Rinku Singh coming in from long-on. Rutherford was looking to go downtown but didn't have any control over the stroke
pulls and misses this short ball
excellent bouncer! Saw the batter back away and directed it right at him, Shahbaz had to scramble hard to sway out of it in the end
backs away and drives this full ball to deep cover
sprays this too far wide outside off, Rutherford tries to scythe this behind point but misses.
toe-ends this attempted muscle across the line back to the bowler
swing and a miss! Was looking to deposit this length ball over deep midwicket
holds his shape and smears this length ball behind point, down to the boundary rider
looks to slog this behind square but gets a thick inside edge to short fine, good stop by Umesh

attempts a short-arm jab but misses. Southee appeals, Jackson appeals. They thought there was a thin bottom edge on that. KKR review. Rutherford was deceived by the slower one that may have just about deviated a wee bit. Ultra edge throws up a flat line when ball passed bat. Not out it is, original decision stays
slash and a miss to this fuller delivery angling away
reverse swept a tad wide of short third, quick single taken
attempts another reverse sweep, hit on the pad. Stifled appeal for lbw from KKR but this pitched way outside leg.
swing and a miss. Looking to deposit this deep over deep midwicket, hit on the pad and way outside leg,
rocks back and pulls, but can't get any power behind the stroke. Down to deep square leg
steps out, takes it on the full and swings this over midwicket. Using his long levers superbly. What a hit
got him! Is there life in the game yet? Shahbaz steps out to go over the top again but is deceived in flight as Jackson pulls off an excellent stumping. Shahbaz has done his job though.
heaved over the infield to wide long-on, good work in the deep.
lunges forward and defends this in drifter
skids one through on a length, Karthik tucks it towards deep square. There's a misfield but they don't take the second
knocks it wide of short third for an easy single
works it down to the man coming in from deep midwicket
beaten by the fizz! Rutherford looks to force this through the off side but it was a lot fuller than he anticipated
bowls full but slips it down leg, DK misses a tickle. Wide called
steered down to third man

unbelievable catching from Jackson! Was going the wrong way, had to change track and then dive low to his right to complete the catch. Rutherford was looking to swing this to the leg side but ended up getting a thin inside edge. Stunning
tucks him with a length ball angling in, defended
slapped over point! That should ease some pressure. Southee hits the hard length but ends up giving him width. Wanindu freed his arms and slashed that away

taken by Dre Russ running back from mid-off! Wanindu looks to back away and hit on the up but gets it off the bottom part of the bat. Couldn't clear the infield. Good use of the angle from Southee, excellent catching from Russell.
punched to deep point
full on off, pushed wide of mid-off for a quick single

both batters at one end, DK was a goner. But the throw is wayward at the striker's end and DK survives. Umesh with a throw to the wrong end. Had he lobbed the throw to Venky Iyer, Karthik would've been going back to the dressing room. He need not even have looked back. What a costly miss. Chaos. Tension. Madness. Back to the stroke, DK was looking to squeeze it behind point.
cheeky for four! Harshal gets inside the line and scoops it over the keeper's head.
swing and a miss. Venky bowls this full and wide, Harshal throw the kitchen sink at it but misses
another swing and a miss. Slow off cutter dug into the stumps, Harshal has a heave at that but played too early
he has pumped this into he gap between wide long-on and deep midwicket! Another short ball dug into the pitch, Harshal backs away, holds his shape and wallops that away when it finally arrives.
pulled over deep backward square for six! Short, sitting up and DK swats that away. All the way, over the ropes. Fist bumps in the RCB camp.
drilled back down the ground for four! Game, set and match, RCB. Jangling nerves? What's that, he asks. RCB are up and running this IPL
Test-match length from Bhuvneshwar: full and outside off, swings away further. Buttler is on the move as he hangs his bat out in the channel and is beaten
good length and curling away outside off, against the angle from over the wicket, left alone carefully
another lovely outswinger from Bhuvneshwar. Starts outside off and moves away further. Buttler drives away from the body and is beaten emphatically once again
inswinger from Bhuvneshwar. Swerves back in from a length, no shot. Does not threaten off stump

edged and taken by Samad at first slip! Another wide outswinger from Bhuvneshwar. Starts outside off and swings away even further. Buttler throws his hands at the ball and nicks it off. Ooooooh, hang on. The no-ball siren goes off at the MCA Stadium. No-ball. No part of the foot behind the line
yorker length, jags away outside off, squeezing under Buttler's bat
on a length and nips back in, Buttler stabs at the ball and inside-edges it to the right of Bhuvneshwar. Eventful first over from Bhuvneshwar
he hits a heavy length outside off, angling across the left-handed Jaiswal. Swing and a miss
just short of a good length and angling across off from over the wicket, Jaiswal punches with an open face behind point
back of a length and angling into middle, the ball hits bat as opposed to bat hitting ball
Buttler jumps across off and searches for the ramp. Romario follows him and Buttler ultimately cops a blow on his body. Doesn't lay bat on ball
overpitched and swinging into middle and leg, Buttler sizes it up and drives it with his wrists between mid-wicket and mid-on
Buttler hangs back for this short ball outside off. He punches it through the line and finds exra-cover
back of a length and on the hips, Jaiswal tucks a single through backward square leg
edged and sliced past slips to deep third man. Wide outswinger, carved away by Buttler with some control
Bhuvneshwar tests Jaiswal with a lifter, sails through to Pooran, as Jaiswal is beaten on the hook

Bhuvneshwar is showing his range year. He follows the bouncer with an inswinging yorker. Jaiswal brings his bat down in time and squirts it out. The no-ball siren goes off once again, taking sheen off the yorker
Jasiwal jumps across off. Bhuvneshwar aims for another yorker. Comes out as a low full-toss, which is squirted away fine of long leg for four
nice and full, slanting away outside off, carefully left alone
full and angling across off, Jaiswal reaches out and drives with a slicing finish to backward point
back of a length and outside off, 143ks, Buttler uses the pace to his advantage and carves a four over backward point, gets it to the right of deep third man
Buttler jumps across off stump, 143.2ks from Malik. Works against the bowler once again. Stylishly ramped over the keeper for six

Malik cranks it up to 150ks, edged and dropped at first slip. Bursts through the hands of Samad. Well, well, the no-ball siren goes off once again, this time Malik has overstepped. Shortish and zipping through outside off, takes the outside edge near the shoulder of the bat. The ball sneaks through the hands of Samad
full-toss on off, backs away and slaps it to mid-off
146.2ks rocket from Malik, Buttler shuffles across off for another scoop, misses it this time
off-stump yorker at 144ks, jammed out to point with an open face
dug in short and wide of off. Buttler reaches out for the ball and flays it over backward point for another boundary
sliding into the pads from round the wicket, 98ks, clipped away through square leg. Ooops, now Washington has overstepped
100.4ks dart, hauled in the air to long-on, caught in the outfield, but it's off a free-hit
Jaiswal takes on Washington and dumps him over midwicket for a six. On a length and outside off, muscled away over the leg side. Samson applauds from the dug-out
fired into the pads, 103ks, whipped away through square leg
pumped over mid-off for six. Fifty up for Royals with five overs. Washington lands it full, so that's in the slot for Buttler. Lofted away
darted into the stumps, hauled away towards long-on off the inside half
back of a length on middle, Jaiswal hangs back and tucks it through square leg. 18 runs off Washington's first over for SRH
Jaiswal steps out. Stays leg-side of the ball and flays Natarajan over point for four
Jaiswal shuffles across off, Natarajan bowls into the pitch and pings the body, cramping the batter on the pull
lifter from Natarajan, bangs it outside off. Too high, so it's wide
Jaiswal stays leg-side of this short ball outside off and solidly punches it away to deep point
back of a length and skids back in at off stump, no room for Buttler to free his arms, jabbed into the covers. Good ball from Natarajan
Natarajan hits a hard length once again, brings this back into Buttler, cramps him for room and hits the midriff
another hard-length inswinger from Natarajan, something that he's been working on during his time away from competitive cricket. Inside-edged onto the thigh pad

Romario returns and provides SRH with the breakthrough. That's his maiden IPL wicket. Slower cutter into the pitch at 121ks, angling away from the left-handed Jaiswal. He swings into the leg side and holes out to deep square leg, where Markram, another SRH newbie, snags the catch
jut short of a good length and slanting in at off stump, Samson aims for a pull and winds up weakly flapping the ball through square leg
seems like the legcutter outside off, jabbed into the off side for a single
dug in shorter and slanting into off stump, neither pullable nor cuttable length. Played back to Romario
back of a length and slanting into middle, Samson punches more or less straight to mid-on
lifter outside off, Samson withdraws from a hook
forced past the bowler to long-off
shorter and turns away outside off, scythed away to sweeper cover, where Washington runs across to his right and stops the ball, cutting it off to a double
dragged down on middle stump, Samson rocks back and pummels a pull between deep midwicket and wide long-on
much fuller and sliding into middle, bunted along the ground between deep midwicket and wide long-on
on a length and turns away slightly outside off, punched off the back foot to short cover
dragged down outside off once again, sits up to be smacked. Samson obliges, launching a six over long-off. SRH's spinners are leaking runs

Mailk spins around and belts out a big appeal for caught behind. Umpire Oxenford turns down the appeal. Williamson challenges the on-field not-out decision. Good length and skids back in from over the wicket at 148ks. Rushes Buttler into a drive. He nicks it off to the keeper. Ultra Edge detects a spike. Oxenford reverses his decision and sends back Buttler. Strong comeback from Malik
short and outside off, 140.5ks, jabbed between point and covers
short and veering down the leg side, helped away to long leg
overpitched and outside off, Malik gets away as Padikkal simply drives it straight to short cover
bouncer, 141.3ks, angling in at the head from round the stumps. Padikkal ducks out of the way
Padikkal stays leg-side of this 142.2ks short ball outside off and flays it away past short-cover
good length and slanting in at middle and leg from round the stumps, picked away through the midwicket region
short and banged down the leg side. Samson pulls...and misses. Wide called
hip-high short ball, angling into Samson, he lines up and pulls it powerfully, sending the ball soaring over long leg for six
pitched-up delivery on middle, smoothly driven down to long-on off the front foot
fullish and angling into off from round the wicket, Padikkal soaks up another dot. Defensively played to cover
sharp bouncer from Romario, angling in from round the wicket, Padikkal ducks under it
another short ball from Romario, Padikkal ducks under this outside off
Samson pounds him over the sightscreen. Fractionally short and outside off, Samson goes back and whacks it down the ground
slider outside off, run away to short third man with an open bat-face
short and into the pitch, worked off the hips to short fine leg for another quick single
reverse-swept over short third man, into the SRH dug out. Back of a length and hint of width outside off. Samson sends it away over short third man
back of a length and on the stumps, punched off the back foot between deep midwicket and wide long-on
sliding across off from round the wicket, slapped to point off the back foot
back of a length and largely holds its line outside off, Padikkal brings out the pull and sends the ball over midwicket for a flat six
proper bouncer from Natarajan, this time, gets big on Padikkal and foils his attempt to hook it away
short and straying into the hips, picked away to the left of deep square leg
slower offcutter from Natarajan, 113.4ks, Samson waits for the ball to arrive, then dinks it down to deep third man
Natarajan searches for the yorker, comes out as an overpitched delivery wide of off. Padikkal holds his shape and drills it straight of mid-off with a high elbow
another offcutter from Natarajan, worked through midwicket
full and wide of off, almost 148ks, Padikkal throws his bat at ball and carves it over backward point
145ks short ball fizzing through outside off, Padikkal is late on the pull and misses the ball altogether
Padikkal  backs away outside leg and slashes a full ball off an outside edge to Natarajan at deep third man
short and well wide of off. Off-side wide. Malik has to rebowl this
too full and veering down leg, Malik gets away with it as Samson only glances it to fine leg
back of a length, angling in from round the wicket at 148.6ks and then straightens away past the outside edge. Terrific delivery from Malik
bumper slanting down the leg side, Padikkal ducks under it. Wide called
Cutter into the pitch,  but it's still fairly quick at 133ks. Padikkal aims to tap it into the leg side, misses, and gets a leg-bye instead
Heaved over mid-on! Just short of a good length and outside off, sits up. Padikkal takes it from outside off and puts it over the infielder
thrashed into the sightscreen. Romario misses the yorker. Goes too full and pitches it in the slot. Padikkal holds his shape and hits it over the bowler's head
slower delivery from Romario, finishes on the pads, picked away through square leg
another poor ball from Romario, with the fine leg inside the circle. Slower cutter, but strays on the hips once again, helped away past short fine leg for another four
on-pace shorter ball outside off, Padikkal leans back from a ramp but doesn't make contact
overpitched on the stumps, Padikkal drives a single down to long-off.
hip-high short ball outside off, you got to get it up higher. Padikkal swivels back and hauls a pull to the midwicket fence
on a length and on middle, Padikkal stands tall and drives it down to long-on
too full and on the pads, duly picked up and whipped away to the midwicket boundary. Another poor ball, put away by Samson
back of a length and outside off, belted through the line to the right of sweeper cover
Padikkal stands up tall to this short ball outside off and forces it to extra-cover

Pace like fire! Malik finishes his shift with the wicket of Padikkal. Nice and full, veers in from round the wicket, gathers extra pace off the deck and crashes into middle stump even before Padikkal could bring his bat down. Time for another time-out.
sliding across off from round the wicket, dinked to short third man
darted across off, Samson reverse-sweeps and misses
swiped over midwicket for six. Washington tosses it up around off, Samson plants his front leg and clobbers it over the leg side
dragged down on middle, Washy keeps missing his lengths. Cops more punishment. Samson uses the depth of the crease and pulls another six over midwicket. Samson celebrates a 25-ball half-century
darted full and outside off, Samson squirts it away through point
pushed through on middle and leg, Hetmyer hangs back and clips it through midwicket. Washington has leaked 47 from his three overs on SRH debut

Samad runs across to his left from long-on and takes a smart catch. Back of a length and angling into middle, no room for Samson, he aims the short straighter boundary once again, but can't clear Samad this time. Splices a pull to the outfielder
just short of a good length and outside off, Parag sizes it up and punches it away to the right of sweeper cover for a first-ball four. The outfielder slies in vain
good length and ducks back in at off stump, steered down to deep third man
bouncer from Bhuvneshwar. Gets big on Hetmyer who seemingly looks away and hooks. Not given out caught behind. Called a wide instead. Williamson calls for a review. No spike on Ultra Edge
back of a length and on the stumps, whisked away wide of midwicket

nip-backer from Bhuvneshwar. Fuller, starts outside off and veers in. Has Parag nicked this off? Not given out on the field once again. Another review from SRH. No bat involved. The ball brushed the pad on its way to Pooran. They check for lbw now, it would've bounced over the stumps
on a length and largely holds its line outside off, pushed back to the right of Bhuvneshwar
full and wide of off, squeezed to sweeper cover
Natarajan misses the yorker. Comes out as a low full-toss on middle. It's still a hard-to-hit low full-toss, but Parag whips it away between deep midwicket and long-on
Natarajan hits the blockhole this time, middle-stump yorker, which is jammed down the ground
attempted yorker from Natarajan. Comes out as a low full-toss outside off. Hetmyer goes low and cracks it over long-on for six
mighty full and wide. Passes the tramline. Left alone by Hetmyer. Wide called
Washy's evening gets worse. He fumbles at sweeper cover, sliding to his right, and gives up four. Pitched-up delivery outside off, drilled away through the off side
wide yorker, hauled away to deep midwicket
yorker-length delivery on leg stump, dug out to square leg
full and wide of off stump, lofted over extra-cover. Markram runs across to his left from long-off and cuts it off with a slide
banged in short and outside off, Hetmyer doesn't middle it but still clears the short straight boundary. Spliced down the ground for six
hip-high short ball outside off, slower variation. Hetmyer delays the pull and hits it to the left of long-on and right of deep midwicket
wide yorker, squeezed to extra-cover
Bhuvneshwar goes for the wide yorker once again. Hetmyer opens the bat-face and deliberately slices the ball to sweeper cover
Hetmyer pre-meditates, shuffles across off, anticipating the yorker from Natarajan. He goes low and scoops this full ball on middle over short fine leg

length ball on off and coming into him. Williamson offers almost no shot, hurried and with no foot movement. Ball hits him on his back leg, but probably too high. They did appeal, but Boult himself said its too high
fuller ball on off. This one angles across a bit and Williamson goes poking at it expecting it would come back. Past the edge.
off the mark, with Boult missing his line a bit. Length on leg, and clipped to square leg for a couple
another one that angles across. Williamson keeps the bat close to his pad, prepared for the ball coming in but knowing he's safe it it goes away from him. Again through to Samson
overpitched on off, and he presses forward to block to cover
that's the over. A terrific one barring that one ball which pitched outside leg. Length ball on off and angling across to the wicketkeeper
full outside off and Sharma drives, albeit with little footwork. Hit to Jaiswal at cover

back of a length outside off and angling even further away. Sharma chooses to cut, but the ball is a tad too far away from his reach. Through to Samson, even though the umpire says not wide. Probably the right call
back of a length on leg. Angled into his chest, and he wants to fend it, but it hits the shoulder of the bat and rolls away to third man

dropped? No, taken by first slip! Williamson stands his ground though. What will the TV umpire say? This was a length ball on off that he tried to fend, but it took the outside edge. Samson dived to his right, got a glove, but the ball popped out. Padikkal at first slip dived forward, and appeared to take a catch, but looks like he has grabbed it even though the ball was awfully close to grazing the grass. If you asked me - and I must say I am not an umpire at any level - that looked like it bounced before Padikkal took it. But the TV umpires are trained to judge calls like these, and has probably made the right call even though the eye can play some tricks sometimes
fended towards the off side
back of a length on middle. Tripathi came down the track but had to get his head away from the line since PK went short
full ball, moving away from the left-hander. Wants to drive, but past the edge
full on off. Bit of movement away. Shuffles to the off side and fends
full on middle, and he plays it back towards Boult
good length ball, fourth-stump line. Bit of away movement as Sharma tries to poke at it. Beaten by the pace, and past the edge
full on middle and leg. Sharma wants to flick, but it hits his thigh and goes down the leg side for four. Samson did dive but couldn't get a hand to it

that cuts through Sharma as he looks to play a mish-mash of a cut and punch. But Boult's length ball outside off jags in, and goes between the bat-body gap. A maiden over for Boult despite the four legbyes
former KKR bowler gets former KKR batter! Short of a length outside off. Hits the seam and moves away slightly. Tripathi wants to cut, but its got some extra bounce, and that's edged to Samson.
good length ball angling across. Throws his bat to try and cut but the ball goes under the blade to Samson
fuller ball, on off. Pooran offers a compact defensive shot off the front foot
good length outside off. Bit of movement away as Pooran wants to cut again. Like the ball two deliveries ago, he plays and misses
fullish outside off. Angling across and he shoulders his arms
maiden over to follow up a maiden over. Full outside off. Pooran gets forward to drive, but hits the inside half of the bat and rolls away to the on side
fullish on off. Stays on the back foot, closes the bat's face, and works it to square leg
full, fifth stump line. In the slot for him to try and slog, but he can't connect. Past the edge to Samson
full outside off stump. Another swipe to the leg side from Pooran, who has now faced six balls without scoring a run. Has missed connecting the ball on four of those occasions. Through to the keeper
good length on middle, and angling down the leg side as he misses the attempted pull/leg-side swipe
another swing and a miss. Length ball around off stump, Pooran looks to pull in front of square, but again no connection

that's plumb and Pooran's horror stay ends. Full on leg stump, and moving into middle stump. Pooran tries to have another crack at it by trying to play across the line. Misses, hits the front leg, and that is definitely crashing into middle or leg.
full on off stump. Wants to play straight but it flies off the bat's inside half and rolls away to deep backward square for four
hits the thigh pad en route to the keeper. Back of a length delivery that's going down the leg side
length ball outside off and shoulders his arms
full on off. Presses forward and fends it back
back of a length on off and angling across. Sharma looks to pull, but he can't connect
good length on middle. Opens the bat's face and dabs a late cut of sorts to short third man for a quick run
good length ball on a fourth-stump line. Markram is in two minds, whether to leave or poke. Eventually offers no shot, and through to the keeper. 14/3 after the powerplay
good length on middle and leg as Coulter-Nile delivers his first ball. Tapped to midwicket's left, and they pinch one as Hetmyer looks to intercept
mistimed drive off the front foot to the off side
full on middle, and going down the leg side. But Samson dives to his left and grabs it before it can go for any extra
full just outside off. Bit of movement into Markram as he creams a drive to mid off
finally a convincing four from a Sunrisers batter as Markram drags a pull from outside off over the fielder at midwicket
back of a length just outside off. Nurdled to deep point for one
good length on middle stump. Nudged to the leg side
tosses it up, and fended to the off side
bit of a variation. Tries the carrom ball, on length and turning slightly away. Fended
good length on off. Backs away and clatters a cut in front of square to the infielder
good length on off. Stays on the back foot and hits a whippy shot down to long on for one
around the stumps and starts off with a full toss. Sharma drills it past Ashwin, and Parag dived at long off to stop it, but the ball dribbled under his body and hit the ropes
too full for Markram to attempt a cut, but he gets a late dab to short third man. Think he was deceived by the release, and thought it was landing way ahead of where it actually did

drilled to long on and Chahal gives a kiss towards Hetmyer as he pockets the catch. Tosses it up, took the pace off, and Sharma came skipping down to clear the boundary with a six. But he's too close to the ball at the time of contact, and cannot get his bat under it enough to get the elevation. Out for a 19-ball nine
googly from Chahal. Good length on off, and turning into middle. Squirted away to deep midwicket off the back foot
full on middle. Tries to whip it off his toes in front of square, but ends up playing it to square leg
full on middle. Big stride in and pushed towards long on for one
full on off. Delivers from a bit wide of the crease. Defended back

full just outside off. Tapped towards short cover and they're off for one. Fielder runs across and throws it in, with Samson whipping the bails off, and Markram is in courtesy the dive. His bat was inside the crease but wasn't grounded, having bounced off the ground before the bat crossed the line
full outside off. Pushed towards cover
good length on off and going straight. Skips down the ground and punches to long on
full on off. Pushed to mid off. Yet another carrom ball
good length, just outside off. Bit slower from Ashwin. Cut to the right of point for a single
good length, outside off. Chops a cut in front of square to the man in the deep

very high, but doesn't have the distance! Full just outside off stump. Turning away as he skips down the ground to try and find a big shot. Sliced it, and long on gets under it for a simple catch. Toe end of the bat, according to the replay
full just outside off stump. Swept from outside off to deep midwicket
tossed up on off stump. Full face of the bat in his drive back to Yuzi
good length outside off. Cuts smartly in front of square, but a sweeper fielder is there
good length, on middle. Worked off the back foot to midwicket
tapped off the back foot to cover. Fielder can't stop it but the man in the deep runs in and keeps it down to one
fullish on off stump. Worked back to the bowler off the back foot
bit of a leading edge that goes past first slip even though Shepherd wanted to tuck one to midwicket.
full on middle and leg. Nudged to midwicket's left off the back foot
slower through the air. Full on leg. Shepherd wants to pull, and gets a glove. Ball rolls away to short fine leg
he's reduced his pace. Good length, wider outside off and turning away. Markram cuts in front of square and takes off for one

did Coulter-Nile lose the ball under the lights? He slid in to try and take a catch but think he slid too much! Good length on off, and Markram wanted to pull this off the back foot, but ended up slicing a catch towards mid off. He ran in from long off, but then that bizarre moment
smacked to long on, and enough time to come back for the second
faster ball, almost like how Shahid Afridi released his surprise delivery. A bit wide, and clattered to Boult at extra cover on the boundary line
short and wide. Stays on the back foot, and clubbed in front of square to extra cover for four
good length on off. Stays on the back foot, and drags a pull in front of square to deep midwicket
good length outside off. Backs away and pulls to cover. Direct hit from the fielder but he's safe
good length outside off. Bit of extra bounce as Markram shapes to punch. Hits the top half of the bat and rolls away to cover
good length on leg, and he swivels to try and aim for a boundary behind square. Can't connect, hits the knee roll, and the ball rolls away
good length on a fifth-stump line. Cut to deep point for a single
rolls his fingers over this ball. Full outside off, and Shepherd is through his attempted slog a tad too early. Sliced in the air, but lands between deep point and cover congregating to take a catch
back of a length on middle and leg. Swivels and makes top connection with his pull. Soars over fine leg
back to back! Same length, same treatment! Just that this went over the fielder at deep square leg who was stationed for that very shot
good length on off. Skidding through. Worked off the back foot to deep square leg
slower. Length ball outside off, and the carrom ball turns slightly away. Shepherd can't cut
good length, on off. Makes room to slap one to the fielder on the boundary line
punched towards deep point for another one
full on middle. Shepherd moves to the off side, gets down on one knee, and tries to sweep. Gets something on it, but Krishna gets a hand to slow it down at short fine leg
length ball. Another slower one from Ashwin. Shepherd waits and waits to cut, and when he has a go he fails to connect. Ashwin finishes with 0/21
full on middle. Quicker one, going straight through. Markram backs away to try and find the gap on the leg side but ends up hitting a shot right onto his own boot
full on middle. Comes down the ground and clubs a leg-side swipe to deep midwicket
bit of a wild hoick. Chahal goes full and wide in a bid to make Shepherd chase at it. Turns further away and he misses

that's No. 3! His 250th T20 scalp. The stumps are shattered, and Romario must walk after an entertaining 18-ball innings. Chahal sticks with a stump to stump line, Shepherd walks across to access the leg side behind square. Misses the slog sweep, and the zing bails have lit up. Time out

good length on off. Pulled off the back foot, along the ground, to deep midwicket. Jaiswal throws it flat from the deep, but Chahal grabs it with one hand and gets tangled up trying to release the ball. Misses the stumps, Markram surprises a run out chance
full on middle. Pushed to long on and Chahal finishes with 3/22
back of a length, outside leg stump. Sundar comfortably clips it off his waist over fine leg, using his wrists to place it finer than usual
around the stumps. Good length outside off stump. Sundar stands tall and drills a back-foot drive through cover for four more

good length on middle. Sundar is now just smacking whatever he can see. Mistimes the punchy shot after making room, and could've been out at mid off had Jaiswal run in a bit quicker. But he doesn't, the ball lands in front of him, and then goes past him for four at long off
yorker length almost. Sundar backs away and smacks it straight past the non-striker. Lot of running for Hetmyer at long on to do, but he dives to parry the ball back, saving two runs for Royals
full on leg. Sundar clears the front leg, breaks his wrists on purposes, and plays a flicky shot off his pads to deep backward square leg for four.

full toss on leg stump. Sundar once again uses his wrists to flick one behind square. Chahal is there at deep backward square for a catch, but he's run in too much! Caught in two minds, finds himself in no man's land, and Sundar survives, earns four, and dents Coulter-Nile's figures even further

full and wide outside off. Gets low, and thrashes a sliced drive to Padikkal at deep point. He ran in to attack the ball, but it still fell short. Nonetheless he got his body behind it - a committed effort from DDP
full and wide outside off. But Sundar stretches out, and gets a slice to third man for one while almost falling over
yorker, almost. Square drive to deep point for one
yorker length, fifth stump line outside off. Sundar gets low and guides it to third man
moves to 40 with that six. Full and wide, and Markram used his bat's open face as a scoop of sorts to lift a six over extra cover

lucky from the batter as this is edged over the first slip fielder to third man for four. Prasidh went full and wide to make Markram reach out. Nearly had his man but as the old adage goes... when you slash it, you're better off slashing it hard
full on middle. Struck down the ground for a single
good length, on off stump. Takes the pace off. Drags an attempted pull to deep backward square

full on middle stump. Clears the front leg and drills it over Boult's head. Buttler straight down tries to intercept with his boot, but looks like the leg was touching the ropes. Sixth boundary or six in 12 balls
aims for a wide yorker, and called a wide by the umpire. Sundar offered no shots
40 off 13! Full on off stump. In the slot, and Boult is punished. Sundar audaciously clears the front leg, gets super low, and then hammers it over long off
back of a length slower ball. Sundar sways away, and called a wide for height by the square umpire

Hetmyer takes another catch and this Sundar's beautiful cameo comes to a close. Has played a big role in giving some sort of a good eventual total to Sunrisers. Another full ball, this time around middle and leg, and Sundar cannot truly get under it to clear long on
good length ball on middle and leg. Tap and run to cover off the back foot

waist high full toss outside off, and Coulter-Nile goes tumbling on his follow through. No ball given but uh oh, problem for Royals since Coulter-Nile gets up, holds his leg, takes his cap, and leaves the ground. How big is that injury? He does have a bad history with injuries.
back of a length outside off. Bhuvi smacks it over the non-striker's head with the horizontal bat. Hetmyer takes a catch at long on, but it's a free-hit remember.
length ball on middle. Markram is cramped for space and clubs a shot off the back foot to the leg side. In the air, but falls between long on and deep midwicket
full on off. Bhuvi clears his front leg and tonks a beautiful shot to the gap at deep midwicket and long on but Padikkal runs across and intercepts before it can go for four
fifty with a boundary. Full on middle, and angling into him. Markram comes down the track, clears the front leg, closes the bat's face and finds a boundary with his flick to deep midwicket
ten rows back! Full on off and middle. Markram gets low, down on one knee, and absolutely clattered over cow corner. #FetchThat
good length, quite wide, almost on the tramline. Smacked to deep extra cover and Rajasthan Royals win by 61 runs as Sunrisers finish on 149.

big deflection and big appeal for caught behind given not out! Well, this will certainly be a memorable first ball in the history of both franchises. DRS is called for. It was on a fullish length on the fourth stump channel. Looked like a pretty obvious edge behind with Rahul prodding at this. Not sure what else it could have been. Rahul sold it well enough on field for the umpire to give it not out but the third umpire was not so forgiving. Decision overturned. Rahul out for a golden duck.
fullish length ball on middle, flicked through square leg for one.
full on fourth stump, defended to cover.
good length ball on fourth stump, tip and run into the covers for a sharp single.
full on fifth stump, punched straight to cover.
back of a length on the hips, goes to pull and is beaten for pace.
fullish length angled across fifth stump, miscues a drive back to Aaron.
half volley on leg stump at 132 kph, flicked wide of mid-on for one.
back of a length outside leg at 133 kph, Lewis plays the same flick pull he missed out on last over but this time gets it fine through fine leg to the rope.
full on middle, heaves for mid-on but gets this more off the inner half and it goes to deep square leg for one.
back of a length on fifth stump at 142 kph, defended into cover.
back of a length on fourth stump, goes to cut and bottom edges this past the stumps to fine leg for one.
terribly sloppy from Lockie Ferguson at deep third man! Back of a length on fifth stump slashed for what should be a single but Ferguson allows three more with a fumble into the rope.
good length ball on fifth stump, de Kock goes hard at this but is beaten.
Bullseye! Gem through the gate! Fullish length angled in on middle, de Kock prods at this but it tails in and splits the gap between bat and pad hitting middle stump three quarters of the way up.
good length ball on off, goes back to flick into square leg for one.
full on sixth stump at 140 kph, defended past the non-striker to mid-on.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended to point.
back of a length tailing down leg, diving stop to save it from being five wides.
short and wide, mistimes a cut into the ground in front of point, diving stop to keep it to one.
attempted slower ball at 113 kph lands full on fourth stump, Lewis keeps the hands back late and plays an inside out square drive behind point that beats the ring fielder to the rope.

early nominee for catch of the tournament from Shubman Gill! Aaron bounces Lewis on fourth stump, who goes to pull this and top edges this over square leg. Gill tracks back 25 yards from the ring going out toward the rope, tracks it well the whole way and dives toward the rope to pull off a superlative catch. He made that look far easier than it was.
fullish length on the legs, flicked to deep fine leg for one.
full on middle, flicked wide of mid-on, matador cape effort from Hardik Pandya diving over theatrically over the top of the ball to let it go to the rope.
good length ball tailing down leg again for another wide.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended behind point.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended to the off side.
full on middle, whips this through wide mid-on for runs, sliding effort at the rope saves this from going over.

gem gem gem! A hat-trick of diamonds from Shami in this Powerplay! Good length ball just seams in ever so slightly from fourth stump and Pandey's lack of footwork is exposed. Pokes at this away from his body and is beaten through the gate, top of off knocked back.
short on fifth stump, drags a pull into the ground to mid-on.
back of a length on fifth stump, defended to cover.
short on sixth stump at 137 kph, goes to cut and is beaten.
full on fifth stump, punched to point.
good length ball on fifth stump, miscues a punch to mid-on.
back of a length on off at 145 kph, flicked through square leg for one.
back of a length on fourth stump at 150 kph, defended to point.
fullish length but sprayed down leg at 143 kph, diving stop to save it from being five wides.
full on middle, flicked wide of mid-on for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, gets on his toes to defend.
good length ball shaping in a touch on fourth stump, defended to the off side.
good length ball on sixth stump, opens the face to steer this to deep third man for one.
full on fourth stump, punched to mid-on for none.
back of a length on off stump at 137 kph, defended to midwicket.
back of a length on fifth stump seams in sharply and beats an attempted punch through cover.
back of a length on off, defended to the off side.
back of a length on off at 147 kph, defended to midwicket.
good length ball on middle, goes back to flick into the leg side for one.
bouncer on fifth stump, Hooda goes to uppercut this over third man and is beaten sharply for pace.
back of a length on off at 150 kph, flicked through midwicket for a sharp two.

nearly a wicket! Fullish length ball on middle, prods awkwardly at this and a thick edge carries low toward Tewatia at backward point but just skids off the turf in front of him and clangs off his fingers on the short hop.
slower ball at 124 kph on a good length on sixth stump, tries to punch this into the covers but mistimes this into the ground toward point and he's turned back.
short on sixth stump, goes to cut and misses.
back of a length on fifth stump, defended to cover.
full on fifth stump, drives to mid-on for one.
back of a length on sixth stump, slices at this and gets a thick edge wide of backward point that beats third man (who was very fine) to the rope. First boundary outside of the Powerplay.
fullish length on fourth stump at 138 kph, punched into the ground to midwicket.
good length ball on middle and off, steered behind point with soft hands for one.
full on fourth stump, paddle sweep to fine leg for a sharp single.
googly spins in on a good length from fourth stump, goes back to flick through the leg side for one.
full on fourth stump at 95 kph, sweeps this through backward square for one.
full outside leg, flicked with ease through square leg for one.
full on middle and leg, paddle sweeps this to fine leg
googly lands on a good length on off and rips in, goes back and jams this out through backward square leg for one.
Short of length outside off, Hooda stands tall and smashes it down the ground, long-on had no chance
was in the air for a bit but falls well short of extra cover. Was a length ball on the stumps. Hooda gave himself room and pushed at it but was early into the shot
scythed over covers. Hardik goes full this time, just outside off. Hooda smashes it over extra cover, just evading the jumping fielder
fuller on the stumps, works it towards long-on for a single
length ball around off, drops it on the leg side and gets to the other end
short of length outside off, Hooda nails the cut but there is a sweeper out there. Just a single
fuller outside off, sweeps it towards deep square leg
fuller length outside off, gets an outside edge towards short third man as he looks to work it on the leg side

a huge, huge appeal for lbw. Given not out but Titans want to review this. Fuller on the stumps, he went for the sweep and at first it looked like he missed it. But it brushed the glove and went towards short fine leg
length ball around off, turned towards midwicket. Rashid puts in the chase and even though he stumbles, that's enough to keep it to one
length ball around off, chopped towards slip
length ball around off, flicked wide of mid-on and they come back for the second. Good running between the wickets
short of length angling towards the batter, Hooda gives himself bit of room and opens the face of the bat to work it behind point. Rashid dives to his left but cannot get his hand to the ball
short of length on the stumps, looks like Hooda was waiting for it. Standing deep in his crease and pulls it over long leg for a six
a length ball around off, Hooda once again goes for the pull but gets an outside edge that flies to the left of third man. Shami runs across to cut it off
length outside off, Badoni too attempts the pull but is a bit hurried. The ball dribbles towards long-on
fuller around off, Hooda clears his front leg and drills it between the bowler and mid-off. The fielder had absolutely no chance to cut it off
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards short midwicket for a quick single. 17 from that over
smashed over wide long-on. Was fuller on the stumps, Hooda went for the slog sweep and cleared the boundary with easily
that's fifty for Hooda, off just 36 balls. A length ball on the stumps, sweeps it towards midwicket
length ball on the stumps, flicked behind square leg
fuller outside off, pushed towards extra cover
fuller outside off once more, swept towards deep square leg
short of length around off, goes back and punches it towards long-on
fuller around off, gets down on one knee and smashes it over deep midwicket, all the way for a six
length ball outside off, moves across and laps it over fine leg, four more, 100 comes up as well
delicate, deliberate! A length ball outside off, comes forward and opens the face of the bat to run it down between the keeper and short third man
length ball around off, tucked away towards midwicket
length ball outside off, charges down the ground and looks to smash it over the bowler's head, fails to connect
fuller outside off, throws his bat at it, it rotates in his hand as well but he has hit it behind point. A couple of bounces and over the boundary line
a googly, pitched on a fuller length around off. Looks to work it on the leg side and gets hit on the pads. An appeal for lbw but not given. A bit high maybe
fuller around off, pushed towards extra cover
brings out the slog sweep, it's the bigger boundary but he made a neat connection. Goes all the way for a six
another googly from Rashid. Dropped short and pulled down towards deep-backward square leg

another massive appeal for lbw from Rashid, and it went on and on like an aalaap. Given not out and Titans want to review this. Was a length ball in the line of the stumps and beat the batter on the sweep. It struck him below the knee pad and the ball-tracking shows it would have gone on to hit the middle stump
length ball around off, goes back and punches it towards extra cover
fuller and wider outside off, opens the face of the bat to steer it towards third man. A tumbling stop by Rashid to keep it to one
goes for the yorker, but just misses his mark. Ends up bowling a dipping full toss at 148.9kph. Took the batter by surprise and hit him on the bat
a slower short ball outside off, forehands it towards sweeper cover. The two fielders in the deep just slide into each other but manage to stop the ball
short of length, goes for the pull but mistimes it behind square leg
fuller around off, hits it hard towards the bowler who stops it in his follow-through
length ball around off, Badoni stands tall and smashes it over the bowler's head. One bounce and over the boundary line
fuller length outside off, looks to smash down the ground but cannot middle it. A single to long-on
dropped by Lockie Ferguson. Was fuller outside off, goes aerial towards sweeper cover. It went low towards Ferguson, he got both hands to it but it popped out
a bouncer from Shami, Krunal goes for the pull, gets a top edge and it's four to fine leg
a full toss around off and Krunal punches it over the non-striker. Too straight for long-off to make the stop

a yorker from around the wicket. Krunal digs it out and calls for a single. Shami is quick to the ball and kicks it towards the stumps with his left foot. Had he hit the stumps, Badoni would have been run out. He was way, way short
another big over for Super Giants, a full toss on the pads, and Badoni clips it behind square leg
goes for the yorker but just misses his mark. Digs it out towards long-on

fuller length outside off, throws his bat at it but gets an under edge towards the keeper. Krunal wanted a single and was halfway down. The keeper lobs the ball towards Ferguson who collects and runs towards the stumps but by the time he dislodged the bails, Pandya had dived back

length ball around off, goes for the pull but mistimes it. Lands short of mid-off who was charging in. The fielder collects and attempts a direct hit at the bowler's end. Misses and Badoni can enjoy his luck
length outside off, pulls it in front of square leg for one
gets to his fifty in some style, 146.9kph bouncer and he simply swats it over deep midwicket
fuller outside off and this time he goes over extra cover. There is man in the deep, so it will be only a single
short outside off, pulled down towards deep midwicket
fuller and wider outside off, throws his bat at it but cannot connect. Too wide

length ball on the stumps, goes for the pull and even though he didn't time it to perfection, it had enough power behind it. That it went wide of long-on did the rest; the fielder couldn't get there in time
short of length outside off, goes for the pull again. Toe-end of the bat I think and it went behind the stumps
fuller around off, clears his front leg and looks to go aerial but this time he got more height on it than distance and Pandya took a comfortable catch at mid-off
short of length at the batter who is standing well outside his crease. Goes for the pull but gets a top edge over the keeper's head. Fine leg cuts it off
length ball on the stumps, goes for the pull but there is n not much power behind it. A single to deep midwicket
back of a length on the hips, late on a a flick but it comes off the thigh guard deflecting to the fine leg rope.
good length ball on middle, defended to the leg side.

a charge down the track goes awry and a catch is skied to point for Hooda. Fullish length on sixth stump, tries to heave this back over the bowler's head but spoons this off the toe swirling high over the off side ring. Hooda settles under this and crouches low, reaching in front of his body to take this at knee height.
back of a length sliding down leg at 145 kph, Shankar goes to flick and is late, wide called.
back of a length on off at 140 kph, defended to cover off the back foot.
bouncer over middle, looked like he wanted to pull initially before aborting the attempt and turtling his head out of the way of a 141 kph delivery.
back of a length on sixth stump, goes back to punch through cover and picks the gap for two runs.
back of a length on fourth stump, tap and run into the covers for a sharp single.
full on fourth stump at 138 kph, goes to drive as the ball tails in, inside edge goes through fine leg for one.

full and swinging in sharply but pings Wade outside leg stump, he's late on a flick and there's a big lbw shout but no way is this hitting the stumps. The ball deflects off the pads through square leg for an extra.
full on fifth stump, miscues a drive wide of mid-on for one.
short and wide at 137 kph, goes to cut and misses. Wade not happy that the ball was deemed legal on the line.
inswinging yorker on leg stump at 139 kph, but Wade is even better flicking this out through square leg to the rope.

yorker at 145 kph cleans up Shankar! Chameera bounced him in the previous over and after a prolonged wait follows it up with the toe-crusher that pierces through Shankar's lame attempt to jam the bat down in time. Off stump is knocked back.
Chameera goes searching for the yorker again full at 143 kph on middle stump, but Hardik is up to the challenge and flicks this through midwicket fizzing to the rope.
full on fifth stump at 142 kph, punched firmly to mid-off.
good length ball on middle at 137 kph, gentle flick goes wide of mid-on and is chased down for two.
creative from Hardik. Bouncer on middle, ducks and tucks a short arm jab pull through backward square leg to the rope.
back of a length on off stump at 142 kph, defended to mid-off.
short and wide on sixth stump at 139 kph, goes to cut and chops this into the ground but goes wide of the field for one.
full on off at 141 kph, defended back to the bowler.
leg stump half volley at 145 kph, whipped with disdain through square leg and races to the rope.
good length ball angled across fourth stump at 144 kph, defended to mid-off.
full on fifth stump at 144 kph, driven straight to mid-off for what should be a dot but a sloppy misfield allows a single.
short and wide on seventh stump, slaps this like a scorned family member at the receiving end of a joke at an awards show through the covers to the rope.
full on middle, flicked elegantly through midwicket and skims away to the rope.
full on the legs, goes to flick and misses playing late with the deflection going off the pads through to de Kock.

full on the legs, another attempted flick and is very late on the shot. LBW shout denied. KL Rahul calls for DRS. Looked like it was always missing leg. Very optimistic from Lucknow. The contact on ball-tracker shows it was outside leg so they don't even continue on to see beyond that. Lucknow lose a review.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended to the off side.
back of a length on fourth stump at 127 kph, defended to mid-off.
very full on off stump at 135 kph, jammed out to extra cover.
short and wide, cuts this straight to backward point.
another half-tracker on sixth stump, carved straight to backward point again.
googly zipped in on a good length on fifth stump, Wade fans on a tame poke away from the body.
Finally Wade punishes the length in this over. Short on fifth stump, rocks back to punch this through the covers and sizzles to the rope.
good length ball pitching outside leg and skids down leg, Wade late on a flick, wide called.
short on fifth stump skids again at 97 kph, punched out to extra cover.
very full on middle, jammed out back to the bowler who fields and fires a gentle throw back to Wade with the ball deflecting off his pads to short fine leg.
full on off, punched back to his brother.
full on fifth stump, driven to the cover sweeper for one.
short and wide, carved through to the sweeper for one.
full on the stumps, defended.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended.
good length ball on middle and off, defended.
pitching full and a foot outside leg, but Wade premeditates a reverse sweep that is dragged through point for one.
good length ball on fourth stump, prodded to the off side.
full outside off, driven to long-off for one.
googly lands on a good length and spins in from well outside leg, goes back to flick through midwicket for one.
spectacular shot! Full and wide on the guideline, would've been a wide if he left it but Hardik reaches out with his Reed Richards arms and smokes a drive over extra cover just over the rope.
very full on sixth stump, driven firmly but straight to extra cover.
short on fifth stump, rocks back and punches to extra cover.

good length ball again on fifth stump, rocks back and punches to extra cover again, very sloppy misfield turns a dot into a two cut off by Chameera at the rope. Or has he? It was an equally clumsy effort at the rope to fumble it but he keeps it just inside.
good length ball speared into the pads, late on a flick and comes off the pads past the keeper for a run.
full outside off, pushed gently into the covers for one.
full on fifth stump, pressed along the turf wide of cover for one.

nearly a catch at midwicket! Full on middle, flicked loosely in the air toward Bishnoi diving left at midwicket but it's just out of his reach and continues through the air before skidding to the rope.
fullish length ball on fifth stump, Wade fans through this.

meatball of a full toss on the waist, Wade miscues the heave high over midwicket and it plops to the turf well short of the rope. They complete two. Looked like it was on the borderline for a no ball live.
in the slot on the wide guidelines outside off at 139 kph, Wade shovels this over the off side beating the sweeper to the rope.
back of a length on fifth stump, sits up for Wade to pull but picks out midwicket on the ring.
back of a length on fifth stump, prodded into the covers for one.
slower ball lands short on fifth stump at 121 kph, bottom edges a pull behind square leg for one.

Krunal wins the battle of the brothers. Tossed up in the line of the stumps, Hardik clears his front leg and looks to go over the bowler's head but the bat rotates in his hands and he ends up more like slicing it. Manish Pandey settles under it at long-off
length ball on the stumps, goes back and flicks it towards short midwicket
fuller on the stumps, flicked but cannot beat short midwicket
fuller around off, pushed uppishly to the right of the non-striker. Krunal dives across but he is nowhere near the ball
fuller on the stumps, pushed back towards the bowler
length ball on the pads, nudged towards square leg and they sprint back for the second
length ball around off, tucked away towards square leg
a full toss on the stumps, flicked towards long-on
fuller around off, hits it towards long-on for one more
length ball on the stumps, goes back to cut but is cramped. Extra cover fields it
bowled 'im! Fuller length on the stumps, Wade goes for a slog sweep but fails to connect and is bowled. That's a big, big wicket
length ball around off, worked towards midwicket
fuller, angled across. Pushes at it and gets it from the inside half of the bat towards short midwicket
fuller outside off, pushes it towards covers
fuller around off, drilled towards long-off but only a single as Hooda cuts it off
fuller around off, pushes it towards covers for another single
length ball on the stumps, punched towards the bowler
length ball on the stumps, flicked behind square leg
length ball around off, punched towards covers
fuller on the stumps, punched towards long-off
fuller outside off, pushes it towards long-on
length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
length outside off, cuts it in front of point
fuller around off, looks to drop and run but ends up hitting it in the direction of the bowler
length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards extra cover. And they sneak in a single
length ball on the leg stump, was looking to tickle it fine but it gets entangled between his limbs
fuller outside off, drives it towards sweeper cover
length outside off, finds extra cover with the cut
shuffles a bit and cuts it through covers, right in front of the stumps
beaten! Fuller length outside off, slides with the arm and beats the bat as he looks to push at it
length outside off, drops it towards point and takes a quick single
Tewatia goes big! Fuller outside off, goes down on one knee and slog-sweeps it over deep midwicket
down the ground this time. Gets to the pitch of the ball and launches it over the bowler's head. A couple of bounces and over the boundary line
short of length on the stumps, swipes it towards short fine leg. Miller is quick to spot the single and makes it despite a quick throw and the keeper breaking the stumps
length around off, drags it on the leg side with the sweep and manages to hit it between deep midwicket and deep square leg
another six to end the over with! Is this the game-changing over? Fuller length around off, Miller clears his front leg and deposits it into the deep-midwicket stands
goes for the reverse sweep and manages to hit it all the way behind point, what connection!
the conventional sweep this tine. Fuller on the leg stump and Tewatia is going all-out here. But there is a fielder in the deep, so it will only be a single
length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
a full toss down the leg side, Bishnoi is lucky that Tewatia didn't get a bat on that. de Kock does well to stop that
down the leg side once again, Tewatia goes for the sweep once more and this time he gets it over short fine leg
another wayward delivery, way down the leg side and Tewatia sweeps it finer this time, over the short fine leg for four more
googly, pitched outside off, Tewatia tries to fetch it but ends up mistiming it towards cover-point
length outside off, slaps it through extra cover for a couple
fuller outside off and Miller launches it over the bowler's head. Not one of those monster hits but enough to clear the boundary
a length ball, wider and angling across Miller. He had to reach out for it and ends up hitting it towards extra cover. KL Rahul juggles it twice before finally holding onto
length ball outside off, goes for the cut but it's too close to him. Ends up nearly chopping it onto his stumps. The ball hits the turf and bounces over de Kock
length ball around off, hits it hard but straight towards extra cover
length ball angling across, looks to hit on the leg side but doesn't get the timing right. Lands short and to the left of short midwicket
a slower one, fuller outside off and Abhinav goes over mid-off. The bottom hand came off the bat but he hit it straight and got the boundary
another slower one, legcutter. Length outside off and goes for the cut and misses
another slower one. This time in the line of the stumps and dipping. Manohar was early into the shot, gets an inside edge onto his shoe and the ball rolls towards short third man
length outside off, goes for the cut and misses. It was an offcutter this time. de Kock appeals for the caught-behind but no one else is interested
fuller and wider outside off, throws his bat at it and manages to slice it fine enough to beat third man
length outside off, slaps it towards extra cover. But of hesitation. The throw is at the bowler's end but the dive saves Abhinav
A four to start the over with. A length ball around off, stays back and smashes it towards deep midwicket. Did it hit the boundary cushion on the full? The third umpire thinks not
a slower one. A length ball outside off, stays back and still, and smashes it through covers for four
goes for the short ball, Abhinav attempts the pull. Not in control there, more like a top edge. Will get a single to fine leg
fuller outside off, creamed through covers and it races away to the boundary line, beating the sweeper on his left
comes back in sharply! Good length outside off, and that tails back into the batter, as du Plessis dabs that down
and again! This is a touch shorter and wide of off, and also bounces more. du Plessis pushes that toward cover after covering for the movement
taps this back of a length around sixth stump, as the ball angles into him again. Still no run for du Plessis
four dots in a row now! A touch fuller and a bit wider of off, as du Plessis reaches out to push at that back of a length ball to poke to point
this goes away from him, and he is finally off the mark. Good length ball wide of off, as he dabs that to third man for the first runs on the board
back of a length on off, as Rawat takes a few steps down the pitch first ball. Taps that toward point and even wants a single, but is sent back
good length, on leg stump, and going further down leg with the lateral movement. du Plessis misses the flick, the keeper dives and can't hold on either, and Arshdeep starts off with five wides!
fuller, on off. Bit of swing into him. Mistimed drive back to the bowler

full on leg stump. du Plessis uses his wrists to gently flick it off his pads, and gets it fine enough to get a boundary to fine leg! Arshdeep is getting the ball to swing into the right-hander, but will get punished if he bowls on leg. Replays show that came off the pad anyway, so legbyes
good length on leg, and movement in the air going across to middle and off. du Plessis blocks off the back foot
defended
full ball, nearly a yorker. Lands just outside leg. Faf is on his floor, but gets up and pinches the run anyway. Soft lbw appeal, but Arshdeep knows that pitched outside leg
good length ball, quite wide outside off to the left-hander. Moving further away after pitching. Left alone
full just outside off. Gets onto the front foot and taps it towards cover point
length on the stumps, full face of the bat to defend
half-volley on leg stump, and du plessis has picked that up beautifully to get a four to deep midwicket. He's on his way
length ball on off, shuffles and tucks it through midwicket
bang goes Rawat. Highly rated youngster. Walks down the track and slams this over long-on. Audacious shot, and he just swung his arms free and connected beautifully.
length ball on off, defended to cover
fuller on the stumps, clipped to mid-on from the front foot
offcutter on a length outside off, goes to mid-on and they steal a quick single. Faf had to dive to make his crease
full outside off, steered to point
this one is speared into him from around the wicket and is tucked through midwicket
dropped at midwicket by Shahrukh Khan. Short ball, sat up, Faf laid into the pull but straight to the man. Pops in and out. Came hard at him but was catchable height
fuller on off, driven to mid-off
fuller on off, again, driven to mid-off again
short and wide outside off, cuts it but didn't time it that well, the ball goes to deep cover
was looking to move across and scoop it, saw the ball angled well across him so tried to scoop over third man instead, but the ball kept going away. Wide.
back of a length outside off, goes for the pull again. Not timed perfectly, but he got it in the gap, so gets two as the boundary rider slides to his left and stops
drilled to extgra cover and Faf hares across for a single, dives to make his crease. Would have been just in even with a direct hit
was shuffling across, Arshdeep gets it to nip in, he's playing it defensively though so the ball rolls to the right of the bowler, from the inside half of the bat
fuller on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
fuller ball, pushed to mid-on
fuller and on a fifth stump line, he tries to slash it with feet static, misses
got bigger on him than he expected, banged in short outside off, looked to pull, came high on the bat, but lands well short of extra cover
almost yorker length on a fourth stump line, gets low and drives to cover, but off the end of the bat

<b>absolutely leathered</> but cover dives to his right and gets a hand on it to save runs. Room outside off and he slashed it hard, SRK dove full-length to his right and got a hand to it. Technically a drop, but more like runs saved
short ball on off, rocks on the back foot and unleashes a pull that goes one bounce to the deep midwicket boundary. Nicely balanced when executing
down the track, flays it over cover and finds the boundary with another superbly executed shot
nicely done, leg-break outside off that spins away and leaves Faf feeling for it outside off
makes room to a full, flighted ball, and slaps it to long-on from the end of the bat
tossed up again, but too full, goes deep in his crease and drives to deep extra cover
flatter, going across him on off, goes down to slog-sweep, but because of the trajectory he can't get fully underneath it, sends it to deep midwicket along the ground
leg break that pitched on leg stump, he was looking to reverse sweep, doesn't make contact, but the ball goes past the keeper
and that's a terrific comeback from Rahul Chahar. Tossed up quicker, dips on him and defeats his big heave to the onside, spins through him and knocks the stumps over
length ball on off, driven to long-off on the front foot
length ball again, knocked to long-off
darted into him on middle and leg, but he was making room, so he manages to flick it through midwicket
tossed up on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
gives it some air again, Kohli well forward and then pushes with hands to run it to long-off
darts it into him, looks to drive inside out, the ball trickles back to the bowler off the inside half
length ball, pitched on leg and spinning across, goes right back and taps it to fine leg
makes room and slashes it over point. Good running by the duo to pick up a second
how did that miss the stumps?. Nicely floated up, dips on him, he's down on one knee to slog sweep, misses it entirely. The ball goes over the stumps by a millimetre
slaps this length ball to cover
flatter and quicker on the stumps, looking to use wrists to pick the gaps through the in-field, but he can't seem to pierce them. Goes to short third man
another quicker on that skids on to him on off, cuts it to point
down the track, looking to be aggressive, but it's flatter and into him, so he can only whip it to long-on
slightly short, Kohli rocks back and smacks a pull hard, to deep midwicket's left
and this one slides on, he's playing outside the line and is struck on the pad. Going down though.
Kohli goes downtown. Dances down the track, gets to the pitch, and lifts it clean over long-on with a free swing of the arms. Super shot. And much needed for RCB too.
down the track again, this is bowled into him though so denies room to free arms, bunted to long-on
was making room, Brar follows him but too much and goes down legside. Wide.
coming down the track again, looking to flick, but it's darted shorter and spins away, goes to cover off the pad
fuller, clipped to wide long-on
length ball on middle and leg, on the front foot to tap it softly into cover for a quick single
fuller, gets some drift, clips it through midwicket using wrist. Hard running again to get two
fuller on off, opens the bat face to steer it to point's right
slighly shorter, goes back and clips it to long leg

quicker one, but shorter, flapped to deep midwicket and they steal a second. Steal is the right word. Faf was diving to make his ground and a better throw and collection might have had him in trouble. But the pressure they put on the fielder results in the second run being possible
tossed up outside off, down the track takes it on the full and slaps to point
stays in his crease that time, low full toss slugged to deep midwicket
drags it short, rocks back and pulls to deep midwicket. Rahul Chahar fumbles with the collection and allows a second
good length quicker leggie on off, bunted through extra cover
flighted ball, sliding down leg, Faf misses out on connecting with the paddle sweep but he'll get the wide
makes a lot of room, gets to free his arms to a full ball on the stumps, and deposits it over long-on. Will that allow him to break free now?
flatter into him, driven through extra cover. The fielder scores a direct hit and they get an overthrow.
starts the over with four. Backs away before Smith bowls. Smith follows him by bowling a length delivery angling into him. Kohli comes down the track and smacks a drive through mid off's left
back of a length on off and angling into Kohli. But Kohli moves a bit across towards off stump, and looks to flick off his hips, but can't connect. Keeper jumps to his left to stop
fullish, a bit outside off. Guided to third man off the back foot with a late cut

the boundaries are flowing! And that's the team 100 as du Plessis reaches a strike rate of 100. Full outside off, and du Plessis plays a flowy cover drive through the packed off side! Stayed leg side of the ball to pierce the cover-mid off gap

helps it along the way! Short ball angling into du Plessis. He stays on the back foot and swivels gently pulling from near his shoulder. Purposely played finer than usual, and that's gone to fine leg for half a dozen
make that a double, please! Full toss on leg stump, but du Plessis walks across to the off side and simply paddles a six over fine leg! ABD may be gone, but FdP is here. Fifty for the captain!
return to regular transmission. Just one as Faf cuts a length ball square to deep point for one
swatted away as Brar goes short, du Plessis goes leg side, and then simply thumps this over long off
what have you eaten today, Faf? Full on off. du Plessis gets to the leg side of the ball, and plays an elegant lift over the bowler's head for six more!
fuller, searching for the blockhole. Lands outside leg, but Faf is out of room. Dug down the ground to long on for one
full on leg. Helped towards midwicket off the front foot, but in the gap, so that allows VK to get back for two
if Faf can, why can't Virat? Full on middle stump. Virat stretches forward, to the pitch of the ball, and drills a six over Brar's head.
full on off stump. Caressed to mid off for a single
full on middle and flicked to short fine for one
quicker one. Length ball outside off. Turning further away. Over the tramlines.
length on off. Tapped towards cover for one
play and a miss. Fullish just outside off stump. Turns away as Faf tries to drive. Past the edge, and the keeper can't hold on either. But was there an edge? Need the replay for that
around the stumps. Full outside off, and turning away with the new angle. Smacked towards deep extra cover
full on his toes around leg stump. Nurdled to deep midwicket
over the stumps. Full just outside off. Caressed to long off for a single. Chahar finishes with 1 for 22
full toss around off stump, and slapped to deep point for a single

back of a length, maybe rolled his fingers over the ball. Kohli smacks a tennis-smash type shot down the ground to long on. Could've collected a wide for height if he let that go, but when the adrenaline is flowing it is hard to resist
RCB 150 in style! Arshdeep goes full, and a bit wider to make Faf reach out. But this man is in sublime form. Reaches out, and uses those muscular arms to swat a six over long off
full, on off. Flicked towards deep midwicket. Faf wants two, but Virat says no
full toss on off stump. Waist-high, or thereabouts. Punched to long off for one

seventh six of the innings for FdP! Arshdeep concedes 16. Two full tosses earlier in the over did not get punished, this time he is. Full toss around off stump. Faf uses his arm strength to loft a six with the full face of the bat over Singh's head. Long on was there, and tried to run around and put in an acrobatic dive, but all in vain
back of a length, quite wide outside off. Skips down the ground and flat-bats a shot to long off

searches for the yorker, does not pitch it as full as he wanted. Ends up as a half volley, and Faf drives it well enough to get it over extra cover with the bat's open face working as a scoop of sorts
digs this yorker length ball down the ground
full on off and middle. A classical drive to long off for a single
slower ball yorker, on off stump. du Plessis turns it towards short fine for one
full on middle, and he breaks his wrists to flick it smartly to the right of deep midwicket. But Smith puts in a dive and intercepts

out for double eight! Changes the angle by coming around the stumps. Not really a yorker, in the slot, but Faf's inside out loft to try and clear long off does not work out. Taken at long off #CaptainFaftastic
full toss around the stumps. On middle stump. Punched to long on
back of a length outside off. Slower ball bouncer. VK drags a pull to the right of long on
fuller ball. Karthik can't get under it, and drives it right back to the bowler. Intercepted on the followthrough
over the stumps. Short ball outside off and angling further away. DK throws his bat at this to cut behind point, but slices it instead. Falls just short of short third man
And Arshdeep finishes his last over well. Nearly ends with a wicket as this short ball is pulled by Karthik, but mistimed. Just over the square-leg fielder
easy peasy! Full on leg and angling further down. DK could've collected the wide but why do that when the swipe can get him a six? Mowed over fine leg!
ten off two and Smith's initiation into the IPL has been quite rough. DK has been brought for this sort of innings and he's delivering it. Length ball angling in, and pulled in front of square
full on middle and leg. Karthik wants to flick but misses. Hits the boot and they scurry across for one. Looks like bat first
good length, on off stump. Pulled behind square to deep backward square leg

50+ for Smith as this slower ball does not work out. Tries to go full and wide with the slower ball, but DK waited for an extra microsecond, does not commit early, and when the ball gets to him, he deposits it over Odean's head
economy of 13 for Smith on IPL debut but finishes well with a dot. Goes full outside off. DK runs across to the off side to try and play the paddle over the keeper's head but can't get any connection
digs this in, and he drags this pull to deep midwicket
DK expected Sharma to go wide. So he walks to the off side as Sharma releases the ball. Gets close to the pitch of it, and flays it over extra cover!
there's the 200 and what an exquisite way to reach the landmark for RCB. Full around off, but he runs across to the off side and ramps it over short fine leg
around the stumps. Yorker on a fifth stump line. Can't get bat on all
punchy shot first up, given width outside off and drilled to deep point
good length, swing away from the left-hander in the channel, left alone
nice shape away again, this one is on a fuller length and closer to off, goes past the outside edge as Dhawan doesn't follow it with hands but keeps bat tucked close to body
takes steps down the track, so he bangs it in short, Dhawan still laces a pull to deep square leg
sharp and short, rising into him, pings him on the glove near chest height and rolls away towards backward point
down the track again, this time the ball is fuller and he frees his arms to stroke an extra cover drive and find the boundary
length ball into him, tucked to midwicket
was making room to free his arms, Siraj follows him like a heat-seaking missile and the ball goes between bat and body through to the keeper
loses control of that, banged in too short and down leg, no chance for the keeper either. Goes for five wides
beaten. Hard length nibbling on an off stump line and nips away, Mayank left feeling for it
another one that jags back in at good pace on a good length, stabbed to point

launches into a drive and finds the point boundary. Was looking to go straighter, it went off the leading edge, but with the field restrictions on, it's a safe enough shot. Full ball outside off, nicely forward to it

loses his radar once again, too far down leg, too much for even a diving DK to stop to his left. Another five wides. Siraj has given up 10 runs not off the bat in this over, and been threatening at all other times
length ball coming into him, softly dabbed to cover for a quick single
fuller on the pads, clipped to midwicket in the circle
spanked over cover. Short of a length outside off, sat up, and he got hold of it well, but Willey has protection in the deep there
fullish on off, chips it over cover, not a well-timed one but that works for him as it clears the in-field but falls well short of the man in the deep
down the track, Willey sees him and bangs it in short, so he has to pull from in front of his face. Goes only till midwicket in the circle
hard length into him again, he goes for the pull, doesn't get hold of it, but clears the in-field for a single
down the track again, some shape away, bunted to cover. Willey sprints across to his right, slides and has a shy. They were taking a quick single, would have been in trouble if Willey hit
length ball into him, tucks him up, guides it to third man
again looking for the big shot but not getting hold of it. This was full and into the pads, he wanted to pick this up over midwicket, but it plops down just past the in-field
he's finally connected with one. Too full from Siraj, allowing him to come on the front foot confidently and hit through the line to loft this over long-off
length ball into him, pushed back to the bowler
wanted to bang this into a hard length, but Mayank read the length early, swiveled and transferred weight back, then pulled to deep square leg
fuller, on the front foot to tap it gently to mid-on for a quick single
stunning shot. Short ball going across him and rising up, but he's making room so he has the space to free his arms and upper cut it over point
good length on the stumps, tucked to midwicket
oh that's an innovative way to get a boundary. Moved well across his stumps to a length ball, and slog-paddled it almost, to the fine leg boundary
length ball on off,  a bit late in getting bat down but manages to jam it down to the legside
stumping chance missed. Down the track, but the ball sneaks between bat and body with a bit of extra bounce. Really tough for DK, must have been unsighted by the batter
makes room and slashes this short ball over point. The last few overs have been mighty productive for Punjab
flatter and trying to keep it out of his arc, uses a flat bat to send it to mid-on
down the track and over the top. Gets to the pitch of it and lifts him straight back over, the ball bounces just half a foot before the boundary
